As a Diamond HHonors member, they upgrade me to a Junior Suite. I stayed here a few times and for sure I am coming back! It is in a perfectly safe area of the university. The parking is underground, $15 a day for parking. 
Checkin/out: staffs are most students, and they are very friendly, and always a smile on their face. 
ROOM: WOWOOWOWOWOWO! Modern decor! Amazingly clean, not a bit dust anywhere! The bed very comfy as all the Hilton properties. The Bathroom, really nice. I do think the water in the shower needs to be a bit HOTTER. But other than that, PERFECT!
GREAT HOUSEKEEPING, AND MANAGEMENT!!! 5 stars!!!
LOCATION: EXCELLENT! close to downtown, everywhere else in HOUSTON. Wonderful
BREAKFAST: They do not have a buffet like everywhere, but you can order off the Eric's rest.'s Menu. It is really good. I had the omelette, so tasty! 
DINNER: The Eric's dinner menu doesn't have too many choices, but enough.. THE FOOD SUPER EXCELLENT! Had the Angel Hair Pasta really really good italian favors. I would order and dine there again and again!
It is the nicest Hilton Properties in Houston. I really enjoyed my stay here!
Truly a 5 star all the way around! Will return at least 8 more times before project is over here in Houston. Great Management team!

title: “Should be named "Hilton (asterisk) Hotel at U of H"”
text:
This hotel serves as a training ground for students in the travel and hospitality programs at U of H. That's the big asterisk. You will get staff with little experience, but with cheery dispositions and willingness to please. My room was relatively spacious ( they can get really insanely large in Houston ) and had very modern decor. Bed was firm but in a good way - woke up feeling rested. Restaurant is is not intended to impress, though quite acceptable. I did not encounter any noise problems. WiFi worked fine for me. About half the price of a typical four star Hilton. Seamless checkout. 
Campus is pretty safe - though a friend warned me not to venture outside the campus at all even by a block on foot - especially at night. Pretty good advice for most of Houston I'd say, but he did make a point of telling me twice in this case. 
When you run into a problem, ( and it's quite possible you will ), simply notify them about it and they are understanding and accommodating and will do their best to fix it immediately. My problems came from a bad room card key, an uninvited insect, and some missing TV channels. They attended to all these problems promptly and to my satisfaction.

title: “No free Parking. Add $15 a day to the room price.”
text:
Upon check-in I was asked "Will you be parking with us during your stay?". Um, well, yes? Do I have a choice? "Well, no, not really!" 
When I got the bill, the PARKING fee alone was $105. 
The sink power outlet in the bathroom was dead, so I had to run my cords to the outlet at the other end of the bathroom. No big deal.
Other than that, the hotel was extremely clean, fresh, and the rooms were very tidy (details were looked after, such as very clean windows, shower, etc.) Linens were immaculate. Elevators were spotless and fast.
Your free wi-fi is the U of H campus wi-fi. Kinda hokey-pokey but it worked. I was able to connect to my corporate VPN with no problems.
The vending / ice maker room on each floor is ungodly loud, so if you are stuck in an adjacent room you'd probably want to ask to be moved.

title: “Mixed Reviews”
text:
The Good: location, very clean room, room was quite, decorated nicely, nice view, a/c worked great, bathroom amenities were great and it was very clean.
The Bad: parking here is a nightmare. Picture the Gallaria during the Christmas rush. The parking garage was closed at least this was the valets story. We came here for a wedding which paid for valet not for over night guests. But there is no other parking so you have to $21 bucks. Which is okay but after I learned from the front staff that if I self-park it was FREE! We had taken two cars. Any how, after having a word or two with front desk the hotel comped the parking. Thank you.
This hotel has great potential there should be more staff on hand in the lobby then one person working the desk especially at 7:00pm when there is high traffic.
This hotel is exactly like the hotels I made my second home in Dublin Ireland and Glasgow Scotland.

title: “Excellent hotel”
text: Extremely modern and comfortable. I thought the value for money was outstanding. The location isn't close to downtown but the area around the hotel is much nicer than downtown in any case. The restaurant may be a little overprices but is very nice and the bar / pool areas are beautiful. Highly reccomended.

title: “My Houston hotel of choice”
text: Good facilities, friendly and welcoming staff, great location for restaurants that you can walk to and other amenities, good breakfast buffet, I must like it as I'm going back there in a couple of weeks!

title: “Lots of character”
text: I had a standard room and it was a little small by US stadards but fine for one person. The bed and linens were very comfortable. No bathtub but a nice big shower with 2 showerheads. The room had nice furniture and decor and lots of character. Front desk staff was nice but service at the restaurant was lacking. There were not that many people and they ran out of croissants at 7:30 AM and I was never offered a refill on my coffee. Overall pleasant amd would stay there again for the right price.

title: “Great Hotel With a Few Quirks”
text: I found this hotel on Travelocity. It had good ratings and looked like a boutique hotel with personality. While the hotel interior was beautiful and the rooms unique, there were a few quirks. For example you had to Valet park your car and couldn't get anything out of the vehicle without calling for valet service. You couldn't get ice from a machine, but had to call for room service. You couldn't borrow a cart to load or unload, you had to have someone load/unload for you. I paid extra to get a room with a jacuzzi tub. Took forever to fill, only to find out the tube jets were broken. The clock couldn't be re-set and was flashing four hours behind the time. When I called the desk, they couldn't tell me how to fix it, you got it, they'd send a maid up to check it out. All that, for a price that was above average. I have to say though, that the staff was this surreal type of friendly. Like they were programmed with the same friendly responses. Better than being yelled and smirked at I guess? To their defense, the woman who booked the room for me was very accommodating. She got permission for my 60 lb. dog to stay when they usually only accept dogs under 35lbs. Of course there was an additional charge, and restrictions, but was pleased she went the extra step to allow my dog. Nice property all-in-all if you are wanting something with more personality. Absolutely loved that they had a Texas rubber duck waiting for you in the bathroom with some great soaps. The rooms was very cozy and relaxing. The city view was beautiful. The location was great for downtown nightlife and there was a nice park/walking area two blocks away, which my dog loved. I'd stay there again. Travel on...

title: “Awesome Property”
text: I found this place by accident, and I am glad I did. This hotel was one of the top five I have stayed in this year. The building used to house a bank and the registration desk still has the vault behind it. It is very retro and eclectic and I loved every aspect of it. I had dinner in the restaurant, which was perfectly prepared, and the staff anticipated my needs and exceeded my expectations. The room was very tasteful and had an excelent view of the skyline. Bed was great, room was clean, and I would change nothing, unless I could have extended my stay...;o)

title: “Standout Service & Comfortable Room”
text: I recently traveled to Houston for business and stayed, along with a number of my colleagues, at the Four Seasons. The service we all received was standout as was the room. I was especially impressed with the personalized touches in my room and bathroom (e.g., eye makeup remover and an offer of a free glass of wine in the hotel bar). The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very spacious. Certainly up to Four Seasons' standards!

title: “Staff were great and rooms were spacious”
text: The hotel staff are great and very friendly. Our room was spacious however there wasn't much of a view. Our only disappointment was that we had to request to have a coffe machine put in our room. It appeared after asking but we were surprised at this level of hotel; it wasn't already provided.

title: “Nice hotel, good location, very practical.”
text:
I stayed at the Four Seasons in Hosuton this May for four nights on a business trip. I was attending a convention at the nearby George Brown Convention Center.
This was my second visit to Houston, and by and large I can see a huge difference. The area around the Convention Center has been cleaned up (and that includes the hotel location). They've planted a park with trees, flowers, a pond and even a tea house. So Houston is definitely moving beyond its image of being a city of heat, dust and ugly concrete. The walk from the hotel to the Convention Center is short, and crosses part of the new park, so overall it feels like being in the same complex. This is a great plus and Houston is a city that is very spread out and where you can easily lose a lot of time travelling, even to places that are supposedly close by.
The hotel is also well located for other attractions in Downtown Houston. The main shopping street is just some blocks away (but honestly speaking not all that interesting, so I wouldn't go there). There are a number of neat bars some of the back streets around the hotel so those are well worth popping into. Also around the corner is the Houston Pavillions, a collection of themed restaurants and music bars all in one building. So you'll have no trouble spending your free time when you're here. I also recommend taking a walk around some of the older parts of Houston which are roughly North and West of the hotel. Personally I was impressed by the different architectural and historical styles. Most recommendable is the Gulf Building (also called Morgan Chase Building) which is an architectural landmark (you can go on a tour). They also seem to be cleaning other parts of Houston up as there is quite a lot of building and renovation going on and much of the ugliness there used to be is gone. One down side, and this has definitely increased since last time I was in Houston, is the number of homeless people and beggars roaming the streets, carrying their belongings in big bags. You see them all day but they seems to get more at night. They aren't dangerous or aggressive but it's still a sorry and uncomfortable sight.
Another thing I can recommend is taking a ride on the Metro. Despite what it's name suggests this is not a traditional metro with tunnels but a streetcar that runs through the streets of Houston and is an interesting way to see different parts of the city, passing several major parks, green areas, universities and other points of interest, and is also a great venue for people watching.
The hotel is quite easy to find. The architecture is a bit nondescript, but difficult to miss nonetheless. The doors were opened for me by a doorman and the receptionist helped me immediately. Besides the hotels and bars I mentioned previously, the hotel has several bars/restaurants of its own. I later tried the one downstairs. Although it was very late at the time (I guess it must have been the early hours of the morning), I was surprised they could still get me something to eat. The choice of drinks was also surprisingly good for a hotel bar and the barman very professional and knowledgeable about it. It was a bit lacking in atmosphere though as most other people there were serious business types and they went to bed quite early.
The hotel has a gym and even an outdoor pool but I only had a quick look at those as I didn't have time for more. Especially the pool did look very inviting, so if I ever come back I'll try and spend some time there. My room was higher up. The view from the window was idionymous with what much of Houston is about. In the foreground a massive expanse of derelict land, temporarily used for car parking, further away some buildings that looked as if they were soon to be torn down. I later discovered there are many more places like these. This is the surreal contrast that typifies Houston: Fancy hotels and many modern skyscrapers that are the HQs of multinationals, and right next door derelict plots and ruined buildings. It makes me wonder how the economics of all that works, and why the people who own what must be very expensive land don't do anything with it. 
The room itself was good but nothing extraordinary. The bed was comfortable though and everything was clean. I didn't check out the minibar, but the ice cubes were filled up every day. Despite being in the middle of Houston, the room was very quiet and I think i slept very well. The bathroom was very tastefully designed, with lots of patterned tiles emanating a warm feeling, making you want to spend a lot of time there.
I think the rooms have free WiFi, but I didn't get around to testing that. 
All in all, the hotel was very well run. The staff were good, the hotel was extremely clean and I can find no fault with any part of it. The interior decoration is on the whole tasteful and makes you feel at ease. The location is also good.

title: “a hotel that smells very good”
text: I was going to a concert in the near by Toyota center and it made sense to stay there instead of having to find parking late at night. When you first walked into the lobby you will be hit with air that has been injected with some delightful scent. The room was clean and the staff was fairly helpful. I had an unfortunate run in with the waiter at the restaurant but the manager was open to constructive advice. Overall not a bad place.

title: “Perfect for Families”
text: We were a group of 4 adults and 3 children so we booked 2 1 bedroom suites which were perfect. The bedrooms were spacious and the lounge area had a lot of room to move around, even once you put the sofa bed up. The kitchen is small but adequate and when staying for 6 nights it was nice to be able to make breakfasts and heat things up for dinner. There was lots of storage space so we weren't tripping over our cases. The only thing which could be improved would be to have more hooks to hang towels in the bathroom but aside from that we were extremely happy with the Beacon. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms clean. The location was excellent. Fairways market was across the road for breakfast supplies and there were lots of restaurants and cafes within a short walk. The subway station was a two minute walk and it was only a 5 minute walk to Central Park and a 25 min walk to Times Square. Was really nice to be in a residential area that was quiet, yet close to everything. Will definately stay at the Beacon when we come back to New York.

title: “Very convenient for families!”
text: Excecllent for families as you can get suites with one or two bedrooms. We travelled as a family of four and had a one bedroom suite - the pull out sofabed in the living room were great fofr the kids and folded up in seconds in the morning. Small kitchen area with fridge and gas stove - the only negative thing really was that the gas stove was just too easy to switch on by accident - several times we must have touched it without realizing what was happening and could suddenly smell gas... Friendly staff and just metres away from the 72nd street subway station. Fairways market across the road provided us with breakfast. A handy Duane Reade (pharmacy, beauty products and snacks) vvery close - open 24/7. Starbucks at hand :)

title: “Great location, room, and hotel”
text: We stayed here for only one night but wish it had been longer. The location of the hotel was perfect for our family of 4 ... we were able to walk to the Park, Central Park Zoo, FAO Schwarz, and, most importantly,Gray's Papaya! The staff was very accommodating; we were arriving from a hotel in Brooklyn and when I contacted this hotel, they allowed for an early check-in. The one-room suite was ideal for us with our two younger boys (5, 8) and the kitchen area was was perfect. The room was very clean; the bed was very comfortable; and the hotel was very quiet. We didn't hear a peep from anyone else in the hotel! We will DEFINITELY stay here again.

title: “Great location and great rooms that”
text: It's a boutique hotel with only a handful of rooms on each floor and really quiet. Has an amazing shower in the bathroom and all the amenities at an Andaz. Location is great, you can walk to most places except soho and the village. So much better than the W

title: “Different! A Poor Start but a Happy Ending”
text:
Our stay at the Andaz did not start well, taxi driver could not find the hotel due to poor signage and cars double parked by the hotel entrance. Once inside, it was not clear where we had to wait as reception area was not obvious and we had to wait 5 minutes before staff appeared. Once checked in we could not open our room door only to find that we had been given the wrong room.
Why have I awarded the Andaz such a high rating you may ask? Well, once the room issue was resolved the hotel staff were very attentive and efficient. We liked our room, especially the bathroom, my only critisism is with the glass wardrobes, not because they were see through, they were just not big enough to store clothing for two people staying 5 days. Loved the shower, the room size, free non-alcoholic mini-bar, and the high ceilings.
Breakfast was superb, we ate everyday, although tended to have lunch & dinner outside of the hotel. Liked the complimentary wine off the reception area at happy hour.
So, besides our first 20 minutes at the hotel, the rest of the time was great.

title: “Good, but needs improvement in a few problem areas”
text:
This was a decent hotel, but for the price I paid, it needs to improve. The problems I had with the hotel are the same problems many reviewers have noted, which concerns me since they don't appear to be being addressed. I'll start with the cons (problem areas): 1) Check-in in has major issues - I initially attempted to check in at 11 am, there was no room available so they took our bags and told us to come back. They said they would work on getting us a high room as I requested. I ended up getting a room on the 4th floor...not high in my book, but I'm assuming it is the highest they had available. Anyhow, they called at around 4 to let me know my room was ready. We came back in the early evening to check in and that is when things took a turn. Check in was chaotic despite the fact that there was only one other couple checking in at the same time. The young man asked us for our name, handed us our key and that was it. No description of the property or amenities, no maps or questions about why we were visiting, no introduction or mention of the concierge, no offer to help us with our bags, nothing. The whole ordeal was a bit cold and unprofessional. 2) The staff is very young and trendy, which fits the hotel vibe, and always smile, but there is just a warmth that is missing. There also seems to be a real lack of organization. The staff always seem to be running around, but not necessarily helping you when you need it. Out of the three days we were there, a staff member opened the front door for us 1 time. That is unacceptable when I am paying $400 a night. I highly recommend management start instituting stations that people must man at all times instead of running around frantically. A person at the front door at all times and a person at the check-in desk at all times is a must. 3) No closet space. The hotel is trendy, I get it and I've stayed at other hotels with similar concepts, but none with this little storage space. No drawers and only a tiny glass closet space to hang a few item and 4) the bed was ok, definitely not the comfiest I've ever slept in.
Pros: Room was very, very clean and the view of the public library was nice. The minibar in the room was a nice touch since it offered free snacks and non-alcoholic drinks. The room was quiet despite facing 5th avenue. Location was awesome.
I stay in NYC at least 2x a year and I doubt I will be going back to this hotel. For the $ I think there are better options with more personal service. If it works out the kinks, I think ti would be a great place to stay.

title: “How to Ruin a Hotel Stay”
text:
I don't ask for much. A hotel that's worth the money with good service and speedy and accurate check in and out. The Andaz, a boutique hotel that is trying a bit too hard to be trendy, was a failure for us. It started out a bit weak. The hotel is difficult to find with no discernable marking and only one spot out front. Nevertheless they managed to take the car after we doubleparked and brought in the luggage. They have the oh-so-cool kiosks with young staff dressed in black. We were in quickly. The room was ok, nice modern bathroom, obligatory impossible to figure out lighting and minimal free snacks. But ok.
Nice big bedand we had a good sleep. Excellent breakfast. Brought our stuff down and checked it with the bellmen and told them to keep our car until later. Got the claim checks and went out for the day. When we checked out at 4 the chaos began. They charged us $300 for a late check out (we left at 11:30). The brought us the wrong luggage. Then the wrong car! (worse then mine so I sent it back). They tried to console us but the damage was done. Pay a little more attention to service and a little less to trying to be hip (impossible in NYC--the hotel is so 2010). Please, no canned management comment about how sorry you are. Own up to it and travelers will return.

title: “Very good hotel with an excellent location”
text: Ok, by NYC standards this is a very nice hotel with great rooms. It has an excellent location, but a boring lobby-definately not a people watching-place to be seen, hip, or even very cool place. It is clean, with larger than usual rooms, a good staff, and is easy to access. The dining choices are limited-but who cares? After all this is New York with fabulous dining adventures on every corner. The hair salon, on Level 4, does a very nice $40 blow out to prepare you for a night on the town.

title: “Post Hurricane Sandy trip to NYC - Decent room, dirty carpet, nice staff, slow checkout”
text:
We came to NYC for a weekend wedding, one week after Sandy hit the east coast. So I think maybe some of my negative reviews were related to that. Anyways, here's what I think of this hotel: 
Pros: decent sized room-I requested a corner unit because we had a dog with us, and didn't want to disturb neighbors. It's not the largest room I've stayed in NYC, but definitely the room with the highest ceiling and the largest bathroom. The minibar in the room has soda and sparkling water, all complimentary. In-room service was fast. Staff was nice to me, but per my husband, he walked right after me into the hotel and nobody acknowledged him. 
Cons: dirty carpet, which was my biggest complaint. I was appalled to see those stains, for a five-star establishment like this, how can you have stains on the carpet? Second complaint, we needed cabs on several occasions, nobody offered to get us a cab at first, then I remembered this happened twice--after we stood outside for like 5 minutes, someone finally came to help us, but was either at the same time chatting with someone else, or really not trying as hard as I'd like to. Third and last complaint, when we checked out, we waited in line for 10 min, because there was only one girl at front desk. 
Maybe it's post-hurricane and people were still recovering, or maybe this is what this hotel truly is, but the whole time, I felt like Setai was under-staffed at front desk and outside the door. Dirty carpet was unacceptable to me, staff was nice to me but not to my husband. And minimal help on getting a cab. For those reasons, I don't think I'd return.

title: “Incredible Staff”
text: This is a lovely hotel and the staff are incredible. They remember your name and things you have told them you are going to do, nice personal touch! Our room overlooked 5th Avenue and was nice and modern. Nice location ,we have always stayed closer to Times Square on previous visits but didn't find this too out of the way at all. We walked everywhere and it was great to be on 5th avenue and be close to all the designer stores. Would stay here again.

title: “Home from home”
text:
After researching many hotels in NYC for our break, we chose the Setai. When we arrived, they unfortunately were closed due to heating problems caused by Hurricane Sandy so we had to go elsewhere for our first night. The staff on duty were very apologetic and assisted us in getting to another hotel.
Thankfully, we were able to return on day two, so spent the rest of our trip there. We had booked a Capella room and asked for a high floor. We stayed in room 1401 which was massive......and I mean huge! The bed was six foot wide and was lost in the room. We overlooked Fifth Avenue and the Chrysler Building. The room had a decent sized seating area with a sofa and two armchairs and the bed. There was a dressing room which had two double open wardrobes and drawers. This then lead into a huge marble bathroom, with twin basins and plenty of countertop space. Shower was vast with two shower heads. You honestly have to see this room to appreciate the space. I do not like small hotel rooms and hate when your cases sit in the corner on open view, which serves to remind that you are going home.....no issues here though - suitcases were well hidden from view.
The Bar on Fifth has a nice, relaxed atmosphere and has jazz bands playing every night.
Location of the hotel is great for going to the various sights of NYC in both lower and midtown Manhattan.
Had a serious personal issue during stay. Brian Fahey, Concierge Manager, was absolutely fabulous with his assistance. He always made sure that he kept up to date with the situation and it helped me feel a little more relaxed. 
Managed to use the hotel car (a Maserati) a couple of times - nice touch of luxury.
Our room was right next to the lift shaft but we could not hear any noises. The room is at the end of the corridor with one other room and is a fair distance away from other rooms, so no disruptions from others walking past.
Did not eat in the hotel (apart from room service late one night, which was good). Plenty of coffee shops, etc nearby for breakfasts.
The Nespresso machine and complimentary mini bar (soft beverages) was a nice touch. Have been in plenty of high end hotels which did not have this. There have been some previous comments bout these not being replenished when used but a quick call to Guest Services soon sort that out.
Would definitely recommend to others and would stay here again on our return.

title: “Great location, but would not stay there again”
text: The Chatwal could not be better located. Everything is walkable from the location on 44th street between 6th and 7th The staff was also great. But the room is very small. And very high tech. And we did not receive an orientation to the room. So we could not figure out simple things, like turning the lights on and off. We actually never figured out one of the lights so we just unscrewed the lightbulbs every night. On our second day we requested and received an orientation, which was very helpful, so we could used all of the "special features" of the toilet. In case it appears we are completely inept, we are not....the toilet actually had to be reset so that the bidet features would work. But the toilet still malfunctioned twice in our three-day visit so that engineering had to come to reset it. So it was a little too high tech for our tastes. Also, we paid for the terrace, which is completely useless unless you are a smoker. Otherwise you would not want to spend time there since it is close to the HVAC unit so very noisy and no view. Lastly, both bars and the restaurant were completely unavailable beginning at 4pm on one of our nights because the Food Network was using the location. It would have been nice if guests of the hotel were offered a complimentary glass of wine or something for the inconvenience. So overall, given the high cost of rooms in this hotel, even with the great location and great staff, we would not stay here again.

title: “A Oasis of Calm in Times Square”
text:
We had 2 rooms at the Chatwal over Labor Day weekend to enjoy the City and the US Open. I had requested that one of the rooms have 2 beds, and that request was accomodated. If that is important to you, be aware that you may get a handicapped-accessible room. For us that was not a problem. The staff was excellent, welcoming us, introducing us to the Butler and bell staff, and making sure our checking was simple. They were also attentive and helpful throughout the rest of the stay. Our room had a quirk in that you could not turn on/off all the lights from the entry light panel. I hope this will be analyzed and fixed. The room was very comfortable and overall quiet. We faced to street and got some expected street noise, but given the location it wasn't bad. The only problem we had was the WiFi. I had almost no signal in my room and my companions had no signal in their room at the other end of the floor. If you are staying for business you will probably need to plug in to the connection, which I did not try. For a smartphoone or iThing you will have an issue. Otherwise, the staff and room was excellent and we plan on staying here again.
Note that this is not a highrise hotel. It's a very old building (for US standards). You will have no view of anything.

title: “Magnificent at All Levels !!!!”
text: Great reviews, so we booked this hotel for my 50th birthday celebration in New York. We arrived after 24 hours of travel from Auckland, New Zealand to stay for 11 nites, 3rd Oct till 14th Oct. What a superb hotel, right from check in to our entire stay. We had a room on the 8th floor which was large and luxurious and not to mention the very spacious bathroom. Amenities in room,gorgeous Asprey products. Very quiet,no noise. Great location to theatre district and shopping,very convenient. One of my birthday gifts was a hot stone massage treatment at the Elizabeth Arden spa, simply sensational after lugging all those shopping bags around.:-) Lobby bar and the first floor bars,excellent to entertain friends in a gorgeous atmosphere. We will surely highly recommend this hotel to our friends and family visiting New York. We travel frequently and find this hotel among one of the best. Thanks to all staff who in made my special occasion visit, one to remember.

title: “Excellent NYC hotel”
text: I had to review this property again. I had one bad experience back in June, but it's not a fair assessment of this hotel. The hotel is great, and the staff is always on point. It will continue to be my hotel of choice when visiting NYC.

title: “Another super stay.”
text: The Eventi has become my go-to hotel in NYC. Why? Whether for business or pleasure, the staff is attentive to every need, genuinely friendly, knowledgeable, professional, great conversationalists, and I could go on and on. The rooms - super modern chic. And large. Everything just so. I do enjoy the restaurant for breakfast. The neighborhood is super-convenient. My stay during this past Thanksgiving weekend was just heaven.

title: “Fantastic 4 night stay”
text:
We've just returned from our New York trip and can not recommend The Eventi enough. We'd booked a corner deluxe suite and when we checked in had already been upgraded to a city view corner, then when we told them it was our Honeymoon upgraded us again to a suite overlooking Empire State Building, we also had complimentary Champagne and cupcakes, plus mini bar credit. Amazing! We were on 8th floor and traffic noise not an issue at all.
Staff are friendly and always helpful, couldn't do enough for us.
Perfect location, only 5 min walk to Macy's and 34th St subway which provides connection to anywhere in the city. Within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park and 5th Ave but after two days of walking everywhere resorted to subway to save our tired tired feet!! 
I only have a couple of cautions
- Do Not buy tickets from street vendors they will rip you off
- Do not bother with The View restaurant in Times Square - ridiculously expensive for poor food which gave my husband food poisoning!
- Be careful in taking Town Car back to airport. Told us would be $75 inc tip but when we arrived at JFK would not take any less than $95. Pay up front before you leave hotel.
We had a fantastic time in NY and would definitely stay t The Eventi again

title: “We will be back!”
text: Everything about the Iroquois exceeded our expectations. The room is lovely and large for NYC standards. The bathrooms are well appointed, lovely towels, robes, etc. Beds were great. The service at the hotel was above and beyond - friendly, helpful and efficient. Breakfast excellent. The location of the Iroquois cannot be beat - walk to the theater, Central Park, Empire State, etc. After staying in several large and small hotels in midtown, I will be going back to the Iroquois.

title: “Great Hotel”
text: I loved this hotel. Very convenient to Time Square, restaurants and theaters. Beautiful, small, luxurious hotel. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The beds are very comfortable and the linens great.

title: “A pleasure from start to finish”
text: We arrived at 3:00 p.m. and were greeted warmly by the staff. Warm cider was "on tap" in the lobby, adjacent to the engaging library with its collection focusing on theatres and showbiz history. Our accommodation was a suite on the fifth floor, facing 44th street. This afforded views of the handsome facades of the buildings directly opposite. There was no noticeable traffic noise. The suite was handsomely furnished and included a sofa bed for the third person in our party. The Iroquois is perfectly located in midtown Manhattan, within an easy walk of so many attractions. The block of 44th street on which the Iroquois is located has much history and was written about in a 2012 issue of Vanity Fair. After a pleasant night's sleep, we enjoyed a delicious continental breakfast in the adjoining Triomphe restaurant and, with regret, checked out...but with the expectation of returning.

title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
text:
This hotel is a real gem in NYC. We reserved a one room suite and were truly amazed at the size of the room, given its location. The kitchenette was very convenient, the service was outstanding, the maids did a very good job, and the front desk was friendly. We received great recommendations for dinner. The hotel was very well kept up, the rug was showing a little wear, but during our stay they started coming in and replacing the rugs on our floor.
The free breakfast was just OK, and served in a very crowded room. But overall, I would definitely highly recommend this hotel and stay here again.

title: “Good Quality, Good Location”
text: My wife, two kids, and my mother-in-law stayed in a suite at this hotel. Check in was a breeze, no need to wait in a long line or anything like that. The room was excellent for the price, compared to the normal, puny-sized rooms of New York. There were 2 separate rooms, one with a king bed and one with a sofa bed. The sofa bed was a queen bed, so it was big enough to fit two people, but for our convenience, they brought in an extra roll-in bed for us. One of the best things about this hotel was that its room service almost immediately brought you whatever you wanted. For example, I asked for more towels and shampoo before I showered, and they delivered them in less than two minutes. The breakfast was rather simple, but the quality was still good. Sometimes it got so crowded that you had to wait in a line to get in. The breakwast was also light, hence the name "continental breakfast," with a wide variety of pastries, breads, yogurts, etc. The hotel's location was very good, right next to the Waldorf Astoria and a short walk to Saks Fifth Avenue. One negative of this hotel was that the dining portion of the room service was not 24/7, and it was only Indian food. The staff was also extremely kind and welcoming. The concierge performed magic tricks for my 5 year old son and gave him chocolates, which brightened up his trip a bit. Overall, this hotel was a successful pick, and I would recommend it to both people and families who are looking for quality, not necessarily luxury.

title: “Convenient Location, Comfortable and Clean Rooms, but...”
text:
We stayed on the sixth floor facing 50th. The rooms were comfortable, large and clean. However, the noise from the street and the construction across the street would wake us up through out the night. This is a convenient location and the staff is friendly. I will likely stay here on my next visit to NYC, however, I would like to see some improvements...
Finding a seat during breakfast was a challenge, regardless of when we came down -- so more seating would be encouraging, possibly in the lobby, which is mostly empty. Or they can provide trays so the guests can make use of their spacious rooms and kitchenette.
The selection during breakfast was disappointing, consisting of mostly of white carbs, pastries, soft apples, Corn Flakes, and Rice Crispies. Great if you are two, but not an adult meal. My wife and I are both allergic to milk, and there were no alternatives available -- so more healthy choices would be encouraging, such as soy or almond milk, boiled eggs, cold cuts, granola, Fiber 1, oatmeal etc.
Despite these minor details, I feel that this Hotel is a great stay due to the pluses, including, comfy beds, wifi, soft and fluffy pillows & enough of them, Aveda products in the bathroom, kitchenette in the room, coffee machine in the room, spacious rooms and seating, convenient location -- close to Grand Central, cleanness and helpful staff.

title: “Great location, large room”
text: My daughter and I recently stayed in an executive king suite. We got a great rate. The hotel is in a perfect location that made walking to Rock Center, Central Park and public transit very easy. The suite was large and clean, the public areas were very nice, business center with plenty of computers/printers for printing boarding passes. Nice continental breakfast in the morning, but the dining area was very busy so we just took our food to our room since it had a kitchenette. Free internet. Service was very good, as well. Only problem was the noise - we were on 12th floor and could hear honking starting very early (and we were on a side street), and the neighbors next door - showering, toddler being loud, etc. I don't think they have soundproofing in walls or windows, so if you're a light sleeper this would be a problem. All in all, I would recommend and would stay here again.

title: “New York Classic”
text: Another fantastic visit to New Yok City. The perfectly located Sherry Netherland is an oasis of calm perfection in the midst of the city that never sleeps. Its gracious European elegance and friendly, service-oriented staff make it the ideal choice for any length stay.

title: “Location is not bad, nice restaurants around, clean and modern, renovated rooms, hip restaurant. Oner Ayan”
text: Although it is not in the middle of action, it is not far from tourist attractions or Grand Central. They recently renovated the rooms, did a good job; very modern amenities, despite being a little small. Nice asian and Indian restaurants in the neighborhood , also try Penelope, the small restaurant close by with great grilled cheese sandwich. Oner Ayan

title: “Sherry Netherland is a 10”
text: You will not be dissapointed....wonderful beds, beautiful rooms. Location at South Central Park is just great. If we had questions, the staff was right there to help.

title: “A grand stay at the Sherry!!”
text: My family and I, after much research, decided to stay at the Sherry Netherland Hotel. It was a fantastic experience. The rooms were fabuluous, the staff friendly and well trained and the location can not be beat. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Sherry!!

title: “Hotel Review”
text:
The staff & management have been extremely helpful and very friendly. The maintenance & up keep at this hotel is second to none. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, including families, and I have already booked to bring my family & friends from Scotland next May for a vacation. 
Regards Mr Glenn McMillan from Scotland

title: “Check in always a nightmare”
text: This is the third time in a year a stayed in this hotel and I can't say check i is getting any better. On March, they did not have the non smoking room ready at check in time. They offered me a smoking room, as if it was a non smoking. Had to return to front desk. Then they gave me a room that was not clean. Unforgivable. At the end after 4 hours of wait I got a room that was supposed to non smoking (cleary had a smoker recently staying), but was bareable. On September I booked a double room but they gave me a single. Front desk suggested me to sleep in the sofa bed on colleagues room for the same rate. BAD JOKE. At the end, after a lot of discussions, they gave me another single room, but upon "check out" billed me double. 1 hour two get the bill straight.

title: “Excellent Customer Service”
text: Stayed at hotel for two week stretches 4 or 5 times on business and was impressed with the staff, cleanliness and attention to customer service that was extended. Director of sales was EXTREMELY professional and technically sound. My needs were met and my expectations were exceeded. Great Job!

title: “Perfect Place to Stay to See Events in Downtown Houston!!”
text: My daughter and I attended a Paul McCartney concert a couple of weeks ago in Houston at Minute Maid Park. The Hilton Americas Hotel is located in downtown Houston and was the perfect place to stay because its within walking distance of the ball park! We parked our car in the Hilton parking garage which was complimentary and we walked to a nice restaurant downtown for dinner and then to the ballpark for the concert. No problems with traffic or parking! The hotel and room was very nice and I got it with Hilton Honors points so you couldn't beat it! We had a wonderful stay with no hassles and it was the perfect hotel to stay in to see an event downtown!

title: “Best Western Downtown”
text:
I was looking for a hotel near downtown Houston to be near family. Usually we bypass Best Western but this hotel had wonderful reviews so I decided to give it a whirl. My husband and I stayed there for one night and it was good. Our King-bed room was roomy and pleasant. Sofa, chair, desk, mini-fridge, microwave etc. The bed was AWESOME (and I'm not easy to please). Our room was on the 4th floor, very quiet and cool. The flat screen TV was new. Helpful and friendly staff. 
The breakfast was crazy good. Scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles (make yourself), cereal, bagels, biscuits, fruit, yogurt, 3 kinds of coffee if that's your thing, very tasty. The eggs were moist and flavorful, the real deal. Good job BW. I would suggest more rate discounts. Otherwise, this hotel is a very good property.

title: “Very nice stay!”
text:
I traveled to Houston to go look at the school and this was an amazing location. It was right on the campus and for a chain hotel it was extremely clean, had a decent restaurant, and a knowledgeable and over-helpful staff.
The restaurant was very good, except for the fact that I wish there were more options for the entrees. It was a little expensive, but all hotels will be. The restaurant staff seemed a little preoccupied as well. I had to wait when I wanted to get my check one night for about ten minutes, because it seemed like it was closing time.
The front desk staff, however, was amazing and attentive. Tremaine is a great asset to this hotel, and she is actually part of the school's graduate program! The other people that were there too were so so nice and I haven't experienced customer service like that in a long time. When I wanted a taxi, they called one right away for me and actually walked me out to the taxi and made sure it was going to the right destination, etc... They also are great in coversation. They really care about what they're doing and stop what they're doing in order to help you. They make you feel right at home! 
I didn't use many of their other amenities or know if there were any, but it was a very nice and peaceful place that offered a coffee maker in the room, will bring a refridgerator right up to you (houseman was extremely nice as well) and all free of charge!
If I come to stay and look at the campus again, I will definitely be staying here, it is very convenient and made my trip a lovely place to stay!
Thank you to all of the front desk staff for making my trip comfortable, exciting and great overall!

title: “LOVELY PROPERTY”
text:
My husband and I checked into this property early yesterday evening. Very friendly front office staff. Ching Ching checked us in....
Our king room on the 8th floor was very lovely....comfortable bed, good shower and water pressure.....nice touch was the lighted makeup mirror!! Tons of natural light as well as ample lamps as well as tons of plugs for different things to plug in!
Be prepared to pay $15 for underground parking....you have unlimited access in and out for that price.
One change -- on the website, it states "unlimited free local phone calls". In their Guest Directory that they leave in the room, it states $.50/per local call...I called downstairs and they were unsure. I called the Diamond Desk and they said they spoke to a manager and the policy has changed and there really is a $.50/per local call. Hopefully, the website will be corrected to reflect the change!!
Being a Diamond Member, we were offered complimentary breakfast @ Eric's. Really pretty restaurant inside....I ordered a cheese omelette with a bagel - very tasty and my husband had the french toast and he enjoyed that a lot too. Coffee tasted sorta burned tasting... so drank mostly water!!

title: “Excellent Product and Service”
text: As an alum of the Hilton College, I am proud to come back as a professional and see how far the hotel has come in a few short years. Since their receivnt renovation, they now have a beuatiful modern product and a friendly service staff consisting primarily of students from the hospitality program. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay, from our warm greeting at the front desk to our check out. The guest rooms are spacious, with beautiful decor, comfortable furnishings, and a great updated bathroom. The room service and outlets are excellent, with great student interaction if you visit the student run coffee shop or lunch restaurant. A great experience this time, and I will absolutely return soon!!

title: “Great Hilton!”
text:
This is a teaching hotel with students from UH hotel mgt program. Very professional and friendly. 
One review said you have to check in before you can enter garage. Not true! Get a ticket and take elevator up. Easy. 
Hotel is very quiet and modern!

title: “Always Delivers”
text:
I often travel on business and when I go to Houston, I look forward to staying at this hotel. Apart form the facilities that are value for money and are of a hight standard, which feels like I am stayng in a five star hotel, but for a four star price; they always remember me. 
Its often the personal touches that make the difference between an OK stay to an exceptional stay. They even gave me a complementary bottle of wine in my room, which was of a resonable quality and just happens to be the one I would normally drink.
The complementary breakfast of fresh juice, berries and pastries is very good.

title: “Great service; noisy crowd”
text: The location is terrific, the Euro-chic decor is funky and hip, and the room layout was great. We had friendly and helpful service from beginning to end, but stayed on a Friday night and were woken up multiple times until around 3 a.m. by loud and intoxicated guests getting in and out of the elevator - but that's a chance you take at any hotel. Despite that complaint, though, the bed was firm, the pillows were generous, and everything was extremely clean. The continental breakfast was quite generous, and the location in CityCentre couldn't be better if you're looking for a fun night out - there are a number of restaurants and bars just steps from the hotel - highly recommend Flora & Muse. We had the best dinner of our lives there the night we stayed at the hotel.

title: “Overpriced for Value”
text:
We stayed here three nights, and upon checking in it felt like a 5 star hotel based on the decor. In the end, I think we would have been just as content at a new Holiday Inn Express and saved a lot of $$. I didn't think there were any incentives to spend the extra money and stay in this hotel at the citycentre. 
The following were the negative aspects of our hotel stay: 
- Limited space in room to store belongings and toiletries
- Breakfast is very disappointing, and there is limited seating in the breakfast area aka Lobby. 
- No hot-tub and very small pool 
- The "Fitness Center and Spa" means there are some exercise machines, no spa. 
- Several of our modern furniture items in our room were broken or missing pieces. Made it feel a little more like IKEA than High Class. 
-You can hear the busy citycentre crowd, traffic and band through the windows, hope you're not a light sleeper.

title: “Nice room, amenities disappoint”
text: Stayed here for 2 nights in November 2012. King bedded room was well appointed with very nice walk in shower with rain shower head. Unfortunately the expected services for this new Marriott Collection of hotels fell short. Front desk personnel were very pleasant and helpfull with directions but there was no concierge at all. Apparently, they offer turndown service but only on request, and I only found out by reading this right before checking out. Room service trays were left in the hallways for hours and I should not have to ask for toilet paper , liquid soap and tissues to be restocked after the room is made up for the day. This was the first time that I can remember that a newspaper was not left at my door as a Marriott Rewards member , although they were available at the front desk. All in all the hotel was ok but there was very little to make it special.

title: “Love love loved it!”
text: We stayed for two nights and paid a little over $100/night using our AAA discount. This was an incredible value. I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are large and immaculate. The bathrooms are luxurious. The staff was extremely gracious. I cannot say enough about the beautiful decor throughout this hotel. We had drinks at the lobby bar (fun!), coffee in the lobby (free!) and brunch in the restaurant (so-so but the ambiance made up for the mediocre food).

title: “Hotel Icon”
text:
We were pleasantly surprized ! We were referred there because it was close to the concert venue, turns out, the hotel shuttled us over to Minute Maid Ball Park to see Sir Paul McCartney.
The hotel has a car and would have taken us other places had we stayed longer. Our room was very unique, with a great tub AND shower ! In fact the bath room was overwhelming ! The room itself had tall vaulted ceilings with beautiful crown molding and the bed was very comfortable. Will def stay there again when in Houston.

title: “Great Location and Great Rooms!”
text: We live in Houston and just wanted a night out to celebrate our anniversary. We were able to walk to dinner and then walk to a few bars for drinks after. We also had a few drinks in the hotel bar (great bartenders). The rooms are very nice and have lots of character!

title: “Bad First Experience at a Four Seasons Hotel”
text: The Four Seasons Hotel in downtown Houston is a great location and beautiful building! The staff are all very nice and professional. I did find that my one night stay was not worth the money spent as the AC in my room did not work well and I couldn't sleep hardly at all and any sleep I did get was terrible due to the warmth and stillness of the air in the room. Next time I am in Houston I am sorry to say but I will not be going back to the Four Seasons Hotel.

title: “Incredible hotel with a staff that is even better.”
text: The hotel was very nice and the staff looked for opportunities to serve. You won't be disappointed. We stayed there for our ten year anniversary getaway and they made it very enjoyable. We typically don't eat at hotel restaurants but the reviews were good enough to give it a try. We were very glad we did, the food and the service were over the top. The pool area was very nice as well. It was different for us not staying in the Galleria area but we enjoyed the change. The George R. Brown convention has self serve bike rentals that we took advantage of to see more of the downtown area.

title: “Service was outstanding...dont let decor get in the way.”
text:
Like everyone has posted, the physical structure and dated looks of the building inside and out is very obvious. That said, the staff was one of the most outstanding crew I have ever encountered in a hotel. Wonderful service all around. Super nice caring people...Four Seasons all the way.
Very low key hotel. The outside pool and bar area is very nice. Great service here too. Check in and out was a breeze. Valet guys exceptional. Housekeeping fantastic, breakfast was excellent. The hotel is close to many things in downtown and wonderful hidden gems of the locals. The spa was booked but they sent me to the Hilton 2 blocks away and I had a great massage. The Hilton is gorgeous inside, brand new...I do not know if their service was as top notch as the Four Seasons but their Spa staff was great. 
Do not let the outdated looks of the hotel stop you from staying here. I am sure they will update soon.
This was our first time in Houston and both my husband and I agreed that this city has the nicest people we have ever met. We will be back.

title: “Great Location and Staff.”
text: We stayed here the week before Thanksgiving 2012. We were on the 25th floor facing Central Park. The room was much bigger than we expected for NYC. We didn't hear any street noise in our room thanks to the soundproof glass. Noise from other rooms was minimal. We had a king sized bed and a kitchenette. There are a few grocery stores within walking distance, so we bought breakfast foods to save a few dollars during our stay. The neighborhood is great and the staff was friendly. The subway is close and if you want to hoof it Central Park and Times Square are walkable if you have plenty of time and good shoes. We will use the Hotel Beacon again.

title: “Location & style = great; staff = meh”
text: Great location for our Thanksgiving weekend festivities; 2.5 blocks from Central Park West where we camped out for the parade. (Getting there at 6am was not early enough for front row, fyi! Next time: 5 am). Our 2 room King suite was spacious (for NYC), the kitchenette well equipped; the bathroom had a great powerful shower with plenty of hot water (but no exhaust fan - got pretty steamy with 3 adults showering in a row). Very nice furnishings, clean and well-maintained. 2 big TVs; docking station for iPods. Our low-floor room was great given that the elevators can be slow. I never knew about the laundry room that others have mentioned here; I add that to the list of things the staff couldn't be bothered with telling us. Along with: no parking garage within 10 blocks will let you park overnight over Thanksgiving (we ended up at Lincoln Center 12 blocks away, on a tip from a guy at the 6th garage we tried); even though checkin is at 3pm, that doesn't necessarily mean 3, it might mean 4:30; (because "it's really busy" - now I know to only expect what I pay for when it's slow). I know it's been a while since I've been to NY, because I noticed the lack of pleasantries, such as "good morning" from a doorman or "Did you enjoy you stay?" from the front desk. Ah well. It's a nice place and you'll love it if you want to stay in a quieter part of the city, without being too far away from things. Fairway across the street; Starbucks on the corner; liquor store next door. Perfect for our 3 day stay :)

title: “Great stay”
text: Stayed here from 23 Sep until the 27 Sep 2012. Wonderful hotel! Conveniently located close to the subway, which was awesome as we bought a week subway pass and used the subway for all our transport requirements. Arrived at the hotel really early in the morning at 8am, the staff were wonderful and checked us in at 12pm instead of 3pm. The hotel room was amazing we stayed in a one bedroomed suite, which suited our needs perfectly. The room had a small kitchen, lounge, bedroom, bathroom and dining area. Really spacious for NYC. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again. The only complaint was that we we so busy and did not have enough time to spend in the room.

title: “Honeymoon Trip”
text: We stayed here recently on our honeymoon. We loved it! The room was a great size and had an incredible view of the building of the upper west side. Location was excellent and only a short walk to the nearest subway station and quite a few fantastic restaurants. The only negative was the bathroom. It was a good size but it was very dated and the grout etc was quite yellow and old also the shower was a bit odd at times with water pressure. That being said, it wasn't a major problem for us anyway.

title: “Great location and nice features”
text: I have stayed at the Andaz 5th Avenue twice. It is a boutique hotel that is well located, near the library and Bryant Park. My teenage daughter loved the trendy decor. The rooms are small, but larger than most in NYC. The bathroom is very modern and spacious. The free glasses of wine in the evening and snacks and non-alcoholic beverages in the room are a nice feature. The only issue is that the rooms only accommodate 2 people. It wouldn't work out for a family.

title: “Excellence in a Crisis”
text:
The Andaz would have received an excellent rating from us in normal times - but in the chaos of Sandy they deserve a 5 Star Plus ! The management and staff handled the whole situation in a very professional, efficient and very friendly manner, so important when most of the guests are probably stressed for one reason or another. Also most of the staff were sleeping in as they could not get home and worked several shifts on the trot. Most guests will want to mention particular staff - for us we want to particularly thank "Ramon" and "JD" for their helpful and friendly attention.
The Andaz will be our first call the next time we visit New York!

title: “Would love to stay here again”
text: Stayed here for one night and after staying at the Andaz on Wall Street during the summer, I honestly can say these two properties are TOPS for NYC standards. The room at Andaz on fifth was very spacious and I loved the separated bedroom and tv areas. The bathroom was awesome, although we had some company and it was a little odd to not have a door directly closing the toilet area in if someone was trying to get ready on the other side. Staff were all very courteous and helpful, they held our bags for practically all of Sunday until we finally came back from venturing around. Did not try to restaurant or bar area, but the lobby was always a buzz with people. Cannot beat the room sizes here, especially if you are staying for more than one night, feels like home away from home. The free mini-bar items are always a nice touch, and the fridge helps out too! Location is perfect for shopping too :)

title: “Great location, great hotel.”
text:
I stayed at The Setai NYC on business in Oct 2012 for 5 nights. 
My room was a good size with a large comfy bed, was extremley clean and had a wonderful view of The Empire State Building. The bathroom was also a good size with a large bath/shower and even had a small TV screen built into the mirror above the sink! 
Location wise the hotel is excellent with the Empire State Building and Macy's within a stone's throw and all the shops of 5th Avenue on your doorstop. Grand Central Station and Times Square are also a short walk away and the hotel has 3 subway stops close by (Herald Square, Grand Central/42nd and 42nd/Bryant Pk). 
The staff I cannot fault one bit, they were very helpful and very polite at all times and couldn't do enough for you. There is a very nice bar just by the lobby which I used a few times but note, there is a jazz band in there during the evenings and can get quite loud if you are after a quiet drink! The restaurant is very highly rated and was recommended to me but I didn't get the chance to use it. For breakfast I opted to go outside rather than use the hotel with Pret, Starbucks and a deli right outside. 
Overall, this is a great hotel with excellent staff and facilities and I would definitely recommend it, but, being a 5 star hotel is a bit on the expensive side, even compared to other 5 star hotels I ve stayed in, you can probably get something in NY very similar for a bit cheaper.

title: “Wonderful staff, perfect location”
text: We stayed here during Hurricane Sandy and we could not get over the friendliness and professionalism of the hotel staff. They have to be the nicest staff in a hotel we have ever come across. Not staged or phoney and couldn't do enough for you. Jackie and your team you are a credit to your hotel! As a result of the hurricane the power was out in a lot of New York, the hotel staff, whilst extremely restricted as to what they could do to make everyone feel comfortable without power, sprung into action with back up plans to ensure all guests were looked after. There was a skeleton crew on during the hurricane who worked extremely hard and, whilst they were exhausted, still managed to go beyond the call of duty. The hotel is in an ideal location on 5th avenue, beautifully furnished, food excellent and attention to detail was top notch. We will more than happily stay here again. What a wonderful experience! x

title: “Nice hotel great location!!!!”
text:
We stayed for 3 nights 4 days. Service is good , the room that we got was small with no view at all, well with the view to another building, so we kept the curtains closed at all times even though we pay 695.00 per night. The hotel's restaurant is pretty good, we only used it for breakfast. The whole idea was to stay at a great hotel, going to nice restaurants such as Veritas, Del frisco and Aureole and to the theater for Mamma Mia and Evita. 
 The beds are comfortable, but they are not five stars. Overall is good to very good but you can get the same deal or better deal at a lower rate. Besides that we requested the complimentary transportation (the Maserati) but was out of service for repair.

title: “Luxurious exquisite lodging for have-it-all travelers”
text: Great place to stay at if your main interest is luxury shopping on 5th Ave and you do not mind being overwhelmed by a crowd as soon as you leave your hotel. Great location, very attentive and catering staff and the restaurant is on NY Times list of best NYC restaurants. The rooms are specious especially for NYC. Italian linen and toiletries and the marble bath tub are a pleasant bonus.

title: “Boutique Gem”
text: We selected this hotel because of its reputation and convenience to the theater district. We were on a 'kamikaze' theater tour, four plays in three days. (We walked everywhere.) We upgraded to a Junior Suite on the 4th floor for the 5 nights we were in-house. We were greeted promptly and professionally as we've come to expect at Starwood properties. Our room was very attractive, new (I believe about 2 years old), spacious and fresh. The toilet seat had more controls than some airplanes I flew in 50 years ago. Lots of outlets for charging and closet space worthy of a home. A continental breakfast was included, I believe the credit was $34 for each of us. If you sit near the gas fireplace it can be a bit warm. I mentioned this once and we were quickly and politely offered another table. On Mondays and Tuesdays they have a jazz pianist on the 2nd floor bar. If you're feeling flush, try the Nolet's Reserve gin martini, $100 for a 2 oz. pour. Maybe on my next trip.

title: “I Love,Love,Love this hotel!!!”
text: I have traveled all over the world and stayed in quite a few 4-5 star hotels and resorts, but this one stands out. I admit I may be a little bias. I know who Stanford White is, and I have seen the movie "Girl on the Red Velvet Swing". I love Art Deco and am thrilled to have been in the building of The Lambs Club. But if you took all that away you would still have a five star hotel with a six star staff. Housekeeping is tremendous,doormen attentive, front desk excellent !!! I had a connecting room with a friend, the connecting door squeaked. They were there in 5 minutes to fix it. The "mini-bar " is a closet, with books,magazines,and all kinds of treats. The room ,itself, has every amenity imaginable and some I never imagined . I would recommend this wonderful hotel to anyone !!!!!

title: “My new favourite NYC place to stay”
text:
This place deserves all the great notices here.. From the moment you step inside , it has a familiar and stylish ambience, perhaps influenced by the 20's Art Deco theme that runs through this utterly charming boutique hotel.
The club bar is clearly now a midtown destination spot,and hosted Jazz on Tuesday nights- had dinner first night at The Lambs Club, sublime, but pricey and not for an everyday visit. 
My room, 411, was front facing, so a little road noise at times, but was very comfortable. Best bathroom I can recall in New York. Rain shower amazing. Location on this section of W 44th is quieter and 2 min walk from 42nd st subway.
Wifi throughout and very fast.

title: “Very pleasant experience....quite comfortable”
text:
We stayed at the Eventi for 5 nights during Thanksgiving week. Our room was very clean, and a nice size compared to most NYC hotels. The bed was very comfortable and requests for additional towels and bath products were promptly honored. Our room was on the 12th floor facing busy 6th Avenue, but was very quiet with little street noise...always a plus in NYC. The bathroom was a nice size, but unfortunately there was only a very large shower and no tub. We could have used more room for toiletries in the sink area, but one doesn't want to get too picky when writing these reviews. The in-room safe was large and always appreciated. The staff was genuinely friendly and courteous.
The hotel is adjacent to interesting neighborhoods, but is located on a rather nondescript block of 6th Avenue. It is very close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, the Empire State Building and Macy's. The 'R' subway line is 2 blocks away at 28th and Broadway and serves all of mid-town and lower Manhattan....easy for any tourist to master in one day.
The spa was booked when I called for an appointment to get a massage, but the spa manager requested that the masseur stay an additional hour to accommodate my request. This was very much appreciated and illustrated the hotels desire to please a guest in need.
The only very small snafu was when we tried to order ice one night around 11pm....they were swamped with requests from other guests arriving back from the theater. They were very apologetic for the delay, however, it took about 20 minutes or so for the ice to arrive. They provide complimentary coffee and tea in the hotel lobby in the morning until 9am....it would be nice if they could keep it out until 10am.
I would recommend this hotel for business travelers and tourists alike.

title: “Delighted business traveler”
text: When I travel for business, I want peace and quiet and a bit of luxury. Eventi delivers - a quick taxi ride from LaGuardia and I'm quickly checked into my luxe room - a tiled shower evocative of a Hammam and large enough for an Asian elephant, yummy Etro products, a Frette robe, a healthy menu selection and prompt room service, a big bed and everything generally appointed as one would expect, from power outlets to internet and my wall-mounted TV. For NYC, the room has plenty of breathing room plus a nice floor to ceiling view.

title: “service with a killahhh smile”
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Eventi. Our room was ready upon my arrival at noon and Sue, at reception, was all smiles and thrilled to provide us with an early check-in. The room we had was outstanding; it was spacious, crisp, full of natural light, sophisticated, tech smart and super comfortable. Upon returning back to the hotel, from being out for the evening, we were greeted in room by a handwritten note, from Sue, some yummy chocolates and a lovely bottle of wine. The Eventi staff were cheerful, witty and accommodating. The hotel is a quick walk to Penn Station, Whole Foods Chelsea and the heart of Midtown. It was a fabulous experience. I'm all in for returning; and truth be told, I've booked another stay in December!

title: “VERY DARK...Literally and Figuratively”
text:
First the good things:
1. Extremely comfortable beds and pillows. Never have I felt such soft sheets!! 
2. The Staff were all very kind. Patrick at the front desk gave me an upgrade so that I wouldn't have to wait for my room to be ready, and a $15 free mini-bar card for becoming an In Touch Member. Kevin in Maintenance was also a big help.
3. The shower is bright and big and has a wonderful rain-shower head as well as a hand-held shower-head. (unfortunately, the floor was very slippery when wet!! Not a good thing)
4. Beautiful, big, flat screen, high-def TV.
5. Excellent hair dryer.
6. Large closet with plenty of hangers, shelves, and a safe. Robes to use if you want.
7. Big full-length mirror.
Now the BAD things:
 The room is INSANELY DARK after the sun goes down. I needed my flashlight to unpack my suitcase and to work at the desk. And trying to get them to bring an extra lamp was like pulling teeth!! I had to basically beg many different people, before someone was able to finally find a lamp!
There is a nice 8 foot long desk and chair, but the unusual desk light illuminates only a tiny rectangle of space on the desk, leaving the rest of the desk in darkness. Same problem with the night table lamp that just shines directly down on a small area. And the only other lights in the room are two micro-mini recessed ceiling lights over by the window that each shine a narrow, angled beam of light directly onto the curtains. The fact that the majority of the walls are dark brown adds to the problem.
Believe me, I'm all for saving electricity, but there are other ways to save electricity. In ACCOR HOTELS for example, the lights will not go on unless you put your room key in a special slot by the door when you enter. So when you go out, and take your key, it is impossible to leave the lights on.
As I was looking through the items in the Mini-bar to use my gift card, I noticed that almost all the drinks and food items were expired. And in addition to snacks, the Mini-Bar also had items like a 3-Pack of CONDOMS, and PERSONAL LUBRICANT for sale! I was offended and disgusted! I would expect to see things like that at a seedy motel that you rent by the hour! 
I'm used to reaching into the night table to read the Bible before going to bed (all Hilton Hotels have Bibles). No Bible in the Kimpton Eventi, that's for sure! 
I couldn't wait to get out of there. Definitely not my type of place. It was creepy!

title: “Our favorite small luxury hotel in NY so far!”
text: My husband and I have made a hobby of trying different hotels in NY. The Iroquios surpassed our expectations. We traveled to a two room suite on the 12th floor which was beautifully furnished, extremely quiet, great linens, soft robes and very clean. All the comforts of home! Two flat screens, pull out sofa and refrig. Staff we friendly and helpful. We would love to return.

title: “They went above and beyond”
text:
My mother and I went to NY to see the opera and shows, I selected the Iroquois because of location and good reviews. The location was excellent, the room was very good, and the staff was excellent. We were stranded there with hurricane Sandy and the staff did everything to keep us comfortable and well taken care of. They front desk, concierge, and doormen were real people, providing great service. We will definitely stay again. Service was excellent, room was very clean, and quite comfortable and well appointed.
Thanks for the very nice stay.

title: “WORLD CLASS STAFF & MANAGEMENT”
text: We have travelled a lot in our lives and we have lived many adventures as well as major difficulties.When we left for NY this time we could not imagine how the hurricane Sandy would impact on our stay in Manhattan.Now ,we are home again and I wonder who has left a hotel after a 7 nights stay (originally 4 nights)and knows most of the staff by name because of their great service and concerns for their clients.The concierges Vanessa and Allan did every day their utmost in order to help us with our cancellations and rebookings to enable us to continue our trip.The receptionists Patrick and Kelly and Mylene and Irena were so concerned about their guests but ensured that we could keep our room ( leaving Manhattan was not possible).Every morning ( most restaurants in town were closed)there was a complimentary breakfast for all the hotel guests organised by Jason and Leonora .And when we finally checked out we were positively surprised to see that Management had invoiced the additional nights in the most decent way.THIS IS THE PLACE TO BE IN NYC.Thank you all.Walter and Anna

title: “Returned My Ipad”
text:
Excellent service, very clean and they returned my ipad that I had left in the room. This kind of personal service is so rare these days and I truly appreciated the attentive staff and immaculate rooms. It was very quiet in the room, almost no street noise and the beds were comfortable.
Most importantly, they treat customers very well. The location is ideal for shopping, restaurants and easy access to transportation. The jitney from the Hamptons dropped us off only one block away. Very convenient.

title: “Room size, amenity, services... Outstanding experience!”
text:
We just returned from our one night mini-vacay from NYC, and I can't wait to write about our experience staying at the San Carlos Hotel. My husband I took our sons, age 3 and 1, to NYC for a weekend trip. We truly enjoyed the hotel from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. There are three main reason why we love it, the room size, hotel amenity and the most important part, staff. My husband and I had stayed in several other hotels in the area in the past, (Affinia, Waldorf Astoria, Hilton New York and Hilton Time Square), but we found this hotel worth returning to. 
First of all, the size of the room is beyond expected. It felt more like a "home" than a hotel room. For the average price of a mid-town Manhattan hotel, we had a true one-bedroom suite with two queen size beds. The bed room was equipped with a standard size desk and a large flat screen TV. The beds were soft yet supportive. The living room had a sofa bed, two chairs, a large TV, a dining area and a kitchenette. After sitting in the stroller all afternoon waiting for us, my boys were ready for some stretching. The room provided plenty of space for them. If there is any downside to the room, that would be the view out of the window. We didn't care, since we spent most of the time exploring the city. 
The amenities of the room were great, especially the kitchenette. It has a small refrigerator, sink, microwave, and some basic dinnerware like bowls, plates, glasses and silverware. Don't worry about bringing a cork opener, they got that, too. We brought in dinner for Sat. night, and all the items in the kitchenette made it so much easier. The breakfast was simply, yet every item was delicious. Even coffee was better than Starbucks! 
Finally, and most importantly, I truly enjoy the people that work at San Carlos. The front desk staff were very helpful and paid special attention to each guest. The captain was very accommodating to our requests. The house keeping staff were very friendly. We truly felt welcomed at the hotel. 
On Sunday morning, my 3-year-old didn't want to go home and wanted to stay in NYC. The whole family found this experience beyond our expectations. We are looking forward to going back soon!

title: “Wonderful location and comfortable, good value!”
text:
Terrific, conscientious service by front desk, doormen, housekeeping staff!
Comfortable beds - large room with mini kitchen/eating area. Wonderful price/value ratio!
Excellent location for transportation, shopping, dining!

title: “Nice place for families”
text:
We decided to stay at the San Carlos after reading mostly favorable reviews on TripAdvisor. We had a 12th floor executive suite facing 50th avenue, from 13 to 19 September.
Hotel location is OK, many restaurants at walking distance, 2 blocks away from subway station, lots of groceries stores nearby, friendly reception staff. Housekeeping is efficient. Free internet access, I could use two devices simultaneously under the same login. No room service.
The suite is large is disposes of kitchenette with microwave and fridge, although a toaster would have come in handy. It is quite comfortable for two people, with plenty of drawers and storing space, sofa and a small dining table with two chairs. Beware of the touch-sensitive mini-bar, unless you really want to pick up something. There are 2 large flat screen TV sets, but the program grid is limited to US channels: no French, German or Italian channel, which could add an international flair to the property. The bathroom has magnifying mirror, towels of good standard, satisfactory but not high-end toiletries. 
Bed is comfortable, there is a good choice of pillows, but sleep quality was greatly disturbed by persistent air-borne noise. The windows are definitely not soundproof (the site call them "double-glazed"), and every kind of street noise seemed to pour into the room, from shouts and whistles late at night, to police and fire sirens all night long and delivery trucks early in the morning.
Breakfast was better than I had expected from previous reviews. It is the usual continental type, and one would not pay less than 13 euros for it in a Parisian hotel; we would complement it upstairs with some fresh fruit bought the evening before. The breakfast room is really cramped, although that is a minor problem if you are on vacation and can manage your time schedule avoiding breakfast at peak times.
The San Carlos is a nice and affordable hotel in NY, adequate for a short stay and particularly suited for families with children.

title: “Best hotel in NYC, or anywhere!”
text:
I travel to NYC for business and pleasure at least once or twice a year.
I have stayed in many different hotels in various locations throughout the city, mostly near mid-town where my business takes me. I can honestly say I have never felt more comfortable or more at home. Because it is a residence building and not an over-sized, transient hotel, it is quiet and comfortable and the location can't be beat.
