I agree with a previous reviewer, I did not want to leave and joked with the front desk I would call a real estate agent! Well, the Sherry does indeed have one, and her name is Theresa Nocerino. If you are in the market for a pied a terre, be sure to give her a call. Everyone at the hotel and in Cipriani's just raved about her. She made sure my every need was attended to, and the entire staff could not be more friendly. The elevator operators evoke an era gone by of service and style. If you want to feel refreshed and rested after a busy day in Manhattan, the Sherry is the place to stay. The only caveat is you may not want to leave your room, so don't overschedule yourself with appointments while visiting New York! 5 star, triple A+!!!

title: “A place in the City”
text: The Hotel is incredible. It has that feeling of living in The city not a Hotel feel about it.And to have an address like 5 ave.that would be nice. The Staff was helpful from the front door to your room.The room was huge compared to most hotel rooms in the city. The decor. is very nice and very clean. Fresh flowers were waiting and a box of chocolates. Had an incredible time. I will be back!

title: “interesting touch”
text:
Spooky in an interesting way, all those bald lift attentands! The location is great, indeed – but there are a lot of great locatiosn in NY. Cipriani not bad at all, though a bit dusty, the entire hotel is actually. There is not much of lobby, but I agree its not such a big lose. Rooms were nice, even if we had them viewing the internal courtyard.
And my 6years old remembers the hotel as the one with chair in the lift.

title: “Great Customer Service”
text:
I spent a week at this hotel, and there was not a morning, nor evening, that I walked through the front door and was not greeted with a smile and a kind word from the desk clerks.
The rooms are large, comfortable, clean and fresh. The location is not far from various places to eat and shop, but at the same time, there is not a bunch of traffic noise at night to keep you awake. 
They provide anything you could possibly need, and if its not already in the room, all you have to do is ask... 
I really enjoyed my stay, and will make it my choice of hotels.. not only this location, but anywhere else I have to travel as well.

title: “i would definitely stay there again the next time i visit Houston”
text: The room was very clean, quiet and the staff were friendly. What i love the most was that it felt like home and not to mention, theres security at night, so dont worry about your car. Also, the hotel is near Target, Best Buy, food places etc. I would stay there again.

title: “The whole package”
text: Great rooms with apartment size kitchens fully furnished as well as roomy desk & tv areas & great staff not to mention the cable tv & high speed internet. Also, the cleanest hotel I have EVER stayed in.

title: “Large room with all the comforts of home.”
text: Great location for visiting family in the NW/Willowbrook Mall area. The room was large and the kitchenette convenient when we didn't go out for meals. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Access via door keys and stairs was excellent. Staff were friendly and informative.

title: “it's a wonderful experience”
text: a very nice property, staff are very professional, room is very spacy.

title: “Great place to stay with one little hitch”
text: I made reservations at this hotel for a group of high school baseball players. Working with Debbie, the group coordinator was wonderful. Beautiful hotel, very clean and well taken care of. Breakfast buffet was very good, but servers were not as attentive as they could have been. We had to check in around midnight, and all I can say is the night crew needs to take lessons from the day crew on how to treat customers. The day crew was delightful to work with. And the cookies at the desk are to die for. If it wasn't for the two minor service issues, I would have given straight give ratings across the board. I would not hesitate to stay here on my next trip to Houston, or to recommend the hotel to everyone, for individuals or groups.

title: “FABULOUS STAY”
text:
Have stayed there several times this year.....my husband and I returned on 8/10/12 to start the weekend of celebrating his birthday, which was on 8/12!
From the minute we walked in, can't rave enough. Valerie checked us in....the manager (Erica) surprised my husband with some wonderful goodies in our room.....and they wished him a Happy Birthday, which he was really surprised.
Lots of restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel (our favorite is The Taste of Texas)....
Our room was bright and spacious....lots of light and great water pressure...and tons of hot water.
Next morning when we came down for breakfast, more friendly smiling faces at the front desk (Angelica and Rita). 
Breakfast was fabulous....excellent coffee.
Can't wait to return!!

title: “Dependable”
text: This is a typical standard Hilton Garden Inn, lobby and rooms clean, good service, excellent internet speed. The Air Conditioner in the individual room is noisy, but it works! Easy access to I-10 freeway.

title: “Great location for conventions and sporting events”
text:
Visited the hotel in November, had a nice room overlooking the park. Room was clean, well appointed and smelled fresh. the bathroom was also clean, including the Tub / Shower area. Had access to the concierge lounge for evening snacks and morning light breakfast. The lounge is open on the weekends and it is quite large. Many areas to relax and meet in. 
Overall a great stay. Did not eat at any restaurants in the hotel but just a few short blocks is a variety of restaurants now

title: “Solid hotel convenient to everything”
text: My family stayed here while attending a MLS game at BBVA Compass Stadium. On top of the fantastic location just minutes away from the stadium, we also were surprised to find a great rate on the Hilton website. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, the hotel felt new and was beautiful and the room was extremely comfortable for our family of 4. The best feature by far is the indoor pool located on the 23rd floor with panoramic views of the city skyline. My kids didn't want to leave the pool. The executive lounge was very well staffed with great food options and plenty of eating. The hotel provided us with a free shuttle to the stadium and then we walked the couple of blocks back. Such a great perk! This hotel is so close to the Toyota Center, Minute Maid Park and the soccer stadium - I'm sure we'll be back next time we go to a game!

title: “Executive Lounge makes the difference”
text: My wife and I were here for a CME conference at the convention center she was attending. We booked 3 nights as this is the only hotel that has a covered bridge to the convention center so you can walk right over regardless of the weather. You can choose to self park or valet. We opted for valet at a cost of $30 a night. But there is a covered walking bridge to the parking garage next door if you want. Our room was on the Executive lounge floor with a King size bed and lots of room on the granite top writing desk. We upgraded to the Executive King room for $19.95 a night as it included WiFi ($15 a day otherwise) and access to the Executive lounge. The lounge offers private access with free continental breakfast and snacks and appetizers in the evening. Coffee and beverages included as well. An adult bar is in the lounge for an additional charge. The coffee offered is much better than the coffee you get from brewing yourself in the room. The fruit and pastries are fresh and of restaurant quality. If you want to get the most out of your stay and have added value upgrade to the Executive Lounge. I am thankful we did! PS. The blanket included on our bed was very very warm. If you like a cool night's sleep as we do just use covered sheets as the comforter will lock in all your heat.

title: “Just OK”
text:
I stayed here because we needed a place in a pinch and so I went on Trip Advisor and saw this was ranked the #5 hotel in Houston. 
Based on that we stayed here - and I have to say I wasn't super impressed.
The staff we VERY helpful and great but the hotel is just a little run down and eighties-ish.
Everything although clean just look kind of old and dinky.
It was fine for the one night I stayed there but next time I would probably keep looking around to find something more modern.

title: “Better than those huge hotel monsters.”
text:
If you need to be in (or near) downtown Houston for a couple of days, don't look any further. The hotel is clean, the rooms are huge with huge TV's, every room has a fridge and a microwave, there's a complimentary breakfast and a "happy hour" during which you get free drinks and snacks.
That is all very well, but what really makes your stay at this hotel worth your money is the very personal approach of the staff. Of course you can go to hospitality monsters like the Double Tree which is actually IN downtown Houston and not NEAR it, but you'll feel like a number, like a soulless statistic out there. 
So I'd say don't go to those horrible, huuuge hotels IN downtown Houston, just take this one. You'll love it.

title: “A very good hotel, but very overpriced.”
text:
A word first about the location. It's in an area adjacent to I-45, just a few blocks from the edge of the downtown office towers. About a 4 block walk. But that 4 block walk, and however many more to your destination within downtown, can be brutal during the searingly hot and humid period between early June and late September. It's location is immediately adjacent to Freedman's Town in the 4th ward, an area just beginning to transition from old, delapidated wooden homes and bad street surfaces to "gentrification". Walking some of the streets late night might not be prudent. There is a secure parking area to the front and the rear of the property.
All of the rooms are suite-sized, much larger than is typical. Lots of room. Room decor is a step up from the usual blandness of most hotels, quite attractive. The room and bath were super clean. Carpet is just a bit frayed though. The beds are very comfy and soft, which I prefer. Some don't. Had a very nice white comforter, not one of those nasty bedspread things.
There's a microwave and refrigerator in each room. And a 42" HDTV. BUT... no HDTV service. Go figure. They spent more than is normal in designing and furnishing the rooms, then won't bother to pay for HDTV service.
The bath was very clean, but average in size and design. The towels were excellent, very fluffy. BUT... no exhaust vent. Why do so many mid-to-upscale hotels not install bathroom exhaust vents?
The air conditioner was very efficient and quick in establishing whatever temperature we set it for. And was very quiet in doing so. Had an excellent nights sleep. 
There's a nice pool, but it's situated a bit oddly. Most of the pool and surrounding lounging area are under the hotel's second floor, with no sun access. There is one small area at one end of the pool that does get sun from midday until early evening.
There is an excellent full breakfast. Which is fortunate since there's no nearby dining or shopping places.
All in all, a very good place to sleep well near downtown, but it's very overpriced. After all, it's just a Best Western Plus. For the same price or a few bucks more a room can be booked at nearby hotels that are actually within downtown such as the Doubletree.

title: “Great Experience!”
text: I was in town for a very large conference taking place in the downtown region. This hotel was just outside the downtown core, but still in a good location. It was a little pricey during my first 3 nights; however, slightly cheaper than other hotels around. The conference I was attending may have driven prices as well. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the downtown area. If you prefer to walk, you can get right downtown to the George Brown Convention Centre in about 25 minutes. The rooms were nice, very clean, air conditioned, had a TV large tv and free wifi. There is a pool and excellent complimentary breakfast. There is also an array of restaurants in the hotel's vicinity. The staff are extremely friendly and will try their best to help you out with whatever you need as well. Overall, I give this place a thumbs up! I definitely recommend it and will stay here again if I return to Houston.

title: “Chic and Fabulous”
text:
Love the location of this hotel. At first glance it was odd, but once you get over the second floor lobby area, everything is FABULOUS!!! Centrally located, friendly service, free Breakfast (not the best but it's free), free Shuttle services, most amazing bed after a long flight from SoCal to Houston.
Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a shabby chic trendy place to stay.

title: “Room is fabulous but Service Sucks!”
text: Hotel Sorella has fabulous ambient and the room is big and spacious. Has its own day bed and closet. No bath tub in my room though, maybe higher rate. It has restaurant in the CityCentre nearby and two bars attached to the hotel. Having said all the good experience, I would comment on the guest service at reception, with so many issues I had they have never tried to assist out of the way. They always provide one blunt answer and there you are lost and they don't care. I hate speaking to the guest service as it always feels like they don't like serving. Hotel Sorella, please look into this. If your staff at reception doesn't want to serve with good customer service, the hotel will eventually get bad review. I would stay here for the room and ambient but I dread such bad service.

title: “Good but not completely soundproof”
text:
A nice and “almost there” hotel. It is obviously meant to be a boutique hotel, placed conveniently for access to roads, although so convenient that you can hear the traffic when you have rooms turning that way. A little disappointed as I specifically requested a quiet room and was told I was given one but apparently the rooms on the other side have bar noise so I guess I shouldn’t complain… well maybe just a little? How can you say it is a quiet room when you have traffic noise in your room (although almost white noise due to the constant traffic) and a building site outside that starts promptly at 7 (thankfully I was here a business guest and was up at this time). The look the owners have gone for is obviously a “boutique hotel” which they have managed, although the build quality isn’t to impressive nor the materials. Everything seems glossy but cheap and for instance the tiles seem to have been placed by a person just learning the trade. The bed and pillows are good though and it does look good if you don’t look too closely and the location is great for restaurants, bars and shopping. I wouldn’t say don’t go, but I would strongly recommend it either.
Oh, and serve toast for breakfast! Not just fruit.

title: “Great Hotel!”
text:
We were in Houston this past weekend. The Four Seasons was a pleasure to stay in. The Concierge helped me find a great boot store out of the city and was very helpful. The room was super clean and the bed was comfy! My husband enjoyed working out in the gym/spa area. And we relaxed at the pool in the afternoon and had great service there too 
My one con on the place is the location. I guess if you are there for during the week it is fine. But we felt like the city itself was empty. There was very little action around us. We went out for breakfast the first morning (Saturday) and had to walk about 1 mile before we found a restaurant that was OPEN! They all close on the weekends. For the 4th largest city in America, I found that strange! The next day we enjoyed a delicious breakfast in the hotel.
But if you want to hang out at a nice hotel and be pampered this is a wonderful place to do that and we certainly appreciated the excellent service this hotel provided.

title: “great location, excellent stay at this modern concept hotel”
text: loved the "non hotel-like" concept at the reception. Beautiful modern rooms, very comfortable bed, free mini bar except for alcoholic beverages, free wine form 6 to 9 pm at the bar and free coffee 24h. Also liked the restaurant at street level and the downstairs. Only "problem: the blinds don't blaken the room very much. We will definitely go back!!!

title: “Great Location - Rooms are not cleaned thoroughly”
text: Location is great - staff are friendly but sound robotic... By my bed the dust was couple of inches and the hair in the bathroom when we checked in was just disgusting... On the other hand the toilet was not flushed and the cleaning liquid they used was still floating in the water and that was not welcoming at all considering the published rate we paid. Will never stay there again because the manager I spoke with showed no sympathy.

title: “lovely hotel but horrible customer service.”
text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Chatwal for our anniversary. We booked at 4 day trip and ended up having to leave early because of illness. Even though we went to the front desk and told them we were leaving the staff didn’t check us out of our room. A few weeks later we called SPG to get the points for our unused nights refunded and were told we couldn’t because the hotel was claiming we stayed the entire 4 nights. We submitted our train tickets and other proof that we weren’t in NYC but the hotel has denied our claim and won’t return our calls. This isn’t the level of service I would expect from a Category 7 SPG hotel.

title: “BOOK IT NOW!!!!! (or you'll regret it!!!)”
text: We have just returned from our first trip to New York where we celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary. We chose the Chatwal for our 2 night stay after reading reviews on here. We were delighted with our stay and were made to feel more than welcome from every staff member we met. The hotel is in an ideal location, just steps from Times Square and Fifth Avenue is very close by too. The hotel is very quiet and we heard no noise from outside whilst in our room during our stay. Our room was simply breathtaking. It was very luxurious and we were so comfortable. It has very nice touches to it such as a tv in the bathroom mirror to suede Walls! We used the concierge service which was very professional. Juan booked our helicopter trip for us and advised on which day and time would suit best after he reviewed the weather forecast which was much appreciated. Overall this hotel is a little gem with the most professional and friendly staff I have ever come across in a hotel. Go ahead and treat yourselves like we did you will not regret it.

title: “Great Boutique Hotel!”
text: Saved us during Storm Sandy. We were able to leave our dark and very cold NYC downtown apartment after 3 days to spend 2 warm and lovely nights at the Iroquois.After searching hotels on 44th street with no vacancies we were so happy when we walked into the Iroquois and they had one room left on the top floor. Great location for restaurants and their own restaurant Triomphe is excellent. Staff are professional and kind. Very helpful and interested in providing rooms to storm victims. I will never forget the experience and we will recommend the Hotel Iroquois to all family and friends when they visit NYC! Location is perfect. Very clean and quiet rooms. Can't say more about the staff--really caring and wonderful!

title: “Good value hotel with helpful staff”
text:
Lovely small hotel in a great location in midtown. The rooms were a little on the small side but very clean with all the right amenities. The staff were helpful and welcoming. 
The only downside is the hotel bar isn’t that nice but the Royalton across the road had a beautiful bar so we often went there instead.

title: “The Best Hotel”
text:
This is the best hotel I have ever lived in and I have lived in mostly all of the Extended Stays of America here in Houston, Texas.
Keep up the good work.

title: “Good place to stay in Houston, Tx.”
text: Wonderful property with great staff, rooms are clean and comfortable. great location right offf the expressway with plenty of restaurants in the area.. I travel to Houston three to four times a year on business and will not stay any place else.

title: “A Gem for longer term”
text: Went to Houston to find a home to settle. Had to find something within a decent budget that wasn't a dive. THIS IS IT!! It's nothing fancy, but it's super clean, and super accommodating. The rooms are spacious, fully equipped and tastefully decorated. Like I said, it's not a fancy place, but it's perfect for longer term stays. I paid only $70 ish per night. It's conveniently located, pretty quiet, at least our room was. They have a laundry room and a pool. It's really a nice place to stay. They charge only $4.99 for Internet for your entire stay. There's extended cable TV with Showtime and HBO, a full kitchen, large bathroom, desk area, hair dryer, and iron and ironing board. For one person it's awesome, for three, it wasn't even crowded. I really enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend it to anyone needing a longer term at a good price. It is definitely priced right for what you get. The staff is not super friendly, but are pleasant and helpful....

title: “have found better values in the area”
text: this hotel does offer free wifi in rooms, but no free breakfast. many hotels -embassy suites do. If you ask for free wifi you frequently will get that also at embassy suites. We booked a two room suite at the garden inn but there is no door between the living area and the bdrm. Since we get up at different times we prefer a door. Also, the bdrm was freezing and the living area was hot. We moved to embassy suites after the first night.

title: “Clean, Affordable, and Friendly Staff”
text: Recently stayed at this hotel for work and was not expecting great things as I've lowered my expectations for some of the "lesser properties" for the big brands; however, I was pleasantly surprised at how clean it was, everything was in great working order, the staff was friendly and courteous, and they gave me some great recommendations for dinner which were right on the money. Nearly every day that I stayed, it was raining cats and dogs in the AM when everyone was leaving and, from what I saw, one of the staff members was in the lobby offering for the patrons to use her personal umbrella to go their cars; an excellent customer service effort that went way beyond. Room rate does not include breakfast, so plan otherwise, though I was told by peers that the food at the in-house restaurant was good.

title: “Very nice hotel... in the middle of nowhere”
text:
We stayed at this place only for one night while rushing through.
I didn't expect too much of this place, being so reasonably priced, but I stood corrected.
This hotel absolutely deserves the name Hilton. The service was first class and the room great for very low money. The room was pretty big for the price class and very clean, as one would expect form a classy hotel like this one.
The neighborhood is pretty far outside and I don't think that there is very much public transportation going on around there, so I would only recommend this place to travelers with cars.
If you are looking to spend much time in the center of the city you might find something closer, but for everyone looking for a quiet place with classy standards, come here and be happy. :)
extra Hint: Some of the smaller "non-brand" hotels around here are in pretty bad shape. Booking any of those will be pure gamble in my opinion. Watch out for that.

title: “Excellent Hotel if you have a meeting there or at the convention center”
text: My husband was attending a large meeting at the Hilton Americas. We had an excellent room. There was a small problem with the lock which received immediate and courteous service. The lobby was so pleasant with many seating choices that I did not mind using the free wi fi in the lobby bar, at the lobby starbucks and just sitting in a lobby couch or chair. The banquet for my husband's meeting was excellent! Always a pleasant surprise given how hard it is to feed lots of people at once. We did use the hotel shuttle to go to Brennans for dinner. The shuttle worked fine and Brennans was superb! I would have preferred if the hotel was within walking distance to nice shopping. Otherwise all was great!

title: “Perfect location for conference attendees, great lobby area, upscale”
text: Because of availability, I had to book another hotel for my first night in town. After that, I checked into the Hilton. As soon as I stepped into the lobby, I was impressed - this was in a different class than the hotel I had just left. The lobby has a pleasant scent and it is elegantly decorated. There are many places to sit along with a coffee/bakery kiosk, a restaurant, and some gift shops. The staff in the lobby area was very friendly and accomodating. My room was nice - it was in a corner area so I think it was larger than other standard rooms. It did cost $15/day for wifi, so that was a little disappointing but I guess that's what you get at higher end hotels. It was soooo easy to walk to the GBR conference center from here - there is an indoor skywalk bridge on both the 2nd and 3rd floors. I'd recommend this to others who are in Houston for conferences.

title: “Very Nice!”
text: Stayed here during the recent AQS Quilt Show. Hotel was extremely busy but always attentive. Room was excellent. Quiet, clean and comfortable. Despite being fully booked at the time, the staff was always pleasant and quick to respond to our needs. If I had any complaint, it would be the price of meals. A bit expensive and there was no way to get a quick easy and inexpensive bite to eat. However, that said, I would recommend the hotel to anyone doing business in downtown Houston.

title: “Very Pleasant Surprise”
text: Honestly, Best Western isn't a chain I normally stay with when I travel for business which is very often. There was something going on in the area and this was very close to my last option. Now, I'm returning to Houston later this month and will definitely be staying there again. It was a wonderful surprise. The entire hotel was very nice AND clean. The rooms were amazing. I would never have expected a room that size. Extremely comfortable including the bed. The breakfast was also great although I would like to have had hot, already prepared oatmeal and other options in fresh fruit HOWEVER that sounds really picky when you consider the variety of options that were available. Good job to all who work there! Thanks for giving me an all new impression of this Best Westerns!! As a note, this is called "Downtown" and the location is quite convenient, however, you should know that it isn't a convenient location for walking to restaurants. On the other hand, it has great parking that you don't have to pay an arm and a leg for so that isn't so bad. I'll still be choosing it and making the short drive (long walk) to the many great restaurants nearby.

title: “A Terrific group of people”
text:
I stayed for 4 days, and the staff was amazing! I asked Jo at the front desk about the closest pharmacy, and she checked with me the next day to see if I got to one, or if I needed to still get some things. Sonny, the shuttle driver, would take me. He seemed to be a my beck and call, even though I know he drove everyone around. And Cynthia, the bar tender, laughed at all my jokes (which can be quite a feat)! Very cordial and a great host! 
Oh, and the rooms where spacious, clean, and since I ate my cookies each day, on my last day, they left me two packs!
A really wonderful stay!

title: “High Price for me but not for Downtown Houston.”
text: This hotel is on the outskirts of the main downtown areas but within walking, cab or shuttle distance. It is my understanding the hotel shuttle is very accommodating though we did not use it. Staff was very friendly, warm and inviting. Our room was HUGE, a nice king bed, clean sheets, a/c very cold, big screen tv with cable, hbo and movie channels. The room also had a fridge, microwave, complimentary water, coffee and cookies. There is a pool outside, one downside is there is not access from the inside of the hotel making it a bit less user friendly, though it is very clean and well maintained. The have a complimentary breakfast with several choices including eggs, waffles, sausage, cereal, biscuits and gravy, fruit, raisins etc. I still think the price is much too high but compared to other hotels downtown I found it to be very reasonable. If you walk around at night watch out for the occasional beggar or two or three…

title: “Clean rooms and great hospitality!”
text: I highly recommend a stay at this Best Western. The rooms were very clean and the staff went out of their way to take care of my group of business associates.

title: “Excellent Choice”
text: Well, I got this room with my AAA card for 89.00. This price did not include breakfast. The welcome at check in was not as friendly as I would expect from a Hilton establishment. The room appeared very clean and new. We did make use of the outdoor pool, which the kids enjoyed. They even had noodles available for the kids to use as well as some swim toys. We did take advantage of room service, which I had a hard time paying $6 for mac and cheese. I ordered a Cesar Salad which was very good. We choose room service because the location of the hotel seemed very disconnected with other restaurants. It was just easy.

title: “Friendly Staff”
text:
Staff is definitely very friendly. Particularly breakfast hostess Lesly is never afraid to strike up a smart conversation on current affairs while making sure you feel at home. Archie and Alma in the evening bar/dinner team also are true professionals . 
Lobby staff , all around is very helpful and every request is professionally and quickly dealt with. Since I stay weeks at a time, that is very important to me. Pool, fitness facilities are well maintained. And finally compliments to the chef in the kitchen !! Plenty of parking and a great location makes this location one of my favorites while in Houston.

title: “Great hotel and Staff”
text: On my way to the hotel it was storming pretty badly. Upon arrival, a staff member offered me an umbrella almost immediately when she noticed I did not have one. They had complimentary toothpaste as well as I had forgotten mine. They were so kind. The room was in great shape as well, and I had a great view of Downtown Houston from the 4th floor. Whenever I come to visit I will surely choose this location.

title: “Friendly staff”
text:
Had a great room. Staff is friendly. Concierge level was great - large area, not cramped as in some locations. If you are at a conference, the location is perfect, and you can walk to a good number of restaurant options.
Air conditioner (this is Houston, it's important!) worked well - very quiet. 
Giant big bathroom.
Warning: check your bill carefully. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I get complimentary internet: "just charge to your room, and it will be subtracted from the bill". Luckily, I did review my bill, called about the charge, :(, got it removed, logged onto the internet, and got charged again!

title: “Quilt Show”
text:
The Hilton made my trip to the International Quilt Show perfect. I enjoyed the valet parking,
the hotel staff and the restaurants. The room was clean and comfortable. The in room coffee
would be the only negative comment that I could make.

title: “Quality Hotel”
text: Stayed 5 days on Business. The hotel has good rooms/amenities and a good fitness center. Minor items: bed too soft for my liking, water hammer in the shower, some of the treadmills in the fitness center did not have all functions working (heart rate). Location is nearby Minute Maid Park and Toyotoa Center, is relatively convenient to the downtown tunnel system and to Metrorail, and is connected to the convention center, Parking is in the parking garage behind the Hotel. After you check-in, the room key lets you in and out for the garage for the one daily rate ($19). The parking is good until 5 pm on the day of departure. If you want shopping and a wider variety of restaurants, I would prefer the Galleria area. If you are coming for the Medical Center, I would stay closer. It is probably about half an hour by Metrorail to the Medical Center.

title: “Very clean and a great staff!”
text: On a recent business trip to Houston I had the opportunity to stay at Best Western Plus Inns and Suites in downtown Houston. The rooms were clean, updated, and spacious. I have been in "big name" hotels that were not even close to being as nice as the room at Best Western Plus. The staff is over the top friendly and customer oriented. If you have business in downtown Houston you can't go wrong staying here!

title: “My go to hotel in NYC”
text: I go to NYC very often for shopping, to get my hair done, go to some dr. appts, these trips are usually solo. I also go with my husband and children during Christmas, and occasionally throughout the year. This is my favorite hotel on the East side, and I have stayed in many. The first time I stayed here I joked with Russell, the man at the front desk that they would probably have to remove me with police force because I loved it so much. One of the things that I find so amazing about the Sherry is that I find myself never asking for anything, because they have already thought of everything. The rooms are enormous, comfortable, the staff is attentive and lovely, I love the fact that beverages and wifi are included. The soaking tub and bathrooms are awesome. There is absolutely no street noise, which is kind of amazing given the location. The location could not be better, you are on the edge of central park, you can walk to any store you could ever want, as well as so many delicious restaurants nearby. There have been a few occasions where they have been booked up, but otherwise, I don't stay anywhere else, I simply don't want to.

title: “wonderful place to stay”
text: Everyone was friendly and the rooms were large. Staying in such a wonderful and friendly place made our trip even that much better. My husband is a runner so being across from Central Park was an added bonus. Already planning another trip there in the fall.

title: “Luxury Hotel”
text: Ever since we started staying at this hotel four years ago, we have will never go to another hotel. From the time you check-in, the friendly staff make sure your stay is perfect. We always enjoy seeing how our room or suite is decorated as every one is different. We enjoy having a lemoncello next door at Cipriani's before retiring at night.

title: “A hidden gem for sure!”
text:
Had a lovely stay at the San Carlos hotel in NYC from sept. 11th-17th. I stayedwith my mum and my sister and we were catered to in the best way by tentative employees of the hotel. The doormen both were true sweethearts, giving us plenty of attention when we came and left, as well as good tips for dinners etc. The rooms are a bit dated, but they are big and comfortable. We thought we had ordered a 2 bedroom suite, but that was expedia's mistake, and not the hotel. When they found out the misunderstanding, they did everything in their power to assist us, to make our stay comfortable in a one bedroom suite!
The breakfast was, as noted by several others, very limited, but it was fresh juice and good coffee, and some bread and cakes to make it through the morning. Should have had some alternative spreading for the lactose intolerant...
All in all, the staff at the hotel made our stay that much better. I'm sure our stay would have been great somewhere else as well, but I'm sure it would not have been as personal. When we left they told us not to leave as they had enjoyed our stay sooo much. It may be something that they say to all their guests, but it did make us feel appreciated!

title: “Great Hotel and Location”
text:
Really enjoyed staying in this hotel. We were recommended it by friends who stayed here last year and we were not disappointed. The Location is relatively quiet and well placed with the subway nearby and central park, Rockefeller centre, times square and Grand Central all within walking distance. We stayed on the 11th floor and had a suite with a Queen Bed and a sofa bed for the kids. The room was certainly big enough for us and had a kitchenette which we used for making the kids snacks. We enjoyed the breakfast which was nice and simple (some cereal, juice, fruit, toast , bagels and some pastries). I could not drink the coffee ( not unusual) but did like the hot chocolate machine.
The service we got from the staff at the hotel was excellent and they were very tolerant and good with the kids. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: “Very Nice Experience”
text:
Pleasant experience from the time I checked in until check out. I stayed 2 nights and was there for business. It was during fashion week, so the hotel was full ( I only know this because some of my colleagues were trying unsuccessfully to stay there). It did not feel like there were a lot of people staying there so it is very quiet. The location is great, near the subway and getting cabs were no problem either.
I actually had a suite (I guess they upgraded me) and it was very roomy. Maybe all of the room are suites. Needless to say, I was not expecting a large room in a New York “boutique” hotel so I was pleasantly surprised. The bed was comfortable the staff very pleasant and the bathrooms clean, well appointed and roomy. They also offer complimentary breakfast and free WiFi.

title: “A very good boutique hotel in a great location”
text:
A small hotel compared to many in NYC, but then you don't have to negotiate miles of corridors.
The location is excellent for most things in midtown. The staff are friendly and very helpful. Rooms are quite small but then it is a city hotel and we were lucky enough to be given an up-grade. Cleanliness is good except for the carpets which do look grubby.
The free WiFi in the room worked! and the complimentary coffee near the reception was appreciated.
We would recommend this hotel as a value for money stay in NYC.

title: “return to NYC”
text: First time at the Eventi...excellent...great bathroom...bed was really comfortable ...rooms small but average for NYC..good location ...a little north of actual Chelsea....great staff ..would definitely return here.

title: “a magical experience!”
text: This review is a few months late, but we had to write one because we had such a wonderful experience at Eventi. We came to New York to get married and stayed for 4 nights. When we arrived in our room (which was totally beautiful, by the way), we found a bottle of champagne, a box of chocolate, and personalized cards congratulating us on our marriage. We are a same-sex couple from the Midwest (not to hate on the Midwest, BUT...) and so this was definitely a big deal. The service was terrific -- everyone was so helpful, courteous, and efficient. Whenever we called to ask for anything, they went out of their way to offer more than what we were requesting. Would definitely return!

title: “Bespoke decor, luxurious treatment”
text:
My close friend and I spent one night at The Chatwal and were amazed from the second we stepped into the room. From the one-bedroom suite that had two bathrooms (with heated toilet seats, a rain shower, and a TV built into the mirror), the courteous and polished staff, and the fabulous drinks at the cocktail lounge, the Chatwal did not disappoint. The distinguishing factor for me was the attention to luxury that the hotel placed on the littlest detail - everything from the amenities in the room to the language used by the staff made the experience that much more satisfying.
Highly recommend this property for anyone willing to pay for it or has the SPG points.

title: “Amazing Room Amenities & 5-Star Hospitality & Service”
text:
Wow! I stayed at the Chatwal on October 6th for 1 night for a day trip visit to New York. I was greeted with exceptional service and smiles, from the doorman to the front desk attendant to the butler. I loved this hotel. The location is great, just a block from the main area of Times Square. When I checked into my room, I just walked around it in awe. It had a very chic modern feel with ample closets, huge tv, and bathroom mirror tv (that actually scared me at first), and a heated toilet seat! The bathroom is unbelievable. 
The bar was lovely with great attendants. The food was delicious at the bar and also room service. I was very grateful of the room upgrade (I'm a SPG member). 
I really must say that this hotel blew me away, and I can't wait to return, and I've stayed at The Ritz-Carlton, Park Plaza, Four Seasons, and other top-star hotels, but this took the cake. BEAUTIFUL. BEAUTIFUL. BEAUTIFUL. A MUST STAY.

title: “Location, location, location!”
text: Cannot get a better location for Midtown Manhatten area than this hotel. Easily within walking distance to all area attractions. The Empire State Building is on the next block. Lots of small cafes, driug stores and shopping close by. We stayed in an apartment suite on 19th floor and it was very tastefully decorated with many amenities...Nespresso maker, kitchenette (fully equipped) very comfortable living area with a great view of the Chrysler building, separate bedroom, very large bathroom with massive tub and a rain head shower in the separate shower...all three rooms had great views of the city. Front desk and conceriege staff were extremely helpful with providing information and recommendations for seeing the city. Everyone remembered our names as we came in and out. The Bar on Fifth was great to have drinks or appitizers before a show...they also have full menu fare. It also was a popular meeting place for business and travellers. Sadly did not get to enjoy the spa or the Michelin starred restaraunt....Very highly recommend this hotel.

title: “Uncommited and unengaged management. Waste of money and estate”
text: We booked the Empire State buidling suites and had high hopes. The floor plan was not attractve but on the first night we observed flocks of hair at the separation of the bath room and hall way as well as in the separate bathroom. I enformed the concierge en she indicated that she would immediately take careof it as well as change the room. Tihis was on November 25. A couple of hrs later after dinner nothing had happened and I went back to the reception asking for the manager. Someone, Bryan, the manager?, came to the room sweept his hand and picked up several flocks of hair. He was embarassed and would take care of it: changing the rooms the next day and cleaning up. We stayed 3 days, nothing happened, request for chanfe of room was not ven in the system. Friendy personnel, but uncommited, no customer focus and no management presence, will definitely not come back to this hotel. Wasted 3,600.00 dollars.

title: “Unique hotel”
text: Everything about this hotel is unique from the second you walk in the door. The front desk looks more like a place where you would go to use the internet but makes you feel one with the staff as they are not stationed behind an imposing desk. The rooms have high ceilings and are sparsely but tastefully decorated like you might expect a NY loft to be. Drinks, snacks, wi-fi and coffee in the morning are all free. Great location overlooking the NYC library.

title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
text:
We had a great stay at the Andaz 5th Ave at the beginning of Nov 2012. Was scheduled to work the 2012 NY Marathon so our trip was cut short when the event was canceled at the last moment. 
The property and employees were very hospitable when we arrived and was quickly checked in and brought to our room. We asked for a Hyatt Gold Passport Platinum Member upgrade but was denied due to Hurricane Sandy causing the property to be sold out. Most of the Trip Advisor reviews are right on. Nice sized standard king room with tall ceilings and an AMAZING bathroom. The location was a quick 5-10 minute walk to Times Square and all the shopping you can handle. The "Bar Downstairs" is a true highlight of the property however the service was a bit slow. The free non-alcoholic mini bar is a great touch and the technology in the room was great as well. Looking forward to our next trip to the Andaz 5th Ave so we can enjoy the property longer.

title: “Great Location”
text:
We were planning to stay 7 nights however it turned into 11 courtesy of Hurricane Sandy. This hotel is brilliantly located on the upper west side a couple of blocks back from Central Park. The subway at 72nd street is a short walk away and this station gives you the option of express trains to 42nd Street and beyond making it incredibly fast to get anywhere downtown. We also walked to and from 34th Street quite comfortably on a number of occassions.
The hotel itself is very nice and we were surprised at how quiet it was. Having a small kitchenette was a bonus that allowed us to eat in on a number of occasions from the extensive food market across the street. The diner next door was excellent for breakfast.
The staff are New Yorkers so their style is somewhat different from what you generally see in a hotel of this standard, but after 11 days even I was starting to act like a New Yorker. If you don't know what I mean then this will be one of the great things you can discover on your visit to this brilliant city.

title: “My place to stay on UWS”
text: If staying on the Upper West Side, you can't go wrong here. The rooms were very clean, great decor, comfortable beds and linens. We were fortunate enough to get a suite and it felt as if we were staying in an apartment in the city. My daughters were thrilled to see what it would be like to live in NYC as opposed to the very tourist oriented areas of the city. There is a nice laundry room that we used. I'm not sure that this is the area we would stay in next time, because it took a while to get to midtown attractions, but if we do return to the UWS, we will definitely be staying at the Beacon

title: “Would recommend to anyone!”
text:
We stayed at the Four Seasons in downtown Houston in 2011. I have to say, there is nothing to complain about here.
We were in a double pool-side, which is perfect, especially with my family who love the pool. The rooms are very clean and up-to-date (which you can always expect from the Four Seasons). Beds were very comfortable. Excellent customer service.
The pool area is very nice, and the house drinks...devine. Again, having the poolside room is a great luxury to have. We were able to have drinks and lounge out and able to access our room without walking through the hotel. 
Will definitely return on our next Houston trip!

title: “Recent Company meeting”
text: I recently stayed at this hotel for a Company meeting. The rating would have been an excellent, but in my opinion, the hotel needs a facelift. The service is Excellent, the rooms are extremely clean, but the hotel interior is tired and needs to be renovated. Overall, the hotel was perfect for our needs and i recommend.

title: “Thoroughly recommendable”
text: Great downtown hotel - excellent service all round and staff on hand to answer any questions you may have. We were a large party and even when arriving 5 hours before check in we were able to check in or were offered upgrades to a different room if our original room was not available. Definitely recommend to anyone wanting to make the most of the city, second visit to Houston and definitely the best hotel we have stayed in.

title: “Steer clear -- the Hotel Icon was a terrible experience.”
text:
I booked this room via Priceline. I was given a room on a floor that was being painted and the smell was terrible. All I wanted to do was take a long bath and relax in my room. My weird little room didn't have a bathtub, and just a drain in the floor with a shower head attached to the wall -- no walls or stall around the shower. The paint fumes were so bad that I couldn't relax in the room. When I called the front desk and asked to be moved, I was told that as I had booked thru Priceline, a move would be considered an up charge. I was quoted a charge of $40, just to be moved to a room with a bathtub. They also said they could not be sure that my new room would be away from the paint fumes. I declined to pay the $40 for the move, and to escape the fumes I went down to the bar to watch a little TV. I had a few drinks and cleared my tab and went to bed. In the morning, I looked at the bill that was slipped under my door and saw that someone else's bar tab had been charged to my room to the tune of $147! 
I took a shower in the weird cattle trough area, which got the entire bathroom floor wet. I then spent the next 30 minutes coaxing the water down the drain with towels so that I could dry my hair without standing in inches of water. Upon check out I argued my bill and got the rogue charges removed, however, it took the Hotel Icon almost a week to credit my account the $147. 
I WILL NEVER, EVER STAY AT THE HOTEL ICON AGAIN -- it was a horrendous experience.

title: “Exceeded our expectations”
text: We stayed here the night on November 14 because it was close to MinuteMaid park for the Paul McCartney concert. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to the Savoy Suite and given two vouchers for breakfast. The rooms were tasteful,comfortable and quite. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. We ate dinner at the Line and Lariat and were impressed at the quality and presentation. The wine menu was extensive with plenty of choices. Breakfast was equally good. We will definitely stay here when visiting downtown.

title: “The best hotel shower ever.”
text: My husband and I stayed here for one night in March, and we'll stay here again if we find ourselves in Houston again. The room was small, but lovely. The bar had delicious cocktails. My favourite part, though, was the delicious shower.

title: “Nice Hotel...”
text:
This is a nice hotel if you want to stay close to Town and Country and City Center. 
Its very modern. Only downside is you can hear your neighbors.
Also ask for a room with view of city center...otherwise you will stare at a building..

title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel”
text: Really great location with shops and restaurants within walking distance. Rooms were large, clean and well appointed. Buffet breakfast was good which we enjoyed outside in the sun. Only stayed one night but would definetly hope to return on furture business trips.

title: “Fine hotel but no executive level”
text:
I stayed one night on a business trip. The hotel was fine, clean, and everything worked. It was interesting to see primarily students staffing the hotel. My only two gripes are (1) there is no executive level and (2) the glass shower is stylish but the door leaks, so you step onto a wet floormat after your shower. 
Hilton Honors gold members get free breakfast coupons which are good for anything on the restaurant menu but no provision is made for food in the evening.
As someone else mentioned, the french fries are excellent, even after the journey via room service. 
Be aware that you have to park in front of the hotel and check into your room to gain access to their underground garage. The garage is on the left-hand side of the building if you're facing the hotel. The garage feels a little sketchy. Try to park near the elevators.
 I'd stay here again.

title: “Great service”
text: The hotel was pleasant, clean, located on the University of Houston campus. Guest are given access to the fitness facilities on the campus which include Olypmic sized swimming pools, rock climbing and spinning machines. The staff were extremely friendly and patient. This is a training facility for students who want to go into hospitality so you can expect them to try harder. The rooms are average size but look bigger because of the set up.

title: “Recent Stay”
text: Great Friendly Staff, Clean Rooms, and great Service. They also provide shuttle service Downtown, which is a very short ride.

title: “Perfect”
text: My visit to Texas was not for pleasure. I was there to attend the murder trial for my brother. The staff was very helpful and caring. Our rooms and the hotel were very clean and comfortable. I can not find one thing bad too say. I would like to give a big shout out to Sonny. He drove the shuttle and dropped us off every day and picked us up from the courthouse when we were ready. This took so much stress off us. Houston traffic sticks and he was an awesome navigator:) The hotel went out of there way to help us. If I ever have to return to Houston this is where I will be staying.

title: “Attention to detail, old school boutique, white glove service, outstanding location.”
text:
Picture perfect 1st family visit to NYC, and the Sherry played a huge part. Top to bottom this is a CLASS operation, from the minute you arrive you are treated with white gloved service, doormen, bellman, desk, housekeeping, just excellent. 
Last minute reservations to Peter Luger's after a broadway show? Renee at the desk made it happen like she had drinks with the host over there on a regular basis! Pointers from the bellmen on shopping, cheap eats - you got it. Housekeeping spoils you w/ the in room coffee, water and drinks (all complimentary) you need, chocolates @ turndown, and seems like they refresh the room every time you leave - I swear!
Then you have the location, which is smack dab in the middle of midtown and the UES... And right across the street from Central Park. Carriage ride anytime you want, FAO Schwartz @ Apple store across 59th street... 10 minute walk to John's Pizzera on 44th, w/ Prada & Lindt chocolates, and Halal/Hotdog vendors at all times of the day for some NYC street food on the way.
If you want pampering and location, you can't do better!

title: “First class all the way”
text: Classy hotel. Great New York experience. We have stayed here before. Like most NY hotels rates change. If you can get a good rate the hotel is a bargain,but sometimes it can be really pricey and you might want to look at comparables.

title: “Nice, but nothing extraordinary”
text: Lovely little hotel and the rooms we had were nice enough, but I found nothing super spectacular about this place. It is across from the park and right next to The Pierre with all the great shopping nearby, as well, but I like many others in NYC better. I did, though, ride up in the elevator with Diana Ross (she was real sweet). I believe she lives here part time. It's a pretty nice hotel, but not what I'd expected for the amount of $$$ we paid (pretty pricey).

title: “Great hotel and location but disappointed with the b'fast”
text:
This is my 3rd stay in this hotel and the location is fabulous, very central, safe, with the subway and Grand Central Station around the corner . The size of the rooms is the big plus for me, a rarity in New York!
The staff are very friendly and attentive.
My only negative comment is in relation to breakfast. I was very disappointed and it wasn't like this the last time I stayed at the hotel. Plastic disposable cutlery and plates are not what I expected for a self-described 'boutique hotel'. Plastic picnicware is not something I have ever seen at hotels (maybe hostels?). It's also environmentally very unfriendly! Bins full of plastic plates, cups, knives and forks. Unfortunately it was a deal breaker for me. I understand the owner may be trying to cut costs but it's very offputting
Tip: we had a very comfortable room but extremely dark. Never saw any daylight, it was facing another buiding which blocks the light all day. You amy want to ask for a bright room
The Affinia 50, across the road, is almost identical and the breakfast room much nicer (with proper cutlery and crockery). I've stayed there before too and will return due to better breakfast facilities

title: “Another excellent stay at the San Carlos!”
text:
We were back again to stay at the San Carlos. It had been a few years since our last stay and apparently it had become more popular since then because of all the good reviews. I guess it is a hidden gem no more! My grown daughters say that they will stay no where else when they are in New York City. Once again, the San Carlos did not disappoint.
When we arrived, Gabriel (I think-no name tags) at the desk immediately greeted us with humor. Since it was my husband with me and our two daughters, he referred to my husband as "Charlie" the entire time and we were the "angels". We had booked a standard two queen bed room but Gabriel said that we were in a king room suite with a small kitchen at the same rate. I asked about the bed situation and he said that if my daughters were unhappy with the sofabed that we could switch. He assured them that the matresses were new and comfortable. 
Our suite was very spacious and we loved the kitchen area. We seemed to be facing out to a street but it was very quiet in our room. Besides the kitchen space, we had a little table and chairs area, two closets, a desk, two comfortable cushy chairs and a big screen TV plus the king bed! So nice for NYC. And my daughters never had a single complaint about the sofabed. I always especially like the real plants in the room and the roman shades. It seems to give such a homey touch. The bathroom was also spacious with robes, toiletries, plenty of towels and a makeup mirror, etc. We couldn't think of anything they didn't provide. 
Everyone as usual was very pleasant and friendly, always greeting us when we came and went. My husband was especially pleased with how quick the bellman got our luggage up to our room-even before we left the front desk. He had to track him down to give him his tip. We saw the umbrellas lined up as usual on a rainy day but we had our own. Everyone always provided help with our questions when asked. My husband enjoys the fact that he can set up transportation to and from the airport through the San Carlos before our trip. I love the scale in the lobby to weigh your suitcases before your flight-which they do for you if you want! I travel a lot and don't see a scale very often in a hotel lobby. A nice touch since I always want to know what mine weigh before I get to the airport.
We love the San Carlos for its amenities and spaciousness but also for its location to 5th Ave. (a few blocks walk straight up) and the subway lines (right on the corner). We also found a great Mexican restaurant on the next block behind the hotel. Yes, the breakfast is a little lacking in variety but that doesn't bother us because we are getting FREE breakfast in NYC!!
When we left, Gabriel joked with us once more and gave us free pens to take. We noticed a small boy coming in after us and he immediately started to show him a magic trick. We had to laugh! The San Carlos always makes us feel welcome and like we are part of the family returning for a visit. Until next time- we can't wait!!

title: “Outstanding - Great for Larger Families”
text: I stumbled upon this hotel while searching for a place where more than four people could stay. I was traveling with four older teenagers so space was important. What a gold mine I found. Very roomy rooms, very clean. I cannot say enough great things about the staff. It was so nice to be out and about all day and come back to smiling, welcoming faces. Yes it is their job to care, but they sincerely did. The hotel is in a wonderful quiet neighborhood and easy to walk everywhere. All of us agree that we will always stay at the San Carlos anytime we are in NYC>

title: “A Nice Place to Stay in NYC!!”
text:
If you have reservations at the San Carlos Hotel in NYC, you are about to be VERY pleased!! From the flawless check in, to the tastefully appointed rooms, to the turn down service, to the entire staff (my wife and I were met in the lobby by THE OWNER!, believe it or not), to the whatever...staying at the San Carlos Hotel on E. 50th Street became a treat for us! Total sleep and wonderful rest await you when the lights go out. We loved staying at the San Carlos Hotel.
 If you find the continental breakfast is a little iffy, (as we did), right across the street is the New York Luncheonette, where they do it right & for the right price. Look at the pictures on the walls! Just about everyone who is anyone has eaten there!
 So, it's the San Carlos Hotel for everything (but maybe breakfast) next time you're in NYC. You won't be disappointed.

title: “A total gem in Midtown and outstanding customer service”
text:
We have a fabulous 3 day stay (which turned into a 6 day stay) at this independent and well run hotel in 44th street MIdtown. We were going to highly recommend this hotel before the storm - and afterwards we can only say thank goodness we stayed at this total gem in Midtown.
Staff are fabulous, rooms are very comfortable (King has much more room and better large bed than standard room so recommend king rooms). No noise from lifts or other rooms despite hotel being full. Its not trendy - its conservative and a little old fashioned but in a good comfortable way with great linen and bathrooms as well.
The location is great - two blocks to the madness of Time Square and then you can retreat to this haven - or walk the other direction straight onto the shopping mecca of 5th avenue. 10 minute walk to Empire State. Breakfast in the hotel's restaurant "Triomphe" is too formal/staid and pricey for us but it was very good food. 
We had our stay extended by Superstorm Sandy and I can honestly say in 20 years of travrelling the globe we have never experienced such service and dedication as the staff showed its guests during this crisis. The morning after the storm when Manhattan was closed down literally and shut off from the rest of NYC, the hotel laid on complimentary breakfast for all guests, they provided up to the minute information from airlines about flight cancellations, they made pots of coffee for guests in the lobby trying to use the internet, and despite having to sleep at work, the doormen handed out umbrellas with a smile and up to date information about what was operating or open when it was hard to find places to eat.
We must mention the fabulous and friendly concierge Vanessa who was always smiling and knowledgable and sorted out anything guests asked her to including spending over an hour on the phone (helping other customers whilst she was on hold I might add!) to an airline for us trying to change our flights due to cancellations. 
Patrick on the front desk kept his cool when faced with tired and emotional customers and was always helpful. Hotel management did the human spirited thing and made the very generous decision to allow all guests to stay on at a flat rate which was below their usual rate (unlike other operational hotels in NYC after the storm) and also to cancel additional nights up until 2pm if guests found they could actually travel out of NYC.
AMAZING. Total customer focus, super friendly helpful staff, and a great stay in a great location. We will always go back here when in Manhattan.

title: “Terrific small NYC hotel”
text: We stayed at the Iroguois the weekend just before "Sandy." Great location (near but not on top of Times Square), nicely appointed room, free wifi, friendly and helpful staff. The Triumph restaurant in the hotel is quite good. The bar is pricey but comfortable to hang out in. We reserved the hotel for 3 nights, but by Sunday afternoon it was clear that NYC was shutting down and we should head for home. At 1:15 pm, we told the front desk that we might like to leave. (Our room had already been made up for us.) The hotel was extremely accommodating - just asked us to be out soon, which was fine, and did not charge us for the night. This hotel is a great find!

title: “Perfect location & great staff”
text:
I have just come to the end of a 9 night stay. It was supposed to be 3 but we had to stay on due to Hurricane Sandy.
The staff have been exceptionally helpful and accommodating given our circumstances. I have have heard all sorts of horror stories from other 'stranded' travellers this week and it appears we certainly struck lucky.
The location of the hotel is perfect too. Just a short walk to Time Square and yet far enough to escape the noise. 5th Avenue is literally around the corner and Grand Central is just 5 minutes walk.
I don't like recommending hotels as everyone has different expectations, but the Iroquois has exceeded mine this last week or so, for so many reasons. 
Thank you Team Iroquois!

title: “Great hotel and service”
text: Location is just ok but the hotel is fantastic. Also 2 queen beds in NYC is hard to find. Would stay here again. Staff friendly. Food at restaurant was good and it was cool that there was a giant TV on the side of the building next door that you could watch the game durin dinner. Pretty bar area with good wine choices too.

title: “top class service”
text:
Stayed at Eventi for one night to celebrate a birthday. Check in was quick and efficient, we were upgraded because of our celebration without request which was a lovely surprised. The hotel is nicely done, and the rooms are very modern but comfortable, and if your a shower fan theirs is fantastic. 
The area the hotel is in is not the most beautiful in the city but its very well located for both midtown and downtown activites and close to public transport which is very convenient.
If your pay painful attention to detail there were a couple bits in the room that could use a cosmetic refresh but it was minor. The best part were the staff who were friendly and helpful as can be. If you are looking for great value and top service cant beat the eventi.

title: “nickel and dime you to death”
text: This hotel is one I will not return to. You pay $2 to make a local NYC call. You pay $7 to use their computer simply to print a one page train ticket. It took them 4 hours to bring me the coffee maker I requested. This is supposed to be a small LUXURY hotel...well Klimpton, it is not that at all. It is the usual souless, enormous, robotic employee cavern of a place. Miniature rooms. No tub in room. No complimentary water--you pay a lot for one little bottle. Not worth the time unless you enjoy this kind of place.

title: “Quiet Luxury in the Big Apple”
text: We stayed for a long weekend to enjoy some theater and dining in NYC and were very pleased with this gem of a hotel in the theater district.We had a suite(Rm701) with a lovey balcony in the back of the building.The ambience of the lobby and rooms were delightfully modern tho art deco style and exceedingly clean.The king-size bed ,linens and pillows were very comfortable.The staff were friendly and attentive and went out of their way on several occasions to be helpful. In one instance we were having difficulty with our laptop and were assisted patiently and at length until the situation was resolved.Several times the doorman walked to 6th Ave to call down a cab when none were to be found on 44th St. We enjoyed continental breakfast in the Lamb's Club restaurant and found the pastries and breakfast parfait to be fresh and delicious.A facial at the Red Door Spa was wonderful .All and all we loved the location,the decor and the treatment we received and are grateful to our travel agent for recommending the Chatwal.

title: “Best boutique Hotel in NYC”
text:
We stayed in this hotel from the 28th of September till the 2nd of October 2012, the moment that we arrived we were treated like in home so I would like to to use this to describe the the excellency and professionalism of all employes that want to make you fill like you're at home far from home, this is one of the most appreciated things that I value at any hotel.
We arrived at the hotel without our main luggage (since the airline lost it), and the staff of the hotel was very kind and worried about this situation fortunately the luggage arrived at the hotel the next day and promptly the concierge write us a letter that leaved under the door of our room giving us the good news (excellent detail).
About the hotel, it's located at a very convenient area in NYC just step from Times Square, fifth avenue, Madison Avenue, grand central station, so at e heart of NYC.
The luxury of this boutique hotel has surprised me (I'm traveling a lot and staying almost 200 days per year in hotels), so believe me I've seen many, I've seen luxury and comfort but The Chatwal has something else like the French say (une je ne sais quoi) that makes the The Chatwal very charming and welcoming hotel with the luxury in the exact right proportions.
We stayed in a very comfortable room, or better suite, or grand deluxe room as they call it, 701/702 with a fantastic terrace, living area, very comfortable sleeping area, and two fantastics (yes 2) bathrooms!, with excellent amenities and again the touch for the detail is amazing.
The breakfast at the The Lambs Club is something that cannot be missed as well, again I do emphasize the professionalism of the staff, great service, excellent food.
I would like to thank the staff of the concierge for their concern on our luggage, Juan Espinal for his advises and availability to arrange us the right site seeing and advise during our stay.
Finally the check-out experience was impeccable with Elizabeth Cardona, that after the check and after we left one cell phone phone at the room, she promptly text us to let us know that the cell hone was forgotten but it was in good hands.
We had and excellent experience at the The Chatwal, definitely will stay again (we will want the same room)
We highly recommend this boutique Hotel in NYC, and it should be higher ranked higher in trip advisor and not only at position 16 that currently has.
Thanks to all the staff of the The Chatwal for the memorable stay!

title: “Amazing”
text: We just recently stayed for a few nights to celebrate by 30th birthday. When the hotel front desk staff found out it was my birthday, they got us complementary drinks at the bar, and the bar staff got me a plate of lovely desserts for the occasion. My spa service with Olga was amazing. It was a wonderful visit, and we will be back!

title: “Exceeded expectations”
text: Booked for my b- day weekend. For the price (although discounted) I must say that the entire experience at the Chatwal exceeded our expectations. It was a 5 star experience. An attentive staff combined with a plush-swanky accommodation and atmosphere that created an exciting yet pampering stay. Lot's of room on our balcony to enjoy champaign in the evenings and selected cigars from near by Nat Sherman. The Lambs Club and the bar on site are a must for at least one evening during your visit. Great live entertainment and we bumped elbows with a few celebs on the way out. Times Square and the shows only a few foot steps away! We'll be back!

author.location: Panama City Beach, Florida, United States

title: “Nice 5-day stay”
text:
We stayed five nights in Setai and the experience overall was more than satisfying. Not only we were upgraded to the King Suite with the most breathtaking view, but we were also pleased with welcoming staff and service in the room. The complimentary mini bar and, for coffee lovers - Nespresso coffee machine, room equipped with most advanced technology - whats there not to love? Occasionally, we used Maserati provided complimentary by the hotel which took us to several places in town. The Maserati driver Jack is a true New Yorker who knows everything about New York - from places to go, sights to see, restaurants to eat, broadway shows, history of NY etc. I personally love pizza and Jack managed to advise us on best pizzerias in town and even the history of pizza making in New York. 
Also, the location of the hotel is what you would name as perfect for a tourist or a business visitor - only 2 blocks away from the Empire State Building and only 10 mins walk from Saks Fifth Avenue and main shopping area on 5th ave. Next time we visit NY, we will definitely stay here.

title: “The Setai was amazing...”
text:
We stayed at the Setai for my birthday. Even though it was last summer I keep telling stories about how great it was so I thought I would write a review.
The night of my birthday my girlfriend and I went out for dinner. When we got back to the hotel we were sitting at the bar and asked one of the bartenders what they recommend doing for the evening. One of the managers was standing near us and offered to call a friend of his that worked at a bar. He called and told us to ask for the manager when we got to the bar. When we got there the club was packed (I believe it was Bomaby which I don't think is there anymore). We told the door guy who we were and the manager came down and met us. He bought our drinks for us all night. The whole bar took care of us like we were old friends.
When we got back to the hotel there was a small chocolate birthday cake waiting for me in our room. The service is impeccable there. The hotel is amazing.
I recommend it all the time when I have friends going to NYC.

title: “Should have stayed elsewhere”
text: We chose to stay at the Setai based on the good reviews it received. Unfortunately we did not have the same good experience. We stayed there for a week and left feeling very let down. We had the classic package that included full american breakfast. On arrival the reception staff told us that they did not have that on their system. I forwarded the email confirming we had breakfast included in the rate and the receptionist said he would send us the breakfast vouchers. What he actually sent me were vouchers for continental breakfast which is of a lower value. I had to call again to set this issue clear and finally get the correct vouchers. Unlike other hotels were they offer the most generous breakfasts at the Setai they are extremely stingy. Full breakfast to them is 2 eggs, 1 sausage, coffee and 1 Juice. For anything else you get charged extra. The free wifi is extremely slow we paid the 15 dollar extra per day. They have all the disney channels apart from Disney Junior, so that they can charge 3.99 or something for 30 minute shows for pre-schoolers. We were never told of the courtesy car they have - they never offered it to us. The room was not being cleaned thoroughly. They change sheets every 3 days. My son had smudged the floor to ceiling mirror in the closet area, those smudges stayed there for 3 days. The doormen would see us coming in with children and bags in arms - would take them quite some time to come and help us. Every night I had to deal with the cigarette smoke from the room next to us. A lot of smoke!!! The positives of the hotel were the size of the rooms, the room service food and the location.

title: “Very good, but expected more from this hotel.”
text:
I booked a one-bedroom suite for 2 nights at the Setai fifth avenue. I chose this hotel because it is branded as a five stars hotel, because of the flexible check-in and checkout times and finally because of the good reviews on this website. Unfortunately, even though there were positives during my stay at the Setai, it did not reach my expectations for many reasons.
I’ll start with the negatives.
First, they pretend on their website that the hotel has flexible check-in and checkout times. In the hotel’s guide inside my suite, it’s also clearly written that «there’s no check in and checkout times at the Setai» and that guests can request a late checkout for their date of departure. Unfortunately, this is not true. I booked this hotel for this reason because I was landing in New-York in early afternoon and leaving in the evening and I didn’t want to wait hours at the hotel bar to wait for check in. Well, that’s exactly what happened. I arrived at the hotel just before 1h00PM and they told me at the reception I had to wait until 2h30PM for my suite to be ready. No excuses, no upgrades. At 2h15, the front desk clerk reached me at the bar to tell me my suite was ready. That was a nice touch, but I was expecting my room to be ready when I arrived. Same story for checking out. I asked the front desk the day before my departure for a late checkout. They asked me what time, and when I said 6h00PM, they said it was impossible and the best they could do for me was 2h00PM. That’s unacceptable from a hotel that clearly claims they have no check-in and checkout times.
The other negative is that I requested at the time of booking a high floor because I always like to have nice views when I book hotels. They gave me the 19th floor. I could say it is a high floor, but not in this case since their website says the hotel’s one bedroom suites are located between 18th and 27th floor. 
The third negative is the service in the room. For example, there was a lack in maid service. There were spots of dirt left after the daily maid service. Also, coffees and milks for the espresso machine were not refilled. So I had to call for a refill and it took more than half an hour to have someone come to my room even though they said someone was coming «right now». Same thing for the laundry service, the person at the phone said someone was already on her way to pick up my clothes but it took more than 15 minutes to have someone knock on my door. This same person asked me when I needed my clothes back and when I said for the next morning before 10h00AM, they replied «no problems they will be in your room before 10». They gave me back my clothes at 10h45AM without warning me they would arrive late.
These are some of the small details that, alone, are not that bad. But, put together, they leave a poor impression. It is unacceptable from a five star hotel who ask their clients more than 1300$/night to stay in the type of suite I had.
Now, the positives.
First, the in-room dining. Although expensive, everything from the presentation to the quality of the meal was perfect.
When I needed transportation to go downtown, I asked if the chauffeured Maserati was available and it was. What an experience! The driver, I forgot his name, knows how to ride this sport car. He will get you to your destination in a very short time and don't be afraid, he is a very good driver.
Also, despite the erratic service I already mentioned above, the staff is, for the majority, exceptionally friendly. They will always smile, say hello and, when they remember, they will greet you by your name. 
Concerning the accommodation, the one-bedroom suite I had was very nice. It was nicely decorated and very spacious. These suites are equipped with washer/dryer, fridge, microwave, oven, etc. It really feels like you are at home. Also, the TV in the bathroom is a nice touch. 
In conclusion, I would have given this hotel 3.5 stars. But since I can’t give a half star, I give the Setai 4 stars because that’s the number this hotel should have in reality. A 5 stars hotel is, in my opinion, close to perfection. Unfortunately, the Setai Fifth Avenue failed in many departments as stated above. It is still a very good hotel, but it costs too much for what you get in return.
For all these reasons, I do not think I will come back at this hotel. I’m ready to pay a lot a money for service but I expect to get what I pay for which was not the case at the Setai. For the same price, next time I’ll try the Trump International hotel or the Mandarin Oriental.

title: “Excellent Stay, even though there was a hurricane!”
text:
We were originally supposed to stay at Andaz 5th Ave for 4nts from 27 Oct, but due to hurricane Sandy, ended up having to extend our stay until 04 Nov. 
Upon our arrival we were greeted by Ramone who offered us wine/refreshments while he checked us in.
