The lobby area was quite large with a seating area/library off to one side and restaurant to the other. A few minutes later we were taken to our allocated room and shown all the amenities the room had to offer. Our room was on the 7th floor, (an XL King with view) and we had a lovely view of the library and 42nd Street. The bed was really comfortable, our son had a rollaway bed which was also comfortable. The bedroom was a good size and had a large 42inch flatscreen TV, sofa, mini fridge with complimentary snacks and non alcoholic drinks, safety deposit box, a small glass wardrobe, bedside drawers, iron & ironing board and desk with a telephone. There was a touchpad control for the lights and window blind, which was straight forward to use. It would have been handy if there was a mirror over the desk as the only other mirror in the room was next to the glass wardrobe in the entrance. It was mentioned in previous reviews about noise from the road outside, the only thing we could just about hear was the sound of police/fire engine sirens.
The bathroom was lovely, it had twin sinks, the shower area had a rain shower, normal shower and footbath. We managed to work out the controls for each one after a couple of goes. There was also a hairdryer and toiletries. The only thing I would suggest to change in the bathroom is the lighting, it was rather dim. Other than that the bathroom was very modern, clean and towels changed every day.
Because of hurricane Sandy the hotel issued us with a torch and glow sticks and offered us complimentary pay per view films/TV. We were expecting the power to fail, but fortunately the hotel was not affected (1 block away was in complete darkness)We were kept informed at all times by staff. When we were told our return flight was cancelled I contacted reception who extended our stay straight away and offered assistance contacting my airline. We met with other guests in the seating/library area of an evening, swapping stories over our glasses of complimentary wine (Ramone was the best 'host'). It is a nice touch that the hotel offers this between 6pm and 9pm each evening.
We used the restaurant for breakfast as everywhere else was closed due to Sandy. The eggs, bacon and hash brown was very nice and staff very attentive.
The Andaz 5th Ave is right in the middle of all the tourist areas, 5 mins in each direction to Grand Central Station, Time Square, Empire State Building and shopping on 5th Ave.
This was our 2nd trip to New York, 1st time at Andaz. When we do return there is only one hotel we shall chose and that is Andaz 5th Avenue. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful, the hotel is modern with a warm atmosphere and in an excellent location.

title: “Gem of a hotel, very cool!”
text: I got a last minute room in the wake of Hurricane Sandy troubles, and would have been happy anywhere warm and with electricity. But this was a very cool corner of paradise. From the anti-hotel vibe in the lobby to the huge near floor to ceiling room windows overlooking the NY Public Library, the Andaz 5th oozes style in every corner. The hotel offers a great combination of elegant modern with a hint of classic. The cleanly designed room is minimalistic, yet warm with a odd-shaped, large couch perfect for gazing through the windows at the lights of the city skyscrapers. The bathroom is designed in wood and glass, with a huge shower (no bath) which includes a seat and foot bath in the back corner. I loved the pounded metal double sinks, very pretty. Another fun feature is that the room is operated entirely by touch, not traditional light switches. And, another nice touch when hotels often "nickel and dime" you for everything.. snacks and non-alcoholic room beverages are complimentary.. Add complimentary lobby coffee in the mornings and glasses of wine in the evenings.. and it all adds up to a fabulous stay. Great for business trips, couples, even families thanks to the large spacious feeling in the rooms. It's also a great location from which to launch exploring Manhattan. Enjoy. I plan to do so myself again.

title: “Hope to make this my regular NY spot”
text:
Great looking hotel with friendly staff and good location. Highlights include the well-designed bathrooms and showers, the automated window shades and the free snacks and non-alcoholic minibar items. Friendly but low key, not 'in your face' service -- and I mean that in a good way. Also, Andaz has free in-room wi-fi, which is a must. I will definitely choose this place again, and in fact have a current reservation for later this year. 
Just a few minor suggestions to get it from really good to perfect:
--the baggage holding area is out in the open in a corner of the library/lounge area. This is unsightly and also lacks proper security for peoples' belongings. 
--the food at the restaurant is just OK. One dinner I had there was particularly substandard. However, in the hotel's defense, they offered to comp the meal without any unpleasantness whatsoever, which really mitigated the whole situation in my mind (although I didn't eat in the restaurant again during the trip).
--gym is sort of lacking ... there seems to be a lot of wasted space on the 2nd floor where they could put a better gym and spa, which would be more consistent with the price point and style of the hotel.

title: “Just the best”
text: Brilliant hotel, opposite a supermarket where you can buy any sort of food. Near to Central Park. The hotel itself was magic, clean, comfortable, quiet. We stayed for 5 nights in a studio apartment on the 19th floor, could not even see the kitchenette from the very comfortable bed. Big bathroom. Great view from the window. Laundry room on the 7th floor. Could not imagine wanting to stay anywhere else in New York. Will recommend to anyone.

title: “Loved the Hotel Beacon”
text: This hotel is magnificent! It's blocks from Central Park and Times Square, Viand is next store with great food and they deliver! The rooms are gorgeous! It's quiet and everything is clean and up to date. There's are great food market right across the street in one direction and a Starbucks in the opposite direction. The staff was spot on! I had an issue with my heater and they had someone up to fix it before I hung the phone up. It was booked and busy but the service was spectacular. Can't go wrong with the hotel!

title: “Perfect for us”
text:
Had the one bedroom apartment, the separate living area works really well if your other half is to bed early. The kitchen is great for having your own breakfast, you would be hard pressed to cook a proper meal given the limited cooking utensils. Having said that Fairway across the road have some fabulous fresh pre packaged meals that you can microwave. The liquor store close by has an amazing selection of wines, plus lots of cold ones if you are in a hurry. The air con is noisy, we just simply switched it off which may not be an option in summer/winter. The lifts are slow at busy periods, some times I just walked the 11 floors (to keep fit!). The laundry on level 7 is an absolute winner if you are travelling on, as we were. If you are going to Newark airport, ask the concierge to book you the shuttle bus, it's far cheaper than the metered taxi. Great location, just a bit more upmarket feel about it, compared to downtown.
Only gripe was booked months prior, and asked to be as high as possible, but ended up on level 11.

title: “Great room and location”
text:
Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Beacon. We wanted to stay in an area that had a more local neighbourhood feeling so we thought the Upper West Side would do the trick. I was really impressed by the value of this hotel. With the tax we paid $344 a night for a King room. Other hotels I researched were even more then that and the pictures didn’t seem as nice. We got there late at night and there was a big crowd in the lobby and low and behold Robin Williams was there visiting with fans. I assumed he was performing at the theatre next door but not sure. Seemed like a sign of a good visit. The room was very large. Much bigger then other New York hotels I’ve stayed in. As well the décor was really nice and bed very comfortable. It definitely seemed like they had renovated recently. Before our arrival I emailed to request a quiet room on a higher floor. They gave us a room on the top floor which is 25th. Our room was across from the elevators which I thought might be a problem for noise but we barely heard anything from the hallway. As well I had read reviews about the elevators being slow but we never had an issues with them. We had chatted with some local residences of the hotel that had been living there for 25 years. It was interesting to stay in a place with such history. When we woke up our first morning we were stunned at the view. A great way to start everyday. 
The subway is right around the corner which is really convenient. At the last minute I considered switching hotels to somewhere around Greenwich Village because I thought that we might be spending hours on the subway but the express train to Time Square is super fast. We would be downtown in around 15 minutes so getting around wasn’t a problem at all. 
Having the Viand Café downstairs is really convenient as well. We arrived late at night and it was so nice to pop down for a snack and drink. On our last day we had to leave for our flight early so again it was nice to have a reasonably priced meal downstairs. We also had breakfast at Le Pain Quotiden on 72nd which we really enjoyed as well we went to Sarabeth’s West which was good but nothing really special and pricey. We also partook in the famous Gray’s Papaya for a snack too. A really nice wine store is just downstairs too and a Duane Reade closeby if you forgot any toiletries. 
There’s lots of shopping around the area too which we didn’t expect which was great. A big DSW was just down the street. We rented bikes at Master Bike Shop on 72nd and did a nice ride around Central Park. 
For the beautiful room, view, location, and value I’d definitely recommend the Beacon.

title: “Expectations - The Four Seasons (Houston).”
text: It exceeds the type of service one expects of a Luxury Hotel. IThe staff makse you comfortable even before you walk through the front door the rest is close to prefection. I have stated a Four Season properties across the country and Houston Fourseasons is at the top of my list.

title: “They make it look easy”
text: Four Seasons hotels are fun for us, because of the staff. They are so doggone good at what they do, and they make it look so easy. Our three day stay was highlighted by staff excellence across the board, and they seem to never suffer from the same glitches we find at most hotels. Great, sustained service starts at the top, so a tip of the cap to the hotel manager and his team. We love stayng here, as we know we will always have a first-rate experience.

title: “There is no need to look any further!”
text: While looking for a romantic getaway for me and my husband I came across The Four Seasons. I was thoroughly impressed with the service from the point of stepping out of my car all the way through ordering room service. This was definitely a weekend to remember and I appreciate the hotel staff helping to make it so effortless. The location was prime to everything we wanted to do and we will definitely be back.

title: “Nice:Not up to Autograph standards”
text:
My husband and I went to Houston for our daughter's birthday and stayed at the Hotel Icon expecting a certain level of creature comforts and executive amenities found in the Autograph Collection. We were both disappointed with the lack of these amenities. There was no concierge, no afternoon cocktail hour, no morning coffer or tea bar in the lobby, or fresh fruit or spa water for the hotel guests. We had to ask for the liquid soap to be filled in the shower. For those of you who are un-
settled by this sort of thing, the soap, shampoo, and hair conditioner containers in the shower are refilled between guests, not replaced. The shampoo dispenser in our shower had old dried shampoo remnants on the pump. The room was lovely. The view was the freeway and air conditioner units on other buildings. The bathroom was huge and nicely appointed. The front desk personnel were helpful but not knowledgable in the current happenings in Houston. Upon checkout, we were given driving instruction to the airport. One major problem: a marathon was in progress and literally all streets were closed to the highway. The Hotel Icon was nice but did not live up to expectations.

title: “Review of Recent Stay During Convention”
text: I loved my recent stay at Hotel Icon in Houston from November 1st through the 4th, 2012. Erica at the front desk was absolutely fantastic at making my trip go smoothly. She made all of the inconveniences of travel go away and had a very pleasant personality that was constantly focused on taking care of all of the hotel's guests. I was with a very large group and she was helpful to everyone in my group, as well as everyone else i saw her interact with while staying at the hotel. The bartender in the lobby bar was also fantastic and took care of a lot of people (and the associated chaos) easily. Overall, everyone I interacted with gave fantastic customer service and made staying at the Hotel Icon an enjoyable experience. I have stayed there before prior to Marriott buying it and was pleasantly surprised to see the same level of customer care demonstrated under the Marriott ownership.

title: “comfortable stay”
text:
Our stay at this hotel was comfortable, room was small, but clean. We found the front desk staff to be very friendly and professional. We had drinks and dessert at the bar. House dessert was delicious and my husband's martini was excellent.
The bartender, a female, was professional but could have been
 more friendly and did not offer a coffee refill. Our room was on the top floor and was too warm. The thermostat was "locked" at seventy degrees. It would have been comfortable at 68. Our room was small with one queen bed.
While overall, the hotel was very nice and our stay was pleasant, I probably would not choose this hotel again. It was a good value, though.

title: “Great Downtown Houston Hotel”
text: The Icon is absolutely my hotel of choice when in town for business. It's a wonderful boutique hotel with top notch amenities and the staff is always phenomenal, I could never say enough about them! The fact that it's a Marriott brand makes it even better.

title: “Hotel with style and location”
text: When I told a friend of mine that I would come over to Houston for the 1st time after several years he recommended me the Sorella as it was pretty new and European style.I enjoyed the Sorella because of its convenient location and great room. The hotel reminded me a bit of the Chedi and the Shangri/La in Muscat, where we had relaxing lunches and dinners when we lived there. The bar with cocktails and live music was very enjoyable. What I liked was that it is possible to walk in the area that features good shops and restaurants.

title: “Overpriced amd nothing special”
text: Stayed there two mights, hotel is clean and modern. Arrived late at night and had to find the small side entrance as everything else was locked. Room was big with desk, nice corner sofa beside the window. There is free breakfast that is a small variety of fruits pastries and cereals, no warm food. The area for breakfast is the lobby and definitely undersized, after 7:00am people were walking around with their plates trying to find a chair. The pool is just beside the main corridor and seems more like a barhtub considering the size. Price for all that, that was nothing more than an acerage hotel was about $400/night, definitely no value for money.

title: “Everything Perfect”
text: I came into Houston for the 1st time in 25 years, and was delightfully surprised at the new city centre -- wonderful restaurants, beautiful greens, totally clean ! And the Hotel Sorella was wonderful - beautifully designed and decorated, the service impeccable. When I needed to set up a meeting for 8 people serving wine from outside their hotel they didn't hesitate to offer space in their bistro, no fees requested. They stored my bottles in their refrigerator, no charge, with a smile, and the breakfast is wonderful. The fruit fresh and copious, the berries outstanding and lots of french pastries and cereals. The rates very reasonable for what they offer.

title: “excellent hotel and location”
text:
I visited the Sorella on a business trip in August 2012. I found the staff to be very helpful, and the hotel is lovely.
The room was clean, big, comfrotable with plenty of wardrobe space and a desk to working on. The breakfast was lovely and the food/room service excellent.
The pool side area was really nice also.
This hotel is in a good, safe area of HOuston with lots of pubs, restaurants within walking distance which is great if you are on a short business trip and dont have a hire car/dont want to use the hire car to get to dinner.

title: “Excellent service, beautiful hotel!”
text: The service was excellent in all areas, the food at the Nigel's restaurant is really good although the menu is limited. The rooms are very nicely decorated. Excellent hotel

title: “Great Experience!!!!”
text: I attended the THLA Short Course from 01/08/2012 - 01/14/2012. I work in the hotel industry as well. This stay was the best i've ever had. I have to mention the F&B Staff. The staff in the bar ( Osli, Tao, Su and a couple othere) were AWESOME! I was in the bar everynight and was amazed at the service. Also the Night Auditor noticed i did not answer my wake up call. She found me to make sure that i was ok. GREAT SERVICE. The entire hotel was amazing!!!! Thank you for making my week there memorible.

title: “Best stay ever”
text: I travel alot and really enjoyed my stay here. The hotel was very clean and the staff very professional. It took me only 5 minutes to make it to downtown and the campus is beautiful. Will stay again soon.

title: “Quality with minor glitches”
text: Stayed one night for a seminar at the University. Clean, comfortable room (nice bed!) with plenty of space. Squeaky clean. Shower temp was a little on the cool side, even at full hot. Air handling unit was a bit loud; could not shut it off despite thermostat in room. But these were minor inconveniences for an otherwise pleasant stay. Nice staff. Free wi-fi. Limited restaurant options with walking distance; Eric's restaurant in the hotel was decent.

title: “Excellent customer service.”
text: I was traveling alone and the employees went out of their way to be helpful. Rooms are spacious well equipped w amenities. I would highly recommend this hotel..

author.location: West Bloomfield Township, Michigan, United States

title: “Very good access to downtown, very nice bed, very quiet, good access to amenities”
text:
I stayed at the the BW Downtown on two separate business trips in Nov. 2011. The access to downtown is perfect--a 10 minute walk to the office, although the shuttle is availble free of charge. The rooms are a bit larger than average, and the beds and bedding were very comfortable. One thing that struck me is that the place is very quiet--the hallways and stairs were recarpeted recently with heavy underlay and you don't notice people walking up and down the halls. There is a pool and hottub that I did not take advantage of. The complimentary breakfast every morning is great--eggs, bacon, sausage, yoghurt, toast, juice, coffee, etc. In the evening there are complimentary snacks and beverages as well. The high speed internet worked fine; much better than at larger places I've stayed at.
There are many restaurants and pubs nearby and the Galleria is about a 20 min drive. River Oaks is quite close for shopping as well and the theatre district is very close. The Texas Art Supply is about 5 minutes away on Montrose, and on Westheimer about 10 min away there are a bunch of eclectic antique stores that are worth checking out on the weekend.
Access to the airport is very good-- about a 30 minute drive on I-45 with no tolls.
I will definately stay here again. The staff are very friendly and they really do make sure that your stay is comfortable.

title: “Everything I thought and more”
text: This is my first year to go to with a group of Quilter from southeast Kansas to the International Quilt Festival. We have never stayed in a hotel that was so accommodating. We were glad to see that the shuttle was extended for the weekend to accommodate all of us. Especially me when I forgot my prescription medicine and they were more than happy to take me to the pharmacy! Thanks you Jo, Sonny, John and all the other staff for making my once a year trip the best!!! I hope to you see you next year.

title: “We Keep Coming Back!”
text: I travel with several friends (we're from a small town) for a "girl's weekend" once a year to big-city Houston for the International Quilt Festival. We have stayed at the Best Western Downtown for the last 8 years and have always had a great stay! We've found the staff (Jo, Sonny, John & all the others) more than willing to help us out in any way they can. We especially appreciated the extended weekend shuttle this year!

title: “Excellent stay!!”
text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while attending a conference. The hotel definitely met and to a certain extent, exceeded my expections. Very upscale. Very clean. Very professional. Would highly recommend!

title: “Nice place to stay but”
text: The hotel was very clean and well maintained. The staff was very professional and helpful. However the bed was one of the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in. I slept in hide-a-beds which were more comfortable. The idea it is adjustable is miss leading yes it adjusts but only leaves a hole in the bed where u were sleeping. The top is so firm there is no element of comfort. If you have a bad back and enjoy firm mattress these are the beds for you.

title: “Very nice, great value!”
text: I was very impressed with this hotel. It was clean, tastefully decorated, and looked like new. The area seemed nice and safe. The room had a full kitchen, table, desk, TV, and queen size bed. The staff was friendly and I had no problems. I have paid over $100/night for worse hotels than this, but I got my room for $30/night using the "name your price" feature on Priceline! What a bargain!!

title: “Pleasant Surprise”
text:
For $54.99 a night we were at first dubious, so we only
guaranteed the first night at the daily rate ($20 more). This property was rennovated 4 months ago as I write (Apr. '07).
It was clean as a whistle. Staff pleasant. Small pool plus
exercise room. Shortcomings? Your room is only made up
by a maid once a week. For clean towels, you exchange
"old" towels for fresh towels at the front desk. Free breakfast
consists of bagels, coffee and fresh fruit (apples/oranges).
This falls short of most free breakfasts. If you are used to
the Savoy, Hilton or Marriott, Extended Stay Deluxe - Northwest
at this location won't fit the bill. But, you'll have extra bucks
for attractions and meals out. We did not use the frige, microwave, or oven. Total stay, 11days.
P.S. Immediate surroundings: a new-looking office park.
1-1/2 blks. from I-290.

title: “Buen Hotel, cerca de las atracciones de Houston”
text: Estuve hospedado en este hotel en diciembre 2010 por espacio de una semana. Las instalaciones estan bien, asi como las habitaciones, amplias y limpias. 2 camas matrimoniales, un sofa cama, un sillon reclinador, cocina equipada. El servicio de limpieza es una vez por semana, pero se pueden cambiar las toallas en la recepcion. Tiene muy cerca un Walmart, Target, Best Buy, para comer un Golden Corral. Se puede ir caminando a cada uno de estos sitios. El internet inalmabrico cuesta 4.99$ por toda la estadia y es rapido y funciono genial. La zona es segura, no vi nada extraño. Queda a 10 minutos del downtown de houston, de las atracciones como el parque hermann, los museos tambien queda cerca como 15 minutos en auto. El desayuno es muy basico y pobre, pan, mermelada queso crema y cafe, algo de frutas como manzanas y naranja. Tiene una impresora inalambrica en la recepcion donde poder imprimir cualquier documento. En general, la estadia fue bien.

title: “Outstanding Hotel Perfect Location!”
text:
My husband and I recently visited the Sherry Netherland for a weekend trip to NY and this hotel was in the perfect location. On the SE corner of Central park, the hotels location on 5th ave. was picturesque! Also, many shops and resturants are within walking distance.
The hotels offers amazing suites, with separate kitchens, living and bedrooms. Plenty of space, yet comfortable ammenities. The beds and pillows were the most comfortable we have ever experienced! The old world design accents of the hotel make the experience that much more memorable.
The entire staff from the front desk to the elevator attendent were always smiling and ready to help with anything their guests need. The definately put their customers needs first. We cant wait to visit this hotel again!

title: “Old- time New York at its Best”
text: Our family stayed in five rooms at the Sherry Netherland this weekend. It's a beautiful old hotel, with excellent service and great attention to detail (eg. the elevator operator remembers on what floor we were staying on the first day). The rooms are spacious for NYC, and were quiet and clean. We have stayed in the Pierre, Waldorf, Essex house, etc and this hotel stands above the rest with their friendly and professional service. Loved it!

title: “A real treat”
text:
I've stayed in a lot of hotels in New York, this was one of the best. Doorman, elevator (lift) attendant and everyone seemed to remember my name which was probably the most impressive thing. A fridge with several complimentary drinks refreshed every day, free wifi (sadly unusual these days).
The location was perfect, right next to the Apple store on the south east corner or Central Park, business or pleasure a great find.

title: “100% Genuine and wholesome”
text:
We chose this hotel because we wanted to stay in a child friendly location in New York, and to be frank, you pay a little more but you get much more for your money. I don't want to spoil the surprise for you by going into detail about all the niceties that this hotel offers, but I can promise you an endless row of moments when you will exert an "Oooh!" and be moved by the care that the hotel demonstrates time and time again. If you are considering NOT to dine for breakfast at the Cipriani restaurant, I have to tell you that you only pay $10 more there for a decent breakfast than in a greasy spoon cafe, but you get more for your money. We tried a few different options, and would not bother looking around for alternatives, unless you just want to grab a sandwich. 
The Sherry Netherland is the first ever service establishment I have encountered where you actually feel that the hospitality philosophy has actually filtered its way to all levels of employees. There is not one person who acts as if they haven't embraced the friendly attitude the Sherry is seeking to emit. There is only one minor complaint, and that is that the bed is slightly on the hard side for me. But this is a minor detail, so unless you are very sensitive to this, choose the Sherry. You will get more than a hotel stay, You will truly beleive this is your second home.

title: “Perfect for traveling with teens/tweens!”
text:
I spent hours researching NYC hotels with suites. We have an 11 and 13 year old and needed two beds plus a sofa bed. We also wanted to be midtown and were hoping for free Wifi. The San Carlos delivered!
The location is central to everything; Times Sqaure, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. We arrived early and check in was a breeze. The room is huge and has a mini kitchenette too. Super clean and comfortable. Parking is self park right next door with a discounted rate of $30 per night-even with our SUV! The gym is small but did the trick and there is a Starbucks less then a 5 minute walk away! The free continental breakfast is simple but did the trick. 
The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had brunch at Madison Restaurant after we arrived-a huge diner that was delicious and the wait staff very nice. We got cupcakes at Buttercup Bakery on the way back to the hotel. We saw Cirque du Soleil our first night and ordered a pizza and salad from Albitino's which is a 5 minute walk. Our last night there we ate at Chop A Steakhouse (a 10 minute walk) and took advantage of their Restaurant Week menu. A fabulous experience.
During check out the manager did a magic trick for my daughter! I have stayed at the Affinia chain and much prefer this hotel for traveling with teens/tweens. There is no restaurant or bar so if you're looking for the trendy/nightlife scene this is not for you. My husband and I have stayed at the W right around the corner and I would go there if you are looking for that vibe. But if you're looking for a spacious, clean, nice hotel that welcomes families, has cheap parking, free Wifi and free breakfast, you cannot beat the San Carlos!

title: “Good room but don't expect to sleep or eat.”
text:
The San Carlos is a a nice average midtown hotel. It was quite clean and had good space, a nice sized closet, including a nook with a fridge for my own groceries as well as a mini bar. The bed was comfortable. A clock radio that will charge your iphone with plenty of plugs to recharge your electronics. I liked my room quite a bit. The front desk staff was kind and very helpful. They allowed me to check in early, and store my luggage on the day of departure. The doormen did a wonderful job helping with taxis and offering advice. However, they can not overcome everything.
I had 2 significant problems during my stay. One was the noise in the hotel. Two was the lack of any civilized dining, as well as no room service at all.
The doors in the hotel slam. So between rowdy guests coming and going at all hours and the morning housekeeping staff hollering down the halls, sleeping at 10 pm or 8 am was just not possible. The walls are thin and I could hear the televisions of neighboring rooms. Believe me, I am accustomed to NYC noise and not much gets to me. The noise at the San Carlos was just overwhelming, not just annoying. I was there 5 nights, and guests cam and went, but the noise level did not change. Such a disappointment.
However, the thing I hated more was the breakfast service in a cramped dark hot room. Breakfast, which was limited to bad bagels, toast, a couple of varieties of cereal and coffee was a chaotic mess. Tiny paper plates, cheap plastic knives that break, and tiny coffee cups that are too hot to carry was a horrible way to begin my day. Everything was disposable and unpleasant. Honestly, the airlines do better. I stayed there five days and not one morning could I easily grab a cup of coffee and take a seat. Just a mess. Don't even think about requesting a coffee service to be delivered to your room either. Other midtown hotels have self serve breakfast, and it works. The key is space, good variety, and enough staff to keep the place clean, well stocked, and to provide assistance. Actual glassware, plates, and utensils would be nice. This just is the worst.
The San Carlos has the potential to be a good hotel. I wish I wanted to return. I wanted to like it very much. I just can not go back unless they care to provide a vastly better stay.

title: “Top Notch Place to Stay in Manhattan”
text:
Our family stayed at the San Carlos for 7 days and found this hotel to be top notch in every way. The customer service from the bellman to the front desk to the maintenance and cleaning staff were all incredible! The rooms are spacious and very clean. Our rooms had refrigerators and microwaves and a small kitchen set up. Awesome Wolfgang Puck coffee too. Beds are extremely comfortable. Large screen TV in the bedroom and family room. The location was fabulous for walking to lots of the city sights. We felt very comfortable walking day and night and the staff greeted us with smiles whether it was 7am or 11pm. We were out shopping one day and were racing down the streets to get to the next store when a tall Irish man across the way was waving and smiling. It was the bellman on his day off, out and about, and in the crazy hustle and bustle of NY street walkers, he recognized us, waved to get our attention and sent a big smile asking if we were enjoying the city. Truly a gem! 
Recommendations: Move one phone into the sitting area instead of having two phones in the bedroom. Perk up the breakfast selections. 
We can honestly say that this hotel is top notch on customer service and the rooms are great too. Highly recommend the San Carlos!

title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
text: I was one of those who had no electricity after Sandy - so moved to this hotel after having stayed at another hotel for 3 days. All I can say is that I truly wish I had come here first! What a brilliant find! Im not really crazy about the area around Times Square - as it can be a bit hectic, but honestly, would overlook that for Iroquois. Service is superb , rooms are cozy ( feels like you are in your own bedroom)...and everything was just spot on. Unfortunately - I didn't get to taste any of the food - but will save that for next time. This hotel is definitely worth a visit.

title: “A perfect stay !”
text: If you like the huge crowdy hotels - this one is not for you. If you wanted a boutique luxury hotels in the best location of Manhattan, just off Times Square - you've got it ! The service is incredibly great, starting with the front desk, the concierge , and even the technician who helped me with the Wi Fi. The room has anything you need with Molton Brown amenities . The fitness room has just everything, and I heard their Triumph restaurant is awesome , though I haven't tried it. It is just THE hotel for NYC.

title: “Great hotel, warm welcome & friendly service”
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Warm welcome from Susu upon check-in in the impressive lobby area and she immediately wished my partner a happy birthday (the reason for our visit). We had a corner room on the 16th floor overlooking the Empire State Building so great views - and great sunrises each morning! The room was larger than we expected; huge comfortable bed with lovely linens, large bathroom with enormous and excellent shower, fluffy bathrobes (even a decent hairdryer in the bathroom which is a bonus). We were very happy with our 'home' for 3 nights. The location was also easy access to Penn St Station, Madison Square Gardens, Macy's etc - easy walking distance to most sights but not as noisy an area as Times Square, etc.
We arrived pretty late on the first night so just went into the hotel bar for a quick drink and bar snack upon arrival. It has a nice ambience though the drinks were a little pricey (it is a hotel in Manhattan afterall!)
The hotel also does some nice touches for guests - inclusive continental breakfast which was very good - fresh juices, tea & coffee, wide choice of fresh fruits, pastries, cereals, breads, cheese & meats. You can choose hot buffet items for an additionsl 12 dollars or choose from the menu. We found the continental breakfast was plenty for us and breakfast is served in a light & airy conservatory.
They also provide free wine hour from 5pm-6pm, again very welcome after a long day sightseeing.
When you need to check in online for your flights home, you can go to the business centre and use their PC to check in and print out your boarding card for free. That was a great, hassle-free service that meant we weren't waiting on busy staff to help us do this.
We signed up to the Kimpton InTouch membership before we visited - simply join online for free and you get perks such as free wifi and a voucher for free drinks from the minibar.
I think I've previously read complaints about maids walking into the room when guests are still in there but that didn't happen with us. There isn't a 'do not disturb' sign to hang on the outside of the door; it's a light switch change next to the door. If the room is empty then the light is orange; if you don't want to be disturbed then flick the switch and it changes to red, telling the maids not to enter. We weren't told about this but figured it out when seeing a neighbour's room light was a different colour!
Overall an excellent hotel with great rooms and friendly, professional staff. Would definitely stay again.

title: “Excellent value”
text: We stayed for two nights for a wedding and were very pleasantly surprised at how good this hotel is especially given the relatively moderate price for a hotel of this quality in NYC. We had a very nice one bedroom suite which was more than adequate in size and quite comfortable, The staff was very friendly and the room service breakfast was very good. We also went to a brunch at the hotel for the wedding guests the morning after the wedding and it was excellent as well.

title: “Stylish night in Manhattan”
text: We stayed for 1 night and really liked the hotel. You step right in off a busy 6th Ave into a very nice lobby that relaxes you immediately. The check in was very quick. We thought the rooms very a little small but very modern and relaxing. This is a great place to stay for a night out in the city. There's a good restaurant connected to the hotel that serves many different types of food and you can sit in a movie theater style set up and watch a huge screen TV (I'm not sure if it was owned by the hotel or not, but was a nice experience).

title: “Dissapointing”
text:
We stayed at this hotel in August and were dissapointed for the following reasons:
1)We arrived at 4pm after an 8 hour flight from the UK to be told, 'your room is not ready owing to a late checkout....why don't you expolore NYC and we'll call you'. This is not good enough for a supposed 5 star property, no apology was offered and the hotel never rang us'
2) Our room was tiny, dark and overfilled with technology which did not function properly e.g the curtains did not close electronically
3) staff tried to add charges from another room to our bill at checkout
I understand this hotel is in NYC and boutique, but definately not 5 star in my opinion.

title: “Beyond all expectations”
text: I stayed 5 nights at the Chatwal recently. From the bell boy who took me to my room, to the room cleaners to the front desk staff all excellent. The room (mini suite) was an oasis in NYC with extraordinary quality and style in every way. It doesn't come cheaply but it is worth the cost.

title: “Stylish & Functional; Friendly yet Discreet and Superb Location”
text:
We had a great 3 day stay in late August, travelling as a family with 2 teenage daughters. Room was perfect, a midsize suite made out as two fully functional bedrooms with two full bathrooms. Of course the girls were ecstatic about the mod cons, especially the television embedded in the bathroom mirror and also the multi-functional WC!
We had transferred rom a very disappointing hotel not too far away where we had a great deal but poor everything else and so it was nice to luxuriate here. I had read reviews about the friendly reception staff and must say that Elisabeth lived up to her very high billing!
Any negatives? Maybe only the views from the rooms at the rear which rather depressingly look directly into very dull offices or that buildings even duller rear end!

title: “The case of the Hungry Housekeeper”
text:
I stayed at the Setai during the first weekend of October for three nights. I was really excited about staying at this five star hotel that has received many great reviews. Our last stay was at Sofitel, and I absolutely loved the service (held your bags, doorman became my friend, gorgeous suite)- Sofitel clearly understands five-star service. The Setai, in my standards, could not deliver when it came to friendly service and hospitality. The concierage did not go out of their way, and the doormen acted more like security guards. The only employee in Setai that actually knew the meaning of real quality five-star service was Brett. Thank you, Brett :) The rest should learn from him!
Here is a breakdown of the Positives and Negatives:
- gave us a room right away as soon as we landed, so easy early check in
- became obsessed with the espresso machine! But, housekeeper was so cheap on providing extra pods
- good location if you are into midtown/Times Square, personally, next time we want to be closer to Central Park 
- Gym had good equipment, but dark paint on walls and no windows may be a hard environment for some to work out in, and what's up with the old, bruised fruit?
- the room service was nice and quick (Sheniqua was a friendly voice on the other end)
- free shoe shine and ironing
- even though I was not happy with the hotel, the room itself was great. Our deluxe king room and bathroom was spacious and nice
- mini-fridge
- hotel car, if you can get it, is a maserati
- be careful, since the location is right on fifth ave, lower level room occupants might be able to hear the busy street, we were on floor 15, but I could still hear the hustle and bustle outside from the bathroom only not the room
******* Oh, the icing on the cake, the housekeeper threw away my take-out twice! The first time, grrr, I let it go, but then the next day, my Mario Batali pizza that was not even placed near a garbage was also "cleaned up". The manager was non-chalent and unapologetic. 
*** I do not mind paying good money for good service, heck I stay at five-stars to receive it, but Setai was a huge disappointment. Not worth it! 
To end on a positive note, make sure you have drinks at the Manadarin one night to enjoy the million dollar view, I love u NYC!

title: “Excellent Choice on 5th Avenue”
text:
My wife and I have tried numerous hotels in NYC without finding one we'd be interested in returning to. The Setai is the first one that hits on that metric.
First off, the location is convenient to both Penn and Grand Central Stations, being only a few blocks walk from each. Close to the E Subway (from JFK) as well. SO far, so good.
Room was huge, and well stocked with water, sodas and Nespresso, all of which are included. It's not cheap by any means, but in NY nothing is, and the hotels we have tried in the $250-$350 range have generally been old, run down places with noisy (and largely non-functional) HVAC. The air system in the room at the Setai got a good amount of chill into the room, and did so quietly. Bravo!
Traffic noise was very muted, with is saying something for NY, the city that never sleeps and never stops blowing the horn on the taxi. The only noise issue was that the doors do not have any kind of damper on the closing/hinge, so if the guest doesn't bother to close the door gently, it slams. That was not an issue on Thursday or Friday of our stay, but Saturday apparently some of the guests on the floor partied late (3-4 am) and then came back too inebriated to bother keeping the noise level down. That interrupted sleep numerous times because of the banging of the doors. Management please take note. Put door closers on the guest rooms, so that the door will close gently and quietly.
Food was expensive but good. Fortunately, my wife is a member of the Leading Hotels program, so we got a $70 breakfast credit daily. That sounds like a lot, but it is about what breakfast for two costs. Service was excellent at times and a bit less so at other times, but no major issues.
All things considered, we enjoyed the Setai very much and will be back.

title: “Enjoyed it more this time but $40 for a Belgium waffle. Really??”
text: My first time at the setai (about 6 months ago) I was not super impressed. What a difference a few months makes. The service was perfect. Housekeeping came twice each day and there were fresh cookies in the room each evening. We had a larger suite so perhaps that helped. They also have a personal assistant to book stuff for you if you would like which is a nice touch. I was very happy with the room and would even say it may be the best suite yet in NYC beyond the plaza. So why only 4 stars? Their room service menu makes no sense in terms of price. $40 for a Belgium waffle with a choice of hot drink and a main entree (meat) is under $40. How does that make any sense?Also who would actually pay $40 for a Belgium waffle?? Bizarre quirk that for the level of hotel should not exist. Loved the room and service : just will have waffles elsewhere

title: “Marwan T”
text: Lucky to have stayed there during our visit to NYC. Sad for the people that were affected by the hurricane. No electricity just 2 blocks away. Met by Ms. Cornelia Samara, the GM, upon arrival. Made us feel at home. A few goodies for the kids left in the room. A nice touch. We stayed in the suite. Good sized rooms for NYC. Lovely terrace with excellent views. Breakfast at the shop was great. The lemon soufflé pancake is a must. The eggs benedict too. Homey feel. Thank you to the general manager and team. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: “An unusally tranquil airy place with hidden hedonism”
text: We arrived after a 3.5 hour journey from EWR, in the wake of Sandy, so the welcoming glass of wine was well received. Reception is trying a bit hard to be different and the iPad the lady had was did not have the right dates on it, but her charm made up the deficit and we were booked straight in and shown to our suite, in the most comprehensive manner. Snacks and soft drinks free, nice touch, great space, free wifi, but the huge TV's had a non-inituitive interface, which was annoying and hard to work. The bar is downstairs and is a brave attempt to blend the chefs with the customers, with completely open cooking stations, we didn't try it as it was standing room only and we were knackered. Benjamin's down the road was great though. We'd definitely go back, as it is perfectly sited for 5th Avenue, Bryant Park, the Theater district and only a mile and a bit to Central Park. Having so many female front of house staff gave it a very relaxing ambience, very friendly.

title: “Amazing hotel with amazing staff!”
text:
We stopped at this hotel for my 30th birthday and 3rd anniversary celebrations! It was also when hurricane Sandy hit! The hotel could not have been more helpful and accommodating given this situation we were all faced with. On arrival we had an upgrade to a lovely suite room which was great. The restaurant and bar areas are very nice and the food is also lovely!
When we return to NYC we don't have to worry about looking for a hotel as I would always stop at the Andaz!

title: “Great Location, Great Rooms, Great Staff”
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Beacon for the first time while visiting our son, who lives a couple of blocks away and who suggested the Beacon. Our room was very good-sized, with a basic kitchenette (and a Keurig coffee maker!), clean, and simply but attractively decorated.
The hotel has no restaurant or bar, but there are plenty of good eateries nearby (for NYC diner-type food, try the Viand Cafe in the same building), and a Fairway grocery store directly across Broadway to get goodies if one wants to eat in. The location is super - away from the bustle of Times Square and the grunge of the Village, but it is easy to get to both of those with a cab down Broadway or, for the more adventurous, a ride on the subway. Central Park is only a couple of blocks away, and the Lincoln Center is a comfortable walk.
All the staff with whom we had contact, from the doorman to the front desk to the housekeepers, were super - very friendly and helpful.

title: “Fabulous”
text:
Fantastic hotel, fantastic location close to the subway station and Columbus Circle. No restaurant but the cafe downstairs is great value for money. Rooms were spacious and clean with a
small kitchen great for making breakfast. The area is more residential so felt safe outside at night.

title: “Nice Change of Pace”
text: This is actually a remodeled apartment building - there are still people living here in rent-controlled apartments! It feels more like what it began as then a modern hotel. Neverthess, our 1br suite was very large by NYC standards, comfortable, full kitchen, clean. The bathroom was not great but hey, think of your grandmothers apt when you were a kid. NOTE- there Is no valet parking or restaurant with room service.

title: “Best View I've EVER had!”
text:
I chose this hotel because it is the closest hotel to my old apartment. I moved out of NY a year ago, and miss it terribly. I wanted to be right back where I used to live. I was a little hesitant about the Beacon, because I had been in there years ago. And I mean over 20 years ago, and it wasn't very nice. But it has REALLY changed!!! It's VERY nice!!! Let me break it down from the big picture to the small details.
Location: Perfect for me. I love the Upper West Side. I spend most of my time in Central Park (walking, photographing, running, bird watching, people watching, going to the zoo, bike riding, exploring, etc). My goal when I lived in NY was to live as close to Fairway (a unique grocery store) as humanly possible. The Beacon is right across the street. And the Beacon has kitchens in each room, so I actually did buy food at Fairway and prepared it in my room. But back to the location description. 75th and Broadway is the epicenter of 3 amazing cupcake shops, a famous bakery, Fairway, Zabars, Juice Generation (great smoohties), Harry's Burritos, Big Nicks, Shake Shack, the Park, three excellent gyms and a couple great yoga places. If your vacation plans don't revolve around food and exercise, you'll think that list was strange. But for me, it was perfect. It was like being home. I should also mention Lincoln Center and the Natural History museum are very close by. All the museums on the East Side are walkable through the park. If you're more into the downtown scene/night life or Broadway, maybe it's not for you. But hey, the subway is RIGHT THERE, so transportation is convenient.
Hotel: The lobby, staff, elevators were all superior for a non-brand hotel.
Hallways: Carpeted, fairly quiet, wide and clean.
Rooms. Bright, clean, newly remodeled, spacious, welcoming, pleasing finishes, comfortable. Each room (as far as I know) has a kitchen (with dishes/pots and pans),a safe, tv, free wifi, extra blankets, good toiletries, ironing board, luggage rack, comfortable beds and pillows. Our room was amazing. It was room 2112, on the 21st floor. It was a corner room with a view I could NOT keep my eyes off of. One window faced Central Park and the East side. One faced downtown. We had views of Times Square, The Chrysler Building, Broadway (the street) and the Ansonia-which is a gorgeous building, and on the East, views of some of my very favorite architecture (the San Remo!), Citicorp, the Sherry Netherland and that glorious Park. We slept with the blinds open. We watched the sun rise over the buildings, We couldn't stop looking or taking pictures. I had lived in NY 10 years, in many apartments, and I never had a view like that. 
BTW there were also windows in the kitchen and Bathroom.The one in the bathroom opened.
I will ALWAYS stay at this hotel when I'm in NY. I think, over the years, I've stayed in almost every hotel that city has to offer, including the Plaza and the Waldorf, and this was by far, my favorite.

title: “Lives up to The Four Seasons reputation.”
text: Great venue for business meetings; good food; and, comfortable rooms. The fitness center is well equipped but limited when large groups convene. The group rate is reasonable - perhaps, a bit pricey/over valued for its individual rates.

title: “Delightful, Pampered Stay”
text: This was our first stay with a Four Seasons property, but it won't be our last. Friendly, attentive staff and impeccable, spacious, clean and comfortable accommodations, including a spacious bathroom, sitting area and soft, king-sized bed. Courtesy car service was a big plus as well. We will return to the Four Seasons.

title: “Mixed Feelings”
text:
Granted, the luxury hotel market in Houston is somewhat limited, but I was pretty disappointed in the Four Seasons. The valet staff were very prompt and friendly, so I do want to give special thanks to them because they made a wonderful first impression. 
The lobby is nice. There is something very retro about the chandeliers, but it somehow works. Overall, I would say the lobby is quite impressive and in line with the purported star rating of the hotel. The exterior, however, is very very 70's. There is absolutely nothing they can do about that, but you cannot help but notice it.
The desk clerk was quite pleasant. I cannot remember her name, but as with most people at the hotel, if you were interacting with them in person, they delivered top-notch service. My biggest complaint about the service, and it is a big one, is that they NEVER answer the phone promptly. I literally would let the phone ring 30+ times, still with no answer. So then I would try housekeeping, the concierge, room service, anybody...same thing. For a five-star hotel, it is pretty unacceptable for this to occur. One time - sure; things happen. This problem, however, existed throughout my entire stay. 
As others have noted, there are certain elements that make the hotel appear quite dated. The elevators are ancient and should definitely be at the top of the list for upcoming renovations. The tracks on the drapes in the room were also quite old. The rooms were pleasant, but not extraordinary. I had to switch rooms, however, because the first one had a very awful musty smell. We were then moved to a room on the level with the pool. It was okay, but it felt very dark. Also, the pool area looked a bit worse for wear. I can imagine how luxurious this place must have been in its prime, but that prime has certainly passed. 
One thing that I find absolutely unforgiveable about this hotel, though, is the ice machine room. They need to remove all signage relating to the ice machine and make guests call to have ice delivered. I had the misfortune of going to fetch my own ice, and I walked into a room that was filthy, covered in trash and clearly (hopefully) not meant to be seen by guests. I was so shocked. For any hotel above 1 star, I would expect more.
The location is great, and you are able to get out of the city quickly, but I was surprised at how dead Houston is at night. Clearly, this has nothing to do with the hotel, so I am not trying to make any connection there; I was just surprised. I would think it might be wiser to stay near the Galleria if you are looking for something other than just a business stay.
All in all, the stay was "ok"; nothing really wow'ed me about this place, so I guess that disappoints me, but I tend to find that to be the case with Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton properties. They rely a lot on name recognition and branding, but they always seem to fall flat for me, both in terms of service and design/aesthetics.

title: “just as expected, with a few kinks”
text: This hotel is absolutly stunning. I stayed for romance and romance was what I got. Yes there were a few kinks like front desk mistakenly giving my room key to another guest, broken toilet tissue holder, small hole (possible where art was) in a wall, and late room cleaning, but the hotel was very comfortable and sexy. The staff as a whole was very helpful but there were times when I felt like some of the guys attempted to cross the line and become flirtacious.

title: “The best ever!”
text: We satyed to celebrate our anniversary. All of the staff did a great job. The hotel was very nice. The front desk was very welcoming Erica especially. All of the Valet team did excellent! Maktar was such a sweetheart. This place was perfect. We look forward to another stay.

title: “100% Amazing!!!”
text: My stay was great. Hotel Icon's staff gets 100 out of 10 stars. Everyone went above and beyond to make our stay amazing. The valet staff Great!! All of The staff at the front desk did a wonderful job taking care of us, especially Erica. I loved it. Can't wait to go back!

title: “Classy hotel in fashionable neighborhood”
text: We stayed at this hotel twice-once while making arrangements for our daughter's wedding and the second time during the wedding. We had a block of rooms reserved for the wedding. We immensely enjoyed our stay both times. The hotel staff was very helpful thought the process starting from making reservations to paying of the bills. We got rooms overlooking the plaza which was wonderful. The staff was flexible through out trying to meet our special needs. We will stay there if we visit Houston again.

title: “Too much money for nothing”
text:
Too much money for nothing. The gym is ridiculous, breakfast is only fruits and cereals. No bread or other stuffs. Ridiculous
The room is very big. But it is dark and you can get same size rooms in other hotels for the price you would pay there.
Only expensive restaurants around.
Definitly I would not come back

title: “Contemporary”
text: Wonderful hotel, free convenient parking. The rooms are spacious, with a view of the courtyard. Breakfast is included and full of healthychoices. The pool is off to the side, but it is on the roof. Local eating establishments, theatre, and trendy shops surround the hotel. It is one of my all time favorite places to stay.

title:
“Great place to stay...value for
Stay is off the chart!!!”
text:
First the location is great...2 mins from IH10. It also is surrounded by nice, trendy shops; good food variety within a walk and drive of 10 mins. It is also easy to get to 610 If you want hit the galleria area as well as hit Katy Mills (large indoor mall). 
Accommodations have always been superb. This place if envisioned should be on a coastal hill in southern California with views of the pacific...type of hotel. The dark floors, modern furniture and beds with very comfortable pillows make this place great. Never had an issue with anything. They also have free breakfast! Whenever I visit Houston, 8 of 10 times I stay there.

title: “Comfortable and spacious, helpful service”
text:
Attending a business conference at the University. Room was large with two comfortable beds and adequate pillows. As is common in many hotels, the chair and hassock were too stylish to be practical and comfortable, useless to try to sit, put for feet up and read. Would take a balancing act. Desk and work space were superior. Nice in room Lavazza coffee set up. Bathroom was superior. Spacious, clean. Shower was a water saver head, but worked pretty well.
I asked for late check-out and this was not a problem, also the screw came out of my reading glasses and when I asked at the front desk for some tape (yes, nerd-style) to wrap around the hinge, surprise, the desk clerk pulled out a tiny optical screw-driver. Be aware, parking is $15 a night for guests, but some room rates include this. Bar and restaurant food and drinks were good and service was very pleasant, but both a dinner and breakfast the wait staff seemed to disappear for 15 minutes right when I was ready to pay and leave. Might have been light on the staff. Hotel is a circuitous 6 miles from Hobby, but GPS worked well, signs are poor. Beware the security line at Hobby can be 40 minutes during mid-afternoon.

title: “Nice room and price but has Bedbugs”
text:
This is the second time I have used this hotel and booked this last time because of the perceived value.
Room is updated and staff is great ...but woke this morning to bedbugs. I travel alot for work and this is the first time I have seen these in person.
 Staff went right after the room but... They are present :( so beware upon checking into the room.

title: “Beautiful Hotel---Will return”
text:
Hotel was perfect. Recent remodel last year, rooms great, very, very clean bathrooms, glass showers, big vanities. University was closed, so ate in the ground floor restaurant. The french fries alone are worth a trip back. $15 cab ride from Hobby Airport.
Had a single room for my niece who was starting school, suite for my wife and me. Stay here....you'll like it.

title: “Nice hotel on the University of Houston campus”
text: We only stayed one night while visiting the University of Houston, but it was very enjoyable. As part of their program, there are many students involved in running the hotel. They were very courteous and helpful. It is a very nice hotel and well worth staying at if you are visiting the campus or just in the area.

title: “treated like royalty”
text:
We were greeted upon arrival by a nice man named Sonny, He assured us that we would be able to use the shuttle to and from the Houston International Quilt Festival. That was a load off our minds as 5 women trying to get a taxi might be a hard thing to do.
We had a wonderful continental breakfast consisting of bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, waffles, bagels, toast, Danish, fruit, yogurt, cereals, oatmeal, a juice bar with orange, grape apple and cranberry, They had 3 kinds of coffee, teas, and bottled water.What more could you ask for
Although the weather turned a little cold while we were there, the hot tub was a welcome comfort on tired, achy feet upon returning from the Quilt show.
The desk clerk Jo was helpful. One of our ladies had forgotten her prescription and John was nice enough to take us to a pharmacy to get it refilled.
The beds were awesome with 4 pillows, down comforters and sheets that were not only soft but smelled sooooooooo clean. We had bottled water and cookies left for us each day.
This hotel is very clean and I would recommend staying here to anyone.

title: “Great Hotel and Great Service”
text:
This hotel is one of my favorites! The staff is first class and will help you with any needs, whether you forgot your shaving kit, need a restaurant recommendation or need a ride to a restaurant they are there to serve you.
When staying here make sure you get to know Sonny. Sonny has helped my business colleagues and me with dinner recommendations and then given us rides to the restaurants. 
This is a great hotel for business, is close to downtown and is in the area they call mid-town, which appears to be going through a bit of a renaissance. Many restaurants, bars, cafes, coffee shops etc near by. I will be staying here again.

title: “Great Downtown Location!”
text: This is by far the nicest Best Western I have ever been to while on vacation. My husband and I stayed here on a weekend get-away for his birthday. The woman working the front desk was super polite and helpful - she called us a cab and even made dinner reservations for us before our concert at the House of Blues! The service was much better then I thought we would get. The room was HUGE, super clean and very comfy. We got turn down service twice while we were there and found our mini bar restocked each time we came back to our room. When heading back to Houston, I will make it a point to book this hotel.

title: “Great location, service and atmosphere”
text: Just back from my third trip to Houston and the Hilton Americas. This is a lovely hotel with nice restaurants, rooms with almost every amenity I want, and a terrific location, especially if you are attending a convention. The convention center is just across the second floor bridge, a handy amenity in a downpour! Just on the edge of downtown, I think, as well. Easy walk to several nice restaurants and this year, a deli/grocery called Phoenicia, which I am about to review as well. My only gripe with the hotel is no complimentary wifi in your room. Yes, you can camp in the lobby to catch up on your email, but WHY do more expensive hotels charge for wifi when every ordinary motel in the country offers if for free? Costs the big guys a star IMHO!

title: “This Hilton was a great Hilton”
text:
I stayed here for a work conference. I was deeply impressed by the cleanliness of the entire hotel from lobby to hotel rooms. The rooms were comfortable too and up to An updated Hilton hotel.
The service of the employees at the hotel was great with even the bar manager coming to apologize when there was a wait for our beverages. Too be honest it didn't feel that long of a wait to begin with. Prompt and courteous service at all times.
I also had breakfast at the hotel with buffet. Average food and nothing that spectacular. 
The location of the hotel was right beside and attached to the convention centre. There wasn't really that much around to walk to or do around the hotel. House of Blues is a couple blocks away.
Overall, I was really impressed with the hotel considering that Hilton can be at times inconsistent. This Hilton was a great Hilton.

title: “Always a great stay!”
text: I recently spent 12 nights at this hotel, something I do every year for Quilt market and Festival. I feel like an honored guest each time. I am greeted by name by the front desk staff and those who work in the Executive lounge. Every member of the hotel staff I come in contact with is pleasant, efficient, and seems genuinely interested that my needs are met. Brenda, who manages the Executive Lounge in the morning, and Erica, food service staff there, are top-notch people. I look forward to next year's visit.

title: “Delicious breakfast!”
text:
The hotel was nice and clean! The beds were adjustable, which was pretty cool. Just make sure you adjust both sides, cause if you roll over it feels weird!
Breakfast was incredible! They had fresh strawberries, pineapple, and melon that you don't see at many hotels. 
We were visiting with the basketball team, and the hotel was perfect for our needs.

title: “A Nice Surprise”
text: This Hilton Garden Inn delivered beyond my expectations. The rooms are comfortable (nice size, good work desk, etc.), friendly staff, there is a small but good gym, a good breakfast service, happy hour and a full service restaurant in the evening. Each of the experiences was top for this class of hotel. If I am in that area I will definitely return to this hotel.

title: “Service beyond expectations!”
text: I have been at a multi-day business meeting here and I was pleasantly surprised by the very high level of service! The employees are very engaging and exceed any expectations for service. What a great team! The hotel is also a wonderful value. I would be happy ro stay here again.

title: “Awesome Service”
text: The front desk was efficient and friendly, the bar was the perfect way way to end a busy day, the music and drinks were very good and the concierge had excellent service, the suite was charming, only request would have been more towels.

title: “Wonderful Hotel”
text: Iroquois Hotel Staff went out of their way to make my our stay enjoyable. The location of the hotel let us be in the threatre district without all the noise. The staff was so friendly and helped with all aspects of our vacation. Don't be afraid to ask help, from threatre tickets to great spots to visit.

title: “Decent stay........”
text:
Stayed here for the first time as hotels I usually use in NYC were all full. Thoughts :
-great location. On W44th between 5th and 6th, a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station and a few mins walk from Times Square, but W44th is not the noisiest street so good from that perspective
-boutique feel. It's small in NYC hotel terms, and perhaps lacks some of the facilities as a result, but is also friendlier than many. Staff are great.
-the room I had was inward facing and had no view at all (a wall obscured part of the window - could not even tell what the weather was like - seriously). However, this also meant the room was quiet - not always the case in NYC
-room was pretty small. Was fine for me travelling solo but would've been cramped if shared. I don't know if this was typical of rooms in the hotel but I suspect it was
-room was otherwise v nice. Quality fittings, nice linen, new-looking bathroom with good shower and Molton Brown toiletries, with a small desk and HD TV and a mini bar in the room
-wifi is free in this hotel which isn't all that common in NYC - could save you $20/day
-room service menu is very limited, although food (from Triomphe, the French Restaurant at Ground Level) is of good quality and the service was quick when I ordered. First room service menu I've seen that had no club sandwich and no fries !
-the hotel has a tiny gym and sauna. The gym, although v small, has enough kit in decent condition for a sensible workout and it was unusual to see anyone else in there
-I didn't visit the bar but it looked lively and has a good reputation for cocktails and atmosphere
-free coffee in the lobby
Perfectly nice place to stay for a few days on business and very conveniently located, but room size, gym size and limitations of room service menu means I'll probably revert to my preferred hotel next time, although I wouldn't mind staying here again. Rates are comparable.

title: “honest and good quality”
text:
perfect location for city explorers! 
very good bed and bed linen. clean rooms but not spacious.
I was surprised about very good breakfast in hotel. room service really fast and no mistake.
reception service friendly and helpful.
 I didn't see that hotel is realy good before.
but you can see how hotel getting older and some details are broken down.

title: “Great hotel, great staff!”
text: The Kimpton Eventi is a great hotel, very nice rooms with nice views, a nice location, and great staff. One thing that seems to stand out with Kimpton hotels, and especially the Eventi, is the friendly,knowledgable, and professional staff. I was on a short business trip, accompanied by my wife. Right on Sixth ave, and an easy ride or walk to shopping and Times square. Our room was on the 17th floor, with corner views looking up and down Sixth Ave. And the bed was so comfortable, better than home. We had a great time, and can't wait to return.

title: “Perfect ending”
text: We have travelled a lot over the past 7 years and this has got to be one of two spectacular hotels we have ever stayed in by far. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. It really was the perfect ending to our holiday..

title: “Very nice hotel”
text: Just got back and really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are exceptionally large and the bed was extremely comfortable. Staff very helpful. They are very flexible with late check out. Looking forward to going back.

title: “Great location, would stay again, but...”
text:
Just finished a long weekend stay at the Andaz. Prefer to stay at Hyatts for reward status, and now have stayed in all Of the Hyatts in Manhattan. Observations:
1) Check-in was a mess. The Andaz philosophy of iPads around a central desk area without a formal checkin desk can be hectic when busy, but there wasn't any line. Stood for a minute with no assistance, eventually an associate looked up from computer screen to see us, but then helped a guest who had a question, who showed up at desk after we arrived. Associate who checked us in informed us our room wasn't ready, acknowledged our Gold Passport status, took our cell phone #, took our bags. Was told at checkin something about 'I'm checking to see what the best room we have available is', and then told quickly before whisking our bags away that 'we have a King room available for you'- same category booked. If no upgrades available, I understand, but don't treat the category booked as a favor. 
2) No perfect location in Manhattan as you may prefer both uptown and downtown locations, but hotel is almost in perfect spot. Easy access to Grand Central and 4/5/6 line uptown or downtown, easy walking distance to all midtown locations. Difficult to get a taxi during weekday business hours, there is no dedicated cab stand for hotel. Saw our associate outside the hotel when returning from unsuccessfully trying to hail a cab on 5th Ave, he offered to wait on 5th to hail a taxi, we laughed and said that wouldn't be necessary.
3) Received ph call that room was ready about 10min after checkin. Room was right across elevator-- normally not a fan of this at all but hotel was very quiet during stay, no noise issues. 
4) Room is spartan, no wall ornaments/pictures but I don't mind this, not staying for artwork. Large desk with plenty of outlets, one large outside window with automated blind coverage, large cream couch for lounging/clothes, comfy bed. Plenty of room for luggage.
5) Fridge well stocked, I suspect most adults won't drink the fruit soda, there is room in the fridge for your own beverages if you move things around/out. The food is a bag of pretty good potato chips, two ok chocolate squares, and an incredibly salty granola bar.
6) TV has a lot of interactive/smart features but only a smattering of HD channels, not an issue for me but if you are watching a lot of TV in your room it is a bit puzzling.
7) Bathroom is poorly designed. Two sinks, plenty of space, but two extremely bad design choices. First, no door separating toilet from rest of bathroom. I am not a fan of modern/Mandarin Oriental-like open or exposed bathroom spaces, and not having a separate WC is really not negotiable, esp for those guests sharing a room who aren't involved. Second, the shower stall is really poorly designed. The glass partition, like in lots of European hotels, doesn't extend far enough to stop splashing into the rest of the bathroom. The shower is a rainshower head with high ceilings, I'm not that tall or large but there is no way to stop water from splashing over and on to the small ledge separating the stall from the rest of the bathroom floor, you have to wipe the ledge mult times during the shower to control the water from spreading. In addition the corner between the glass partition and the back wall of the shower has at least a 1/3 inch gap between them, so water splashes through that gap and in the corner behind the sinks. More wiping down, and that area has already started to have discoloration and wear of the tile and grout. It's inconvenient, and adds to maintenance costs, and will eventually require renovation before it was necessary. Hyatt must spend millions on new room prototypes- I don't understand how this wasn't recognized as a problem. The Andaz Wall Street has similar shower sizes but not the same problems.
8) Good coffee service in the lobby. Some fruit in baskets but no other snackies. Good selection of papers.
9) Didn't go to gym or spa. No room service ordered.
10) Went to restaurant for Sunday breakfast. Priced similarly to other hotel restaurants. Crowded, had a wait for a table. Breakfast was excellent, recommend the mini brats.
Prob the first choice for Hyatts in Manhattan because of location. I think the Andaz Wall Street has nicer rooms, service, restaurant, 48 Lex comparable in quality for usually less money. Will see what the anticipated Park Hyatt brings. Overall would stay again.
Contact me for any questions. Happy travels!

title: “Very good but......”
text:
The andaz hotel is a very good hotel.
Pros
Clean
Kind staff
Great food 
On 5th ave
Great gym 
Near the empire state building
Cons
No 'proper' jam at breakfast. You get conpot!
Poor lighting in cuboards
Overall a very good hotel

title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
text: Because the hotel was booked, I was upgraded to a suite. The room was magnificent and the bed comfortable. The valets and bellboys were very friendly and polite. Personalized service was provided every time I used the phone. I felt totally pampered my entire stay.

title: “What a great experience!!”
text: I had to make a visit to Houston to see my brother who had a stroke. I came on a red eye trip 7am - so I was very tired. Jo ( front desk lady) let us check in early and let us get some breakfast. The rooms were so spacious. The hotel made us feel right at home. We will be back!!

title: “My favorite hotel in Houston”
text: I very much like this hotel - the grandeur of the lobby takes me back to my favorite hotels in Asia such as the Shanghai Grand Hyatt and the Shangri-Las in Pudong and Nanjing. The rooms are nicely appointed and the spa and pool facilities are a treat. The Executive Lounge is great - breakfast selections (particularly the fruits) are top notch and all the staff are friendly and accommodating.

title: “FAST SERVICE, GOOD FOOD, GREAT PEOPLE”
text:
We were at the Hilton Americas of Houston from 10.28.2012 through 11.5.2012. It has a Cafe. I had been at this same hotel last year and frankly, the service was terrible. I and my friend waited 20 minutes for a waiter to come around..completely mind blowing. Especially for a Hilton. This year, I'm pleasantly surprised. The crew of the Cafe, beginning with Juan A. Gererro, Cafe supervisor, Yulia Putnam, Beverage and Food, from St. Petersburg, Russia and our incredible waiter, Yorbel, from Kazakhstan, turned this situation around. What a lovely shock! I love Hilton's because they truly are a UN, bringing people from all parts of the world together. Yorbel was a treasure. He is intelligent, personable, a really good hearted person. Yorbel is in his
3rd year of accounting at the University here in Houston. Further, he's already passed his first CPA of three. He's one of those people who is going to go FAR in life, be very successful. He's a waiter at the Cafe and what ashamed...his talents are so much more. I hope Hilton will consider him for a position in Accounting and utilize all of him, instead of a tiny part of him. Needless to say, we came back for lunch nearly every day and were given swift, prompt service with a genuine and sincere smile. Honestly, it felt like a family was welcoming us. And that's why I'm taking the time to put this on TripAdvisor. It was an incredible experience. Beyond the norm. The Hilton management has really chosen fine people in a service industry that sometimes falls very short. The food quality was never a question. It is excellent, served hot and is creative. Our favorites were the Tortilla soup, the crab cakes and the quesadilla. Dinners were always hot and delicious. My particular favorite was a caesar salad with slices of flatiron steak on it. We had room service, which has always been speedy--20 minutes after the phone call. The food arrived hot. I'll be coming back to the Hilton Americas next fall for the IQA, international Quilt Association, show. And I'm really looking forward to eating in the Cafe again, instead of dreading it as I did in 2011. Thank you, Juan, Julia and Yorbel. You all rock! :-)

title: “Great experience at this Hilton”
text: From check-in to check-out our experience was delightful. The staff was the most courteous I have ever experienced. Rooms were as requested. They handled crowds very pleasantly and supplied a buffet to accommodate many dinner guests. Best of all, there was no long wait for elevators. Hilton Honors lounge very well run.

title: “Nice & comfortable stay at Hilton Garden Inn- Energy Corrider”
text:
I have been staying at the Hilton Garden Inn for the past several months while in Houston on business. I find the rooms, hotel staff, food and amenties to be top notch. 
The front desk personnel (along with the director of sales- Ms Marcia) are very attentive to my needs. The check in procedure is made simple.
The rooms are very comfortable (great bed) and the ladies that make up the maid staff do a wonderful job in cleaning and supplying my rooms.
