The restaurant prepares very good food. Breakfast can be made to order- cook staff always willing to make ur favorite. The wait staff does a wonderful job and make me feel very comfortable. And the dinner menu is also very good and has a good array of different choices.
The excersize room is sufficient for a good workout and the pool is heated. Also the pool area has a nice size jacuzzi.
I thoroughly enjoy my stay here.

title: “Nice and clean”
text: Hotel appeared fairly new as everything was in good shape. Room was comfortable and quiet. Bathroom very nice. Everything was clean. Definitely would return.

title: “ALWAYS AWESOME!!!!!!”
text: I have stayed here just about every week for the last two years and I have to say it just keeps getting better (if that is possible) From the minute you walk through the door at the beginning of your trip until you walk back out at the end, you are "home" The rooms are always clean, quiet and housekeeping keeps it that way every day, the lobby and bar are so inviting, that you can't help but hang out and relax. The most important part is the staff, what can I say....5 diamond all the way! Lisa ( one of the managers) is always smiling and talking with the guest as if there is nothing else that needs attending too, her staff Rita, Kelly, Angelia,Valerie, Jeff and all of the others are great, they certainly understand and embrace the concept of "customer service". I have never reviewed a hotel until now, when a co-worker showed me a review someone else had done on my HGI titled "DON"T STAY THERE", all I can say is there has to be more to the story than what was shared. I bet if you asked the staff they would tell it differently. I just wanted everyone to know that this is the best hotel in the area and I can't wait to check back in next week.

title: “Great hotel”
text:
Took my mother to NYC for a few days. For the price of a room we got a suite which was charming. It was not large but we had privacy and the pull out couch had a memory foam mattress which was very comfortable. KIng bed looked great, but I let my mom use it so I can't testify to it's comfort. The rooms while small were very nicely furnished and we had both a great shower and a jacuzzi tub in our bathroom. There were 2 TVs, which we did not really have time to watch. We were 2 blocks from Time Square, and a block from 5th and yet the street is quiet. There's both upscale restaurants and bars on the block and a coffee shop and diner. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant, so I can't comment on the food, but the bar was jumping. 
Not only would I stay here again, I will be disappointed if I can't get a good price and thus stay elsewhere. This was a really nice place and we got a very good deal.

title: “wonderful pool”
text:
The lap pool is on an upper deck and has a beautiful view of downtown. The pool has plenty of room so I could get a good swim in while others were using the pool. The deck outside the pool area is a comfortable place to chat or read a book. 
The hotel staff are helpful.

title: “Great location!”
text:
We stayed here for the Comicpalooza and got a great deal on rooms for the convention in a hotel that's otherwise pretty pricey. We were able to get our room upgraded to a corner room which has windows on 2 sides, the view was amazing! This hotel is clean, beautiful, huge and in a great location.
We ordered room service once while we were there, it was expensive of course, but fantastic. Our room was clean, the bed was very comfortable. The pool area is also very nice, they have a huge indoor pool on the top floor with a jacuzzi area as well, and an outdoor sundeck with great views of the city. 
Sadly this hotel was booked for the weekend we're planning to go back for the Texas Ren Fair, but I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Only advice is to look for their specials and packages, you can get some really great deals, but the hotel is worth the extra money!

title: “Enjoyed the getaway.”
text: The Hilton Americas is a great weekend getaway destination with plenty to do both on-site and nearby. The staff is always incredible and the food in both the main dining room and Spencer's is excellent. A taxi ride is $6.00 anywhere downtown and the hotel has a shuttle that is available most of the time. Management is very attentive and when I was last there Bill the Food and Beverage Manager and Morgan in the lobby bar were great and remebered us from a previous visit.

title: “Save energy.”
text:
Save energy, gas, by staying nearby your meeting.
HGI is close to many companies on Energy Corridor I10, and Dairy Ashford, Eldridge.
Comfortable, good value, reasonable Internet, food ok. Maybe a little boring if you stay more than a few days but, hey, we're here on business.

title: “Great value for money”
text:
Unlike some hotels in the area it is great value for money.
Rooms are spotless and a good size.
Perfect alternative if you can't get into the sister Hotel Embassy suites.
Has a good steak restaurant minute walk away.

title: “Hilton Garden Inn Houston Energy Corridor”
text:
Clean rooms. Great breakfast.
Friendly, attentive reception desk especially Brandi.

title: “Excellent Hotel - Early a.m. Departure Difficulties”
text:
I travel to Houston for business purposes and love this new hotel. The 024 lounge includes a modern waterfall with plenty of separate furniture groupings for discussions with your co-workers. The lounge staff are very friendly and willing to work with you on obtaining items off the menu even after regular kitchen closing time. The room and bed were great and the in-room safe the perfect size for multiple laptops and other electronics. 
The only issue occured when I needed to check out at 4am to catch a 6am flight out of Houston Hobby. The hotel no longer prints the check out docs and puts them under the door and I had a 15-20 min search around the lobby and the first floor to finally find a front desk attendant to process my departure and make it to the airport in time.

title: “Top Notch Customer Service”
text: I recently booked a room at this Hilton for just the day, as I was in town for business. The staff was so accommodating and friendly, both before and during the stay. They expected me by name and made me welcome. They were polite and helpful. The hotel was very nice, but I have to say I was most impressed with the hospitality of the staff. They were just outstanding!! I will definitely be recommending this hotel to everyone I know! I was raving about the hotel to everyone I knew as soon as I stepped out the door.

title: “Great Hotel and wonderful rooms”
text:
I got married at the AD Bruce Religion Center on the U of H campus and I stayed here the night before my wedding with my bridesmaids. I was shocked at the beauty of the hotel when we entered. It is chic and elegant. Not exactly what I expected on a college campus. The staff was friendly and accommodating. 
The room, however, was the best part. We loved the asian inspired decor throughout the hotel but we gasped at the elegance of the room upon entering. The following day I had hair and make-up people in and out of our room but the staff were very understanding and allowed us to check out late. 
The one con about the hotel was the paid parking. This is common for hotels near downtown, but I never have understood why it is necessary.
Great hotel! I would definitely stay there again.

title: “Block of Rooms for wedding”
text:
Tried to set up a block of rooms for my wedding in Houston. The guy said yes to our weekend and then when we told him there was an event in Houston he said that he would have to honor the first response and they would keep the block of rooms. 
A few days later we received an email from them saying they could not honor their word. 
MORAL OF THE STORY: If you're blocking rooms for a wedding, get it from them in writing before you leave the place, their word means absolutely nothing.

title: “STAY-CATION”
text: My hubby and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend, it was PERFECT in every aspect! From the check in process, in which we recieved two complimentary drink vouchers for the Monnalisa, to the speedy check out process. There is plenty to do while staying at the Sorella, within the Centre area everything is literally in walking distance, from resturants, bars, shopping and even the movies. The parking can get kinda of crowed but with a little patience, you'll sure to find a good spot.

title: “Anniversary Stay-cation”
text: My wife and I spent the night and had dinner at Bistro Alex. Positives: bed, service, Monnalisa Bar, location. Very romantic, sexy feel. The only negative experience I had was at Bistro Alex. I ordered the Airline Chicken, which came out under-cooked...which I could have easily forgiven...until the manager came out to tell me why I was wrong about the chicken. The rest of the staff, including the executive chef, worked very hard to make the situation better, so that took some of the sting out of the manager's response. Overall, good experience. We will be going back to the hotel, although we'll probably eat somewhere other than Bistro Alex.

title: “The hotel is beautiful, cultured and inspiring to look upon with nice people and things.”
text: The hotel is gorgeous. The room is spacious and well decorated. The hotel staff which I interacted with (Erica and a few others like the vallet guy) were warm and welcoming. I only wish the view was a little better and that it was easier to find. The hotel is connected to a restaurant which is on the face which the address is for. So it was confusing getting there. (The drive in entrance for vallet is on Congress.)

title: “Wonderful stay at Icon in Houston”
text: We stayed just one night and wanted something near the Wortham Center. The hotel is in a landmark Houston building that once was a bank. (Look for the vault door behind the reception desk.) It's stylish and comfortable, with an impressive bathroom, as other reviewers note, and it was exceptionally quiet. The building has that solid and well-constructed feel of older buildings, with beautiful moldings and arched doorways. The service was the best I've had in a hotel in a while. And the drinks at the bar are worth trying, too--they make interesting mixes with Texas-made gin and vodka. Try it!

title: “All the quality and attention a 4 star deserves.”
text:
Outstanding service. Good attitudes exhibited by all.
The room was large and very nice. I do wish there was recognition that one size does not "fit all" for bathrobes and slippers.
Free wifi has been noted as very important to travelers (57% on a recent survey I saw).
I misseed my newspaper the first day and so you need to comment on this when you check in. I realized there was a door tag you need to put out by 1 AM but this did not work either. You need the paper you want in your profile. Tell them when you check in.
I would like for it to be easier to get coffee and tea during the day rather than having to order it from room service.

title: “Hotel Beacon Review, UWS NYC”
text: Great location, wonderful rooms - great size for the city. Wish they had loyalty reward program as we plan to stay there 5- 6 times a year for the next three years. Having kitchenette with Fairway Market and it's great food right across the street is very convenient and helps to keep costs down.

title: “Does what it says on the bottle”
text:
We were very happy with the location of the hotel: on Broadway, 2 mins from a main underground line, 3 blocks from Central Park and surrounded with delis, groceries and good value restaurants.
Two restaurants we would recommend: Citrus and its sister restaurant (name escapes me for the mo) on 75th /Amsterdam and 76th / Amsterdam respectively were great.
We asked for a high room with views and thats what we got. When we woke up the first morning, it was fantastic to open the blinds to see New York city in all its urban glory. It was really exciting and we could not wait to get going. As soon as you step out, you are right in the centre of everything you came to New York for.
We understand the beds are new since a year and we slept like babies which was fantastic because we suffered no jet lag (from UK) and I was found I was sleeping for 10 hours! (unheard of). Not only are the windows sound proofed but the hotel is in a quiet zone where traffic must resist honking and beeping at certain times of the night. For the 4 nights we were guests, we did not hear a single sound from the corridors either last thing at night or early morning which is highly unusual. Probably the best sleep I have had overseas.
We had a kitchenette which is ok - one can knock up a bit of breakfast but nothing too complicated. There is no worktop space and about 3 cooking utensils with enough cutlery for 2 people. The fridge is great for fruit, eggs and juice. A coffee machine is provided and a kettle.
Everything worked like clockwork. The only comment would be that I missed having a bar, a communal area to fall into after a long day's walking the great streets and sights of Manhatten. Loved to have come back for a cocktail and communal chat with other residents, etc. 
The hotel is billed as a 3 star but we can categorically say the bedrooms are 4 star. We understand a bar is being added from Feb 13 and I hope this does not mean they gain a 4th star allowing the rates to increase. Its not cheap for a 3 star but NY is not cheap. Its a great hotel and good value as it stands.

title: “Stylish, modern hotel..... disappointing service”
text:
This hotel tries hard to be stylish, modern, funky and top of the range.... it almost succeeds.
Architecturally, the hotel is cutting-edge. Public spaces are sophisticated. Rooms are stylish with state-of-the-art fittings. Huge bathrooms have a real wow factor with black stone and red marble treatment. Complimentary snacks in the rooms are a nice touch. Location is great - directly opposite the New York Public Library.
Unfortunately, we found the service to be well behind that we experienced everywhere else in New York. Check-in with the state-of-the-art island check-in system was confusing and slower than a normal check-in arrangement; it was surprisingly hard to get served in the ground floor bar area and it took the hotel two days to find and deliver to us package that had been sent to us using UPS express service.
Some more active management intervention is needed to get the best out of the enthusiastic youthful staff and turn this from being a great building into a great hotel.

title: “Perfect”
text:
General: 
stylish and modern hotel in great location
Location: 
great location on 5th Avenue, only minutes away from Empire State Building
Rooms: 
Great rooms with all amenities in place (free WiFi, espresso machine, free water and sodas, TV etc.) and somehow sound proof windows (which is important with hotels in NYC)
Bathrooms: 
good sized bathroom with beauty products
Service: 
Excellent service, friendly and helpful staff
Price/Quality ratio: 
good value for money

title: “Beautiful apartments ...but unprofessional service...”
text:
We ve been in one bedroom apartment which was really very nice and comfortable. Great if you are not paying for the service of a five star hotel as well.. unfortunately we were paying the service of a five star and this is not the case of The Setai Fifth Ave. 
Too many details... too many things that were not what they should have been...
1) There s no mini bar, there s a fridge but it has just water.
2) Nespresso coffee is not refilled every day and no creamers available. 
3) there are important glitches of communication and some people at the front desk are rude. We were given a 4 o clock late check out at the time of the check in. A man from the front desk called at 3 to ask when we will be leaving, we informed him about the scheduled late check out and he said he didn t have that information, he called again 15 minutes after and raised his voice (that was too much!! ) when we told him for the second time that everything was approved already. When we went downstairs at 4 we were told by a different person that our late check out
was perfectly clear in their computer and that there was no problem... so we didn t understand why such a rude person called us for no reason.
4) The concierges are kind but not professional and confusing, they don t even know the dining 
schedules of their own restaurant AI FIORI
5) The AC is noisy and disturbing
6) We found wonderful antislamming devices in the cupboard drawers in the kitchen but ironically all the rest of the doors slam constantly with unexpected violence(the apartment door, the door to the toilet...)
7) The key card don t work well on the elevators and it takes a lot of time to be able to access your floor..!
8) Room service is quick, good, but the waiters need professional training.
I mean, the hotel decor and room sizes and views are lovely, the food is very good, and the people working there (with the exception of the rude one from the front desk) seem really nice, but some professional training and supervision would help a whole lot if The Setai wants to be closer to a 5 star... it is still far away... the service needs a lot of improvement.

title: “It's the Place to Stay”
text: From the front desk (Elisabeth and her colleagues), to the doormen, concierge and the butlers, the experience at The Chatwal is second to none. All of the amenities of a large hotel in a boutique atmosphere. The bar servers are experts at making any drink. Whether traveling on business or with my family, this place delivers an excellent experience.

title: “The place to stay”
text: Just spent 2 nights at this hotel, the experience was wonderful from the minute we stepped out of our cab. We had a junior suite with a butler. Although it was on the 4th floor facing the street, it was unbelievably quiet. The room was nicely appointed with an exceptionally large bath. The service was perfect including the lobby bar and dinner in the Lambs Club. This has definitely become our new go to hotel in NYC, look forward to our next visit.

title: “Wonderful hotel!”
text:
From the welcome at the front desk, to the last moment, this stay was great. Service was prompt, always with a smile and pleasant greetings, everyone let us know they wanted to be of service to make our stay tops. My room had a view of the Empire State Building and it was lovely at night. Room very clean, best hotel bed I've had in a very long time, bathroom luxurious...amenities high quality.
 They take making women traveling alone feel comfortable and safe very seriously. 
Concierge service guided us to fabulous steak house and gave us easy directions.

title: “Great location”
text: The Iroquois is a very nice small hotel right off 5th Avenue but away from a lot of the street noise. The lobby is small but charming and has a small library with two computers for guest use. The staff is very friendly, and coffee is always available at the entrance. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. After all, when you are in New York, you aren't in your room very much, so it really doesn't matter if it's small. We did have somewhat of a view of the patio with tables and chairs of the building next door, so at least we didn't have a brick wall two feet outside our window, which we have had in Mahatten hotels before.

title: “Excellent NYC hotel!”
text: Stayed at the San Carlos for 3 nights in a one bedroom suite this July. I chose this hotel after countless hours of Internet searches of NYC hotels and I have to say I am extremely happy that I did! The room that we had was clean and spacious with 1 1/2 baths plus a small kitchenette area. The hotel staff is helpful and friendly. Location is great for midtown. We were able to walk to Times Square, Central Park & Radio City! Plus, breakfast is included with your stay! My only problem was that I had to leave so soon!!!

title: “It wasn't our first choice but it turned out to be way better”
text: Our original hotel was over booked and they offered us the San Carlos as a replacement. Did we luck out! Great location - close to all the action but not as busy/loud at night. The room was large and clean. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Free breakfast was another benefit our original hotel did not include - a nice benefit and money saver. I quite enjoyed the coffee - me being a coffee snob this speaks volumes. Go ahead and book this hotel it won't disappoint!

title: “The Perfect Location in NYC”
text: I have traveled all over the world and stayed at some of the finest hotels in Europe, Asia and Austrialia. A hotel needs to be truly special to impress me enough to leave a review. The Sherry is such a place and I can not say enough about what a wonderful experience it was to stay there. The location is second to none, the service is superior and the various rooms in which I have stayed are always a joy to come back to in the evenings. My most recent room had a full kitchen so leaving in the morning was often delayed by the enjoyment of a coffee and bagle breakfast overlooking the City. Exceptional bedding and pillows, responsive thermostat and virtually sound-proof windows (I can not say enough good about the sound-proofing) made for a good night's sleep. Very much looking forward to our next stay and would not even consider another hotel in New York City.

title: “perfect stay!”
text:
what can I say? attentive staff, homey feel, perfect location, big rooms,tastefully furnished.
the hotel is very quiet, no lobby , plenty of " habitues'', you will be called by your name and feel very welcome and taken care of..I really thank all of the team who made us feel at home and particularly jackie who upgraded one of our rooms without us asking when she saw we had a lot of luggage..only downside my stay was too short!

title: “OMG - What a fabulous hotel!!!”
text: We just got back from a trip to Houston, Texas - we stayed at the Westin at Memorial City. All I can saw is "WOW" - from the start of our stay until when we left - everything was beyond perfect. The most impressive of all was that the employees there were friendly, helpful, genuine, nice, - you get the picture. I was blown away with their friendiness. The room - OMG - the room was the best room we have ever stayed in!!!! It had everything. Talk about spacious - the bathroom had a bathtub AND a shower and was enormous. The TV was enormous - the bed was heavenly!!! Everyone was so helpful.....I went to the mall - which was just across the street and there was a shuttle that took me and when I called for them to come back and pick me up - they did so quickly. We were treated like royalty. The hotel is close to just about everything you could need - I hated to leave there - it was SUCH a wonderful stay. The front desk employees were so helpful and they were friendly and nice - I just cannot say enough good things about this hotel. When we go back to Houston - we will always stay at this Westin...it is the most amazing hotel ever.

title: “Very Nice!”
text: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Memorial City as a quick get away and loved it. We had a few problems booking the room (we were transferred to the wrong extension twice) but it was worth it. Upon arrival Valeria was efficient and helpful. She gave us a fantastic upgrade which was far away from the convention that was going on. The view of the Houston Galleria area at night and the sun rising in the morning was great. The infinity pool on the 18th floor was nice but we didn't try it out due to the rainy weather and LOTS of people. The view is very nice! The pool is heated so it could be used most of the year. The section of the 18th floor where the pool is located is covered but open on the sides to the elements. The 24 Grille, located in the lobby is a little expensive but comparable to other hotels. I recommend the Orange Blueberry Pancakes for breakfast. Yum! This Westin provides a free shuttle to nearby businesses and restaurants. They do charge for parking so the free shuttle is the way to go. CityCentre is about 15 minutes away and a great place to meet friends, shop and eat out. BUT Memorial City Mall is within walking distance, just across the street from the hotel. They are connected by a 3rd floor sky walk. The only problem we experienced was the hotel is next to a hospital so there are sirens at various times. It didn't bother me (sound sleeper), but my husband heard them during the night.

title: “Delighted!”
text:
Very pleased with the hotel! Check in was smooth, room decor is new, bed is ultra comfortable, toilet is bright and clean, shower is very spacious! Also, 2 bottles of water were offered free in the room every day, a kind gesture!
Hotel is linked to a big mall by a link bridge on level 3. The mall has a good selection of shopping and restaurants. Level 2 has a Hertz car rental, this is convenient for car pick-up and return and after hours return is possible.
I had breakfast and dinner at the hotel restaurant. Quality of food and service are good, much better than the restaurants at the mall. Would definitely recommend the hotel restaurant.
I will definitely return to this hotel if I am in the area.

title: “Unbelievable Value”
text: I found this hotel while searching for a place to stay near the University of Houston for a football game. What I found was an absolutely beautifully appointed hotel and rooms. The motif is Asian and it is carried through to the room appointments. It was very reasonalbly priced and has free internet in the rooms. It is a great bargain for location to the University of Houston.

title: “Ok....but understand it is a TRAINING HOTEL”
text:
I will begin by stating this is a TRAINING HOTEL for Hilton. Upon entering, the sign states the hotel is apart of the Hospitality School for UofH. So with that in mind...
We stayed one nite at the hotel. The rooms were recently remodeled, and are decent. Nothing super, but nothing awful. There is enough space to get around and feel comfortable for a stay. The beds are a bit firm, but I donot mind so much. The bathrooms are clean and bright, however, a bit tight. WiFi was free and worked well. It seems the common areas of the hotel are still under some sort of renovation.
I would recommend eating someplace other than the hotel restaraunt. We waited 45 minutes for hamburgers and pasta. The explanation was the burgers are made fresh and take time. This is un-acceptable, as we noticed a few others come in, order, served, and left. The manager took care of this issue, as we were clearly un-happy with this. The following morning's breakfast was very week....at best. I advise finding another eating establishment (there is a food court accross the street) if staying at this hotel.
Again, I must state this is a training hotel, with students working the hotel and restaraunt. The service is spotty, depending on the students working. However, the students need the experience on the do's and donot's of hospitality industry.

title: “Wasn't ready for guests...”
text:
I stayed at the hotel in April and they were still finishing up their remodel. Why they opened the hotel to guests...I'm not sure. They were not ready at all. I'll start with the good feedback: The rooms are nice, they have great lounge chairs to relax in and the bathrooms have a great amount of counterspace. The beds are comfortable (as most Hiltons are) and there is plenty of closet and drawer space. 
Now for the rest...When I walked into my room, it had such a strong odor of paint, there was no hot water..for all 5 days I was there! I would crank the heat up in my room in the morning so the cold shower would actually feel good. The internet connectivity was terrible. It was hit or miss all the time. When I arrived in my room, there was no room service menu, no directory, no bottled water. The light in the closet wouldn't go off when you closed the door, so I had to disconnect it so I could sleep at night. Only one elevator was working, so it took forever to get up to your room or back to the lobby. The bathroom mirrors in the conference space are enough to make you dizzy. I'm not sure who ever thought their design was a good idea, but it's like being in a clown house. And the main restaurant in the hotel was still closed.
I'm sure once they work out all their kinks and get everything fixed and opened, it will be a nice hotel, but I'm not prepared to take a second chance on it. They should have waited another month or so before opening back up to the public...big mistake.

title: “Trendy place, great service!”
text: This is a beautiful hotel on the outskirts of Houston. The staff is really friendly and we even got upgraded! There are plenty of fun options for food and drink in the area and it is a great place to stay with friends and family. We really enjoyed having so many food options close to us and there are even some shopping areas as well so people are entertained. The rooms are large and comfortable and everything still feels new. The only weird thing is that we found a woman's black underwear on the floor in our bathroom when we got there, although everything else looked very clean. Not sure how to explain it, but it didn't seem worth complaining about at the time. The beds were really comfortable and we loved the style of the hotel. Bistro Alex had pretty tasty food as well and the bar in the lobby played live music at night. I didn't know that Houston had such a fun scene such a distance from everything in the loop!

title: “Best business hotel in Houston”
text: Stayed in a lot of hotels in Houston over the years, but this hotel has what I am after when on business and working in around the i10. Good breakfast with fruits, museli, etc, great rooms laid out for business and pleasure, easy access wireless, local restaurants. The staff are attentative- but they are everywhere in Houston - and the atmosphere is great too, Makes working in Houston a bit more fun.

title: “Modern clean but a bit cheap looking. Good location”
text: I love the location of this hotel, Friday night is fun and one can walk to various restaurants and bars. The rooms are spacious, and modern, very clean. But furniture looks a bit flimsy. Breakfast is great, lovely pastries and fresh fruit.

title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
text:
I travel every week and have found that many "full-service" hotels are simply overpriced, while offering nothing but mediocre food, dirty rooms, and indifferent staff. I wasn't expecting much from the Hotel Sorella, but had business at the hospital nearby so I thought I'd take a chance. 
Wow! I was completely taken aback by the beauty of the hotel, the friendliness of the staff, and the total comfort, convenience, and fun offered at this hotel. The rooms are clean, well-designed, and very comfortable. The bathroom is well-lit and spotless, and the towels are so high quality as to be heavy. 
The food was outstanding...I only had room service, but it was efficient and tasty. Yes, it was pricey, but that's to be expected. 
As others note in their reviews, part of the fun of this hotel is the "plaza" and shops at the base of the hotel. All sorts of dining options (Ruggles for delicious salads and healthy food!) and some unique shops. 
The only slight difficulty is the parking garage which, although it gets good marks for being attached to the hotel, is always jammed with cars. So I valet parked, which isn't cheap, but oh well. 
I will definitely stay at the Hotel Sorella again. I loved it, and I'm hard to impress when it comes to hotels.

title: “Cozy Boutique hotel in downtown Houston”
text: I was looking for something a little different in downtown Houston and came across the Hotel Icon (a member of the Marriott family of properties). It's located a little north of the central business area of downtown. The room I had was on the small side - but very nice and well appointed. The in-house restaurant was great, whoch was a good thing as there are few choices within easy - and safe - walking distance. But this property was very nice, friendly and helpful staff, etc... I will definitely stay there again.

title: “This is a great place to stay with outstanding service!!”
text: This was my first time staying at this hotel, and I would definitely come back. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful (especially Erica), the hotel rooms were very nice, and the food was great! I definitely recommend this hotel!

title: “Wow, it's Perfect in Every Way!”
text: It's really terrible when you can't find anything wrong at all with a Hotel. LOL So comfortable that you will not mind the parking fee which is a little high but excellent service. It is located in an amazing part Of Houston, TX (Theatre District). So many things to say and do just in a 3 mile radius. Which they do offer a Shuttle, but you will want to walk (if you can) because their is so much to see and do! I was very surprised that the room didn't make me miss my bed at home. It is a renovated Bank, which the Vault is directly behind the desk where you check in. The standard room is awesomely large and beyond what you would expect for the cheapest room they offer! I really want to see the other room's (Deluxe), and the security is the best I have seen Yet! You will not be dissapointed with this Hotel because it is a Vision in Itself!

title: “Magnificant Hotel and Service!!!”
text: This is a lovely hotel with extremely polite and friendly staff, including the valet and baggage staff. Our room was clean, smelled wonderful and felt like a cozy little home away from home. The beds were super comfortable and we didn't wake up feeling sore or achy. The view of the city from our room was pleasant. The bathroom products they provide are L'Occitane, which was much appreciated since we forgot our bath soap and body wash. We were very pampered and the check-out process was smooth and quick too. We look forward to our next visit to downtown Houston so we can have another stay at Four Seasons Hotel in Houston!

title: “Service Excellent; Pool Area Nice”
text: It's the service here. Compared with other Four Seasons some of the physical/decor wow factor not there but the Four Seasons bed, L'Occitane bath products made it comfortable. Large room just needs a little color-pizzaz to freshen. Pool service excellent and area was very relaxing and more resort like than a downtown hotel property. Good gym. Very prompt service retrieving car. I went for a party nearby but can see this would be a good choice for business trips. It was also an incredible value-- weekend rate was very very low and enjoyed the deal

title: “Outstanding Service and facility! If you want to be taken care of this is the place in Houston!”
text:
Outstanding! Great staff, service and facility. Convenient to other restaurants as well. You will be taken care of here. Staff goes over and beyond from the doormen, to maids. The location to other restaurants is good as well.
Can't go wrong on this hotel.

title: “Very good hotel for business”
text: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel in downtown Houston last August. The staff is exceptional and all our needs were attended to promptly. Comfortable, clean and conveniently located to everything downtown and surrounding neighborhoods. Our room was very big. Only negatives were that the carpet looked a little stained in places and the counter in the bathroom was very low. I am 5'8" and it hit me mid-thigh. Only one sink for this large room. There is a nice salt water pool and the gym is great. Very big with lots of treadmills and even a separate weight room. This is a late 70's hotel that has been kept updated. Not much to do for kids around there or at the hotel except for the pool, so it is ideal for business travelers.

title: “Pretty average when things get tough”
text:
We experienced the Beacon for three weeks, before and after Hurricane Sandy. The hotel was fully booked when we arrived and the attitude showed. Management did a great job of keeping guests informed immediately after the storm. 
My major criticism is the front desk attitude towards guests when they know they have so many wanting a room. Prices were jacked up by $50 a night after the storm (supposedly because of the Marathon). The TV system throughout the hotel was brushed off and our problems were only addressed when we pointed out that we were not 1 or two night guests but in fact there for weeks. I understand this will be completely fixed mid November.
I agree with all the positive comments most reviewers have made, this is why we had chosen the Beacon as a return visit. Location could not be better. A real positive also is free WiFi throughout the hotel. Would we stay again? Yes.

title: “Another Great Stay at Hotel Beacon”
text:
Thank you again to all at Hotel Beacon. From initial contact with the reservations team our complete experience could not have gone any better. We were forced to make numerous changes to the initial booking - mostly as a result of the unforseen and unfortunate weather conditions - each and every change request was met with complete kindness and co-operation.
We made the very good decision to extend our stay in the end so that we could make the most of the fabulous city of NY.
The location is perfect and a lovely stroll from Central Park. There are lots of shops and plenty of dining choices very close by. Right accross the street is 'Fairways' - a most fabulous market.
The rooms are very spacious and spotlessly clean. Staff are exceptional.
Our only one disappointment is that we had to leave.
I would highly recommend this hotel and will definately be returning myself again when I visit NY next time - hopefully in 2013.
Thank you to all at Hotel Beacon

title: “Great place to stay with kids”
text:
Rather than repeat what everyone else has been saying, I will just say "You can't go wrong". Great location near Central Park, Upper West Side shops and food, and not far north of midtown. Plus, it was ideal during Hurricane Sandy - dry, secure and no power cuts!
Oh, and just to address some earlier complaints: wifi worked perfectly, no bed bugs, and the elevators worked fine too.

title: “Excellent hotel & location”
text: We stayed at the Hotel Beacon, in the Upper West Side residential area pf New York for 5 nights last month at the start of our coast to coast rail journey. The hotel is well positioned within a short walk of the 72nd St Subway station so it's very good base for getting about. We can recommend buying a 7 day metro card, we certainly got our monies worth and it saves the hassle of buying tickets. The hotel has helpful & friendly staff, the concierge is particularly knowledgeable. We had a very comfortable and spacious room on the 25th floor, with a small kitchenette, fridge etc useful for preparing breakfast. There is no restaurant or bar at this hotel but there are plenty of both within a short walking distance. We can recommend Viand next door to the hotel for breakfast and 'Citrus', an excellent Thai restaurant just round the corner (great sushi). There is a huge Fairway supermarket across the road and an amazing (if expensive) delicatessan next door to that. Central Park is 2 blocks away, it takes about 20 minutes walking briskly. All in all The Hotel Beacon is a lovely & welcoming place to come back to after a day of heavy sightseeing and we will definitely rebook if we ever go back to New York.

title: “Fabulous”
text:
The hotel is very artsy and beautiful! From the moment we walked through the door the staff were very friendly, helpful, and accomodating.
I was traveling with family, so we stayed in a suite. I love the views of the Empire State Building and the library across the street.
I loved the foot bath in the shower, and the food and snacks in the mini were complimentary.
The staff left us store our luggage and we were able to check in two hours early.
While we were waiting for our room, I loved being able to hang out in the library with artsy books to look through and listen to the beautiful, telaxing music playing the background. I felt so peaceful that I actually feel asleep in one of the chairs in the library.
You can't beat the customer service at this hotel. When we take an trip to NYC, we are going to stay at this hotel.

title: “Outstanding”
text:
Truly a fantastic stay! All the agents working at reception are courteous, professional and knowledgeable. My room was spacious and modern. Loved the hardwood floors and sleek design. And the bathroom.. just WOW. Great fixtures, amazing lighting and space, space, space. 
I dined both in the restaurant and through room service and the food was amazing. Fresh ingredients and beautiful presentation.
Do yourself a favor... and STAY STAY STAY HERE.

title: “Best hotel stay!”
text: We checked into the Andaz in a rush after checking out of the Yotel two days early because the Yotel has no customer service and is not meant for people who want to sleep. The Andaz staff were so kind and accommodating. They stored our luggage until our room was ready and allowed us to access our room two hours early. We got an upgrade to a beautiful corner suite with a balcony. We could see Time Square, the Empire State Building, and the WTC tower from our room in addition to the beautiful library across the street. The staff were responsive to all our needs and we slept great at this place. This is our new favorite hotel and we hope to return soon and to try the other Andaz hotels in the country.

title: “Nice style, needs some work on substance to be excellent.”
text:
The pluses:
The bed was big and comfortable, with nice pillows. The rooms have
good high ceilings and lots of storage space. The location is very
central - although would not be first choice if you want the more stylish parts of town. There are lots of complementary snacks and drinks, both in
the room and the lobby. The bathroom (actually a shower room) was very
stylish. The staff were very enthusiastic and friendly. 
The minuses:
Lots of the design involved style over substance. The overall room
space was large but was divided up in a way that left a 2 foot gap
between the bed and the wall/ television. The safe was behind a pull
down shelf that then projected out requiring the arms of a large
primate to reach the back of the safe itself. There was a kitchenette
but only one glass (in a room for up to four people). The cutlery was
in a drawer with a flat front. It did not open with a spring
action,you had to coax it open squeezing your fingers between the
bottom edge and the dishwasher (yes) door below. There were the usual
signs about hanging up your towels. The double sink had one small
towel rail on one side and nothing on the other. There were two more
hooks for towels which left none for the bathrobes. One of the room
divider doors did not close properly and the doors to the bathroom
closed with enormous creaking and banging sounds however carefully you
tried.
Overall we wished we had not chosen to pay for this much space when
lots of it was badly used. 
When we left we were told that they could not get any taxis and were offered a town car to Penn station for $35. We took that and later got billed for about $140 dollars. It was refunded after an email and phone call but the email confirming it was being refunded apologised for the delay in replying but not for overcharging us in the first place. Not the best customer service.

title: “Mixed feelings: not as good as the hype but not totally bad and def worth a stay”
text:
Hi stayed 4 nights in october.
Chose setai NYC because of LHW and TA reviews.
Sadly too much hype and too much attitude- but its all relative.
You are in NYC after all and well its all relative - baseline prices up baseline service down.
The bad:
- terrible attitude in their signature restaurant ( ate their once and only once
Like most upmarket establishments in USA gratuity automatically added- for those outside of USA we find this weird. Anyway gratuity added and then they ask you for a tip at time of sign off)
-maserati house car - is it real
Never saw it and was always busy when asked
-erratic service 
-poorly maintained rooms- leaking shower, chipped stained bathroom, blocked toilet
- erratic personal assistant service
- odd location - middle of fifth ave busy but really middle of nowhere
Neither uptown midtown or downtown.
The good:
- nice size rooms rest of world but ok great size rooms in NYC
-front desk staff mariana very helpful and just delightful
Helped us in crisis getting out when there was a parade blocking fifth ave and very much appreciated.
- great spa
- great gym but errratic gym service from attendants
- amazing head massuer at spa was best massage ever had
- responsive manager who responded promptly and appropriately when concerns raised
Summary: a very good property
Def worth a stay
Expensive but huge rooms for NYC
Good spa
Great gym
Good LHW acknowledgement
And in time of need were very helpful
So yes I will def be back
-
-

title: “The Best Hotel in NYC”
text:
If you are those who think we got to be cheap and is only there to sleep, this is not for you!
I visited NYC now, and I noticed that finding a good hotel with a reasonable price, in the city is not an easy task! They are usually expensive and the rooms are minimal, and the care is not always compatible with the value of the fare paid. Or he has a reasonable fare, but is a fleabag! Difficult is not it? Cheap and good Hotel in New York I never found!
How I use always lot the Leading Hotels of the World, I looked at their relationship with one that was a promotion for the duration of my stay in the city, I found the The Setai Fifth Avenue.
Located at number 400 Fifht Avenue, the hotel is really very good, the staff is amazing, polite and efficient, and I'll tell you one thing, I'm picky! Mrs Sohee and Kimberly concierges are perfect! It is well located, new and has large rooms.
The amenities are excellent! The Breakfast is perfect!
On this stay I have only praise for this hotel. Will be back soon! Wait for us!

title: “Magnificent hotel !”
text:
Magnificent hotel with professional and friendly staff. As we were staying 7 nights they upgraded us to a bigger room.
The very large bed was extremely comfortable and the same with the pillows. 
The Nespresso machine, the complimentary drinks and water in the room all free of charge were a lovely touch.
The free wi-fi was excellent too.
The location within walking distance of Empire State Building, Times Square, theaters, etc. is just terrific.
The Setai Hotel made our stay in New York unforgettable and we definitely would love to return to this hotel !!!

title: “Fantastic 1st impression of New York”
text:
Stayed here in Nov '11. The front desk staff gave a very warm and inviting impression to someone on their 1st trip to NY and the US. They were very helpful in providing information and ideas about the city.
After arriving, I thought I had a problem with the bathroom sink, and called for someone from maintinence. Someone come up very promptly and was very helpful (turns out I was just an idiot and didnt turn the tap correctly). 
Location was fantastic. Less than 200m from Times Square, but you wouldnt even know it til you walked outside. Rooms were very quiet.
Will definately stay here again.

title: “The Chatwal surpasses expectations”
text: We had heard that The Chatwal was a wonderful hotel, and our stay in late August surpassed my high expectations. An absolutely perfect experience, check-in to check-out. On arrival, we received immediate attention -- friendly, professional and most important for me, non-stuffy. Front desk service was genuine and helpful. Everything about our room was terrific - super comfortable and quiet. As close as this classy boutique hotel is to Times Square, we did not hear a peep from the outside world. We look forward to getting back to The Chatwal again, and when we return, hope to dine at the Lambs Club restaurant (big fans of Mr. Zakarian and the Food Network's Chopped).

title: “Good experience for mother/daughter”
text:
The bed was comfortable, bathroom amazing, Kimpton Rewards coupon for minibar and the free WiFI appreciated. Also, the air in the room was amazing, but I could not have the air conditioning/heat on at night because something in the unit was rattling. So could not use as white noise. 
We purchased room via Snique Away and I bought the 12th floor deluxe view room. We made one special request and that was that we only had one night in NYC and it was my daughters first time, so said we'd love the Empire State building view BUT I am also very sensitive to sound (thus the view room purchase) and specifically requested not to be next to elevator and clearly stated that our sound avoidance needs trumped desire for view. So despite this request, we ere put in a room directly in front of the elevators, not backed up to them, so I thought maybe it would be OK and didn't request to be changed. As it turns out, the elevators were not the problem; we were also next to some shaft and in the middle of the night there was this awful banging sound that went on and on. I don't know if it was pipes or something else changing temperature, but it woke me up and kept me up for quite some time. We were on the 23rd floor and directly across from the elevator, 2305 I believe. If you want a quiet room, I would ask to avoid being next to any shafts, elevator or otherwise.

title: “Awesome hotel”
text: My friends and I took a girls trip to NY and stayed here. We had a phenomenal experience! The staff made us feel very safe. They were friendly and very knowledgeable. The rooms were great!! The spa was amazing! This is definitely a place I would stay again!

title: “If okay is good enough”
text:
Lobby and elevators smell like bad cologne...they have candles going on. that might be it. Checked in..had to have someone come up and change the clock time. I could not figure that out nor could he. Television pixilating...front desk did not even know the hotel offers HBO and not knowledgable on a thing. Maintenance fixes tv...MY comforter had holes in it...feathers flying everywhere. Had to ask that be replaced. Room service not bad...not great food. Pass on the happy hour and breakfast they are comping....so mediocre from the wine..and taste of food...complimentary for a reason. Checking out. I cite that Room Service is not on the bill. Sorry they can't help but I will need to call later and get an accurate bill. Guess what I am traveling on business...they made this hard on me and easy on them. I need an accurate receipt to expense...again...easy on them hard on me. Clock never worked right..not lit...could not see.
Again, people great...bathrooms good. But if you want a tub, be sure to ask. funky contemporary shower. 
If you want okay...this is it.

title: “Great, affordable, hotel with good location”
text: What people want out of a hotel is differs with every person, but if you want an affordable, clean, QUIET hotel in NYC with great proximity to Times Square and Penn Station, this is it. I'm often in NYC for work and this was by far the nicest hotel I've stayed in. The room I stayed in was perfect. No view but I was thankful for a corner room that blocked out much of the city noise. I've never stayed somewhere in NYC that was so quiet and was able to get a good night's sleep. I travel to Penn and this hotel was within walking distance, which I like. There are also great restaurants nearby as well as a nice one in the hotel. I got free breakfast because I booked online and the breakfast was delicious, seriously. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous. I will definitely stay here again. Highly recommend.

title: “perfect”
text: could not ask for a better stay. location, room, and staff/service were exceptional. early check in and even earlier bag drop gracioulsy accomdated. upgrade to the excutive suite for a real treat and they throw in a City Pass what a great deal.

title: “A GREAT PLACE IN MY”
text: this is a smaller, lowere=rise hotel with great staff and great service. Teh rooms are small and the place is somewhat expensive for NY, but they usually have deals at reasonable prices. Great location.

title: “The San Carlos exceeded all expectations!”
text: After consulting tripadvisor and a couple of other websites, we selected the San Carlos Hotel for a recent visit to the city. Traveling with seventeen and nineteen year old boys, both over 6 feet tall, we needed all the space we could find. The San Carlos did not disappoint! We were in a spacious two room suite for a fabulous price. The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and just one block from the nearest subway station. We could not have been more pleased. The service and accommodations were top notch. We will be back soon!

title: “Great Location & Staff”
text: The staff were excellent. The location couldn't have been better. We received excellent recommendations on restaurants, etc from the desk staff. Suites are very spacious and very clean. I would definitely stay here again when in NYC.

title: “Nice stay in San Carlos NYC”
text:
We stayed in the executive suite in San Carlos in June 2012 with our two kids. 
The location is very convenient to visit most well known spots of Manhattan. The room was big enough to accomodate four of us while kids slept in the sofa bed. The room was clean and we were satisfied by the housekeeping. 
The continental breakfast (very basic though) and the wi-fi in the room is included in the price. The reception staff was also very helpful. I think considering all above, the price-quailty balance of this hotel is excellent. I fully recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Manhattan.

title: “Astoundingly clean, fantastic staff”
text:
For those less familiar with Manhattan, the lodging options are overwhelming. With so many choices, it should be easy to find a myriad of properties that suit any number of requirements. But for me, it was a struggle to find the perfect location, level of amenities, and acceptable price point for a recent 4-day trip w/ my hubby. 
I ruled out the overpriced hipster boutiques, the stuffy landmarks, the dinosaur properties, the tourist-laden chains, and the too-good-to-be true rates in less desirable parts of town. After that, I wasn't left with nearly as many options as you'd think.
Then I found the listing for the San Carlos. I loved that they're one of the very last independently owned hotels in NYC, catered to a European clientele (which usually means non-fussy rooms, immaculately clean spaces, and competent staff), and the Manhattan East location; the area was convenient to RCMH where we were seeing 2 nights of concerts. The fact the rooms looked large vs the price and came w/ mini fridges and microwaves (somewhat unusual for Manhattan) sealed the deal. But looking good on paper doesn't mean in reality it will pan out.
I'd made my reservation months in advance, over the phone, for a certain room type that the young lady I spoke to had 100% guaranteed. When I called week-of to confirm my reservation, I was told there was a possibility I might not be able to get the room type I'd been promised. Irked, I referenced the original reservation but they explained sometimes these things happen. True, but I hung up the phone and considered rebooking elsewhere; the phone rang back moments later and the young lady I originally spoke to apologized, said they would upgrade me at no fee and get me what I needed no matter what, and really acted as if she valued my business. I'd expect this from a 5 star property, but at a under $300 a night spot, it was refreshing. Customer service is a dying art. The staff at the San Carlos is old school, in the best possible, most refreshing way. 
Upon arrival, an easy cab ride from Penn Station, the lobby was sparkling, the bellman exceptional, and the check-in flawless. It's not the fanciest place, more suited for the upscale business traveler (though I spied many families too) but the cleanliness, a huge factor for me, absolutely perfect. And my room, a King, was HUGE. Not huge just by NYC standards, huge by any hotel standard. 
The view from our particular room wasn't much to see, but windows that actually open in both the room and bathroom were a bonus. The amenities were lovely, towels and robe divinely soft, the bed linens super comfy, and a pant press a blast from the past. The room was modern, simple, understated, private, quiet, and cozy. Everything worked too. Which should go without saying but unfortunately is often not the case in any class of hotel. The real silverware, plates, and glasses provided were a great compliment to the microwave and fridge.
 Did I mention that housekeeping is outstanding? In my years of travel, I've never seen more competent housecleaning. 
My interaction with the staff was easy peasy. Items I needed were sent up immediately, dinner spots/phone numbers provided, and I was always greeted with a smile. I dreaded check out because it meant our experience was over. I literally had zero complaints during my entire stay except that the Indian restaurant next door (that serves as the San Carlos' complimentary breakfast serving area and then offers their own menu for limited room service too), is simply not up to par with the rest of the hotel.  If 24 hour American cuisine room service is a make it or break it deal for you, that's about the only reason I'd consider finding a different hotel. Seeing as Manhattan has every food conceivable, most of it deliverable, I easily overlook this.
Quiet rooms, pleasant interiors/halls, a great business center/overflow lobby, elevators that were kept constantly cleaned (check the Ritz for smudges, lol), and staff that valued my business means that next I'm in NYC I'm making a beeline right back here. Sure, there's more glamorous or hip spots, but for the level of service vs price and comfort, there's a reason this is a hidden gem amongst your hundreds of NYC hotels. Part of me doesn't want the secret to get out.

title: “Odd experience”
text:
I found this quite an odd experience. The hotel is part of an apartment building so doesn't have the feel of a hotel at all. Check in was fine and my bags were delivered quickly to my room and I was shown how to work all the various things in the room. Complimentary drinks in the fridge is a real bonus. However this was about the only time any of the staff actually spoke to me. Each time I got the lift up of down I was greeted with hello or good morning but try to engage the attendant in conversation and it is an up hill battle. I thought maybe it was an isolated case but it happened with all of the attendants. I did come down in the lift once with one of the residents and the attendant didn't draw breath so I assume that hotel guests are just to be tolerated to defray the cost of maintenance on the building.
Same with the staff at reception and the door man, each time I walked passed I was ignored. I just put it down to the fact that I was just not Upper East Side enough and fankly having said all this it didn't really bother me.
The rooms are large and beds comfy. As far as amenities I could not complain. Bathroom was a bit tired and needed little things fixed and an upgrade. Location is also great with everything nearby.
I can tick it off my list but I wouldn't stay there again.

title: “New York City's best hotel by far!”
text: The Sherry is the most wonderful "quiet" in the middle of the NYC storm...outside the great hustle and bustle...inside the Sherry is total serenity. We feel so warm and welcome from the minute we step out of our car in front until the minute we pull away from the curb...simply amazing experience every time!

title: “My home away from home!”
text: The Sherry is by far my most favorite hotel. My business takes me to New York often, and it's such a pleasure to always be spoiled rotten! From the flowers, chocolates, handwritten note of thanks from the manager, to porters bringing me some microwaved popcorn! This is old school service, I count the days for my next trip.

title: “There are better hotels out there.”
text:
Good points – 1. excellent location (1minute walk to Central Park; close to shopping areas and the Met); 2. Spacious room (in NYC standard) with comfy bed and soft beddings; 3. Complimentary refreshments in room, which is a nice touch of the hotel.
Bad points – 1. The housekeeping staff took away one of my tops by mistake. People make mistakes sometimes so I was not too upset that it happened. I was unhappy as I had to explain the incident to the reception 3 times before someone actually acted upon it – very disappointing given it is supposed to be a 5-star hotel. The receptionist told me that housekeeping could not find the top but then it was later returned to my room with no note of apologies or explanation; 2. Hotel staff in general was polite and professional but some of them (esp. lift attendants) were too stiff – you just couldn’t have a chit chat with them – not very friendly; 3. There was some cigarette smell lingering for a couple of days. When we rang the reception, they said it was the smell of the cleaning liquid. (really? Seriously? Are you kidding me?!!); 4. Bathroom is bit old and dated. Took 10mins before hot water would come thru every evening.
The hotel staff recommended a diner called Gene’s on the 60th – absolute gem – must try. The hotel also offered 15% off if dine in “Bottega del Vino” next door. Please I beg you not to bother – the food was ok but all the waiters were so up themselves and arrogant and rude, which made the whole dining experience pretty awful. 
Most of the guests at the hotel seemed rather miserable and took themselves too seriously, maybe this is why staff were not very laid back. Gotta loosen up, people. (just my personal opinion)

title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL!!”
text:
Being that we live in Houston, we typically don't stay in local hotels, but decided to stay in Houston this weekend and have a "mini-vacation".
From the time we checked into this property yesterday afternoon and from the time we checked out this morning was fabulous. Awesome, front office staff.....Angelica checked me in and was so friendly as well as the other people working the front desk.
They have delicious cookies in the evening....be sure to get some.....
Being a Hilton Honors Diamond member, you are offered a complimentary cooked to order breakfast. It was delicious...very fluffy omelettes, delicious bacon, bagels, danish, french toast, etc......so many choices and the coffee very fresh tasting too.
Even if you had to pay for the breakfast, it is only $10.95/per person, which is so reasonable for all the choices that you are offered!!
Wonderful bed and great shower. Room had a lot of light and we really enjoyed our stay!!

title: “It's big and it's cold”
text:
Despite sleeping on an exceptionally comfortable bed each night for FIVE days, what I have taken away from this stay is that the Hilton Americas likes to keep the hallways at Arctic temperatures and could use another tower of elevators. Each night I would wait forever for an elevator back to my room, often having to pack in so tight that I practically had my nose in a gentleman's armpit. Seriously, and I'm not that short. And finding the stairs???? Well, I was on the 18th floor.
The bar is actually great. I loved the dessert menu and the Harvest Martini. I also thought the gym facilities were good. It's easy to navigate the hotel and the conference/ballroom facilities are very nice. There is a lot to be said for the rich foliage throughout the hotel and the dramatic Chihuly fixtures. The restaurants leave a lot to be desired if you are a vegetarian. Neither option is particularly noteworthy. I recommend heading across the way to The Grove.
Their SPA ought to have its own page. And receive 5 stars. In desperation, I called the front desk to see if there was a salon. YES! It's the same price as getting your hair and nails done in Downtown Boston. But this is also an EXPERIENCE. I adored Luci, the manicurist and former entertainment reporter. She was personable and my nails haven't looked this good in ages! AND then Alonso.... this hair stylist is a gem. He immigrated here from Columbia over 40 years ago and has a way with hair. He took off 6" of my overgrown locks and I can assure you that when I return for the annual Houston trip he'll be cutting my hair again.

title: “Outstanding Service”
text:
My buddy and I stayed at the Best Western during the Final Four. It's a couple of blocks from downtown Houston. However, the location turned out to be ideal as mid-town is also a couple of blocks in a different direction and it has a terrific collection of bars and restaurants. Sonny who works at the front desk will be happy to drive you to any of them.
The free breakfast was outstanding.
Jo (who really runs the place) could not have been a better host and made sure that all of our needs were met. They probably don't pay her enough given that she goes out of her way to make sure the guests are happy.
Bottom line: the hotel met our needs

title: “The Best Value Choice in Houston”
text:
I stood 4 nights at this hotel with my mother (shopping trip).
Before booking a room for four nights at the Best Western Downtown Inn and Suites, I read some reviews about this and other hotels on the downtown zone (Doubletree, Marriot Courtyard, etc.) and I'm glad to say that all of the good comments that were written about BW are true.
The hotel is located right oustide the Houston downtown, but outside doesn't mean far. The few times I decided to walk to the downtown, a 15-minutes walk took me to the heart of it. If you aren't a walkiing person, the shuttle of the hotel will take you anywhere within the downtown area or even to the midtown if the distance isn't too far. 
The rooms are clean, spacious and very well equipped with an iron, a coffee maker, the basic bathroom amenities, satellital TV and as many bottles of water as you can drink. It also has a microwave and a small fridge, which makes your stay even more comfortable. Vending machines are avaiable to get microwave food and sodas whenever you want.
The best of the hotel is the staff: Jo, the front-desk lady is just lovely and helpful. Sonny (the multi-task guy of the business) is always ready to give you a ride on the shuttle or to recommend you the hot spots to hang out at night. There is a third front-desk guy called Don, that kindly took us to a Walgreen's like 20 blocks away from the hotel in his own car, as the shuttle only works from Monday to Friday. That was something nice I didn't expect.
The breakfast is simple but effective: waffles, sweet bread, cereal, milk, coffee, eggs, sausages and bacon. They serve the same breakfast everyday, so try to "rotate" your choices if you are staying more than one night and you don't like to have the same everyday.
The hotel is totally non-smoking. If you are a nicotine addict, DON'T DO IT INSIDE the rooms. During our stay, we saw two guys being kindly kicked out of the hotel after paying a $ 250.00 fine for smoking inside.
The only thing I didn't like were the pillows. They were too large and squishy and it's the only kind of pillows they have, so if you are a "firm" pillows user like me, you will have to bring yours. 
In conclusion, if I ever visit Houston again, I will stay here for sure.

title: “Lovely hidden gem”
text:
I love this simple hotel! Sparkling clean with extrodinarily comfortable beds tucked into spacious rooms. 
It clings to the outskirts of down town and offers free shuttles for the out and about. The staff is efficient and carrying...they fussed more than I did when I thought I lost my phone. 
 The entire hotel is a non-smoking oasis.

title: “Traveling for business: Westin covered all the bases”
text: I recently traveled to Houston for a meeting at the hotel. The food was good and the service was generally good, but slightly indifferent at times (the only reason I didn't give it the top rating). The large room (this is Texas after all!) didn't feel cramped at all. In addition it was very clean and orderly with an I-pod radio you rarely see in business hotels. The robe in the closet was a bonus for relaxing after a long day of meetings. I really can't complain about anything other than my wife lamenting that she wasn't there to enjoy the comfortable bed that the Westin is well known for. If you have time, there is a large mall across the street with a sky bridge connecting to the hotel. Last note: If you are taking a cab from the airport, bring lots of cash; it was over $80 with tip.

title: “Superb rooms-not so superb service.”
text:
My wife and I stayed at your hotel a bit over a week ago. Overall, it was an ok experience but could have been better. The room was fantastic and the gentleman at the front desk put us in just the room we requested. Our only problem was the horrible room service experience on the day of our departure. They messed up our order not just once, but twice and it was still not correct! We had ordered two steaks-medium rare with broccoli and a toffee cake dessert with ice cream. The 1st time they forgot the broccoli, cooked our steakes well, and brought us up a plate of toffee cake with the ice cream completely melted! Shame to even try serving a guest a dessert that looked like that! The server apologized and said the kitchen was too hot, but that is no excuse! The second time it took over an hour to get our meal. This time they seperated the ice cream and cake which was great, remembered the broccoli, but our steaks were still well! By then we were so hungry and had no time (or nerve) to request a re-make. The kitchen took care of our meal but we were still highly dissatisfied. We complained to the front office manager, Mrs. Heinrichs, who was very nice and did say they were short staffed (one person was shuttling and delivering room service simultaneously?) but they should have gotten another attendant or someone from the restaurant to help. I understand one mistake, but the same one twice is unacceptable.
We do plan to return again as we found the hotel atmosphere so great, but hopefully our next visit will have a much more positive in room dining experience.

title: “Classic and comfortable”
text: The hotel is decorated classically. Love the wooden feel in the room. And as other Hilton, very comfortable.

title: “Inside the University of Houston”
text: This hotel is a little tough if you are doing business in downtown. There aren't the amenities youd expect: Vending machines, a hotel store. Its not close to bars or restaurants. The rooms are nice enough for a comfortable stay, and if you are there for getting around the University of Houston, you couldn't do any better.

title: “Going the extra mile”
text:
I made our reservation over the internet and somehow the room preference request didn't go through. 
I showed the young man at the reception desk my confirmation from the website, which I had printed out that morning. As he apologized, he asked to copy my print out and said he would correct the error. Then, he led us to a large hospitality suite as a substitute for our room. We had a kitchen, a large living and dining room, two huge closets and doors to a large balcony. The living room and bedroom each had large plasma screen TV's. 
I appreciate the effort and interest in making us comfortable and correcting the mistake.

title: “Not bad, not great. Needs an update”
text: Although I didn't need to be near the hotel I was worried that the campus would pose a problem but it didn't. The night I arrived it was pouring rain and visiblity was poor. I was thrilled to have underground parking which is not always the case in Houston. The hotel staff was very nice and yes there was a lot of students in training. The room was a bit dated but clean. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quite. My only complaints are the fact that the air conditioning could not be set to a certain degree, it was either on freezing or nothing at all. I tried to adjust the thermastat but to no avail. The other issue is the need for a token to exit the parking lot. This meant you were constantly asking the front desk for them. If you forgot it requires a trip back upstairs to the lobby. All in all for the right price (under $125) I would stay again any more and I would have to think twice.

title: “Weel worth it”
text: Even though I live in Houston, we decided to take a mini-vacation and stayed in the hotel. The rooms were great, but the Bistro Alex restaurant, although limited in selections, was terrific. I say skip the appetizers, get the five tomato salad and try the "Airline Chicken".

title: “Great location, fantastic exciting stay!”
text: We were attending our nephew's wedding and took the opportunity to reserve rooms at Hotel Sorella. With our hectic schedule at this busy time this was a perfect place. The location was perfect for the celebrations that took place and plenty to see and do in the few moments of down time. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful and the location fantastic. We would highly recommend this hotel to travelers in the area.

title: “Wonderful Rooms, Comfy Beds, Great Lifestyle Center”
text:
We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Sorella for my 20th High School Reunion. The two nights we spent at the property were glorious. The rooms are spacious, clean and brand new. Each room is well-appointed and very clean.
It's located in a large sprawling lifestyle center with numerous options for eating, drinking and even fine dining. We only went to one of the restaurants, but really enjoyed the environs.
The bed was luxuriously comfy. Thanks for having us Hotel Sorella.

title: “I Will Stay Again, But....”
text: The Icon is a property in Mariott Hotels' "Autograph" collection. It's a splashy, opulent, boutique-style hotel right in the heart of Houston's downtown. The rooms are finely appointed, with the bathrooms the most impressive feature (I think the shower is the size of some hotels' bathrooms). I didn't care too much for the "disinfectant" smell in the room, but the comfy king sized bed made this forgivable. The red-colored gym on the first floor is about as unique as I've ever seen. If anything needed improvement, I'd have to say that I'd rather wished the desk staff and door staff were a little more crisp and professional. As it stood, the front of the hotel had too many bellhops not only idling but not having much of a clue of the surrounding areas when asked about whether "X" place was within walking distance. The desk staff may have simply been a little too informal for my taste, but it could be more a folksy, laid back Southern way of talking to guests than I am used to. As it stands, I am still looking forward to my next Icon visit.

title: “Put me into a handicapped room”
text:
This hotel did not meet my expectations. This might be due to the fact that they placed me into a handicapped room ( looking at recent reviews it seems like this is happening more and more often @ Icon). I believe this is something they should warn ahead of time. 
Overall - the lobby looked beautiful but the handicapped room ruined my experience. I am sure they are well aware they are giving away these rooms (esp to those who find them discounted).What made things worse was the view from my window - all I could see is dumpsters and a empty/dirty alleyway. 
I was tired and didn't feel like arguing so decided to just stay there instead of wasting time asking for a new room...if you decide to stay at this hotel i strongly suggest you request another room.

title: “Excellent Hotel”
text:
First class hotel, actually the only AAA 5 diamond hotel in Houston. Rooms are very large, excellent bed, very clean and quiet. Staff are very helpful and polite. Close to George Brown convention center, the Toyota Center and some shopping. You'll find scores of autograph hounds assembled outside the hotel - evidently a lot of athletes who have an event at the Toyota Center stay here.
There are several items of note: The lobby smelled like cigarette smoke to me. Maybe it's the air freshener they use, I don't know. The weekend we stayed here the area was fairly dead. I guess it is mostly like this unless there is something going on at the convention center or the Toyota Center. We were a little uneasy about the people in the area during the weekend - there were a lot of homeless people, but they were mostly 3 or 4 blocks away. We didn't feel very safe walking outside a 2 block area, so we didn't explore the area.
If you are attending a conference at the George Brown or an event at the Toyota Center then this might be a good choice. Otherwise, my preferences are for something less expensive and not in this area.

title: “Birthday weekend getaway”
text: Go to the Four seasons in downtown Houston on a birthday occasion and let them take care of you. You will be impressed. The service was outstanding from the valet to the front desk to the driver that took us to dinner. The weekend experience was top shelf.Thanks Four Season

title: “From a business travellers perspective - excellent!”
text:
Im a business traveller, so thats my perspective on my 8 nights stay at this Four Season. Im usually a Hyatt-man, but since my last stay at the Hyatt in Houston was quite dissapointing, i tried out the Four Seasons this time.
Beeing away from my family a lot and often staying quite long periods at a time, Im looking for location, personalized service, and a bit of luxury in my hotels. And I would have to say that Four Seasons Houston really delivered.
Service; Everyone, and I mean everyone, from the doormen/woman, the reception, concierge, the barstaff, housekeeping and roomservice, to the Manager is dedicated to make your experience the best. They smile, they greet you, by name very often! They resolve any issues that you may have, solve any problems that may occcur. Just ask! And thats my best tip overall: Dont burn inside with any problems or wishes, express them and you will see that they will go the extra mile to help you.
Location: The hotel is situated perfectly downtown. The hotel car will bring you around downtown, the taxies que up just outside, So your never short of transportation,. ( The citys light-rail-metro runs very close also)
Rooms: I had a executive suite which did not stand back to other suites Ive stayed in. I really cant see the need for major rehabilitations that other reviewers have screamed about. The hotel is distingueshed and classic all the way.
Food: The breakfast is good, although pricey. The Sunday Brunch is worth a stay for itself. The dinners in Quattro is close to Michelin-quality.
Take my word for it: As a business traveller youre going to love it here.

title: “Almost a year since we stayed at the Beacon...”
text: Our first trip to NYC family of 4 incl 12yo and 10 up. We had tried to book a 2 bedroom suite as we stayed for 8 nights. Unfortunately no 2 bdr available so went for a 1bdr with sofa in living room . All worked well as we were out and about so much of the time . We were so happy we stayed at The beacon - it was the perfect spot for our family to use as a base during our NYC adventure ( friends stayed in 2 bedrm suite at same time - we got to see their room. Would definately recommend this room with older kids ). Have been thinking about NY so much lately with Sandy. Hope all get back on their feet soon . Can't wait to visit NY again in next couple of years .

title: “Love the Beacon”
