text: I stayed at the Beacon for 2 nights and had to leave as Sandy arrived! I love this hotel - it has a wonderful NYC feel to it. I could cook if I needed to and the staff is fantastic. Fairway market is across the street and was a treat. The beds were extremely comfortable, great view from my room - just loved it!

title: “Marathon week”
text: Stayed here for five nights over marathon week. Had a bedroom suite which was quite spacious, though we were three blokes. Large king sized but then a rollaway and a sfa bed ! Non- smoking but always had a smoke odour in the room. Small kitchenette. Well located. Clean. Nice towels and toiletries. Elevators reasonably quick. TV malfunctioned at one stage - maintenance quickly fixed it. Relatively quiet on the 18th floor. No accessible power points in bedroom. Poor lighting in the living room. No bedbugs

title: “Look no further for a family stay”
text:
This review just echos what everyone else has said. This hotel is perfect if you are are going on holidays to Manhattan with a family.
We were on a family trip of a lifetime to New York for a few days and this hotel made it the perfect holiday. Our room was on the 7th floor and there was buckets of space. The bedroom had two double beds and the sitting room was large with sofa, armchair and dining room table for 4. The kitchen had a normal (by Irish standards) sized fridge and cooker plus a microwave. It was just an alcove really but perfectly adequate for preparing / heating up the goodies from Fairways.
There was a laundry across the hall from us which also had two payphones - so we could use prepaid phone cards to call home very cheaply. Tea and coffee were provided. The coffee perculator was intuitive to use and made exceptionally nice coffee.
Fairways supermarket is directly across the road. It is not for the faint hearted as it is a warren, and very busy. At the meat and deli counters you need to take a ticket and wait for your number to be roared out (took me a while to figure this out!)That said, it is a tourist attraction in its own right for those more used to pushing a trolly around Tescos or Lidl. Just don't take kids when you are doing that first supplies shop especially if they are just off the plane and tired. We remained pretty much on Irish time while in New York as it was only for a few days so meals from Fairways at the dining table in our room was ideal rather than restaurants with children.
The subway is left out of the hotel and two minute walk. There is a self service machine on the way in. We put $20 on a metrocard which allowed the four of us to be swiped through one after the other. You can see your balance at the turnstyle as you swipe. Just be sure you know your uptown from your downtown before you travel. The subway stops at convenient points for all tourist attractions.
Central Park is two blocks away and a haven to come back to in the afternoon after sighseeing. The staff were helpful and given that we left on the eve of Superstorm Sandy they were serene in the face of mounting panic from potentially stranded tourists. 
This hotel was available as part of Tesco clubcard deals via Tour America which saved considerably on the cost of the holiday.

title: “Boutique service and style”
text: From the attentive doorman to the hostess who greeted me at the door with a bottle of sparkling water... I was made to feel special every step of the way. There is no check in desk and you are put right at ease as the host checks you in on an IPad. I requested and received a quiet, minimalist room with high end features such as touch operated black out shades. Room service was fast and reasonable. I requested a toothbrush and received the toothbrush, toothpaste and floss. It's as if the staff really wanted to exceed every expectation. The hotel is directly across from the New York Library. This was my first stay and won't be the last!

title: “Fantastic Hotel”
text: We stayed for 5 nights and everything from service to food was amazing. Great location with an easy walk to anywhere in Manhattan. Very central. When you walk in you are greeted with super friendly and helpful check in staff. They offer advice on anything that your little heart wishes to do whilst in NY. The bathroom shower was insane with water coming from every different angle and the bed was super super comfy. We went to breakfast every morning in the hotel as the atmosphere, food and coffee were all excellent so why go elsewhere.

title: “We love this property!”
text: Althought it is not a cheap hotel, we love this property! This is our fourth time here and the quality of the rooms and the staff are very good, high level service, very professional! We like the Capella King Room, which has a nice sitting room inside the room itself and is cheaper than a suite! The spa is good, the gym is fantastic - Technogym equipments and very well equipped! The location is also great. It is in Midtown, Bryant Park is very close, and it is easy to move uptown or downtown by taxi, if you want! Times Square and Broadway shows are also nearby! The personal assistant - it is like your private concierge - is very efficient and helpful. One night, I needed to put a cold pack for back pain in the freezer, and they provided me everything. The other day, I asked a reservation in Eleven Madison Park Restaurant - which is difficult to get! They called me and confirmed it as I requested! We stayed at Plaza Athenee, Trump Soho, Trump International, ecc. but we still prefer The Setai! The bathroom, the spacious closet area and the nice colors of the decoration make you feel at home!

title: “Things you don't expect to hear at a Five Star hotel”
text:
As someone who has worked in the hotel industry and who shopped (inspected) upscale hotels and been a guest of many all over the world, I must sadly say that The Setai NYC does not live up to it's promise. First the good part-/rooms are unbelievably large with beautiful baths. Unfortunately they are devoid of any warmth. And speaking of warmth, I had to call my "personal assistant" for several blankets because my room was so very cold. With the temperature set way above 
70, I could not get the room over 68. Why would a hotel of this caliber not have a true concierge staff headed up by a member of the clefs d'or? I called prior to arrival to ask about theatre tickets and the personal assistant had no idea what show (on Broadway) that I was speaking about. First thing she asked me was had I gone online to Telecharge to look for tickets. Huh? During my first day at the hotel I again called my assistant for dinner reservations within the hotel. This time I was told to call the restaurant directly. I guess I am unclear as to what the staff is there for. They are nice young people, but woefully undertrained. First evening I asked the doorman for a taxi. He never greeted me or made eye contact. He seemed preoccupied with the headsets that he was wearing and asked me several times where I was going. 
On the plus side, front desk staff was very pleasant and room service and housekeeping could not have been nicer. Great chocolate chp cookies as a snack, but they weren't enough to make me want to book again

title: “Th place to stay while in NYC.”
text:
The staff here is amazing! Constant correspondence before I arrived by the hotels personal assistants made sure my stay would be worry free.
No matter how crazy my demands, they got it done; Bar seats at Masa on 2 days notice, done; cliff bars in room before arrival, done; lost in the city with 7 friends and need a vehicle to take them all around, done! The staff here made my trip extremely pleasant and enjoyable. I will stay nowhere else in New York but here.

title: “Don't Understand why it's a 5 star...”
text: I really don't understand why they received a 5 star rating. This is not what I would call a service hotel. I agree the shower and tub are amazing and the kids loved the high tech toilet. The location is great for walking around Times Square, but getting to the hotel was a crawl. The pool is smaller than my hot tub at home and my kids 5 and 8 were told to keep it down when they were just giggling & having fun. No kids menu so I ordered just one plate of pasta with butter sauce, apple juice, milk and glass of wine it was 84 dollars. I just don't think its worth it room very small and toiletries in closet not in the bathroom. They asked for my kids names and ages at reservation and told me they might have something special for the kids, nothing came. Which is fine, but don't say anything. No coffee, no chocolates and no view.

title: “Outstanding Boutique Style Hotel”
text: This hotel which is literally a few short steps away from Times Square offers a unique high end hotel experience in New York. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, very stylish Art Deco interior, beautiful rooms (we had a superior guestroom which was a bit on the light side in terms of space and a very generous junior suite), spectacular bath rooms and a nice spa with a small jet stream pool. Undoubtedly expensive, but highly recommendable. This is a 10 out of 10.

title: “Spacious Room but skip their breakfast and spa”
text:
I stayed at the hotel right after Hurricane Sandy. I pre-paid it for the NYC Marathon that didn't take place. The hotel is new and its room spacious with a huge bathroom with marble tub/floor. We stayed at its 1-bedroom suite. It has a pull out sofa - a nice added option. Overall, I liked the hotel and its friendly staff. But the staff and their manager were not empowered to make decisions and they could not authorize me to checkout early with refund even though the marathon was cancelled and lots of people needed a room. Unlike other luxury boutique hotel that I stayed and liked, the staff in Eventi didn't have as much pride and ownership. 
Back to the atmosphere. The lobby is small and basic and bar on second floor but both are not as fun and lively compared to the neighbor hotel NoMad. Also, skip the Eventi hotel breakfast and head to Andaz hotel cafe across from the Main Public Library for breakfast i.e. melt in your mouth souffle pancakes and great vibe! And I agreed with the other reviewer that expansive water in the room is unnecessary.
The hotel spa was below average. We went there because it was convenient. But it was super small (2 chairs sitting) and no 'space' to relax. more or less a 'in and out' thing but sadly the massage my friend and I received was not really good. Save your money and skip the spa.

title: “Breathed a sigh of relief”
text: Put a lot of thought into this trip as it was my wife's 'surprise' 50th Birthday treat. In the event I very nearly cancelled due to the awful effect of Hurricane Sandy and the uncertainty of what we would find, but the hotel gave me assurances by telephone that they were almost functioning at 100%. We were so pleased that we went ahead. The staff in the hotel were very pleasant and friendly -- and genuine, not 'have a nice day' whoever you are style. We had some very interesting chats and they had some stories to tell of the impact of the storm on themselves and friends --- but all were very positive and there was also a nice friendly atmosphere among guests who included forlorn marathon runners and some refugees and their dogs. The hotel is tremendously relaxed. We were in an incredible 20th floor room overlooking both 6th Avenue and 29th Street. Just lovely and comfortable. The bed was one of the best ever. It was certainly more spacious than other hotel rooms in big cities that we've been in. We became regulars at the evening Wine Reception and studiously managed three glasses each and also availed of the tea/coffee at reception each morning; though we did miss not having tea or coffee in the room which is after all the norm in UK hotels. Not wanting to deviate from our affection for this hotel, we do want to mention a few other aspects that may be worth consideration by the management: having to pay premium prices for drinking water in the bedroom seemed just a little mean; we didn't really enjoy the breakfast - eggs were quite runny with a strange tang and the sitting area was cold; the hairdryer had a very short cable and there was nowhere in the room really suitable to use it with a mirror; while there were dressing gowns, there were no slippers -- thick socks which served as slippers were hanging in the cupboard and could be purchased, but it's just that any hotel we have been in with robes have also had basic slippers. Oh and by the way we had a brilliant time in New York - we adored the New Yorkers who are for sure among the friendliest, warmest and most genuine people in the world. A strange time to be a tourist and we felt a little guilty to be enjoying our holiday so much when many were struggling with their daily lives!!! .

title: “Elegant, Comfortable, Trendy, Awesome Staff”
text: We chose the Eventi Hotel, after searching multiple hotels in our price range for a couple weeks. I found by chance that the Eventi had some availability after reviewing Kimpton hotels in general. We liked the idea of the location of this hotel, because we wanted to spend a lot of time in lower Manhattan on our 5 day trip, as well as doing a few things uptown, including a Broadway show. We were very happy to have chosen this hotel! It has an elegance not expected for a hotel in NYC for this price! It was super duper trendy, and the rooms have amazing bathrooms, and lots of space and great views!!! (Our view in particular was that of the Empire State Building!). The bed was dreamy, I slept like a good sleeping baby! The bar area, and restaurant are situated on the backside of the hotel, and through the back part of the bar restaurant, you look out through a glass wall of windows onto their xtra big screen hanging on the side of another building across the street! Super cool! The wine hour with appetizers daily is something you will not find in NYC period! The staff was always willing to help with recommendations, even though we are the type of people that research in the weeks prior to our trip where to go and what to do, have no fear, being a fly by the seat of your pants type of guest is perfect in this hotel! They make recs fitting to your interest, and make reservations for you, etc. They take care of it all! Since we celebrated our anniversary there in Oct during our stay, they had a bottle of wine and a fruit tray sent to our room the day we checked in! Sweet! Some have mentioned that they don't like this part of town...because it is just shy south of the hub-bub of times square, but I found that great!! We were two short blocks from the subway, and right next door to Macy's Herald Square! I also really loved not being run over by tourists when I walked out the front entrance! There was nothing inconvenient about this location whatsoever...and we wanted to spend lots of time in SOHO...so this was a perfect hotel for us!!! We cannot wait to come back and book the Eventi! Specifically, we loved Patrick, and we also had a great time talking to, and getting recommendations from TJ about restaurants to try in the city. We have suggested good friends stay there this coming weekend, and they have booked the Eventi and cannot wait to go!!! We would suggest it to anyone! you will not be sorry! Oh and PS, the pizzas on the bar menu at the restaurant are excellent! Thin crust, fresh garlic? Is this really a hotel?! Excellent!

title: “LOVED everything about it!”
text: My husband and another couple went to NYC for a 4 day weekend birthday trip. We chose the Iroquois and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel! The location was perfectly central for shopping, dinners, broadway and the subway. The room was a good size for NY and clean. The staff was better than THE BEST!!! The concierge, Alan, was unbelievable. He got us into amazing restaurants at perfect times! He got us fantastic tickets to a great play! Gave us perfect directs and made great suggestions. He pulled off an amazing feat for my birthday by having a flowers sent to a trendy restaurant and on the table with wine chilling with the best table in the place! Both he and Bill our Bellhop, not only made great after dinner ounce recommendations but they got us on the guest list and we didn't have to wait despite huge line ups! They literally made the trip for us and will always be thought of and spoken of when we reminisce! The rest of the staff was very good as well. Bottom Line - we would stay again and recommend it to others! Thank you!!!

title: “Awesome Place!”
text: My friend and I recently visited NYC from Texas for the first time and were SO glad to have found the Iroquois. It was a haven in the middle of the city. The staff was top notch and very helpful. The concierge was super helpful and Patrick, at the front desk was super nice and accomodating. It's a quick walk to many, many locales and we always felt safe in our surroundings. We will DEFINITELY stay at The Iroquois when returning to NY.

title: “Loved it!”
text:
I stood at the San Carlos for two nights after it being highly recommended by my colleagues. I arrived to a peaceful lobby and greeted by the doorman Bobby who seemed a little too anxious and was in a way breathing down my neck. But after checking in I found my room to be quite comfortable and the bed AMAZING. The view decent but you couldnt expect much from the towering buildings around the venue. Amazing restaurants were just blocks away, clothing stores were also conveniently close. From the friendly front desk agent of Asian decent to the attentive Doorman Steven who chased down taxi's for 25 minutes so I could make it to the theater in time. 
My only criticism, the bread from the complimentary continental breakfast lacked taste and moisture. But overall, from an individual that vacations a lot I would say this hotel is at the top of the list. I will definitely see you soon San Carlos!

title: “Great Hotel”
text: Just spent five nights at this hotel. We booked a one bedroom suite for myself, husband and two grown up kids. When we arrived we were upgraded to a two bed suite. We cannot fault this hotel, rooms are large by city standards. We had kitchen area with microwave and fridge and coffee making facilities. Breakfast is ok usual fare but fresh and just what you need to start your day. Location is great short walk to Rockefeller Centre, close to subway which will get you uptown or downtown. Free fast wifi and use of computers if you need them. Highly recommended.

title: “Small boutique hotel with great location”
text:
The San Carlos staff made myself and teenage daughter feel very at home. We were checked in early and given a room upgrade to celebrate my daughter's sweet sixteen. The suite was very large with a kitchen area and gorgeous outside patio. The rooms are well appointed with a bedroom and sitting area with basic kitchen equipment for breakfast and snacks. The hotel was very quiet ( unusual in NYC) and very clean. Access to the subway is a block away and shopping is an easy walk to Madison Ave..
We really enjoyed the quiet oasis away from the heat and bustle of midtown. I highly recommend this hotel for couples or business.

title: “Location, Service & Comfort....Unsurpassed!”
text: This was our second trip to the Sherry. We were there in October and again this month. The ambiance is Old World style as you are greeted by the doorman, the front desk staff and the ever so courteous elevator assistants. Our rooms overlooking Central Park South...couldn't be more better for "city watching". Shopping, dining and entertainment are steps away and being an Apple aficionado, having the flagship Apple store right next door couldn't get any better! The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Every request from room service to UPS delivery of an over-night package was handled with finesse. The Sherry will always be my favorite place to stay in New York!

title: “They don't make Hotels like this anymore! Superb!!”
text:
I brought my 84 year old mother to New York last week for a birthday treat of shopping, dining, etc. We absolutely loved our stay here, start to finish. The reservations agent, Miss Julie, was extremely pleasant & helpful. Our room was gorgeous, clean, fresh flowers & candy, and the bed was to die for ( I wanted to order one). They offer a 20% discount to those guests who choose to dine at Harry Cipriani's, a nice bonus. Of couse, the location of the Sherry Nethrland is excellent, close to great shopping & restaurants. This comes in handy in any kind of inclement weather.
The hiring process must be rigorous as every member of the staff we encountered was unfailingly courteous and professional. It was like walking back in time to the 'good old days' when people took their jobs seriously and wanted to provide guests truly excellent service.
We will be back, but perhaps I'll go there with my husband next time as it a cozy, romantic place too.
MH

title: “a good stay”
text: I have been in this hotel multiple times, always in business. I like it, it is quite a posh one (for the category), breakfast buffet is not included (in some cases is, depends on the rate you are paying) and is very good if included, if not I think it may be a little bit pricey, cannot remmeber how much was it. Everything is new and well maintained, the exercise room is very small but helps the purposes, has a business center where you can use the computers and is a good place to stay. Last time I went there was for holidays and if was ok. Very well located in the energy corridor and close to the offices of several companies.

title: “Clean and convenient”
text: Every thing worked and was what should be expected for this type of property and pricing. Good breakfast at a reasonable price. Nice staff members

title: “Excellent value and service”
text:
Sales Manager Debbie Bunn has done a fantastic job providing SIII Baseball Academy's players and family with great rooms, breakfast and rates. 
Debbie makes setting up room blocks quick and easy. The kids love the big hotel lobby and full service complimentary breakfast!

title: “Fantastic”
text: After having multiple problems checking in and being very frustrated (the problems of a convention in the hotel, not caused by Hilton), the staff were incredibly considerate and helpful and even gave us free breakfast tickets. The location next to the convention center was very nice as well. The employee that stands out the most was a man at the front desk named Landon, who helped us get our room, gave us tips for the city, and recommended multiple delicious restaurants. It was definitely worth the extra money, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: “These people are awesome!!!”
text: I stayed here recently in the month of October. It seems to be a busy time in the city and I was fortunate to get a reservation at this hotel. Amelia always ensured my room was exceptionally clean and stocked. Martin provided me VIP treatment at their Spencer's restaurant. I also had the pleasure to meet Jacques D’Rovencourt the hotel manager, and witnessed firsthand his care and concern for staff and customer alike. He is one in a million in the sense that there is no separation between his words and actions. It is my whole hearted belief that the reason for the kindness, understanding, compassion and generosity from all the employees comes from Jacques’ direction and management style. Thank you to everyone for making my stay memorable! Say hello to Jacques and tell him to keep up the good work.

title: “A home away from home for the frequent travler”
text:
I'll start with the best - the staff. From house cleaning to management these folks are outstanding. They are always there to assist you (but not in an overbearing way). They are all genuinely friendly and just nice people. I can't find enough good things to say about them. The people make the place, thus the title of my review.
I have spent over 60 nights this year at this hotel and consider it the very best hotel I have every been at. I say this from several perspectives (starting with the staff, above). The ground floor is stunning. The massive open area is very impressive and compares well with all but the most exclusive 5-star hotels. It is truly world class. 
This is a convention hotel and when it is busy there are people milling about everywhere. This can be a form of entertainment in itself. There are places one can go to escape all the noise and commotion when one needs some quiet time so don't feel intimidated by this aspect.
The breakfast is amazing. The food is gourmet quality. The fruits are freshiest and tastiest I've had. Even something as simple as scrambled eggs is a real treat. Don't miss it. It is well worth the price.
The location is great. It is next to convention, baseball, and basketball/concert venues. One can walk to most downtown places, but a cab is immediately available at the whistle of the bell captain. The LRT is within an easy walk, and it goes all the way to Reliant Stadium.
This hotel is not cheap, but you get what you pay for (world class) - the best staff in the business, gourmet food, some great rooms with great views, tranportation on demand, and a home away from home.

title: “Best value for the highest quality and excellent service!”
text: The hote is immaculate! Rooms are very clean and the beds are so comfortable with down comforters and pillows. Every morning, we were greeted with a delicious breakfast bar filled with scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, bagels, fruit, coffee, juice, cold cereal, hot cereal, and more--it was wonderful! Plus, we had free bottled water available to us at all times and they have a happy hour at 5pm where we would start our evening with a few glasses of wine and snacks. The staff was personable and helpful. We especially got to know Sonny--he's the man to see when in Houston. He recommended 3 restaurants to us and they were all outstanding. I had the best steak I've ever had and Sonny pointed the way! He drove the shuttle van and took us where we need to go. Our other colleagues stayed at the Hilton, Hyatt, and Crowne Plaza. Little 'ole Best Western had them all beat!!! Our stay cost about 1/3 less and we had all the great perks!! One colleague commented that her bottled water was $3.50 at the Hilton. I cannot rave enough about this hotel. I will be returning to Houston for another conference in the future and will stay at the Best Western.

title: “Nice place to Lay Your Head”
text: I was in town on business, and this hotel happened to be closest to the office. It is very well kept. The rooms are big and clean. The beds are extremely comfortable. The bathrooms are clean. Breakfast is decent - good variety of hot and cold fare. Check in was no hassle. It's a great place if your in town on business or otherwise.

title: “Great experience at Westin”
text: Beautiful rooms, wonderfully warm and efficient staff. Good location and highly resourceful staff. The lift works perfectly, the shuttle is on hand to help customers and the location is just right. The connection to the mall is a tremendous shopping experience. I would go back there if I have to.

title: “Pretty Sweet”
text: This hotel is located across from Memorial City Mall and attached to a nice medical facility where you can reach the mall via a sky walk way. The hotel itself was clean and modern. The front desk staff was efficient and friendly. I’m a platinum member with Starwood so I started with a regular king bed room and then was upgraded the next day to a suite. I used the executive club for breakfast and evening snacks. The service and staff in the club was very pleasant. My one complaint was that it was so small compared to the other Westin I have stayed in. In the morning it could get really crowded in there. Housekeeping was ok; my only complaint was not one time didn’t they put in any toiletries, no body wash, lotion or anything. I even took them all out and put them in my suitcase and nothing was replaced ever. I was there for 11days. I also used self-parking garage it was painless just be careful some people drive really fast in the garage. Overall it was a pleasant stay and I would stay there again. I didn’t get to use the pool or Jacuzzi even though I stayed on the 18th floor. But it looked very nice along with the gym.

title: “Very Nice Option to Galleria Area”
text:
I stayed at the Houston Westin in Memorial City for 10 nights. The room was a king deluxe room with a nice comfy bed, good working area, large screen tv on a swivel with HD Programming!!! a nice sitting area by the window, a very spacious bathroom with a seperate shower and a bathtub, dual sink and mirrors with excellent lighting. The full length mirror was excellently placed in the room next ro the entrance to the bathroom. The room also had a small refrigerator neatly hidden under the counter and a safe in the closet. The lounge opens around 6 for a continental breakfast, lots of choices for cereals, bagels, muffins, coffee, teas, and juices. Evening snacks were provided as well. I personally did care for the evening food
but there was complimentary drinks provided until 730 and the lounge itself was open until 11p. Water, chips, soda, candies, chocolate covered pretzels all for the taking!!! Thumbs up to the lounge staff....always pleasant and smiling with a greeting to everyone. A really nice pool setting up on 18th floor overlooks the highway and on the right day, some lovely sunsets. Self parking is easy enough and probably faster than Valet service. Park on third floor of garage
and go right into hotel. Hertz rental car is located right in the hotel. Cheesecake Factory right across the street. Hospital right next door. Easy access onto Katy freeway 4 miles West of 610 and about 1 mile east of Highway 8. Definitely would stay again....and again and again.

title: “SORRY excuse for the CONRAD HILTON name”
text: DATED ROOMS: SCARY PARKING: POOR ROOM SERVICE; CLUELESS FRONT DESK STAFF: NO SECURITY: STAY at the HILTON AMERICA's - it's only five minutes away.... I stayed at the University of Houston Hilton last year (9.2007). I was attending a conference for 5 days. I was sick and I called the front desk SEVERAL times to tell them not to cancel my reservation which was GUARANTEED with a CC because I would be there by 6 a.m. Monday morning instead of Sunday night. The reservation WAS cancelled and the hotel was booked for the entire length of my conference - no apologies at the time. I wrote a letter and finally got a "free romance weekend night" apology. That night was last Friday 8.1.08. First of all, we were given the "murder central" room at the end of the hall by the stairwell where the noise transfers extensively. The only time I have been given this room in the past is when I get a "priceline room" or the "military rate" room. Our romantic strawberries were great. And then, it started - the noise. About 9 p.m. we could hear very loud laughter. We waited to see if it would quit on it's own - I AM NOT A COMPLAINER! really. We complained about the noise twice before 11 p.m. - no apologies or offer to move us to a quieter room. I was awake listening to DOORS SLAM! loud laughter, someone singing in the shower near me, and music. I finally called the front desk around 4 a.m. They said there was nothing they could do and offered to move us. WE LEFT - sleeping in my bed at home with my three dogs and cat was is more romantic! The entire hotel management and especially the front desk manager Michele K. does not have a good handle on the staff or the quality of service. The rooms ARE dated - looks like something Lucy and Dezi would have stayed in on one of their trips to California... Room Service is limited. The bathrooms are tiny with chips falling off the tiles and mold in the air filters. I contacted management again and was told there was nothing they could do about the noise!! and offered me free dinner at the crappy restaurant. I WILL NEVER STEP FOOT INTO THE UNIVERSITY HOUSTON HILTON AGAIN, unless I have to because I do attend conferences there. PLEASE contact me if you need more information....

title: “Beware the handicap room switcheroo!”
text: I am a Marriott Rewards lover... I need to stay in Houston... I like boutique older hotels... Icon sounded cool... I check in at about 11 pm.... Outside lovely... Inside lovely... Staff friendly... I walk into room... Handicapped room... Buzz kill... Too late to screw with it.... Creeped out by bathroom... I mention at checkout how disappointed I was... Young guy could give a crap less... Why spend all of the money to build a great property and hire a doofus to work the front desk? It could be a great place to stay... I won't be back due to them not telling me that I was about to walk into a handicap room and for not even acting like they care as I check out....

title: “It could not have been better!”
text: My husband and I checked into the Hotel Icon for a one night stay. We were going to the Houston Symphony, and wanted a hotel close by. The lobby is charming, and the room was wonderful! It is so nice when an old building is renovated as beautifully as they have done the Icon! The Icon has everything you need, plus old world charm. We loved it! The crowning touch was the complimentary shuttle service, that took us to and from the symphony, and the next day to Brennans' for brunch. We will be back!

title: “Nice downtown location for business”
text:
I stayed at the Icon for 2 nights in October while attending a meeting. The meeting was actually held at the Hilton Convention Center but as a Marriott member, I was okay with staying about 1 mile away. One the first morning I walked over but then was told the Icon has a shuttle that will take you anywhere within a 3 mile radius. I used their service for the remainder of my stay. 
The gym is nicely updated and the room I got on the 9th floor with 2 double beds was quite spacious. The only problem I had was getting there in a cab when he wasn't sure so I had to pull up the location and address. Otherwise it was a nice and convenient hotel.

title: “Good option downtown”
text:
I spent many days there in different stays and overall I've got a very positive experience.
Pros: location, attitude of the entire staff, restaurant, rooms size, beds very comfortable, nice bathrobes, great Sunday brunch.
Cons: small pool area often crowdy, overpriced breakfast (no buffet option), need for a general "lifting".

title: “Another Great Four Seasons Experience!”
text: If you are a regular Four Seasons connoisseur this is deffinitely not as nice as some of their other marquee properties. The claims that it is dated and in need of a facelift are bit beyond the reality of its current state, while it does have some wear it is less tear and more charm. The staff was courteous and helpful, always providing great directions and convenience. We stayed at the property early in the week while I was in town for business (my wife came along so we could celebrate her birthday), which was helpful because the pool was not very busy but fully staffed, which meant near constant service and attention. I am giving the property a five because it always disarms me a bit when such fabulous hotels fall down the tripadvisor. Bottom line is that it was a great place to relax, recharge, and celebrate my wife's birthday!

title: “Great place!”
text: Just accross from the New York Public Library (which deserves a visit!) and a few blocks away from the Grand Central Station (try the Oyster Bar there), this hotel has a perfect location in middle Manhattan. We stayed in a very confortable and modern loft. Everything was very clean and the bed itself was great! The minibar content was complimentary, except for the alcoholic beaverages. The staff was really kind with us, and the check-in/check-out processes were surprisingly fast. Next time in NYC this is a place to be considered!

title: “Great experience”
text:
Very modern decor, great location. We had one of the suites with a little balcony. Bathroom was great but I wish they would have a soaking tub instead of a huge shower. After walking in the city all day long, a soaking tub would be good. 
Breakfast was top notch...

title: “Stunning New York Location”
text: From the moment you walk through the door you realise this is not your average out of the box hotel. We were warmly welcomed on arrival and given a coffee while checking in! The staff were knowledgable and efficient. Our room was stunning, with massive floor to ceiling windows looking straight on to the New York State Library. All the little things have been thought of and the location is fabulous. Will definitely be back to stay in the future if we are lucky.

title: “Second stay at the Setai”
text:
We stayed at the Setai last year and returned this year, on arrival at the hotel the doorman greeted us and welcomed us back and said it was nice to see us again and collected our luggage from our car,nice start to the visit. 
Greeted at the desk and informed our room was not available yet, which was fine as it was 11.30am we had arrived in NY on the Queen Mary 2 so we were early, waited in the lounge bar area until around 1.30 room still not avail, so went out for lunch came back at 3.30 still not avail, at this point they decided to upgrade our room rather than keep us waiting any longer, which we appreciated, not sure if I would have waited any longer, obviously the no check in/out time works fantastically as long as the hotel is not full! 
The room was gratefully accepted and appreciated.
There was a little event going on in town the United nations convention, and the hotel was a little busy with a few diplomats and presidents plus security floating around, but this did not impact on our visit at all, until one day a security guy looked me up and down (not the usual staff who always most friendly and polite) and questioned if I was staying at the hotel, maybe he thought someone wearing shorts and a t shirt would not be staying at the Setai? Flashed the room key and in we went. 
All went well during our four night stay until our departure, on checking the bill it had been charged to the wrong card I was assured it would be changed, got back to the UK to find the bill had been charged to my card in error, which has just been refunded to my card after eleven days, after many phone calls and emails to the hotel and visa, I am still awaiting a part refund for the difference in the exchange rates that the banks had the nerve to charge me,which amounts to a couple of hundred dollars, if the total had been a couple of hundred dollars I would not have pursued it as much but as it was $4000 it needed dealing with asap, an awful lot of work for something which should never have happened as I felt I had dealt with this before my departure on the 24th sept, everyone was very apologetic about the issue but I really could have done without all this hassle, Thanks for the stay Setai it was great except for the issue and work on my return home.
PS. Hopefully next time on check out I wont be asked to leave via the staff entrance (not so attractive as the hotel, concrete is not an attractive colour) so as to let Mr Clinton come in the front.

title: “Disappointed”
text: We were welcomed in a genuine and thoughtful way. Among the pleasures of the hotel was an espresso machine with all the fixings in the room. The room was lovely and we emptied the espresso supplies-delicious. The next day we left around 9am for a day of sightseeing in the city. We had a wonderful day and returned around 3:30 for another round of espresso's and a nap before dinner and a play. The day was rainy and as we walked a great deal we were soaked. So a hot shower, espresso and a nap. However, the room was not made up. By the time it was there was no time for any of the planned rest before dinner. When the room was finally made up the espresso supplies were not replenished nor were they resupplied at turn down service. Reading the ratings in more detail I see this is not a rare occurrence. The staff apologized but no explanation was given. I think the saying is you only have one time to make a good first impression. At a less exclusive property no big deal but in hundreds of stays at hotels this had only happened to me once before and not at a high end property.

title: “Worst Front Desk Staff”
text:
I have been very fortunate to travel much of the world staying in both some of the finest and some of the most rustic accommodations, but I've never come across a worse/more rude front desk staff. Listing the positives first, the hotel is admittedly a beautifully decorated well thought out property and the head butler Brandon was fantastic. Unfortunately, I left the hotel utterly disappointed and completely enraged by the front desk staff and management.
When booking a junior suite two months out, I requested one with a terrace and asked for an early check-in depending on availability. Two weeks out I called to reconfirm the request and when the hotel called me two days out I repeated it for a third time. During check-in, my request was once again relayed, though unfortunately a terrace suite wasn't available that day nor could I check in early... no big deal. However, I was told I could move rooms the following day to have the terrace to which I agreed to.
Later that day when our room was ready (received no phone call btw even though we were informed we would be called), it was once again communicated we would like to move the next day. The next day when I called in the front desk staff had no idea what I was talking about, but were looking into it. I called back 20 minutes later when we had to leave for a tour and were told they didn't have an answer yet, but the manager would call. Once again, no phone call was received. 
Upon return to the hotel, I was told they were very sorry, but room wasn't available. Of course we had not unpacked due to the promised room transfer and was quite frustrated at the huge lack of communication especially by such an expensive/highly rated hotel. Unfortunately, I did not have time to continue the discussion as we needed to change and head to a show, but informed the manager I expected him to do something to write their wrong of over promising, not communicating between staff members and not ever calling/following up with me. Once again, a phone call was promised and never received.
That night upon return was my bubbling point as there was a new and very rude girl working the desk who told me essentially all I was saying was a lie and no request for a room was every made, meaning no phone calls before arriving, no communication upon check in, etc. I proceeded to go off on her and her manager who finally realized they were wrong and apologized. But guess what... nothing was ever done by them.
Being in the customer service business you need to control your clients expectations and if they have simply told me the room wasn't available upon check in then no big deal. Instead they caused a huge ordeal as they lacked any resemblance of customer service or professionalism. I would never ever recommend this hotel and the frustration/stress their front desk caused essentially ruined me and my girlfriend's trip to NYC.

title: “An experience!!!!”
text:
We, a family of 3 including my 12 yr old boy (who just turned 12), stayed in the The Chatwal on 44th & Times Sq. It's an experience! The Chatwal is 1 of the listed 5 Star Hotels (List of 5 start in NYC: The Pierre; Setai Fifth Avenue; Trump SoHo New York; Trump International Hotel ; Mandarin Oriental New York; Plaza; St. Regis Hotel New York; Peninsula New York). 
It did not have the luxury of the open location like The Plaza or The Trump International, but it had the location history & Heritage. House in the same place with The Lamb Club, Chatwal is blessed. Luxury is defined to another dimension in this Hotel. The Guest Bathroom is a Trump card to every guest. The shower is similar to be in the rain forest in-home or Niagara in-home. It was outstanding. if you couple it with Jacuzzi, it's a topper. The in-room lighting & electronics is itself a 'show'. The closet & etc is another visual pleasure. Bed, one the best quality memory foam (coming from a memory foam user at home for 7 yrs). 
The pool and Jacuzzi coupled with complementary biscotti & lemon water followed by another all around pressure shower is itself a spa experience. Chatwal's attention to detail for luxury and guest is second to none.
The Lamb Club, their restaurant is a wonderful and full of heritage. a true luxury is defined by Chatwal. I congratulate Mr Chatwal to stand with same line up w other 6 5-strays, if not being on the toppers. They know how to take care of guest, they know what attention to detail is!

title: “Amazing Staff!”
text: We had a wonderful 5 days in the city! The room was beautiful and clean. The hotel is classic, art deco ... wonderfully appointed. The best thing about our stay was the staff. They were so down to earth and friendly. Helpful for sure. The doormen, Nick the conceirge, the bar tenders, the check-in girls. Loved it guys, keep up the good work!!!!

title: “Misleading information, won't stay there ever”
text:
I had a reservation for Nov 2-Nov 4, and was not able to make it to NYC because of Superstorm Sandy. I tried calling, emailing, and faxing the Eventi to let them know ahead of time that I was not going to be able to make it, but to no avail. Because I had pre-paid my reservation via Amex, the folks at Kimpton reservation couldn't help me because they said I had to talk directly to the hotel staff to change it. And that I shouldn't worry if I couldn't get through before Nov 2 because they would understand. I was finally able to talk to their manager on duty on Saturday Nov 9th to explain the situation and rebook for the weekend Nov 9. He said he would change it for me and that I would be all set. To my surprise I called last night to confirm and was told by a different manager who was on duty that it hadn't been changed, and that it was showing up as a "No-Show" so I would have to rebook and pay again...because it was a pre-paid reservation!! It didn't matter that I was not able to make it because of the storm. I'm so upset with the level of service and the misinformation and the inability to honor my reservation that I have decided to write this review. Hope nobody else experiences something like what I did!
Too bad because I was a fan of Kimpton Hotels, but not anymore.

title: “Great Stay In NY With Minor Quibble Quickly Dealt With”
text:
We stayed for nearly 2 weeks at the Eventi in early October. We have been to New York a few times and this was by far the best location we have stayed at. An easy taxi or walk to all locations and perfect for getting about.
We stayed in a King Deluxe City View which was great. We were meant to upgrade to a Suite but the room was so nice that we decided to avoid the hassle and requested to remain in the room. This is where my minor issue occurred. On check out the bill for the 2 night adjustment was huge...we also hadn't been told it would be assuming (probably wrongly) that the rate would remain the same as we had been paying. On the day the manager did try to help and reduce things a bit but I subsequently contacted them on my return and they were able to reduce things fully for us. It was wrong not to say the rate would change when we said we would stay but the way it was handled was superb and I would not hesitate to stay again.
Back to the hotel. The room was spacious and clean. The views were great and the service in the room (both room service and cleaning) was good. The lifts were a bit slow but we were there at the same time as a large French party who all seemed to leave at the same time. Certainly nothing to moan about as it was all good fun cramming into the lift!
What I do want to highlight above anything else is the fantastic and personalised service provided by one member of the front of house, Kevin Rountree. The trip to NY was planned so that I could propose to my girlfriend. Living in Hong Kong the logistics of doing this were tricky so I contacted the front desk a few weeks before to see if someone could help. That someone was Kevin who helped arrange EVERYTHING and most of it in his free time. He was even at the proposal location (a bookshop recommended by him) to set everything up on his morning off. Honestly cannot think of anywhere that has given such a personalised service and whilst we may have got lucky with Kevin specifically we could sense that the overall vibe was that people were there to help. Kevin though we have to thank you again and hope someone gives you a promotion for your efforts!
We would stay and perhaps even plan to do so again in 2013. Hotel is great and we highly recommend it to everyone.

title: “Amazing stay during interesting times”
text:
We recently stayed at the Eventi just a few short days after hurricane Sandy, and we absolutely had an amazing time during the challenging times that New York was facing. We were greeted by the General Manager himself - Robert - and he made us feel welcome immediately!
The room itself was a lovely oasis on the 17th floor, and we enjoyed the modern design. There is so much to see and quickly get food close by, and we always looked forward to coming back after being out on the town. It's so close to walk to everything - Macy's is 5 mins, and Times Square takes no time at all to walk, and there were lots of cabs around.
The breakfast buffet was delicious and we definitely raided the minibar, being Kimpton loyalty members.
All in all - we loved the weekend and can't wait to come back again! I most highly recommend the Eventi for what it offers and where it is located.
All in all - an amazing trip

title: “Review of Iroquois Hotel in Manhattan”
text:
We just came home from a wonderful weekend in NYC and a stay at the Iroquois Hotel.
Not only is the location excellent, but the entire staff extremely helpful, accomodating and courteous. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to the Presidential suite which was absolutely first rate. We have stayed at the Iroquois on several other occasions in the past and will continue to make this our stop away from home whenever we are in the city. Kudos to this wonderful staff.
dt
Maryland

title: “Great Hotel with excellent staff”
text: We loved our stay at the Iroquois. The staff is very helpful and friendly...giving great recommendations for restaurants and how to get around. We booked through a 3rd party, who did not notify the hotel that there would be 2 people staying in our room. The front desk offered an upgrade to a larger room, without us having to ask. Bill was really helpful, he gave us great suggestions for dinner, took care of our luggage and secured us a car for our trip to the airport while we did our last minute shopping. The hotel is clean, friendly, nicely decorated and in a great location. We'd definitely stay here again.

title: “Great hotel”
text:
Small boutique hotel close to Times square, we stayed a week.
The first room we were on was on the first floor with poor view(despite us asking for a room higher up). The hotel moved us the following day for the rest of our stay. Not many amenities, there was a small gym with sauna, basically a converted room, but it did the job. 2 bars, one a cocktail bar but we preferred the restaurant bar which had an excellent barman.
The restaurant (for evening meals) was expensive but fantastic. If you want a special meal absolutely eat here. 
Negatives: The restaurant and bars closed totally for Jewish holidays. Now I respect the owners religious beliefs BUT when operating a hotel for international guests we were surprised to have everything locked up for 2 days.
The breakfast was expensive but it's easily fixed by walking out the front door, turning right and eating the the Red flame diner 100 yards along the road. Really good selection at reasonable prices.
Floor 8 also smelt of damp. This is the floor with the James Dean suite in it.
The staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. The beds were comfortable and for the price we paid for the hotel in a very central location was great.
We'd definitely stay again.

title: “good location, perfect room for family with 2 teens”
text:
I picked this hotel for several reasons. Close to subway, free wifi & breakfast and most importantly... 2 Queen beds AND a sofa bed. I come from the tall family. My husband and & I cannot fit in a double/full size bed and then our boy and girl teenagers wont share. Hence the need for essentially 3 beds. The San Carlos had the above with the most reasonable price. 
Everything was clean and up to date. Doormen were SUPER helpful. They even let us check out late when our plane was delayed.
My only complaint was that the breakfast was just okay- mostly bread items. But I still gave it 5 stars. This is perfect for families otherwise.

title: “Has it's good points and bad points”
text:
My wife and I went to NYC for our anniversary and stayed at the Sherry Netherland. 
The good...The location is outstanding (5th Ave and 59th Street across from the horse carriage stand at Central Park). Central to everything. The staff is excellent, attentive, polite, includign the white-gloved elevator operators.
The bad...The much-raved-about Cipriani's restaurant was poor at best. Breakfast was blindingly expensive. The food was sub-par. The wait staff was slow and inattentive.
The ugly..."Courtyard view" ??? Really ??? Look at the attached photo and make up your own mind.
For the world-class price they charge, the Sherry Netherland needs to up their game to compete favorably against other world-class hotels.

title: “Cannot ask for more!”
text: It is a hotel experience like this that makes you want to visit New York. A perfect location, combined with expansive rooms, wonderful service, and a beautiful view of Central Park will bring us back again soon. A last minute dinner, arranged quickly and courteously by Cipriani next door, made it a perfect stay for us. k and b, Boston

title: “Enjoyed my stay”
text: Free internet and free parking, always a good thing! I've paid as much as $14 for internet and $20 for parking at other places. I like the location - easy access to a major freeway but set away from the freeway so that you don't hear all that freeway noise, which can be annoying if you're a light sleeper. I like the room. The microwave and mini-fridge came in handy. The adjustable bed gets high marks from me. That along with the comfortable pillows made for a good night's sleep. Only negative comment would the a/c unit being a bit loud for my taste but then I'm never heard a really quiet one either. The most important thing for me is that I have a clean room and that indeed was the case. The lobby is nice and inviting. Nothing special in terms of staff service but still a job well done in check in and check out and housekeeping. There are plenty of restaurants around and a shopping mall just a few miles away. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: “Great location off Katy Freeway”
text: If you are looking for a hotel in the western part of Houston, this is a good choice. Easy access to the Katy Freeway but far enough from the road to be quiet. This hotel is only a few years old and I have stayed there 3 times. Weekend rates on priceline are under $50.

title: “great value option in west Houston / energy corridor”
text:
As long as you your dealings keep you west of the 610 loop, this is a great option - near the new City Centre complex, between routes 8 and 6, near the major oil companies, and surrounded by various dining options, though very limited entertainment or culture in the area. Very clean - new feel - ample parking (free) - and priced right. 
Highly recommend it.

title: “Very Nice Place, but you pay for it.”
text:
The hotel was very nice, put you definitely pay a premium for the location. Plenty of surcharges and city taxes and there is nothing inexpensive in the hotel. 15 bucks a day for WiFi is a scam.
The room was very clean, no complaints there at all.
The location is right next to the Convention center and there is a nice little park right by it. Again I guess location is everything.
The staff was extremely helpful, i would have to give them a 10 out of 10.

title: “Did it all”
text:
I was here for a conference in September. The location for that of course is excellent since you just need to walk over the skybridge right into the George Brown conference center.
I know the place was sold out but it never felt busy or cramped which is a good thing.
Rooms were average in size and don't really deliver a great view (but who comes to downtown Houston for the view anyways ?). 
I marked it average for value. Food in the hotel was at the pricier end for what you got (although the quality was good). I know I'd have been annoyed at being charged for internet (which you are), but luckily I inherited Hilton gold status thanks to my frquent flyer card and the internet was free...(The lesson here kids is travel 65000 miles a year in an cramped aluminium tube and you too can get free stuff).
Anyway it gets a recommendation from me. It did all I asked of it.

title: “Amazing Staff with one of the Best Customer Services in the industry.”
text: We had reservations for a couple of non-smoking connecting rooms at the Hilton Americas for the first weekend in October,2012. We were celebrating our daughter's 13th birthday and had invitated a few of her teenage girlfriends to stay for an overnight. We selected this weekend because we thought there were no concerts, conferences or conventions in town and the kids could enjoy the space without having to be over supervised. To our suprise upon arrival to the hotel, the lobby was packed with guest from a huge business convention. Also, the two non-smoking connecting rooms that we had reserved were not available due to past guest smoking inside one of the room. I was dissapointed and stress out as we were traveling with 7 teenage girls and was needing to come up with a plan B very quickly. Kaitlan at the front desk was very apologetic and extremely accomodating. After a long search, She found us a suite and a near by double queen bed room to accomodate our party. She helped with keeping the birthday cake refrigerated until it was needed . The hotel manager on staff, Mr. Ruben Wong was very professional and apologized for the inconvenience to both my husband and I. He went the extra mile by providing our party with valet parking at no cost. He sent a birthday card and a plate of chocolates and fruits to our daughter from the Hilton family making her feel special. We have stayed in many hotels around the world and my husband keeps elite levels status with different hotel chains and we have to say that we were definetly amazed with the First Class Customer Services provided to us by the Houston Hilton Americas. Other hotels should learn from this well trained hospitality staff. We will recommend the Houston Hilton Americas to friends and clients and we will back here for more stays.

title: “I always feel welcome and at home here!”
text: I've stayed at the Best Western Downtown Houston on so many occasions now, I thought it would only be fitting to send in my review. Over the last five years, I have come to know the hotel staff so well; we are all on a first-name basis; they recognize my voice when I call in to make a reservation. Feels like home almost. They receive high points for: cleanliness of the hotel (always), very close proximity to downtown Houston (literally two blocks away), friendly staff, pretty lively happy hour (at times). Very important is the feeling that I am always safe there; since I travel alone most times, this is a very good thing!

title: “Great hotel just outside of downtown Houston”
text: Great hotel just outside of downtown Houston. Very friendly staff, they remembered my name after two stays. Free shuttle to and from anywhere in the downtown area.

title: “I enjoyed my business at this hotel and the service was excellent.”
text: The service was excellent. The room was clean and neat. The location is very accessable to downtown and surrounding areas. The shuttle bus srevice was the best I have ever encountered.

title: “Perfect balance: location, value and first rate facilities”
text: My corporate group, including several clients, stayed at the BW Downtown while attending a large convention at the nearby convention center. Overall we a great experience. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean. The breakfast is plentiful. There is a shuttle bus that took us to the conference. In the evenings there is a complimentary happy hour for hotel guests. We found the staff professional and welcoming, by the end of our time in Houston we were on friendly terms. Overall, a great location if you're doing business in downtown Houston at a price point that includes amenities (breakfast, internet, shuttle bus).

title: “The staff accommodated our every need and gave outstanding service.”
text: I couldn't have asked for better service when many people in my family stayed at the Best Western Downtown Inn & Suites in Houston, TX. We were there for my son's wedding and stayed for 4 days. Jo, at the front desk, was amazing. She accommodated every request I had, starting with letting me check in early, and making sure I had an adjoining room to help with my young grandchildren. We were a large group and often took over the lobby and breakfast area and all the staff was always trying to make sure we had everything we needed. The entire staff was helpful, kind and very caring to our family. I will definitely go back there when I visit Houston and would highly recommend it to everyone.

title: “Modern, understated and CLEAN!”
text: Stayed in Houston with my husband over this last weekend and we just loved how comfy the Deluxe room was. We stayed on the 8th floor, but had a really nice view of the city and mall area. The bathroom was nothing less than palatial with the his/her sinks and the 2 separate shower/tub options. This is a really great room for two folks who hog the bathroom on a normal basis because you both can get cleaned up at the same time. Sadly, we didn't have time to enjoy the restaurant or other aspects of the hotel, but it's a really beautiful place in a very upscale looking part of Houston JUST off the freeway. We would DEFINITELY stay again and I'm pretty picky. The ONLY complaint is the $12 for daily parking, but that is expected when staying in a somewhat urban hotel - property is at a premium so they build UP rather than out with huge parking lots.

title: “They understand they are in the " customer service business"”
text:
We had booked this hotel after hours of research of hotels. What made use choose The Chatwal was the location, being close to Toys R' Us was very important to our boys. Having a pool was another reason, although the pictures lie and really do not show its 4x8 with a max of 4 people in the pool , it worked for us. The last reason was because of the reviews on this site. We arrived early and could not get in our room, not an issue they took our luggage and we went shopping. When we checked in I asked what type of beds were in our room and was told queen, when I got to the room later that night after wife checked in, I got into bed and realized they were not queen size. Went down to the front desk the next morning and the same girl was working that checked us in, I asked again what size the beds were, she again said queen, I said they were not, but that is what I booked when I called. After a call was made, she said they are not queen beds. I then proceeded to tell her we now have a problem, I booked queens, was told at check in they were queens and was paying for queens......I wasn't paying for something I wasn't getting. Manager was notified, he called my wife while son and I was at the Yankees and they said they didn't have any other rooms available for 4 , he called back and moved us to the penthouse., it was gorgeous and more than expected. We thank you for recognizing your error and correcting it.
Rooms are very cean, well appointed and high tech..the high tech was a bit over the top for me...keep it simple. Showers were great. Rooms were dead silent, didn't hear anything , amazing being that close to Times Square. Great location to Times Square and subway.
Elizabeth who was the woman that checked us in was incredible to my boys and wife, great personality and gorgeous as well. 
Manpreet the butler is second to no one, pressed all our clothes and made us feel like royalty....he is one of a kind.
Concierge was very helpful and doorman were on top of everything when they saw you.
Great hotel and service. I could have dwelled on the negative start but you could tell they truly cared about customer service and in today's works that lacking in many businesses.

title: “Luxury Hotel”
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my recent stay at the Iroquois. The staff were courteous, helpful and polite, the location is perfect and the James Dean suite exceeded my expectations. I didn't get a chance to sample the Triomphe but make sure to check out the authentic Greek fare at the nearby Kellari Taverna. Red Flame Diner is great for breakfast.

title: “Oh Dear .........”
text:
There is a downside to Tripadvisor that shows its face occasionally - a self fulfilling prophecy, here's how it works.......................
An average hotel / service / (whatever) gets some good reviews and the Manager responds to the reviews with kind words to the reviewer and more follow, the hotel climbs the popularity ladder and then people start to choose it because its near the top. To get in on the 'love fest' action they then also write good reviews and get fawned on by the management etc etc etc even though its in relaity no better than other similar products.
Suprisingly the one "I don't get it" review gets no management response - so this perfectly adequate hotel becomes the 4th best in Houston - really ????? This is a sub-brand chain hotel in office central, how can that be ?
I have stayed here quite a few times as well as the Courtyard Marriot just across the way - I like the HGI slightly more, the Courtyard is marginally less nice overall but it is 194 in the ranking which would make this HGI just above that so here's and honest review of this hotel - stayed here 3 nights this week.
Check-in - friendly enough but nothing special no welcome back etc, interestingly some colleagues didn't get the free breakfast coupons that come with our company rate here - arguements ensued and end result they didn't get them apparently because they had booked through an agent ...........just as I had and received them - get it sorted guys !
Rooms - nice enough but a bit dated, really think these chains should have central air con, hate the noisy wall / window units
Cleanliness - had a good look round as others have waxed lyrical, clean enough I suppose but lots of corners not vacumed, same in bathroom so pretty average.
Bed - really like these adjustable ones
Toiletries replaced sometimes
Wireless - really slow in higher rooms, spoke to reception to see if anything could be done and the answer was its working ok
Food - absolutley average, really nothing great to write home about, usually choose to eat out for that reason
Breakfast - didn't bother to use my vouchers as last time cooked was very greasy so has put me off
Check-in staff general - always felt I was breaking in on some gossip as I passed and it went quiet a couple of times, no friendly hello's etc - pretty poor really.
So, all in all a really average hotel that thinks its one of the top ones in Houston and clearly isn't - can we have some more honest and realistic reviews on here please to stop this kind of thing from happening and maybe some consideration of what can actually be done better by management so they actually try.

title: “Another great value”
text: Very clean, very comfortable, great price . . . I will stay there again for sure.

title: “Only okay”
text: I had read the other reviews when selecting this hotel, but once I got there, I couldn't figure out what the big deal was. Sure, it was clean, and yes, it was quiet, but the food wasn't all that great. As far as toiletries go, just average. Service was fine. When they couldn't book me into the room I had requested, I received a free breakfast voucher. Overall, it was fine, but I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here and probably won't again.

title: “We packed this hotel and it was still fine”
text: Stayed here for a huge conference in early October that basically took over the entire city. Hotel is perfectly situated for basketball/baseball games and conference center events. There were some minor cleanliness issues- some junk in the hallways and the lobby bathroom being pretty dirty at 6am one day. Rooms have pretty much everything you need and have a nice modern decor. A corkscrew/ bottle opener in the room would have been nice though but the front desk provided one right away. Otherwise well laid out for the business traveller. The gym/pool on the top floor offer great views and there is an open deck that is great to hang out on in the evenings. At peak times the 12 elevators have a little trouble keeping up when the hotel is full- modern elevators should sense when they are near capacity and not stop at every floor to pick up passengers. Because of that and the road closures around the hotel for our conference I would like to apologize to the other guests -especially the weddings going on-that were likely pretty inconvenienced by us being there. Food and drink not cheap here either- including the coffee shop but the service was very quick and very friendly. Overall if I was back in town I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

title: “Service delivered perfectly.”
text: In a world where good manners have faded from the common scene and thorough training of hospitality sector employees lacking, here is an oasis. A sense of genuine caring was part of every service from bellman and front desk staff, to housekeeping. This is primarily a large convention hotel. You would never know it from service delivery. On entering the room forst assigned, it did not seem perfectly fresh. The bellman, hotel clerk and manager made the quickest correction possible, with all the grace you could imagine. This manager should be cloned. The visit restored my hope that we can experience this quality of service in 2012. I am a picky traveller. This stay was lovely.

title: “No issues”
text: No issues at this Hilton. My room was fine and was clean and quiet. The self-parking is across the road and there are not obvious signs identifying it as Hilton parking. The only surprise was the 17% tax on the room. The attached convention centre leaves much to be desired, though.

title: “One of the best”
text:
Great location,great staff,amazing rooms and bathrooms, quiet with no noise at all, all in all brilliant. One of the best value rooms for location,service,comfort(the beds were excellent),service etc etc
Located just on 5th Avenue opposite Central park and a block away from the Apple store and FAO Swchartz , but very quiet. All of the staff were excellent and it really felt like a home from home. Small but nice touches included free soft drinks and water in the mini bar, with fresh flowers and chocolates.
A great stay and we will definitely return

title: “Good Location”
text: Good location close to Central park and in easy walking distance of most attractions. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite overlooking Central park,which helped to make our stay special.Warm welcome,friendly staff and good service. The only downside was the small lobby with no "common area" where you could easily get a drink or cup of coffee. The restaurant (Harry Cipriani's) which was attached to the hotel was a bit fromal and stuffy if you just wanted a cool drink,as we did in the recent heat wave- no shorts allowed,not even late afternoon before dining starts.Other than that, lovely stay.

title: “Service/Location=Great!”
text:
Our stay at the Sherry (Sept. 17-20) was wonderful. The hotel is steps away from Central Park, FAO, and Bergdorffs. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Any request was immediately taken care of. The rooms are larger than the average NYC hotel. The restaurant and bar are well worth the visit. We felt as if we were a guest at a fabulous home instead of a hotel. Warm and welcoming! Stocked mini bar in the room and umbrellas for the rainy days.
The beds were very comfortable.
We will be back.

title: “Great location, spacious suite and great service!”
text:
We just stayed at the San Carlos for 4 nights last week. This hotel is perfectly situated, in mid-town just a short walk to Lex/53rd subway, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite, which includes 2 queen beds, plus a fold-out couch in the adjoining sitting area. The space was perfect for our family of 2 adults and 3 kids. Each morning we were able to go down to the lobby for an included continental breakfast. While the breakfast was nothing fancy, it did include pastries, toast, cereal, as well as yogurt and cottage cheese to go with the coffee, tea, hot chocolate and assorted juice. It was definitely sufficient to get us through to an early lunch.
The only draw-back was that the windows are pretty thin, and since our room was overlooking the street, we were able to hear all of the traffic outside. But we just chalked that up to being in a busy city and it did not bother us too much.
We'll definitely stay at the San Carlos for any future visits to New York City!

title: “Spacious, perfect location, great for family of 4!”
text: San Carlos did not disappoint! We chose this hotel for our 4 day getaway to NYC based on the reviews and ratings from tripadvisor. First time to New York. Location was perfect for us -- 20 minute walk to Central Park or Time Square. Just a few blocks from Rockafeller Center (try Top of the Rock - spectacular views!!). LOTS of shopping nearby. Very safe neighborhood, felt comfortable going out late. Staff was wonderful at every level. Clean and quiet. Free WiFi. We had one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds plus sofabed, Bedroom was very spacious, lots of pillows, desk and chair and separate A/C controls. Sofabed was fairly comfortable and big enough for my 17 year old son. Tons of storage space incl. 2 closets. Refrig was nice size. Small sitting area with table and two chairs was a plus for eating takeout. Living room was great size with huge TV. Bathroom on small side but not a big deal for us. Breakfast was enough to start the day. Never had to wait for elevator. Parking right next door - get ticket voucher from front desk for $30/day. A 24 hour McDonalds is across the street and a drugstore is only 2 blocks for convenience food/drinks. Had a slight problem with TV the first night - they sent someone within 5 minutes and took care of it. Will absolutely stay here again and again...loved it!

title: “New York family gathering from Scotland”
text: Hotel great location to all amenities Times square broadway etc, staff very friendly, executive suite clean plenty of room, quiet so great nights sleep. Complimentary coffee in the morning very good and, Red Flame Diner two down from hotel great for breakfast. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: “Great location”
text:
I was there for a wedding- the hotel is expensive, but definitely meets and exceeds expectations. Lovely experience. Staff was friendly and quickly repaired a mis charge with no hassle. 
Great accessible shopping and a variety of great restaurants in the neighborhood!

title: “Great staff, great accomodations”
text: We spent a weekend at the Eventi while visiting our daughter. We were welcomed by a friendly, accomodating staff who arranged for our luggage to be stored due to an early arrival. Once we were checked in later, we found a sleek, European style hotel room (a bit small which is usual for NYC) with robes and slippers, flat screen TV, and all other amenities. The glass enclosed shower was convenient and clean. The hotel also boasts a spa, fitness center, restaurant and bar, and a veranda which looked spectacular, but which was closed due to cold weather. Complimentary wine was available from 5-6pm. The hotel is pet friendly, and was populated with a myriad of dogs (many of which we expected were pets of families displaced by Hurricane Sandy). All staff members greeted us warmly. We felt like welcomed guests. It is a bit pricey, however. We were fortunate to get a deal through a discount website. Check it out!

title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
text: My Husband and I stayed at the Chatwal Labor day weekend 2012. I have traveled allot and stayed at many hotels over the years, this is the best hotel I ever stayed at! The service was amazing the room was very clean and the bathroom blew me away with heated toilet seats and a bathroom mirror that turned into a t.v. I am looking foward to returning to NY to be able to stay at The Chatwal again.

title: “Luxury with a personal touch”
text: We had an amazing experience from start to finish. The hospitality throughout is unsurpassed. We enjoyed all the extras great espresso in the room, complimentary refreshments in the fridge, amazing dark chocolate, housekeeping with pressing of 5 pieces of clothing daily, and complimentary shoeshine and newspaper of your choice. There is also no set check out time so you can leisurely utilize your room until your departure time. Our room 1011 had a great view of the Empire State Building and the bedding and shower were fantastic. Also the car service is awesome. Anytime you can ride in a Maserati you're having a good day and the driver Jack was great. If you can afford it I would highly recommend. Thank you Setai for making our stay a perfect memory. We will be back! Also a special thank you to our personal assistant Narissa she went out of her way to make my wife and I anniversary amazing.

title: “Great Location, right near NYC Library and Grand Central Station”
text:
A little pricey but well worth it. Absolutely no complaints with the room. Bathroom setup was top knotch. 
We really appreciated the location. With the Fifth to Madison block being short, it was a short walk to readily catch a cab uptown(on Madison) or downtown(on Fifth). We found 'Essen, A NYC quick restaurant around the corner on Madison a great place to grab a cheap and healthy bite to eat on our way out for the day.

title: “Different take on NYC”
text: Instead of the hustle and bustle of Midtown, stay on the Upper West side in a more residential area that still has lots of life! Hotel Beacon is right across the street from a faboulous food market and cafe and still has plenty of shopping and great restaurants around. The hotel is comfortable. It is a boutique hotel so no restaurant or other typical hotel amenities, but you stay there for its location and comfort AND affordably priced! We had a suite. I slept on the pull-out sofa bed...I think the bed was broken but I was able to sleep sideways so as to not fall into the couch!! I suspect that this is not typical of their sofa beds and that I just got a lemon. But dividing a suite by 3 or 4 people makes it very affordable. We loved the neighborhood surrounding it too! Easy to get to Central Park.

title: “Great Area,Great Hotel”
text:
