Selecting a hotel in New York is always a challenge - mostly old properties, insanely expensive, smallish rooms and most top recommendations on TA are around Times Square (not necessarily a bad thing, but some may not like living there).
Andaz is a welcome change!
Getting there / location
-----------------------------
Its right on Fifth Ave, opposite the NY library. So not very busy, but still very centrally located (on 5th, close to Grand Central, we also walked it to Penn Station - though you may be better off taking a cab).
Check-in
-----------
Very quick. It doesn't have much of a lobby, but frankly I rather have large rooms than large common areas. 
Rooms
---------
We were two couples with a kid each, so we got the 2BR suite, which is highly recommended. It cheaper than getting two rooms, and its HUGE. Two nice rooms, with views of the library, empire state, and huge living room with TV etc and dining area. Very sweet!
Room service
------------------
Quick and efficient. They also have free internet and also restock the room bar with non-alco beverages and some snacks twice a day for free. All of these expenses would other wise add up, so factor this in mind which comparing room rates across hotels.
Also, best to book via the Hyatt website. You may get some sweet deals.
The summary is that its a great hotel. It is a new property, which means everything is new, its well located and has good service. Plus you earn Hyatt points!
Highly recommended

title: “Good for turists and for families”
text:
The Beacon Hotel in New York is situated very close to the 72.nd Street metro station and thus only one stop from Times Square. The rooms we had were very large and had a small kitchen that allows you to either prepare a meal or to bring take out and eat in comfort in the room. We found the room clean – the only animals we encountered were the little dogs that some people on the lower floors have. We did have a problem with the air condition system – but after four tries it was corrected on the fourth day of our stay. We found the staff very friendly – naturally somewhat busy as it is a large hotel. The elevators don’t work properly. Almost every day one of the three elevators was out of order and under repair, and we had one incident were the elevator wouldn’t stop. A bit scary. As we lived on the 10.th floor that was a problem –especially on the day we left as we had to take the elevator going up from the 10.th floor with the luggage as it was always full when stopping on the way down. That has to be fixed.
There are so many restaurants nearby – from the little diner Viand next door ideal for breakfast to Luxembourg on 70.d and Coppola on 79.th
The room was quiet – we asked for a view but didn’t get it – I take the view must be wonderful from the top floors. For a morning jog the central park is very close.
There is free internet in the hotel even in the rooms– more hotels should think this way! 
Adding to this the convenient situation of Fairways – a very good supermarket across the street - it was a good experience to stay at the Beacon – with a few flaws.
We will certainly return.

title: “Loved, loved, LOVED IT!”
text: Could not possibly say enough wonderful things about this hotel! We stayed in the suite - and were so impressed my husband took VIDEO of the place! **THREE** closets in this suite - one of them a walk in! Seriously, splurge for the suite if you can...

title: “Great Hotel, in a great location.”
text:
This review is a little late since we stayed there in July. 
This was our third trip to NYC, absolutely love this city and our first time at this hotel. We try to stay in a different area each time we come. We loved the Beacon Hotel, it has a fabulous location on Broadway and 75th, and as others have said it's in more of a residential area. The subway is a short walk away, 2 small blocks to be exact and there is a supermarket across the road. The apartment we stayed in was immaculate and spacious with a kitchenette and a lovely view . We are from Australia and I couldn't believe the amount of Aussies that were staying at this hotel, it was like a little piece of home in the biggest city in the world. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to New York, really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and throughly recommend it.

title: “A disappointment.”
text:
Stayed here one night to celebrate my birthday. Service was outstanding, from the front desk to the spa to the in-room servers. The spa (which I visit frequently) was lovely as always - every masseuse I've had is excellent and the ambience is very nice (despite the fact that you have to walk through the gym area when going between the spa waiting room and the massage rooms). 
Unfortunately, everything else was subpar. The room decor was uninspiring; the layout was ineffective; the curtains were difficult to maneuver; the carpet was stained throughout the entire suite; the toliet dripped endlessly. The one nice thing I'll say about the room is the bed was pretty comfortable (not the best I've slept on, though). The in-room dining was soooo disappointing. It took more than an hour to arrive, was incredibly expensive, and just plain wasn't good. I did not enjoy eating it. The entire hotel experience was not at all worthy of the cost - more than $400.00 for one night with room service for 1 - and left me feeling disappointed that I spent my birthday there.
I did not use the pool or fitness area so can't comment on those.

title: “The best service in Houston.”
text: This Hotel went well beyond good service to the three young children in our party. They were treated as little queens and will always remember their stay. The spa offered an ice cream spa service for the kids at a super price. The driver took us to a local venue for a play and then cam back and picked us up afterwards. We had a minor issue with a leak from the air conditioner in our room. While we were at the pool housekeeping moved all of our stuff to another room and placed it in the exact same spot in our new room. That is service.

title: “Thank you for making our wedding stay a bliss”
text:
The Four Seasons Houston has served the best type of service to my wedding block that stayed at the hotel between 5-7 nights. 
The level of service, the personal touches, attention to detail and not to forget the smile on their faces have made my wedding week including pre, day of and post celebrations a FANTASTIC one.
I had the pleasure to deal with some of the greatest people working at the hotel and worth recognizing . Sarah Smith , Jodi Doughty, Maria Lopez, Michelle Smith and many more who have adorned our special occasion and made us feel at home with a Four Seasons touch.
I would recommend the Four Seasons Hotel , not only for it's location and phenomenal spa but also for the staff that are making the guests' stay a memorable one !

title: “Attention to Details”
text: My stay with the Hotel ICON was very good. The interior of the hotel was beautiful. It had a unique level of early 20th Century luxury. The details of the hotel were exquisite. Some dating as far back as 1911. The streetcars moving about gave you the feel of San Francisco without the hills. I would also like to mention a few things in particular that I noticed but are not reasons to not stay at this hotel: (1) None of the staff, i.e. front desk, valet, concierge...etc. I encountered had on name badges; therefore, I could not address them by name or single anyone out for providing good service; (2) I did not like not having easy access to ice. You had to call the front desk for ice; (3) The hotel did not have a gift shop on site. I have a tradition of sending post cards from places I've visited and getting "shot glasses" for family and friends. Unfortunately, I had to venture out to get these items. It would have been convenient to purchase them from the hotel gift shop. Overall, my experience at this hotel was very, very good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others traveling to this area.

title: “Excellent Service and Pretty Rooms - Dont Let the Bummer Reviews Turn You Away”
text:
Truth is I was a lit apprehensive to stay here when I read the other reviews of it being out of date. The room I got (splurge for the Jacuzzi) was gorgeous. I really like super modern "W" like hotels but this was a very satisfying substitute. Yes, there are some more vintage parts of it but it makes it stylish not a creepy "red rum redrum" type of place. 
The staff were great...the valet and shuttle guys were very responsive, the bartender was very nice and made you fee comfortable to a be a girl alone at the bar. And Erica, Miss Erica...was a gem! She was part smiling and lovely front desk expert, concierge, and restaurant critic. The other front desk staff were just as helpful when I talked to them but Erica seems to be there all of the time so make sure to ask for her. I made several (daily) special requests and they were on it. 
I did not use the spa so can't comment on that. I had the breakfast every day which was good. The rest of food from room service to lunch and appetizers was fair to good (although DO NOT have the gumbo). 
I would say this area of downtown is the best for short stays. there are enough restaurants to walk to in pinch and you will be happy with them. But take the hotel up on the shuttle and explore downtown for some of the excellent restaurants that are more than a mile. The shuttle is very usefull, just don't count on it to be readily available if you need to be somewhere asap because they are super busy.

title: “Would not revisit”
text: Regular rooms are very small, cramped with furnishings and dark. The beds are hard and the lighting is horrible. The elevators are the slowest in town and you can expect a five to ten minute wait. If you eat in the dining area, do not expect much in the service or food.

title: “An Icon-ic Weekend Stay”
text: We spent last weekend at the Hotel Icon Houston (part of Marriott's Autograph Collection) and it was a real pleasure to stay in this historic property. We liked its proximity to the Wortham Theater where we attended the Houston Ballet. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful...including using the hotel car to take us to and from the theater...certainly better than trying to park in the Wortham garage. Rooms are spacious and traditional...colors are interesting without being over powering...they've capitalized on the history of the building (a bank dating from 1912) but kept a light touch. We enjoyed both breakfast and dinner in the Line and Lariat Restaurant...again, a great staff and excellent food. Drinks in the bar were very good but a tad over priced.

title: “Great location and setting”
text:
Nice boutique hotel with modern decor. Quite new. Wonderful continental breakfast buffett with lots of fresh fruit, quality pastries, cereals, yogurt (even Greek yogurt). Staff will even make capuccino, latte for you (gratis). Next to a small-medium meeting area.
Location is great - City Centre is a new mixed used area with restaurants, shops, etc. On the Friday evening that I was there, there was a live band with many families, couples, etc.

title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
text: Rooms are nice and relaxing, staff very helpful, breakfast really good (mostly fresh fruit). The bars and restaurants surrounding the Sorella make planning your evening very easy.

title: “Great location for a night out”
text:
We had a perfect night in this great hotel. It's surrounded by a lot of good restaurants and shopping. The rooms our very well done and the bathrooms are big with a great shower.
From our room we can see the whole city skyline so it's got great views from the upper floors.

title: “A Pleasant Stay In The Center Of The City”
text:
This Hotel is hard to find but once you find it you will be pleased. Free parking right next door. Once you arrive you don't have to go anywhere....conference rooms and restaurants are within the complex.
Overall service was excellent and rooms were high quality and clean.
just a few flaws that need to be mentioned.....no morning paper at your door. Fitness Center is not well designed. Both treadmills were extremely noisy because the TV was attached poorly to the top of them. All equipment have TV's but it is difficult to get them to operate properly. As I was having problems getting my TV to work the man next to me said he spends many nights at this facility and the TV's are always giving Fitness Center users problems.

title: “Always excellent service”
text: Although this Hilton is not a five star property, I gave it the high ranking due to the extreme efficiency, pleasantness and attentiveness of the staff. My wife and I always stay here when visiting. This hotel is part of the hospitality college and so most of the staff are students who are learning everything about hotels. What they bring to the table that an average hotel doesn't is their enthusiasm! They are always ready to bend over backwards and offer better service than when I stayed at several 4-star properties. The food at Eric's, the restaurant, is excellent and the rooms are very adequate. Location wise it is on the campus so it is perfect for trips to UH and the parking fee and taxes are average for hotels in Houston. Unfortunately, the city has high hotel taxes. This place is always welcoming, go for the staff, you will be blown away.

title: “Yikes, not a flagship property”
text:
I'm curious why the Hilton at university of hospitality (part of U of H) isn't nicer. I would think that this hotel would be at a higher standard given it's association with the school of hospitality.
I've been here before, but last time i had a suite. This time I'm in what they probably refer to as the standard room. It's tiny. There are two beds thrown in here along with a TV so small, i think it might be a fossil. The air conditioner sounds like a 747 getting ready for takeoff (and blows right onto the bed, that's pleasant!) and the noise outside in the hall was pretty bad. Everything is pretty worn, their bedding is old fashioned (coverlets) and i think they are just ready for a soft goods rehab.
The wireless connectivity works well here and that is the saving factor.
I've heard horror stories of colleagues of mine with severe ant infestations in their rooms and in our conference rooms but i haven't seen them myself, so i can't confirm that.

title: “Excellent for a shcool”
text: What people need to realize is that this is a teaching hotel. Since it is a part of the university, almost all of the staff are students. They pretty much run the hotel, and the restaurants. They also welcome constructive criticism, because it helps them in the learning process. Having worked in the hotel and amusement park industry, I have realized that running one of these babies is really, really hard work. These kids are working their heinies off for no pay (execpt for the university's tuition). And you can get a great deal on food when you go to the student run dinners, and you will be doing a good deed, AND getting brownie points. Who doesn't want those?

title: “Fabulous Dining”
text:
This is my second stay at the Hilton, we
spent the weekend in Houston visiting our son at the University of Houston. One doesn't need to leave the campus for food, dining at Eric's is a fabulous treat, the food is devine, the service impecable and the atmosphere is relaxing.
I recommend Eric's as one of the top places to eat in Houston.

title: “A must visit at the right price”
text:
First off, the price for this place on a weekend was a steal. If you can get rooms for $119-$130 a night, it is extremely worth it. Hopefully they don't raise them too high, but this hotel could probably easily be priced much higher, but then again they are the experts so they know what they're doing. They attracted me, didn't they? 
We stayed a Friday and Saturday night, three day weekend in Houston. The only major downside would have to be that it's on the Katy Freeway, so coming in on Friday from the east can be a pain, unless you take the beltway around. Exit I-10 East from the Beltway all the way on the west side of town and you get your own dedicated exit to Gessner and the hotel. Made things much easier than coming across straight on I-10. 
Valet parking isn't cheap. You can park yourself for cheaper. But the valet staff was really helpful and professional. You won't be disappointed using them. 
Checking in was about as painless as I've ever experienced, plus they registered me into their rewards program too, didn't take long at all. The elevators are key access above the third floor for added security. Most modern hotels have this. 
The room was only a traditional yet it was much larger than I was imagining. On the 7th floor. It had an excellent view, large floor to ceiling windows. It had a good size refrigerator. The bathroom shower had two shower heads. The tub didn't drain very quickly, but it wasn't an issue for me. Also, the phone calls to valet were very staticy. Wish wifi or computer access was free. Read that it wasn't, but we didn't use it, so I can't totally say for certain. 
There is an open patio area on the 18th floor, hot tub, infinity pool that is 3-4 feet, large sitting area and fitness area. It was really nice and the breeze for a late spring day was great. In winter, it could get cold up there. 
I didn't eat in the hotel besides the bar snacks so I can't rate the food. The bar, 024, was superb. Great service and drinks for reasonable prices to other major bars in major cities. 
The location is really great. It's off Gessner at Memorial City Mall. There is a skybridge to the mall. They have Target, Macy's, Apple Store, sports stores, etc. For food, they have a food court, plus a sports bar, California Pizza Kitchen, Cheesecake Factory and a Tex Mex place although it was more like line up service, not a traditional restaurant. 
Noise wasn't an issue in the room. I heard an ambulance once for the nearby hospital. Storms came through and although I could see the lightning, I never heard the thunder. The beds are very comfortable, a ton of pillows, too many for me. And the bedspread kind of got me hot but I just kicked it off. The bed itself was very comfortable. Huge flat panel tv also with a lot of channels. 
On the weekend, the drive on the Katy wasn't a problem at all into the city. You won't regret staying here, especially for the price. I'd say anything under $180-200 is good, under $130-140 is great at this place.

title: “Good hotel and function venue”
text: Stayed here for a week with a work conference and had no complaints. Modern, well appointed rooms, friendly staff. Complimentary and flexible shuttle in local area. Only suggestion I would have is for some other eating and dining options in the hotel, but there are ALS plenty of options in the nearby area.

title: “Very nice Westin in the Houston Area”
text:
Terrific room, Executive Suite upgrade.
Very clean. Mini fridge. Kitchenette, living space, 2 bathrooms, nice bed.
Slept well, quiet. 
8th floor, and still nice and quiet. Many windows. Good tv reception. Internet fairly good.
Pictures enclosed in review.
Room service very good.

title: “Highly Recommend”
text: I was exhausted and felt like it would be unsafe for me to make the 30 mile drive home from work. Sonny, at the front desk, offered to send their shuttle van to pick me up. All areas of the hotel are clean and modern. The hot breakfast is better than most. I have recently stayed in several 5 star hotels. The room/bed was every bit as nice. If you don't require the fancy restaurants and services of one of the 4-5 star hotels in downtown Houston, you will NOT be disappointed with this location. This hotel is a couple of blocks from the western edge of downtown Houston and very easily accessible. What you will not get is parking and traffic headaches.

title: “Good hotel overall”
text: This hotel has friendly staff, big clean rooms, free WiFi, confortable beds, excellent shuttle bus. However the breakfast is a polystyrene+cook your own waffles thing - which does not match the price or quality of the hotel. The location is good if you have a car but hopeless otherwise as the area seems completely restaurant-free.

title: “not bad at all!”
text: We stayed one nite for an early Valentine's Day trip. Check in and out was quick and painless, the property is clean and maintained. We missed the happy hour (which is 2 drinks per person, either wine or beer) but we made it to the breakfast, which was fine. Cereal, juices, fruit, yogurt, waffles, sausage,eggs, etc. The pool looked nice, but small and the weather kept us from it. The room(king suite) was very large and looks just like the pictures online. Didnt have much personality, but good nonetheless. Had an elevator and many different vending machines, ice machines, and laundry area. Right on the edge of downtown, close to aquarium, restaurants, etc. Paid close to $200 which was a bit much, but it was clean and everything worked! And parking was free.

title: “Decent, functional, exactly what I expected”
text:
Functional hotel, nothing elegant but clean, comfortable and spacious; decent value for the location at $197 incl taxes.
Positives:
- Big, clean & well appointed suite with comfortable bed, living area, full cable tv, iron & board.
- Free wi-fi internet
- Courteous & helpful staff
- Decent breakfast included
- Quiet location
- Outdoor hot-tub
Negatives:
- Location only 10 min walk from downtown, but you have to negotiatie a busy free way & according to the receptionist it could be dodgy at night
- Pool is small & had twigs in it

title: “Everything's bigger in Texas & friendly service at this hotel is HUGE!”
text: I was wowed over and over by the friendly, professional service and felt very valued while staying for several nights at this excellent downtown hotel. EVERY employee encountered from the front desk, housekeeping, exercise room, security, restaurant, concierge, bellman, general manager, etc. exhibited a professional and friendly attitude. How do you have such an amazing staff who come across with such sincerity. KUDOs to staff. And your hotel is clean, comfy beds, great location. This Hilton rocks! Thank you and however you do it, keep it up!

title: “Loved this hotel !! Incredible customer service!”
text: Was here on a business trip for 6 days and couldn't have asked for a more beautiful, convenient and customer service oriented facility! WOW! From the housekeeping to the waitstaff to the front desk folks, they were all superb. Darrell at the customer service picked me up emotionally after a very long, exhausting week with his contagious smile, quick wit and friendliness!! Thanks Darrell !!! Will be back.

title: “Excellent Service”
text: The front desk staff really stood out for their friendliness and welcoming demeanor. The roof terrace was a great place to relax and smoke a cigar, with a nice view of the skyline... Rarely have I stayed at a hotel that made me feel like more than just a reservation number; this hotel is very well managed and the staff is excellent.

title: “Not to be missed!”
text: Wow-I really enjoyed this Hilton Garden Inn because the rooms, bar, food, and service was impeccable. LaLa was a big help and provided excellent customer service. This was another business trip for me and I would recommend it to any business traveller or vacationer.

title: “Convenient for Westlake”
text: Handy for Westlake with very friendly pick-up service from Westlake. For those without hire car, the hotel has a bar and restaurant serving nice food.

title: “Fantastic top notch property”
text: Brought two soccer teams here to stay for the weekend for a tournament. The hotel staff was outstanding from minute one and never once dropped the ball. Had stayed here once before and had a good experience so chose this hotel again for that reason. The property is beautiful, kept immaculately clean and very well appointed. The staff is outstanding and the level of service is better than many larger or competitor properties that I have stayed in. Rooms are comfortable, have microwaves, refrigerators and coffee in the rooms. Nice fitness center and even a guest laundry. Good location and easy access to the highway and the businesses in the area. I will stay here again and again anytime I am in the area.

title: “Very nice hotel!”
text:
I was greeted at the front desk by a sweet woman named La-La. In fact she spoke to me each time I passed through after checking in! I was very impressed with the cleanliness and comfort of my room and bathroom. 
The breakfast ranks up there with some of the top hotel breakfasts I've ever eaten. So many selections! I selected your hotel for 4 reasons: Location, price, trip-advisor reviews and responses from your general manager. 
I wish I had another excuse to visit Houston so I could stay here again!

title: “This is Where we will ALWAYS Stay”
text:
Over the last 6 years we have stayed at the San Carlos Hotel at least 4 times. In between we tried a few different hotels which were good but ended up returning to the San Carlos because, as a whole, nothing can beat it. All personnel treat you like royalty and the rooms are beyond clean (I am a germaphobe) and updated. The continental breakfast suffices if you're not a big hot breakfast person (they have yogurts, danishes, cold cereals, apples, cottage cheese and hot drinks as well as juice).
The rooms are quite large and well laid out and you can't beat the location with an easy walk to TImes Square and Central Park.
We decided to stop trying out other hotels - this will be our destination for our yearly trip to NYC.
I accidently rated the spa and pool, both of which I don't know if they have.

title: “Can't wait to return to The Iroquois”
text: Absolutely wonderful experience at The Iroquois. The location is second to none, with Times Square and 5th Avenue seconds away and Central Park a 10 minute walk. The area always felt safe, even when returning to the hotel late at night. Iroquois Hotel staff were exceptional - friendly, knowledgeable, welcoming and efficient. Given our extended stay we were upgraded to a Deluxe Room which was spacious enough (for the location), very clean and tastefully decorated. The bed was also really, really comfortable! Major bonus points for the Molten Brown toiletries. Thanks to all at The Iroquois for an amazing vacation, we can't wait to come back.

title: “Good location. Hotels grows on you”
text:
We arrived at the hotel at one in the morning after a flight from Europe and are first impressions were of just how brown and unboutique like the hotel was. We had a std room which was small but once you got past the brownness of it, which I think automatically makes it look shabby, was very clean, we'll laid out and with a very comfortable bed. 
We were ther three nights and by the end, the room we found the room ok. The big selling points for us were the location, which couldn't be better plus free wifi and that it was clean and quiet. We were with a couple in a superior room that seemed less brown probably because it was bigger and therefore less overpowering. Fair value for money, although might stay next door at the Sofitel if I got a good deal when we go back. 
Staff very friendly and helpful

title: “Excellent experience”
text:
Perfect location for a quiet night's sleep in the city~ but close to great shopping and activity~!
(42nd Street is a block away~)
Thanks to Leonore for recommending her favorite store - Barami~
Cant wait to return~

title: “Perfect setting for a trip to NYC”
text:
My wife and I tagged a short three day stay to a business trip and were not disappointed. The front of house staff were attentive at all times and very friendly. They were most apologetic that we arrived early and our room was not ready!! Not a problem as we could take a short walk up 6th. 
The room was superb as on previous trips to NYC I had found the rooms very cramped. The views of The Empire State Building and down 6th were quite awesome. I particularly liked the very comfortable bed and pillows - quite the best hotel bed I have slept on.
I enjoyed being just that bit out of the hustle of Time Square.
I would recommend this hotel to all.

title: “Bar closes at 10pm!”
text:
Stayed at the Eventi as part of a business trip. Like most NYC hotels it is expensive, but for the money it didn't quite live up to my expectations. The rooms are small by US standards and felt a little cramped. I kept knocking my legs against the bed due to the lack of space. The bed was comfortable, and had all the usual amenities including wifi. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially the porters. Did not eat at the hotel, and did not manage to take advantage of the free wine reception each night, but it was a nice touch that the hotel offered this.
The location of the hotel was good, near subways and just 5 minutes from the Empire State Building. Times Square is within walking distance - around 30 minutes away. 
The strangest thing about this hotel was that the hotel bar shut at 10pm. I have never been anywhere with such an early closing time, and to find that hotel in a 24 hour a day kind of city such as New York was really surprising. It was disappointing not to be able to have a quick drink after being out for the evening. 
Overall, it is a classy hotel - it just did not "wow" me as much as I was hoping or expecting.

title: “High praise for The Chatwal”
text: Rarely does on find an establishment that is as well managed a beautifully appointed and inviting as The Chatwal is. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by and attended to by polite and efficient personnel from the doormen and valets, to the front desk and bellmen, to the bartendeders and waiters, to room service and the domestic staff they offered some of the finest service we have experienced anywhere. The Chatwal is just a block and a half off Times Square, and yet it is something of an oasis. This well maintained and historic property has been beautifully rennovated and offers luxury ammenities and services.

title: “Great stay, location & experience!”
text:
We chose The Chatwal due to its location right off Times Square, but what a wonderful welcome we had when we checked in, the staff were friendly and courteous throughout our stay and we were more then pleased with our room and the quietness. 
The hotel and room were fabulously unkept and we felt extremely safe during our stay in NYC, in order to go up or down, you'll have to swipe your room kaycard, so don't forget it or lock yourself out of your room, it happened to us, but they sent concierge right up with a new card!
We didn't use the spa service or have time to try the restaurant, so can't comment on those, but with the service you get at this hotel, I'm sure those services are exquisite as well!
If I were to ever visit NYC again, I would definitely come back to The Chatwal!
Thanks everyone for the great experience and stay.

title: “Fantastic Experience”
text:
The Chatwal in New York City was the Hotel that my wife and I chose for our honeymoon.
The hotel experience was beyond wonderful. The staff was incredibly attentive and extremely warm and friendly. The front desk staff namely Ms. Cardona always greeted us with a warm smile and was extremely friendly and was first and formost our welcoming committee when we left and returned. The room was magnificent to say the least.The concierge was extremely knowledgable and guided us towards some fantastic meals. The only negative thing that we could say was that we hated to leave. They trul;y made our honeymoon a time to remember and I would highly recommend The Chatwal for anyone traveling to New York. We WILL DEFINITELY GO BACK and are already planning our next trip there. 
Terri and Charles

title: “Fabulous hotel”
text:
Myself and my husband stayed at this gorgeous hotel for a 3 night stay for my 40th birthday and all I can say is what an amazing stay. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a superior room with no extra charge my husband had been in contact with the hotel staff Kelly in particular and had arranged for flowers, balloons, champagne and strawberries as a surprise in the room and they were gorgeous. Our room was excellent with a view of the Empire State Building. The next day we were offered another upgrade to a suite at an excellent rate of $100 per night and as it was a special occasion we thought why not as the suite was amazing.
The Saturday was my birthday and as another surprise the hotel knocked with a free bottle of champagne and chocolate strawberries yum yum 
The turndown service was lovely too coming back on a night to cookies and slippers by your bed was lovely. We were also given 4 vouchers (2 each) for continental breakfast which we could enjoy either in our room or in the hotel restaurant so we ordered room service which was a treat eating breakfast overlooking the city doesn't get much better. The nespresso coffee machine was excellent and made lovely coffee. There were also soft drinks included in the fridge all free of charge. The bed was very large and was extremely comfortable you sank into them the same with the pillows. The free wi-fi was excellent too.
We were also lucky enough to get the use of the hotel car Maserati which was another special treat on the evening of my birthday as it took us to Times Square where we had booked our meal.
We didn't have to check out of our room until we were leaving for the airport later in the afternoon which was excellent.
The door guys were really helpful too, polite and they all knew it was my birthday that weekend it was all in all an amazing stay and we would love to go back one day!!

title: “Disappointing”
text:
I'm quite surprised that this hotel is one of the top-ranked in New-York on Tripadvisor. The only good thing about it is the location. It's perfect - you are in the heart of Manhattan and at the same time the area is not as overcrowded and dirty as Times Square for instance. However, it's the only good thing I can say about this hotel.
The lady who met us at the reception tried to be friendly, however as far as I understood she was just a replacement since they were understaffed. And of course, she didn't know the breakfast time and some other details, but that's fine. At least she tried to be nice. Even though we arrived at 4 pm, they didn't prepare the room and after 10 hour flight we had to wait before they cleaned it up and filled the minibar. The room itself was probably the biggest disappointment. Since I'm a diamond member with Hyatt, I usually get very nice rooms, when I stay at their hotels. They state that they will give you the "best room available" However, at Andaz they gave me most likely one of the worst. It was very small, with a view on an ugly inner court and worn-out furniture.
On top of it, most of the waiters at the restaurant on the ground floor are rude and unhelpful. Even though they can easily charge up to $200 per person for dinner, the quality of service is not there. And also on the next day after I checked out, I received a text from my bank saying that you card was charged for $75 by Andaz hotel. When I gave them a call, they told me that it was for breakfast on our last day. And they were genuinely surprised when I told them that breakfast is always complimentary for diamond members. So I had to wait for another week before I received my money back. And of course no one apologised for that.
So overall it was very poor experience and I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone

title: “Simply a great hotel with outstanding service”
text:
I just love going back to the Four Seasons in Houston. Have organised a number of conferences here and both hotel and catering staff are accomodating, friendly and pro-active. 
Rooms are spacious, beds are good and amenities are lovely. 
Location is good for downtown business and the concierge always has great restaurant recommendations. All in all one of my favourite (business) hotels.

title: “Hotel of Class”
text:
There are good hotels, there are nice hotels , there are average hotels and there are classy hotels. The thing that separates them are the attention that is paid to the details. The Hotel Sorella just has that ambiance of class. From the time you enter the main entrance which is a wood staircase to the time you check in, to the time you walk down the hallway, to the time you go to your room, the atmosphere is one of class. There is so much detail in the decor. It really is a beautiful hotel. The check in was quick but the the receptionist was very friendly and helpful as she explained the amenities. We had a corner room which had a great view of the courtyard, swimming pool, and a lot more of the City Centre. The room was very big with a king size bed, a 42" TV, a couch, a lounge chair, a round table and 4 chairs. The bathroom had a walk in shower and top of the line hair care items. Again, the room and bathroom had so many fine details that just separates it from the normal hotel. The hotel also has an outstanding restaurant, Bistro Alex . The food and attention from the wait staff was above and beyond. There is a club/bar known as the Mona Lisa which along with everything else in the hotel just exudes class. A continental breakfast was served in the morning starting at 6:30 which was unusual for a Sunday morning. It consisted of a variety of fruits, dry cereals, pastries, and breakfast drinks including made to order specialty coffees. You had the option of eating in a very open lounge area or outside on the balcony.
The area around the hotel is known as the City Centre with multiple places to eat from fast food type places to really nice restaurants. There are places to shop, a movie theater, and a family friendly commons area where live music was being played and kids were playing on a turfed area as people sat around the perimeter and ate, drank or just watched.
There are nice hotels, good hotels and then there is the Hotel Sorella--a classy hotel.

title: “Nice rooms, nice location”
text:
Stayed 2 nights on business related to the attached Memorial Hermann hospital. My room was a nice surprise, being extremely clean and organized. I liked the technology in the room, especially the iPhone/iPod clock-radio in the room since I lost my iPhone charging cord during travel, and thought I was going to have to buy another one. The shower appeared newly remodeled, was clean, and the double shower head was awesome. The room was also very quiet even though I was placed next to the elevators.
There is a sky bridge crossing the street to a moderately size mall with shopping and restaurants.

title: “Great Hotel”
text: This is great hotel, free parking, a couple of blocks outside the main town. The older gentleman who manages it provided us with free shuttle to the Astros game, welcomed us in every day, great conversations with him, and was very nice. It was about a 20-30 minute walk back, I love walking a new city so no problem for me, but you might wantt to take a cab if your anywhere near the ballpark. Place has free parking, a simple, but effective gym, free water in room, free fridge, free breakfast...make your own waffles too! We had to change rooms because it the first one smelled terribly of smoke, its a smoke free hotel, but obviously someone didnt care-not the hotel's fault. Anyways great hotel, maybe a couple of blocks off the beaten path, but if you have a rent a car, its perfect

title: “Great Service, Great Beds!”
text: Have stayed at this hotel twice for Astros games. Location is great, close to stadium and we felt very safe. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are clean and spacious. The beds are very comfortable! The parking is good and FREE! My kids enjoyed the pool and the hotel is located close to the Aquarium and Hard Rock Cafe. The downtown Aquarium has rides and carnival games and is a great place to spend an evening. Right across the street from the Aquarium is Hard Rock Cafe and my 10 year old who loves Guitar Hero really enjoyed this. The hotel is not walking distance to the game, but the price and quality of service by far made up for having to drive 5 whole minutes. The hotel does offer shuttle, but we have not taken advantage of it. The hotel breakfast was perfect and had plenty of food available. We brought drinks and food to keep in our in room fridge so it was perfect. They have snack and drink machines along with an icecream freezer. Overall, I would totally recommend it to anyone. We had a great stay both times we visted this hotel.

title: “Large rooms but not a great location”
text:
I was in Houston on business and stayed there for 3 nights in early March, 2008. The room I was in on the 4th floor was fairly typical in terms of layout except for the size - it was bigger than similar class hotels. 
I appreciated the free internet. They have wireless and wired but you will need to bring your own cable or buy it from the front desk ($10).
Another nice feature is the breakfast which is a bit better than some free continental breakfasts including some hot items.
My biggest complaint was that the location is a few blocks away from the main downtown area and there are no nearby places to eat. I got in at supper time and had to call for delivery from a pizza place nearby that had a pretty limited menu.
The indoor pool is quite small and is located right next to a sitting area in the lobby so unless you want to be on display while you swim, it's not really useful.
If I go back to Houston, I'll probably opt for a hotel in the downtown core, and one that has an in-house restaurant.

title: “Great Stay At The Best Western”
text: Stayed one night at this best western and it was a great stay, the staff was very friendly and gave me some great spots to eat at around the area. Hotel was very clean and had internet in the room and in the business center. Great stay overall.

title: “Pleasant stay, good location”
text:
Just one night. Quick check-in, though a little trouble over check-out time. My reservation was of a kind that included 2pm check-out, but the desk clerk treated it as a "request". We compromised on 1pm, but I'm not sure what didn't get through from the reservation.
Quiet (mostly) room - odd banging outside(?) in the night. A/C was not easy to manage. Iron leaked more than steamed. 
Had a meal as part of a conference banquet - very good food and excellent waiters.
Also had a business meeting in one of their "Board Rooms" - excellent facility & service.

title: “Very nice hotel”
text: We enjoyed everything about this hotel. From the moment we entered the hotel it was great. The staff was very pleasant. The rooms were nice and comfortable. Nice selection of channels on the television. The bars made very good drinks. It was located within walking distance to several bars and restuarants.

title: “Great hotel”
text:
I do not have any complaints about thus hotel. I was in houston for a conference at the George Brown conference center. I booked a room on the executive floor that also came with breakfast each morning. 
The room seemed expensive but the breakfast coupons covered anything we wanted for breakfast. We got the buffet which on the menu was 20.00 a person. The executive lounge is very nice and has food a few times a day. The hotel is across the street from a park and connected to the conference center.
The pool is nice, it is for swimming laps not playing and the view from the patio is awesome.

title: “Very comfortable and quiet”
text: I had a very nice stay at the hotel. The room and service were exceptional. The staff are all very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is well maintained, clean and comfortable. I will certainly be back and I recommend to others.

title: “Nice place, I'll stay here again.”
text: Relatively new, good fitness center, excellent staff, very nice lobby, nice little pool with a neat little waterfall, clean and very comfortable room, good desk, good internet access (surprisingly good for a hotel!) Everything worked!

title: “Stayed every weekday for 6 months, loved it”
text: The staff made my weekly stays at the hotel for the past 6 months so enjoyable. I always felt at home and very comfortable there. They did an amazing job at making me feel very welcome. My company decided to put me and a few of my coworkers up in a nearby apartment complex to cut down on costs, but I will definitely miss staying at HGI, and of course the rubber duckies that always greeted me when I got to my room.

title: “If you are having a meeting, any meeting...”
text:
We held the Annual Meeting for our organization at Hilton Garden Inn - Houston Energy Corridor last week. I'm new to setting up meetings and don't know what I'm doing yet. To a person, the people at this HGI are simply outstanding! Marcia Burt is the Sales Director and helped me to cover the things I forgot. Jennifer Dennis is Catering Manager and she helped me pick out all of the meals, lined up all of the AV stuff, and all of the details.
And then there's Marco... I think Marco's title must be "Mr. Everything Else". You will rarely find a person with such a 'can-do' attitude. He set up the sound system and projectors. He ran the kitchen and made sure that the meals were on time. The food that came out of that small kitchen was just OUTSTANDING! I fouled up a few things, but never managed to stump him. He took it all in stride and helped to make our meeting a great success. All of his people were great too! Always around, solicitous, but unobtrusive.
Thanks Guys! But I'm afraid you've fouled us up in one way... From now on when I go to a hotel to set up a meeting, my expectations are going to be way too high!

title: “Houston's best”
text: This hotel was fantastic. The rooms were well maintained. The staff was ready to please at all times. Free shuttle service with recommendations to the best restaraunts and a very good on site steak house.

title: “Hidden gem in downtown”
text: I can’t forget the sense of disappointment when I saw the concrete, characterless streets of Houston’s downtown when the taxi rolled in to the street on the Saturday afternoon from airport. However, I must say that the hotel compensated for all the concrete gloom as I spent three weeks. It was one of the busiest hotels, I have stayed at. The lobby was grand, the restaurants lively, the bar well stocked and room had the view of the only green patch in whole of downtown. The park in front is not just another green patch, it is where locals turn up with their kids, yoga and aerobic classes happening every evening. People playing sport and tiny concerts happening all the time. The sports lover would never miss a trick. There is a dynamo, base ball stadium within walking distance. Not far (5 mins walk) is the Houston Pavilion with a number of very nice restaurants. All in all, the hotel was a good experience, with good choice of restaurants around. I would recommend the hotel if you have to stay in downtown.

title: “Very nice.”
text: Great room with a view of downtown Houston. Walking distance to Minute Maid Stadium and Convention Center. Nice amenities in room and large bath. Could have used an exhaust vent though, for the steam. We ate at the cafe twice, for a late dinner and breakfast the next morning. Very good food and service both times. There are 3 bars in the huge lobby. Kinda pricey, though.

title: “"PERFECTION!!!!" - Our Son's Wedding Weekend!”
text:
A GLOWING REVIEW: Hilton Garden Inn, Energy Corridor.....AMAZING!!!! From the moment I stepped into the hotel, greeted by Debbie Bunn, it was a wonderful experience! ALL the family and friends stayed at the hotel. The Rehearsal Dinner and Cocktail Hour before were perfection! YIPPPEEEE! A business that KNOWS their business and does it to....yep! Perfection!!!! More to say about the Hilton Garden Inn......I delivered 22 baskets to the hotel on Wednesday before the wedding. Family and friends began arriving on Thursday and would arrive all the way through to Saturday afternoon. Each and every person received their basket at check-in AND received the correct basket. (Each basket was made for each family in mind.) We're off to a great start! Then, following my dad's birthday celebration at Texas Land and Cattle (already heard that story, did ya?).....we all went back to the hotel and we took over the bar area, stayed around past the time the bar was to close and the bartender told us...no problem! No Problem....I'm sorry, I am just not used to that selfless, customer service oriented behavior....AMAZING!!!!! 
Friday....family and friends still arriving...hotel handling everything smoothly. Shuttle took family and friends to the mall and picked them up again....and was prompt! I arrived at 3:00 to begin decorating the hall. Jennifer is the event planner for the hotel. Another "Can Do" person. How could there possibly be that many GOOD people in one place? The room was set up, Marco was there to run everywhere around the hotel for me, finding everything that I requested....HE should be the CEO of Hilton! That guy is over the top! The room was super fun with all the Texas decorations, and the details were all taken care of by Jennifer, Marco and the hotel staff. The cocktail hour was a hit and the appetizers were excellent! They even set up our own little bar! The Barbeque and all the fixins' were superb! People were still talking about it on Saturday! We finally "let" Marco and the waitstaff go home about 10:30. They never complained! Just said it was a wonderful event! THE ENTIRE NIGHT AMAZING!!!! THEY WERE AMAZING!!! Once again, we all stayed at the hotel bar area and the lounge area for a while longer. Did the bartender complain? Nope! Sure didn't! What is this hotel feeding its staff? Happiness, Loyalty, Appreciation? Maybe....just maybe.....what a novel idea! Saturday night....Wedding is over, all is well at the hotel. Everyone is resting, including my hubby and myself. They comped us a room for Friday and Saturday night, so if we wanted to be with family, we could. Really? Giving us something for nothing....noooooo way! WAY!!!!!!! We got up on Sunday morning, met everyone for breakfast. They gave us the back area, so that we could all be together and then we all broke bread together as family. It was a wonderful ending to a wonderful weekend. I truly am almost in tears thinking about and writing about "our" wonderful hotel. They joined my family that weekend. They were as happy and excited for us, as we were. From the bottom of my heart, I thank you Hilton. God's blessings upon each and everyone of you, and much, much success always. YOU DESERVE IT!!!!

title: “Nice....”
text:
This is a relatively new Westin. The facility design is modern and sophisticated, the rooms are great and the staff was top notch. The interior deign was beautiful. 
My only comment was that I am a light sleeper and even on the 14th floor the noise from the highway was bothersome. Even with the noise I will not hesitate to stay at this Westin again.

title: “Luxurious new Houston hotel”
text: Stayed here a few times on business trips (my employers HQ is across the road and they have a corporate rate here). Its a new (2011) hotel and is still looking very fresh. Rooms are to a very high standard, luxurious, spacious and comfortable with a good work area and large flatscreen TV. The beds are very comfortable. Staff were friendly and efficient. Have used the bar (O24) and restaurant (Il Mulino) in the lobby, both good but feel a bit formal for my liking. There's a "Skywalk" connecting the hotel to the Memorial City Mall if you want to do a bit of shopping or go to the movies at night. Hotel located right next to I10 but on various stays havent been troubled by any traffic noise. I've also been at a few meetings and events here and the facilities are excellent and well set up.

title: “Average Hotel”
text: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times. Liked the location when I visit UH since this hotel is right next to Moody Towers. Room and beds were decent, clean and comfortable. Maids were pleasent. Expect to pay about $20 in taxes and $4 a day for parking in the garage. Nothing above average about the hotel but it's decent.

title: “Best business hotell in Houston?”
text:
Great hotell for business trips in Houston. 
Located in ciytcentra, with lots of resturants close by. 
At times difficult to get parking due to the are is starting to be more popular.

title: “Average hotel”
text: Stayed at this hotel during OTC 2012 in Houston. In my view restaurants opportunities in the area is the best with the hotel. The hotel it self is just ordinary. Parking is difficult, poor swimming pool area and fitness room cannot be called a fitness room. However, next door there is a fitness center which is great.

title: “Beautiful hotel - great service”
text: Hotel was very clean and one of the most quiet I have stayed in... The staff was very nice and attentive. Bistro Alex has excellent service. There are nice shops around to browse and many restaurants to choose from. I even took in a movie at the Movie Studio Grill which was within walking distance.

title: “Nice hotel and great service”
text: Very cool hotel. Nice break from the usual bland hotels for business travelers! Eclectic decor, great service and fitness room. My advice- take a cab or shuttle. Parking can be tough at rush hour. Overall, great experience.

title: “Absolute gem in downtown houston. Fantastic room sizes and colors”
text:
I was checking into the Hotel Icon an Autography Collection for Sunday 9-24-2012. The lobby and check-in desk is beautiful. I love the extra large vault door behind the counter and the "Iconic" columns in the retaurant. The beautiful red doors to the room are a nice accent touch. The rooms rae decorated in a modern and contemporary decor. The bathroom is huge with a whirlpoo tub and extra large shower. I am not a fan of older hotels but this place feels brand new with all of the old school architectural charm.
The in house restaurant is a bit pricey but the food is definitely a 4/5. Great customer service. I like the personalized service and ambience.

title: “Quiet, Spacious, Friendly, and Immaculate”
text:
Enjoyed the extra friendly staff who went out of their way to make me and my family feel welcome in their hotel. 
Room was perfect, spotless, and roomy. Staff responded to all requests well and quickly.
Would return!

title: “3 seasons, not 4”
text: The service was outstanding, could not have been better. The pool was small - a place to cool off but not to swim. The room service was reliable but the food - well, I just did better at Chili's at the airport. Great bed. Breakfast service was great but how can you serve smoked salmon without lemon?

title: “Wonderful southern hospitality...great service!! Excellent location for concert!”
text:
We stayed one evening to see a concert at the Toyota Center!! Perfect location!! Within walking distance...a few blocks! The suite was extremely clean with very tasteful decor. The pool area was fun and intimate!! Room service....French fries....a must....order an extra because you won't want to share!!
The service is pure southern hospitality!! Friendly and genuine!! You are given a cold bottle of water upon leaving with a friendly request to return some day...we will definately be back!!
If you enjoy haning by the pool after hours...book a room which opens to pool...each room has a private niche with ambient lighting and personal lounge chairs!!

title: “Excellent service. Mixed location”
text: In keeping with the Four Seasons experience, the service was excellent and they had the best club sandwich I've eaten. The pecan pie was also excellent. The location is convenient for business during the day, but lacks options at night.

title: “Fantastic Location!”
text: I have stayed at Hotel Beacon twice and plan on returning on my next trip to New York. The hotel is located on Broadway just two blocks from the 72nd street subway. The Fairway Market is directly across the street, Trader Joes's a few blocks away, and lots of restaurants, bars, Riverside Park, and shops within walking distance. The Upper Westside is less chaotic than midtown and has a distinct neighborhood feel. The hotel is clean and rooms are spacious with kitchenettes. The only reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars was because of my last stay in room 1701. The room, unlike others, is cramped and level with the rooftop with views of equipment and a work trailer. The staff is friendly and efficient.

title: “A Wonderful Stay at the Beacon”
text:
We stayed at the Beacon in October for our annual girl's trip to NYC. I'm the trip planner and I always try to find a different area for us to stay in. This year, it was the Upper West Side. My research showed that the Beacon was the best deal for the dates of our trip. October is a very expensive time to come to New York so when I was able to find a 1 bedroom suite for less than 400.00 a night, I made the reservation.
The hotel is in a lovely, residential area of New York. When I win the lottery, that's exactly the area I want to live in! We arrived at the hotel at about 10:00 AM on Friday, Oct.5th after a very long cab ride from LGA. Note to self- don't plan our next trip to NYC to arrive during rush hour. Lucky for us, our room was ready when we checked in. The manager on duty was David. He took such good care of us during our stay. This was our 8th annual girl's trip to NYC and as I mentioned we always stay in a different area. The service at this hotel was the best we've ever experienced.
The suite was lovely. Our room was on the 20th floor with a beautiful view of the city. The queen bed was so comfortable and the living area had a pull-out couch and a roll-a-way was sent up for us, which was a nice touch. Loved the fully stocked kitchen. The hotel has been renovated recently and our suite was immaculate. One of my favorite things was having a delicious cup of coffee each morning. There is a Fairway market directly across the street and a wine store next door. Very convenient!
We had a wonderful trip to NYC as always. Had tickets for the Kelly and Michael show, Jimmy Fallon, Huckabee, and saw an Off-Broadway show, Cougar the Musical. Walked the entire High Line at night, went to Chelsea Market, shopping at Macy's,and had some great pizza in Soho just to name a few of the highlights.
Planning another trip to this great city in January, with my husband this time. This will be my birthday trip. I love this city so much. It truly is addicting!

title: “Pragmatic choice on upper west side”
text: We came here because friends had booked it as part of a package deal and we wanted to stay at the same hotel. Were pleasantly surprised. Location is good but a little out of the way of major attractions. Rooms are spacious and provide a small kitchenette (which we never used). Rooms close to the elevator will suffer from some noise - plus the walls are thin enough to follow the TV program next door. The breakfast place right in the same building (but apparently under independent management) is competently run and offers hearty and healthy choices. Staff were helpful. All things considered the price was fair.

title: “Sweet 16 in NYC”
text: I took my daughter to New York for a 2 night trip. We stayed at the Andaz using Hyatt points and she thought it was the best hotel she ever stayed in, and I have to agree. We were greeted immediatelyin the lobby with a warm hello and offer of a beverage. Checkin was smooth and since we were just a few minutes early we had to waitfor just a few minuteswhile the hostess checked with housekeeping to ensure our room was ready. We waited in a comfortable area just off the lobby and discovered a nook with 5 full shelves of hardcover novels to borrow during our stay. We were escorted to our room and the staff took time to walk us through the cool features of our "space" including touchpad light switches, shower with 3 options (footbath, rainhead or handheld) and the nicest bath sheet towels to wrap up in. The blackout shades would roll down with a touch of a button and we were lucky enough to have a small kitchenette area that included a fridge, freezer,microwave and mini coffee maker that made a nice cup of espresso. This area was stcked with soda and other drinks, I enjoyed the large bottle of organic green tea and my teen loved the fizzy organic soda, the Cocacola was just not as cool! In addition there were kettle cooked potato chips, a dark chocolate bar and one of the most delicious granola bars I've ever had. I saved the package so I can research them on line and order from this local N Y manufacturer. The best part is these snacks are that they are free and replenished each day. In addition,if you visit the lobby there is always coffee, tea, fruit and even wine at a nightly 6pm reception. Prior to our stay the hotel sent an email reminding me of our upcoming stay and asked if there was anything they ould do to make our tay more comfortable. I did respond and let them know we were there to celebrate my daughters birthday- on Friday there was a knock on our door and compliments of the hotel a beautiful piece of chocolate cake arrived with a personalized birthday card wishing her a happy day. All these touches made us feel welcomed and at home during our stay. After a hectic day of touring and running around we splurged on room service at 11pm (the hot dog from a street vendor at 5 was just NOT dinner, but shopping was her 16 yr old focus). The room service staff was courteous, eager to please and prompt. The Andaz is a great value for the money and I do p,an to return, it would ake a great trip with my husband as the hotel has a great bar (whichi was not able to visit this trip) and a nice location. Across from the New York Public Library and only 2 blocks from Times Square one way and 2 blocks fromGrand Central Station in the other direction the hotel makes a great homebase for exploring NYC.

title: “Cool "W" Like Vibe in a Hyatt Boutique Hotel”
text:
This hotel has a very understated exterior. The subtle signage makes the building blend into the block. You really have to be looking for the hotel to know that it is there and once you are arrive it is not entirely clear as to where you enter. You enter the hotel into a very small lobby. Off to the right of the lobby is a nice seating area that I think the Andaz refers to as the Library. To the right of the lobby are bar height tables and chairs . Eight of us ended up gathering here for complimentary wine during Happy Hour. We checked in around 3pm and our rooms were still not ready. This was a little disappointing since I had requested an early check in but in their defense I was told that they were fully booked the previous evening. 
Unlike traditional Hyatt's where there are clearly defined roles (i.e.. concierge, bellman, reception, etc.) the Andaz seems to employ generalists. The same person that checked me in also stored my bags, brought the luggage to my suite and later served us wine in the lobby. The staff goes out of their way to remember your name and did greet us personally several times throughout our visit. This was very impressive
The suite was of decent size by NYC standards and had modern decor. The room had a small fridge, microwave and even a dishwasher that were all concealed behind modern cabinetry. The Andaz provides a small quantity of complimentary snacks and beverages in the room. The living area had a very comfortable couch that folded out into an amazingly comfortable sleeper. The high quality King size mattress and high thread count linens made for a comfortable nights sleep. The bathroom is probably the highlight of the accommodations. The walk in rain shower provided seemingly endless hot water. 
I have read some reviews that suggested that this might not be the most ideal location for families. In general I would agree but did notice that there were a number of travelers accompanied by well mannered children. We had our kids with us and they enjoyed the stay. Outside of the room itself there really isn't anything onsite that children would be drawn to but we were there to tour the city. 
The restaurant is very small for a hotel of this size. We had to wait about 10 min for a table for breakfast. The food is tasty, locally sourced (in some cases) and very fresh. This property does not have a Regency Club and as such offers Diamond status guests a $75 food credit each day. This sounds like a lot but and is very generous but keep in mind $75 will likely feed 2 at breakfast. 
If you are looking for a grand lobby or a wide array of activities this is not the place for you. If you enjoy a modern vibe and enjoy personalized attention this is the place for you. Upon departure, the staff offered a small complimentary gift

title: “First Trip to NYC!”
text:
We chose the Setai as our hotel on our first trip to NYC because 
1. Its # 1 Rating on TA(when we booked)
2. Location 
3. Price( great deal on last minute travel) 
We were traveling with another couple, and I am always the trip planner. 
We were not disappointed. I am sure we had the lowest grade rooms yet they were nice size, probably large for NYC, no view, only another building. The hotel, rooms and bathrooms were all extremely clean. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms were very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. 
I thought it was an exceptional item to have no set check-in-check-out times. I’m sure if they are super full they can not always accommodate, but we arrived at 1pm and were able to go to our rooms and had a late flight on our last day and were able to check out at 3. 
Additionally we received breakfast coupons upon arrival that I was unaware of! Had 3 great breakfasts in their dining room the days we were there, but they do have a very limited menu. 
We had drinks 2 nights in the hotel bar and while pricy it was a comfortable atmosphere. Great friendly servers. 
The only minor issue was our friends bathroom, they had absolutely no counter space, just a sink on a wall Room 919. Our rooms were identical, but we had a nice long marble counter in our bathroom - Room 719. It was odd. Maybe theirs was a handicap room, but if it was I have no idea how a handicapped person could get in/out of the deep tub! When calling to confirm our reservations the day before we came I did mention it was their 30th anniversary. I felt bad they got that bathroom, but not a huge deal, but if you want a counter in your bathroom don’t stay in room 919. 
All in all, great stay, lovely hotel.

title: “Best service in NYC”
text: I stayed here in Sept for 5 nights with my partner. I am a frequent visitor to NYC and have stayed in a lot of hotels throughout Manhattan. This is by far the best I have stayed in. The rooms are really comfortable and hi-tech. And at last ....a hotel that provides free high speed wifi throughout the hotel!! My room did not have any view but that did not matter to me, the service is awesome. Complimentary shirt iron on arrival, shoe shines, check out when suits you as the hotel was not fully booked - never been asked before "What time suits you" to check out when I enquired about a slightly later check out - and I mean any hotel anywhere. Front desk, concierge, all top notch. Great location for escape downtown or hitting the midtown/uptown highlights. I was on a mix of business and pleasure and it worked for both, highly recommended hotel.

title: “Feels like home in a big city!”
text:
From the time the Chatwal opens the doors for you it's time to be pampered !
Our first visit to the Chatwal was in November, 9 months later we checked in and all the same smiling faces welcomed us back! They take pride in remembering you!!
Top notch!

title: “The best in Midtown”
text:
I've stayed at St. Regis, Mandarin, all of the most reputed hotels in NYC, and I'm really glad to have discovered the Chatwal. Room 709 has an advantage that puts it head and toes above the others: a large private terrace! We had dinner served there by the Lambs Club (downstairs), and Chef Z delivered a perfect meal---the delmonico steak and everything else was superb, and enjoying it privately was fabulous! 
Now to the room and hotel: The greeting starts your visit magnificently. The front desk is friendly, professional and very helpful, 24 hours a day. The lobby itself feels like a 1940's cruise ship, right down to the uniforms worn by the service staff. The fittings are first class----exceptionally clean and tidy throughout.
The room is also exceptional, with a hand made mattress that feels like heaven, the finest linens, a great tv, and a thoroughly first-class experience is assured. You even have a butler, a very friendly fellow who offers to iron your clothes, and cause anything you need to happen almost instantly. We had brought our own bottle of Veuve, and they gladly set it up for us, as if we were in a restaurant. This is a very guest-oriented hotel. I was addressed by name by everyone there!
Negatives: too much frivolous technology. It would be nice to have a normal light switch rather than a gadegeted up bathroom switch that operates 4 different functions, if only you could figure them out in the dark. Likewise with the climate control, which you operate via a screen on the telephone. It's all pretty silly to me, and makes simple things far more complicated. Even the toilet is high-tech.....it plugs in to the wall, and you can press buttons on yet another controller---that indicate "wash front" "wash back" and even "dry." 
My only other grip is the door staff, who spend more time on their phones and chatting with each other than paying attention to actually opening the doors for guests.
Aside from that, this hotel hits homeruns on every front. It's a very upscale experience that is rewarding in every way. My new fave in the city!

title: “This hotel is bliss.”
text: My sister in law and I stayed at Eventi for a girls weekend in NYC. We had such a great time and the hotel was the foundation of fun. Not only did Patrick at the Front Desk greet us with a warm smile when we arrived early, he sent us a lovely bottle of wine and fruit as welcome gift! Kimpton hotels know how to provide an experience to their guests -- free WiFi for In Touch members, complimentary member upgrades, a hosted wine hour each night, and clean, comfortable accommodations. Everything was great -- the space was sufficient for 2 ladies, the bed was comfortable, the shower luxurious, and the entire staff welcomed you with a genuine smile and gentle demeanor. For us, the location was perfect. It was easy to get to the Subway and we felt safe coming and going by foot at night. Thanks for a great experience Eventi... especially my personal super star, Patrick!

title: “nothing wrong per se- but somehow still disappointed”
text:
We picked this hotel after a very thorough research (I now know alllll NYC hotels!) based on the great reviews. I had previously stayed at the times square intercontinental which I had found to be very good but a little bland and impersonal. Eventi seemed to have more of a personality and better design (which it did!)
The staff is great and nice, however we made a request for a empire state view or at least a great view, but we got the back view which isn't particularly nice. Seeing as we made the booking quite a while in advance, I somehow figured they'd be able to accomodate us.
We brought our pet with us after having filled the pet registration form they require on their website in addition to emailing them prior to again specify we're bringing our pet. Upon arrival though, they claimed to not have received any notification of us bringing a pet. It wasn't a problem as they just had a bed sent up (like i say the staff is super nice).
The room: we had an executive suite. It's nice but like many pple had mentionned in their reviews, it does feels pretty small and cramped and a little dark. some of the wood on the floor is a little worn (scratches..) the bed is great though, but it's not a king. The bathroom is very nice.
Room service: lovely service, decent food.
Location: not bad, close enough to 34th st shopping, decent distance from times square...we are big walkers so it wasn't a problem for us.
Overall, we really did like it alot..but now that I've tried it, I think I'd go back to the intercontinental rather than this one (might be a bit more impersonal but the views are amazing, the windows are bigger, and the rooms feel airier and less cramped.)
Still, would I recommend this hotel to friends? yes, especially if you have a pet..it's really what sets them apart, you feel like your pet is welcomed and not just tolerated. so thumbs up to Eventi for that. :)
I have to say the slight disappointment probably stems from the fact that this hotel has such amazing reviews, better than many others, that I figured it would be nothing short of awesome. instead it was very good, not awesome...:) still a thumbs up to the wonderful staff. Maybe our experience would've been helped if we'd managed to get the room with the empire state view...ah well!

title: “Location, location, location”
text:
This hotel is all about the location. For a first time visitor to NYC it is amazingly close to about everything. We barely used public transport during our stay. Walking and a few taxi trips solved about all of the transportation.
The rooms are nicely appointed with a really comfortable bead, and a clean large bathroom. It is not overly large, but not small either. I would describe it as a good standard but not extraordinary.
Staff was both great and a bit of a miss. The concierge and the bell boys went above and beyond in helping us and really did a great job. I would recommend talking to them about restaurants, air port transfer, shopping etc. Though the fornt desk staff was more of a miss. They felt clueless in several requests and gave contradictory answers and did not feel that professional or knowledgable.
During our stay both the restaurant and the bar was being refurbished, something we were not notified of beforehand. And the breakfast was instead a box collected at the front desk consisting of yoghurt, a croissant and a banana. It was sufficient, but perhaps not something I would expect from a hotel such as this.
In summary, it is perfectly located and provides a good nights sleep. But it did not provide me with that feeling of a place that goes above and beyond, though the bell boys certainly do!

title: “The a/c didn't work!”
text: Nice size rooms, clean, very friendly staff, HOWEVER ... two of the four nights we were there, the A/C didn't work. When I reported it to the front desk, they just said "Yes, we knew it was out". Ummm, what? They said it would be fixed the next night, but the next night was just as hot. When we checked out and again reported the problem, she said "Did you alert the front desk" to which we said yes. And that was it, no mention of a discount, no apologies! I am disappointed because I really wanted to love this place, but unfortunately, even despite the great location, I will not be staying here again. No one likes to sweat while they sleep!

title: “Good value, good location”
text: Stayed two nights in a very spacious well equipped room in this small hotel right around the corner from the Waldorf Astoria. My room had a kitchen, couch, and comfortable bed. Bathroom was small but functional. Breakfast was included but I didn't try it - looked like the usual continental buffet. My only hesitation in recommending this hotel is a very limited room service menu that comes from the Indian restaurant next door. The food was pedestrian and the delivery person hit me up for a tip in cash- a rather odd exchange. No silverware came with the meal - the idea was to use the silver from the kitchen but then plates and silver stayed until the next morning. Otherwise, my stay was good and I would go back. It is away from the hustle and bustle but very well located.

title: “Excellent-As Always!”
text: We just returned from our 5th or 6th stay at the San Carlos Hotel and it was wonderful again. Rooms are spacious and clean and the location is great. The staff are very attentive and you see the same smiling faces as the last visit who seem genuinely happy to see their guests return. You always feel safe and well cared for at this hotel. Don't understand the other Trip Advisor reviews which say the complimentary breakfast leaves anything to be desired-the selection is vast, fresh and presented beautifully. There are plenty of great options and this benefit allows you to start your day early and not have to spend any money. We will be back here again and again and again...

title: “Amazing stay, amazing staff, WOW!!! The best location, the best stay ever!!”
text:
We have been planning for this trip a long time, first time for my children to to New York!!, I have three boys, ages 7, 11, and 14, picking them up from Camp in upstate New York. We stayed for 13 nights!! can you imagine?
Where do I start........everything was truly exceptional, the rooms that we where assigned to...perfect one bedroom suite with a sofa bed on the other room, a kitchenette that saved us a bunch of expenses by having cereal or a sandwich now and then, and also feeling like residents a bit. In front of our suite, a room for my other two boys, also perfect, the decoration, very clean and luxurious..........and the beds are the most cozy and confortable beds we have ever experienced in any hotel, and we have been all over the world. The staff, how we felt welcomed with gifts for our kids, sodas and water for free every day and the amazing service worth mentioning Tammy at the front desk, she is the best!! and Kristina Kinet, Thank you for everything!!!

title: “Awesome hotel room, great location and brilliant staff!!”
text:
I had the pleasure of staying at the Sherry-Netherland for one night only which was such a shame as it is brilliant.
On my arrival I was ever so nicely greeted and looked after by the front desk. 
My room was 1111 and I can honestly say that when I entered it my jaw hit the floor. It is massive. The lounge is big and can certainly be used to host a drink reception. There is a kitchen area, small but does the job.
The bedroom was big as well and the bed ................ one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on, especially the pillows. As soft as anything.
The location is great on 5th Avenue, at the south end of Central Park and north end of the shops. 
Would I stay there again . Absolutely.

title: “You'll feel iike a Rich Uncle...”
text: This is the way it must have been for my mom in New York City in the '50's...like visiting your dowager aunt living quietly in elegance on the Upper East Side. Today, it's mostly a residence with fifty or so rooms available. Ours was a suite on the tenth floor, loads of space, a deco bathroom, a kitchenette filled with complimentary soft drinks (a lovely touch)...my daughter left a note saying "I (loveheart) this hotel" which just about sums up our visit. A particular pleasure was our interchanges with the elevator operators...of course we could have pushed the buttons ourselves, but how enjoyable to have a real person watching out for you. We also loved the back entrance to Cipriani's...we felt very sophisticated sitting at the four seat bar having a Martini (ask for a "Hemingway"). The Sherry isn't the newest or coolest midtown hotel, but it continues to deliver an elegance of another time...an experience you'll surely enjoy.

title: “Great new westin”
text: Love this new Westin. Great staff. Nice il mulino bistro

title: “Great business hotel”
