text: I was recently a 4 day business guest at the Westin Memorial City and thrilled with the experience - not only was the guest room lovely, but the business meeting rooms were great. The hotel is sort of convenient to downtown but there is so much convenient to the hotel not much need. Westin is literaly connected to a large mall and hospital. The in house restaurant we very mixed reviews but the bar is beautiful. The staff at the hotel is the best and the courtesy van super! compare room rates week day to weekend huge difference

title: “Friendly and professional”
text: I felt the hospitality staffs were friendlier and professional than front desk staffs. They seem too proud to be standing there while staffs from cafe to valet are more than courteous. Overall, the hotel us well kept and clean. definitely returning to this property for business trips.

title: “Absolutely best location in SW Houston”
text:
Hotel staff very professional. Spacious rooms, nicely appointed. Wouldn't use hotel for family, not really a young child friendly environment. Pool almost roof top with bar service, bar had great jazz band playing in the evening. Many great restaurants from pizza to sushi in walking distance. Locating the parking garage can be a challenge. There's lots of shopping close by too.
Great breakfast and cappuccino made to order. If you are not up to breakfast in the lobby, just ask for a tray to carry back to your room,staff very accommodating.Easy access to interstate.

title: “Noise Alert”
text: Citycentre is a lovely destination but our Easter stay was marred by excess noise from outside (concert on the green) on our first night and noisy wedding parties (3) in the hall on our second night. Yes, we had requested and paid a bit more for a quiet room to no avail. We even changed rooms on the second day. Were sorry that we were moved to such a lively floor! Loved the area, restaurants and shopping. To avoid the noise, we'd only stay there again during the week.

title: “Patchy service”
text:
I was recommended this hotel because it is near the Energy Corridor where I have meetings and it has restaurants and shops within walking distance, which is unusual and safer than other hotels in Houston.
It is a little difficult to find (if you drive) even with satnav because it doesn't have a drive up front door/reception. Instead you need to park on the third floor of a public parking garage and drag your bags to the hotel.
If like me you live in Asia and are used to service then this is a bit of a drag (pun intended).
Which brings me to the patchy service.
I arrived late and just made it before the kithen closed at 10pm, so I ordered room service (burger of course, not a lot of choice but this is US). When I returned the next day at 5pm the tray was still outside my door. I noticed this was common during my stay (trays left in the corridor). Also if you call the front desk they are very helpful but nothing happens, you may have to call back again once or twice.
Still, it is true there are several restaurants and shops in the vicinity so that is a definate plus, and I would recommend this place for that reason. After all safety is a consideration.

title: “Great location and rooms, not so great housekeeping.”
text: The hotel is very unique, in a great location and we got a great deal, but there were a few things that will keep us from staying here in the future. Although they have free wireless, the signal wasn't strong enough to connect in the room. Also we stayed for three nights and were out of the room during the day, and housekeeping NEVER came by. Fresh washcloths can go a long way.

title: “My new favorite hotel!”
text: My husband I stayed for one night on the Kiss and Tell package. I can't say enough good things about the ICON. We travel A LOT and have stayed in very nice places...but I found this hotel to be both affordable and decadent. The staff is great, the room was excellent, and the area fabulous. We enjoyed a little Irish bar down the street, Sean McElory's. I highly recommend. I will be coming back to this hotel as soon as possible.

title: “Great Adult Get Away”
text: Service was excellent, environment was classy and relaxing. I would stay here again anytime! Mike the bar tender was friendly outgoing courteous and responsive. We loved the Benz shuttle, we were ridding in style!

title: “Peace, quite, relaxation, and gourmet room service in the middle of downtown Houston.”
text: The junior suite is spacious, quiet, with a comfortable king sized bed, rain shower, and jacuzzi tub for two. The Line & Lariate menu is full of variety and flavor. The staff is prompt, courteous, and friendly - eager to make the experience as stress free as possible. While the rooms are quiet w double paned windows, the view of downtown seems to allow stress to creep back in - fortunately the curtains close but it would have been nice to look outside and see trees instead of metro rail. All in all, the best hotel I've stayed in and would recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing retreat.

title: “My new home in Houston!”
text:
You should be able to hear my applause from where you are....
Hotel Icon is now my hotel of choice in Houston. Unless this hotel is full...and they can't convince another guest to scoot over, I won't be staying at any other hotel when visiting Houston. The architecture is beautiful, the room was pristine and so comfortable and quiet, and the staff...oh my Lord, that staff! I stayed three nights and staff member I encountered ( from desk to valet to room service) treated me as if I were visiting royalty. They were invariably friendly, extremely helpful, and very very efficient. When i asked the concierge about the Houston metro rail, the man ( nice ostich boots, by the way) all but led me by the hand to the appropriate stop. Erica at the front desk ( who obviously has her own Tripsdvisor fan club) lived up to her advance press and simultaneously provided information, arranged a favor for me and ooohed over pictures of my grandsons. All of the staff were just that awesome. The reason for my visit was a small grandson's surgery. After long frightening stressful days at the hospital, the Hotel Icon was a peaceful and uplifting retreat. I will always stay here, if possible, whenever I visit Houston.

title: “DIGNIFIED LUXURY IN THE HEART OF H-TOWN!”
text: Beautifully furnished withe exquisite chandeliers throughout, this luxury hotel felt like a home away from home - right in the heart of Houston. Although the self-park garage was NOT FREE, it was suitably located, reasonably priced, and had plentiful spaces. I would avoid the valet service - too much congestion at the front entrance - and too few valets means long waiting periods for car retrieval.

title: “Loved the Four Seasons, Houston Not So Much”
text:
My husband and I traveled to Houston for a conference and were delighted upon check-in to hear we had been upgraded to a suite in the Four Seasons Residences. We were ushered into a separate check-in area and quickly shown to our spacious and elegant apartment which featured a fully equipped galley kitchen, living room with dining table, bedroom and bathroom. While we would never have splurged to upgrade ourselves, it was a wonderful perk. The hotel is older, perhaps a bit dated (could be considered "classic"), but seems to be well kept up. The service was exceptional: we enjoyed complimentary newspapers, coffee and delicious breakfast pastries each morning in the Residence's lobby and appreciated all the advice and help with dinner reservations from the concierge. The valet at the main hotel lobby was extremely accommodating and arranged to have the hotel's car and driver take us to a conference event that was a few miles away. One of the highlights of our stay was the Tuesday evening wine tasting event in the Four Seasons wine bar, Vinoteca. We enjoyed four or five generous pours of excellent Italian wines and when my husband remarked that he particularly liked one of them, the waitress came and poured him a full glass! When we returned home we we looked up the wine he had liked so much and found it to be a bottle that sells for $85! There was also a delicious buffet of Italian cheese and fruits and crackers to accompany the wine. Very, very enjoyable! I walked through the smallish pool area and it would have been inviting if not for the stifling heat (well over a hundred.) The one downside to our stay: it always aggravates me to have to pay extra for internet access and the Four Seasons charges a daily fee for internet.
The comfortable accommodations were especially appreciated when we left the hotel to find the downtown area highly depressing: soulless architecture, somewhat desolate and grungy, and full of panhandlers. We were not 20 feet from the hotel when we were approached by a man claiming to have car trouble and looking for a handout. We took the light rail out to the museum area and Rice University just to look around and get the lay of the land but the extreme heat in June did not allow us to explore much. We ended up taking the downtown underground tunnels back toward the hotel to get out of the heat and noted very few open businesses and lots of closed/empty storefronts. Houston's downtown seems to have seen better times. Two enjoyable places nearby: The Grove for dinner and cocktails was fun and Phoenicia Specialty Foods is fun to explore (a middle eastern market cafe) and the salads and sandwiches we tried were delicious.

title: “Dated property, but classic four seasons experience”
text:
First and foremost this is a business hotel through and through. It's located in the downtown area, great for meetings but very quiet in the evenings.
The hotel feels like its getting a bit older, but upkeep is good as you would expect, and service and rooms are of the four seasons quality you would look for. I didn't eat in the restaurant, but the room service was good and the dry cleaning service was fast and efficient.
All in all a great choice when in Houston for business.

title: “Awesome”
text: Had a very memorable stay at this hotel-- gorgeous room, courteous staff and perfect location to do things downtown. The bed was super comfortable and enjoyed all of the bath products too (L'occtaine!). Would definitely stay here again even though it was a bit pricey.

title: “Location, lovely, and loved it”
text: I enjoyed everything about the Beacon. Start with location, especially if you want to be on the Upper West Side. Close to subway, Central Park, shopping, restaurants, everything you could want. Very clean and well appointed rooms. Appreciate that each room as a refrig and microwave. Very helpful when you travel. Complimentary wifi (as it should be!). Helpful staff. Starbucks across the street, Viand Cafe next store--great place to eat. I only wish they had a loyalty or frequent traveler program or even an email list for deals because I would like to stay here as often as possible. (Fun fact: if you are a fan of 666 Park, the apartment building used in the show is across Broadway from the Beacon.)

title: “Excellent choice”
text:
We had a seven night stay at the Hotel Beacon in a King suite on the 21st floor. As a couple of seniors who didn't want to be near the hustle & bustle of Times Square, we couldn't have made a better choice.
We had plenty of room, a kitchenette to prepare breakfast & other snacks & an extremely comfortable bed. The neighbourhood was great, so convenient to everything, local restaurants, the subway & Central Park. Having the Fairway market opposite was a bonus and the choice of foods was excellent.
My only criticism would be that the air conditioner was too loud & we had trouble adjusting it to suit us.
A few weeks later we had to return to Manhattan for one night & couldn't get a booking at the Beacon. We stayed in the midtown area in a similarly priced hotel. The comparison with the Beacon was like chalk & cheese. The Beacon was far superior in all respects.
If we every return to NYC we would only stay the the Beacon. We strongly recommend the Beacon.

title: “Do not use the phone for international dialling!!!!!!!”
text:
OK, I know, only an idiot would expect anything but huge prices for calling internationally on a hotel phone, but seriously, this was OUTRAGEOUS! We made a ten minute call to a landline (our bank) in the UK and were charged $149!!!! And $60 and $80 for two 5 minute calls to Australia. Furthermore, when we asked for more information on the call bill (they gave us the time, not the duration of the calls), the man at reception got quite annoyed and basically implied that we must be idiots if we can't see that the international calls are what cost so much (yes...! but can you tell us how you got to the cost please? the duration?? the rate???). No matter what we said, he just kept saying that it was all written on the bill (on the bill was actually the time of the calls, written in 24 hour time) and the rate is whatever unknown rate they are charged (probably using gold cables being exchanged through luxembourg) plus 75% and scoffing and waving the bill away. He would have clearly seen this was not the case if he'd chosen to listen to us rather than scoffing at our stupidity and gesturing to talk to the hand. Absolutely get a phone card even if, like us, you have no intention of making calls anyway. Or, just use your foreign mobile, its actually WAY cheaper. You never know when your bank might freak out over security and cancel your cards or someone at home has an urgent problem.
That aside, this hotel is pretty good for a middle of the road place in NYC. We stayed with our two young children, aged 2 and 3 years old and the location is fantastic. You can easily walk to loads of child-friendly attractions including the children's museum, the natural history museum, central park and even the Met by walking through the park. All the museums and galleries also run children's programming so there's even more to them than just looking at the exhibits.
The kitchens were VERY basically supplied so even though they say that you have a full kitchen, you can't really cook much. There are no dishes/pans suitable for the oven so its completely redundant. There are also no dishes suitable for cooking food in the microwave... except maybe 4 small plates, 4 dinner plates and 4 shallow cereal bowls. I suppose you could heat a TV dinner in the packaging it comes in or heat baby food etc, otherwise you're completely limited to what you can produce on the stove with a small frypan, one spatula and one small saucepan.
The hotel suggests that you contact the Babysitters Guild direct for babysitting services, which we did and we absolutely loved our sitter whose name was Amy.
The doormen are lovely and will receive parcels for you if you shop up a storm and need to have things delivered.
There is a very handy coin-operated laundry room on one of the floors which costs $1.75 for each box of detergent, wash or dry load.
The rooms are small but furnished nicely. There are pretty good restaurants nearby and the supermarket across the road is conveniently open until 1am.
There is good, free wifi in the rooms and a printer and computer for guest use on the ground floor.

title: “Would definitely go back”
text:
It was my first time to New York and we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite at the Hotel Beacon and couldn't really ask for more. The service was great, all requests and queries were answered and the location is ideal if you are wanting to get around Manhattan.
It has the Beacon Theatre next door, a late opening supermarket across the road and the Cafe Viand next door does great pancakes with equally as good service.
The tea and coffee were topped up every and the small kitchenette was ideal for quick snacks and a bite to eat especially with the doggy bags we bought back. 72nd Street station is 2 blocks away and to walk Central Park, National History Museum and the Lincoln Centre are only a few blocks too.
If I do go back I would definitely stay there again as it ticked all the boxes for location, service and facilities without being overly expensive.

title: “Great Location - Needs a little help”
text:
The Andaz New York for sure is new Hotel experience. Something great, good, mediocre, and bad. They want to be the best hotel, but they (in this authors opion) fall a bit short. The personal attention is something that they have figured out pretty well. Always someone to greet you and make you feel at home. There are casual uniforms and they want you feel as if they are your friends. I was told that management wears a tie, they the” front line” do not.
Wow, what a novel idea everything other than alcohol products are free in your room refrigerator. No longer do you have that obstacle in your room that you must avoid at all costs. Liquid wise you had a few choices, food was either potato chips or a granola bar that was it. Still better than nothing. Wi-Fi was included as it should be in all hotels.
Two Mediocre, I am a 65 year old male that suffers from sleep apnea. I have a cpap machine and I use it religiously. In a cpap machine you are supposed to use distilled water. Three out four people I talked to in the hotel did not know what distilled water was. Finally I did assure myself that they did not have any and I would have to find some myself. I walked to two Duane Reade Drugs stores that had no distilled water and finally had to go to a Walgreens in Times Square. I forgive you for not having it but please tell me where I can purchase some. I did attempt to call the hotel manager, not because I was upset but I thought that he should know the operator trying to protect the manager gave me the voice mail of his number two. Not good! You too should not have a tie.
A $75 breakfast was included with our reservation. Hard to believe $75, but again it was New York and I think an omelet was $17. On our last day we checked out early so they could get the room ready for the next reservation, even though we had about two hours until check out time and when we needed to leave. When I got home I looked at our credit card statement and found $89 charged to our bill for breakfast. $14 above the allowed $75, first how could that be and second why was this not included. We checked out to do the hotel as a favor and now I was being billed for breakfast. I called the hotel a couple of times and the staff were very courteous and took care of this problem.
There is “no free lunch,” the Wi Fi took me about 20 minutes to hooked up to when we checked in and later in the week (we spent five nights) I had to call there service once again.
The showers which the staff was very proud of, actually scared me. At 65 I am not as agile as I would like. The shower is large and I was fearful of slipping and falling. I do not want a handicapped room , but I think the shower could use a couple of safety bars.
Yes I would most likely stay again, if I had the daily room rate, but there are many choice in and below there price range to choose from.

title: “Favorite Hyatt Property”
text: I stayed here for a weekend and I have to say this is an incredible property. Excellent location at the heart of Manhattan, with chic rooms and decor, and almost an entirely free mini bar (excluding alcohol). Every hotel I stay at is now compared to the Andaz on 5th. I will spring the extra monies next time I visit NYC.

title: “Perfect mid-town location, huge room with quirks”
text: First time at this Hyatt property, as a Diamond HGP, received an upgraded suite... it was a massive hotel room... separate living room, sleeping area, hallway with with a lot of closets, and huge bathroom. Included a 'pantry' area with microwave, sink, near full size refrigerator (all items comp except for beer and liquor), and nepresso coffee machine. A few quirks though in this room... the light controls were 'touch pads' and aside from being senstive to the touch (turning lights on/off that we didn't want), the control pad for the bath room was in the hallway, which meant hunting down the halllway in the dark to find it, press it and peeking into the bathroom to find out if on or not (w/o bathing the sleeping area in light). Also, there is no door between the WC and the rest of the bathroom... so when one of us had to use the loo, the other had to leave the bathroom (did i mention that the bathroom is huge, so in theory, more than one person should be able to use at once). As a note, no newspaper is delivered to the room (which was odd as when i was walked to the room by someone from the staff, they asked me for my newspaper preference). Wonderful location if one wants to spend time in mid-town, which is exactly what we wanted to do.

title: “Perfect Place to Stay in NYC”
text:
My wife and I stayed 5 nights and were upgraded at check-in to a large deluxe room. We were truly amazed by this wonderful hotel in the center of Manhattan, its excellent service, modern facilities, gorgeous bathroom and a very comfortable bed in a super-sized room with a walk-in wardrobe. I had requested for a low floor (9th) and although our room faced Fifth Avenue, it was so quiet and peaceful, and I could stand by the tall windows, deep in thought, watching the hive of activities below.
The location is perfect, being walking distance to Times Square, the theaters along Broadway and Bryant Park. 
One regret was that we didn't manage to secure a treatment at the spa as it was so full and popular, and couldn't accommodate our last-minute attempt to book.
We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in NYC.

title: “Brilliant service & great room with lovely extras.”
text:
We stayed 6 nights and could easily have stayed many more.
There is a service ethic that runs through the staff that is magnificent. From the concierge staff who greet you each time you walk though the front door, , to the front desk, restaurant staff and house maids there is a consistent desire to provide wonderful service whilst making you feel comfortable in a home away from home manner.
From the complimentary "refreshment centre" ( ie fridge stocked with water, juice and soft drinks) to the observant house maid who noticed we were almost outoftoothpaste and so provided a new one, there were just so many lovely little touches. It's the little things that make a stay particularly memorable. 
Room tip: join Leading Hotels of he World and you will stand a good chance of getting a room upgrade whilst being assured of continental breakfast and free Wifi. If you don't do this may I encourage you to get a rate that includes breakfast especially if you like a full breakfast asit can be quite pricey. 
Can't wait to stay here again.

title: “great place to stay”
text:
I visited NY last october and I stayed at the setai on 5th.
The concierge its really friendly and helpful and the rooms are new, clean, very comfortable and bigger then expected! And the bathrooms are gorgeous!
One minus for breakfast , it was quite poor and took forever to bring 2 eggs ( half hour) and they were so fried that was impossible to eat them. I would have preferred to have a nice small buffet breakfast but they dont have one.
The door men were very careful always to help with umbrellas,doors and luggage it had a real feeling of a 5 stars!

title: “Great Midtown Hotel”
text: The Chatwal is a diamond in the rough. Great location - almost an oasis in the mayhem of the Times Square area. Rooms are comfortable and modern with outstanding bathrooms. Most have spacious separate rain showers and embedded TVs in the mirrors. Despite the location, the rooms are very quiet, and outside noise is rare. The staff works hard and is outstanding in very way. Serivce is very personal yet appropriately restrained. The Lambs Club restaurant has excellent food and the bar upstairs is amazing. My family had four rooms during our stay, and the hotel was able to put us together on the same floor and upgraded the rooms. I highly recommend the Chatwal in every way.

title: “Beyond any of my expectations”
text:
It was my second time visiting New York and chose this hotel purely based on its location (it is located very close to Times Square and is surrounded by Broadway theaters so there is a lot to do around the clock). The staff was extremely attentive and determined to assist me in every possible way from the moment I walked into the lobby.
I was very impressed by the quality of service at the front desk even though I did not have high expectations from a hotel in New York, given that my last stay at the Four Seasons during my first time in New York was a true nightmare. The staff was professional and diligent yet very pleasant and concise.
The hotel Art Deco interior gives a true sense of elegance that is hard to find in a hotel nowadays. The room was very stylish and well-designed with impressive finishes like leather/suede accents.
I found the hotel spa pool somewhat small but that is to be expected from a pool in a hotel in New York City.
I highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again during my next visit to New York.

title: “A new favorite in Times Square...”
text: Our travel agent has given us many wonderful NYC hotel recommendations over the years. Her latest was the Chatwal. We were only going to be in town a couple of nights and we were going to 2 shows. So, she felt the location would be perfect. We checked in easily and found the small lobby charming and the 2 women at the front desk delightful. The lobby bar is at the other end of the lobby as is the restaurant. Another lounge is located up the stairs on the second floor. We were taken to our room by an enthusiastic bellman who showed us how everything worked in our room - including our Japanese toilet with the heated seat! The room was small - it is New York after all - but luxurious and immaculate. The walls are covered in mocha suede. We had ample closet space and a terrace with a table, chairs and a large canvas umbrella. The bathroom is luxurious. The hotel spa is a satellite location of the famous Red Door Spa by Elizabeth Arden. I had a superb facial as my husband worked out in the adjoining exercise room. They also have a resistance pool. The staff is as friendly and professional as the rest of the hotel. The food in the hotel was delicious, the drinks and servers in the lounge were wonderful! You are less than 2 blocks from Times Square which makes Broadway an easy walk. But as close as this hotel is to the hustle and bustle of Times Square, it is a oasis of calm and sophistication in this hectic city. It will be our go to hotel from now on.

title: “Typical high standard Kimpton”
text: Stayed for a night a new weeks back. Wonderful service. Arrived quite late and was offered cocktails in the small lobby lounge which was much appreciated. Had an upgraded suite which was large for New York standards. Room was really nice and refined as expected. Did not manage to eat in the restaurant but it was not a Kimpton restaurant so had little interest anyway. Really nice location and would rate as one of the best in New York and personally I prefer to the Four Seasons. Only reason why I did not want to rate excellent was there being no lobby bar for food and drinks for those coming in late. Seemed Un New Yorkish. Love Kimpton Hotels though.

title: “Accommodating Staff, Well Decorated, & Iffy Location”
text:
We traveled to New York as a family. We combined a little bit of business with leisure. One member of our party participated in a conference at a hotel 2 blocks away near Madison Square Garden. We chose to stay at the Eventi because there was a labour dispute at the hotel hosting the conference and we had also read about bed bugs at that particular property.
The staff was very polite and welcoming. The doormen handled our luggage with care and made sure we had an easy check-in. The lobby is small, but average by New York standards, but very lively and trendy.
Our suite was uniquely and tastefully decorated. Everything about the room was very nice, but small, understandable in Manhattan, but still small. The only thing that was spacious was the bathroom. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The sofa bed was great for the teenager.
Some downsides to the hotel were room service. Room service seemed slow. The staff was also slow to remove tables and trays from the room. The location was good for the conference, but the Garment District can be very gritty, even by New York standards. Trash piles up on side streets and most of the surrounding buildings are active warehouses. Lastly, the bathrooms in the suites feature a barn style door on sliders. This very heavy barn door became derailed and trapped two members of our party in the bathroom for several minutes, while the third member of our party was out of the room. Beauty and practicality must come together.
The hotel's pricing is about average for New York.
I recommend this hotel if this is your desired location.

title: “Eventi is simply the best hotel in NYC.”
text: I have stayed at the Eventi several times, and it is always a pleasant stay. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, the rooms are spacious with great views, and the beds are super comfortable. Special kudos to the manager, Julian Miller, who went out of his way to make my mother's first stay at the Eventi an excellent experience.

title: “Good Value, Location”
text:
We stayed at the Eventi for a function and received a special rate of $380 a night for a King Room, including tax. For the price alone, I think we got what we paid for. 
The positives: The location is central and it's easy to get anywhere in Manhattan fairly quickly. The rooms are well designed for the size and had a really comfortable, white duvet bed, large flat screen TV, mini bar, safe, desk and two chairs. The decent sized marble bathroom featured a wide vanity and a large shower with teak seat and Etro toiletries. Floor to ceiling windows even had a look-up-to-the-left view of the Empire State Building. Housekeeping twice a day was great and scheduled around us without issue. 
The negatives: Our room was not ready, which isn't totally inconceivable at 1:00, but the desk attendant didn't seem the least bit welcoming or concerned about our inconvenience--especially since we arrived during a rain storm. First impressions are the most important and I guess we got off to a bad start. Other staff members were friendlier. The hotel decor is comprised of dark grays, black and browns which gave off a dingy vibe in some areas. Lack of sufficient lighting in the room compounded the problem. While the guest room and bathroom were of ample size, the closet was too shallow to hang clothes without having to squeeze them in at an angle or to store a full suitcase. 
Other than a few gripes, I would consider staying here again if the price is right and I needed to be in this part of town.

title: “Great hotel”
text: I recently stayed at the Iroquois and couldn't have been more pleased. The service was great, the rooms were very nice and very clean. Location is great. The restaurant (Triomphe) was superb. I would HIGHLY recommend staying here for anyone visiting NY.

title: “Quaint Hotel with soothing atmosphere and great location”
text: This hotel was very clean, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It is a quaint hotel with a soothing astmosphere. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay there in future trips to NYC. The location of the hotel is great also.

title: “good location”
text:
very clean and tidy,good location,room was quite spacious,
for new york. restaurants nearby, good night sleep,
staff very helpful and use of internet free. stayed here for 
7 nights enjoyed would go back

title: “Decent Enough”
text:
This was an adequate stay for a reasonable price.
The hotel is well situated on E 50th; across the street are both the Benjamin and Affinia 50, so others might want to try them for comparison.
There's nothing special about the property. The reception lounge is relatively small yet efficient. The executive room I took was ok, decent space, comfortable sofa and chairs, workable kitchen facilities - but not of a quality of a place like the Alex. Bathroom was small yet functional - ok water pressure and Aveda giveaways. Bed quality was fine.
Two gripes were the towels and the continental breakfast. The towels were so worn and thin that I thought their sandpaper-like quality might exfoliate my entire body without ever really drying it. Really, it was like a bad summer camp experience. And the continental breakfast was bland, cheap in quality and tasteless. The hotel management must have someone specifically picking up months supplies of huge quantities of nourishment at BJs or Walmart.
So, if you want that location (50th and 3rd) for a decent night's sleep, grab a discounted rate and avoid the breakfast. It's a decent enough place for a night or two (p.s. go get a breakfast bagel at Ess-A-Bagel and coffee across the street and don't even try to justify the embedded continental breakfast cost).

title: “Another excellent stay t this wonderful hotel”
text: I just finished my fifth stay at this best kept secret in Manhattan on April 17-20 and the best thing about this hotel is the friendliness of is staff fom the concierge to the bellman (Bobby) to the check-in staff. They are all amazingly kind and well-informed. The rooms are very spacious with modern furnishings. The beds are ver comfortable. The heat and A/C work very well. The television reception on some of the stations in my room (#1009) could have been better bu this small factor is not severe enough to lower my rating of the hotel. It is in every possible way five star. The continental breakfast provided every morning with the cost of your room is fine. Best of all the location is excellent for every type of sightseeing you could want to do in Manhattan.

title: “Convenient & value for money”
text: Overall a great place to stay, away from the crowd especially at Times Square. Highly recommended for families traveling with children. The only thing lacking is a self service laundry facility.

title: “I love San Carlos!”
text: The first time I stayed at San Carlos Hotel I was 7 years old, in December 1971, almost 41 years ago. Since then I've stayed there for many times. After a complete renovation, it reopened still better, that's why every time I am in NY, my choice is the San Carlos Hotel, a lovely place, with nice and confortable rooms, warm staff and perfect location.

title: “The best hotel in New York City!!”
text: We have been coming to New York City since I was a little boy, and I know all of the finest hotels in the city very well. I am now in my sixties, and there is no other hotel I would stay at in the city besides the Sherry. The rooms are beautiful, the location is the best, the staff is genuinely caring, they are like a family. And it is truly a value, not a rip-off like most other hotels in the city.

title: “Great Place”
text: I have been to midtown Manhattan many times and have stayed in a variety of hotels. This place has been the best. Nice, quiet hotel near Central Park...not noisy like the hotels near Times Square. Never had to wait for an elevator. The place has white gloved elevator operators! Rooms are nice and big and super clean. Right across the street from the Plaza if you are in the mood for some drinks. Within walking distance of everything. Will stay here again...just loved it!

title: “Great hotel in a great location”
text: Took my wife to NYC for her 50th b-day. The hotel is beautiful inside and the decor in rooms etc. made us feel as if we went back in time to the early 1900's but with modern amenities. Very ornate lobby and elevators (real live elevator operators) Great location at Central Park and within a 10 to 15 minute walk to Time Square and Broadway shows. We have stayed near Time Square in the past but wanted something less crazy and this place met our expectations. Also a short walk to Metropolitan Museum and You can pick up hop on hop off sightseeing buses, take carriage ride a block away from hotel. So for us it was convenient near attractions and less hectic than other parts of the city. We got a great price break and paid for three nights and got third for free. It is hard to find an inexpensive luxury hotel in this area. This hotel also has upscale residences in it.

title: “Elegance of a By-Gone Era”
text: The Sherry-Netherland is most definitely a very unique and exceptional hotel. While I was staying there, I felt as if I were staying in an elegant pre-war Fifth Avenue co-op apartment. The old-world elegance and the attention to the details of hospitality (a hand-written welcome note from the manager, fresh flowers, a box of lovely chocolates, gratis beverages in the refrigerator, and white-gloved elevator operators) make The Sherry-Netherland a breath of fresh air in today's cookie-cutter world of sameness and mediocrity. The Sherry-Netherland is heads and shoulders above its competition! Kudos to the exceptional staff---especially Renee and Russell. I look forword to my next stay at The Sherry!

title: “Awesome Property”
text: We had a/c problems this past weekend so decided to stay here to get away from the heat and leaking problems! It was wonderful from start to finish! LaLa at the front was very nice and made sure our evening was a good one! We used the pool and hot tub and enjoyed it. Was nice to destress a little from the problems back at the house. We had a quiet night's rest. The hotel is very warm and inviting from the staff to the rooms! Definitely recommend to anyone coming to the area! Thanks!

title: “Our dream wedding came alive!”
text:
My husband and I had our wedding there May 7th and I want to thank the staff, specially the Wedding Coordinator and catering manager Ms. Dennis and Mr. Marco, Food and Beverage Hotel Mngr. for going always ahead of us to please our needs. 
Every detail for the big day was done perfect, the timing for everything planned the food WOW delicious, guests were amazed at the food and service while they waited with appetizers and drinks. Once the party started and dinner was served everyone was even more thrilled to see the different choices in the buffet line, set up with so many choices of fresh and luscious foods. 
Our decorations were so elegant, and all the details I myself wanted such as little surprises through the night, or the way I wanted things to look, colors, chair covers, cake table, gift table, favors for guests, announcements, even our picture and sign table etc… where done exactly as I had asked them. Having our wedding there was hassle free and with less planning from our part. 
Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and we look forward to spending our next anniversary there as we can assure the next morning’s breakfast after our wedding reception was so DELICOUS we didn’t want to leave. 
As for the hotel itself, it is beautiful, it smells still like new, the rooms are comfortable, the bathrooms close to the wedding reception were kept neat and clean, and the floors and decorations were so nice and pleasant to invite anyone to stay there. We also want to mention the nice appearance of the front staff and the waitress/clean crew for looking clean and professional. 
Finally, we will keep staying at the Hilton family and would like to say one more time thanks to the Hilton Garden Inn for making it possible to have our dream wedding come true!!!
Love Diana and Marvin Gonzalez

title: “Best Hotel for Conference”
text: Just got back from a 5 day stay for a conference. Everything was excellent from the staff to the food to the room. We had excellent cleaning service in our rooms. All the food-- breakfasts, lunches and dinner were great quality with impeccable service. It was an easy walk to the stadium and we were able to use the hotel shuttle. Can say enough good things about the staff. It was a great trip.

title: “Great hotel, great price”
text: I thought the staff here were incredibly helpful and friendly. My friend was staying at the Hyatt Regency, and for a third of the price and a two-block walk from downtown, I got a larger room, free delicious breakfast, free high speed internet, and best of all, chocolate chip cookies and a happy hour! Every staff member I spoke to took an interest in me and my exploration of their city. They were very knowledgeable and provided me with terrific advice. My visit to Houston was a wonderful experience I won't soon forget. I absolutely would stay here again.

title: “Business type hotel”
text: If you're looking for a nice size room, which is reasonably clean and maintained, this may be a good choice. However, the staff was extremely cold and distant, so don't count on them for any advice, directions or any assistance, I was treated as more of an inconvenience than a guest. I believe that they only wish to cater to business travelers who need absolutely no assistance. I had no particular problem with the staff, but certainly did not feel welcome at this hotel.

title: “Dancing out 2012”
text: Fred Astaire dance competition was conducted at the Westin December 9, 2012. Although I was the only participant from our family, my wife accompanied me as a spectator. We decided to stay at the Westin instead of driving the 3-hours from San Antonio and back in one day. The welcome was spectacular; the reception persons provided service above what I would call normal greetings and assurances that our stay would be memorable. The hotel was situated comfortably in Houston, making easy on and off I-10. The guest room was roomy, clean and welcoming. The shower was very relaxing-with a rain shower head. The bed was very comfortable; and, I'm very particular. The Grille 024 restaurant provided a good breakfast buffet, but the servers went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. I found the hotel experience very nice. Generally, my wife and I stay at Bed & Breakfast establishments because we enjoy our comfort. However, the Westin made us feel just at home as most B&B's. Coming to or driving through Houston-the Weston is worth the stop.

title: “Inconsistent service”
text: The service lack finesse and consistency for a AAA - Four Diamond Award hotel. Requests like point credit and weekly email bills are ignored. Issues continued to be unresolved regardless of escalation channels. Location and newer room do not make up for their weak points.

title: “Great Choice”
text:
Excellent location of this hotel, it has a mall which you can walk through a walkway too; together with a local drop of van to various places in the area.
The conferencing/meeting facilities are excellent, along with the staff whom were on hand all the time and dealt with queries in amazing timing.
If you book a clubroom you can get access to the club lounge which is certainly worth it.
There is a open air pool on the top floor and jacuzzi which were great and the views too, were excellent
I will most certainly be booking this hotel again for a future business event for sure

title: “Nice new hotel”
text:
I stayed at the hotel 2 nights for buisness in January 2012. The hotel is new and looks very nice. They have new card readers in the elevators which seemed to confuse some people. They prevent non-hotel guest from getting to guest floors, it was an appreciated security feature. The food was excellent during the course. The hotel is connected to the mall which is a nice feature and very convienent to grad something to eat or pick up something you forgot at Target. 
The only negatives were that my room faced the free-way which was very noisey. I also had a view into the hospital rooms next door. When I checked out the front desk said they were calling for a ride, after waiting 25 minutes, I found out they didn't call and I almost missed my flight.

title: “Beautiful Hotel, Rooms, and view of downtown”
text:
The Westin - Memorial City was a beautiful hotel. Stayed there for a long weekend while traveling for a wedding. The hotel is brand new (about a year old). I was absolutely amazed by our King Suite we had. HUGE corner balcony with expansive view of downtown, huge living room, kitchen, and separate bedroom. It also had 1.5 bathrooms (unexpected). Staff was helpful and nice. There was a neat waterfall in the bar. The pool patio gets a decent amount of sun late morning/early afternoon, but after that it's all shaded - not the best for sunbathers. 
I don't agree with having to pay for parking at the hotel since it's in a residential area. I would understand if the hotel was in downtown or a densely populated area, but not when it's out in the "suburb." I hope the hotel rethinks it's $12/night parking fee - should be free for guests - or at least a perk for us SPG members.
Overall - I will return and recommend Westin!

title: “Trendy and noisy”
text:
Quality of hotels in this area is poor, and other reviews are not wrong that the standards are pretty good here.
Big plus is ability to walk to lots of restaurants, yes WALK in Texas!
Also close to main highways so great for getting to most places.
Downsides - if you face the courtyard they have some very noisy music that goes into the early hours at the weekends - if you're here to party not a problem. If you are here to sleep bring the ear plugs.
Breakfast buffet suits me, lots of fruit and cereal and a few high sugar pastries, but might not suit those looking for hot breakfasts or a little variety. Come early - seating can get tight.
Minor comments - need more English breakfast tea sachets at breakfast and lifts can be very slow.
Overall a refreshing change from boring norm, but not quite up to international standards.

title: “Swanky Party Scene”
text: My wife and I arrived Friday evening to a large party crowd in the lobby and at the bar, which had a live band playing. The band was rockin' but we were pretty tired after a days worth of layovers. The bros running around the lobby were not sober by any means and did not appear to be upstanding citizens, so we were not at ease during the check-in process. I guess if your not with them, you really don't want to play with them. Normally, I'd be up for shenanigans, but we were tired. If the swank, party city scene is yours, this would be a viable choice. The hotel is located within walking distance to a wine tasting bar/restaurant and a brewhouse with hundred's of fresh brews from around the world to choose from. We woke up every morning to some activity blasting in the city center (yoga and spinning classes). The rooms were modern and clean. Walk-in shower that's legit, no toilet/sink/shower privacy. The lights were a little dazed and confusing and almost felt prison-like. Overall, not a bad place for those seeking great restaurants, activities, and a Vegas scene minus the gambling. It really is in the city center.

title: “Wonderful Stay, we'll be back!”
text: I just spent a wonderful night at the Hotel Sorella, Sat. March 24th. Service was wonderful and the rooms are very nice. I asked for a room on a high floor facing away from the citycentre activities and I'm glad I did! We didn't hear a thing and it made for a great night's sleep! The beds are very comfortable and decorated nicely. The room had plenty of pillows, towels and 2 bathrobes. We are from Katy so this was a mini staycation after having dinner at Eddy V's and sipping wine at the tasting room. We also visited the bar at the MonaLisa and they had a live band that was AWESOME!

title: “Disappointing stay at Sorella”
text: Looked forward to our stay after reading all the wonderful reviews on tripadvisor. I have mobility issue and handicap parking here is horrible. We could not find any marked spaces near hotel entrance, only near the theatre entrance as they share the parking garage. Hint: head to level 3 of garage to directly access level 2 (lobby) of the hotel. Encountered housekeeping issues as there were green stains on sheets which had to be changed. The following day we did not receive housekeeping service and by 5:00 had to request service twice. The front desk staff apologized and we were suprised when a bottle of wine arrived with apologies for the inconvenience. The continental breakfast is average and the lounge was suprisingly dirty both mornings we ate there. The furniture in corridor leading to lobby is shabby. Bathroom is very small and cleaning was spotty. On a positive note, the location of hotel is near great restaurants, shopping, spa and movie theatre. My husband loved the sectional in room where he could stretch out. Bed was comfortable. However, I would not choose to stay at this property again.

title: “Great Place In the Heart of the City”
text: I had a layover at Houston International Airport and didn't want to stay at another airport hotel. I chose to stay here and was really glad I did. The service staff were great, the hotel lobby fantastic and the rooms really nice (not large but reminiscent of a by-gone era in terms of decor yet with the updated amenities that one would expect). I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

title: “Why do big hotels nickel and dime you?”
text:
The Four Seasons on Houston is a wonderful hotel. My room was a suite of some sort - very comfortable bed, very quiet and very clean. The restaurant in the hotel, Quattro, we really great and the staff were, without exception friendly.
My only complaint is why, oh why does a hotel that charges the rates that the Four Seasons does nickel and dime clients when it comes to wifi? I arrived in the evening and checked out next morning so occupied the room for 17 hours tops yet I had to pay for wifi and pay for 24 hours of wifi. Really?

title: “Nice stay.”
text: What a 5-star hotel should be. Service was top-notch. The staff was always helpful.

title: “Small Rooms, but Service makes up for that”
text:
Spent a night in the Four Seasons Houston, and the personalized service was exactly as expected, very responsive with dry cleaning and fax services (if you need a doc printed, don't bother with the business center and the $1 per page printing cost, just email your doc to the front desk and they will print and deliver.
Ate at the bar and Quattro for breakfast, very good crab cake at the bar for $5. Breakfast very reasonable from hotel standards if you are ok drinking water. A juice and coffee costs about the same as an entree.
Courtesy car was great, Joe and Rashid were both very friendly and responsive, will take you anywhere within downtown quickly.
Only complaints I had were the size of the room and the second day my room was not serviced until after 3pm, which of course was when I was at the gym and coming back to shower and finding I could not get in, waiting 20 minutes outside which was slightly annoying, but just unlucky.

title: “Loved it - would recommend”
text: omfortable, clean and a great base for sightseeing in NY. Ideally located for restaurants and drinks in the local area too. Stayed room only, but loved the kitchenette and comfortable facilities. Enjoyed the great view down broadway - really made us feel part of the action - a lovely romantic break!

title: “Another fantastic stay”
text: This was my second stay at the Beacon Hotel in September this year. It was even better than the first. The service is impeccable, the location fantastic particularly with the Fairways Supermarket across the road and the rooms are roomy and well equipped. I will certainly be staying here again. And don't forget to try the Fairways Cafe above the supermarket - great food!!

author.location: Fairy Meadow, New South Wales, Australia

title: “Favorite Place I've Stayed”
text: My friend who lives in the Upper West Side recommended this place, and I'm so glad she did. The subway stop was very close - with the Red 1 line as an option. Gets you to high destinations quick with less stops. Hotel rooms were roomy, great beds, perfect sized kitchenette and wonderful staff. The rate was moderate, but you get a lot more for your money than most similarly priced hotels. Lots of great restaurants close (not to mention the Museum of Natural History & Central Park). This is where I will stay from now on.

title: “Funky hotel on 5th Avenue”
text:
I thought I had walked into an Apple Store with the funky check in area! Fab service and loved the extra touch of a glass of wine during check in.
Loved the view of the library and being so close to Bryant Park. The service is great, and bathroom was wow. Highly recommended

title: “Best of the Best and Only Get Better”
text:
Assumming luxury at its best. Upon checking into the lobby I was greeted as if I was a familar . I arrived approximately 1 hour or more prior to my check in time. The person staff person who greeted me was very apologetic that my one room suite was not yet available. He stated excitely that I would be very pleased with him because he had an upgrade for me. We were offered compliminatary beverages while we waited and someone appeared from nowhere to take our laugage.
 The update was a two bedroom suite. Wowwwww!!!! I had a bedroom and full bath to myself. The bathroom; marble and glass and more marble and glass in all of the right places. The shower; water. . .water . . .everywhere. This place was well appointed I was travling with my two daughters for my eldest daughter's 13th birthday celebration. Every detailed was taken care of with class and style. From every angle there was a great view from the floor to ceiling windows. With all of this, I still felt like I was right at home but only with my own private staff 24/7 hours a day.
 I am looking for an excuse to go back again. My youngest daughter stated that she did not want to go back because she stated that "nothing could match this".
 Pricey but well worth it. This is my New City place to stay.

title: “Perfect!”
text: Unfortunately this was a quick visit and we only spent one night at this Hyatt property, but it was perfect. The standard King room was small and cozy - typical for NYC, but the windows were huge and our room faced the library. Beautiful view. There are suites available, but the standard room suited us just fine. This is not your typical Hyatt-it is more like a boutiquE hotel. The whole property is VERY quiet, the staff is helpful yet subtle, the decor is soothing, sleek, modern and minimalistic. The Bar Downstairs was very hip and the food was delicious. The bathroom was very large-the best feature was the extra large shower. Tile and glass with foot bath, handheld shower and rain shower features! My only complaint, if it can even be called a complaint, is that the lighting in the bathroom was a bit too dim. This is by far one of the best Hyatt we have stayed at, and since we are Diamond members, we stay at a lot of Hyatts. A great choice if you want a change from the "big chain feel" of most Hyatts.

title: “Top Class Hotel in New York!”
text: Stayed here in May of this year for 5 nights. It is a beautiful hotel in the perfect location. Service was second to none and our room was outstanding. You will pay for the pleasure but it was more than worth it!

title: “Classy hotel....location superb....service brilliant”
text:
We absolutely loved our stay at The Setai. The service was impeccable. The hotel feels really classy but the staff are very approachable and helpful. We got upgraded to a one bedroom suite which was spacious and welcoming. The mirror in the bathroom had a tv built into it...amazing. Would recommend you get a deal with breakfast included as a little pricey but very tasty.
It's locations brilliant...on Fifth Ave. Only a few mins walk to the major shopping hub on 34th. About 15 mins walk to Central Park and a couple of streets from Empire State Building. Just loved it, would recommend it to anyone.

title: “Fabulous!”
text: This is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at, and I have traveled a great deal. The staff could not have been more accommodating, polite, helpful, and efficient! The rooms are spotless. The location is perfect -- just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of 42nd Avenue, but close enough to walk everywhere I needed to go. The bed was so comfortable. No need to get used to a "different" bed as in some hotels. Each time I walked into the hotel I felt I was coming home and once in the room I felt completely at home! I will look for The Setai wherever I travel, and hope I get to stay here everytime I am in New York City.

title: “An AMAZING property”
text:
So, this place is fabulous. I stayed at the Hyatt before I stayed here, and this was like an island oasis.
First, the service is FANTASTIC. Everyone greets you by name. You get complimentary pressing. You get complimentary shoe shining. 
Second, the amenities are great. There's a complimentary mini-bar. There's a huge soaking tub. The soaps smell lovely. You get a pouch with a loofa and other nice things. 
This is where I plan for the foreseeable future when I have to go to New York. It's just not worth staying anywhere else.

title: “Attentive service, amazing room.”
text:
We arrived far earlier than the check-in time, however, Christine at the front desk upgraded us to a junior suite, took our bags and phone number and told us to go enjoy the City and she would call us when the room was ready. The room was amazing. Large, modern and clean. The bathroom is not only a work of art, but it spoils you at every turn. All requests were met with immediate attention and gracious service.
We had drinks at the Lambs Club (again, attentive service) and as we stepped out to dinner, I decided I didn't need my sweater and the gentleman at the front desk offered to put it back in our room for me.

title: “If you get a deal on a room...”
text:
Pros:
-Top-notch service
-Excellent location
-Very good "boutique" hotel feel (not a big hotel, Art Deco theme throughout)
-Nice bar/restaurant attached (Lambs) with a very happening bar and jazz on Wed
-Cool bathroom 
-Free shoeshine, internet, butler to press your clothes, etc
Cons:
-Minor, but there is no ironing board/iron in the room. Sure you can use the butler but if already in your pjs you may not want to mess with the hassle
-Gym is a joke (free weights and a couple of treadmills)
-There are no views
-Walls are very thin. Sitting at the desk, I could hear every word the person in the next room said as they were chatting with someone else on the phone. And they were using a normal talking voice. Slept with earplugs to ensure I wasn't woken up. Overall wasn't that big of a deal to me, but surprising given quality of hotel
Overall great hotel. With rates this high, though, something like being able to hear every word of your neighbor is surprising. If you get a deal on a room you'll probably be able to overlook this (too many other positives of the hotel), but if you are paying rack rate and expect perfection, hotel can't offer it.

title: “Kimpton never seems to fail me. Eventi NYC is delightful.”
text:
Just got back from a weekend trip at the Eventi with my partner and another couple and found the hotel to be charming, chic, elegant, and accommodating. All of the things I've grown used to from Kimpton. We stayed in a suite (pricey) and it was everything I was hoping for. The bedroom was well appointed, perfectly lit, amazing bed. The bathroom was the highlight...this is not your normal NYC bathroom or room for that matter. It was spacious and the shower was simply perfect. We were in a high enough floor that I didn't hear any noise. This is a real treat as anyone whose ever stayed in NY know that the traffic noise can be annoying while you try to sleep.
I also loved my yoga bag, being able to use their gym and the great products in the bathroom. I wish I had taken photos as the room was just as attractive as the photos on their site. My only issue was that the hotel is not really in Chelsea (or if it is it's on the border) but closer to Herald Square. I was looking to walk to great restaurants and bars but really they weren't in that area. Chelsea's best spots are south of 24th and this was at 30th St. Still you are close to the subway which was great and walking in NYC is part of the fun. Kimpton...please keep up the great work. I don't want you guys to loose your mojo.

title: “Gem in midtown Manhattan”
text:
Took a chance on hotel we'd not heard of, and what a pleasant suprise! Reviews we read were all accurate - very friendly staff, very helpful. Rooms were very nice, clean, modern - bathrooms were large with big, beautiful shower - beds were very comfortable with several pillows. Nice flat-screen TV with lots of channels. I felt it was also a large room compared to some of the little rooms you get in NYC hotels. Free coffee/tea in the morning and wine reception at night. Good location too - easy stroll up to 42nd street and Times Square, and hit all major subways at 34th street just a couple blocks away. Excellent coffee close by too at Stumptown on 29th. 
Great hotel at great price - highly recommend!

title: “3 Strikes”
text:
This is my 3rd trip to the Eventi. As a (somewhat disgruntled ) Starwood Platinum member, I have been giving Kimpton a serious try. Most of their hotels are wonderful. Eventi just does not make the grade. The staff for the most part are very gracious. But something is always just not quite right here. My first visit they had some sort of water pipe break which flooded some guest rooms. They gallantly and apologetically put me on a steeper sofa for the night. OK, stuff happens--I understand. The next trip here they somehow cancelled my room--yes I was late, but I had told them I would be late, but they did get me a room and sent a very nice amenity to the room. I kind of decided this one would be chalked up to my fault: I was late arriving. The third visit started out great. An upgrade to a suite by a wonderfully gracious friendly welcome staff. I get to my floor and there are dirty room service trays everywhere. This is at 4:15 PM. One has to order ice here from room service. 25 minutes later and 3 calls it finally arrives. When I complained there was an excuse about the ice has to come from the resturant. I asked if the NYC garbage collection department was responsible for collecting half day old room service litter in the hallways, and asked for the general manager to call me. Yes- I admit my happiness with the suite upgrade had faded now in the face of inattentive service. 
So my advice: great location, very friendly staff, nice rooms, but the attention to detail leaves a bit to be desired. My experience here makes me re-think my plan to leave Starwood for Kimpton, but I have to admit other Kimpton properties have been quite wonderful. If the kind of issues I've described don't bother you much, then you will probably like Eventi quite a lot.

title: “First class hotel -- extremely memorable”
text: Everything was perfect. Elegant, great service, fascinating artwork throughout the hotel, and outdoor dining on the 6th floor terrace, facing Ground Zero. Only afterwards did I realize that the large outdoor screen adjacent to the hotel was part of the hotel. Extremely memorable.

title: “Adequate but Overrated on here.”
text:
A small "boutique" hotel but without the truly boutique features. It's an adequate average hotel with small rooms and tiny bathrooms even for NY. Comfortable bed but noisy ac, no coffee maker or kettle and no curtains. Shower standard within bath. As I said. Not really boutique. 
Service was fine and it was good to use the gym restroom and shower before leaving. 
Guys on the entrance doors did everything other than hold the doors open. Idle chat to their mates seemed the order of the day. Go take a walk up to the Setai on 5th and see how it should be done is my suggestion to them . 
Would I return ? Only if most other usual options in this price bracket were unavailable.

title: “Great hotel”
text:
Nice hotel with personable hotel staff. Molton Brown toiletries. 
The rooms are small but normal for NYC. I stayed in the smallest room and it was fine for one night. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the street was fairly quiet.

title: “Normal Hotel with a perfect location”
text:
the hotel is an OK hotel.. nothing fancy about it all, given the fact that it is a 4 stars establishment, but yet doesn't look like one, however, if you want a clean decent hotel with a perfect location, then this is it, I would say that the negative thing about it was the price, I don't think it was well worth the price.
on the other hand, if you want a taxi take the meter taxi, i was cheated the first day by the door man, who advised me to take a private car to a Russian restaurant that was only 5 minutes away driving from the hotel, and costed me USD 25, the door man added that the place i am going to was too far and the taxi may not know the place, pushing me to agree to the 25 dollars ride, which unfortunately i accepted, when i cam back i decided to take a meter taxi that costed me USD 8 with the tip ONLY.. beware.
the room i stayed in was a superior room, the room size was ok, good for 2 at least, the bathroom size was also fine, no complains, however the room furniture looked old, cheap but clean at least, the the negative thing about the room was lack of lights, I do not think it will hurt the management to put some lights in room (at some points it was irritating).
other than the above, my stay was smooth, problem free, and the staff were very good

title: “Great Hotel in an excellent location”
text:
We just spent a few days in New York staying at the San Carlos. From the moment of arrival you could tell this was something different, something out of the ordinary.
The receptionist greeted us warmly, took time to ask about our trip and explain the facilities of the hotel. Now this could have been a one off, an employee on a good day, however we found all the staff to be uniformly friendly, informative and very helpful.
We had booked a one room suite and were pleased with the size of the room and its practicality. It comes with a microwave, mini fridge and a well proportioned living room. The room also had a good safe, free wifi and two large TV's. The hotel also provides a 'computer suite' on the second floor for guests consisting of 6 PC's and 2 Printers.
The hotel is in an excellent location for exploring the city with 2 subway stops within a couple of blacks, plenty of good restaurants in the area and it is within walking distance of Rockefeller and Central Parks.
Would definitely stay here on the next visit to New York.

title: “The San Carlos equals great service.”
text: After spending a night in another "big hotel", left there, came here. The staff was wonderful and most accomodating to our needs. I've stayed here 4 times now, and will never stay anywhere else. The front desk staff is phenominal to my wife and I. The place is roomy, quiet, and has all those amenities that make a great hotel. Do yourself a favor, stay here and enjoy NYC.

title: “Great hotel. Super location & staff.”
text: Rooms were large and beautifully decorated!! Staff was helpful & friendly. Very comfortable bed!!

title: “Amazing hotel with an incredible staff”
text: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. We have stayed here a few times now and we really don't ever want to stay anywhere else when we visit NYC. We have stayed in suites and rooms and even the rooms are very large. You can't beat a suite! No two are the same and they are all HUGE! The hotel is very quiet. We hardly ever see another person and we definitely don't hear a thing. The staff go out of there way to greet you and make sure that you have everything that you need. I can't imagine a nicer hotel in NYC. I HIGHLY recommend the Sherry Netherland!!

title: “LOCATION”
text:
Location is perfect, but not all the rooms are fine. The first day we were on a room on the 3rd floor with an ugly interior view, no hot water, and they were not able to change the room till the next day,we had an interior regular view on the 10th floor, and everything was ok, nice amenities and free soft drinks on the fridge. Bad wi fi signal on both rooms.
Jummeirah essex house is a much better option with same location and very similar prices.

title: “Great Event Venue!”
text: Not only is this property in a great, central location, but it's a beautiful hotel as well! The banquet team can't be beat - everything was set up perfectly and were happy to help with last minute preparations. The catering was exceptional also. Extremely accommodating! We will be hosting our future seminars here!

title: “Let me count the ways I adore you, HGI-Energy Corridor”
text:
I have stayed at this hotel numerous times in Houston when I come to town to visit my clients in the Energy Corridor. I love the convenient location and the staff are great too. I've stayed at countless Hilton properties and this one is one of my go-to's and favorites. This hotel is a gem in the HGI crown!
Let me count the ways I love this place: 
- (Insert oil company name here) is just minutes away! 
- There's a Kinko's next door! 
- I don't have to get on the freeway to get to my meetings! 
- There are tons of restaurant options nearby (sushi, Mexican, BBQ, etc)!
- I am always greeted as a return customer, and they've upgraded my rooms a few times!
This hotel has great hospitality and I think it is a no brainer if you're going here for business. The staff are great and know what they are doing. 
One tip though - book well in advance, because this HGI's awesomeness is known around town to energy corridor business travelers, this HGI is often booked to capacity. I've had to pull the Hilton strings more than once to make a reservation when they've appeared to be sold out. Now you have a tip to outsmart everyone to get your room here, too.

title: “Wedding Reception ROCKED!”
text: Our son and new daughter in law had their wedding reception here. It not only met expectations, but exceeded our expectations. The event planner and restaurant manager were on site for the entire event making sure everything ran smoothly. There was plenty of waitstaff, the food was amazing and the event was truly magical. Truly lived up to the Hilton name.

title: “Best ever for conventions”
text: There were some 700 very picky people at this hotel for a conference, and every single person I spoke to agreed emphatically that this was the best hotel we have ever experienced for a conference. The location is good, the room was very spacious, and the management clearly knows what guests want. The staff was well trained to respond to guest requests quickly in a courteous manner. All six elevators worked promptly. The hotel was beautiful and clean.; iIt looked new. The convention staff was superb in every way -- responsive, courteous, anticipating our needs. All meetings were on one floor-- a big plus. The food was outstanding, the best I have ever had at a conference. As I was leaving, a kind employee insisted on helping me with my bag. Turns out he was the General Manager. Clearly he is out there among the guests. Now that's good management.

title: “Perfect Location”
text:
The Hilton America's Houston was perfect and I have to give it the best rating. The location was wonderful, my family and I stayed there for a convention and the hotel like others said is directly connected. Perfect. The green buses that run downtown are right there as well and I LOVED the Hilton Downtown Shuttle as well. We utilized both and found them very helpful. We also went to an Astro game which was within walking distance and it was fun you could see all the excitement from outside our room which had a gorgeous view of the park. 
The employees we encountered from Front Desk, Starbucks, Breakfast place, Bell Desk etc were all so nice, helpful and went above and beyond. A+ job to everyone!! I am huge on customer service, and I was really pleased. I am a Hilton Honors member as well and was very pleased with the service I received with that as well.
The room was typical, clean and I loved the pole in the shower so you could hang a towel or steam clothes. Used it every day!! I did encounter a problem (not the Hilton's fault, it was drunk people from a wedding being held there on that Saturday) and the Hilton took care of it. Wonderful time in Houston, so much to do and this Hilton made our trip so much better!!

title: “Great location for taking in Astros game”
text: I stayed here for business and was entertaining clients at Minute Maid Park. Just a short walk to the game. Hotel was very nice and had that new and clean feel all the way through. Restaurant and bar were good and staff was friendly. I did not get to use the fitness center, but I will definately stay here again.

title: “Good place for a good price”
text: I was in town for a conference and did not have a car. The location is close to downtown--walking distance about 6 city blocks--and felt relatively safe. There is a decent happy hour for registered guests; a small, but nice workout room; and free computer access and printing, which I appreciated to print out my boarding pass. The bed was extremely comfortable and nice. My only complaint is that the desk staff was not particularly forthcoming about the free shuttle service it provides to the downtown area. It's fast and free, but only runs during the day. At check-in, I asked about my conference location for the next morning and was told it was an easy 7-block walk. But, of course, I had luggage, etc., so I wasn't too thrilled with that news. No mention was made of the shuttle service. When I checked out the info in the room, I saw the shuttle service and called the front desk. I confirmed that the service was available. I was amused that the person who advised about the "easy" walk was my shuttle driver. Nonetheless, a good place for a quick overnighter. No close-by restaurants, however, and area delivery was SLOOOWWW and minimums for delivery were high for one person.

title: “Great for the $$”
text: We were only staying one night in Houston, and didn't want to pay a fortune! This place was PERFECT! Very clean & location was convenient. We would definitely stay here again!

title: “a bit far from downtown”
text:
I stayed here for the houston marathon over MLk weekend in 2006. It was not right in downtown, but close enough for me to walk to the expo and race start, but keep in mind, i run marathons, other people would consider this hotel too far to walk.
the rooms were very nice, large, clean, and comfortable.
the breakfast was more than the usual continental - hot waffles, eggs, and good selection of cereals, yogurt adn fruit.
No places to eat near hotel, so you would need a car to go to a restaraunt. 
pretty affordable, somewhat cheaper than the hotels that were located right in the downtown.

title: “Great Location and Huge Rooms”
text:
I have stayed here many tiumes and always happy. Free wireless and wired internet and HBO, free breakfast. Great location, clean rooms and coffee maker.
I always walk downtown although there is a free shuttle bus. It only takes about 5 minutes to walk.
In the evening I would avoid walking near the hotel, its a little crappy!
There are some great restaurants and pubs on W Gray, only 2 minute drive. Mexican, Japanese, Soul Food. The Front Porch pub is particualrly good, amazing range of beers.

title: “Perfect for business in the area”
text: Great location, two minutes from I-10. You can walk inside a tunnel with A/C to the Memorial City Mall or next door to the Memorial Hermann Memoriay City Medical Center. Hotel has a complimentary shuttle to business nearby.

title: “Very nice property.”
text: I stayed here the past weekend for myself. I was upgraded to the executive suite, which i greatly appreciate.The room was very nice, having a patio to myself was definitely a plus to my stay. The mall side view was very nice. The fitness center and the rooftop heated pool were amazing. I definitely recommend this place.

title: “Nice modern new rooms, comfy, clean, great location! Very nice stay”
text:
Overall it is a pleasant stay at Westin. Staffs are quiet friendly and helpful. Rooms are modern, new and clean. The club lounge is also really nice with a view. I am very pleased with my stay.
I do notice, if you do the club level rooms, it is on the 17th floor, ask for a room not below the gym!!!! or else you will hear weight dropping on your ceiling!!! 
Parking is easy, skybridge over to the mall, it is a good value!

title: “Not the best hotel”
text:
Pros: 
*New
*Clean
*Modern
*Quiet
*location was good
*service was average 
*provides 2 bottles of complimentary water
*exchange housekeeping service for SPG points (500pts per night that you do not wish for your room to be cleaned)
*Pool was small but very nice
Cons: 
*Ridiculous rates for wi-fi!!!! $9.99/day/device. (if i got wifi on my laptop it costs $9.99 and if I wanted wifi on my phone it is ANOTHER $9.99! and executive club rates do not include wifi)
*Expensive (our rate was $209 excl taxes but included access to executive club with has continental buffet and o"dourves which are almost the same everyday)
*does not accept travellers cheques (this is the first hotel that I've been to that does not accept travellers cheques) 
*Housekeeping only makes your bed and tidy a few other things 
(they do not put your iron board, phones, bathrobes and other things back to its orignal place)
*I got wake up a call at 6:30am when I asked for a wake up call at 7:30 am
*check-in agents are not knowledgeable and took a long time to check-in guests which lead to a line up
Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. We are actually leaving this hotel to try Hotel Sorella at City Centre.

title: “The best staycation in Houston.”
text: Between Erica at the front desk and our wonderful waiter Oscar the faculty at the Icon have made our stay wonderful and memorable. From the moment the valet took our vehicle we have encountered nothing but, smiling and curtious staff. I would recommend the icon to anyone planning on being in the downtown area.

title: “Excellent hotel, as expected.”
text:
I have previously reviewed this hotel, and you may find my comments on the link that will show up below. I encourage you to read it for a more comprehensive review of the hotel.
Having visited this hotel before, I was much more at ease with the unusual check in process. I enjoyed a glass of wine while the friendly attendant took care of the setting me up in the system and handing me my key. Since I had stayed before I turned down a tour of the hotel.
The hotel is as impeccable as it was last time. I booked a different room this time, to ensure that I would have a view of the New York Public Library and Bryant Park. It was very much worth it! The bathroom is beautiful, and the shower is possibly the best of any hotel I've stayed at.
I look forward to returning on my next trip to New York City!

title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel opposite NY Library”
text:
If you don't like the big chains, stay at Andaz. Even though it's the Hyatt premium brand, it feels like a boutique hotel.
The rooms are very comfortable, in a clean design. The shower is wonderful. The snacks and non-alcoholic beverages at the mini bar are free.
People-wise, the team is very welcoming and polite.

title: “Very nice and luxurious stay in Manhattan.”
text:
The Setai fifth avenue is a very good 5 star hotel in the heart of Manhattan. The service is very good, from the start of your booking until you check out. The rooms are big and luxurious for New York and are cleaned 2 times a day. You have a nespressomachine. We enjoyed a great coffee every morning.
