The fridge is included and so you can enjoy a selection of soda’s every day. The WIFI works very good and is also complementary. A nice feature is the television in the bathroom in the mirror. The hotel restaurant Ai Fiori is one best Italian restaurants in the city. It’s not cheap but certainly worth the money. The breakfast, you can choose to have it in the room or at the restaurant is ok, but nothing special and every day the same.
But if you go to New York and you are searching for a very good hotel and a 5 star service don’t hesitate and book a room in the Setai Fifht av., you won’t be disappointed.

title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Friendly Staff”
text:
Stayed here for two days and loved it. The hotel is a beautiful conversion of a private club - great new interior in a McKim Meade and White building. It's near Times Square but quiet. 
We booked a King suite with terrace. The terraces on the front of the hotel have a perfect New York urban feel. Also loved the 2nd Floor bar and the Lamb's dining room. Can't say enough about how beautiful the hotel is throughout. 
Staff were all great. Christine at the front desk in particular took excellent care of us. Highly recommend this place as a central beautiful place use as a base in NY.

title: “Service!!!”
text: Best service in NYC...Elizabeth at the front desk is always so helpful!!! I give them a 10...!! The restaurants are also very good and the upstairs bar is always happening. The bathrooms are amazing with full amenites. The location is also a big plus for me. Reall excellent stay and highly recommend The Chatwal....Its also a Starwood property with a great awards program.

title: “5* service, 5* quietness, 5* amenities, 1* view”
text:
Great gem 25 steps from Time Square!
Check-in and check-out: very helpful staff. Elizabeth was all smiles as she wrote down my requirements for what I call my dream room so that next time I come to the hotel I get exactly what I need.
Butler: Brandong was extremely helpful as we were working on gathering props for two TV segments on ABC. Placed calls, helped us find the right stores, etc...
Cleaning staff: just perfect
Bell/valet: smiling and efficient
Quietness: excellent for the insomniac that I am!!! I could sleep full nights (a treat in NY!)
Room: modern yet functional. Attention to details. Very comfy bed. Enough blankets and pillows. Spacious working station and charging outlets are numerous.
Bathroom is exquisite with an intriguing toilet with heated seat and other cool functions. Shower is great though the cord is on the short side and might lead to some leaks outside of the tub if you are 150% careful! You will even find a TV in the mirror!
However, room 205 has a terrible view....basically facing another brick building a few feet away! Oppressing feeling for sure.
And the internet truly sucks....terrible speed, impossible to connect at times, etc.....
Food: just tried the breakfast. Excellent quality! Well worth the price. Their Earl Grey is very tasty.
I would definitely come back IF I get more natural light in my room.
Great job guys!

title: “It's fine but struggle to recognise high rankings from others”
text: Stayed for two nights for business. Nothing the matter with the place. Staff friendly rooms clean and toiletries good. But rooms also tiny the lobby dark and small and there is little special about the hotel that merits the high rankings on this site. It's dine but not special in any way.

title: “Good Boutique Hotel in New York City”
text:
This Hotel has an excellent location right in the theater district. You can esentially walk to any Broadway Theater Production. 
The Hotel itself is small and very clean. .The rooms are updated, well appointed and the bathrooms are very nice- done all in granite. The rooms are on the smalll side- but this is typical of New York city where a large room is either rare or very very expensive.
The Hotel is on the quiet side. We found this to be a positive but if you prefer an establishment that is buzzing, this may not be for you..
The French Restaurant at the Hotel was closed at the time of our visit. This was the one major disappointment of our visit. We had eaten in the restaurant seveal times befoe which is how we discovered the Hotel. When we made the reservation to stay at the hotel, we were not notified that the Triomphe Restaurant would be under renovation during our stay; we would have preferred to have known this in advance.
Since we booked by e mail, it would have been thoughtful if the Hotel would have let us know of this temporary disruption in advance.

title: “Comfortable, intimate European feeling hotel”
text: I have stayed here several times and each time am very pleased to be here. The multi-lingual, efficient and friendly staff is equally comfortable with English and non-English speakers and the number of non-American guests attests to this. Most of the rooms are good size with refrigerators and microwaves and coffee service. Very clean. Decor is subdued - nice calm after being in NYC. Continental breakfast is tasty with good pastries. Be sure to ask for the NY Times. Convenient for mid-town, close to several subways. Easy to get to Broadway.

title: “Outstanding value for NYC”
text: I am much more of a "W" Hotel type of gal. But it's hard to justify W prices and comparatively tiny rooms when you can stay just around the corner in a 2-room suite with a kitchenette (we paid $269/nt with our corporate rate in late Feb). Hubby was able to go into the other room and watch TV/recline on the sofa when he woke up at 5AM; I was able to sleep in the bedroom undisturbed. Great to have a fridge to store our bottle of wine. Great to have real wine glasses & corkscrew. Nice to have plates to use for any food we brought back. Nice to have a place to put all of that (countertop, sink, small dining table and two chairs). Bathroom is well appointed (Aveda products), with vanity plenty large for two adults to spread out. Reception staff are charming and helpful. Free breakfast offered each morning off the lobby featuring breads, pastries, cereals, yogurts, cottage cheese w/juice, coffee. Fine if you have kids that need filling with carbs. For a real breakfast or a business breakfast, go to the National (Lex and 50th) or for real NY bagels go to Ess-A Bagels on Third (betw 50 & 51). We even met the OWNER as we were checking out. Where else in NYC do you meet the actual owner of the hotel where you are staying???

title: “Such nice southern hospitality!”
text: We booked here because they were able to offer connecting rooms and the location was good for visiting family. We arrived at 10pm and there were no connecting rooms, (we could have called ahead to confirm but did not). The front desk staff worked together to come up with a plan to accommodate our family and after the first night we switched one of the rooms which worked fine. They were so polite and helpful. In fact, EVERYONE working at the hotel was unbelievably hospitable....a very well trained staff! Price seemed low coming from Calif but we found out that other similar hotels in the area were less expensive. Still, no complaints. Rooms were quiet, large, comfortable and clean and staff was amazing so it was money well spent!

title: “This is a great hotel”
text: In for yet another soccer tournament. We really enjoyed our stay. Everything was so clean and neat. There was a warm smell of cookies or vanilla in the lobby that made it feel welcoming. Our room was spacious, and the beds were very comfortable. The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend this hotel. Conveniently located just off of I-10.

title: “Good hotel if location to Houston isn't important”
text:
We selected this hotel over hotels closer to Houston because of its high rating in Trip Advisor. I was a little disappointed and wish I had gone with a hotel closer to the city. It's not that it's a bad hotel, it isn't. It just donesn't deserve being the #6 best hotel in Houston. From my standards, it's a very good hotel, just what you would expect from a Hampton or a Garden Inn, but it's not an outstanding hotel.
On the downside, the service is spotty. Some staff are increadibly helpful while others are not. For example, wanting a cup of coffee around 3 pm on a Sunday afternoon we discovered it was cold. When we told the front desk about it, their reply was that we would have to wait a couple of hours until the new shift came on duty. What?! Room service was also slow on some days. We had to wait until 5:30 pm on a Sunday to get a maid to make up our room.
On the upside, the breakfast is very nice at a cost of $10 per person. There are cookies in the lobby in the afternoon. The wireless Internet and parking is free. The exercise room is minimal but acceptable. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and quiet which is what is more important than a hot cup of coffee on a Sunday afternoon.

title: “Stay here often. Always a pleasure.”
text: Stay frequently for business. The staff goes out of their way to make sure you are well looked after. My home away from home.

title: “Great Hotel!”
text: My wife and I stayed five days for a tradeshow. This is a beautiful property that is joined by walking bridge to the convention center. The hotel is impeccably clean, the room was spacious, including the bathroom which had excellent light. The beds were especially comfortable. Great service, friendly staff. There is a great park directly across the street with a lake, and always various activities going on. It is within a block or two of shopping and restaurants downtown. We did enjoy the hotel restaurant, especially their outstanding breakfast buffet. This was our second stay here, it's a great hotel.

title: “Best hotel ever”
text: Just spent 5 days at this hotel at a convention. It is quite possibly my best hotel experience ever. The staff were awesome at every level, food was excellent, and the service was impeccable. I will certainly return here, congratulations on running a great hotel, I would highly recommended this place

title: “Hilton "Downtown Houston"”
text:
My husband and I spent our 14th year wedding anniversary at the Hilton Hotel in downtown Houston and it was the best day of our lives. We were treated with such generosity and well wishes for our special day. We would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation because they have definitely proven to be the hotel of choice. The Hilton family is the best and we are looking forward to our next stay! 
Renetta and Charles

title: “Downtown Houston”
text: Very good hotel. The staff was most accommodating, willing to go above and beyond to provide service. Cafe service was a little slow, but food was excellent. Great rooms with good amenities. Check in and check out was easy with proper details already entered. Room service was prompt (quicker than ordering in the Cafe) and hot food arrived hot, cold food arrived cold. A/C worked properly. Had a problem with the toilet making noise, and it was fixed promptly and then a followup with a coupon for free breakfast because of the "inconvenience."

title: “Nice clean hotel with great staff”
text:
My girlfriend and I had a night here immediately after arriving in Houston. The hotel wasn't too far from the airport as far as I remember but i did resemble the living dead at the time after a rather long flight so it may have been longer than i think.
The room and hotel itself was nice, clean and tidy - everything you could ask for really. We were advised by the security guard not to go wandering through the local area as it was a bit dodgy at night. So we ordered some food from a nearby cafe and he went and picked it up for us which was a really nice surprise and came to typify the helpfulness of both the staff at this hotel, and pretty much everyone we met whilst travelling around Texas.

title: “Perfect for our 1 night stay...”
text: We only stayed the one night...but this hotel had everything that we look for in suitable accomodations....It's fairly new, so everything looked 'fresh'...and the location was directly off the highway and close to downtown.....It was very clean...a large room...the pillow-top bed was awesome...and great pillows, too!....The breakfast was much better than your average 'continental breakfast'...serving eggs, sausage and waffles. We would definitely stay in a BW again.

title: “A Houston Bargain”
text: You get a lot for your money here. Although the location is a little odd (semi-industrial area on the edge of downtown), if you're driving that's not a problem, and the parking is free. It's only about 2 blocks off of I-45. The room I had was just as nice as some I've had at 4-star business hotels -- clean, roomy, high ceilings, a table and chairs, a desk, an armchair, good lighting, comfortable bed, etc. They have free Internet in two locations downstairs. The free breakfast had a larger variety of food options than motels usually provide (cereal, waffles, fruit, bagels, toast, juice, coffee). The staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again -- I thought it was quite a bargain.

title: “Huge rooms in a good hotel”
text: Enormous rooms, clean, modern and with great services. They have a business center with PC/internet free at use, happy hour with free beer and some food, pool etc. I had a very short stay, but it was a great exprience.

title: “Great stay!”
text:
Took my daughter adn her friends for a birthday nigth out and a visit to the new American Girl store. The hotel was lovely! The girls were thrilled with it. We had a large suite with seperate living room - the bedroom was huge and the bed was very comfortable. 
The rooftop pool was wonderful. Great views. The breakfast was very nice - though not much seating is offered in the lounge.
Staff was all very kind and helpful.
The weekend shopping rate is very good - with a $100 mall gift card. The girls were happy to spend it.
My only complaint is the bathroom is very roomy but has very little counter space and not enough hooks to hang towels.

title: “Not so Heavenly Bed”
text: I am sad to report that I am very disappointed in the bed at this Westin. It was hard and lumpy, not heavenly, like sleeping on a cloud. I stayed at the Westin in downtown Calgary, Alberta, Canada a few years ago and it was the BEST sleep I have ever had in a hotel. No so much at this Houston upscale Westin in Memorial City. I would not recommend this hotel, OR I do recommend that you test the comfort of the bed upon check-in and asked to be moved to a more comfortable room if it does not meet or exceed your expectations, based on the Westin's reputation for the divine Heavenly Beds. Not impressed, not at all. Oh, and our room window faces the Sam Houston tollway: very noisy day and night. There doesn't appear to be any noise abatement here.

title: “a quiet gem in a crowded field”
text: the Westin Memorial has only been open a year and a half. You can really get the feeling that that's true as soon as you walk in. It seems as if the plastic wrapping has just been pulled off. Not in a bad way, but in a way that you know they are doing a good job with the upkeep of a new property. Very ample meeting space, good layout and comfort in guest rooms, decent food, nice bar and attentive staff. The air quality in the room seems quite good and this is no small feat in Houston where the humidity rapidly makes everything somewhat mildewy. You don't get that sense in the guest rooms at all. It also seems "green" though I didnt seem much explicit signage indicating any bragging about what eco-friendly materials they used in the construction and decor. This Westin is also in a good location -- actually adjoining Memorial City mall. If you are stuck without a rental car on a business trip you can at least get outside and just walk across the skybridge or across the street to many shops, restaurants and movies. Overall the Westin Memorial City is just a darn good value in a city where there are lots of mediocre properties courting business travelers.

title: “Always a pleasure!”
text:
The staff is always focused on taking care of it's clients. We had a meeting at this location for two days and the food was better than anticipated.
I'm sure we will be back in the near future!!

title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
text: Stayed here for a weekend trip to see an Astros game. Hotel was about a 10 minute walk to the ballpark. Parking was expensive, even self park was $19. Had a king room on an executive floor. Rooms were clean and comfortable with large flat screen tv and nice bathroom. Only room complaint was there were only 2 bath towels, so had to call for more. Lots of restaurants and bars within a few blocks so no need to eat at the overpriced hotel restaurants. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: “Good weekend trip”
text:
My boyfriend and I just returned from a quick weekend trip to Houston to visit family. We stayed at the Hilton Americas. It is a nice, clean hotel. There seemed to be quite a few events going on at the hotel. The hotel hosted the Miss Texas pagent. There was also a magicians conference. It was a very eclectic mix of guests. We had a good time people watching!
The hotel itself is adjacent to the convention center and located close to several restaurants and shops. The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff is very friendly.
I recommend the Hilton Americas.

title: “Excellent hotel”
text: Attached to a big mall and also a hospital, which was a bit surreal, but I am sure visitors to the hospital find it a great location.Very good service from friendly check in to easy departure. Unfortunately only stayed one night, but appreciated huge suite with large living area and so comfortable bed. Very quiet room, but not much of a view. Used the pool area and it was a bit odd to be sunbathing exposed to the noise, fumes and view of the drivers on the freeway close by. But nice pool and sunloungers.Nice club lounge with reasonable breakfast and snacks at night.

title: “Great choice for West Houston”
text:
A new hotel, attached by walkway to the Memorial Mall (and hospital).
Staff friendly & efficient, great rooms (our suite was spacious & very well equipped), and a small but good pool area on the 18th floor (quite windy and noisy).
I only ate in the club lounge, so can't comment on the restaurant or bar, but they both looked good.
I would stay here again if in the area.

title: “Great!”
text:
Lives this hotel and extremely comfortable for the business traveller
Great bartenders downstairs and a very welcoming front desk staff
Will definitely be back! Definitely a must stay if you don't need to be in downtown houston

title: “Staff is Great”
text: I just want to say that the staff was very helpful in getting my family an early check-in for a local wedding. Kelly was particularly helpful and I want to thank her very much!

title: “Excellent service!!! and a great hotel.”
text: Service is excellent!!! it's the most important thing to me. Kudos to all the staffs... you guys are doing great job. You can't go wrong with the location - trust me. Room is great and the television is BIG! I didn't have to press any button in the elevator coz they'll do it for you - and they know what your floor is! I can't ask for more...

title: “LUCKY US!”
text: luckily we got an amazing rate for this POSH hotel...almost half the usual price. luxurious landmark hotel right across the street from the park (central park, that is). and everything in the room fridge is complimentary! gotta love that. if you want to do something special, and can't afford the plaza, this is the answer!

title: “Perfect price, size, value & service.”
text: Great location in Midtown for sightseeing and getting around via bus or subway. Room size is amazing for New York hotels. Continental breakfast is a great time saver and a tremendous value. The entire staff was amazing! Shhhhhh! (this hotel is a best kept secret)! We'll be back.

title: “Enjoyed my stay”
text:
I stayed at the San Carlos Hotel on business last spring and was pleasantly surprised. I chose the hotel based on price, location (proximity to by business meeting) and reviews. I found that the hotel, while not the cheapest, was a great value for the money. The room was a decent size and nice condition. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance and short cab/subway ride to a bunch more.
No problem recommending this hotel to anyone else looking for a place to stay in this part of the city.

title: “well located nice hotel”
text: Perfect location, close to Times Square, but in quiet street. Very Comfortable room and bed. Bathroom something special. Staff friendly and helpful. Wifi wouldn't work in our room on top floor, but good access to computers and printer in lobby. Walking distance to good restaurants

title: “Amazing service, great location and excellent accommodation”
text: This hotel was amazing from start to finish. A beautiful heritage hotel not far from Times Square and all the other midtown action. The room was very nice and we enjoyed our week at the hotel. The concierge Vanessa is extremely helpful!

title: “Overall Great”
text:
Good: High quality room (tub, shower, amenities, all top-notch). Usual super-friendly Kimpton staff.
Neutral: Slow and distracted service from bellhop... Not up to Kimpton standards.
Negative: None.
Note: Some people have complained about the location. I thought it was just fine. 5-10 minute cab to Penn Station and Central Park. "Gritty" and non-touristy aspects of the neighborhood is what gives Hell's Kitchen it's character.

title: “A must stay kind of place”
text:
I have stayed at the Eventi before and this visit did not disappoint. Kimpton Hotels really get it right. They treat you like a visiting friend and know how do make it all perfect. 
The mid town location is so close to everything and being lucky enough to be facing the Empire State Building is the cake topper. Every room is spacious, clean and has a great view of everything you want to see while in NYC.

title: “Terrific hotel with spacious rooms”
text: Spacious, nicely decorated rooms with lovely views. On a somewhat odd stretch of 6th Ave in sort of a tweener neighborhood - not really Chelsea, sorta Herald Square, surrounded by lots of odd wholesale shops - wigs, sunglasses, barrettes, cheap jewelry - and close to the Ace Hotel with its excellent branch of Stumptown Coffee. While still a bit pricey, given the size, views and quality of the rooms, this is really an excellent value.

title: “Perfection in Hotel Form”
text: My wife and I spent our honeymoon night at the Chatwal. This hotel by far provided us with the best experience we have ever had in a hotel stay. First, the service was exemplary. Both Elizabeth and Christine were warm and inviting, and made sure that everything was perfect. They both were wonderful with checking us in and out quickly, but at the same time, engaged us in friendly conversation without any generic small talk. They were authentic. The rooms were immaculate. We were given a Junior suite with some light refreshments and a hand-written card congratulating us on our wedding day, which is something we have never experienced before in guest service. The bathroom was spotless, spacious, and all amenities were provided without need for request. The bed was extremely comfortable with top of the line linens and a cozy mattress. The fact that everything was able to be controlled by the phone (e.g. shades, lights) was also very convenient. You'd be foolish to book a stay anywhere else if you are willing to spend a bit extra for a luxury experience.

title: “Excellent 3-day stay”
text:
The location was fantastic. The staff were very accommodating and professional. The maid service to the room was discrete. The room was quiet and immaculately presented. 
Really excellent stay and would thoroughly recommend this hotel. 
We will definitely be back when we are next in NYC.

title: “Great staff - poor management”
text:
I stayed at the hotel as I was attending a conference for several days. The meetings were great as was the food.
I used the gymnasium daily which I found to be inadequate - not very clean and supplies were not full. In comparaison to other luxury hotels, could be nicer. Sauna and steam had smell.
Front Desk was nice but not enough people and there never seemed to be a manager around.
Bar area was empty all the time and it was difficult to find a waiter.
Not enough managers around compared to other hotels of this caliber.
Ai Fiori was excellent.

title: “The best service.”
text:
We just spent a week in The Setai 5th Av. That was for our family first trip to NY. We travel a lot, 5-6 time per year deferent hotels, but THE SERVICE at The Setai - the best we ever had. I could never even think that people can de their job as good as they do in The Setay. We always plan our trips, we do all research about where to go, where to eat, what to see.. If you come here - forget, they know everything way better then anybody. All advises that we got from the concierge where very useful and made our first trip to NY unforgettable. 
Personal Thank You and absolute respect to Sohee and Luis. 
the Hotel itself is great as well.. we found our suite huge, big comfortable bedroom with fantastic bed. Bathroom - wow, with TV.. Nespresso coffee machine, soft drinks... the rest you can find on their web.
Al the time, all 7 days the rooms were immaculately clean. 
And the main - HUGE panoramic windows all around the suite, even from bathroom, with fantastic view. Loved it. 
Location for the first time visitors - the best.. just 2 min till Empire Building, 10-15 min Time squire, 20 min till Central park..
 Limousine service from the Hotel was great. The Jazz Bar - on the first floor was very nice. We were using Spa, and hairdresser service - all that was very good as everything in this hotel.
Perhaps I would change a carpet in front of the reception.:) but that was just a little "minus", that after all great time we had in NY, means nothing.
Unforgettable Experience.

title: “A must stay”
text:
When you are doing a short list on where to stay in New York City, you cannot go wrong with putting Andaz 5th Avenue on your list, take it from someone who lives in New York City. The rooms are exceptional, small and cozy, you are greated by name and one thing that always manages to be mentioned whenever i hear about Andaz, is the service, top class service no matter the grade of your room.
Just a tip, make sure your try one of their salads, it is one of the best i have tasted, and in the group that i was with, the salads were really popular, although some loved the liquor menu a little too much. Book at the Andaz! you will not be dissapointed.

title: “New Favorite”
text:
Every aspect of the Andaz make it a truly outstanding hotel. The location is perfect. The rooms are beautiful, sleek and modern and very well appointed. Equally impressive is the huge bathroom and shower. Service is excellent. The staff members are very helpful and accommodating. This does not feel like the usual big chain hotel. It feels more like a lovely boutique accommodation.
All of this plus complementary snacks and beverages make you feel like you are being pampered.
I will definitely being staying here on my next trip to NYC.

title: “Exceptional Hotel Great Location”
text: Most reviews state that The Hotel Beacon has built up a reputation over many years as a quality hotel and situated in a very good location. These recommendations encouraged us to book a pre-cruise stay at the Beacon and it turned out to be the best stay we ever had in New York. Booking in process was swift and our suitcases were delivered to our one bedroom suite immediately. It was a very spacious area, far more than usual for New York. The Kitchenette had everything you would need to cater for in room dining and a visit to the amazing food store literally across the road from the hotel proved a very tempting prospect for us even though we had intended to eat out most of the time.The oversize double bed, comfortable furniture, fully equipped Bathroom with quality toiletries and a separate lounge/dining room, high def TV and free WiFi made our stay home from home. We could not have asked for more. We definitely will return!

title: “Good for New York Standards”
text:
We stayed for 10 nights, ideal location to 72nd street subway which has an excellent service to Times Square and Penn Station. Across the road Fairways supermarket and deli next door, plenty of restaurants nearby.
Hotel staff - typical New York but not service focused, hotel itself dated, good for New York standards.
Our room was a 1 brm suite on the 18th floor facing Broadway, kitchen facilities were good, room cleaned every day, bathroom on the small side.
View from room was overlooking the roofs and Broadway, with the wooden water tanks on top of buildings and being entertained at night by the ballet dancers practising at the ballet school.

title: “Exactly what I expect of a Four Seasons property with great service and a wonderful pool deck.”
text: Four Seasons Houston is a great hotel for a "staycation" and my family particularly enjoyed the beautiful pool deck/pool and the poolside room. I previously stayed at the hotel for businesss before my family relocated to Houston and, each time I have been a guest, I have been impressed by the attentiveness and friendliness of the staff.

title: “an OK hotel for me so far”
text: Compare to the other same-class hotel I've stayed, this is an OK hotel I think. Not really impress with hotel interior & facilities, except that everything is big as typical American hotel :). Outside & inside looks tired & old. The staff was great though.

title: “I love HOU”
text:
Super deal on a weekend rate. Great location next to discovery Green, great place to explore. Pool is kid and adult friendly.
Great welcome by hotel staff, loved the stuffed horse for our daughter.
If you are there during the week there are several sandwich shops/coffee shops catering to the office crowds. Slim pick G's after the workday/on the weekend outside of the hotel within walking distance. But tons of options if you don't mind a short cab ride downtown.
Great hotel in a great city. The General Manager was a super nice guy as well. He and his staff are 5 star.

title: “Great Staycation!!”
text:
Erica at the front desk was so helpful! She really took the time to go the extra step and providing us with aspirin and great places where we could go out and have dessert! Her personality was great! 
I've enjoyed staying here and look forward to coming back SOON!

title: “Very Romantic!”
text: The staff was great and the quality was top notch! It was the most romantic weekend we have ever had. The food was phenomenal. The rooms are adorable!! We only wish that our stay could have been longer. We will most certainly return the icon, hopefully again and again!

title: “fabulous trip”
text: The hotel is beautiful and the service was fabulous. We sat and looked out over the courtyard and watched the awesome fire pits. The hotel is located in an area where you never have to leave the property. The restaurant Alex's brunch was amazing. There is a movie theatre, stores and spa all within walking distance. This place rocks.

title: “Best Hotel in Houston”
text: From the time we drove up to the Hotel Sorella to the time we had to leave the staff was amazing. As i checked my family in i was greeted by a gentelman named Marcus who intoduced himself as the Front Office Manager he was great. After we arrived in are room he called up to ask if the room was what we wanted and if he could help with a list of local events or anything else (outstanding service). We at brunch on Sunday (food was great) in the resturant and were approached several times by George who i think was another manager. It's seems everytime we turned around some staff member was offering us help and most of the time it was a manager. With this type of service and a staff that cares about it's guest so much it will be NO MORE Four Seasons but Hotel Sorella everytime i go to Houston. My family thanks you for the wonderful time, we will be back.

title: “Worth the stay for the price and proximity”
text: We got to Hotel Sorella close to 10p (blame Houston traffic) and the hotel employees were just as friendly as if we had arrived early in the afternoon. Definitely not your typical hotel room: dark laminate hardwood floors, very modern design aesthetic, super comfy bed and linens, plus a lounge area in the corner of the room. Loved the CityCentre area and being able to walk to a nice variety of restaurants and shops. Felt very safe walking around after dark. Loved the self-park feature and that you're in a covered garage, not having to shell out the bucks for valet. Only downfalls: Agree with the other reviewers noting that the rooms are rather dark. No overhead lighting. The continental breakfast was also lacking for late sleepers so make sure you get there early. For the proximity to the city and the cost (VERY nice military discount), we will definitely recommend to friends who make the trip over to Houston.

title: “Pleasant hotel, pleasant amenities”
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is new; the room was clean and well-appointed. The special weekend price made it a good deal. The infinity pool on one of the higher levels was very nice, although it wasn't heated, so it was too cold to swim in. 
The hotel is in a great location, on the west side of Houston, adjacent to the Hermann Memorial City Hospital and the Memorial City Mall.

title: “Great location for hospital or mall”
text: We went to the hotel for a quick getaway. The hotel is new. The rooms are nicely appointed and corner rooms have a nice view of downtown Houston and west Houston. Although located n the freeway, there was no traffic noise. The pool and spa are located on the 18th floor and have nice views. The restaurant is very good with great service. The bar looks nice, but the night we went a family with young children was also there. The parents sat around drinking and the children ran all over the bar as if it was their personal playground. Maybe appropriate for a backyard, not for a bar. It is connected to the hospital and mall via indoor walkways. Friendly staff.

title: “Modern, friendly hotel in a good location”
text: Stayed here in December when working in Houston. Hotel was quite hard to find as not well marked. Satnav sent me round the block a little as it is set back from the feeder road. Staff welcoming (especially valet parking guys who are great!). Room quiet, clean and comfortable. Reception staff very good. Bar staff average. The bar was always very busy with a good vibe to it but one evening I sat and waited for table service and actually got completely ignored so I left. Nearby restaurants are not too shabby so plenty of choice. A little bit of shopping close by too - boutique-type stores. I thought it was a little expensive but then it is Houston.

title: “Great tourist-class choice -- modern, clean, convenient”
text:
I was visiting Houston for the first time, and wanted a place that was convenient to downtown (ie, not out by Galleria or the Astrodome), affordable (less than $100 per night, and no hidden fees like parking for the downtown luxury hotels), private (ie not a bed a breakfast). Oddly, didn't find that many options in Houston (seems like all the motels and cheaper hotels are way out in the suburbs). Came upon this Best Western Downtown and got a room (one king bed) for $69 p/n (plus tax), for five nights. Couldn't have been happier with my choice. Room was very large, modern, clean, and in addition to the usual (big tv, coffee maker), had some things I didn't expect (small refrigerator, small dining table with a few chairs around it, free high-speed Internet). No closet -- just an alcove with a clothes rack -- but that didn't bother me. Room and entire hotel were spotless; they said they had been open several years, but if they told me only several months I would have believed them - it was clean and freshly painted, and furniture all seemed new. Other amenities were: free parking, free cont'l breakfast (I didn't use, so can't vouch for quality), pool, and exercise room (small -- just had a few new cardio machines). Service was friendly and helpful, both for maid and front desk. Hotel was pretty empty, but I'm guessing that's because Houston just doesn't attract that many tourists over the Christmas holidays.
Location was fantastic - right between downtown (a few blocks to the east) and Melrose (a five minute drive to the west) and River Oaks (about a ten minute drive west) and the Galleria (maybe 15-20 minutes to the west). It's not like there are cafes and shops right outside the front door; but if you get in your car, all the attractions of core Houston (downtown, minute maid field, convention center, melrose, museum district, uptown/galleria, houston heights) are a very short drive. Seemed like a perfectly safe neighborhood -- looked like there had been a lot of construction (townhouses, etc) built in the last 10 years. 
In sum, if you're looking for an affordable option that is convenient for touring Houston sites (or for business within Loop 610), and don't want to stay in a bed-and-breakfast, I think this is probably one of the best options in Houston (I drove around Houston for five days and didn't see any other comparable-class hotel in the vicinity -- only luxury hotels in downtown and in the Galleria area). This Best Western doesn't offer up a ton of charm -- no big surprise for a tourist-class chain hotel/motel -- but for under $100 a night, it met and exceeded my expectations

title: “Minute Maid - A Nice relaxing walk from the hotel”
text: We had a nice stay at this hotel on our recent trip to Houston. We wanted to stay somewhere close to Minute maid Park. It took us about a 1/2 hr to walk there from the hotel, it is a good walk through the downtown area, once you walk over the bridge ( don't look down).The Hotel was clean, nice room and nice workout room and pool area.Make sure you get up in time for the continental breakfast and have a waffle shaped in the size of Texas. You can't beat that.

title: “Beautiful hotel. New & very clean”
text: We stayed in this hotel April 2004. It is very new and very nice. The rooms are rather large and ultra modern with a cordless phone and high speed internet access. The hotel was quiet and close to downtown. The neighborhood used to be questionable but new developments are taking place and is undergoing a major renovation.The pool area was clean, relaxing, and semi-enclosed.

title: “Im Schatten der Wolkenkratzer!”
text: Optimaler Aufenthalt für 3 Tage! Traumhaftes Bett, Super Frühstück! Optimale Lage! Sehr sauber und gepflegt! Nettes, freundliches und sehr hilfsbereites Personal! Guter Preis! Wir sind glücklich dieses Motel gefunden zu haben und können es nur weiter empfehlen!

title: “Attached to the convention center, close to entertainment”
text: Having a sky-way attached to the convention center was nice. There were several bars and restaurants so no need to leave the hotel. I ate at both restaurants - they of course weren't cheap but very good service and food. The hotel is just a few blocks away from the "pavilions" for nightlight and across from several nice parks.

title: “So mellow I nearly couldn't, almost, wake up in the morning.....”
text:
The Sherry Netherland functions so smoothly it could almost put you to sleep. This is not neccessary a good or bad thing. That will depend on whether you're looking for excitement, or predicability.
My wife and I like both equally, both can't afford the grand a night it costs. For us there is the Sherry Netherland. Perfectly located; historical, friendly, intimate, cumfy, and quiet. Five stars all around, but especially for value!

title: “The manhattan hotel”
text: It's not the typical hotel with a big lobby. However if you want a quiet but upscale hotel this is it. You are welcome from the minute you step in until you leave. The staff pro guest ratio is very low so I never waited in line for any service. The staff were very friendly with my kids. Location was perfect as it was in a safe area to walk around, food choices are aplenty in the area. Beside subway and bus stops. Service was impeccable

title: “Top service, old world charm and reasonable prices”
text: If you like old world charm and the best location in NYC, this is the hotel for you. Situated in New York's most outstanding street corner, the hotel offers great rooms, a coziness that only an hotel with 50 rooms can provide, a staff that greets you with a smile and an atmosphere similar to New York's top tier hotels. Prices are reasonable for New York's standards and rooms are big, very well decorated and with all the amenities that you' d expect from a five star hotel. The only problem was the noise from the courtyard, because of the air conditioning units that work all day and night. A second minor problem is that you have to wait a couple minutes for the hot water in the shower, because - I suppose - plumbing is tired. But besides that, I recommend this hotel to those who would like to stay confortably in New York's best address and in a landmark building that has been kept in pristine condition.

title: “Great hotel”
text: We spent two nights at the lovely San Carlos Hotel, on East 50th Street in NY. The room was luxurious and quiet, and the staff was great. The hotel has a very gracious feeling and is unlike many of the other NY hotels that have a commercial atmosphere. The room rate was inexpensive for New York, because we were there just after the holidays (end of the first week in January). There is a breakfast room just off the lobby, where a complimentary breakfast of pastries, cereals, and yogurt is available, and it is completely kosher for those guests who require it. I recommend this hotel highly and plan to stay there again.

title: “home away from home”
text:
This is an awesome hotel. It is across from the Kimberly Hotel which I also hear is good. But I will never know, because I have no reason to look anywhere else. Everything was excellent from the manager, bell captain to housekeeping. We had reserved the hotel's car to the airport and were a few minutes late getting back to the hotel. They were very gracious and said that they would hold it for us.
The rooms were very clean and spacious. the microwave and minifridge was a plus. We had 2 queen beds, a fold out couch and a small table with 2 chairs to have coffee and pastries. The continental breakfast was excellent and much appreciated. If you have tried to grab a meal for some change in NYC, you know that it is very expensive.
We had 4 girls and bathroom time is always a challenge with that many women. But we were able to make it work as there was a mirror on the outside of the bathroom door and a large mirror over a table/desk in the living area. We had no problems.
A friend sent us a gift basket arranged by the hotel and it was lovely. They did a great job including the I Love NY bear. The snacks were very tasty.
You would be hard pressed to find a larger better hotel room for the price. I think we paid $350/nt. I would highly recommend this location and hotel. We will be back.

title: “Location. Service. Spacious. Value.”
text:
Location. Lex & 3rd Ave, we could WALK everywhere. Metro 1/2 block to Green 4-5-6- line; 2 blocks to blue E-line; 3 blocks to 5th Avenue and Rockefeller centre; 5 blocks to Plaza.
Service. The people are extremely helpful and friendly. Nothing is a problem. Toaster. Kettle. Towels within 5 minutes of request.
Spacious. The living room is HUGE. Wide. Spacious. We had 5 people and everyone could find space. Table and kitchenette (well equipped).
Value. Well priced. Clean and comfortable. Excellent Service. Suites simple and functional. Housekeeping EXCELLENT, accoomodating for late sleep in and very efficient.
There is a good selection of convenience stores and restuarants on Lex and Second Avenue. 
We really appreciated the spacious room, location and customer service. Highly Recommend, would stay again.

title: “very good place close to the Radio City and not far from Central Park”
text:
close to 5th avenue, and a lot of subway opportunities, you reach everything smoothly.
we had suits which were large and convenient. also had a kitchen if you want to eat in. If you pay before the travel, you can have discount, and it is a good deal. I'm not sure about the regular rooms.
breakfast is only bagels and cereals but very good in a busy morning. breakfast room is very small and can be crowded if you don't come early.

title: “fabulous”
text: Fabulolus hotel, location and staff. spotlessly clean. So near to all the hustle and bustle but far enough to be peaceful. great cocktail lolunge and restaurant to die for. I definitely will be back. why 200 characters? if there is nothing but compliments, more is superflous.

title: “Great Package rate”
text: The "Date Night" package was awesome. It included cocktails in the very cool Lantern's Keep bar and continental breakfast delivered to our room. The room was fairly small, but very comfortable and quiet. We were celebrating an anniversary, and the hotel sent up a bottle of wine, some chocoates and a note. Great location in Midtown. Only complaint is that the bathroom was small, and there was not much room for personal toiletries. If you're driving into the city, the hotel has a great rate at the parking garage directly across the street. The staff was all very professional and friendly. Would definitely stay at the Iroquois again.

title: “Stylish boutique hotel near Penn Station”
text: I was attending a business conference in New York City near Penn Station and selected the Eventi because of its proximity to the event and based on my prior good experience with Kimpton hotels in other cities. I was not disappointed in my choice of the Eventi. Its style is modern both in the rooms and the lobby. My room was above average size for New York City and the bathroom was particularly so. The service was very professional without being cloying. The price was high but on par with other midtown hotels. I will definitely consider staying at the Eventi again both for business and for pleasure.

title: “Defines Top Of The Line”
text:
My stay at The Eventi Hotel displayed the perfect service and style of which I expect when staying at any five-star hotel in NYC. 
The staff goes above and beyond in all aspects of hotel including guest services, housekeeping and waiting staff. Right when you enter the hotel, you are greeted with smiles and attitude-less, genuine service at the front desk. A gentleman helped me with my bags right away and my room was ready right when I walked in. 
The rooms are small - but if you're in NY and want a large room, you're in the wrong city. It met my (high) standards. Elegant decor like posh pictures, linens and fixtures. The bathrooms are large and are equipped with luxurious walk in showers and marble counters. There was a nice sign in the restroom that stated they will provide "ANYTHING" you need that you forgot to pack like hairdryers, straighteners or hair spray. 
The spa was very nice. They accommodated me even after hours. I got an hour facial by a very polite shorter gentleman who was very good at his service. My total for the spa was $200, which I would say is a bit more than I would expect, but after all, it was delightful.

title: “Excellent hotel, in a great location”
text: Upon arrival, they upgraded us to the 22nd floor with a view of the Empire State building. Room was clean, bathroom large, bed comfortable. Staff were professional and friendly, always willing to get us a taxi. Location was perfect and felt very safe there.

title: “All the way from Melbourne Australia”
text:
This Hotel was well worth the money we paid, it was well appointed as you would expect and in an excellent location (next to Times Square). The bathroom was amazing- the only complaint would be that it was too small, I kept bumping into my husband and we are not big people. The toilet was the specialty, never seen anything like it, warm seats and it turned into a bidet. The robes, slippers and toiletries were first class. Reception was very friendly and the concierge was very helpful- booking restaurants (all excellent) and anything else you needed. Breakfast was very pricey, we found an excellent restaurant across the road that made delicious food and average price range.
Great place to stay if you want to splurge!

title: “A Star Off Broadway!”
text:
To celebrate my birthday, we booked a room with Starwood points. Because of my plantinum status, we were upgraded and given coupons for a free continental breakfast. I do a lot of traveling around the world and I can honestly say this was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. The staff were very pleasant and knowledgeable. The butler, Brandon who shined my shoes was so proud of the hotel, you'd think he was a partner. The quality and layout of the room was spectacular! Five star quality all the way.
I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York.

title: “impecable hotel and outstanding service”
text: beautiful hotel very clean and comfy,great location the saff were super nice and made us feel right at home especialy christina at the front desk,she went out of her way to make this experience unforgettable,so did micheal at the entrance door he was very polite and helpful, we will definitely come back and recommend your place to family and friends,thank you for making my first trip to ny so pleasant, cristina xoxox

title: “Good, but not great.”
text: I stayed in the Setai 5th Avenue over Labor Day weekend. The staff was exceptional. Couldn't ask for a more friendly, accommodating group of people. The hotel itself, however, was just okay. It was nothing special. I booked two rooms and both had a view of a brick wall. The room was large and the bathroom was a good size. The beds were very comfortable. To be fair, I didn't ask if any other rooms were available so I don't know if they would have changed our rooms or not. I have stayed in quiet a few hotels in NYC (8 to be exact) and I do not think I would rate the Setai as 5 stars. Glad I gave it a try, but would not go back.

title: “far, far away from expected for a hotel like this.”
text:
i was so excited, my wife had invited me to recently stay at the Setai for my birthday, i was amazed first, how cold was the employees of the hotel, i know its NY but usually in a hotel like this you expect over the top service. the room, nothing special, pretty small with a non existing view, and even we checked in at 4, it wasn't ready (and of course didn't gave us a late check out when we asked for it).
the Al Fiori, after all the great things said (obviously) by the personal assistant, we tried it and wasnt good at all, so disappointed. 
after all, will be so difficult to come back to the Setai, even i wanted to love it because of the location.

title: “Great NYC HideOut!”
text:
My partner and I stayed here for four nights over Labor Day weekend - what a treat! From the moment we arrived until we left, we were greated by our names, always being asked how things were going - in short - attentive Hyatt staff - without being over the top and invasive.
The rooms are small - typical NYC - but very well designed. As a Hyatt Diamond member we were upgraded to a small suite which gave us ample room to spread out. Love the Andaz policy of free snacks in the room, the Nespresso machine made us feel at home and the wine happy hour in the lobby is a great way to ease into an evening in New York! The breakfast menu rocked - and the Hyatt Diamond level free breakfast credit covered two extremely filling and tasty breakfasts each morning. The location is great for shopping, theatre and exploring New York.
The downside - having to leave! Already planning our next escape to New York!

title: “Great Boutique Hotel on Fifth Avenue”
text:
It is hard to remember sometimes that Andaz 5th Avenue is a Hyatt hotel, so devoid it is of the usual Hyatt corporate hotel feel of grand lobbies and cookie-cutter boring rooms. The lobby and lounge areas had a relaxed yet friendly feel. I always appreciated the fruits and water invitingly laid out in the lounge area, as well as the free business center services. The room I had was large, modern, and comfortable. The bathroom was fantastic with its oversized shower, roomy layout, and artsy design. My only complaint about the bathroom, and it is a small one, is that the glass countertop, while great looking, created a bit of pressure on me to constantly clean it as water spots showed up easily so it looked really messy every time I used the sink. 
The hotel reminded me of the wonderful Upper House in Hong Kong, with its high-tech features, the system of no charge for mini bar items, and the large bathroom. It is not quite up to Upper House standards in terms of service and comfort level, however, but on the other hand, a night at the Upper House does cost $200 more than Andaz and service in Asia in general is much warmer and thoughtful than in the U.S.

title: “Phenomenal Service at the Bar!”
text: The service here was EXCEPTIONAL. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the small plates and diverse liquor menu, but having it all brought quickly and efficently. Priceless. Oh, and the location (underground like a speak easy) ensured that my BB wasn't bothering me every two minutes.

title: “One of my favorite hotel in the world”
text:
If you are looking for location, service, design and nice rooms, this is the place. I try to visit as often as possible and always please with the staff and the rooms. Andaz 5th Ave is certainly one of my favorite hotel.
A must in NYC!

title: “Great rooms,Top location for Upper West Side.”
text:
We like to stay no more than 5 days in the one hotel. 
Well it's not North Korea you know ! 
See the world.Share the love, variety is the spice of life.You get the point.
We arrived here after 22 hours above planet earth. Its a great location.Rooms are very clean staff are very friendly and helpful.Got great laundry facilities.
We love walking everywhere. It's very close to Central Park, LIncoln Centre,museums 2 minute walk to Subway station. (Get a weekly pass for $28 best value in town) Great proximity to retail and restraunts.20 minute walk to Columbus Circle.The entrance to Central Park.A further 10 minutes and your in Midtown.
I felt as if I was back in Australia every second person was a stinkin Australian !
Saw David Byrne and St Vincent next door at the Beacon Theatre. Phenominal ! 
I'd recommend the Hotel Beacon.

title: “best in new york city”
text: the best rooms service and a short walk to seventy second street subway and short walk to central park the best.We had a supermarket across the road and coffee close by . The rooms were large all facilities including a kitchen would stay there again any time .

title: “Fabulous hotel - perfect for families”
text: We stayed at the Beacon for 8 nights during the middle of September with our two teenage daughters. Our room was on one bedroon suite on a high floor on the corner. We loved this hotel. Great location in the UWS within a lovely safe area. Fairways supermarket across the street in wonderful for all your food supplies. There is an abundance of great local cafes, delis and restaurants. it's convenient to the subway but if you are a group of 4 its probably just as cheap to jump in a taxi. Our room was large by NY standards with a walk in wardrobe, kitchenette, bathroon, sitting room with eating area and sofa bed. The beds were very comfortable but would have been better if thet were queens not doubles. Great to have laundry facilities on level 7. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to NY. Our favorite hotel from our trip - felt like a home away from home.

title: “Ausfamily750”
text: We stayed as a family of four for one week. The location is excellent, with a wonderful supermarket across the road and the 72nd street subway only a short stroll away. You can also walk easily to the Lincoln Center, Central Park and the museums on both the west and east side. The room was quiet, comfortable and nicely furnished. No complaints about the room or the staff. It was such a good location we would stay at this hotel again if in Manhattan.

title: “Flawless Stay in Downtown Houston”
text: I'm not one that has a high appreciation for downtown areas of big cities but this was a terrific experience. From the moment I entered the doors until I was escorted down the hotel steps when departing the next day, each encounter with the staff was great. This is not a new hotel and is primarily a "business" hotel so I didn't have high expectations but I was pleasantly surprised. It is probably good that I wasn't there long enough to get use to it. I would suffer later at lesser hotel properties. Of course they are living up to the "Four Seasons" reputation for quality and service but my experience went beyond that! Everything was wonderful.

title: “Four Seasons Houston”
text: Great hotel and very nice staff. Houston downtown is very dead at night but the hotel is so nice. If you are arriving late, there is not a gift shop to purchase sundries and everything around is closed, so make sure you have what you need. As for a room on a higher floor.

title: “Not a Four Seasons Experience Here”
text: Surprisingly disappointed with this hotel. I had to extend my trip an extra day and asked a friend in the city where I should stay. Hands down he said the place to stay was the Four Seasons. I've stayed at Four Seasons in other cities (Philadelphia, Austin, etc.) and will have to say my experience here ranks the worst, even against other "less" luxurious brands. I stay over 100 nights in hotels yearly so I am very particular when it comes to hotels as a business traveler. When I checked in I had thought I booked a king size room. Check in girl offered an upgrade to a King suite for a $50 or so up charge. I declined (thinking I had a regular King room). Got to my room and found two TWIN beds. Went downstairs and asked for a different room from different clerk no more than 30 minutes later. He said the hotel was sold out and did not have anything (even though previous clerk had offered a different room for an upcharge). Didn't have time to argue because I was late for dinner so decided to come back later and deal with it then. Came back a few hours later and asked the same guy and he said yes there was a room for the $50 up charge. I was tempted to argue for a complimentary upgrade, but was too tired at this point and just paid it. When I did get to the room it was a King Suite, but nothing too amazing. Very disappointed in how dark the bathroom was though. The only saving grace was the bed was quite comfortable, but other than that I've received better rooms and service from Westins and Marriotts. Main issue here was the twin beds (not even queens). Would not expect that from a four seasons. Also the hassle at the front desk and inconsistent responses from the staff adds to the frustration.

title: “Dated but good for price”
text:
We stayed at FS using Amex Platinum travel service. Price was good due to getting dinner and breakfast credits at the Quattro restaurant there. The restaurant was just so-so food. The staff was friendly & attentive. If it were not for food credit I wouldn't recommend eating there. 
The rooms are large but a bit dated. Air conditioning loudly cycled on and off all night long leading to really poor sleep. Although room appeared clean my pillow smelled distinctly of perfume, and it wssn't my perfume - kind of gross! 
Hotel fitness area was large enough and had decent equipment. Pool looked small but nice.
My biggest shock when getting our bill though was the valet charge of $15 a day. We checked in at 3pm and out at 8am, which is less than 24 hours but still got charged a full $30! Nuts!!! Next time we will likely try a different hotel.

title: “Memorial Day Weekend - FUN”
text:
I love the Marriott Autograph Collection ~ Boutique Hotels and this one did not disappointment. 
This was my first trip to Houston and I could not wait enjoy all the city has to offer, Initially, I checked in and was offered a beautiful room that face an abandon building. I called downstairs and asked for another room and was told that there was another room available but on the same side and the view should be the same. I was never give the option to check it out.
I went downstairs and requested information to another Marriott in the area. Well, that request got the General Managers attention who was standing within an earshot of the conversation and I was moved to larger corner gorgeous suite and offered champaign.
At that point my stay flawless...
The fitness center had everything you would need for a great workout. The Standing O restaurant and bar in the lobby was fun and cheerful. The valet and waitstaff were attentive and always smiling. Nice robes and bath amenities. The drapes and furniture were regal and the location gave you great access to the historical, municipal, theater districts. I had a car but did not drive around the city. I walked to shopping area and took the hotel shuttle when I was dressed for dinner and it picked me up. I did drive to other areas such as the Galleria and Stadium. It was the valet that informed me this hotel was frachised to Micheal "MAGIC" Johnson.
I would definitely return. At the end of my stay the GM sent a letter thanking me for choosing the ICON while in Houston. I will definitely be back!

title: “Stepping back in time...”
text:
We live in Houston suburbs and needed a walking distance hotel room to enjoy a gala downtown. What a find! Beautiful room, great service. And cudos to Michael's Bloody Mary! 
We are Bloody Mary buffs, and he is now in first place. PLEASE share your recipe with the rest of the bar staff (wasnt the same at Sat breakfast!) A memorable stay.

title: “Perfect!”
text: This was the first time to stay here and it was a pleasant surprise! Great location...near the ballpark, the arts, and many restaurants...all within walking distance. The hotel had so much charm! Not one complaint! Definately going back when in Houston!

title: “Great Location in Houston”
text:
Modern hotel in upcoming trendy area. Very safe neighbourhood - visited many times for upmarket shopping during my time in Houston. Now returning on a regular basis from abroad this is hotel is top of my list for short stays. Nearest alternative - also very good, is the Westin at Memorial City - slightly better connected for a full US-Mall shopping experience.
Rooms at the Sorella are very well appointed, clean and comfortable - excellent examples of leading the market - and putting anything at twice the price in Europe totally to shame.
Local restaurant scene is very vibrant, plenty of choice with the big advantage of not needing to drive.

title: “Great stay at the Sorella”
text: We arrived late and was unable to find the hotel right off, no sign,but when we found it an employee was on the way out, he escorted us in, took us to the desk and made sure we were checked in. The rooms are large and spacious, clean and beautiful. We also had a very nice continental breakfast , no meat, delicious fruit. Employees were all great and we had a great experience with bartenders in bistro bar on the first floor , I def would go there again. You won't be disappointed!!!

title: “Trendy hotel, great restaurant, odd location”
text: This is a modern, trendy, comfortable hotel situated in a shopping/dining/entertainment complex about a half hour from downtown Houston. Once you have exhausted the local stores (it is a good selection of smallish trendy shops), not sure what else there is to do. It has that artificial feel of something that has been constructed to appear very cool. Major service issue was that the 2-bedded room I had booked through hotel website, and paid for fully in advance, was given away and we were stuck on the third floor within easy earshot of booming music that went on well past midnight. Staff was apologetic and paid for dinner (and town car to the airport, after I asked), but, in my mind, just not good enough. Overbooking is just not cool, and when I lose sleep and can't function properly the next day, there is just no way I can be happy with my stay. Bistro Alex, adjoining the hotel, was very good.

title: “Stylish hotel in a good location”
text: Arrived after a long flight to a very friendly welcome at the Sorella. I was very impressed with the decor - both in the atrium and in the room. Very stylish and comfortable room, one of the best I've stayed at in a while. Decent self-service breakfast in the morning if you need to head out, and the location of the hotel so close to so many bars and restaurants really make it a find in a city like Houston. Free WiFi really adds to the whole package - this is an ideal business hotel on the Energy Corridor. Valet service quite steeply priced however. Will definitely be returning if I'm back in town.

title: “Clean, Modern, Friendly”
text: I stay at this hotel each week when I travel to Houston for work. The hotel is very clean and modern. This hotel also feels very safe in comparisons to others I have stayed at. The gym is small but has nice equipment and the machines typically only become full at around 6 am or 6 pm. The food menu is also very good! This Westin's executive club lounge offers a nice breakfast in the morning, and some yummy snacks and beer/wine in the afternoon. One of the really nice features of this hotel is the sky-walk that connects it to the Memorial City Mall. You can access the sky-walk from the 3rd floor of the hotel. This Westin has a great location too (right next to the highway).

title: “Slightly better than Holiday Inn”
text:
45 min wait for a burger at the bar because "they were really busy"
Bed looked like it had been slept in
No phone book in the room

title: “Excellent place - Awesome staff”
text: I went to the westin hotel during the Houston salsa congress (jan 12-16th). The place was very clean the staff was really friendly, respectful, and helpful. The hotel is conveniently close to a shopping mall where they have plenty of things to do: movies, shopping, eating, iceskating, etc... The room was really clean, it had two full size beds, desk, flat screen tv (with movies for purchase), fridge, iron, safe, etc... i hope that the congress is held here next time, because thats where i want to stay. If you are traveling solo - use the super shuttle for 25 bucks, otherwise, a cab could cost you 50 bucks one way. The down town area is about 10-15 mins away by car, so a cab could cost around 20-25 dollars. The space center is about 45 mins away, so a rental might work best.

title: “BW Plus-Hotel mit guter Lage nach Downtown”
text:
Das Hotel liegt optimal nach Downtown (incl. Zugang zum Underground) und zur Interstate. Parken ist kostenlos, die Zimmer sind sauber und geräumig, mit Safe, Mikrowelle und Kühlschrank. Das Bad war neu. Es gab kostenlos 2 Fl. Wasser und 2 süße Snacks (weiß jedoch nicht, ob das an meinem Rewards Diamond Status lag). Tageszeitung u. WIFI (gute Verbindung)gibt's ebenfalls gratis. 
Das Frühstück ist neben Toast, Bagel, 3erlei Kellogs und Kuchen zusätzlich mit Rührei, Wurst. Der "europäische Kaffee" ist allerdings dann doch eher "American Standard". Das Fitneßcenter ist modern u. es liegen Handtücher bereit. Es gibt neben dem klassischen Getränkeautomat auch ein Automat mit Tiefkühlprodukte (die in der Mikrowelle zubereitbar sind) Chimichanga kann ich hier nicht empfehlen ;-) 
ca. 0,5 km entfernt befindet sich Pizza Hut, Taco Bell, diverse BBQ Restaurants. Zum NASA Space Center sind es ca. 45 min. (öffnet erst um 10 Uhr)
Negativ: Unsere Toilette war verstopft u. das Personal hat uns einen Pluncher in die Hand gedrückt mit dem Kommentar: Helf dir bitte selbst! Heute ist Sonntag und kein Handwerker im Haus.

title: “Avis partagé”
text:
les + : Superbes chambres, spacieuses et bien équipées (wifi, ecran plat 107cm). Personnel très sympa et de bon conseil. SDB grande avec baignoire et douche. Parking surveillé.
les - :Petit dejeuner inclus très moyen mais complet. Hotel bien situé, mais un peu cher...
ALlez manger au Bistro et Tapas sur Glay street a 2 minutes en voiture... c'est excellent !

title: “un hotel ok ma dalla aprte sbagliata della città”
text:
La camera è una standard americana, ovvero sempre troppo grande per una persona sola ma comunque pulita. Nei bonus era compresa la colazione e un servizio di aperitivo che credo sia stata una delle cose più povere e tristi che abbia ricevuto. L'hotel però si trova in una posizione comoda da raggiungere ma i dintorni non sono il massimo per fare una passeggiata. Nei dintorni infatti ci sono case abbandonate e semi distrutte, un carcere minorile (!!) , due cimiteri e campi abbandonati con carrelli della spesa ovunque..
tutto sommato è ok per il prezzo se ci volete stare una notte..

title: “Gutes Stadthotel”
text:
Wir hatten nur eine Übernachtung in Houston bis zu unserem Rückflug und suchten uns eine zentral gelegene Unterkunft, um möglichst viel von Stadt und Umgebung zu sehen. Das Best Western ist nur zwei Blocks von Downtown entfernt und Theater, Oper, Aquarium, Kunstmuseen und Baseball-Stadion (Astros) sind in wenigen Minuten erreicht. Über die nahe Interstate 45 kann man auch noch einen Besuch im Space Center oder in Galveston einplanen.
Unser Zimmer war sauber und geräumig, das Frühstück ausgesprochen gut und der hübsche kleine Pool ein angenehmes Extra. Im Vergleich zu anderen BW Hotels in Houston ist dieses relativ teuer, aber durch die günstige Lage auch für Geschäftsreisende interessant.

title: “Can't beat the location if you;re going to the convention center”
text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during the Jr. Olympics. The rooms were very nice and ours had a great view of downtown. Beds are soft & comfortable and the maid service was prompt & efficient. I arranged a group dinner at The Cafe for our party of 30 and they were very accommodating. The food & service were very good and varied for our mixed group of adults & children. The best part was the short, air-conditioned walk to the convention center!

title: “Convention Center attached- STAY HERE!”
text:
The Hilton Americas is attached to the convention center with an air-conditioned walk way! The room was expensive, but worth it- I had the most relaxing convention experience ever because it was so easy to get back and forth. FYI: there are 2 towers- my room was in the tower farthest from the convention center. If I knew that ahead of time, I would have asked for a room in the other tower. However- I was completely satisfied with my room. 
The front desk staff were absolutely wonderful- they upgraded my room to the executive floor, so there was free breakfast each morning, drinks all day, and cocktails and snacks at night. The staff in the lounge were so friendly and gracious, the food varied and delicious, and the drinks plentiful. I looked forward to my visit to the lounge at the end of the day. 
The business center is also a UPS store, and is open from 7 am to 7 pm but your room card provides 24/7 access. 
The restaurants in the hotel are EXPENSIVE- so I walked around the area and found lots of dining options. I LOVED PHOENICA just 2 blocks away- an international grocery with a restaurant- huge variety of cheap food- deli, hot food to go, restaurant with nightly specials, and more, more , more. 
The hotel has a shuttle- for access to shopping and meals in the area. The stop for the local bus to the huge mall is just down the street. 
I took the super shuttle to and from the airport- and did not need a car the whole time I was in Houston. The super shuttle was great- not as well-organized as other cities- but it worked.
Make sure you check with your airline for the gate assignment for departure. Fortunately, I used the sky cap outside when the shuttle pulled up, and he let me know I should get back on the shuttle to go to the right terminal. United changed my gate to a different terminal and it would have been a L O N G walk.

title: “Second time around at this hotel and they won my respect with this visit.”
text:
I shared a less than positive experience, ok a terrible experience, at this hotel quite some time ago. I have since stayed there again and would like to rewrite my opinion of the place. 
First of all, I write my reviews almost immediately after a visit somewhere. I travel often, and figure it is best to do it immediately while all of the details are fresh in my mind. 
My last visit to the Hilton Americas was awful. The room and facility were amazing, however, the staff was terrible. Without a complaint from me, I was contacted regarding the feedback I left on tripadvisor.com and the folks at the Hilton wanted me to think it was an isolated incident and that the folks I had ecountered were just having a bad day. 
Frankly, I was suprised to have been contacted by them. I hesitated to want to stay there again, but, they sweetend the deal and I caved. I decided I would give them a shot on one of my next jaunts to Houston. 
I am glad that I did. They staff that I dealt with were all friendly and certainly gave the impression that they really cared about my stay and my comfort while at the hotel. Given the great staff I had the fortune of working with and the spectacular property, I would say that my stay at the Hilton Americas was, without a doubt, first class. 
Take the time while in Houston to check out a beautiful hotel that is convenient to the entire Houston Metro area. Relax in a great bed in an incredibly well appointed room and certainly take the time to enjoy the fantasic restaurants on property. 
Kudos to the staff here, they turned a really upset customer into a loyal customer that will be back as soon as it is possible.

title: “An Excellent HGI Property”
text:
As always, making my reservation took less than 3 minutes using the Hilton website.
The hotel is located just off a major freeway/frontage road. The hotel offers plenty of convenient and free parking. I was greeted with a smile, welcomed by name, and my check-in took less than a minute. The hotel itself is very clean and well-maintained. The hotel caters to business travelers and at least in the early evening the lobby/bar area is fairly noisy. My room was on the sixth floor and was also very clean, with a spotless duvet and a very comfortable bed.
I am a long-time Hilton Diamond HHonors member, and virtually all of my domestic hotel stays are at HGI properties for reasons (as in this case) include: free and convenient parking, free high-speed internet, a free and well-equipped business center, a clean indoor pool and a free and well-equipped fitness center, and a restaurant offering good food at reasonable prices.
If you like to workout, I recommend that you get to the fitness center as early as you can because the place fills up fast. 
The property, its staff, my room, and all of the usual HGI amenities made for a very comfortable and enjoyable stay. I recommend this property to you.

title: “Excellent service, clean property, free parking”
text: I have stayed at this property 3 times during the months of August and September. My first stay was to recover from a day surgery for a week, then two more one night stays for doctor follow-ups. The staff there was amazing - all very helpful, going out of their way to make sure I had everything I needed. The room was very clean - and I'm picky. The free breakfast and evening "kick-back" food choices really made it much simpler not to leave the property to buy to-go food while I recovered. The food offerings were all good quality and served and proper temperatures. Free parking is a rearity around the Galleria area, which was very welcomed.

title: “Another Day in Court”
text: This is one of my most favorite hotels to visit when in Houston. The front desk staff are always courteous and pleasant; they seem to go out of their way to accommodate needs and requests and to make sure you are comfortable. Of course the breakfast and afternoon happy hour treats are a plus. If I had a complaint, it's that they have switched over to wireless internet completely and for those who have not moved to that point this can be a setback. Of course, they have the business center available. Rooms spacious and clean with comfortable beds. Also as a coffee drinker, changing over to the one cup brewing pot is a minus but that's minute compared to the overall excellence of the hotel. The DISH network jumped in and out otherwise the channel selections on the TV were good.

title: “best location, amazing views”
text:
Best location on the park, amazing views, staff lovely, made me feel welcome, rooms are airy light and beautifully appointed.
I spend only 2 days here before moving on to another place to stay. Great start to my New York visit, excellent breakfast and room service.
Thank you to everyone at the Sherry!

title: “fun, elegant and personal”
text:
stayed at the sherry for 3 nights whilst in new york, which is one of my favourite cities in the world. the staff there are the best thing about it.... warm and helpful, but never intruding. the rooms are beautifully appointed without trying too hard, with a botanical theme. because i'm not fond of large impersonal lobbies, i was really pleased arriving at the sherry despite the bustle outside its entrance. it felt like SUCH a privilege every time i walked through that revolving door. although i would have preferred a slightly quieter address further into the upper east side, there is something to be said for its proximity to bergdorf goodman :P 
although we didn't make use of the room service, i believe many good things have been said about its neighbour Harry cipriani. i'm always charmed by any establishment that offers free drinks in its minibar - whilst not the type to drink many of them in the first place, it just seems so much less 'commercial' this way... honestly, who's going to drink 20 cans of coke from the minibar, even if they were free? 
so... the sherry might suit someone like me, who prefers their hotels thoughtful, beautiful and intimate.

title: “FANTASTIC!”
text: What a superb place to stay in NYC! Gorgeous rooms, friendly and helpful staff, perfect location. Totally delightful.

title: “Live Like a New Yorker”
text: OK, so most of us can’t afford to be upper east-siders. But we can stay at the Sherry to see what the big deal is. And, it is a big deal. Walking distance to Broadway, the Lincoln Center and the main art museums. (don’t miss the Whitney!), as well as the many wonderful restaurants. Then, the hotel itself is no hotel. It is a residence. The staff is as professional as they come. We stayed for several days and lost the feeling of being yokels from Virginia because we were treated as residents. The rooms are exquisitely appointed and larger than the NYC norm. Cipriani’s is the attached restaurant and has great service and excellent food, which came with a discount, since we were residents … er … hotel guests. We try to get to the Apple at least once a year and traditionally select the Sherry. Occasionally we experiment with other venues such as the Plaza. But we have always happily returned to “our” place. The Sherry. We’d give it six stars, if we could.

title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
text:
