We stayed in the San Carlos from Dec 25, 2011 - Jan 1, 2012. We stayed in a 1 bdrm suite which was large by any standards, and extra large by NYC standards. It has a small kitchenette with microwave, frig, sink and storage but no stove. 1 bathroom which was average. Hotel was clean, modern and updated. We have a child in a large wheelchair, and the room was not gigantic but large enough to accomodate the wheelchair and his other items. My other son said the pullout sofabed was comfortable. 2 big flat screen tv's in each room. There is a computer center with internet on the 2nd floor with like 6 computers and a printer. If you have a computer, you can get free wifi throughout the hotel. We have stayed in 3 hotels on E 50 St. The other 2 were The Benjamin and The Kimberly. For the price, quality/size of room and wonderful staff, it is by far the best hotel in the area. The breakfast was perfect since we are not big breakfast eaters. It includes juice, milk, coffee, danishes, muffins, breads, etc. Nothing hot other than coffee. It has a small gym which I used twice. It has 2 treadmills, an elliptical machine, stationary bike, and free weights. Perfect for a decent workout. I ran to and through Central Park. The hotel in centrally located. 2 blocks from a subway station with an elevator which is an issue for us since we travel with a wheelchair. 4 blocks east of Rockerfeller Center and about 8 blocks from Times Square. Blocks in NYC are short so most things are within walking distance if you're a walker, and you can always find a subway near by if you're not. 
The night staff was wonderful in making restaurant recommendations. The gentlemen made suggestions and each one was better than the next. Chin Chin was probably one of the best Chinese restaurants I've eaten at. The staff was welcoming, courteous and helpful. Evelyn made great New Years' Eve recommendations for a restaurant right off Broadway in Times Square. If you are a young couple looking for a party scene, you may want something trendier. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC especially with children.

title: “Fabulous!”
text: Good sized rooms, great location, and helpful staff. Good little breakfast to get you on your way, saves stopping off at other eateries and instead making the most of this amazing place! We went in December and the Christmas themes throughout hotel very tasteful. Already looking to return this year! Special thanks to Matthew the doorman!

title: “Great staff team + good value”
text: This was third year in a row enjoying a short break in Manhattan for this reviewer. OK, so the Iroquois doesn't have the great views or big spacious lobbies of some other midtown hotels, but it was by far the friendliest, most helpful (and quietest) hotel I've stayed at. Nice touches such as free morning coffee and Internet all made it a happy choice for us. Great job.

title: “Great Hotel in the heart of midtown”
text:
We've stayed at the Iroquois New York a few times already.
The staff are incredibly helpful and pleasant. Whatever we asked for we got within minutes. 
The rooms are very clean, modern and pretty. 
We would definitely recommend a stay (or many!) at the Iroquois - great hotel in a great location!

title: “Weekend Getaway in the Big Apple”
text: From the minute we walked into the lobby the staff was wonderful and went above and beyond to make our stay there memorable. Very clean and modern rooms with great views of the city along with the nightly wine hour made this hotel one we will be visiting again.

title: “Great Hotel!”
text: Eventi - a Kimpton Hotel was a great place to stay. The room we had was on the 12th floor and had floor to ceiling windows and was extremely spacious! The washroom was huge (by city standards) and very nicely finished. The furnishings were all nicely appointed, comfortable and very clean. The room came with everything you could possibly need and we found the location convenient as well. The staff was very helpful and provided us with some excellent dining suggestions. We also enjoyed the complimentary wine hour, great spot to enjoy a drink! I would definitely stay at a Kimpton Hotel again and recommend for sure.

title: “Billed for umbrella and water that I never took”
text:
I am disappointed with my stay at Eventi. I stayed there for one night in September 2012, and I won't go back again.
My main disappointment is due to *two* charges that got added to my credit card bill (I didn't get any room-service, etc.), which I only found out when I checked my card statement. One was for a bottle of water (for about 5 bucks), and another one for a $25 umbrella. It wasn't even raining when I was in NYC.
Adding two extra charges is way too many for me. Mistakenly adding one is OK; adding two is unacceptable to me.

title: “Club Like Atmosphere and Service....Top Marks!”
text: The Chatwal is an oasis of luxury just off of Times Square. The property is beautiful and opulent, yet not gaudy or ostentatious. It is clean and stylish. The staff were beyond attentive and super responsive to every need. Long story short-- this propery and is staff are world class.

title: “Truly hidden, but an unexpected GEM”
text: To be honest, I booked this hotel reluctantly for a short trip and mainly in an attempt to maintain my membership level through SPG. The concierge staff reached out to me a month before my trip to ask about reservations and shows, which I have rarely had happen before. So I began to feel a little better about the reservation. However when I walked up to the very small doorway on an a city block that I didn't love, I was sure that I had made a mistake. I was immediately proven wrong once I entered. The lobby and bar area were surprisingly nice and the staff everywhere was over the top. The room itself was incredible, but I must admit that I got an upgrade thanks to my SPG level. For a hotel in the city, it was an embarassment of riches in terms of the bathroom size and amenities, the room itself, and a fantastic sleeping bed. The sophistication of the room and the staff was truly outstanding. I have stayed in many great hotels in the city, but none touched the service that I experienced at the Chatwal. In a perfect world, the location would be a little closer to my favorite restaurants, but this staff and that room will most likely be plenty of incentive to walk a few extra blocks. The concierge staff and the front desk were truly off the charts. Exceptional.

title: “Falls short as Leading Hotels of the World..Be aware , This is not a 5* luxury hotel”
text:
I wonder how the reviews showing high level 5*,surely they are not familiar with what 5* luxury means and what is required to be a Leading hotels of the world member.This hotel has a serious management problem.
I booked one avenue appartment and one delux studio as a supplement room in this hotel through the leading hotels site for me,my wife and four children.I have requested ( high floors,adjointing rooms,room with balcony,birthday celepration)(very simple requests)
What happened during the check in was not acceptable under any measures.Im entilted for upgrade and Mr. Brian from the frontdesk ( introduced as on duty manager by hiis colleque..which i dought) has done the upgradation for the supplement room and refused the upgrade for the main, moreover he was offering 1 room in 5th floor and the other in the 21st.
I had to argue for an hour and more to get the two rooms in the same floor.He kept taking my hard copy of the reservation and checking several times although i had a confirmation email from LHW that my reservation dossier has been sent to the hotel.
For the first time in my life i was calling the LHW and complaining.
The hotel facilities and aminities and what im entiteled of was explained to me by the DOORMEN insted of the reception like any respectfull 4 or 5* hotel.
As for the hotel, the property is an appartment building which was converted to hotel ( not bad but still an appartment not suits )it is not bad and clean with highline furniture and amenities.IP phones worked only the first day,no bell to the room.
The one bedroom suit size is OK ( less than the size compared to same category in other manhatten hotels)
The location is bit far from the shopping and dining areas unless u like to walk for 2miles+
The breakfast in the Ai Fiori is not recomended since the room service is better in taste,time and frindlieness.
My advise to anybody who want to stay in this hotel to bring a hard copy of their reservation and call the hotel earlier from arrival to insure their requirements is being taken care of.
For LHW members, avoid this hotel unless you want to be treated as booked through travel agent, and be prepared to have more than 1 hour argument.Dont expect the usual LHW members treatment,dont expect a welcome note from the General manager or even email ( his secretary will sendyou)
For LHW is to review this hotel qualification as a member
For me, NEVER AGAIN

title: “Excellent service & location”
text:
The location is superb enabling you to see the majority of sights on foot. The concierge service is excellent and friendly. The hotel itself is very clean and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The maid gave the room a clean 3 times a day!
Whilst this is not the cheapest hotel it does offer excellent value for its location, a 5 minute stroll to the Empire State Building and the shops on Fifth Avenue. We will be staying there again.

title: “Little piece of Heaven”
text: This hotel is absolutely spectacular. The rooms are very spacious. Bedding and actual beds are a little piece of Heaven. Absolutely the best hotel I have ever stayed while visiting NY. Service and staff were available for whatever was needed.

title: “There might be better in NY but not to me!”
text: My wife and I spent four nights at this great property for the second time in a year (lucky us!). I don't believe there is much better to my taste than the Andaz 5th Avenue. We already tried a few Ws, the NY Palace, the Grand Hyatt and some other places but to us, Andaz is the best of our world: Loft-type comfortable rooms with floor to top windows (stayed at a junior suite, that help), simple but top-end design (not as hype as W - which I still enjoy -neither too heavy like you would see in a St. Regis), comfortable rooms, great service, amazing location (right on the 5th but benefitting from the quietness of the 41st street), etc. As a diamond member we enjoyed the additional benefit (basically 75$ off the breakfast bill) without missing the lounge access of the Grand for one bit (the drinks are in any case available both at the lobby and in the room, and the food is anyway better in any New York restaurants). The staff is definitely one of the best I know: very professional but quite relaxed too, which I like. It's a good change from the arrogance you get at SLS and some Ws and the overwhelming assistance of some other luxury places. We had some minor laundry issues and Jefry was always very reactive and helpful to sort things out. So in short great property, great location, great comfort, great staff, try it!

title: “Awesome location, friendly staff, great atmosphere”
text:
There are only three things that slightly annoyed me about this hotel:
1. The shower was very awkward to work. On the upside, you could fit 20 people in that shower.
2. I was using a verizon wireless phone while there, and you cannot get reception (okay, one bar) in the hotel.
3. No hot tub & no pool. Oh well.
Other than that, this place was great. We arrived in a shuttle, in the pouring rain...and immediately there was a guy with an umbrella covering myself, my wife, and our luggage until we were inside. From there on it was pretty full on awesome service. The location is directly across from the main NYC library and also a few pretty nice Japanese restaurants/grocery places. With times square two blocks away, it was perfect for sight-seeing. 
It is DEAD quiet inside the rooms, the bed was one of the most comfortable my wife and I have ever slept on. I highly recommend this hotel, I just wish it were cheaper...but it is NYC.

title: “Pretty darn perfect”
text:
The check-in was unusual but really cool - walk into the lobby and one of an amazing array of model-quality hosts will come up and greet you warmly, and check you in. Then they will accompany you to your room, making sure that you are comfortable with an array of eco-friendly aspects of the room. 
Our room was huge, especially by NYC standards. Full of high-tech stuff, modern and sleek, yet comfortable and inviting. It was a bit of a challenge to get the lights turned on in the bathroom, but somehow we managed. The room was quiet - #1 priority for us. 
We were there only for a short time, but it involved seeing a play on Broadway and a marriage. No big whoop. It started to rain just before we headed out to see the show, and umbrellas magically appeared, as well as practical advice about trying to get a cab at "that" time of day. Forget about it. Loved it – and they were right!
Next day we met a friend, had breakfast in the delightful restaurant, went and got married, then came back to a pleasant check-out and again, more staff who took a genuine interest in us and our stay.
I can't wait to come back to this hotel. While the hotel itself was first-rate, the staff made all the difference. Who knew people could be so nice, professional, and good-looking at the same time. 
I recommend the Andaz highly to all who want to stay in a top-notch hotel and experience the warmth and pleasantness of a professional, smart staff who can make you feel like you’re staying with relatives (the good kind).

title: “A fabulous Hyatt in NYC”
text:
I had been looking forward to staying here and was finally able to spend 2 nights in a Suite on the 16th Floor.
The GOOD:
Wonderful location (although it can be hard to find for first-timers, especially at night), very tasty breakfast, great bathroom (although the shower control is very tricky to use).
The BAD:
Breakfast service can be slow.
The UGLY:
Ineffective room blackout. My suite has a small balcony and the the shade is installed 24" away from the window, so there is light leakage coming from the sides. If you don't like lights coming in early morning, wear an eye mask.

title: “Good hotel, great location!”
text: It has been a while since my visit to New York and this hotel, but I do know that this hotel was very comfortable and in a great spot, close to central park. No complaints whatsoever! Staff was friendly and cooperative, rooms were clean and well kept. No complaints whatsoever!

title: “Good but should be better”
text:
We spent four nights in New York at the Beacon Hotel. We had a quite large suite with a large sitting room, a large bedroom and a fullsize bathroom. After five weeks in European hotels we really appreciated the space.
The decor throughout the hotel is understated and the facilities are very limited (no gym, no pool, no breakfast). Reception and porters got the job done but there were few smiles and limited rapport. 
Maintenance is also an issue. There were several small tthings in our room that should not have been that way. A door handle on the coat wardrobe was loose, the centre of a power point in the sitting room was loose and moved about if you tried to plug into it, there was an area the size of a tennis ball where the paint had flaked off the window sill, the coat hook behind the bathroom door had been moved and refixed without repainting the now exposed area and the tapwear in the bathroom was almost completely devoid of chrome. None of these things are terribly serious in their own right, but when you are paying the kind of prices asked by this hotel you are entitled to better.

title: “Enjoyed It So Much I Applied For A Job Here..”
text: After a hectic conference at another property I decided to stay here for a couple of days. The bellmen, concierge, housekeepers, front desk agents, and restaurant staff members were all fantastic. I have stayed at many properties around the world and I can honestly say that this property is "no ka oi" as we say on Maui. (The best). When I return the next time I hope I'm an employee instead of a guest.

title: “Luxury and a Salt Water Pool”
text: I was staying at this hotel because I was in town for a conference at the George R Brown Convention center. My room was an upgraded King Suite which had a nice view overlooking the saltwater pool at the hotel. The amenities and room service food quality definitely remind you that you are at the Four Seasons. If in the Houston area again I would absolutely stay at this property. Photos of my room and the wonderful pool view from my room are included in my review.

title: “Pricey, little long in the tooth, but classy”
text: Great location, great bed, but decor is a little dated. But staff is top notch. You pretty much know what you are going to get with a Four Seasons.

title: “A Place to Spend Time in the Room”
text: Great location in downtown and absolutely wonderful room decor. I wouldn't recommend this if you are planning to spend a lot of time out and about, but if you want a place to relax and enjoy without going out much, they usually have great deals for the location. They also have an amazing penthouse if you can afford it. We'll definitely be back in the near future.

title: “Lovely hotel”
text: Stayed here 7 nights for work. This is a beautiful hotel- every detail of the decor was just so beautiful, with a great Texas feel. My room was gorgeous and spacious, and the bathroom was amazingly so. I seriously considered purchasing the gigantic, fluffy bathrobe provided in the room. There is NO pool at this hotel. The extremely nice bellmen took me in the shuttle to the shiny new downtown YMCA where I swam (for $10). The bar is in the center of the lovely lobby and serves good drinks and food. Management went to great lengths to make sure we could watch and hear the opening Olympics ceremonies at the bar. Access to different floors on the hotel elevator requires a room key. The added security is appropriate, unfortunately. Downtown Houston isn't the nicest/ safest place to walk around. The Gastro Pub next door has good food and creative drinks. Also try the Mia Bella Italian restaurant, a block away, which has outstanding food. Parking is valet only at this hotel and it's $28. The shuttle will take you all over- we went to an Astros game at MinuteMaid Park and to the original Ninfa's Restaurant. Overall, good stay.

title: “Downtown convenience, quirky good”
text:
Icon is an unusual little hotel that is generally pretty successful at guest service. I've stayed there more than 6 times for business, so have a good feel for the place. The lobby entrance is on the side, not grand by any stretch, but the main floor has high ceilings and a grand feel appropriate to both Houston and the bank formerly in the space. (Behind reception is the old vault.) The rooms are boldly wallpapered. Thankfully, the TVs seem to have been upgraded recently. (In 2011, they were mostly 1990s vintage.) The bathrooms are excellent, with nice products and large space. I'm not sure any room has a good view -- certainly I usually find myself looking at the side of another building or a parking lot.
The gym is small, and oddly dim with red and black decor. It doesn't scream "fitness" but it works.

title: “Comfortable elegance”
text: We were very pleased with out 6 day stay at this hotel. Conveniently located downtown, it exhibits the old style charm and classic architecture of a former bank building (the bank's vault being the backdrop to the front desk). The elevators, rooms and commubal areas are tastefully decorated and the service is first class. The rooms are spacious and ours was equipped with a whirlpool and large shower. The beds are extremeky comfortable. Free internet. The only downside was the $28 overnight valet parking; no other option.. Also $12 parking for my son who joined us simply for dinner.

title: “Exceptional Sray”
text: This was by far the best stay at a hotel that my family and I have ever had. The people were very friendly and the food was outstanding. The sleeping rooms were very nice and the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. My family and I will be coming back to this hotel.

title: “Nice place and great pastries”
text: I have stayed at the Sorella many times in the last two years and was never disappointed. It has a modern feel, is surrounded by some good restaurants and price-wise on par with e.g. the Marriott Energy Corridor which is close by. for the same, price, however, you get an individual hotel experience instead of a chain-one. Something I prefer. The breakfast pastries are delicious and free and I like that. Highly recommended.

title: “Lovely hotel”
text: Stayed here for five nights. Had never heard of the hotel or CityCentre which is not anywhere near downtown Houston. Turned out to be a modern, well appointed hotel with some lovely features including crisp, cleanly designed, well maintained, fairly large guestrooms and lovely public spaces. Breakfast is an upscale cold buffet of quality fresh fruit, croissants and other pastries, boxed cereals, yogurt, juice and coffee, all served in a beautiful lobby seating area. Walk to all sorts of restaurant and shops that are right outside the hotel door. Self park in a nearby covered garage is convenient. Only drawbacks - the hotel promised transportation within a 5 mile radius and then seemed to favor business groups over individuals. Also no real concierge on staff.

title: “A Must Stay and Great Location!”
text:
This is a beautiful property and still seems new. The work out facilities are excellent and the infinity pool is gorgoues. The staff was great as well. You will get a well rested nights sleep with the Heavenly bed.
We also enjoyed the club lounge which I don't think I have seem before at a Westin. 
The location is in the prime area for the Memorial Mall and hospital district at memorial. We ae at Cheesecake factory which is a small walk away. 
We will definately be back.

title: “Great Hotel Off the Busy Freeway”
text: Stayed at the new Westin for 2 nights in early December for a business conference and had a really nice time. The hotel is still very new (Opened March 2011) and the staff go out of their way to make sure your experience is memorable. The facility is impressive; about 25 stories tall with speedy elevators. I neglected to check out the penthouse infinity pool and work out room but was told the view was spectacular of West Houston. The rooms are large and comfy, lovely bathroom and glass shower. It was fully equipped with necessities (wifi costs $9.99 a day however). Located in a very busy part of Western Houston directly off the very busy/congested I-10 corridor within the giant Memorial City Hospital Complex (only complain that parking was confusing and a hassle as the hotel entrances were difficult to find and negotiate) and across the equally busy Gessner Road from the large Memorial City Mall. Very pleased that they constructed a pedestrian bridge to and from the Mall as otherwise it would be dangerous and ill advised (Texas drivers don't cater to peds)

title: “Gutes Hotel, auch für mehrere Tage”
text: Wir waren im März 2010 für ein paar Tage in Houston und haben in diesem Best Western übernachtet. Wir waren sehr zufrieden. Die Lage ist gut, Parken kostet nichts extra. Es gibt ein gutes Frühstück. Für jeden ist da etwas dabei. Die Zimmer waren groß und sauber, die Betten weich. Das Personal war freundlich und zuvorkommend. Kostenfreies WLan in den Zimmern.

title: “Honorable, correct sans plus”
text: Un peu loin du centre, mais pas grand chose à faire de toute façon. Chambre best western classique. Petit déj moyen, vaisselle en plastique, gauffresà faire soi même sympa. Piscine correcte mais un peu sale en fin de journée. Accueil correct.

title: “Not worth what I paid”
text:
Overall, this hotel is nice. But, hardly worth the $200 a night I paid on a recent one night trip over to the Houston area for a football game. I had high hopes to stay at the visiting team hotel to truly make it a fan experience. I called numerous hotels who told me to check with the Hilton Americas. I eventually spoke with the hotel manager who explained they are a "preferred NFL team hotel". While I understand they can not tell me who is staying at the hotel, they can certainly tell me who isn't, and they had no problem mentioning that the "Home team" was staying and The Rolling Stones stayed just a week prior. Unfortunately, my team was not staying at this hotel and I was suckered into thinking they were.
The staff was not very knowledgeable about the surrounding area. My wife and I were looking for lunch and led on a wild goose chase trying to find a simple quick meal. There really is not any places to eat (outside of paying hotel prices) with-in about 3-4 blocks. 
Also, for the football game, we were told the metro rail would be the best way to take the cheapest trip to the stadium. The concierge failed to mentioned to us, it is a free ride to and from on game days. Something a random stranger had to tell us after we paid for tickets to and from.
While I found the bed comfortable, the pillow left little to be desired. I simply could not get comfortable as it was like sleeping with my head on a rock. Also, note that the thermostat does not have a "fan on" setting. So, its hard to drown out noise from the hallway. I was startled awake numerous times with people coming and going in the hallway.
Also worth noting, the ice machine on our floor was broken. Not all that big of a deal, but when you pay over $200 for a nights stay you expect things like that to work.
I can honestly say, I feel ripped off. From the attempted fan experience to the broken ice maker. I wish I would have saved myself $150 bucks and stayed somewhere with a free breakfast and free parking.

title: “Pleasant surprise”
text: This is a nice hotel with friendly staff. Not luxurious, but comfortable. The "king size" bed is a small king, so plan accordingly. It has nice little touches to make the rooms homey - little reflective paint under counter in bathroom so turning on the light at night is unnecessary; shelving in the tub to hold towels; hutch for microwave and refrigerator with room for storage. We ate the breakfast and it was good - not great, but as it was included in our price, we won't complain. Sausage gravy and biscuits, eggs, bacon, cereals, fresh fruits, pastries, yogurt, french toast, pancakes, hash browns, coffee, juice, and am probably leaving something out. We received a special rate due to the meet we were attending and it included breakfast. Not sure we would have been as pleased otherwise, but for the $80 (including tax) we paid, it was beyond great.

title: “I felt like I was staying with family that really cared about us.”
text: I went to all the hotels in the area to find the one that would accommodate my extended family and friends for my daughters wedding and this hotel was by far the best. It was everything they promised it would be and more. I would highly recommend having a weekend wedding in this hotel because the staff was very attentive and worked with our time crunch because it was a morning wedding. The hotel was set back off the freeway and it did not have a through street so I felt safe and secure.

title: “Very comfortable and clean. Highly recommend.”
text:
Everything to say has already been said. Great staff, clean rooms, and very comfortable beds. So, I'd light to highlight great customer service from Lala. Every time I make a reservation to any hotel, I request non feather bedding because of my allergies. I simply cannot deal with donald or daffy. And every single time, the hotels over look this request. Lala read the request and personally checked the room as I unloaded the car to make sure that the geese were elsewhere. That's service people! Hotels with far more stars don't have that kind of accountability and person touch. I have no quarms about recommending this place.
GPS totally missed this place so be sure to be on the side of katy freeway heading east toward the beltway. Its next to texas land and cattle and holiday inn. The sign is small and low to the ground.

title: “Long time traveler; best stay ever!”
text:
I travel 50% of the year, mostly for business. This specific trip was one with my wife and parents to visit my sister and family. The service was amazing from the second we walked in the door. Everyone from the front desk to the restaurant to the maid service was ultra friendly and helpfull. I found myself saying to different family members at different times how impressed I was and how much this hotel stood out more than any others. The food is fine; what you would normally get at an HGI, the workout facility was much better than most and the location is perfect, lots of shopping, restaurants, etc. 
I don't typically write reviews, this one was worth it. You will be very happy if you choose to stay at this property.

title: “Where the extras aren't extra...”
text:
This hotel is superb value. Every day at 5:30pm we were greeted by an all-you-can-eat supply of Hot Dogs and Cheesy Mac. What more could one want? 
Free breakfast, free parking, free long-distance calls, great pool and gym... no need to consider anywhere else!

title: “Drury knows what Hospitality means!”
text:
Once again, the Drury brand has risen to the challenge and MORE than achieved the success it deserves and is recognized for - JD Power and Associates 7 years running! You can associate "luxury" with all sorts of names in the Hotel industry, and quite frankly, none will match the UNFETTERED, consistant results that Drury lives up to.
From the moment you arrive, you have this instant "ahhhh...Home Sweet Home"! That "dated" look so many comment about in my opinion continues that "ahhhh...Home Sweet Home" charm. That unpretentious, warm, welcoming greeting you get from Mary, Christopher, and the rest of Jose's Team enforces that "ahhhh...Home Sweet Home" sense when you arrive. 
Check-in is always a breeze, one that says, "hey, hope your travel here was comfortable, and we're glad you're here." That anticipation of when the buttery hot, fresh, popcorn smell will begin to waffe through the lobby, to the "when's dinner - aka - 5:30 Kickback"; tell me, where are you going to get THAT feeling, and all at an incredible value?
I actually appreciate the room, it's layout, and amenities. It tells me that I've paid a reasonable price, for a safe, clean, quiet roof over my head with all the "trimmings" of a FREE hot breakfast, FREE hot afternoon/evening Kickback, FREE good wireless internet, FREE long-distance phone calls, FREE daily popcorn/soda, FREE parking and amenities like an INDOOR/OUTDOOR pool, indoor hot-tub and exercise room... My roonm is meant for a few hours of shut-eye; not where to spend my day. And so, I don't want to pay a huge price just to say it's chi-chi and ooh-la-la!
Proximatey to the Galleria, downtown Houston, 610, 10, 45, 290, River Oaks, and on and on. It's where to BE if you're going to be in Houston!
Jose...you bet we'll be back. You have a tremendous Team, run a beautifully managed hotel, with Staff who show they enjoy working there. We can't wait to be back!

title: “Good but older Drury”
text:
We have stayed in several Drury Inns, so we're familiar with and appreciated the standard extras offered at this chain. Traveling as a family, this is part of why we choose a Drury. We enjoyed the hospitality of the staff, who were very accommodating. We appreciated the proximity to the Galleria and free parking. We liked the clean pool! However, we would not stay at this location again unless we knew the beds had been replaced.
The room itself was very clean. However, unlike in our past visits to other Drury Inns, we found that the beds were squishy and left us feeling creaky in the morning. Also, there is a smaller, traditional sink area, instead of a spacious marble counter area as in newer Drurys. The parking lot gate was up when we arrived, and when I inquired I was told that it was put down later in the night, but I wasn't awake to confirm this and it was open by the time we departed. This policy left me feeling a bit misled and nervous about the gated parking. Fortunately, there were no problems. The fitness room provided a nice workout, although it was a bit warm due to poor AC. Anyway, this stay was acceptable, but we'll hope the beds are updated by the next time we visit Houston Galleria area.

title: “Exactly as advertised”
text:
I always read what hotels say they offer but am always wondering what I will REALLY get when I am there. When I booked this hotel I heard that it was great and lived up to the mottto of "The extras aren't extra" and they were correct!! Free Hot or cold breakfast buffet, happy hour with 3 free drinks and dinner buffet, WOW! It was always stocked, clean and great for my family!! Th pool was an indoor outdoor one that our kids loved! 
 The only negative was that the hot tub was always breaking down and all the soda machines were out of stock?? Kind of annoying... Overall CLEAN, FRIENDLY AND FREE FOOD AND DRINKS!!!!!!

title: “Great for a family”
text: Our family of 5 (children aged 12, 10 and 7 yrs) stayed in a suite on the 15th floor for 7 nights over the New Year season. Our suite had 2 Queen beds in the bedroom and a comfortable sofa bed in the living room. We were impressed by the comfortable beds, big size of rooms, kitchenette with microwave and fridge, simple but adequate breakfast facilities, good bathroom size, fantastic shower and high standard of housekeeping. The room was quiet and being on the 15th floor we had plenty of natural light. The lifts were fast and staff were accommodating with allowing us to have a late checkout, and doorman organized a car for us to JFK for $69 + tip which was cheaper than 2 taxis. Highly recommended for families.

title: “Looking forward to returning”
text: The last time my family stayed in a hotel (a Marriott in DC), my husband vowed never to stay in a hotel again. It was that negative of an experience. The San Carlos changed his mind. I booked a 4-day stay right before Christmas based on the Tripadvisor reviews after looking for a suitable hotel and location for months. We're so glad we did. The parking next door was so convenient and reasonably priced, the hotel staff was wonderful, check-in and -out was a breeze, the room was spacious (though it was a suite), and the beds were so incredibly comfortable - even the sofa bed. Great to have a kitchenette in the room, as it saved money not having to eat out every meal. The breakfast was nothing to write home about but I didn't book a room because of the breakfast, it was just an added perk. My only complaint was that most days we could not find anyone working the breakfast and the one day we did, she could not speak fluent English so she had trouble understanding what I was asking for. It was only a concern for my family because my son has food allergies, and I wanted to check ingredients on several items. He was forced to eat only the packaged items, but that is not the first time this has happened while traveling and we bring foods with us for situations like this. We would gladly stay here again when we return to NYC.

title: “Oasis of Calm & Courtesy”
text: Everything about this hotel was outstanding. We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon, on vacation and were very quickly assisted by the bellman, then on to the front desk. This is a compact hotel, not grand, so if you're expecting that, this is not for you. Located on 44th St in Manhattan, it is literally close to everything we wanted to do: 9/11 Memorial, Ellis Island, Village Vanguard Jazz Club, ComedyCentral Club, Rockefeller Ctr, Strawberry Fields...etc. Very close to subway stations, Times Square, Broadway. The room was super-fantastic, beds were comfortable, sheets very luxurious, service was OUTSTANDING. The bath products Moulton Brown (very nice!). Join the Gold Club and receive a bottle of wine when you check in. I just can't say enough about this place, it's so quiet and classy. The bar downstairs made me a world-class special drink, the music was so nice too. I had a wonderful time and woul recommend this hotel, we got a good rate on booking.com.

title: “great first time stay here!!!”
text: we try to come to NYC at least for a weekend once a year, but have never stayed at this hotel before. I booked it based on price then reviews. We arrived around 1130am way before check-in, but the front desk said they would store our luggage until the room is ready. We didn't use valet($65/nite) since there is a parking garage directly across the street( after validation $35/nite) I thought the room was comfortable and spacious enough for us(2 adults/2kids) it was clean,the shower was hot and good water pressure, we needed extra washcloths, which came immediately after i called front desk.You can't beat the location, extremely close to Times Square. We did receive a recommendation from Bill (bellhop/doorman) for a casual dinner, he recommended HB burger on 43rd, which was great( the beer was good , too). So, if the rates stay reasonable, this may be our new favorite hotel for use in the future/great staff/helpful and attentive

title: “Luxury hotel with understated presence”
text: This hotel is located in lower mid town New York City close to Broadway & Madison Square Garden but tucked away so as to be out of the out of the hub bub of pedestrian and taxi traffic. The ambiance is great and the staff couldn't be any more accommodating.

title: “Best experience in NYC”
text:
Amazing from the min we walk in. Our room was not ready for an early check but the sweet girl at the front desk offered us some ice tea and tokd us about the hotel as the bellman Ali store or bags one hour later she called us to inform us that the room was ready we got to our room AMAZING ! !!! The most beautiful mini bar we have ever seen and don't want to get out of the bed because they are the most comphy !
The restaurant lambs club was great christine recommend the burger and sea scallops delish !
We did not use concierge much because every time we tied they were on break Christine at front desk offer to help. 
We stayed at lots of hotel around the world and by far the Chatwal is now at the top of our list ! 
Thank you christine for ice tea and the seafood restaurant and Ali for helping us with taxi and special thanks to the front office manager lance. We will be back !

title: “3 night stay for our 10th wedding anniversary”
text:
Please see below the email I sent to the director of operations at the Chatwal. In summary, great facility, great location, but this hotel has some serious service issues. Please excuse the spelling mistakes - the email was sent from a smart phone.
---
Mr <name removed>,
Good morning -
We just left the chatwal this morning and wanted to share with you the experience we had with your hotel. I am a starwood platinum member and do in average 30 to 35 stays a year in starwood hotels. 
first, the positive, everybody is indeed nice and the hotel and the rooms are superb.
However, I think the hotel has a serious issue in following up and and executing on guest's requests.
I'll just state a few problems that we experienced:
When we arrived on Tuesday, our room was not ready (not a problem in itself), I was asked for my cell number and were told I would be called when the room is ready. I also requested a crib or small bed for my son.
We were also told the hotel was giving us a small gift for our 10th wedding birthday. We never received anything (not that we care, but if you say you will do something, do it or don't say anything).
We came back around 4:30pm. The room was ready (but we were never called).
We get in the room and our son's bed was not there.
We leave around 5:00pm for an early dinner. I request the bed again to make sure we can put our son to bed upon our return.
We return 8:30pm and no bed. 9:15pm was when we had the bed ready in the room.
I go get a bottle of sparkling water in the fridge and find in the bar a bottle already open and half empty.
the inflatable bed we were provided was leaking air, was 3/4 deflated in the morning and my son felt 3 times during the night (try to sleep on a high, deflating bed).
In the morning I signal the issue of the deflating bed. They come and pick up the bed, say they will bring a new bed. 
5pm no bed. My wife request another time the bed before leaving for dinner.
We come back 8:30pm, no bed and have to call again to have it.
Thursday - we notice that house keeping threw away our breakfast coupons left on the night table. I requested some new ones. House keeping also got the great idea of storing all the pillow in a closet where my wife was hanging her dresses, so the results is that the bottom half of the dresses are just laying on the pillow. Not helpful in trying to keep your clothes nice and wrinkle-free. A suggestion: move the clothes or store the pillows somewhere else.
And last but not least, why would the staff knock on our door at 10:45pm to give us the bottles of water for the turn-down. Should that not be done a tad earlier??
So, in conclusion, I am not asking for anything, but thought your should be aware of the issues. I am suspecting other guests are currently finding issues. I stay mainly in westins and W hotels and occasionally in luxury collection and st regis hotel. The chatwal is one of the 2 hotels in the last 4 years I experienced as many issues.
I suggest you review your processes to ensure that guest requests are accomodated and I believe your staff needs additional training in standard practices for luxury hotels.

title: “Spacious and comfortable”
text: This was our first trip to NYC and we stayed at the Setai for 11 nights so we were very grateful to have such a spacious room with a large wardrobe where we could completely unpack and make ourselves at home. The hotel does not have any designated "check in or out" times which is great because they will work around whatever suits the guest. All staff were extremely helpful, attentive and friendly. The rooms were HUGE, clean and comfortable. We loved the addition of the Nespresso machine and small sweet treats that were delivered to the room each night - it's the small details that make this a special hotel. Great location, close to shopping and Times Square. Highly recommended! Oh and do try the wonderful restaurant on the 2nd floor - Ai Fiori - you must book in advance, but it's worth it !!

title: “A home from home..”
text:
We travelled to New York recently for a 40th Birthday celebration and spent a wonderful 3 nights at the Setai. We were lucky enough to get a deal, a 3 for 2 nights on a Studio Suite much earlier in the year. The room was fabulous. Having done a great deal of research about New York hotels and prices, we were expecting very little for our money but the Suite at the Setai surpassed all expectations, it was a really good size, with a seperate lounge area, walk in wardrobe and huge bathroom, with a large walk in shower, very large luxurious bath, oh yes and 3 TV's one of which was in the bathroom mirror! 
Our personal assistant Eugenie was exceptional!, As we were there for a special occasion we had been in contact with Eugenia for a good few weeks prior to our arrival to help us with restaurant recommendations and bookings, as well as other sightseeing and tour information. When we arrived everything was ready for us and the slightest mention of wanting to visit anywhere was followed by a few clicks of the keyboard and we had all travel information and tickets in our hands, they made it so simple and easy it was truly fabulous and we both wanted to say a big thank you to the hotel and Eugenia, who helped make our trip so special. They even sent us a bottle of champagne and birthday cake with Birthday note.
The hotel is very conveniently located on fifth avenue, a few blocks walk from Grand Central Station, The Empire State Building, Times Square etc as well as the Subway. 
When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by the staff with a "welcome to your home for the next 3 nights" This certainly was what the hotel felt like, the service was excellent but the room just felt like we had arrived and was as close to home as you can get when staying in a hotel room. We would highly recommend.

title: “Good Value”
text: Nice and comfortable hotel situated just north of Columbus circle on Broadway. Considering its proximity to crowded tourist areas, it had a quiet and homey feel . If you are staying on a budget for several days it would afford you the opportunity to eat some meals in your room. I was on a short visit to attend a concert at the Beacon Theatre and it worked out fantastic for my purposes. I love the resteraunts in Manhattan and chose to eat out for all my meals. I did use the coffee maker and it made a good cup. Service was ok and the rooms were newly renovated. My room (813) had a great view of broadway below.There is a dance studio across the street and enjoyed watching some great dance rehearsals for free! Only in New York!

title: “Perfect Hotel”
text:
Everything I read about this hotel before travelling was right.
Comfortable beds, clean rooms, friendly staff, close to the Subway and the Fairway supermarket.
We were on the 9th floor and had a double room with two double beds. I loved this hotel, and would definately stay here again if we ever get to return to this AMAZING city.
Hotel Beacon thank you, it was great coming back to this lovely haven in a great neighbourhood in such a BIG BIG city after very busy days and lots and lots of walking.

title: “What a surprise! A gorgeous Hotel.”
text:
. This Hotel is a beautiful and the check in process was smooth and quick they were very attentive and helpful and kind. 
 I believe the girl who checked us in her name was Erica. So friendly and seemingly genuinely so, it didn't appear it was just because it was the job. I was surprised when we went to our room because it was just so luxurious feeling. It was a beautiful, well decorated Room. It was a convenient location, close to downtown. We were able to catch the Hotel Shuttle to a local place we went too, got a cab back. I honestly considered just ordering in and not going that is how nice the Hotel is. 
Spent some time at the bar, great drinks, and I thought reasonably priced too. 
 A couple of draw backs, very small and quickly corrected except for one. The TV didn't work when we got there so we called down, within 5 minutes someone was there and he was extremely friendly also. (The TV was unplugged didn't think to check that) We didn't have a room service menu. However this was quickly corrected when we called down. Room service breakfast didn’t have the usual condiments with the breakfast (ketchup for the potatoes, hot sauce for the eggs, no preserves or Jelly for the bread, no water with breakfast) However the food was good. 
The most disappointing thing was I booked the room because of the Jacuzzi tub. It didn't work, however I didn't know it didn't work until I was in it taking a bath so I couldn't very well call for service on it. I was very disappointed though. I would make sure upon booking that it is working. Also it appeared the floors in the bathroom could have used a better cleaning, but everything else was spotless.

title: “wonderful Westin”
text: Classy, Clean and Courteous. Beautiful facilities with good-sized, well appointed rooms and contemporary furniture and fixtures. We stayed there for a company party. I only have two hiccups to mention. When we had the car valet parked, they told us it would be one price, however, the next morning when we had it retrieved, it was triple that. Secondly, our room had a door into the room next to us. The couple in the room next door talked late into the night and we could hear every word. They were sort of talking loudly, but not out of the ranged of acceptable. So, if you can, get a room with no adjoining room door.

title: “Just right.”
text: We stayed here one night to test drive the heavenly bed and not only the bed but everything about the stay was just right. Check in was cheerful, efficient and included a brief but thorough orientation, the room was tasteful and fresh, the bathroom and particularly the large shower ith double head was luxurious. And the bed....let's just say we ordered one yesterday to replace our much-hated tempurpedic. The location is very convenient to the huge medical complex and shopping mall, connected by a skyway. This was a very nice stay. Weekend rates are very reasonable.

title: “First class stay in Houston”
text: Our family stayed at the Hilton Americas in Houston this week. My wife was there for a conference, and the family got to tag along. The hotel was immaculate and the service was absolutely wonderful. We upgraded to have access to the executive lounge--although set up for business folks, it makes for a great breakfast spot with the kids. The queen beds in the double rooms are oversized--making it easy for parents to share a room with two kids. Plenty of room in the bathroom for everyone's needs. Plenty of storage space in the rooms--both hanging and drawers. Great TV and wonderful housekeeping service. The meals in the hotel are pricey, ut we knew that. There are a LOT of fine dining choices away from the hotel as well. A bonus is a wonderful "shuttle" the hotel operates to act as your own taxi anywhere in the downtown area. No need to keep hoping for good parking spaces in the hotel garage when you return from a meal. All in all a great place in Houston.

title: “Excellent Hotel”
text:
Stayed at the hotel for a SBA lenders conference. Eveyone I came in contact with at the hotel was helpful. This includes the front desk, concierge, housekeeping, and the employees who were working the conference during breakfast and lunch. The hotel has Chihuly glass pieces in the lobby and is nice touch. 
The hotel was clean and so was the room. The room had modern furnishings, a flat screen tv, desk, coffee/tea in room. The bathroom was nice and the toilletries were luxury soaps & shampoos. There was good water pressure and the temperature from hot to cold water adjusted quickly. I ordered room service one night and the food was quickly delivered. 
I did not use the gym or the pool, but did use the internet. It was $15/day and was wired. Like others have said, internet could only be used in the room. This was not a problem since if I needed internet access while outside the room, I could use my phone. i would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recomend.

title: “A Great View!”
text: I stayed here one night while in town for a conference. It is connected to the convention center, so it makes for an easy walk to your meetings. The views are amazing as they look over the Discovery Green, downtown Houston and Minute Maid Park. The service was exceptional; rooms clean and bed a dream. I did not like having to pay an additional fee to use the gym, but the rooftop pool is free and clean. I do not recommend eating in the hotel as the food and drinks are overpriced and not good. There are closer restaurants nearby. I suggest The Grove for meals and the nearby Phoenicia Specialty Foods for breakfast and lunch. This is part market, part deli, part bakery, part coffee house, part bar. Excellent food and inexpensive.

title: “Warm reception and relaxing stay”
text:
I've stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on Katy Freeway about 7 times now for business. Each time I've been welcomed and assisted by their staff with both professionalism and warmth. Here I feel that they actually appreciate my business and I'm not just name on a check in sheet. In particular one of their staff, has stood out as a person who wants to ensure your experience is a good one. The fact she remembered my name after the first visit is a plus as well!
The cookies are a bonus as well!

title: “Hilton Garden Inn Houston Energy Corridor is fantastic!”
text: My husband and I were working on our house last month and we stayed at your hotel for one night. My hat goes off to you and your staff! Very clean, beautiful lobby and wonderful room! My husband slept so good, we were both late to work! I couldn’t wake him up!!!

title: “Personal Touch”
text: I recently spent three weeks at this hotel over a 2 month period. The staff is second to none! As business travellers we all know it's not real glamorous being on the road a lot, the staff at the Hilton Garden Inn made it comfortable and inviting . Their personable and conscientous attitudes coupled with their friendliness amde my time their very enjoyable.

title: “Do you want to get a good night's sleep? go here”
text: Most of the time when you go to a hotel you can tell whether or not the manager and staff care about pleasing you. This hotel is one where the staff cares. The manager circulated during "happy hour" in the lobby, where 3 free beverages and a good choice of hot foods and chips were served after 5 pm. My room, which was a dog friendly room, was nice, clean, the temperature control worked well, and I slept like a baby. In the morning, both hot and cold foods were offered up for breakfast, all the standard fare. The only reason I gave 4 instead of a 5 rating is that I wouldn't call this hotel EXCEPTIONAL - but it is very very good.

title: “Awesome staff, food, and location”
text: My family and I set out on a mini vacation and really enjoy every bit of our stay here. The breakfast was amazing saved so much in eating here morning and night. The staff wad accommodating and friendly. The location was also a big plus and we were able to have our family pet along with us. What more can I say but Can't wait to back here!

title: “Nice Stay and Amazing Service”
text: Brought a Girl Scout group..and had a great time. The pool was clean; the fitness room was in perfect order and the meals were good. The hotel is close to the Galleria without the typical extra charging found in that area..no parking fees at all. The rooms were clean and just as requested despite multiple changes and multiple needs. The staff even called the morning before we arrived to make sure that we had it all straight! GREAT customer service!

title: “Great Stay!!!”
text: We've stayed twice with the Drury Inn near the Galleria, and both times have been great stays! When there was a problem with the noise, they went above and beyond by moving us up to a suite on a different floor at no extra charge. Great value and always great service!

title: “lovely boutique hotel, highly recommend!”
text:
The hotel is lovely and the staffs are very helpful. The hotel is well located at the heart of Manhattan. It is a great value in this area of town, close to Times Square and Grand Central. The room is well equipped and the bed is comfortable. There is no coffee maker in the room but Gregorys Coffee shop is just down the road for coffee and muffins. 
I couldn’t connect to the internet on the first night. The front desk staff came in to my room and tried to help me, she had the internet server to call me but the problem was still. I knew it was nothing they could do but at least she called me back and asked if it worked. I really appreciated that. It was actually my computer firewall problem, after I fixed it, the internet worked fine. 
The staffs friendless are wonderful, especially the one who helped me with the internet, and the doorman who hailed taxi for me all the time. Absolutely much much better than some staffs in anyother hotels I have stayed, just say hello in the way everyone would expect, or may have conversation with you, but then completely forget anything about you next time they see you. 
In The Iroquois, I am recognized and my requests are being taken care right away. Highly recommend to my colleagues and friends.

title: “Not As Good As Previous Stays”
text:
We have stayed at this hotel before but found that the level of comfort and service has gone down.
The Iroquois hotel is in an excellent location in midtown Manhattan. The staff is very accommodating. The provided continental breakfast was good.
However, the room was small and we had trouble with one of the bed lights not working, the air conditioning not cooling the room adequately and the hot water for the shower never getting more than warm. There was also a lack of available electric outlets in our room for computer power. Also we found the lighting in the lobby and the room to be inadequate.
None of the negatives mentioned above are more than minor complaints but they did add up and diminished our enjoyment of the hotel, which we have previously found to be quite good on all counts. Since the Iroquois is rated more favorably on Tripadvisor than some of its close by neighbors, which we have enjoyed, we thought that it would be wise to let fellow travelers know that there are other good choices in the neighborhood

title: “An extremely comfortable stay right in the centre of New York City”
text: I spent one night here and cannot fault the comfort and luxury of this Boutique Hotel. It is right in the hub of New York but it was quiet and haven from the action inside. The staff were extrememly helpful and I was able to have an early check in which was much needed after a trans Atlantic flight. I availed myself of one of the special's on offer and it actually was great value.

title: “Thrilled with our choice!”
text: I have not felt compelled to write a review on a hotel or restaurant ever! We went to NYC for my husbands 40th birthday and to attend the US Open. We arrived to the hotel at 11am and were immediately checked-in. Very happy I could change clothes and relax a little before heading out. We stayed in the superior room and it was perfect for us. We faced the W Cafe and could open our windows (this was a first for me) and listen to the sounds of the city. We loved coming back to our room for a little treat in the evening - a big soft pretzel with mustard one night. I asked for a couple of more pillows on our way out one morning and when I had to run back to the room an hour later there were 4 fluffy pillows waiting! We slept like babies for all of our three nights - there was no outside or interior noise AT ALL. Housekeeping was also the best I had ever seen. They really took the time to straighten and clean our room each day. The staff as a whole were very friendly and helpful! We were very sad to leave!!

title: “Outstanding weekend with the familly”
text: Had a long weekend stay with my familly. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are beautiful as well. We had access to the executive level lounge which provides a great continental breakfast in the morning and reception food at night. Erika and Jackie took great care of my wife which is not always easy to do. All the staff were frendly and inviting.The best dining was in Spencers steak house where the attention to detail and service was superior. Robert our waiter was outstanding. I would definitley reccomend this hotel for a great weekend getaway with all the sports venues with in walking distance. As well as other downtown venues and dinning.

title: “Great choice if you're attending something at the Convention Center”
text: Beautiful, striking hotel right next to the George Brown Convention Center. Other than the hotel and the convention center, not much going on in this part of Houston's downtown (although House of Blues is just 2 blocks away!), but you're right on the freeway grid and seriously, who visits Houston and doesn't have a car? Easy to drive nearly anywhere in the area. Rooms are extremely comfortable, and the ceiling in the lobby area unexpectely is adorned with genunine Dale Chihuly glass pieces--a beautiful touch as I'm a big Chihuly fan. When I need to stay in downtown Houston again I'll definitely be back--super nice!

title: “Excellent business hotel, the best staff team I have ever encountered”
text:
I have spent much of the last 3 months at the Hilton Garden Inn. It is well laid out, clean and quiet, and as a business traveller it has more than I would normally expect. But without doubt the staff shine, their close knit teamwork results in the highest levels of service to their guests.
Rooms - I have stayed in the normal rooms and the suites. Both types are spacious, clean and comfortable and have all the amenities I require. The suites are divided into two areas (sleeping & lounge) separated by the bathroom. They have two flat screen TVs, settee, armchair, coffee table, work desk, free internet (wifi & wire), table lamp, ergonomic chair (very few hotels have these and it really helps when you're working). There is also a microwave, coffee machine, fridge, iron and ironing board. The beds have a facility to change the softness levels of the mattress and a duvet. The bathrooms are spacious with a full size mirror, good water pressure, and plenty of towels. 
You can request a room exercise kit if you don't want to go to the gym, and an exercise video. A great idea (I keep promising myself that I'll get around to asking for one... one day!). The swimming pool is out the front of the hotel, it is a good size and has a jacuzzi. It overlooks the carpark, but you're not in a resort so it does very nicely for what it is. It is clean, well maintained and there are plenty of sunbeds and umbrellas.
The hotel is set back from the freeway but very little noise can be heard. Mostly guests are individual business travellers and many are regulars or here on longer stays so it's relatively quiet .
Breakfast is a buffet with a really good choice and excellent value for money. 3 or 4 types of milk (including Soya) to put on your choice of a dozen different cereals, half a dozen different fruits (always a large bowl of strawberries), a good selection of yoghurts, oatmeal, pastries, bagels (6 varieties), croissants, plus a cooked breakfast buffet with bacon, eggs, hash browns, omlettes, waffles etc. Free newspapers at breakfast. 
Room Service - good choice, good quality and good value for money. 
Lounge in Reception - nicely laid out, feels homely even though you're just off the lobby. Comfortable to sit and work if you're here on weekends. Plus there is complimentary tea/coffee available all day.
There is a small shop selling all those things that you might have forgot or, if you're on a longer stay, run out of such as hairspray, toothpaste etc. Also has wine, salads, microwave meals if you want to cook your own, cold drinks, etc.
Hotel bus - a real plus. The hotel run a free shuttle bus service to anywhere within a 5 mile radius. They take bookings for office runs in the morning when it is busiest so saves messing with hire cars and taxis. To come back to the hotel at the end of the day you either book a time in advance or just ring up when you're ready to be collected. It's like having a personal chauffeur. They will drop / collect you at restaurants, shops (Memorial Mall), wherever within the radius. 
Staff - you can stay in the best hotel in the world but if the staff are haphazard or surly then your stay is marred or even ruined. I've travelled all over the world and in an average year, spend 150-180 nights in hotels. I can honestly say that this hotel has one of the best staff teams I've ever encountered. I won't name them all because I'm bound to miss someone, but when you have Nancy or La-La starting to worry about whether you've returned to the hotel at your regular time, or when the breakfast team give you a hug, then you know that the team really do care. They all take a great pride in their work, in looking after their guests, and they really do work as a team. Hilton - take note, your other properties could learn a thing or two from this team.
Downsides - of course there are some:
- Air conditioning units can be a bit noisy and draughty. They are next to the bed, but if they were at the other end of the room it would be better.
- Makeup mirror - would be good to have a magnifying mirror, but it's not a big deal.
- Room safe - plenty of space to put one, so would be good to have.
- In-room coffee facilities are good for coffee - but not good for tea. Tea needs boiling water and it shouldn't be put through a coffee machine because it taints the taste (you can tell I'm from the UK). An in-room kettle would be great. And I'm sure if I had ever bothered to ask for one, it would have been immediately forthcoming.

title: “Business Travelers Dream”
text: If you travel for business, especially if you stay for multiple days, this hotel has really thought of everything for the business traveler. The rooms are comfortable and set up well for working. They provide both wireless and ethernet internet connections for FREE! The business center has everything you need for printing, copying, faxing, etc. Again at no charge. The "print from room" feature is the greatest! I don't have to bother people at the office to print stuff for me. The workout facilities are top notch. New equipment in good working order. Balls and weights. LOVE the pool. It's outdoors and is 5 ft deep. Heated in the winter. All the staff I've encountered at the desk, at the bar/restaurant are attentive and accomodating. Nice breakfast. Dinner fare is reasonable in price and well prepared. Nice touches....cookies at the front desk daily and apples in the workout room. Yeah it's a bit tricky to find when you come in from the Beltway and I-10, but once you figure out that you need to go to Dairy Ashford and make a u turn, it's a breeze. Otherwise very well located access to restaurants and major highways.

title: “Excellent staff!”
text: After a sudden change in plans, I found myself stranded at the hotel for close to 9 hours. When Mo saw me sitting alone in the lobby with all my luggage, he suggested I speak with Henry Strait at the front desk who was more than happy to lend a helping hand. Not only did he allow me to spend a few more hours in my hotel room, but he also gave me complimentary drink tickets so I'd have something to do while I waited for my ride. My day turned out a lot better than expected thanks to both of them.

title: “Excellent hotel and staff!”
text: I reserved this hotel based on location. I have to say, this hotel has the friendliest staff! Crystal was a awesome clerk and took care of everything from check-in to check-out! The hotel has a beautiful lobby and the meeting rooms are exquisite!

title: “AWESOME.”
text: You want a great experience stay here. Not one thing to say bad about this property. Perfect stay and they make you feel special. Staff wonderful.... Stay you won't be sorry

title: “Great Experience”
text: We just returned from a four day trip to Houston with our three grandsons. The experience was wonderful, made more so by the facilities and staff at the Drury Inn Galleria. They were always helpful with suggestions and directions. The General Manager, Jose Miranda, was especially friendly and knowledgeable about the area. We got the impression that he was our personal guide. All said, we were impressed by this entire experience. We will be back!!

title: “Clean, welcoming, warm!”
text:
I was welcomed by a big ear to ear smile! her name was Rita! What a great gal! I was a little uneasy because I have never stayed at a crowne plaza before, but she made averything special. The rooms are super clean!!! a lot of pillows!
The area is like 20ish minutes from the airport, and surrounded by a huge noise highway but I loved how many restaurants are around the area! You have to go to pappadeaux! 
Also the hotel has a free shuttle and internet (remember to tip) the shuttle driver is stanley and he is also a darling! He speaks Spanish and English which is awesome!
I was there for business, free continental breakfast! And the lady who tends the breakfast was awesome too. hreat people over all working there.

title: “A Gem of a Hotel !!”
text:
Traveling a lot, I get used to delays and disapointments. I am a Gold Priority Club Member. BUT, Staying at the Crowne Plaza in Brookhollow for the both times I stayed there was a VERY pleasant supprise. The service (Henry Strait in particular), Room, Staff, Room Service, Food and overall accomodations were the bright spot in my day. I actually looked forward to the end of my work days so I could spend time back at The Crowne ! It is in my opinion well worth the effort when staying in Houston. I will be making The Crowne my standard Hotel when staying in Houston.
Thank You All at The Crowne Plaza Brookhollow,
Doug Marinchick (Service Tech) Advanceds Poly Pkg. Inc.
Cell # 330-352-0202

title: “Kind Receptionist - Makes for a Great Welcoming”
text: Upon arriving I was greeted by the receptionist named Rita Washington. I've only stayed at the hotel once previously, however she knew me by name and was beyond friendly. I'm a strong believer that the employees make a company, and Rita made my trip enjoyable. Thanks for a great stay.

title: “Super fun hotel!”
text: This was the funnest hotel of all the hotels my friends and I stayed at! The pool is awesome, the lights are fun, and the staff was super cool. Very informative about all of the things to do in town. Galleria mall is amazing. Really cool fountain.

title: “there are bed bugs in my room and nobody cares about that”
text:
I arrived yesterday May 1st and leaving tomorrow may 3rd. This morning I try to explain to the receptionist at the front desk about the problem and she told me: "nothing that we can do, we are full".
I did not expect this problem at the hotel

title: “Great Place for Families”
text:
We were so surprised by the great service and quality of this hotel. All the little extras like the Happy hour drinks, Free popcorn and sodas from 3 to 10, free food from 5:30 to 7:30, and hot breakfast buffet in the morning made this one of the better places our family has stayed at. They served hotdogs,nacho bar, and baked potato's that evening with three free adult drinks per adult. This made it that we didn't even have to leave the hotel for dinner since it was all food our little one loved at no extra cost. The staff is excellent and friendly. They go out of their way to make you feel special and welcome. The room was very clean and very quite for being in such a busy area. 
As a mother I think The pool could have used a bit more cleaning but our daughter loved it regardless. 
Drury Inn and Suites is out new favorite hotel. Cannot wait to see what the others are like on future travels. .

title: “A great place to stay in the area.”
text: Maybe the best value for a moderate level hotel in the Galleria area. Clean, friendly, comfortable, good breakfast and evening reception - what more could you ask for?

title: “A great new hotel”
text:
This was my second stay at this property and it did not disappoint. The location is great for me with access via walkway to the Mall and several restaurants.
The rooms are clean and modernish in a Westin kind of way.
I have a pet peeve with all Westin's I hate the soap, other than that hard to find fault with the toiletries.
I did have one not so good experience; after being out for the day I cam back to find my room door adjar. When the room had been cleaned the door did not click shut, thus my possessions were unprotected for the day. Fortunately nothing was stolen but it could have been disastrous. (my computer was in the room)
There is also an unpleasant odour in the lobby, something that I have noticed on both occassions when I have been there.
Having said that the staff are great, very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very nice. Highly recommended.

title: “Hidden treasure”
text:
Great location near shopping and great places to catch a lunch, dinner or live music. 
Loved the rooms. Only down fall was the low lighting in the room and bathroom which
made putting on makeup a bit challenging. All else was great! LOVED the bed, sheets and pillows. Great lounge in the corner of room made for hanging out place with friends. 
Staff very helpful, great breakfast and many areas for relaxing after dinner, meeting for work.
Will stay there again if in the area.

title: “Excellent hotel, nice area and great food”
text: I had received a couple of certificates to stay at this hotel and wanted to use them as a getaway for my fiance and I while we looked at apartments. When I initially tried to book the hotel, I had some difficulty which was swiftly stopped and taken care of when I emailed the hotel manager. We were greeted with champagne in the room which was a nice surprise. The room itself was beautiful with hard wood floors, nice furniture and a very welcoming shower in the bathroom. The area itself is awesome with great shops, restaurants and fun things to do (dinner movies, etc). The drive isn't bad into the city on the weekends (maybe 20 or 30 minutes) but the weekday rush hours are horrendous. Overall, I really enjoyed this hotel and would stay again.

title: “Loved it!”
text: My hubby and I stayed here for 3 nights before heading to New Orleans. Two things that make the hotel wonderful - beautiful unique deco style and the amazing cocktails at the bar. The staff is very pleasant. We would definitely stay here again! The hotel is right near the metro which takes you to downtown,zoo and the museum district. If you go Check out Mia Bella trattoria they have an awesome Italian creme cake. Also the cucumber melon cocktail at the hotel restaurant is yummy! We also drove to Galveston which is an hour drive from the hotel. Def worth the drive to Galveston beach, Pleasure Pier and Strand area has beautiful shops and a nice ice cream parlor.

title: “Fine for business travel; sterile decor with little sense of place”
text:
Stayed for only one night in June 2012. 
If on business, fine and predictable. If on pleasure travel, would prefer a more unique boutique hotel.
Pluses - 
-- good workout facility with plenty of cardio and weight equipment; plus a pool (although gym is essentially in a big hallway - kind of odd, but there are windows at least)
-- large and quiet room (when I requested one away from the elevator, I got a very quiet one)
-- comfortable bed, AC worked well and not too loud
-- friendly front desk staff
Less than charming factors --
-- no views (just office buildings)
-- room seem clean but found a water bottle lid just under the bed skirt, which makes me wonder if it's well cleaned
-- could use a way to plug in iPhone near bed easily, without reaching behind dresser (so can charge it and use it as an alarm)
-- room was very large but sparsely furnished. One comfortable chair/ottoman. An open space about 10 feet x 10 feet between bed and TV.
-- no uniqueness/charm - could be anywhere. 
-- expected a bathroom with a separate toilet area (like in most Ritz Carltons), which is better for 2 people. But this is just a big bathroom with everything in one room.
-- if you get a pool side room, note that you will have little privacy unless you ask for one that isn't right by the door from the spa (and in the traffic pattern)

title: “I think I expected more”
text:
This is in no way a bad review of my March 2012 stay at the Four Season. I think I was expecting more because of a recent, awesome stay I had had at one of the other Four Seasons properties. Honestly, if it were smaller, Four Seasons Houston probably would have stacked up. The service was expectedly good (but not awesome). I loved the call I received when my room was ready (conference started at 2, I checked in at 1:30 and the reserved room wasn't available). I could have upgraded at my own cost for immediate check-in, but it wasn't necessary. This service also included bag storage and delivery to the room, which was a concern of mine with the early check-in.
This was my first time to stay at the property since I live in Houston. I've always enjoyed the ambiance in the 'public' areas. Part of our gathering included a cocktail hour by the pool and groups of us got together in the lobby lounge for drinks. It had been a number of years since I'd 'lounged' there, but it was about the same as I remembered.
Other than that, this was an average stay.

title: “Home away from home!”
text:
The Hotel Beacon really lived up to our expectations! check in was easy the room was bright and HUGE especially by NYC standards!! There were 3 adults in a 1 brm suite, loads of storage/luggage space, we didn't utilise the kitchen much but i enjoyed having the coffee maker and fridge for snacks etc. The fairway market across the street is awesome for breakfast and their pizza's are delish! The viand cafe down stairs does free delivery and the food is good :)
because the UWS is a residential area it is really quiet and you get the real feel of what it would be like to live there (I WISH!) It was really nice to retreat back to a homey place; there are lots of restaurants and shopping close. The 72nd subway is 2 blocks away and in minutes you can be anywhere in the city!

title: “Perfect location”
text:
The Beacon Hotel is in a brilliant position in the Upper West Side. Its just a few minutes walk to 72nd St tube station and Line 1 gets you to most places easily or you can change to other lines. The Hotel is spotless, staff helpful and little kitchen was ideal for making drinks, keeping food in fridge from the excellent market and food shops in the area. 
Tips for others:-
Make sure you take an adapter and you will need dual voltage on any heated appliances
Buy a seven day metro pass (24 dollars), this gives you unlimited travel for up to 7 days for more than one person. 
Carry a copy of your passport as some places ask for ID
The TKTS ticket offices for shows are not a reliable way of securing show tickets, they only open at certain times, there are only two of them and often only have matinee tickets or tickets for the same day. They are not even that cheap.
Bike hire in 72nd St East of metro you can hire a bike for up to 4 hrs for 20 dollars andride in either Central park or by the river.
Free Staten Island ferry doesn't actually take you to the island where the Statue of Liberty is. It just rides past to give you a view. Then you have to get off and get on again to come back. Its still good but if you want to actually fo onto the Island you will need to catch a paid ferry from Manhatten,
To walk across Brooklyn Bridge get off tube at City Hall.

title: “Stylish and comfortable”
text: After a dreadful experience in our previous visit to New York, this time my husband and I decided to choose an hotel regardless to the price! We choose this hotel for its location, on the 5th avenue just in front of the Public Library. We stayed in an Extra Large View room at an high floor: the room was quiet, the view was outstanding and I liked very much the stylish design of the environments. We appreciated the gym and the complimentary WI-FI. The staff was helpful and attentive, even if they can improve in some details (for instance, on Sunday the room was not yet ready at 2 p.m.). Last but not least, we had a good lunch at the restaurant of the hotel.

title: “Wonderful stay at the Andaz”
text: Recently stayed at the Andaz 5th for 7 nights and enjoyed every day of it! The hotel is in the perfect location. We walked to many locations - Central Park, Upper East/West side, Madison Square Garden, Times Square and Chelsea.. Our room was great and had a spacious bathroom. The service was excellent it was quick to check in and check out. All the staff were wonderful. We loved our stay at the Andaz, wish we could have stayed longer!

title: “Really is the best”
