text: Great location, great staff, great property. I have stayed at the peninsula hotels around the world, Alvear in Buenos Aires and other great properties and The Setai is on par with the best. The rooms are huge. The property location is perfect but the service truly stands out. Our personal assistant, Sohee, contacted me prior to arrival and arranged all transportation needs, special requests I had for celebrating my mother's 75th birthday, dinner reservations and on and on. The bar is great with great jazz in evening, great atmosphere, very laid back and great view for people watching on 5th Ave! Al Fiori is great. Hotel car and driver was always available and very nice touch. Service really does exceed what I have experienced in Asia and have never received at other luxury USA properties. Cannot say enough about The Setai.

title: “Wonderful Hotel with Great Service”
text: My husband and I just returned from an overnight stay in the city to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The Chatwal was a perfect choice. We were very pleased with the service, the accommodations and the location of this hotel. The hotel was very thoughtful and provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates in honor of our anniversary. I'm hoping to return again in October with my 5 year old son as it is also a very safe facility.

title: “Great base for a girls' weekend away”
text:
We stayed here because it was the best reviewed hotel that offered twin rooms. And how we were rewarded! Close enough to all the action without any of the noise. A five minute walk from Penn station makes connecting with the airports easy too. 
The lobby is small and funky, with really friendly staff. When we asked we were given excellent recommendations for places to eat and drink in the areas we wanted to visit. After registering with Kimpton's loyalty scheme we got free wifi that enabled us to stay in contact with home.
The room was comfortable and large, with two queen beds and floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom was stylish, with a large walk in shower and plenty of fluffy towels.
The icing on the cake was the invitation to the daily wine and cheese event.
I will definitely stay here again.

title: “Great wee hotel!”
text:
As this was our first trip to New York, we wanted to be close to the action but still have a quiet place to come back to after a day in the city. After some research, we decided to stay at the Iroquois. 
Knowing that hotel rooms are small in Manhattan, we opted to go for a Duluxe king room. As we had booked through a 3rd party, I called the hotel prior to arrival to check everything was fine, which it was!
On arrival we were greeted at the door and were welcomed by all members of staff. Although we arrived slightly early, the room was ready and we could go straight up. The room was clean and tidy and although not huge, was just fine for what we wanted. 
Vanessa ( the concierge) and Patrick at the front desk were extremely helpful and offered assistance where possible and would check on our return to the hotel of everything had gone well. 
The room was pretty quiet at night given we had a front facing room and the air con kept the room at a comfortable temperature even though it was 95-100 outside sometimes!
Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

title: “Spacious rooms, great service and location”
text:
I can only add to the positive comments about the rooms, location, and service that I won't bother repeating. Very reasonably priced. As others have said, try and get a room higher up.
The included breakfast is poor. I recommend giving it a miss if you're not on an extremely tight budget. I highly recommend treating yourself to breakfast at the National just across the street (cnr 50th and Lexington); more expensive than a diner but worth it for the food and the experience.

title: “Perfect...especially at the most wonderful time of the year”
text:
I have been staying at the San Carlos Hotel probably for nearly a decade every time I am in NYC. I make 6-8 trips a year for either business or pleasure and my stays have ranged from a week to just a few nights. I was there the week before Christmas this time along with several business associates. 
Everything about this place is first class. The rooms are spacious as well as extremely clean and comfortable. The staff is enormously friendly and accommodating, courteous and fun. During what is a very hectic time in the City, the staff continued their excellent service, and the prices were entirely reasonable. The location, in midtown East is ideal, near to metro service and within easy walking distance of lots of excellent restaurants, diners, and attractions.
In addition to the warmth of the staff, the San Carlos did a great job this year of getting us all into the holiday spirit with their tasteful and clearly upscale decorations throughout the lobby and waiting areas. Whoever was responsible deserves special kudos. I commend the managment and staff for continuing to provide always such a hospitable place in a sometimes cold city!

title: “Great Hotel and perfect staff”
text: I spent the weekend at the hotel and the service was perfect. The room was great and the staff was awesome as always. This is my favorite hotel in New York.

title: “One of The Best Hotel Experiences of My Life”
text:
If I were to run a hotel, I'd do it the way it's done by the staff of The Sherry-Netherland. I'd been told by a friend of the superior staff, rooms, service, historical ambiance, still I knew there was no such place left in the U.S. Boy, was I wrong. 
The building is comprised mainly of apartments, lending it an air of quiet elegance, not at all dreary like some historic hotels. It faces the SE corner of Central Park, convenient for shopping and hopping on local transportation. The rooms are cheerful and immaculate, tastefully appointed with modern conveniences. As a side note, the park was too icy to run in during my stay; I discovered the Sherry has one of the best fitness rooms I've ever visited at a hotel!
Prices are steep, but what isn't in the city? I can't wait to be able to come back to The Sherry!

title: “Hard to Find”
text:
It's a little hard to find because the signeage is low and hidden by tree brances as you approach the driveway. Also,the Hertz Neverlost directed me to the next street which did not have access to the hotel.
The rooms are spotless, the exercise room has new, first rate equipment, the internet works. I only had a slight problem with the movies which the front desk worked diligently at fixing.

title: “Just Alright for me”
text:
Just alright for me. 
I am a Hilton Honors member, so I always stay at Hilton properties (unless someone else is paying of course!). 
This hotel is pretty nice. We stayed here because we were attending a Texas Family Law Advanced Family Seminar, which was held here in the hotel. 
The hotel is clean. The staff is attentive and nice. The rooms are a nice size, well-lit, have great views and are modern, with LCD televisions, mini bar, business desk an chair, etc. 
My only complaints: $15 a day for wi-fi, and what you pay for only works in your room. You cannot use that same wi-fi in other parts of the hotel. That is a ridiculous price and it is ridiculous that you cannot carry it with you. Of course, this is the same at all Hilton hotels. This is something that really needs to be remedied. 
That is all.

title: “Free Upgrade”
text: Friendly staff. Aurelia the front desk clerk upgraded us to a suite and we didn't even ask her for the upgrade. The room was nice and big with a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was included with our room rate and was fairly average, but the service in the restaurant was good.

title: “Two hotels in one”
text: This is really like two different hotels in one. There is the tower part of the hotel which is very typical of any Crowne Plaza (nice), and then there are the "Courtyard Rooms", which I am reviewing. The Courtyard rooms have outside entrances and the inside faces the pool. Nice little balconies on the poolside. Our Corporate Lodging card is only good for the Courtyard rooms, but the price is VERY good. Inside the room was a little ragged around the edges but clean. Front desk was incredibly helpful and responsive. Beds and interior finishings (albeit a little worn) are just like any other Crowne Plaza. Good nights sleep, for the price I'd stay there again.

title: “Staff makes this hotel ****Excellent****”
text:
The hotel gets a very good review from me but the staff gets an "Excellent". The front desk person named Henry checked me in on Tuesday evening and I could not have asked for a more welcoming and helpful front desk representative. When you're tired and just getting off a plane, a smiling face of greeting at the hotel really makes the difference. Well done to the management of the hotel for putting the right people at the front desk. The scheduled shuttle service was on time and the driver was very friendly. Excellent service all around.
Cons:
Fresh fruit at continental breakfast for Priorty Club Members was delicious but some Granola and some protein would be nice for those of us who need to watch our waistlines as it was a carb fest.
Hotel needs to be refurbished, it looks and feels dated.

title: “Court Setting”
text: I have stayed at this Drury Inn & Suites several times and will continue to stay when I visit the Houston Area. The hotel lobby is clean and inviting and the staff are courteous and accommodating. The rooms are spacious and clean. Of course the free hot breakfast and afternoon happy hours are a plus.

title: “I'd go back here”
text: Spent 3 pleasant nights at the Drury Inn. Great location near freeway, Galleria and convenient to downtown. Worried about being so close to the highway, but never heard the traffic. Staff was helpful and friendly. Room was a bit small and dark, but fine for sleeping. Used the workout facilities every day, but never swam in the outdoor pool. Breakfast was usual fare of eggs, sausage/bacon, biscuits & gravy, waffles, and only one selection of fruit. Also partook of the free happy hour.

title: “Great place to stay near the Galleria”
text: I like to stay at Drurys everywhere. I like that they have food available for FREE for breakfast AND dinner. My stay here was pleasant. The room was clean, the wi-fi was fast, the TV had good channels and 'happy hour' is a nice perk. I will stay here again when traveling to Houston on business again.

title: “Can't go wrong with this Drury Inn”
text: This Drury Inn is conveniently located to the Galleria. Room was large and clean and had a mini-fridge and microwave. There was plenty of food at the kickback reception and the breakfast buffet was every bit as good as the one I paid $12 for at another hotel. Love that Drury has these extras but doesn't charge more than a comparable hotel. Appreciate that this location is going green and has installed refillable shower gel, shampoo and conditioner dispensers in the shower. Also like that the sink is outside of the toilet and shower/bath area. Makes getting ready easier when you are traveling with others. Only minor complaint was that the towels were small and rough.

title: “Great hotel! New! Beautiful! Great Service!”
text:
The Westin Memorial City opened in the spring 2011, a midrise hotel with garage parking at I-10 and Gessner at Memorial City, the hospital campus/retail area. I stayed on business for two nights and was upgraded to a corner suite which provided a private bedroom with windows on 2 sides, the size of most hotel rooms; a Vegas-sized 12x12 bathroom with separate shower and non-jacuzzi :( tub, and sitting area with separate TV, sofa, table, bar and bathroom. Very roomy. Check-in was very professional and friendly. 
This is a property worthy of the best reputation Westin stands for. Nicely appointed, beautifully-finished, businesslike, with a very smart and professional staff.
Dinner both nights were from the on-site restaurant, Trattoria Il Mulino. Very good entrees, and my selections were non-traditional, did not disappoint, and were reasonably-priced. 
I did not rate the hotel as an excellent 'value' since it's well over $200/night so they're not giving it away. But it's fairly priced.
Let's talk about the road noise. There are 15 lanes of Interstate, 7 lanes of eastbound access road, and 11 lanes of Gessner Rd. including an underpass echo-chamber impacting this property. That corner-suite upgrade put me on the corner that put me front and center to ALL of those lanes and the drone of road noise all day and all night was much louder than I would have liked.

title: “All around excellent property”
text:
Excellent new property, stayed there approximately 20 days this year on business. Top notch. Great addition to the Starwood family.
- squeaky clean rooms
- huge bathrooms and spa showers, luxurious materials
- great staff
- great gym
- fancy rooftop outdoor pool; while haven't had the chance to try it, provided for great scenery while stretching after my workout

title: “Great Hotel...”
text: Stayed at the Westin for a week’s business in the area. Having stayed at many hotels I would rate this particular hotel right at the top. Clean & large room with a comfy bed was one of the many plus points. Good sized gym & handy little skywalk thru to the shopping mall also made for a pleasant stay.

title: “The Best Houston has to offer!”
text: Best Hotel In houston. Great customer service from hotel staff. Managers are courteous and attentive to your needs. Price is a great value. Hotel is clean and has a very cosmopolitan feel. The flaoting staircase is awesome! I have been spoiled and it will be hard to stay anywhere else. The bar has been raised!

title: “Great hotel”
text: I stayed here on a business trip. Never heard of Hotel Sorella, but it was booked with an event while staying at the Norris Center. The room was very nice, modern, clean with (fake?) wood floor. Great bathroom with large shower. All the amenities including free wireless (in a business hotel!!). The area was very nice--a pedestrian area in Houston(!) with lots of restaurants and shopping right there. Free parking in the parking garage (park on 3rd floor and walk directly into the hotel lobby across a short walkway, which also connects to the Norris Center). The room was very quiet considering all the nearby highways and restaurants. Not expensive for a luxury hotel near shopping, or for taking the wife with me on business. Got a great rate for booking with the Norris Center event.

title: “Wonderful place to stay”
text: The hotel Sorella was beautiful with wonderful surroundings. Everything was very clean with all sorts of accommodations. The staff was very friendly and the front desk was very helpful with any questions we had for them and had some great suggestions on places where we might go to have fun. The views were spectacular and the citycenter itself was great, you could just go out and have fun as they have all sorts of restaurants and sort of a central area where people gathered to relax and the kids could play. I think it's a great place to stay whether your on business or for a quick getaway with someone special, or even for a family on vacation. I would recommend this place and would stay again on a visit to the Houston area.

title: “Best place in town...”
text:
I travel to Houston quite often and ever since reading about Sorella in Conde Nast I decided to try it out. The location is convenient and great, with lots to do, but more importantly it feels like a retreat whenever I'm there. The staff is fantastic, rooms are beyond luxurious and comfortable. Makes you not want to go to work on your business trip. 
Highly recommended. Great restaurant too!

title: “Amazing Stay”
text: We loved every minute of our stay at Hotel Sorella. From the amazing room view, to taking the kids to the Studio Movie Grill. Once we parked our car we didn't leave City Centre area. There are plenty of things to do within walking distance. The restaurant at Hotel Sorella, Bistro Alex, is amazing, I recommend the Chicken and Waffles or the steak for Brunch! Great place to to have a romantic weekend or a girls weekend, as well. When in Houston we stay at Hotel Sorella!

title: “Great place!”
text: Returned yesterday from an overnight stay at the Hotel Icon. My husband and I live about an hour and a half away and try to stay in Houston about once every 3 months or so. We have stayed at the Icon before when it was undergoing renovations and loved it. Now that Marriott has taken it over we decided to try it again as the rate was very reasonable and came with breakfast and valet parking. We were not disappointed. From the staff at the front desk to the young man that brought us ice the service was excellent. Great room, great breakfast. We will be staying here again.

title: “Wonderful stay!”
text: My husband and I just needed a night to get away. We received the Anniversary special of $100 a night. We've stayed here before and loved it. We love the boutique feel and the room is wonderful. It was a Deluxe King with a jacuzzi tub. We haven't been disappointed. The staff was very attentive to our needs. However, there is not a refridgerator in the room, if you call down to the lobby, they will bring you ice. We also ate at the restaurant that night and it was very nice. Our waiter seemed to be not as attentive to us. However, the manager and other staff members seemed to wait on us more. The atmosphere was nice and the food was quite fancy and pricey. Would we eat there again? Probably not, but it was a good experience. We were charged for opening the mini bar $21..so don't think it's a fridge, like me..you'll get charged. The staff took off the charges without a problem. :) Overall, it was good hotel stay!

title: “Great Place to Stay!”
text:
I have stayed at the Hotel Icon in Houston many times. The changes I have noticed since it became a Marriott property are few; It still remains my favorite place in Downtown Houston. Overnight valet parking is steep, but I have found it that way at almost all downtown hotels.
The interior design and furnishings in the lounge and lobby are beautiful. The guest rooms and bathrooms are very well appointed - they make you feel as if you've stepped back in time! 
All employees are very professional and helpful.
I would highly recommend the Hotel Icon for anyone looking for a spectacular get-away!
Very close to several downtown attractions.

title: “Anniversary Get Away”
text: My husband and I chose Four Seasons for a night away from our children for our anniversary. I was very pleased with the friendliness and professionalism of the staff. Our room was very nice, and the bed was very comfortable. We even recieved a plate of assorted chocolates as an "anniversary gift". The only things that concerned me with our short stay is that we checked in at about 7 or 8 o'clock and night and checked out around 10 the next morning and we recieved two $15 dollar charges for the valet as the price is $15 dollars per day. We used the valet a total of 2 times so this didn't really seem very reasonable to me but I understand the policy. Also when we left I called for valey 15 minutes before hand. After about half an hour of waiting I ask the valet manager what the hold up was. Turns out they brought the wrong car down.... Wasn't happy about that but overall we had a good night there. I would recommend to a friend.

title: “Perfectly acceptable experience for a business trip at a reduced room rate.”
text: Four Seasons is not a brand I would normally stay in for work or vacation due to cost. This is in no way a reflection on the hotel just my price range. I would not be able to recommend Houston Four Seasons unless there was a reasonably good deal on price. I did not feel there were enough unique selling points to justify it. Also the Quattro restaurant was not great. Breakfast and lunch food and staff were very good but dinner (which is kind of its Raison d'être) was very poor and I returned my food. I am not someone also who requires large amounts of food but the portions were small and my colleague and I had to go and eat at House of Blues (even though she did finish her Quattro food she had another course out). I consequently read reviews on Yelp and others seemed to have had similar experiences. I also felt there was a disconnect between the front of house and kitchen which was also highlighted by others' reviews. Overall this comes back to the coordination and training of staff.

title: “Above and beyond”
text:
My family recently stayed at the Four Seasons in Houston while I was there for a work conference.  I was very hesitant to book at the Four Seasons because we have two small children (ages 3 and 6 months) and I wasn't sure how kid friendly it would be.  I decided to go for it because of how close it was to the convention center and I could not have been more happy with our choice. 
The Four Seasons went above and beyond to make each of us feel welcomed. When we arrived, there was a roll away already turned down for our 3 year old and a beautiful crib waiting for the baby.  Not to mention the plate of oversized chocolate chip cookies, juice, kids cup, baby food jars and what else...a silver spoon they had waiting in the room.  All that on top of being greeted by a wagon filled with beautiful stuffed animals they each got to take their pick from. 
I guess to say the Four Seasons went above and beyond would be an understatement. They were so kind, warm and welcoming every time we left or arrived.  The room was superb, hotel was gorgeous, and staff was always ready to help.  We really could not have asked for more.

title: “Nickel and Dime You for Everything”
text: I am completing a second week of staying at this hotel and in both weeks I am getting nickeled and dimed to death by the staff. Good example is that this morning I stop for a cup of complementary coffee in the lobby (they have it set up in the bar area). They have dixie type cups so I asked for the larger paper cup and they gve it to me w- along with a bill for 3.00 for the 8 oz paper cup. No kidding. I went back to my breakfast bill from the morning and I see that I was charged not just for a cup of coffee with my breakfast but also another 3.00 for a paper go cup to take with me. This is just one example. I would not recomend this hotel because its hard to relax when you have to watchdog the staff for such sillyness when you are paying a pretty penny for a 5 star hotel. You have many other options in Houston that you dont have to keep the same vigilance.

title: “A really nice place to stay”
text:
We recently completed a 21-day tour across the USA, concluding with three nights here. As it was a package, I was apprehensive that with NY being expensive, our tour company may have settled for budget accomodation, but no, the Hotel Beacon was great. Friendly staff, top class rooms, we were on the 22nd floor with marvelous views, and everything in the room was of a high standard. No food, but the excellent Viand cafe/diner is next door, and they do room service for the hotel.
The subway is three blocks south on 72nd Street, whilst three blocks east brings you to Central Park. The Fairway supermarket is right across the road and have all you need for a mid day lunch.

title: “New York”
text: Check in a breeze,Great staff very helpful.Rooms very nice,and great view from our room.Cleaning staff extra helpful.Washing machines and dryers on 7th floor was a bonus.Market across road great,has everything you need.Walking distance to central park.Subway within walking distance.Great restaurants and lots of variety and great cocktails. bathroom a bit small.Will stay here again in 2014.

title: “Fantastic location and amenities.”
text: This hotel was one of my favourites. Ithas everything you could possibly need, especially if you are there for a few days. It had a kitchen, with microwave, stove top and fridge, etc. the market directly across the road is great. There is also a laundry within the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, and I can't complain about anything.

title: “Fantastic!!”
text:
I stayed here on my first holiday to NYC for 6 nights in September 2012. This hotel is in a great location, being right out front of a subway stop (which makes it very easy to get to the 9/11 memorial, times square, empire state building, statue of liberty etc.), but also being within walking distance of some great places. We walked to times square on our first day there and it would have only took 20 minutes, however we saw and did so much on the way! And only about a 2 minute walk from central park, which was great!
The supermarket opposite (Fairway) is amazing, has everything you can think of and came very much in handy! There is also a great restaurant just next door!
The room sizes were great. My boyfriend and I stayed in a one bedroom king suite and found that we had more than enough room for the both of us. The bathroom may have been small but it is New York and this didn't bother us at all.
I am glad that we didn't stay right in the heart of times square as it was always very noisy and it was nice to be able to escape to our hotel.
Will be recommending this one!

title: “Pleasant city get-away!”
text:
Bedroom was ultra-modern and a gadget geek's dream. The beds and sheets were super-comfortable. 
Service was helpful. Check-in was smooth and staff replenished the mini-bar daily.
Foot bath didn't work but the rain shower more than made up for it. 
Overall a pleasant experience. Would definitely recommend.

title: “Great stay and great service”
text:
We made the trip to New York last weekend to see a few days of tennis at the US Open in Queens. The Andaz on 5th was a perfect location for us. Easy access to pretty much every Manhattan subway line, and a 7-line station right in Bryant Park across the street to get out to Flushing Meadows for tennis each day. The walk to Times Square is just a couple of blocks, and the main library building is right across the street - which was great, as there is an excellent "Lunches of New York" exhibit showing right now! grand Central station is a block away as well, and the shopping on 5th is quite good.
The hotel was excellent. The room was quiet (in spite of being right across from the elevator), the room was huge for NYC, the bed was comfy, the tech was flawless, and the bathroom/shower were excellent. We ate breakfast at the restaurant two mornings, and while expensive, it was very tasty. The best part of all, though was the service. In particular, Kelly and Joe were always incredibly welcoming, helpful, and seemed genuinely interested in what we were doing and what we needed.

title: “Loved the Andez!”
text: My friend and I stayed here overnight on a girl's weekend in New York and were very impressed! The service could not have been any better and our room was beautiful.... we were looking down on the steps of the New York Public Library! We were able to walk everywhere we need to from this location...perfect for our little trip. We will definitely return!

title: “Comfortable and well situated”
text: Stayed at this property in Feb of this year for 4 nights and enjoyed a comfortable stay. Very well situated. Modern boutique hotel that hits the right notes with its clients. Enjoyed their bar each evening. Staff were always friendly and I appreciated the super quick check in, check out and small parting gift of lip balm. Room was a little on the small side but was well and comfortably appointed.

title: “Hip”
text: This place is very hip, cool, clean and efficient. We stayed there last week for most of week one of the US Open. The hotel is extremely convenient to the 7 train which runs you out to Flushing Meadows in about 25 minutes. Note...we did run into at least one of the big tennis stars on site and heard more were staying there. Overall our stay was great. The hotel is very hip in style and the check in and check out were very efficient. Our room was the "loft" room and was very clean and comfortable. Surprisingly quiet for 3rd floor facing street. The "living area" was very small but worked well for our suitcases and used the desk as a place to put stuff. The sleeping area was nice being separated and both areas had a flat TV on the wall with good HD for many channels. The bathrooms have many mixed reviews on this site and probably deservedly. On the one hand, they are very stylish, modern and well appointed. The shower is very cool and large. On the other hand, the "open" concept does not provide for much privacy and the lighting was not good for my wife putting on makeup. Overall the lighting is very low and more moody than functional. We read on iPad's so wasn't a problem but for the over 50 crowd (us) the low light is a challenge at times. Would also suggest a small coffee maker in the room although the free coffee in the lobby was fine. Service was also very friendly when needed with an attentive young and cheerful staff. We had one tapas meal down at the Bar Downstairs and it was very cool with good food and wine and a nice atmosphere. Overall it was a good stay and we might stay again next year for the Open.

title: “Average, more four star than five !”
text: We stayed at the Setai for three nights in May, booked through five star alliance! Despite having spent a fair amount of time researching the best hotels in New York I feel I made the wrong choice with the Setai. We found the Bar on the ground floor lacked atmosphere and felt a bit like an airport lounge. Our room was modern and clean but predictable and forgetable. Staff were pleasant enough but the restaurant for breakfast was lacking again in atmosphere and the food was again average. Overall a four star experience, we did get a good deal and perhaps it proved the point that you get what you pay for !

title: “Service & style”
text: Wow - service that even gives Asia a run for it's money. The staff here really put NY service on the map. From check-in to check-out I could not have been looked after better. As my first visit, I could guess they were out to impress - and they did with a room upgrade and a late (4pm) checkout. My unscientific test of a hotel restaurant is how it does eggs benedict for breakfast - and this hotel delivers the goods A+. Even the bar staff are friendly, engaging and happy to serve you. The room was epic - large, with a huge bathroom and the bed was so comfortable I always woke up with the other side completely undisturbed. Good, large gym with modern equipment. Perfect location on 5th Ave and an awesome steakhouse round the corner (Keens).

title: “Thé best hotel un NYC”
text:
We spend 10 nights in the setai, it was absolutly wonderfull, great room, great restaurant, free maseratti with driver, free mini bar, on 5th at 10 sec from thé empire stage building and 5 minutes from Times square.
A jazz concert every night at thé bar hôtel,
A real 5 stars hôtel !

title: “One of the best hotels”
text:
This was definitely one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. To summarise the best points...
-gorgeous room - incredibly spacious (even more impressive considering it's in the city centre) with amazing attention to detail including huge two person bath, tv in the bathroom, twin sinks, lots of storage space - just great. Nespresso machine in the room, which was a very welcome touch.
-brilliant service from the doormen to the personal assistants (who we used to get us tickets, dinner reservations, directions etc) and the cleaners....they folded clothes, organised shoes, even put make up away, separating skin make up from lipstick from eye make up! There were free soft drinks in the mini bar. Turn down service was lovely - low lighting and jazz music left playing, and always a little treat left on the bed, from cookies to popcorn to tiny meringue tarts.
-great gym with lots of varied machines
-excellent location
-really nice bar (if, not surprisingly, expensive). They do a mean negroni!
Only slight negative...
-breakfast. It wasn't included in our rate, and we only had it once. One of us had granola and the other a smoked salmon bagel. It was tasty, but HUGELY overpriced. There were much better places to get breakfast for a fraction of the price within 2 minutes walk from the hotel.

title: “Excellent location”
text: This hotel is in an excellent location: a short walk from the Empire State Building and easy distance from the Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Terminal, and the Chrysler Building. I was not there for shops but it is also within easy reach of many of the well-known shops. I did not experience the same attention to detail as other reviewers though; for instance, there were at least a couple of days when I did not get the NY Times and despite three calls to the front desk staff could not remove a flashing light from the 'phone in my room. However, I would still recommend this hotel whole-heartedly. I was concerned when I saw building work from my window but I heard nothing: rooms were spacious and surprisingly quiet given the location.

title: “Superb Experience”
text: Two days at the Chatwal were filled with superior service and attention to every detail. Our room was immaculately prepared. The Art Deco design of the hotel was striking yet elegant. The bathrooms and room control in the phone system are technology wonders. So close to Times Square yet in another world of peace. Perhaps most important is the style of all the employees we met. Just the right mixture of formal professionalism and warm hospitality.

title: “Despite a total power failure on the hottest day of the year, The Chatwal delivers!”
text: The Chatwal is a beautiful hotel located in Times Square, but slightly off the beaten path so even though you are a few minutes walk from all of the hustle and bustle of the theatre district, you are far enough away to escape. The staff was superb. From the doorman, bellmen, reception, butler (yes, you have a butler!) bartenders, you name it, all of them catered to our every need. The rooms were fabulous and so comfortable. We were in a king suite that had every conceivable luxury you could think of. We especially loved the integrated mirror tv in the bathroom. The beds were supremely comfortable and the room was so dark and quiet that we ended up sleeping until well past 9 every morning! Our only one complaint about the room would be that since the tub/shower is a walk-in, the door did not fully seal and every time we took a shower water would literally flood out of the back onto the floor. We just placed a bunch of towels down and tried not to walk around in socks! The second story bar closed by midnight on the weekdays so get there early if you want to try it out. We went up 2 times and were turned away each night. We did however have the absolute BEST manhattan I've ever had at the lobby bar. We had the unfortunate luck of being there during one of the hottest days of the year (over 100 degrees) when the hotel lost power. We had been walking all day and were trying to get ready for dinner at Daniel so it was a huge bummer since the shower was cold but the room was steamy, we did have emergency lighting (at the time) but no electricity so I had to just take a cold shower, pull my hair back, throw on my dress and try to get out of the room ASAP. It was also raining like crazy! The staff was keeping their composure under ALOT of pressure. Kudos to the doorman who tried his darnedest to grab us a cab. Unfortunately we ended up having to settle for an $80 rickshaw ride. TIP: If you decide to take a rickshaw, make SURE you negotiate and agree on a price before getting in. We thought we had calculated the cost of the ride based on his posted rates, only to find out that in SUPER small print were the terms "rate is per person". Dinner at Daniel was fabulous but when we returned to the hotel, ALL of the power was out, including the emergency lighting. We hurried up and got changed and hit the bar right next to the hotel that seemed to have escaped the power outage somehow. After spending about 3 hours there, the power finally came back and we were back in business! The rest of our stay was perfect, and the hotel even offered us a free night for the next time we come back, and we will definitely be back!

title: “That's why we stay again and again and again!!!”
text: We have stayed 3 times this year at The Chatwal! It is an unique experience. The location is excellet, the rooms are out of this world; everything is extremely clean and in order. The service: The Best! Nick Mullins is The Best Concierge in The Whole World!!! For sure The Best place to stay!! The Castros- PR!

title: “Good value if you can get a good price.”
text: Liked location, good staff. Fitness area small but clean. Rooms up high are nice, clean modern, and some with decent views. Room service also very good. Would go back if could get good price. Much better value than other hotels in the area.

title: “A quaint little treasure in the heart of the city!”
text:
I stay at the Eventi about 6 times a year on business travel. Each visit is for about a week at a time. It's conveniently located in mid-town near the fashion district - just a short walk to and from most of my appointments which is great. 
At night it's nowhere near as noisy as the hotels in the Times Square area which is also great!
I love staying at the Eventi because it's cozy and doesn't have the corporate feel that some of the other 'business' hotels have. It's small and quaint and has become somewhat of a home away from home. The staff is friendly and helpful with great recommendations of local spots - my favorite has been Tre Dici for dinner, just a couple blocks away! 
The rooms are smallish but still comfortable with nice furnishings. The bathrooms are actually quite sizable in comparison.
My only complaint about the Eventi is that I've had a couple of disappointing experiences at their Spa. I would not book anything there again but that's ok with so many other great Spa's in NYC to choose from!

title: “Premier One Bedroom Suite”
text:
Received an email with upgrade options a week before arrival and went for the Premier One Bedroom Suite for a good price. My wife and I were in New York to celebrate our ten year wedding anniversary, something we mentioned in the booking form. Had almost forgotten about having written this when we arrived, but when we entered our suite a hand written letter from the management, a bottle of champagne and delicious chocolate was waiting for us! Thank you very much :-)
The 500 square feet suite on the 22nd floor was unbelievable. Lots of space (have been in hotel rooms the size of the bathroom...), a great bed, a nice living room and a splendid skyline-view. The room was quiet, and I liked the possibility to open the window.
Great staff and housekeeping did a wonderful job!
Also, the hotel is near several underground stations, a few blocks away from Macy's and a relatively short walk away from Times square.

title: “Great value for a boutique on 44th Street”
text:
Loved the Iroquois from it's very NYC decor to it's location and it's wonderful staff. A seven minute walk to Times Square on one side and 5th Avenue on the other, Iroquois could not be better located.
I also loved that it's reasonably priced but maintains a luxury hotel vibe with sparkling clean sheets, bathrooms that are contemporarily designed and a funky but historic elevator.
My only grouse was that the room was a little cramped for the two twin beds that my friend and I had picked but I guess that's NYC for you.
Breakfast was a little expensive so we ended up eating at the Diner next door.
Finally the highlight of my trip was the concierge - Vanessa and Alan who both took a lot of trouble to find out our likes and dislikes and recommend custom made "local" itineraries...all in all a hidden gem that I'm recommending to my friends in the US!

title: “Happily consistent”
text:
I stayed at the Iroquois exactly a year ago (coincidentally) and at the the time was thrilled to have found such a great place with (for New York) reasonable rates. I am happy to report that the love affair continues.
I was greeted upon arrival with a "welcome back" upon giving my name, by the charming and very efficient male receptionist upon check-in. The room I was given (901) felt smaller than the room my partner and I were given the year before but nonetheless it was comfortable as we remembered with all the amenities (complimentary water and chocolates) upon arrival. The wi-fi which is also included in the room rate has good and strong signal and as I was in New York on business, was greatly appreciated. 
The New York Times is delivered to the room every day except for Sunday (understandably as it huge and heavy) which is how I discovered the joys of the library in the hotel where one can read it while enjoying a coffee from the complimentary coffee dispenser in the lobby. The library also has two computers for guests to use. 
I must say that it's very nice to be greeted warmly by hotel staff whenever they are encountered in the hotel lobby and when one leaves or returns.
The only thing we had forgotten from our previous visit and that can be constituted as a minor criticism was that there are no ice machines on the floors and that you have to call reception to have it delivered which it is usually done very promptly, but not always. There also was no fridge but there was a mini-bar on a sensor tray on top of chest of drawers which looked ridiculous and incongruous. We did find a card that said a fridge was available if required. My partner and I laughed as we reviewed the room, as we wondered where they possibly could put a fridge in a room that was already choc-a-bloc. It would have been a lot better to get rid of the annoying sensor tray altogether with it's vastly over-priced never used contents as I or my partner were always inadvertently knocking the mini-bottles of booze down on it panicking us that we might trigger charges for stuff we didn't have.
Our room was quiet as it didn't face the street.The beds were superbly comfortable, the bathroom spotless,the water pressure and temp control perfect, though the drains in both the shower and the wash-basin took a long time to clear. 
All in all another great stay and we shall definitely return.

title: “Convenience and class”
text: San Carlos is a find. Located in a quiet neighborhood convenient to Grand Central and subway. Wonderful diner across the street. The staff is well trained and strives to please. Our suite was roomy and comfortable. Only complaint, the free breakfast pastry dry and would like fresh fruit.

title: “Great family room set up!”
text: We stayed in one of the suite rooms with 2 Queen beds and a Queen sofa bed in a separate room (4 people - 2 adults and 2 teens). We were surprised by the size of the bedroom and the additional room with the sofa bed. Everything was really nice - the bathrooms, the beds, and the kitchenette. There were nice bathroom fixtures and also a good size countertop space in the bathroom for us to share. We asked for a quiet room and got one - you would have never known you were in New York from the lack of street sounds - our room was completely quiet. We were impressed with the staff - when we asked for extra blankets and towels, they were immediately brought to our room. The staff was also helpful with restaurant suggestions. All in all, we could not have asked for more. This is a great hotel in a great spot in the city - blocks from Rockefeller Center and many other attractions and activities. We loved it and will definitely go back!

title: “Excellent!”
text: My family absolutely enjoyed our stay at San Carlos. Cleanliness was supreme and the one bedroom suite was spacious. The mini kitchenette was fabulous especially traveling with an infant and a child who has food allergies. We will be staying there again next year for our December trip.

title: “great price, great location”
text: My new favorite hotel in New York. Will definitely stay there again. Hotels in New York are outrageously priced during the Christmas season. The San Carlos was a bargain. It is older, but nicely furnished. Similiar to a Marriott. Free breakfast in the morning(fresh pastries and bagels, yogurt), refrigerator in room, free wifi, business center and Aveda products in the bathroom. Beds were nice and comfortable and the room was much larger than ones at the W on Lexington. Nice diner across the street for quick meals; breakfast and afternoon snacks. Right near the Waldorf for drinks and easy subway access. Bellman made limo reservations for us to take us to and from the airport; otherwise 2 cabs were needed. Arranged a car service for us at night. Suites were $100 per night higher and had a full living room and kitchenette. Plenty of places nearby to get a drink. Staff was friendly and helpful. Have stayed at the Omni Berkshire and the Kimberly in the past which have more ambience but cost a lot more. Will stay here in the future for the price. Another reviewer complained about the poor lighting, plumbing rattle, view of wall and inadequate breakfast. Yes the backside faces a wall about 25 feet away but you don't hear the horns blasting away in the morning on 50th. If he paid more, he could have had a room that faced the street. The bathroom is small but adequate and no plumbing rattle. Breakfast is better than Hampton Inn or Courtyard, and it is free in NYC. My lighting was fine, not inadequate. If you want luxury, stay across the street at the Benjamin or the New York Palace. This is a nice hotel, just not a fabulous hotel.

title: “Luxurious accommodations, personal service and superb location at the Sherry-Netherland!”
text:
My daughter and I spent last weekend at The Sherry-Netherland, and were immediately impressed with the warm welcome at the front desk and the handwritten welcome note in our room. The staff made us feel at home, from the elevator operators who knew our floor, to the doormen who always greeted us so graciously. Our suite was lovely, appointed with beautiful furnishings in soft colors, and the bedding was so comfortable, it was like sleeping on a cloud! The location of the hotel could not be better, right on Fifth Ave at
59th St, overlooking the main entrance to Central Park. The highly acclaimed restaurant, Harry Cipriani, is there to be enjoyed by hotel guests as well as New Yorkers in the know.
We think The Sherry-Netherland is a true gem, and give it the highest marks for luxury,
service and location in New York City!!!!

title: “Amazing hidden Jewel”
text:
Great stay. The location, right next to the Apple Store — not far from the bustling stores that line 5th Ave, but not in the noise and commotion either. The hotel has a beautiful view of the trees and water bodies of Central Park.
Service was really personalized. It's a small hotel: a small but dedicated staff. The housingkeeping lady would talk to us every day if we were in. The guys at the reception would greet us every time we walked in.
The hotel lobby is small (really tiny), but tastefully decorated. This is not the kind of hotel that looks like The Plaza the moment you walk in, but it has its own charm — sometimes charm is in simplicity.
My only complaint is the breakfast: a tad bit too expensive. But with amazing breakfast places nearby, we had no reason to complain! (we tried out different breakfast places daily — it's a great way to dine at places you wouldn't normally visit).
The Sherry will remain our first choice in Manhattan — above the Waldorf, Plaza, Palace and Pierre.

title: “Awesome location”
text:
The location of this hotel is simply amazing. 12 steps from central Parks, two blocks from all luxury shops, next door to huge Apple store and that huge toy shop. It is not far from Madison Avenue for business, yet you can do quick shopping for family at home.
The room itself is quite sufficient in terms of space and comfort (For NYC standard) The breakfast was great, in fact I am confident in saying that their Bagel salmon creme cheese combo is one of the best in Manhattan area ( fist fight almost broke out in the office when I said this :-)) The lobby is not big, but I prefer property that pays more attention to size of rooms than size of lobby anyway. The room that we got did not have a very good view, but it did not bother me at all, since the whole experience was quite positive. We have stayed twice here, and we will certainly come back.

title: “Great Hotel, Loved It!”
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel for a week whilst visiting relatives who live in Houston, I booked online via the website,
We arrived fairly late in the evening, and very tired after a day’s travelling from the UK. We had a suite and my mother-in-law had a room, on the same floor. Our room was lovely. Extremely clean and comfortable with a separate sitting area with a closeable door between the bedroom and sitting room. Big bathroom with separate shower and bath. We appreciated the coffee/tea making facilities and the microwave and fridge. The sitting room also had a flat screen tv and a desk plus sofa and chair.
The bed was exceptionally comfortable with high quality linens and, despite the jetlag, slept really well, there is no noise at all from the road outside and we heard no noise from other guests, it was very quiet. I agree the ac units can be noisy, but they didn't bother us.
We really enjoyed the breakfast, well-presented, fresh pastries, fruit, yoghurts, cereals, waffles, pancakes and eggs cooked to order. Service was friendly and efficient.
I always like to take my own teabags on holiday and every morning I took them wrapped in some tissue to have during breakfast. One morning I realised that I had left them on the table from the breakfast the day before, and thought that my package of teabags would have been collected up when the table was cleaned and probably thrown away! However, when the waitress saw us she proceeded to give us back my teabags that she’d found on the table and had saved for us! I was so grateful, especially as I’d run out!
We had a really nice meal in an Italian restaurant just along from the hotel (I forget the name, but it is mentioned in the hotel’s room guide). We found the hotel very conveniently located for the freeways and shopping malls etc.
I used the pool area several times during our stay and found the whole area to be very clean and well maintained with plenty of pool towels and sunbeds available.
There are 2 items that we wish were in the rooms – a bathroom vanity mirror (my husband found it difficult to shave just using the main big mirror, and a room safe (we used the safety deposit boxes at reception, but would prefer an in-room safe). 
Overall, we really loved this hotel, enjoyed our stay in Houston and wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again, should we be visiting the city in the future.

title: “Just an average hotel”
text: We stayed here because this hotel was the 5th best hotel in the city. All I would say is if this is truly the 5th best, I wouldn't want to stay at any worse hotel than this one. Honestly, for the price, it was fine. We got this hotel for real cheap on a Saturday night. The staff was very nice and the hotel was fine. Nothing spectacular about it to earn a Top 5 rating. I always rely on tripadvisor to tell me where I can stay in the nicest hotel for the best buck. This time I was let down. The rooms were average, the amenities were common and the location was fine. Nothing too nice to comment about. If you want to save some money...yeah, stay here. But don't expect any bells or whistles.

title: “Nasty Pool....”
text: Nice place.staff friendly but pool is nasty,has a debris and some animals inside.i wait for 4 hrs somebody to clean, but just i saw some maintenance guy check the water and walk around the pool and left.(happend day of the week.Friday) Guyyyyyy is SUMERRRR and kids like Pool.pay attention. Thank you angelica for you help.Nice Lady in front desk.

title: “Even with a GPS you can get lost trying to find this hotel”
text:
Warning you can easily miss the turn off for this hotel due to poor signage. All the overpasses in the area can easily interfere with your GPS signal.
When coming off the highway via Dairy Ashford, onto the Old Katy Freeway, we would recommend you look for the Holiday Inn Express sign as the Hilton Garden Inn sign sits low to the ground, is unlit and blocked by trees. You will be turning into this hotel as soon as you pass the Holiday Inn Express sign and a steak house. If you go past the Hummer sign and drive by a car dealership you have missed the entrance to this hotel.
Overall this hotel is very good. It is clean, quiet and safe. The beds are comfortable, but on the firmer side. As others have mentioned in their reviews, the air conditioning units are noisy especially if you are a lighter sleeper.
The breakfast buffet for $9.99 is tasty; they serve the same items daily. This may get kind of boring if you are staying here for a week or more. Other Hilton properties we have stayed at offer similar breakfast items, but vary their menu items daily. Like ham slices one day, bacon the next, sweet potato waffles one day, blueberry the next, scrambled eggs one day, then eggs benedict the next, etc., etc. 
Front desk service was excellent, very helpful. If you require anything for your room it is best to contact the front desk directly, as most of the maids do not understand English very well. This includes trying to tell them something in person or writing a note. It certainly would be nice if the maids could make the effort to get notes translated and/or get someone who understands English better, if they don't understand what you are asking them for.
The cleanliness inside the hotel is very good, but the swimming pool was a bit of a disappointment in the cleanliness department in comparison to the rest of the hotel as it had dirt, debris and dead insects floating in it. We mentioned it to the front desk staff two days in a row and finally it was cleaned.
In our room we could see that one pillow had some small blood stains on it. Not on the pillow case on the pillow directly. We put the pillow in the closet and forgot to mention it, because there was plenty of other pillows on the bed. 
With minor improvements this hotel could be awesome.

title: “Great place to stay for families!”
text:
We have stayed here several times and I love it every time! We usually stay here when we come to town to watch the Astros play at Minute Maid Park. The hotel overlooks Discovery Green and is a short walk to the ball park. My kids love the pool on the 23rd floor. It is beautiful to swim and look over the city, especially at night. The sitting area outside of the pool is great as well with comfortable chairs and sofas. 
We loved having access to the Concierge Lounge. Great evening snacks and a really nice breakfast in the morning. My only complaint would be that the evening concierge staff obviously did not appreciate children in there. Every single guest was greeted warmly except for us when we walked in with our kids. The next day there was a sign outside saying that children would only be permitted with adults, so I am assuming there was some sort of incident. After seeing that, I was more understanding of the staff's apprehension, but when you have two well-behaved children who use their manners it was a bit off-putting to be given the cold shoulder. On the other hand, the breakfast staff was wonderful, greeted us warmly and visited with both of my children.
Overall, it was a great experience. The hotel is clean and the lobby is beautiful! Our room was perfect and housekeeping was very prompt when we asked for an extra blanket. We love this hotel and will definitely be back again.

title: “Beautiful hotel, very nice rooms, 25 meter pool for swimmers”
text: I travel a lot for work so finding a place where I can train for the swimming portion of a triathlon is not easy. And finding a 25 meter pool is even more difficult. The Hilton Americas has a great workout room where you can watch the sun rise from the elliptical trainer and for all of you who are swimmers you know how hard it is to find a 25 meter pool for training swims. On top of that the Hilton is a beautiful hotel with an awesome lobby and bar as well as a van service that can get you to your office in the morning.

title: “Mid-week Bliss to Weekend Clamor”
text: My wife and I stayed here Tuesday through Sunday, 6 nights. First, the good: very nice clean rooms, big bathrooms, large flat screen tv, and coffeemaker. Very nice pool , hot tub , outdoor terrace, workout center and spa on 23rd floor. There are 2 resturants, a bar and a coffee shop on site. Now the bad. The hotel hosts many conventions over the weekend. The convention goers sometime forget that there are other guest. Saturday evening, the room across from ours decided to host a party that went from 9PM to after midnight. We needed to get up early Sunday morning and did so with little sleep. Unfortunately Sunday night the party started again at 9PM. I went to the front desk to explain the situation. The front desk person contacted security since the hotel has a no room party policy. The front desk also suggested moving to another room, which was not appealing since we had been there 5 days. The front desk person went with me back to my room to check out the noise. When we got off the elevator you could hear the noise and as we neared my room the front desk person said " You need to change rooms!" So at 10PM on a Sunday night, we moved to a different room. The night manager took care of Sunday nights room charge. The bottom line here is they make alot of money off conventions so they won't inconvience them, just the family guy in a single room.

title: “Comfortable, quiet room in NW Houston”
text: Was there for conference. Outside of hotel fools you as the inside is very nice. Wonderful staff, well appointed room that is very quiet despite being right next to freeway. Bathroom was clean but needed updating. Workout room is small but met my needs. Good accommodation for the price.

title: “Great Customer Service”
text: I seem to always check in on a Tuesday night and the front desk people are awesome. Twice now they given me a room with a balcony on a high floor facing the highway which is just what I like. They are so friendly and super helpful. Great job.

title: “Great Stay”
text: I attended a convention a business conference at this hotel! The beds were really comfortable and luxorious. You even get a choice of feather or foam pillows! I brought the whole family and they certainly enjoyed themselves while I sat in class all day.The pool area is beautiful and overlooks the downtown area. We felt like we were in a resort! The hotel staff was friendly and accomodating. They extended a lovely friendly Texas Welcome to us. They were very pleasant whenever we called to ask for more towels or general directions. There is a skywalk that connects to the hotel, so you don't need to go outside to get to the mall. The mall is complete with a carousel for the little ones, a movie theater, and even an ice rink for the adventurous ones! There is a wide array of restaurants for every taste palette out there.

title: “A few tweaks needed, but overall nice”
text:
I'm a business traveler; I travel every week on business. Curious about this new Westin, I decided to try it. The room itself--wonderful, especially the bed, of course. Standalone shower is wonderful. Not much counter in the bath for us ladies with blowdryers and curling irons, but here's a frequent traveler tip: need more counter space? Use the ironing board. Anyway, bathroom nice and bright. Room very nice. 
Only disappointment was the staff....I always get a king bed room,and that's what I reserved, but they gave me a room with 2 doubles. ? So as soon as I stepped in the room and saw the beds, I called the front desk. The first guy to answer the phone says, Oooh, I dunno, we're full tonite. (HARDLY! The parking garage was mostly empty, the hallways and lobby deserted, come on. No need for bs like that.) He transfers me to the front desk who tell me, well, we'll see if we have any king bed rooms....WHAT? EXCUSE ME, but I booked a king bed room, I'm on your frequent stayer (Starwood ) program, the hotel is half empty! So now I raise the tone of my voice just a tad and say, Pardon me, I booked a king room, I expect a king room. {Geez it's not like I booked on hotline or something...I booked thru the hotel website!) Finally they come up with a king bed room. At that point things get better...they bring me the key and the rest of the stay is uneventful.
The only other issue is, don't park on level 4 of the garage, because the hotel elevator only goes to level 3. So if you are parked on 4, like I was, you will now have to trudge around the actual driveways of the garage up to level 4. That's insane, but oh well. 
I won't stay again. Too overpriced, inconvenient (garage thing), and staff too green for road warriors.

title: “New property ... like it very much”
text: This is a new Westin Property ... liked its location right next to a mall ... memorial city with lots of shops and restaurants. Hotel is right next to the highway .. making getting to the airport easy and also to other locations ... short 15 min drive to the Galleria Area ... Rooms are comfortable ... except highway can be a little noisy during peak times

title: “Very nice, new Westin”
text:
I love staying at Westin's and this was a good stay. This is not an excellent place for Platinum recognition, but the stay was very good.
The hotel is new and everything works. As with all Westin's that I have been in, the bed was excellent and the shower was superb. The bathroom lighting was very nice. I got a room that was on the diagonal end, so my bath was very long -- that was a nice touch.
I had to pay for parking, so was not happy about that.
Will surely stay again here.

title: “Excellent Stay! Very Pleased!”
text: This review is for my stay on 2/3/2012. I decided to book a weekend getaway for my fiancé and I. I booked the "Ti Amo" package in a room which features a room with views of Citycentre plaza and downtown Houston. The package includes room, a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, breakfast for 2 at Alex Bistro, and complementary valet parking. Normally I have been let down in the past with other establishments as they do not follow the package. I have found myself calling the front desk asking where my stuff is.. but I am excited to report that everything went SMOOTHLY at hotel Sorella! I have to say the most difficult thing I had to do was find the place. It is tricky to find the main entrance. After finding the front entrance, I proceeded to use the valet parking service. No problems there. I was directed to the side elevator which takes you to the 2nd floor where the lobby is located. There were 3 other people being helped but I did not wait long at all. Upon checking in, they gave my the keys etc.. and presented an envelope with my voucher for the free breakfast for 2 at Alex Bistro. That was easy! I went to my suite on the 9th floor and was very pleased with the room. It was big and clean and very comfortable. It had a great view as well. Just as described on the hotels' website. I was very surprised at the level of cleanliness.. no hairs, dust, or wrappers. It was spotless! About 30 minutes after checking in, the champagne and strawberries arrived! Again I was pleased that they actually followed through on everything I was expecting without me having to "remind" them. Later in the evening after returning from a movie at Studio Movie Grill, I had a welcome card with a bottle of red wine and 2 glasses waiting for us!!! That was unexpected but very welcomed!!! We really enjoyed it! This morning we woke up excited to have breakfast at Alex Bistro. We got there around 9:30 and it was not very busy. We got seated immediately and our waiter was very friendly. I asked if there was a value/limit for our voucher and he said no, just as long as you don’t order 7 courses! So basically order as you normally would. :) The coffee was great and food was good too. We gave him our voucher, tipped, and left. Easy process! I am giving Hotel Sorella a perfect 5 stars because everything was perfect! No complaints on the room, the cleanliness, and the staff was great! Always courteous and greet you by last name. I would highly recommend staying here whether for business or pleasure. There are plenty of restaurants and entertainment nearby and you will feel well taken care of. (p.s. i'm giving them an excellent on location because of the proximity to restaurants and bars...not by where the front door is lol)

title: “Great Place”
text: Overall, this is a really nice hotel. Great service. Quiet. The rooms are very trendy but comfortable. The only reason I did not give it five stars was due to cleanliness. Nothing horrible, but there were a couple of hairs on the floor of the bathroom when I arrived. Most people probably think that is picky, but being a clean freak, those kind of things gross me out. Many folks from my employer stay here and all seem to like it.

title: “Great hotel...once you get there”
text: The reason I gave this hotel "4" stars is because of the difficulty in locating the property. GPS, Google, Mapquest...nothing worked to direct us to the hotel. After a long day of travel it was very frustrating to drive around in circles looking for the place. There is little to indicate where the hotel is. Apparently nearby construction disallows any signage? At any rate, we had to phone the property for assistance. The person who helped navigate us in was amazing! Stayed on the phone with us until we arrived at the valet stand. This boutique hotel is in the "center" of the new Citycenter shopping area, an open air shopping and dining concept where the old Town and Country Mall used to be in Houston (I-10 and the outer loop - Sam Houston Prkwy 8). Lots of great restaurants, shopping. Wonderful weekend getaway. Lots of action. Lots of young people partying. A truly happening place. The hotel is very hip. It was strange that none of our friends in the Houston area had ever heard of the place. I would advise the management do a bit more PR. Get the word out!

title: “Old charm with new amenities”
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Icon while visiting family in Houston. As many have mentioned, the hotel is undergoing renovations and there are lots of great changes! Our room was one of the recently renovated and we loved the combination of old, charming details with modern features like the bathroom fixtures. The location was also great in downtown Houston.

title: “Clean Antique hotel”
text:
The hotel just finish renovation. So new carpet, new paint. Antique Bank door and other decoration with ages.The bedding is warm and comfy. The bathroom is giant with rain shower.Hotel restraurant is reasonal priced and provide corn bread with jalapino. Free shuttle bus within downtown. Front desk has many cellpjone charge if you forget yours.
My room has big windows from both side and sardin curtain looks really nice. Only complain is no blackout curtains. 
There is no swimming pool. The gym is in basement with bright red color equipments. But I didn't try.

title: “Line & Lariat Restaurant at Hotel Icon”
text: I wasn't able to find a listing for this restaurant so decided to post here. I highly recommend this location for an excellent fine dining experience! Both the service and food were top notch! Menu had good variety in main course (steaks, seafood, and other rarer meats like boar and venison) and mixed drink menu was amazing! For appetizer I had crab cake, and for main meal I had the Filet Mignon (perfectly cooked), with melt in your mouth mashed potatoes and sweet carmelized carrots. Then for dessert, I had the flour less chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream. The restaurant is in the lobby area and has amazing trendy and modern Texas decor (cow stools, Texas state flag upholstery, but also grand pillars and large chandeliers). I would recommend this hotel's restaurant for a romantic meal or a classy business-entertaining venue!

title: “Lovely pool and gym, double rooms have two twin beds!”
text: I travelled to Houston for a conference and the Four Seasons is two blocks from the Convention Center, has lovely amenities, a large gym with quite a bit of equipment for a hotel, a huge sauna and beautiful outdoor pool/jacuzzi/deck space. The service was professional and friendly. However, I travelled with a colleague from work and we were surprised that all the double rooms have what they call European Twin - which are about 3 inches wider than a twin bed! So, I was in Houston, Texas in the smallest bed in all the state, I bet. The hotel says this is a Four Seasons policy, but I stayed in Vancouver last year with 2 full-size bed in the room. I did not ruin my stay, and I would probably have chosen the Four Seasons over the Hilton Las Americas, the other hotel closest to the Convention Center) because of the outdoor pool space. But it was a bit of a last minute surprise.

title: “Great hotel!”
text:
Very friendly staff, clean & modern rooms, huge gym and pleasant pool area. No complaints! I would stay here again if back in Houston. Brunch buffet is kind of pricey at $50 but it's as good as a buffet you will find with everything from omelet bar to sushi bar and everything in between.
The friendliness of the staff was a big plus, everyone smiled and said hello which is really kind of rare.

title: “Perfect.”
text: We were there to celebrate a 10yr anniversary only for one night, and we experienced incredible service by all staff, delightful health minded breakfast, and each staff member went beyond to make our stay excellent. Favorite perks are the car service to the theatre, morning paper & complimentary coffee and tea bar, turn down service, pool service, and the attentiveness of every staff member. Great value, and such a lovely experience to have enthusiastic delightful staff around.

title: “STAY HERE!!!”
text:
No really. Cancel your other reservation and make one here. I'm willing to bet you are paying much more for much less. This property is wonderful. From the outside you wouldn't necessarily know how nice the rooms are - I had a king and it was very large. Kitchenette in the room was more of a small kitchen - well equipped with pots pans and dishes. I was able to prepare breakfasts and snacks from the groceries I had purchased at the AMAZING huge Fairway market across the street. Room was extremely comfortable, although it is NYC and I wasn't in the room all that much. Service staff was wonderful - tiny problems (remote needed new batteries, one other small thing) addressed immediately. I left my Iphone charger at home and one of the gentlemen at the desk checked to see if he had his personal one with him and loaned it to me until I could get to the Apple Store the next day. I needed to go to the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal and the Bellhop/Valet dealt with not only getting me a cab but making sure they knew where I needed to go and how to get there (not all cabs want to go to Brooklyn evidently).
Quiet - this is a largely residential section and believe it or not cabs and trucks and such incur LARGE fines if they lay on their horns. So much for that NY stereotype but I've stayed on 42nd and not gotten a lot of sleep, so I enjoyed the quiet. 
Convenient - three blocks to Central Park - right by Strawberry Fields. Three blocks a different direction to the 72 street subway stop for 1,2 and 3 lines. 3 is an express that will get you to Times Square (where you can transfer to about any other subway line) and all the Broadway shows and on down to the 9/11 memorial stop. 1 or 2 will get you to 50th street stop for Radio City, 30 Rock, Rockefeller Plaza etc. 3 or 4 blocks the opposite direction from Central Park is the Hudson Riverfront. Lots of restaurants in the area, lots of shopping up and down Broadway. Don't remember one in the property itself, or room service, but didn't look because with the kitchenette I didn't need one. Used the computers, very helpful to have free WiFi in the rooms too (seriously why don't all hotels have this now?). Believe there was a pool because I saw kids in bathing suits but I didn't check it out.
This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who resides in the neighborhood and I'm so glad I took his advice. 4 people from work have stayed at this hotel at various times this summer and we all plan to make this our regular NYC hotel from now on.

title: “Wedding Stay”
text:
Myself and my wife stayed in this hotel in May and thought it was terrific. We paid for a suite and it was really large and had plenty of extra room if you wanted anyone to stay the night i.e. all the bridesmaids stayed and everyone got ready in there whilst i stayed elsewhere for that particular night.
In a great location next and really nice area of New York. Really close to a Subway stop and that is how we got around the whole time we were there. Really easy to do.
The hotel staff were really good and it was just the little touches that made it lovely, such as when it was raining you could take the big black umbrellas with wooden handles and keep them all day.
There is Freshway Market directly opposite which is great for snacks, drinks and beer etc. Nice big fridge in the room to store eveything.
Overall terrific stay.

title: “A really nice hotel, good location, excellent supermarket across the road!”
text:
We'd read good reveiws about this hotel and were not disappointed. Really pleased with our suite, large sofa bed for the children, separate bedroom for us. Well decorated and very clean.
Good points:
Across the road from a fantasitc Fairview supermarket with stacks of fresh fruit, veg, freshly prepared meals. Wish we had one like this in UK 
Subway, 2 min walk
Central Park 10 min walk
Lots of shops, cafes, bars close by
Friendly, helpful staff
Fantastic cafe about 15 mins walk away called 'Good enough to eat'. It's only small and quite popular, the food is amazing.
Bad point - an unwanted cockroach in the kitchen cupboard. Fortunately we didn't find him until our last day. But don't let that put you off. This is a very good hotel and we would definitely stay there again if ever i am lucky enough to visit New York.
New York is a fantastic city, we throughly enjoyed our 4 nights and didn't have time to see everything. 
If you can, avoid being talked into buying advance tickets for the Guided tours / Empire State, there is nothing to gain by doing this. You dont save any money and despite what they say you don't jump the queue.

title: “Amazing stay!”
text:
We stayed 3 nights early September and had booked the hotel on recommendations from other TA reviewers and we were not disappointed!!
We were allocated a corner room on the back of the hotel which was very quiet and large in comparison to other Manhattan hotels. We had 2 beds, a large separate kitchenette area with window and a large bathroom, again with window that opened! Although I do sleep with earplugs, the room was very quiet. Beds were very comfortable and had not trouble sleeping. So good to be able to wake up in the morning and make a proper cup of British tea!!
On the 2nd day we arrived back to our room to discover that the smoke alarm was sounding - seemed as though it could have been the battery. I called reception and within 15 mins a friendly maintenance guy took a look and resolved the problem. Great service indeed! In fact, all staff were very friendly and helpful. We were heading to Citifields for the Mets v Nationals game and the doorman was extremely helpful in providing the best route to take by subway and train.
We were visiting our friends in Brooklyn so spent a lot of time away from the hotel - but we found it to be in one of the best locations to access anywhere in Manhattan. Only 2 blocks/5 minute walk to Central Park. A minute's walk to the subway and a good 30 minute walk to Times Square (but we don't mind walking in Manhattan - it's the best way to see the city).
Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and will definitely book again as and when we find ourselves visiting Manhattan. Although perhaps we should keep it a secret from others so we can always get a room when we need it!!

title: “And now for something a little different”
text:
This is a boutique hotel, located across from the NYPL, and around the corner from Bryant Park. While being located on a busy street, the entrance is on a small lane (Library Way?) which makes for quiet entry and exit. When you first walk in, you are not sure what to do. There is no front desk, but one natural gravitates towards a cluster of what look like empty computer stations, where seconds later a young man greeted us. Oddly, there don't seem to be any women working at this hotel! We had arrived a few hours before check-in and the room wasn't ready but they stored our luggage (in what turned out to be not a very secure location by the front door but with no mishaps), and we went to explore NYC. 
The room was then ready when they said it would be, and once again we weren't really sure about things once we got in the room. It's all very understated. We had a suite with a nice master bedroom, and small living room with a kitchenette that took us a moment to find (sleekly hidden behind cupboard doors). The LR room has an understated wabi sabi feel too it that might have been better in concept as the linen on the custom couch was quite soiled. But it folded out (with some effort) to a fabulous sleep sofa for the kids. It was as comfortable and plush as any regular king size bed, which is saying alot for a sofa bed! Behind the couch was a low table with rolling chairs. Again we were unsure about the concept but it turned out to be an excellent dining table/desk. Best of all the unit had a balcony. A balcony in the middle of NYC! It took us a while to figure out the lighting (the master switch doesn't mean master bedroom, it means universal as in turning all lighting on and off), which was a little underdone. Every room could have used more light. A lot more light. The bathroom is done in very dark slate, and with barely any light, it felt very cave light. 
The next day we were dying for some wine without a liquor store in a 4 block radius, which was easily solved by a chat with one of the many metrosexual men milling about who quickly supplied us with ample portions. There is a Panera and many little eateries, as well as the Grand Central Station locale, close by.
So while this hotel makes you realize you aren't really as cool as you think you are, it truly is a fabulous little find. The service is quick and friendly even if you don't know how to access it - help always seemed to find us. The location is just fantastic. As previously mentioned, they could do with some upgrades, particularly to soft surfaces (really that couch made me think of the light they use on the hotel makeover shows to illuminate the gross stuff you don't want to know about), and improve lighting. They also cheaped out on the floors a little bit, installing a plastic laminate in the hotel rooms and a poorly laid carpet in hallways. It would be nice if these were upgraded. But the spacious lay-out and good value for $, would make me go back. Even if I did have to sit on a towel.

title: “Great property”
