text: What a great property and right in the middle of Manhattan, with only a short subway ride to anywhere. Very modern decor. Staff are very friendly and Joe the concierge wonderful. Thankyou for a wonderful stay and we look forward to returning.

title: “Overbooked, doubled-Up or Walked!!”
text:
Booked and confirmed two nights here last weekend. My wife and kids were in NY for the Open. Despite confirmation, we were told they were overbooked. Never had this happen before. Our options were to have all of us stay in one room (small suite) or walk to a Hyatt which was 7-8 blocks away.
Tired and frustrated we decided to stay on a pull out and roll-out.
To their credit the room was clean and the service staff was well-trained. As a meeting planner this type of problem makes one pause.
Peter C

title: “Nice hotel but extremely poor and expensive breakfast!”
text: The hotel is situated in a very convenient area and the personel were very friendly. Our reservation was for bed and continental breakfast. We travel all over the world with my husband and have stayed at more than 100 hotels so far. It was the first time that we had so poor breakfast!! Normally continental breakfast includes: cereals, toast, cakes, fruits, cheese and it is usually buffet. Their breakfast was not buffet was: 1 tiny croisant, 1 small muffin, 1 small piece of cake, 3 extra-thin slices of the quarter of an apple, 3 or 4 extra-thin slices of banana (cross section), 2-3 rasberries, 7-10 cranberries. This breakfast costs US$35/person! My husband cannot eat sweets and he asked to substitute the muffin and the cake with 2 slices of bread toasted. They did not understand and they brought it as extra. The charge was US$50/person!!!! I suggest other travellers not to book breakfast at this hotel. There are a lot of cafe very close to the hotel where you can enjoy a rich breakfast with less than US$20!!

title: “Top notch elegance”
text:
Stayed for a weekend in August, for a wedding Anniversary. Gentleman, if you want to impress your lady, this is the place!! Absolutely gorgeous room, with an impressive view, and all the amenities. To quote my wife, " you have always booked nice hotels, but this is the best!"
Complimentary bottle of wine, and a personal note of congratulations on our anniversary!, greeted us in our room! Fantastic friendly, and abundantly helpful staff. They will hail you a cab, open doors for you, greet and wish you a good day, give you directions and restaraunt suggestions, and bring you anything you need. Great location, close to shopping and Times Square. Truly an amazing property, with equally amazing staff to match. Absolutely no complaints here. Even a late check out was no issue. You absolutely can not go wrong with the Setai. We had an absolutely stellar stay.

title: “Cleaning staff takes it to the next level!”
text: I stay all over the city when I'm here. What I love about hotels is the attention to detail. The staff all the way around is outstanding but the cleaning staff deserve a 6 star! The attention to detail is superb!!!!! They fold things for you, they line up your shoes, they organize your toiletries, the room temp is perfect, and you get cookies!!!! Good cookies! Homemade cookies!

title: “Grace under fire: The Chatwal in a blackout”
text:
My husband and I went back to the Chatwal last week for a three day stay. It was 103 degrees when we landed in NY and we were looking forward to calm oasis of The Chatwal in midtown while seeing a few plays. As always, they welcome you back and seem to remember you from the last time. We got an upgrade through our travel agent and had a king deluxe room overlooking the street. We went to the theatre that first night and when we got back to the hotel after a late dinner, it seemed a tad warm but chalking it up to a brutally hot day in the city, we went to sleep. Somewhere in the middle of the night, we realized the AC wasn’t really working and by the time we got up in the morning, the lights were blinking on and off. I took a quick shower but by the time my husband stepped into the shower, the water wasn’t working as well. We called the front desk and they told us there was a power issue, not just for them but the whole block and they were dealing with it. Over the course of the next day and a half, the hotel and the entire block lost all power except for emergency lights and elevator. The hotels across the street were sending people elsewhere as the entire street was now cordoned off. 
During this time, the staff and management couldn’t have been better. We decided to tough it out and they bent over backwards to make sure we were as comfortable as possible. Cases of water were sent to our room and we decadently showered in Fiji water! Buckets of ice and wine were sent to ease our stress and although we stayed away by virtue of seeing a bunch of plays, every time we came back, they checked on us. They brought in emergency generators, they gave us fans to use when we finally had some power but not full AC and I know they worked round the clock because we returned at 2AM one night, both the general manager and director of operations were still there on the street talking to Conn Ed and trying calm everyone’s nerves at the same time. By 3 AM that night, all was restored and we slept in a cool room. When we went downstairs the next morning, we were approached by both managers who wanted to know what they could do to compensate us for our troubles. They completely stepped up to the plate by not only comping us the night but also by upgrading us to a suite and sending us to the spa. All for a situation that was entirely out of their control.
Mind you, we are no VIP guests to them, just a couple of people who like their hotel. And because of this amazing attention to service, we are now diehard fans. Are there cheaper midtown hotels in the area that are nice? Yes, but I am not sure they would have treated us like family in this stressful situation. We look forward to our next trip back!

title: “Great property - but small rooms and poor soundproofing!”
text:
After staying at the St. Regis, our expectations were admittedly high. And for the most part, the Chatwal delivered, primarily with the room's excellent bathroom - an almost spa-like experience. The Asprey amenities are great, and the minibar was well-stocked and priced to be used. We had drinks and met a friend at the second-floor bar, a great spot for casual conversation. All around, the staff were friendly and went out of their way to meet our needs. For example, the room included complimentary garment pressing, steaming, shoe shining, etc., and the butler called to follow-up after we checked in, to see if we needed anything. 
A few negatives:
-We were in the basic room, and it was very small. There was little room to maneuver around the bed, and this seems more in line with the standard NYC hotel than a luxury hotel. Considering this place has nightly rates that can be $600 or more, I wouldn't expect even the smallest room to be this small.
-The bed was not the most comfortable. While the linens are very good, the bed here was a bit too firm for us.
A major problem:
-Noise control. In the bathroom, we could hear the conversation of those in the room above us. When I say "hear," I don't mean that I could hear muffled talking or whatever - little stuff like that wouldn't bother me. I mean I could hear every single word that was said, and it was more than a little awkward/uncomfortable. Now, usually I'm the first to say, "Why wouldn't you call and switch rooms?" to someone, but we had already gotten settled in, didn't have long before dinner, and didn't figure it would make a huge difference anyhow, so we left it alone.
Without the noise issue, this would have been 4 stars for sure (and perhaps 5 if the room size were more comfortable) - it is a dazzling property and a place I would happily stay at again, if I could be assured that the soundproofing were better.

title: “Charming boutique hotel in really convenient spot”
text: The Chatwal is a gorgeous hotel. The rooms were fabulous - we had a suite and a room for our grown up family - but the most important difference is the staff. They were friendly and polite and nothing was too much trouble. The technology in the room was fun although the high tech toilet was a bit scary! It's just off Times square and we found that very convenient.

title: “Love Kimpton!”
text: We stayed at Eventi (our 2nd Kimpton NYC property and 3rd in the US) during my husband's business trip. The company booked us in a hotel in Times Square but we don't care for the crazines of that area. The location of this hotel is perfect! Flat Iron, Fashion District, Empire State Building - all right there. The hotel is beautiful as all Kimpton properties are. Our room overlooked the back courtyard where the hotel was hosting the opening ceremony of the Olympics. Neat perk! Big screen, cocktails, hors dourves, games. You name it! It is always helpful to be an InTouch Member for the free Wifi for my husband can work and I can play. Will always be back!

title: “GoodTimes”
text: Centrally located for easy walking or a short cab ride to everything. Our stay was great the room was modern and clean. The staff was very helpful. They even brought us a bag of ice at 2a.m. for my wifes feet after a long day and night out. They also gave me a free upgraded room just because it was available. They moved me to a higher floor and a corner room where I could see both the Empire state building and the Freedom tower. AWESOME!!!

title: “All the comforts of home plus so much more!”
text:
I recently stayed at the Eventi for two nights for business. I got a good deal through hotels.com and was very impressed with all of the hotels amenities. The check in was easy and the staff checking me in was friendly. The room was clean, comfortable, and modern. The bathroom was also clean and modern with good toiletries and a comfy robe. I forgot my toothpaste and the hotel staff brought some up in five minutes. The TV channels were plentiful and the desk/work area was convenient and work-friendly. The bed was quite comfortable and anytime I called the front desk for either room service or a wake up call, everyone was responsive and friendly. Location was ideal for me- close to penn station and a short walk to Times Sq and shopping. The doorman was great about getting car or taxi service for me.
Highly recommended and I hope to be back soon!

title: “Elegant hotel near Times Square”
text:
We stayed for 10 nights recently and booked after reading positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We Had requested a room with a view if possible and they upgraded us to a room on the 10th floor with a bay window that looked out towards the Chrysler Building. 
The hotel is elegantly old fashioned, and for a hotel a block away from Times Square it is very quiet. You can't hear much noise from the street (with the exception of the odd garbage truck or siren which you would hear anywhere in NY). 
The rooms are not large but then most hotel rooms in NY are not big. However being so close to Times Square and several subway stations was great. You can walk to many attractions such as the Rockerfeller Centre and USS Intrepid. 
The wi fi was always reliable and there is a computer in the library off the lobby that you can use if you need to print.
All the staff were great, particularly Patrick who always greeted us warmly. 
We would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting something quiet but close to Times Square.

title: “take the concierge home!”
text: Midtown manhattan is not my best location, unless proximity to times square is important. But we stayed for 4 nights in this hotel, in this small luxury hotel group member. The reception area is a bit dark and foreboding, and it didn't quite have the upmarket luxury i was expecting. But it was very quiet- unexpectedly, as we overlooked 44th street- and very comfortable. But we loved it for the concierge service. Having visited NY many times, we had a concierge who was brimming with new ideas, all of them good, and who hugely contributed to our stay. Vanessa ( and colleague Alan) organised our days to provide variety, and fun experiences, and there was always a huge queue for their time, such was the smile and the popularity.

title: “Great location and fab staff!”
text: If you are headed to NYC, you would do well to consider a stay at The Iroquois, a boutique hotel well-located in midtown. We stayed at The Iroquois for Labour Day weekend when we were in the city to watch US Open Tennis and shop; the hotel had been recommended to us by friends who have stayed there twice before and had us sold when they told us about the Frette linens and bathrobes, Molton Brown products, convenient location (easy walk to the bustle of Times Square (where we had stayed before - W 44th St bn 5th & 6th is a much more civilized location), Grand Central Station, Lord & Taylor, Bryant Park, etc) and stellar service (Vanessa at the concierge desk was uber-helpful with restaurant reservations, directions and questions in relation to our pre-planning). We had a lovely room which was super comfy and spacious for midtown. I am a fan and am telling friends and family that The Iroquois is the place to stay in New York City!!!

title: “Nothing special, but a decent value for NYC during the holidays.”
text:
Like many hotels in NYC this one is an updated, but an old one with all the issues that would normally accompany one (poor lighting, plumbing tha rattles, small bathroom, etc). 
While i had a "courtyard" view (really just a brick wall 10 feet away from the window) there was none of the street noise that bothered others on the other side of the hotel. 
Finally - the 'free' breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, but at least the coffee is okay.

title: “Surprisingly wonderful!”
text:
For my four-year-old's first trip to NYC, we stayed in a suite at The San Carlos, and what a treat! An immaculately clean bathroom (w/ a bath tub/shower--not always the case in NYC) and bedroom, plus a separate sitting room w/ a tiny kitchenette (no stove, but a sink, small fridge, coffee maker, microwave, dishes and utensils)--perfect for traveling w/ a small child. 
We were on the 17th floor w/ not much of a view and some minor street noise, but never anything disruptive. The staff were always smiling, helpful, and competent. And to top it off, the location cannot be beat--close to every thing we wanted to see and do: Rockefeller Center, the 5th Ave shops, hansom cab rides, tea at The Plaza, etc. 
If you're looking for 24 hour room service and a grand lobby, this is not the place for you. But if you want a nice, clean, convenient place to relax between outings, this place more than fits the bill. Overall, I'd definitely return to this hotel and heartily recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

title: “Great family stay in October”
text:
After AIRBNB cancelled our apartment reservation at the last minute (4 days prior to arrival) we contacted the San Carlos, a hotel the company has been using for years. We got an extremely reasonable price for a family suite and kept wondering after that why should we ever bother with the unreliable AIRBNB service ever again...We felt so pampered at the hotel!!
The suite was spacious. There's a bedroom with very comfortable bed, TV and closet. The living room has a foldout double sofa, with a very thick and comfortable mattress. Since we are 5 people they brought in another single bed, and the room still felt spacious. 
The living room area also has a TV, two armchairs, a small dining area with 4 chairs and a real kitchenette with microwave, small but real refrigerator and plenty of dishes. For breakfast, though, we used the hotel dining room downstairs. No cooked food, but still enough to get you started in the morning.
The only reservation we have about the room is the fact you can't really open the windows for fresh air (2nd floor) because the cooking fumes and odors you get from the restaurant next door. However, ventilation system is rather efficient.
Staff were very helpful and kind. They make you feel very much "at home" and as if each visitor is "a regular". 
Last but not least: Location! Initially we wanted to go for the village, but we actually found this location to be even better: easy access to all parts of the city and important destinations - central park and the museums, the MOMA is within minutes walk, Times Sq is close enough to walk and yet far enough... 5th avenue shopping area is really close. Warmly recommend it.

title: “Fun Girls Weekend at the San Carlos Hotel”
text: My friends and I had a great stay at the San Carlos Hotel. We all stayed together in a 1 bedroom queen suite. The bedroom had two queen beds, and we had a generously sized sitting area that included a sleeper sofa, 2 arm chairs, sink and fridge. The bedroom was also a nice size, and we had 2 closets with ample storage space. The room was clean and comfortable. The Aveda products in the bathroom were nice! We could hear a little bit of street noise, but it is NYC after all. The hotel itself was very quiet--I never heard any noise from other rooms. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Be sure to pick up a map! We also loved the bowls of fun size candy bars at the front desk. I'm not sure if that was leftover from Halloween or if they're always there, but my friends and I always made a quick stop to pick up a Hershey bar on the way in or out. One guy at the front desk was particularly helpful by arranging for a limo to take the 6 of us to our dinner destination one evening. We saved a bit on cab fare that evening and enjoyed the ride in the limo! The hotel is very convenient (1 block) to the subway on 51st and Lexington. There is also a great bagel place, Ess-A-Bagel on 3rd at about 49th or so. I will definitely stay at the San Carlos again if I ever have the chance to get back to New York.

title: “A very wonderful hotel”
text: My husband and I spent 3 and 1/2 marvelous days at the Sherry Netherland at 59th St and 5th Avenue. We were very sorry when the time came to leave this wonderful hotel. It is small with beautiful rooms, It isl, well located across from Central Park with a delightful, helpful staff. The room had fresh flowers and delicious complimentary Godiva chocolate waiting for us when we arrived. We received a 20% at the Harry Cipriani lovely restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel and a 15% discount at a charming Italian restaurant around the corner on 59th St. We love the neighborhood.. This hotel is a gem . We look forward to returning and recommend the hotel highly.

title: “A business event that changed to a pleasure trip because of this hotel”
text: I had the very good fortune to secure a room at the Sherry Netherland; the rate was comparable to other NYC hotel rates as pre-approved by my firm's travel guidelines. I was there for one night and didn't anticipate anything but a usual hotel stay. To my surprise, I was taken with the beauty of my room and found myself enjoying the time I had before I was due at a meeting. The sun was streaming in the window, I had a crystal chandelier and a decor I would love to copy in my own bedroom. I travel a lot for business, I always thought rooms are just rooms .....until my stay at the Sherry; it was a refreshing change to NOT want to leave a hotel room!!

title: “The **ONLY** Place We'll Stay in NYC!”
text:
The Sherry Netherland is truly a special home away from home. It starts the minute you pull up to the Sherry… A very friendly doorman (absolutely no attitude, just a friendly soul!) greets you and escorts you to the front desk. The lobby is small, but so elegant and warm. You instantly know that you are in the land of ‘old money’. If Bernie Madoff was not in jail, you would expect him to walk out of Cipriani’s and take the elevator up to his apartment! This building is only 50 rooms dedicated to hotel guests; the rest of the 30+ floor building is soley dedicated to owners. Currently, there are apartments selling for around $10,000,000! 
Our room was large and spacious. We paid to upgrade to a bit larger room with a view of the carriages and statue at the end of Central Park. It is also fun to wake up and walk 20 steps to the CBS Early Show... Unless there's a big name concert going on, don't worry about getting there super early. There were never more than 50-75 people there. 
We were greeted by Lori Ann at the front desk. What a kind soul! She asked how our flight was and if she could do anything at all to help us feel more settled. I mentioned to her and to the doorman that my cellular phone had gone missing in the airport limo to the hotel and they were seemingly as upset for me, as I was! When Tammy (also a front desk superstar employee!) came on to shift, she heard about my phone missing and was quick to give me advice. She told me to offer a reward (bribe?!) to the dispatcher/driver and see if that would help my phone suddenly show up (driver had been saying that my phone was not in his town car!). Mysteriously, after I took Tammy’s advice, and offered the ‘reward’, at 12:41 AM, my phone showed up. The bellman was so nice and even though it was late, he called me to let me know it was safe and sound at the front desk and would be delivered to me in the morning. 
The Sherry gives you a well stocked bathroom! Shaving Creme, Razor, Toothbrush, Toothpaste, All the Toiletries You Will Need (except for hairspray). There is also bottled water, complimentary, as well as free wi-fi. 
The gym is small but good. However, you walk SOOO much in NYC, it is doubtful that you will spend anytime in it.
This hotel is such a shining star! You feel like royalty, but somehow, the Sherry team never displays that stuffy attitude that I have experienced with other high end hotels. 
Our room was lovely and we feel blessed to have so much space in a city that almost prides itself on tiny spaces.
Also, when I mentioned to one of the staff that the price of food was a bit mind blowing in NYC, they suggested that we go to Gene’s Coffee Shop, right around the corner! Yay! What a helpful hint! We had GREAT food, and never spent more than $20!! That was for two people! I told one of my friends back home that I felt like I got ‘one over’ on the City! Ha! Make sure that you walk out of the hotel, go right at 60th and walk 1.5 blocks and look for Gene’s! You will LOVE it! Great Food…GREAT prices! Also, remember that Gene’s delivers to the Sherry, for FREE! Almost every morning, my mom and I had a hot egg white veggie omelet with crispy, HOT French fries delivered to our room. The delivery was always here within 20 mins! 
If you want a great tour, be sure to take a peek at PhotoTrek tours. This website is linked on the Sherry’s website and it is worth EVERY penny! Marc is the talented prof’l photographer that owns PhotoTrek tours and you will adore this tour! Try to get the 3 hour tour, if possible.
The Sherry is magical! The location is PERFECT! The staff is even more perfect! You will be so sad when you have to check out since you will feel like you’re saying goodbye to family. 
Hurry home to the Sherry Netherland! You’ll be glad you did!!!

title: “Beautiful room but service not up to par”
text: The room was awesome, large and beautiful with a great view of Fifth Avenue. Unfortunately there was construction going on outside during the night which made it hard to sleep but this was not the Hotel's fault. The Bellman was very slow bringing up the luggage even though the front desk was told we were in a rush to change clothes for the theater. Not that they were busy at the time! Also our bill was handled incorrectly and we had a hard time getting in touch with anybody who could fix it. The people who run this hotel just don't care too much about their paying guests and it shows. Too bad. One would expect better management for a high-class hotel. Too much is left up to the front desk in terms of taking care of the customers and they are not always capable of fixing everything.

title: “Could not have asked for anything better”
text:
As a large group it is hard to please everyone. Hilton Garden is on their A game.
My group was sent to Houston to open a new store, the work is hot, physical & stressful so it was nice they could finish the day & not have to worry about where they were sleeping. Rooms are clean, safe, breakfast is excellent & the staff could not have been more accommodating. 
Keep up the great service

title: “A very good choise”
text: Clean rooms, nice staff and an excellent restaurant where we had good meals at a low cost. We also appreciated that the hotel has a buisness room with internet access which you can use if you have not brought your own PC. It's not likely that we will visit Houston again but if we do we would definitely stay at this hotel.

title: “Absolutely fine. Comfortable stay”
text: I stayed in 3 'business' hotels in Houston and this was easily the best. Nothing fancy but big light comfortable room and bathroom. Would happily stay there again on future visits.

title: “Nice hotel but definitely NOT quiet due to Window AC unit”
text:
We chose to stay in this hotel based on the reviews. The beds were comfortable, the rooms and facilities were clean, the kids loved the pool and hot tub .... the pool was free-form and looked nicer than the itty bitty rectangular ones you normally see at most other Garden Inns.
My only complaint is that the window mounted AC unit is very loud. Everytime it kicks in I would wake up so I just turned it off completely .... then it was extremely quiet! Maybe it was something specific to our room -- #203 -- not sure. Maybe I'm used to hotels that don't have window mounted units and this is normal loudness.
Other than the loud AC unit, everything else was great. The ladies working the breakfast and Ivy in front desk were all very professional and courteous.
Overall, we enjoyed our stay and the kids loved having the pool almost all to themselves for a couple of days.

title: “Outstanding”
text:
Excelent hotel, next door to the convention center. The rooms are great, service is very good, food (lunch, diner, and breakfast) is excellent and inexpensive, and the bar is great.
The gym is very good.

title: “Houston JO Trip”
text:
Check in process was average, our luggage was whisked away by a bellman and we were told we could not take it to the room ourselves. Forty five minutes later we were still waiting for our luggage to arrive and it had been sitting at the desk downstairs...."waiting for us to get to our rooms". I had called in advance for a fridge since I had an athlete competing in the city for Junior Olympics and I was told it should not be a problem. At check in I was told they had all the refridgerators out and it would be the next day beofre I would get one. I finally got the fridge the last night of my 5 night stay. Rooms were clean and neat.....carpets could have used a cleaning. For as nice of a hotel as this was with flat panel tv's upgraded amenties etc... I would have expected a mini fridge in each room.
Parking was absurd at almost $20 day for self parking.
Location was great for downtown and for access to the convention center. Food was quite good in the restaurants.

title: “Business trip downtown Houston”
text: Checkin quick. Front desk clerk helpful with directions just wish we were offered a map of downtown. Room 16th floor numer 1660. Large hotel. Elk conference going on so very busy. Even with many people room was quiet. Modern room furnishings, flat screen, desk, coffee/tea in room. Updated bathroom. Luxury soaps & shampoos. Water temperature extreme. Went from cold to very very hot in seconds. Even when washing hands. If my kids had been with me it would have been a safety issue. Mentioned checkout time to front desk checking in which was late in the day. Told maid two doors down when I went down for food. Still received a call asking when we would checkout for housekeeping. Do wish hotels would pass information along to housekeepers. So you won't be bothered by ringing phone while trying to nap. Cafe for lunch. My takeout order fried green tomatoe BLT with sweet potatoe fries, chicken tortilla soup. The soup fantastic flavor. Fried green tomatoes made me sandwich soggy. Wouldn't order sandwich again. Quick service for takeout at the bar. Indoor pool looked nice for exercise. No place to sit outside pool. Very large functional workout room. If you like to work out this is a great place for you. Good hotel for going to downtown.

title: “Business luxury at its best.”
text: I booked a room here to coach a writing client on her upcoming book, and it was the perfect place for it. The rooms are appointed with a long glass-topped surface spanning the entire drawers/fridge/desk, making it ideal for spreading out presentations, paperwork, or in our case, the book manuscript. The infinity pool and the hot tub on the 18th floor was a fabulous place to get away from it all, and so was the 024 bar with the super blue waterfall in its midst. Rich linens, thick towels, a bathrobe, double showerheads, and suede-like chairs, made this business trip a luxury I am eager to repeat! Perfect location across from the mall and restaurants, too. All floors accessible by room key only, including pool area.

title: “Nice New Hotel”
text: A couple of friends and I took a road trip from New Orleans to Houston to see the Astros/Red Sox game. Our first night in Houston was at the St. Regis. We decided to stay at the Westin the 2nd night because it is brand new, not too far from downtown, and had a good rate. We loved the property even though it seemed deserted. I'm sure they are still trying to get the word out about themselves. The lobby and public spaces were beautiful and modern. Our room was a typical Westin room with amazing beds and a great tv. I was a bit diappointed as the shower and tub were not separate like in most Westins I've stayed in. We greatly enjoyed the Executive Lounge with wonderful snacks and a decent breakfast. The pool and fitness center on the 18th floor were really cool. We enjoyed the view of Houston from up there. The pool was a bit chilly and hot tub not warm. Maybe they can work those kinks out. The Il Mulino restaurant was amazing. We were the only people in the whole place. But, I loved my chicken piccata and their award winning meatballs. The hotel is in a great location with Target, Cheesecake Factory, and Memorial City Mall across the street. The valet was helpful. No one really offered to help with luggage. At check-in, the gentleman was cordial but not genuinely friendly. He was a bit stiff and quite consumed with the rules such as asking to see my AAA card, telling me I'd probably not get SPG points since we held the room with my friend's credit card even though it was booked in my name and paid for in cash, and letting us know we had to use our room keys to access the elevator. Overall, we enjoyed our experience but prefer the St. Regis a few miles away because of their outstanding service.

title: “Best Place to stay in downtown Houston”
text: It will be your journey to Houston's past with this hotel located in historical building. Yet, hote is so modern, elegant and comfortable. Service with smile is motto here and employees come forward to help you even without asking. Metro rail stop is seconds away from hotel and will take you to restaurants, museums, parks and concerts. Great bathrooms and HD televisions with prompt service. Wi-fi was slow but free.

title: “Tried not to like it, but...”
text: I arrived at the Hotel Icon and they were doing construction outside and everything seemed a mess and my first reaction was to try to switch hotels. (I hate staying at properties doing construction.) I am glad I stayed. They upgraded me to a larger room with a tub and glass shower and the room was great. The hotel has wonderful character and everything was clean. Breakfast was top notch.

title: “Perfect for what I needed.”
text: Clean safe and reasonably comfortable. The room size is small but that's the compromise to save $50-100. For a single traveler it seems well worth it.

title: “The Best Hotel in Downtown Houston”
text: Stayed several times at this Hotel and every time the service and accomodations are exceptional. Every member of the staff is extremely accomodating, with warm sincere smiles and a friendly personal greeting. The location is perfect for any activities downtown. The pool area and workout facilities beautiful. The Sunday Brunch is a must do.

title: “Very nice indeed”
text: Amazing hotel with impeccable service. It's like everyone knows your name. Their personal assistants are remarkable and the service overall is incredible. I would rate this one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed at in the world

title: “Great Expectations”
text: As a Starwood Gold member (just recently downgraded from Platinum), we used 30,000 points for a 1-night stay at The Chatwal. Although the hotel is a very nice property, it did not come close to our expectations for a "Category 7" hotel. We requested an upgrade a couple of weeks before our stay and informed a "front office supervisor" that we would be celebrating a special birthday. He responded promptly and said he would do his best to obtain an upgrade but could make no promises. Our reservation was for a "grand deluxe" 400-square foot room. At check-in, we were advised that we had been "upgraded" to a larger room (but not a suite) on the tenth floor. The room, in fact, was the bedroom of a suite and had a locked, adjoining door to the suite itself. It had two windows, but limited natural light and no view to speak of. One of the first things we noticed was that the occupants of the suite kept trying the adjoining door to our room (presumably assuming it belonged to their suite). This was a bit unsettling from a security standpoint. The room was luxuriously appointed but did not appear to me to measure anywhere near 400 square feet. The bathroom had 2 sinks, a heated toilet (which held no appeal to us in 90+ degree weather), a TV built into the mirror, and a rainshower tub/jacuzzi (but not very much room for toiletries). The bedroom had a sitting area, desk, and coffee table, with a good selection of interesting magazines. The major disappointment we had was that the so-called "lap pool" was not a lap pool at all. I would call it a "plunge pool" at best. The spa attendants referred to it as a "resistance pool"--it is the type of pool that would be installed in a luxury condominium unit that does not have the space for a "real" pool. I tried it out (very skeptically) as I am a devoted lap swimmer and found that I could not take more than one stroke before being pulled back to the wall of the pool. I am sure there is an art to mastering this type of pool, but it is not for real swimmers. The picture of the pool on the website makes it look much larger than it is and, when I mentioned this to the spa attendants, they laughed (good naturedly) and said they did not understand how it could have been so misrepresented. All in all, our one-night stay for an occasion that we hoped would be quite memorable was nothing special. Perhaps it was naive of me to expect the level of luxury that we had encountered in such properties as Tambo del Inka in Urubamba, Peru, the Rambagh Palace in Jaipur, the Park Hyatt Palacio Duhau in Buenos Aires, the Nadesar Palace in Varanasi, the Taj Mahal in Mumbai, and even the ITC Maurya in New Delhi and the ITC Mughal in Agra. I wish I had saved my 30,000 points for a truly seven-star property.

title: “Surprisingly good location”
text: I stayed at this hotel in June 2012. My first impressions were great. I thought the location near Times SQ would make it really noisy, but it's actually set far back enough from the action that you're not really affected by the hustle and bustle of the square. The hotel's proximity to 42nd St station and Grand Central make it perfect for getting around NYC. We had a little trouble with our credit card when we checked in: the staff tried to put a 'hold' for the total cost of our stay on it, as is normal practice, but it was being declined (my bank thought it was a fraudulent purchase and stopped my card). However the staff were so pleasant and understanding about the situation- not snooty at all- and gave me the time to sort everything out. The room was phenomenal. We stayed in a suite which came with a butler! To be honest we didn't use him much, but it was great to know that he was there. The concierge was super, printing out all of our boarding passes for us the day before departure and putting them under our door, and the reception staff, especially Elizabeth and Catalina, were the most friendly hotel staff I have come across in a long time. We were even loaned a laptop for the duration of our stay. I think a lot of hotels forget simple things, like remembering the name of guests, smiling, and being genuinely helpful. The Chatwal had all this perfected and it made this a truly great stay. The only reason i haven't given this hotel a full five stars (although I'd like to give it 4.5 out of 5, but TripAdvisor doesn't allow that) is because the control panel for the lighting/curtains in the room was a little complex and confusing and on a couple details didn't work. But our butler sorted it out, so it was fine in the end! I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anybody visiting NYC- I've been coming every year for the past 8 years and this is the best hotel I've stayed at in the city.

title: “Great girls night in!”
text: We recently stayed at the Eventi hotel this past weekend to celebrate our friends last girls night out as a single woman. It was perfect. The room had a great view of the city, the spa was an overall good experience. They were very friendly, from the parking garage to the front desk and all areas in between, great costumer service. The decor of the room was elegant, classy, but not too posh. Marble bathroom, european shower half doors. Feather pillows and comforters. A very homey feeling when you walking into the concierge/front desk. We forgot a tooth brush, hair spray and needed an extra comforter. All were given within 3 minutes of the request at no extra charge. They gave us a $30 credit to the spa, $15 for the mini bar, free parking spot, and champagne,cupcakes and strawberries sent up to the room for signing up for the package. It was a relief for all of us that a NYC hotel would go to these lengths to make five females very happy! It made for a great night =) We would definitely return either with our spouses or a reunion to remember the great times had!

title: “Great Hotel in NYC”
text:
Really impressed with this hotel! we usually stay at the Muse (another Kimpton and near Times Square - a favorite of ours but not fully available for our stay) 
At Eventi, we had a beautiful, clean room with a view of the Empire State building -location was great to get both uptown and downtown. Staff members were very professional, helpful and friendly. Overall a terrific NYC experience and we will definitely be staying here again.

title: “Great Hotel but Service need improvement”
text: Just stayed at this hotel for 4 days. The suite was wonderful: great bed, great bathroom and nice view from the windows. Also very friendly staff. When you stay at an hotel where you pay 600$/night you expect service. Not sure that there was enough staff on site. No one was there to help us when we arrived but they had time to chat while I was carrying my luggage. Waited 15 minutes to have the bell boy pick up our suitcase. Again friendly staff but our mini-bar was not refilled every day. We use bar glasses to drink and they were never replace. The bar was not refilled of white wine either. Also, the last day, we were missing some face clothes...

title: “Great location, great staff, very clean. Would stay again!”
text: I took my daughter to NYC for her 16th birthday and stayed at the Iroquois. The location was great! Close to shopping, times square, subway, dining, etc. The staff was more than accomodating and helpful. The room was very nice and clean - being clean is an absolute MUST!! I will definately be back to the Iroquois!

title: “Friendly staff + cosy, but just an average experience overall”
text: Bottomline is that this is a 3-star hotel advertised as a 4-star. While the staff is generally nice and competent, the whole experience at the hotel falls short. For e.g. there is no room service on Sundays, breakfast is subpar, etc. I wont stay here again and will switch back to the Grammercy Park as my choice hotel in NYC.

title: “Great location, service and stay”
text:
My wife and I had a very nice stay at The Iroquois from Jul. 26th to Jul. 30th.
Pros: location is excellent, a short walk to Times Square on a quiet street. We went to Radio City Music Hall for show, and to Rockefeller Centre to Top of the Rock and these were just a nice walk away. Check out Gregory's Coffee across the street, they have excellent coffee and try the pound cake, yummy! Also close to tons of restaurants close. The Red Flame Diner is a great spot for a very reasonably priced tasty bite. We went for breakfast, was very good.
Service was very good. The concierge was very helpful. We found everyone to be quite friendly and it had a personal touch.
The hotel was old in a good way, it had character and nice touches. It was very clean and quaint.
We got a competitive rate on a package deal and was satisfied with value for this property.
Cons: Our room was very small, which I understand is typical of Manhatten, however it was much smaller than another Manhatten hotel we stayed in last year. Also it had no view, just into another room's Window and a brick wall. Most disappointing was the bed, which was much shorter than standard size perhaps needed to fit into the small room. I'm well over 6 ft tall wasn't the most comfortable. Also my wife was surprised they didn't have a hairdryer, which is typically standard in most hotels. 
Overall we enjoyed our stay at The Iroquois, the best points being it's location and service. I would return in a larger room with at least some view and larger bed.

title: “The Sherry Netherland is our most favorite spot in NYC...pure comfort!”
text:
Why we love the Sherry...as soon as you pull up at the curb you worries are whisked away. The pure professional nature of the staff mixed with genuine kindness is wonderful. Everything is immaculate, the fresh flowers give off such a soothing scent.
The food at Ciprianis is amazing!

title: “outstanding service, cleanliness of room, everything ! Also extremely quiet !”
text: i have stayed at hilton Garden suites 6 time in the last 3 months. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel. the front dest was extremely helpful, the room are imaculate, exetremely quiet, and Marcia Burt has been extremely heplful 9 even with last minute changes on the weekend). GREAT PLACE FOR BUSINESS AND RELAXATION!!

title: “Best location for conventions”
text:
I stayed at Hilton Americas in Houston this past May when i was there for an international conference. The facility was wonderful, and the staff was well-trained and helpful. What I enjoyed most was the location, because I could get easy access to the convention building through the skywalk instead of walking in the heat in my high heels. There are several nice hotels within a few blocks from the convention center; however, considering the extremely cool air in the conference hall and the heat outdoor, even one block makes a different! The hotel is also steps away from the Green and the lake park (a very cute but small park), and it is two blocks away from the grocery store and a few blocks from the Tunnel (lots of shops and dinning underground). Downtown Houston has many luxury hotels, but I saw many homeless people wandering around in downtown. I consider Hilton America a nicer and safer location.
There are fine dining and bars on site as well, which provides more options and convenience to the guests. The gym has a great sky view, and the swimming pool is on top floor. 
There was only one disappointment. My former colleague dropped me a gift bag at the concierge. I forgot to pick it up that day, and it was lost when I went to pick my bag the following morning. Although the concierge patiently helped me to search for the bag and followed up by phone calls, I didn’t receive my bag at the end. 
Overall, I enjoyed the location, the welcoming staff, and the comfortable bed. Hilton Americas is an ideal for business/conference travelers who need to spend a lot of time at the Convention Center.

title: “My Excellent Adventure”
text:
I stayed at the Hilton Americas for almost two weeks on business. My every need was attended to with promptness and a big smile. The food was divine at every restaurant. The room service was extremely fast and equally delicious when I was not eating at one of the restaurants. 
The gym helped me to keep up my work-out routines. Everyone spoke to me by name and made me feel as if I was the only person at the hotel. That is a feat when two or three groups or meeting at the same time. The bed was fit for a queen. I was well rested each morning even after working 12-14 hours a day. 
I recommend this hotel for personal or business. Loved it.

title: “Fantastic Views!”
text:
I loved my stay at the Hilton Americas in Houston, TX. So much so, I would have given it a 5 star rating had it not been for a few things. I can not and will not give a 5 star rating to any hotel, no matter their status, when they charge you such a ridiculous price for parking. It's become a pet peeve of mine. Also, since the hotel is so big, it has different wings. We happened to get on the side of the hotel opposite the pool and observation deck, which made for quite the hike just to get to them. But once you are there... Oh my! The views are fabulous! 
The common areas and rooms were so lovely and I found no fault in them at all. The beds were so comfortable. Several times we took advantage of the free shuttle service, and our driver was very knowledgeable and kind. I appreciated that I had free wifi in room, as many places are starting to charge for this. It's location is perfect and central to so many attractions in Houston. Did I mention the views? We were there over July 4th, and were able to watch several different fireworks displays from the hotel's observation deck. That was such a plus! 
I would and will stay here again, and recommend it to all my friends. :)

title: “Great business stay, but pricey”
text: Great hotel for a business stay, roomy, comfortable work space in the room. The hotel did break my pet peeve...no free wireless Internet in the room! Also, the business center is operated by a shipping company which is good because you can buy some emergency supplies like notecards and sharpies, but bad because you can only use the desktop computers for free if you are printing a boarding pass. Still this is a great hotel to hold a large conference in. Just don't forget your own laptop and 3G connection.

title: “Great Place to stay”
text: My elderly Mom and I were in town for one Saturday night and chose this hotel due to it being close to our destination. Wow, what a pleasant surprise! Great price as we booked the "No Refund" which was $71 and some change tax and all. Sleep Number beds, wonderful bedding, flat screen TV, spacious room, great location close to several restaurants, bar in lobby with a restaurant that serves a great breakfast, fresh cookies in lobby, wonderfull staff...absolutely perfect stay. No reason to look further, will always stay here when in town visiting relatives.

title: “The Hilton Garden Inn is friendly, luxurious, beds are super comfy and it won't break the bank!”
text: It is the perfect place to have family or friends stay when you don’t have any more room in your house! My sister and her family stayed there recently, and they loved it! The rooms are so nice and have granite counters in the bathrooms and are spacious (I’ve seen them), and they’ve got an inexpensive full hot breakfast as well as lots of amenities. In each room is a mini fridge, microwave and flat screen TV. It is reasonably priced, especially on the weekends, and it’s brand-new, so everything is so nice. All the details are just very well done. My sister’s husband has a horrible back, and he never sleeps well on new beds, and he loved the beds! Even better than his mattress at home! The lobby is beautiful- looks like it is for a luxury hotel, complete with a fireplace and marble floors. It’s very nice and impressive when you walk in. The staff is so friendly and wonderful too, and they have fresh cookies in the lobby at all times!

title: “Very comfortable...outstanding location!”
text: We usually stay further downtown, but bid on this 3 night package on Luxury Link and were very impressed. The Sherry Netherland is really a residential hotel, with probably more residents than transient guests. It doesn't have a big lobby or gift shop or coffee bar or hopping bar scene, so if you want those things go somewhere else. What you get is over sized rooms with comfortable furnishings; surprisingly quiet rooms (even though you're at the corner of 59th and 5th) and a drop dead view of either the Plaza Hotel, Central Park's entrance or as we did, the plaza at the CBS Studios. We loved watching TV in the morning seeing Harry Smith, Dave Price and Maggie Rodriguez on our screen and then opening our drapes and seeing them outside our window! Pretty cool. The staff is very professional and very helpful. They do give discounts at several local dining spots and have a business center if you need to print a boarding pass or make a copy. It's so cool to be in an old, established hotel with real elevator operators. Very relaxing and posh. The bedroom was huge and the bathroom nicely appointed, including toothpaste, shaving cream, toothbrushes, free bottled water, soda pop and a lovely flat screen tv and IPOD docking station. Given that the Pierre and Plaza are adjacent, this is a steal!

title: “Perfect”
text: Recently received this room as a gift and took my wife and 9 year old son. It was perfect. The room was spotless, beautiful, and huge. The location is the best in the city (right at the beginning of Central Park - with FAO Schwartz 30 steps away), and the people that work there were unbelievable. They treated us like royalty. If you are in NYC and want a perfect place to stay, STAY HERE!!!!!

title: “Simply Amazing!!!!”
text:
For our first trip to New York, my girlfriend and I and chose to stay at The Chatwal because I read quite a few very good reviews on this hotel. I have to admit that all the reviews I read did not even do this wonderful hotel justice. I have had the chance to stay at some very nice 5-hotels in the past, but this is the first time that I feel that I just HAD to take the time to write about it.
First off, the staff was absolutely charming and always very nice to us. There was even this one instance when, one morning, we leave the room and someone from the staff whom I had yet not met before already knew my name as he wished us a very nice day. I found that to be a very nice human touch.
As for the room, it was simply gorgeous and every aspect of it said abundance, class, and comfort. And as a man, I really enjoyed some of the more luxurious touches such as the hidden HD tv in the bathroom mirror and the heated toilet seat/bidet.
What we also noticed was that the room was cleaned not once, but twice every day so when we'd be coming back to the room after a full day of shopping or an evening on the town, the room would always look perfectly fresh. Just as though it was our first time entering it over and over again.
So this is it for my first hotel review. I would most certainly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone in the world who feels that they deserve to be treated as nicely as humanly possible. You DO deserve to be treated nicely, don't you?

title: “Great for couples but not for four!”
text:
I have stayed at other boutique hotels in New York and thoroughly enjoyed them. This hotel I did not. Please remember though that some events happened while we were there. It does not mean it happens constantly. 
Pros-
Great location between Times Square and 5th ave.
Comfortable beds
Very clean
Older style but updated nicely
Awesome for a romantic getaway or for a solo traveler
Cons
Very dark in lobby, not welcoming
Bellhop not available to open doors for people? Wonderful guys but never around to help. We happened to be coming back to the hotel and had to help arriving guests with large luggage up the stairs on three seperate occasions. I understand it was very hot outside, but when we would walk by other boutique hotels, bellhops were outside sweating it out.
FYI there are stairs to get into the front door, not many but enough when hauling luggage. 
Because the building is older and it was in the 90s during our stay, our home was very warm and we had it turned down all the way. Sorry, I like it really cool when I do come back to rest especially when you have been walking, shopping and sweating all day. 
Rooms are tiny and yes I know that is the standard for New York BUT if you have a party of 4 and are not reserving a suite than you need to look at other hotels. I have stayed at plenty others that have much larger rooms. 
Because it is a boutique hotel and very small, I guess I thought we would be greeted when we would walk in or leave. The bellhop would greet us as he was standing by the front desk half the time instead of the door. :)
For me, I just didn't get the exciting fun feel of New York as I have other times. If you like it quiet, dark and quaint then this is perfect for you.

title: “Excellent Hotel with Free Shuttle (within 3 miles)”
text:
I stayed in Hilton Americas for almost 3 months for a business trip in Houston, and I almost become a part of Hilton Americas' family :-)
The hotel staffs are amazing, friendly, and very helpful. During my stay, I made several friendship with the hotel staffs including: Mayre, Carlos, Daniel, Fredi, Modesto, etc. 
Mayre Guidos (Restaurant Manager) is super friendly to the customer. She would walk around and talk with the customer during breakfast or dinner time, and she is amazingly nice and friendly, and most important she is very sincere and committed to provide the best service to hotel guests. 
The hotel also provide free shuttle within 3 miles (or downtown area), and they are willing to pick you up as well within these 3 miles. Fredi and Modesto are super friendly shuttle drivers that will take you around and ensure your safety as their highest priority. 
The workout room is excellent with all new and complete equipments from cardio to weight training. The Olympic swimming pool is fantastic and has super clean and clear water. 
The hotel is committed to meet, if not, exceed your expectation during the stay. 
Thank you Hilton Americas for your great service.
Ricky Halimah (your guests from August to October 2011)

title: “Great location”
text: The Hilton was one of the better I've stayed in. They had great food, clean and comfortable rooms, and decent service. It wasn't anything spectacular, but it met my expectations. The food for our conference and at the restaurant was very good, but it was expensive. The service didn't quite live up to my expectations - they seem a little aloof, but that's Houston expectaions.

title: “What a great hotel!”
text: Based on reviews here at TripAdvisor, I booked this hotel initially for a week's stay, and ended up extending my lodging there for three weeks. The cleanliness, the friendly and professional staff, the good food, and the sound sleep every night was tremendously welcome. The exercise room is great, with lots of machines, and neat as a pin. The hotel is located just far enough from I-10 that road noise is not an issue. This will be my preferred place to stay for business on the west side of Houston, for certain!

title: “Best Businessman's Hotel in Houston”
text:
This hotel (Hilton garden Inn, Houston Energy Corridor) is by far the most accomadating hotel in Houston. The people are very friendly and service is excellent.
I've stayed there well over 30 times in the last two years

title: “Extremely nice, comfortable hotel - great value”
text: I got the Hilton Garden Inn on a Priceline deal during a quick business trip to Houston. I've never stayed at a Hilton Garden-Inn, but had a great night at this Houston location. The HGI in general was extremely clean, very well decorated, and had a nice lobby and lounge and breakfast area. My room was huge, really huge, including the bathroom. Although it didn't have a couch, there was a nice desk area, along with a coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator. It was very functional and comfortable, and I would stay there again.

title: “The Sherry Netherland is an oasis in NYC!”
text: We had such an amazing time. We felt so well cared for from the minute we pulled up at the hotel until the moment we left. Everyone is so devoted to making you feel comfortable it is truly amazing. You must pop in to Harry Cipriani's for a Bellini...

title: “Amazing experience!”
text: The accomodations at this hotel are simply amazing. The details in the rooms were beautiful, especially the marble in the bathrooms. Adding to the wonderful experience was the courteous, pleasant and exceptionally helpful staff. The piece de resistance? The banana pancakes at Cipriani's were to die for. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: “All in all best place to stay in NYC - more bang for your buck”
text: Have been staying at the Sherry -Netherland for 10 years , about twice a year . If you don't need the " big hotel " feel , then this is the best place to stay in the city . Try and get a room/suite on the highest floor you can . The rooms/suites are all different , and if for some reason you don't like the one they have for you , most of the time they will give you another one . For what you get , it is a real deal .

title: “One of New Yorks best”
text:
Ok I had a one day stay in NYC on business and wanted to splurge a bit. After searching through dozens of hotels on Essentravel.com I found the Sherry Netherland. The price was $700 a night but I said what the heck.
I was not dissapointed. The staff were more than helpful, the rooms were opulent and clean, I had a great stay. 
If you want to splurge a bit, give the Sherry a try. Its great!!

title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at”
text: The Sherry-Netherland is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Though it can be a bit on the pricey side, if you want to splurge, it's worth every penny. When you arrive at the hotel you are greeted by Doormen with white gloves. This may seem like the same as most Luxury hotels in the City, but the Sherry is different. I've been staying here for 20 years, and for most of the time it's been the same people. I know the Doormen by name, they know me. It's nice to arrive in a city not your own and be greeted with a hearty How you doin Mr. Thompson, you feel like family here. The rooms are all Unique, each one decorated by the owner. No expense is spared though. The best part of the Hotel is that it is close to pretty much everything, but at the same time once you get into the Hotel it feels small, relaxed and quiet. It's a welcome respite from the Hustle and Bustle of the City streets. Overall....a top notch hotel, and in this humble business travelers opinion, the best in NYC

title: “Great locate, good value.”
text:
This hotel is within walking distance of many attractions in Manhattan: the United Nations, Times Square, MOMA, etc. We had a suite and it was very nice. New York is an expensive city and other, more famous hotels were charging much more for the same thing.
We did not eat in the restaurant as there was a good deli across the street and, of course, many restaurants nearby, but they do have a breakfast available.
 All in all, a good find.

title: “Good location, good price, good service!”
text: Never having been to New York before, we chose the San Carlos after a lot of research. The location was centrally located, within walking to several sites, the subway and restaurants. We found the room to be spacious and clean. We were on the backside of the hotel so there was no view to speak of but that also meant very little street noise. I used the fitness facility, while small, it was adequate for my needs. Breakfast was included which wad a bonus. Just your typical assortment of yogurt, breads and juices it helped us curb costs and get through until late afternoon. The hotel staff was helpful in securing a cab to the airport and in recommending several nearby spots for casual dining. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a home base from which to plan their trip. It's not going to have the spa, or restaurant, or service of some 5 stars but we also didn't have to pay for that.

title: “Nice hotel in New York, skip the breakfast!”
text:
very nice hotel, quiet, clean, updated rooms with great A/C. The price is good as well, especially for the location - 50th and Lex. Enjoy!
However, you may want to skip the free breakfast - too many other choices in NYC.

title: “Fanstastic stay!”
text:
With 4 NYC hotels under my belt in the same trip, Iroquois far exceeds my expectations and in my opinion, is the choice hotel for me when I visit NYC again. The bed was so comfortable that I spent a lot of time sleeping and having a good rest during my stay. The bathtub was a great addition and the Molton Brown toiletries tops the cake. Housekeeping services are carried out in the day and in the evenings, the hotel provides a turndown service, complete with a weather card for the next day and delicious chocolates on the pillows. 
Internet is complimentary and the signal was strong enough for me to do some work. There is an iron and ironing board in the wardrobe and the luxurious bath robes are handy too. I would also like to commend the hotel for safekeeping my online shopping parcel which arrvied after I checked out. The hotel made a note and allowed me to pick it up at a later date and their exceptional service continues to impress me. Location of the hotel is close to Times Square and the nearest subway station - Bryant Park, is only 5 minutes away. There are many restaurants, diners, duane reade pharmacy and starbucks nearby so you won't regret choosing this hotel.

title: “Very good hotel - good Chelsea location”
text:
My wife and I stayed for a three day weekend. I was very pleased with the hotel. Clean, modern, free glass of wine at checkin & and friendly staff. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was well equipped. 
I liked the location, but you have to want to be in Chelsea. My wife prefers time square / south of Central Park - but I like Chelsea by its hip and a bit out of the craziness of midtown.

title: “Brilliant!”
text: After a 5 hour flight from L.A and a horrible cab ride into manhattan, We arrived on a cold fall evening and were welcomed by Stephen the concierge. He was our knight in shining armor as he not only made us feel very welcome but he upgraded us to a nicer room with a view of the empire state building, a bathtub and the next night sent us a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates! The rooms are beautiful, the staff are fantastic and I couldn't recommend this place enough. I am very picky with service and I feel as though we have found a place that is more than luxury away from home.

title: “Wonderful Service, Luxurious Hotel, Best Staff!”
text:
This was an amazing hotel from the moment we checked in. We were delayed by a traffic jam and exhausted. The staff was so wonderful. 
The room was very comfortable. The bathrooms are amazing!
The food is great. The attention to detail in every way is visible. You feel like you are in a 1940's movie!
The location of the hotel is perfect for a show on Broadway or site seeing! I would go back in a heartbeat!

title: “I was expecting more - not impressed”
text: This is a nice, clean hotel in a good location. However, I found the service to be lacking in a few areas. Despite being a Platinum member, I don't believe I was upgraded to the best available room and wasn't offered a Platinum amenity. The drain in the tub was broken, and it took 10 minutes for someone to come up and fix. The concierge and folks at the front desk were friendly, but those small things were disappointing for what should be a top-rate hotel. When in the area again, I'll stay elsewhere.

title: “Unforgettable stay”
text:
You cannot go wrong with this hotel. I had planned lots of surprises for my honeymoon, and the personal assistant team helped me to have everything ready for our arrival. And believe me, it was LOTS of things they arranged, apart from words written with rose petals on our bed, a chocolate cake for two (to die for) and a bottle of champagne (all complimentary!!!). There were many packages including clothes, action figures, a framed photograph of my husband and I and tickets for a couple of musicals. Really, it was the perfect stay with a warm welcoming from the staff and all. We stayed at one of the avenue apartment suites, quite expensive but got a good discount on expedia, and yes the suite is worth it. The views of NYC are astonishing. 
We also used the SPA and it is amazing, the best treatment I've ever had. In general, this hotel is really good. The only bad thing I will say is that they keep a ridiculous amount of money on your credit card for "extra" expenses. They release the money a couple of working days after check out, still, it's annoying. 
Anyway our honeymoon experience in NYC was AMAZING and we owe a big part to the Setai. Narissa Martin's help was absolutely the best! She's a rock star in personal assisting. And, in general, I believe all the personal assistants at the Setai are very professional and take care of all your needs to guarantee an unforgettable arrival. I would recommend this hotel for a luxurious special ocassion.

title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in”
text: The Setai was one of the most comfortable city hotels I have ever stayed at. The rooms are spacious, nice decor, a window that can be slightly opened for fresh air and staff are simply superb. Add to that the excellent location, it is up there as on of the best

title: “Spacious mid-town luxury”
text: My wife and I spent five nights here on our second visit to NYNY and wished we could have stayed longer. The location is brilliant, right in the middle of what seemed like everything and it was this which made the Andaz stand out of the hotels we could book through Virgin Holidays. The Hotel's receptionist met us at the door, checked us in on their iPad and we were quickly taken to our room in the back tower of the Hotel. The room was gigantic by NY standards, had a luxurious bathroom and very comfortable bed. The air conditioning worked perfectly, fortunately for us as we were visiting during a 100F+ heatwave! The room was quiet at night even though it overlooked E 42nd St and the included screen blind meant we could have privacy from the overlooking tower blocks even with the blind open. The TV had many channels (most in HD) which was useful for when our jet-lag woke us up at strange times of the morning. All in all we were delighted to have found the Andaz, which in our opinion was far more up-market than the price tag suggests. We'd make a bee-line for this place if we ever visit mid-town NY again.

title: “Not a brand hotel, this is special”
text: Great hotel in midtown. Wonderful service and beautiful design. Very modern yet comfortable. Basement bar is interesting, wonderful and intimate. I recommend this hotel, particularly if you are staying near Bryant park.

title: “Upper west side!”
text: Our stay at the beacon hotel was excellent from the moment we got there til the moment we left. The staff were friendly and helpful they always put your needs first just to make sure your stay at the beacon won't be your last stay at the beacon. We spent a week in NYC. This hotel was two blocks from the nearest subway station so if you're not familiar with the trains I suggest you do as times square is about a 20min to 30min walk from the hotel whether you like to walk that's up to you we did it a few times just to become familiar with the surrounding area. As we were on the upper west side Central Park was only two blocks from the hotel. Also being in this area the rules are enforced that drivers are not allowed to honk horns so you won't be hearing that constant noise all the time. Our view was spectacular the sun rose above the buildings over the upper east side and turned orange every afternoon. The room had a very comfy king bed medium bathroom, kitchenette, flat screen tv, free wifi, in room safe. Hotel has computers and printer, washers and dryers, fairway supermarket across the street, up the street Starbucks and the best italian restaurant serafina, as this hotel is on broadway there is a theatre next to the hotel, there is no pool but who needs to go swimming you're in NYC you will never get bored! Highly recommended!

title: “Beautiful”
text:
This hotel was wonderful to stay in. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were serviced daily. The conceirge was always available to help with all your questions and to help book excursions.
The Hotel itself was 2 block from Central Park and just a short walk to 72nd st subway station which made it so easy to get around either uptown or downtown.
I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone that is staying in New York.

title: “A super New York hotel with large bedrooms”
text: So this hotel is a mile or so from Times Square but it's easy to move around as there is a tube station right outside. It's a stones throw from Central Park but the biggest advantage of this hotel is that the bedrooms are very large, especially by NY standards. Didn't really use any of the facilities but the bedroom was very clean & the staff were very helpful. There is a really interesting market over the road selling everything you can imagine and, as the bedrooms all have a kitchenette, this is a bonus if you fancy a night in. All in all a great hotel in which to unwind after a busy day in the city

title: “Astounding level of customer service”
text:
I stayed at this Four Seasons location twice in March for a total of 2 weeks, and I can honestly say, without exaggeration, that I never opened the front doors of the hotel myself: the level of attentiveness of the doormen was that good (even at 4 AM). And that's just the beginning of the stellar customer service.
Don't let a previous whiny review about outdated decor fool you, if you are using the hotel for business you could not be in more capable hands, and the style of both the personal hotel rooms and the business center and conferences room was modern and tasteful. 
Our group had no problems with check in, luggage being delivered to rooms, cleanliness of rooms, or billing. The beds are divine, the shower/bathroom luxurious. The concierge was wonderfully helpful. The front desk was prompt. But I have to go back to the customer service, and especially the valet. Our group was renting more than 5 company SUVs, two box trucks containing valuable film equipment, and a stakebed, and they handled the chaos without batting an eye. Even when we occasionally lost valet tickets or had delays in loading gear and held up the clockwork precision of the front of house parking. I can't recommend the hotel enough, especially based on this.
Not to rave too long, but I have to include this example of the insane level of customer service: I was walking through the lobby to my room after working all night, and carrying a smoothie I had just picked up from a local restaurant for breakfast. I asked the front desk a question and accidentally dropped my smoothie and spilled it all over the lobby (to my utter embarrassment). After trying to help mop up and being shooed away, I made it upstairs to my room and got a phone call exactly five minutes after unlocking the door. It was room service. They politely stated that they understood I had dropped a smoothie that was full, and could they replace it for me with a new one on the house? People, I hadn't even bought the smoothie from the hotel, so that was totally unnecessary. I was blown away.
In short, highly recommend this hotel for groups and business travelers.

title: “Flawless”
text: Staying the weekend here and once again, customer service is excellent. Amazing, clean rooms. Very spacious. Staff makes you feel at home from the moment valet greets you, until they see you depart. Can't say it enough, it's a great place and this is the home away from home for us.

title: “Quiet part of Downtown, Still close enough to enjoy it all.”
text: I travel frequently for work and look to take advantage of Marriott hotel Points. I was pleased to see that this place had nice reviews, and was part of the Marriott family. The Lobby, lounge and Restaurant once was home to a bank. It is very comfortable, and I find myself frequently eating here as opposed to heading to other areas down town. I love the rooms. They have an “antique” feel to them, while still being modern and very clean. If you have to stay in the Houston, do yourself a favor, give this place a shot. I can almost guarantee that you’ll feel you made the right decision. BTY: the city trolley train is right outside, making it even easier to get around the area.

title: “Nice small hotel”
text: Stayed at the hotel in January. Rooms are quite plain but clean and tidy. The area is being redeveloped and will be nice when it's complete. The Yard House pub is lively and serves about 50 different draft beers. The food is also great at the Yard House and the Bistro Alex.

title: “A beautiful hotel”
text:
Super comfortable rooms, modern but elegant decor and very good location. Just walk outside and a slew of great restaurants and shops are within minutes of walking distance. Front desk staff are welcoming and helpful. 
Direction to the place is a bit tricky

title: “Great Time!”
text: This hotel is awesome! From the looks to the rooms. We stayed in a balcony suite which was great... very spacious clean...The only thing is the view isn't the best but to me it didn't really matter cause the room was great. There is a skywalk to the mall which is convenient. Overall stay is much better than the Westin galleria. Will be coming back!

title: “Nice New Hotel.... but Front Desk and Breakfast not so great.”
text: We stayed on a weekend. Nice new hotel, recently built, very clean. Valet staff was great - especially Jose/Diya. Front desk staff was polite but impersonal, very sterile. Answered your questions but with no warmth or inclination to be delightful and with one word replies. I am a gold SPG member and they pretended they had no upgraded rooms available. I persisted and told them I knew hotel was mostly vacant. Which is when they relented and upgraded me. Club floor lounge evening host was very nice and friendly, genuinely seeking to go above and beyond. Breakfast in the morning was a let down. Not refilled even when items ran out and not enough variety to begin with. Very easy skywalk access to the adjoining mall. Overall not a bad stay. But staff needed quite a bit of polishing and training.

title: “Great place to stay!”
text: We stayed in this hotel as a family with 5 children. The split room with a king and sofa sleeper suited us just fine; the staff was willing to bring in a crib and a very comfy, large roll-away to accomodate the family. This save us from splitting our family and from having to rent two rooms. The food was great; a lot to choose from for being free. And who could complain about free dinner? The free popcorn and beverages in the evening were the clincher. Only the children wished there was a non-soda option, like lemonade between 3-10pm. This hotel was very clean, very spacious, and very accomodating. Our room was quiet. Even though they accept smoking in some rooms and pets, our room smelled of nothing but cleanliness. Staff was very thorough when cleaning the rooms. The pool area was clean, but a little chilly. We are Ohioans, so it doesn't bother us much. This stay was altogether fabulous. We will definately locate the drury hotels for all our future hotel stays.

title: “Good place to stay”
text: Very clean, nice linens, super staff-manager Jose Miranda interacted with the guests in the evening. Secured parking was very nice. Will be back.

title: “Excellent for business travel/conferences, etc.”
text:
For many years we have stayed at this Crowne Plaza for an annual conference of a society we belong to. The society needs a variety of accomodations for a full 3 day event: welcome party & general gathering room, a large meeting room for 8 hours of Power Point presentations that can be turned into a banquet room 2 hours later & the banquet itself & on the last day, a double size banquet room for a vendor expo that is open to the public as well as members. The expo. extends into the hotel's side lobby, too. Every year it comes off without a hitch. 
Now, at the same time they are accomodating other events - weddings, meetings, etc. & 2 or 3 churches without buildings meet there for their Sunday Services. This 5 ring circus goes on very unobtrusively to each of the rings. They have meeting rooms suitable for 12 to 675 people.
Cost: guest room conference price is very low, quality very high. I don't know how much they charge the society for the 3 days of space & the banquet with wine, but you can judge by the fact that it's a non-profit society & this is their annual fund raiser. It has to be reasonable.
Business travelers will appreciate the large guest room, free WiFi everywhere, 2 phones w/ data port, voicemail & oversized work desk. Business center & fitness center, both key accessed. Very nice pool, patio, hot tub. Poolside guest rooms have private patios. The staff is most gracious.
One negative: The breakfast buffet in the coffee shop offers every item you can think of, but lacks flavor & cost $14! On the other hand, there are many, many restaurants very near by.

title: “Working smarter”
text:
I stayed at this hotel for a conference and arrived at the same time as other attendees. Because of the line at the front desk, extra employees came to the line to check that we had proper ID and paperwork ready. They even took our IDs to copy in order to save the desk clerk the time. The check-in line moved very quickly because of the extra employee's assistance. Thumbs up to a place who knows to work smarter not harder. 
Two thumbs up to Aurelia at the front for being extremely helpful and courteous!

title: “Seminar and Stay in Houston”
text: I speak at seminars across the country and found the amenities and staff at this hotel to be among the best! Rita and Henry were absolutely fantastic! They both displayed hospitality and charm that was inviting and welcoming at check-in and throughout my time there. This hotel far surpassed my expectations and it was the staff that made the difference!

title: “Business Trip to Houston”
text: Rizwan, Henry, Julier, and the overall entire staff were AWESOME! They provided exceptional care and service. I lost my phone before arriving to Houston, and I had a new phone shipped to the Crowne Plaza hotel. The manager, Rizwan, personally took responsibility of making sure I got my new phone.
