Other staff members were aware of my phone situation, and did randomly check without me having to ask for them to check. Where do you get that kind of service?

title: “Good Hotel”
text: Stayed here for a conference and the hotel is in a great location. Connected to the convention center and within 4 blocks of multiple restaurants and a mall. The lobby is impressive, especially the bar area. We said it looks like a villains underground headquarters with the world map behind the bar. Stayed for 3 nights and looking forward to the next convention so I can stay there again!

title: “High quality hotel in downtown Houston”
text: The hotel has an impressive lobby. It has excellent conference facilities and is well staffed. The rooms are modern and well kept as well as being very clean. It is a perfect hotel for business, but is quite far from anywhere. The hotel is almost adjacent to both the Toyota Center and Minute Maid Park Stadium. I had a great stay.

title: “Great hotel, so-so location”
text:
I recently stayed at the Hilton Americas for four nights. I was in town for a business conference. This was one of the best properties I've ever stayed at and the conference was served by the staff as well as I've ever seen. The hotel is nice and clean. The staff are incredibly attentive and friendly, from the front desk, to the restaurant, to the housekeepers to the banquet staff. Very impressive. They have been trained well.
The room was comfortable and well lit and had most of the amenities you would need. One downside to the rooms is that there was no refrigerator. But the bed was comfortable and the room was quiet even though the hotel was pretty full.
On the down side, on three different floors, none of the vending machines were fully functional. That's not a big deal, but it did factor in one fairly significant way. The hotel does not provide bottled water in the rooms. The water out of the tap in the bathroom was lukewarm. And, as mentioned, there was no refrigerator. So, if you want cool drinking water, you're at the mercy of the vending machines.
The hotel was a bit on the pricey side, so even though it was very nice, it may not be a good option for budget travelers. And then when you add the fact that breakfast is not included, other properties (notably the Embassy Suites across the street) start to look like better options financially.
Also, the hotel is handicapped a bit by its location. I found that there isn't much going on downtown after 5 PM and there aren't many (any) reasonably priced restaurants downtown that are open for dinner. So if you're without transportation, plan on spending a good bit on meals. But if you need to be downtown (e.g., especially for an event at the convention center) it is a very convenient location. And it seemed to be a relatively safe location, as well.
All in all, my experience was great. But it was a little pricey and there are limited options for meals or other things to do outside the hotel. So, overall, I can just rate it four stars even though, if you don't mind the price and need to be downtown, it is a super option.

title: “You have to leave home, stay here.”
text: Sometimes the most resounding feedback is what you don't hear - and I never heard a single word of complaint from the members of our group. For my own experience, I saw that everything was in order from the get-go, your front desk people had all the reservation info quickly at hand (probably the fastest check in I've ever seen), the entire place esp including my room was spotless and the pool/hot tub were pristine. All personnel were pleasant and helpful. Overall, staying with you was a positive experience that I would gladly recommend to others, and your crisp arrangements were a big part of it.

title: “Good service...clean space... very welcoming”
text:
I travel often and this hotel was good. The staff were some of the nicest that I have met.
Maria at breakfast was warm, attentitve and helpful.
Boris at the front desk was knowledgeable, helpful, and worked to make sure that my questions were answered.
I will probably be staying at this hotel again in the future.

title: “Fantastic - My new best place to stay in Houston”
text: This was a fantastic hotel. The rooms were spacious (we had a family room and a connecting room), it was very clean and well serviced by cleaning staff over the christmas and new year period. In addition, the breakfast is varied and of good value, it has a nice gym and a nice outdoor pool (the smaller one is heated). The beds were very comfortable. I hardly noticed anything from falling asleep to waking up. The shower is great and the bathroom is well stocked with towels and bath products. It has free wifi and the business center has free internet and a heavy duty printer. You don't have a lot of staff assistance for minor things like carrying your luggage and the domestic staff are sometimes too overly keen to clean your room, but for the price , and even if it was more expensive, it is definitely worth it, and we had a fantastic stay. We were able to use their bathroom scales to weigh our luggage and the location is also very good for most places from downtown to the airport.

title: “Great Location, Good Service, Rooms Vary in Size + View etc.”
text:
Perfect Location => 5th + 59th => Easy to Catch Cabs, good for mid-town meetings + restaurants. Rooms vary tremendously => Suites are massive (some have kitchens) and others have huge living rooms with great views - try either 2nd floor overlooking 59th or up high toward Park.
Room service menu is limited but decent => with New York Prices $$$$. Room prices have come down a lot! Paid ~$350 with corporated discount (+taxes).
Bed is very comfortable. Check-in/Check-out is super quick => not a lot of rooms available. Most of the building is private residences. Good Security => Elevator Man in the lifts.

title: “Superb - Best in NYC”
text:
This is going to sound a bit over the top but I had an exceptional stay at the Sherry Netherland and give the hotel my highest recommendation:
Location: A perfect location for exploring the city. Central Park is across the street, the exclusive Boutique shops of 5th Avenue and Madison are blocks away, Broadway Theater - Rockefeller Center - top Restaurants and Museums are all a short walk (there is also a beautiful restaurant off the lobby - Cipriani's - but we did not have a chance to visit).
Service: Warm, friendly and very crisp service was delivered throughout my stay. Housekeeping was flawless - with one of the most thorough evening turn-down services I think I have ever experienced. Every inch of our suite was immaculate. 
Room: Staying at the Sherry is like having your own luxury apartment right in the city. We had a City View Suite with a lovely view, spacious living area, dining area, beatuiful bath with a fantastic shower and every bath amenity imaginable, and great bedding and linens. Fresh flowers, chocolates, and soft drinks were complimentary with a nice welcome note from the management. The decor was classy and elegant and included all of the modern electronic conveniences. 
Summary: Staying at the Sherry makes you feel like a celebrity. It is so intimate and personal, yet offers everything (and all of the services) you can want. Hands down my favorite hotel in NYC.

title: “The Old World Discovered”
text: When you arrive the door will be opened for you. When you get into the sequestered gilded lobby you will be introduced to each of the staff members who will be helping you during your stay. One of them will escort you to your room. This is a hotel for extreme privacy, right on the southern edge of Central Park. The spacious rooms evoke an old Holywood film, and you leave partly surprised you didn't meet Fred Astaire. If you've never felt special, this place will teach you some tricks.

title: “Good location, large room”
text: I had to be in New York on late notice and was priced out of my favorite hotel, the New York Palace. I was able to secure a small suite at the San Carlos for about the same price I would pay for a room at the Palace (a bit more than $400/nt). While the service and amenities are not up to the same standard as a 5 star hotel, I had a very nice stay and would go again. Having two rooms plus a small kitchen counter and sink is a plus. If you are traveling and prefer to buy take-out and eat in your room it is a good set-up. Plus if you are on a business with your spouse one person can work, talk on the phone or watch TV while the other sleeps in the bedroom. There was a free continental breakfast next the lobby but I did not have time to partake, It did rain one of the days I was there and a pile of umbrellas greeted guests as they walked out the door. The location, 50th and 3rd is excellent with great restaurants all around and not far from shopping and the theatre. They do not have the most luxurious furniture but it was more than adequate. The older AC was a bit noisy but these are minor complaints to a very nice stay. I will stay again.

title: “Great location! Quiet and clean room.”
text: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel was very centrally located with many great restaurants and sights within walking distance. The room was very clean and comfortable. Our room was on the back side of the hotel and we did not hear any street noise. Not much a view, just the back of another building, but we slept great. Staff was friendly and the price was reasonable. We highly recommend this hotel.

title: “Great hotel...”
text:
We stayed in an executive suite with our baby daughter for week and loved the hotel. It's in a great location, the staff were friendly and really helpful and it's not often you get breakfast (albeit a continental one) and free wifi included in your room rate.
Our room was of a decent size, the kitchen area was well stocked, the small dining table and sofa came in handy and the beds extremely comfortable. We found the doorman and reception staff to most helpful and pleasant throughout our stay.
The only one thing I could fault was the carpets could have done with a better hoover on our arrival. It’s a small point as all other cleanliness was spot on.

title: “Housekeeping horrible but nice room for price.”
text: My husband and I picked this hotel for the size of the room as my mom stayed with us a few nights. The room overall was in a good location and big in size (except for the bathroom). However, the housekeeping is a huge disappointment. When we arrived, the sheets were stained. This is a small hotel, so we were left to chg the sheets on our own. Then the next day, I noticed that the hall 1/2 bath had urine underneath the toilet bowl by the floor. I informed the front desk, and again, never got a response. The urine was left on the toilet bowl. When my mom, arrived, she found filthy, stained sheets on her fold out couch. The stains appeared to be blood stained. Also, we asked housekeeping to refill the towels in the 1/2 bath, but again, to no avail. I wd also not recommend this hotel if you are new to nyc. They do not have a real concierge. The doorman was great, however.

title: “Truly fabulous Hotel. Highly recommend”
text:
I spent a week in NYC on my own a few months back and I highly recommend this boutique Hotel. It was perfect.
Ideal location with 5th Avenue being at one end and Times Square being two blocks at the other end, although once inside the Hotel you wouldn't know that you were in the hub of YC with how quiet it was. The room was lovely, the concierge were fantastic (hello sold out Ice Hockey tickets), the bottle of wine, sparkling water and chocolates on arrival were appreciated and I got upgraded which was fabulous. 
The staff were really attentive, remembering everything that I told them the next day and overall very sweet. Being on my own I felt very safe being there and the amazing location meant everything was easily accessible late at night without the need to even get a taxi. I loved the fact there was a Duane Reade just around the corner for late night drinks, snacks and nail polish too!
They had the cutest turn down service where chocolates and the weather for the following day were placed on your pillow...oh and the gorgeous bath products meant I was always wrapped up in a Molton Brown cocoon before bed. Love.

title: “OK, but we would not go back”
text: We booked the hotel because we got a deal through Booking.com for a "Superior Queen" for about $200/night. When we arrived the room we were given was dark, tiny, on the fire escape and the bed looked far more like a double than a queen. We were able to upgrade to a room with a queen sized bed but had to pay a further $50 a night. The room was noisy which we expected because it was right on 44th and it was generally clean but really annoyingly the A/C (and heat) are centralised and controlled by the front desk. My wife was freezing in the room but the only way to control the temperature is to open and close the vents in the room so it was either stuffy because there was no air coming in or very cold. For the most part the staff were friendly and helpful (although one girl, in response to our comment that it was cold in the room did say my wife should just wear a sweater). Still, we felt duped by the description of the room we originally booked and, for the price we ultimately paid, could have stayed in a nicer hotel. Overall, except for the staff's friendliness, we found little to recommend and we left disappointed. We would not go back.

title: “Brilliant”
text: My partner and I stayed here,3 weeks ago, in September, and to say we were impressed would be an understatement, we booked from New Zealand and found the reception staff all excellent.On our arrival we were so tired and the staff were both speedy and efficent, we had asked for a high up room with a view if it was possible.When we got to our room we were so happy to see the Empire State building and a fabulous view, not only that we had a lovely gift basket including a bottle of red wine and a lovely handwritten letter from the manager, I honestly can't say enough about this hotel, from the front desk to the superb bedding everything was first rate, thank-you for a truly delightful stay.

title: “Excellent Location and Staff”
text: I stayed for 3 nights at the Eventi and it was just a great stay. The room was a good size, the shower was great, the bed very comfortable and all the staff, from front desk reception, restaurant, security and housekeeping were friendly and very professional. I was there on business so was out most of the day but returning every night was just a pleasure and I felt comfortable and safe as a lone woman. I would definitely go back and imagine for a special occasion and leisure trip it is a fantastic place to stay, as the location is perfect. I know New York well and didn't need to ask directions or advice from the staff, but from what I overheard when other guests did seek such advice, the staff were knowledgable and helpful.

title: “Service was beyond great”
text: I've been to Eventi more than once, and always found it clean and comfortable. This week, however, I was in town on a special occassion, and without any prompting the front desk clerk had champagne sent to my room. It was an unexpected, nice touch. I will definitely be back.

title: “Spectacular Hotel!”
text: This is truly the nicest hotel I have ever been in! I picked this hotel for the location to Times Square. The hotel looks like you are walking into another time and place. I happen to love the 30'-40's era and the Chatwal made me feel like I was there. The attention to detail of furnishings is amazing. Professional staff great you with a smile and make you feel special from the minute you walk in. We booked the Junior Suite at a price that I would normally not pay. But I thought for just once, spend a little more to see what happens. Well, I never wanted to leave the room. It was so wonderful! We were there for a quick night into the city to see a concert and I can be sure we will stay at the Chatwal again! I can't wait to come back!

title: “Boutique and Luxurious - but Staff makes it even better!”
text:
Our recent stay at the Chatwal was amazing at every level - I rarely write reviews but I think our experience should be shared. I travelled with my husband, 6 year old daughter and 20 year old nephew...as frequent travellers, we bring our daughter everywhere with us and she always rates the hotels. She compared the Chatwal to many other 5+ stars and we all agreed that we would return. Our nephew appreciated the art deco design and loved the tv in the mirror. He also liked the location as it was steps from Times Square, but my husband also noted how quiet and serene it was at night in the hotel (it was hard to believe we were in the middle of Times Square when we were in our room). We didn't have any issues with noise which was nice!
Check-in:
The staff at the Chatwal are all so professional and friendly, and most of all helpful. Prior to my arrival, the Concierge staff (Nick, Tim, Juan, Pierre) emailed me with hotel, weather, and local information as well as answered all of my questions and arranged for everything that was requested, including accepting packages and making reservations for dining/transportation, etc. Check-in with Catalina was literally 5 minutes and we were in our room with our luggage and a tour of the room right away. 
When I was out and about during the day, I was able to email concierge with any requests or questions and they were always answered almost immediately or in a timely manner. Thanks so much to everyone at Concierge!
Staff:
Our butler, Brandon, was most efficient and even had delicious treats for my daughter pre-dinner...it was perfect and she lasted until we were settled and decided on a place to dine at. He was available to greet us either in the lobby or seen in the hallways, and most of the staff remembered us all by first names. 
The cleaning staff were all efficient and no complaints whatsoever - fresh towels were provided daily and replenished at night if needed. Doorstaff are always available to flag down a cab or arrange for transportation.
Room:
The room was extremely spacious and amenities well-thought of. You can be assured that all of the little details are taken care of - from the umbrella in the closet, to the computer phone, to the spacious storage and snack bar, different types of hangers in the closet as well as lint remover, shoe horn, laundry bag, etc. Plenty of hanging storage, and chest of drawers are provided.
A list of amenities that can be requested from your butler is available in the guest info book. The suede walls, and soft carpet was a nice touch and I'm sure doubled as a noise-buffer for the rooms. Complimentary shoe shines are offered daily and the mini bar included shakers, gourmet snacks and a wide range of beverages/alcohol, and many magazines are stored with the mini bar. 
The motorized drapes are controlled by the computer phone but we had them closed most of the time. The desk also turned into a make-up vanity and media centre which you can use as a charging station or computer work area. 
Beds:
The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable and the turn-down service great. The reading lights at the side of the bed are handy.
Ensuite:
The bathroom design is important, and we always look for a hotel with somewhat luxurious bathrooms. This bathroom included contemporary Kohler fixtures including a heated bidet seat, tv in the mirror by the vanity and an extensive amenities box. The speakers on the ceiling make it easy to hear the tv while in the bath or shower. Shower options include a handheld, rain shower head, and tub with spa jets. The Asprey products are one of our favourites too. The entire bathroom is tiled in a sparkly, Black Galaxy granite which gives a nice glamourous/luxurious feel.
Robes and slippers are also provided.
Dining Options:
Room service is available 24 hours a day, 2nd floor lounge provides refreshments and snacks + bar, and dinner at the Lamb's Club is a must!
Other:
We all commented on the elevator access (each guest has to scan their card before the elevator would work) which made us feel safe. You will learn more about the hotel's history during your overview of the room, and most of the movies playing in the elevator had some sort of connection to the hotel.
As you enter the elevator area in the lobby, you will find refreshments (iced-tea for us) and a quaint sitting area. The spa and pool were under renovations during our stay, but we were told that spa and pool access could be arranged at one of the hotel's partner sites. We didn't take advantage of this as our stay wasn't long enough to do so. 
The gym was extremely clean, a little small but had a bike, treadmills, elliptical and free-weights, a bench and exercise ball, towels and bottled water, and yoga mats. If you forget your ipod you can borrow one from the hotel or grab a pair of earphones for the tv's.
Complimentary wifi is available in each room, and ipods, ipads and laptops are offered for complimentary use at check-in. A Backgammon set is available in each room as well.

title: “Classic Art Deco in the Heart of the Theater District!”
text:
I love this hotel. This was the second time we'd stayed there and it is a favorite, to be sure! A small lobby for check in, wonderful staff. The lounge upstairs is a great place for people watching after working hours or late night. Their restaurant downstairs is quite excellent, although I think if you're in New York you should get out of your hotel for dinner.
You are in the heart of all things theater and only a block or so from Times Square.
The rooms are VERY spacious for downtown NYC and have every amenity you need and don't. Perfect little wardrobes, mini bars, full length mirrors, it's all very high end. The bathrooms are extremely luxurious and, I know this sounds weird, but the toilets are rather decadent. That's all I have to say about that, you'll see what I mean when you stay.
The spa and pool are beautiful and I thought the masseuse that I had was world class. This hotel combines a retro New York City feel in a charming and warm atmosphere, all while letting you know that this is a full service, luxury property and whatever you need will be delivered.
Love it.

title: “2 Days of Bliss in NYC”
text: The Setai NYC, is one of the best hotels we have every stayed in, every single member of staff goes that extra mile to make you feel welcome..Rooms are superb..Restaurant Excellent..Bar on Fifth with nightly Jazz is again Excellent.. Would recommend without exception,

title: “The best hotel, in the world!”
text:
We recently stayed at the Setai as part of our honeymoon to the USA and I felt compelled to write a review to comment on how fantastic the hotel was. Like many of the reviewers of this hotel we had excellent communication from their Personal Assistant, in our case Kimberly Small. Kimberly was outstanding and did everything possible to make our stay the best it could possibly be. I think that this part of the hotel service sets the Setai apart from any hotel that we have ever stayed at.
The attention to detail at this hotel is superb and we could not find fault with any part of the Setai, the room was out of this world, we had a suite which offered fantastic space and style. The turn down service offered by the hotel is unbelievably good. In short, everything was perfect. 
 I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely return. It is perfect in every way.
Location wise, also perfect for all the sites and there are some amazing restaurants nearby as well.

title: “Nice, but not worthy of a six star rating”
text: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary quite recently. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we could sense that the hotel was understaffed and not immune from the commotion of the surrounding area. For example, when our cab pulled to the front of the property, one of the front desk clerks actually had to run outside to assist us with our bags (as the bellman/door man) were busy. Once we were able to enter the (very small) lobby area, there was a wait to check in... understaffed.... The hotel elevators were very busy....we had to wait for one of the four elevators for a number of minutes each time.... the rooms, though nice, were dark and did not have movies on demand.... So, overall, a nice property.. but ABSOLUTELY NOT at the same level as the Penninsula Hotel down the street.... this property should her really considered 4.5 stars... not 6 stars.... understaffed .....

title: “Mr Tony Rose”
text: Outstanding hotel! I have travelled extensively, and stayed in many hotels worldwide. The Setai Fifth Avenue in New York is exceptional. The rooms are stylishly appointed, in a minimilistic way, and the service from all staff has been exceptional. The complimentary coffee and drinks in the room is a nice touch, as is free wi-fi facility. Room service from delivery to quality was perfectly executed. Will definitely return, and recommend the hotel highly.

title: “We totally enjoyed our stay at the Andaz”
text: Central location, we enjoyed stunning views of New york library from our large window. Staff helpful, friendly and attentive. Thanks in particular to Joe and Amanda who went the extra mile in making us feel welcome. Most comfortable bed, room spacious, chic and very clean. It is a lovely hotel and we will most certainly visit again, excellent

title: “It's a nicely located boutique hotel”
text: The location is good, the room is cool, the price is reasonably, the bed is very comfortable, but the breakfast is pricey. The check in and check out is pretty quick. The staff is friendly. Most of the stuff in the mini-bar is free. The room I stayed in has no view, but that's fine for me, as I don't spend a lot of time in the room.

title: “Been a regular and am happy”
text:
I have been coming here many times now after trying a couple of hotels in New York: a few Ian Schrager, The Chambers, Parker Meridient, The London, W.
There is nothing exceptional (particularly vs. the great Asian hotels) in the property but it ranks very good on all fronts. There is no real weakness. Not the hypest hotel but great, big and functional rooms. Quiet rooms too.
Staff is young, energetic and mostly helpful.

title: “Great hotel, excellent location.”
text: My fiancee and I spent two nights at the Andaz 5th Ave and absolutely loved it. Even though the car drive had a difficult time finding the hotel to drop us off, everything else was fantastic. The staff at the hotel were very professional and responsive. By far though, my favorite thing about the hotel is its location. We are theatre people, and were with a nice 10-15 minute walk of every show we wanted to see AND YET we were far enough from Times Square that we felt we could escape the "hustle and bustle" of the theatre district. We'll definitely be back.

title: “Very enjoyable”
text: We had a great 5 day stay at the Hotel Beacon. Great location with numerous restaurants and eateries surrounding the hotel. It is next door to the Beacon Theatre, 5 minute walk from Central Park and a short sub way, bus or taxi ride to downtown. The main attractions such as Time Square, 9/11 Memorial as well as shopping all require some sort of travel. The subway station is close by and about a 20 min trip to downtown. We travelled via the subway several times and never felt concerned for our safety, in fact we found the "locals" very willing to engage with travels and all to willing to assist with directions. Overall we loved NYC and the people there. The pace of the city is hectic but if you just go with it, you will have a great time. We found the hop on hop off bus ours a great way to see the points of interest as well as to get your bearings. My view is that no matter where you stay in NYC you will need to travel to see all the highlights. With that in mind, I would happily stay at the Hotel Beacon on my next visit.

title: “Great New York City Hotel!”
text: Stayed here for only one night prior to cruising to Canada. Wish we could have stayed longer! We had booked a double/double (and the beds were wonderful), but we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. So much space! Having the additional lounge and kitchenette would be wonderful for a longer stay. The location is wonderful - near Central park, Columbia University, and so many wonderful restaurants and stores nearby, but no street noise! The 72nd street subway station was about 3 (?) blocks away. I will definitely stay here again when returning to New York, especially for a longer stay. It was very spacious for a hotel in New York.

title: “Beautiful Upper West side property”
text:
Super hotel, highly recommended for location, value, service and the room itself - clean, spacious, upmarket with a fridge, cutlery etc
Close to Grays Papaya legendary hot dog joint, and a stones throw from the subway taking you to mid/downtown within minutes. 
Quiet part of time and very gentrified, right next to the Beacon theatre and opposite the superb Fairway market - a gourmands paradise.

title: “Quiet hotel”
text:
If you want to stay in New York but do not want the noise of downtown the Beacon is ideal, it is quite a way out but very conveniently situated with the red line just around the corner which takes you down to places like 42nd street, Times Square. The hotel rooms are very well decorated and have great facilities including a small kitchen area with two rings, toaster etc. the hotel does not provide food in any way but with the convenience of a very large supermarket directly across the road which sells everything you could possibly need including hot food to take out. There is also an eating place next door which has good food all day. Central park is within walking distance.
New York is not one of my favourate places but if you like it the Beacon is a very good base

title: “Four Seasons Property but there are a few weak points here”
text: I had an Executive Suite and the bedroom is separate from the living room. The air conditioning control was in the living room. At 68 degree setting, the living room was chilly but the bedroom was warm even though there was a vent in the room. I left the door open all night but it never really cooled down. If I were staying here again, I wouldn't take this kind of suite. Also, the elevator service in the hotel was slow at almost all hours. It was intolerable when there were crowds in the lobby. I was told this was because the hotel was fully occupied. And I think one of the elevators was out of service. But I think they need to update their elevators anyway. Otherwise, Quattro restaurant was very good for breakfast and lunch; the room was nice; the gym is one of the best in town for hotels; there is a real spa on the property which is probably unique for a Houston hotel; and the pool area is quite nice with a jacuzzi. The hotel is close to Hobby airport and the best choice if you are in downtown or going to the nearby convention center. If you need to be in the Galleria, the St. Regis is my default choice for that neighborhood, but if I had to put the two hotels side by side, it would be tough. I've been more impressed with the rooms at the St. Regis but the common facilities at this hotel are superior (except for the elevators). But the hotel has some kinks to work out if it wants an Excellent rating from me.

title: “Not a Lot of Options in Downtown Houston: Service is Always A Plus at The Four Seasons”
text:
Well, I'll admit I struggled as to whether I should rate this property as a 3 or 4. One thing you can always count on at the Four Seasons, anywhere, is excellent service. Service was pretty great, but the property itself seems a little neglected. With that said, this is a rather tired Four Seasons. The room where I stayed--especially bathroom-- could stand to be updated to match other properties. Soundproofing between rooms as well as hallway also seemed to be lacking. 
There were several weddings the weekend I arrived, so it was a bit chaotic, and staff seemed less attentive to us non wedding party people than usual. Understandable, I suppose. A nice amenity is the large outdoor pool w/jacuzzi and bar area. Some rooms lead directly to the pool with poolside patios. If you want some sun and fun, I recommend those rooms, which also provide 24 hr access to the area while others are restricted between late evening and early morning. The fitness room is also quite nice and was in the process of being refurbished at the end of my stay. 
A real negative for the hotel, that I have not experienced at other Four Seasons, was poor quality food. I ate in the somewhat touted restaurant and it was really mediocre, especially for the money. The menu items sounded good but the execution was less than pleasing: too creamy, too saucy, too salty, etc. I also ordered room service one morning and I was equally disappointed with the poor food quality. 
And, on a side note, I was charged $7 for an 8 ounce cup of coffee at the pool, when unknowingly, just steps away in the fitness room, there was free coffee and tea. I never signed for the coffee, so could not dispute it at the time. The staff did remedy this charge upon check out as they were in equal disbelief that this was the charge. BUT, with these factors aside, if you have to stay in downtown Houston, not sure you will find a better place.

title: “Best place to stay in downtown Houston”
text: This hotel is quite elegant. They staff is so friendly and helpful. The beds are the best! We are considering purchasing a Four Seasons bed. The in-room breakfast is fabulous.

title: “Room's”
text: Very nice rooms and the beds are amazing also the furniture provided for us like a desk and a comfy little couch and the bathrooms are so well decorated and the shower's are so relaxing and the whole room is clean and the room service was just so incredible it was like they had already knew what we wanted

title: “A great place to relax!”
text:
My husband and I celebrated our 8th wedding anniversary with a night here. The hotel, previously an old bank building, has been beautifully remodeled into casual elegance with a few charming details left alone (the clock-style elevator floor indicator, the brass and marble accents, etc.). I think they just finished the interior remodel on June 30th, and they were still working on the exterior during our stay (the valet entrance was moved to Travis).
We took a junior suite on the 11th floor, and it was stunning. The king bed was the definition of comfort and the corner location meant we had two big windows on each of the outer walls, done up with roman shades, sheer curtains and heavy blackout shades for the sun-shy. The couch and the over-sized chair were very comfortable, and despite the fact that we were facing two busy downtown streets the soundproofing was pretty effective.
The bathroom was at least half the size of the bedroom and contained a giant whirlpool tub (rectangular, not square, and quite comfy for two) and a separate walk-in shower with TWO heads, one rain shower head and the other with serious water pressure. They have tidy shampoo, conditioner and body wash dispensers in the shower so if you'd like (and I did!) you can just take the little bottles home untouched.
We ate at the restaurant downstairs, the Line and Lariat, and though the arrival of the entree was a little slow the food was very good and the waitstaff was courteous and attentive. We also ordered room service just before the kitchen closed and our selection was delivered promptly and tasted wonderful.
The valet was a little expensive at $28 a night, but much better than parking your car downtown someplace. 
This place is definitely going to be our regular local getaway. Thanks for a great experience!

title: “Good staff, old building”
text:
I stayed in the hotel for a total of 4 weeks. I think the hotel staff was very pleasant to deal with, and that goes a long way when one needs to stay on an extended period. This is an old building and I thought that the overall look and feel of the hotel is nice. Don't expect the glitter and glamor of a downtown modern hotel. I actually like the architecture. Having said that, there are some things about old hotels that people may mind. Dark hallways, dark carpets, Victorian color combination, etc. 
Room wise, it was average. My main complaint about the room is that there seems to be paint flaking off here and there, and obviously due to the condition of the building. Not a huge deal, but something I feel that the staff should be meticulous about. The bathroom is huge, I enjoy having a shower room that is NOT part of the bathtub, and a large one at that. As a matter of fact, the bathroom seems to be the same size as the bedroom at where I stayed. 
I don't think I ever got to stay in the hotel when it is fully booked, so I am not sure how noisy it could get, but the other reason I liked the hotel is that it seems very quiet in the evening. That goes a long way for me as well. 
Location of the hotel is so-so. Typical downtown location, the restaurants and shops close early. It looks like it is in a bad neighbourhood at first glance, but it really is safe. If you are a runner like me, it is close to the river path and that path is great for the 5k/10k runners. There is a nice coffee shop about 5 minute South West of the hotel, called Minuti Coffee, beside Chipotle. If you are staying for the long term like I did, there is a conveniently located dry cleaning place right across Main St.

title: “Very nice”
text: In a rather quiet downtown the Hotel Icon is delightful. The staff is ultra-nice. Nthe rooms are large and beautifully decorated (they are updating them now). The food at the restaurant excellent (the main restaurant has been closed for some time for renovation, but they have set up a small space on the balcony which is quite comfortable). Overall a very pleasant experience.

title: “The only place to stay in Houston!”
text: My girlfriend and I spent the night at Hotel Icon, what an amazing experience. The staff was exceptionally helpful, the room was recently remodeled; it was incredibly clean and extremely quiet. The location is top notch, we were within walking distance to the best restaurants and bars in the city. Hotel Icon will be my new home in Houston on future trips!

title: “Overall Average Stay”
text:
First impression upon arrival set the tone for the rest of our stay. It was extremely difficult even with GPS to find this Hotel the only indication that we saw that helped was the HS initials on the valet booth. Pulled up to the valet and was informed that the garage was at full capacity and that even though we needed to park handicap we would have to park two blocks away and tote our luggage to the hotel. When we finally made it inside to the hotel we were completely lost because you then have to tote your luggage up a wooden flight of stairs to check in on the second floor. We later learned that there was a side door that led to the elevators. A first time visitor like myself would have never guessed that...I traveled with a group of 6 and overall if you don't mind early morning construction noise or occasional loud music from the club area or the courtyard then this is most definitely the place to stay. 
I must say that we had a few minor hiccups during our stay and after we expressed our concerns to the Assistant General Manager he did go out of his way to personally make things right. So I will spare the details of the minor issues we faced and focus on the many positive. I would most definitely stay here again if I was looking for a weekend get-a-way spot for romance or a place to party with my girlfriends. Hotel Sorella is sleek, stylish and very innovative. I loved the design of the Hotel. My room was clean, modern and well stocked. We ordered breakfast one morning that was perfectly delish. I would recommend the vegetable omelet and the steak and eggs. The complimentary breakfast consist of all the fruits your heart desires, dry cereal and milk and pastries. Monnalisa is a great bar that has a very stylish atmosphere and great drinks. 
I was a little disappointed with how early the surrounding restaurants close on the weekends. Most of the kitchens close at 11:30 which is no fault of the hotels but the hotel's kitchen/room service closes at 10pm as well.

title: “Good but not great”
text:
This is a nice modern hotel in a very affluence mall area.
I like it overall but there are few flaws that I wish they would correct:
1. it is very hard find this place - no signs. Many drivers get lost. I come here often because my company puts all visiting staff here.
2. the bell man do not have good attitudes. Some of them look like they have side business and not paying attention. Once I had to demand that they carry my luggage as the guy talk away on the cell phone.
3. the wifi speed is slow. It is about 0.5 MB/sec. It is ok for emails but not if you want to watch a video.
4. it is noise because there is an outdoor cafe with people hanging out. May be a better sound proofing window would make a difference?

title: “Must Go!”
text: Room was awesome! Super clean! Love the wood floors and only carpet near bed. Great for allergies! I always wonder if the carpeted hotel rooms have dirt or God knows what else that hasn't been properly cleaned. I only wish they had a way to play music like an iPod station, etc. Also, the food could be better. Our breakfast arrived cold. The dessert selection wasn't great. I couldn't believe they didn't have hot chocolate or even 24 hour room service. Overall, I would return in a heartbeat.

title: “If You Can Stand the Noise......”
text: Noisy? Yes. Clean and comfortable? Absolutely! I will stay here again even though it is a bit noisy. The noise is due to the availability of many restaurants, shops, bars, and a cinema right next door. It is also due to these noisy hot-spots that you will also be treated to a great view of fountains with fire and beautifully lighted trees. We even saw a dance recital on the green, right from our window. The breakfast is good, much better than the danish and cold eggs at most chains. They provide specialty teas and coffees, high-end pastries, and fresh fruit. We have stayed here twice and can't imagine why anyone would give Hotel Sorella bad ratings.

title: “Brand-spanking new hotel wtih great facilities and attentive service”
text: I think that says it all! But a few more details--our suite was spacious and luxuriously appointed. It was so new that the bedside lamps were not even plugged in yet. The check-in staff was friendly and thus learned that we were celebrating a special event. They surprised us later with a plate of giant strawberries with warm chocolate sauce for dipping! Fortunately, we also thought the gym was terrific. All the equipment is new, and the views from the 17th floor give you something to watch while on the treadmill. The room-service breakfast (oatmeal with banana brulee) was one of my favorite breakfasts ever.

title: “Nickel and dimed”
text: Everything at the Westin costs extra. $10/ day for the internet. $12/ day for self parking. $10 for a simple bowl of oatmeal. $5 for a not very nice capuccino. The location is good for shopping. The gym and pool are excellent, if you have time to use them. It is brand new, so squeaky clean. Service is fine. Bed and pillows are good. Desk is well appointed for working a weekend away. The light in the bathroom is blinding. I am undecided if I will stay here on my next visit, but thus far I have no compelling reason to return.

title: “A beautiful hotel, a trying staff...”
text:
Westin Houston still had that fresh paint clean smell upon arrival. We were eagerly greeted by valets who were semi-informative on self-parking. During check-in, we were informed that our reservation had been made for the wrong day. Although the situation was easily fixed once we received the help from a busy manager, the front desk man who was doing his best was not doing much at all.
The physical appearance of the hotel was very captivating. The design was functional, and was complimented by the cleanliness of the hotel. The pleasing aesthetics of the room were not an overstatement. The room in which I stayed was one of the cleanest rooms I have seen in a hotel. Most of the guest service staff were willing to help and upheld friendly attitudes. 
We didn't spend much time in the hotel due to the nature of our business trip. Most of our time spent in the hotel was after 10PM. We did not have a personal vehicle to travel downtown, nor did we have the energy to take a 25 minute cab ride. One unfortunate detail about this time of night in the area is that most businesses were closed after 9:30 PM. Inside the hotel the pool was closed, the adjoining restaurant was closed and the "024 Lounge" was a make-shift location for a business event due to everything else being closed (needless to say there was no room in the bar). We were made to feel as if we were intruding on a private event.
My colleagues and I are not of business formal appearance. Although we were either business casual or causally dressed, sneers did make their way across the room (mainly from hotel staff). From the moment of our arrival, our presence was continuously questioned. After returning from our event, we spent time lounging in the common areas. It was during this time that we were physically questioned by a judgmental security personnel while drunkenly, sloppy guests seemed to have more welcome. Although it was not an issue the first encounter, it began to disturb us once he continued to question into us being there (after we had to show our room key and provide our room number).
We enjoyed our stay at the Westin. The location of the hotel was conveniently located in relation to downtown Houston. Our room is very clean with all amenities provided, the hotel was up-kept by a wonderful custodial staff and the late-night room service staff was probably the most helpful personnel we encountered. I would stay again at the Westin Houston Memorial.
If you are considering this hotel for either business or leisure, I would inform you to not have high expectations if you are a "night owl", or work late evenings, with hopes to have something to do around the hotel location. If you are one who dresses casually or enjoys dressing comfortably, around your hotel or in general, be prepared to face some criticism/questionable profiling.

title: “Good hotel for the area”
text: This is a great hotel to stay at when in the Galleria area of Houston. It is not as pricey as some and is even fairly close to the medical district.

title: “Just Perfect”
text: Stayed at the Drury, for 7 days in December. It was just like home! Excellent care and staff were the nicest I have ever met at any hotel! Maria who took care of my room, Annette who was the morning cook, Erika the evening bar lady, Wow, they really became like family to me. I really miss them all. Thank you to all the staff. Hotel pool, exercise room, dining area, location, all was perfect. I certainly will return here for another visit. Wish they had a Drury here in Montreal. Also the drinks at 5:30pm were just perfect along with a nice choise of food.

title: “Perfect for my needs- Clean, reasonable, free parking”
text: Met all standards and then some. Location is convenient to all locations I need to get to while in Houston, Hotel is friendly, clean, free dinner and breakfast, parking. Rooms are good. No complaints and a terrific value for less than $150 per night!

title: “Should be "Dreary Inn and Suites"”
text: Aging, noisy and somewhat dilapidated with a constant buzzing noise in the room noted by two guests in different rooms on different floors. Smelled badly of cigarettes throughout the hotel. SHeets old and bedding old fashioned. The hotel is no frills at all: basic and none too clean. The breakfast was the "plastic" kind - plastic cups for coffee, plastic plates and utensils and stale eggs, sweet rolls and the usual cereals. The pool is a "dipping pool" and none too clear. Avoid this hotel.

title: “Never again”
text: House keeping totally disregards the do not disturb sign. The manager made snide comments about my luggage. The waitstaff would not even bring me my food, I had to pick it up at the bar. I would rather sleep in my truck than stay at this unfriendly hotel again... Even for free. I also felt that my caucasion demographic figured into the maltreatment.

title: “Good Service, Poor Facilities”
text: Staff is friendly and helpful, but walls are very thin and facilities are in disrepair. Wish I could give this a higher review. It seems like good staff got stuck in a lousy building. Noisy, noisy, noisy.

title: “UNSAFE, panhandlers, rooms robbed”
text:
I was a guest in August, there to photograph an AKC Dog Show that I have covered for several years at this location. I set up my backdrop & lighting on Thursday night in what has always been a locked Ballroom. I always finish up my setup before the start of each show so as to not spook any dogs. On Fri before the show I found my lighting equipment stolen as well as the crate for my medical alert dog. I soon found out that other vendors who were set up in a different area than I was were robbed as well.
The staff could have cared less. The manager would not come to speak to us about this. We asked to see the security camera film. We were told "We do not have security cameras because it would give our guests a false sense of security."
I asked what they would say if it was a child that had been taken? Guess cameras would be a good idea then. Later on I heard their excuse was that criminals were suing them for taking their photo without permission. REALLY??? Cameras are on our highways, in stores, & a part of our life. I do not buy that one either.
There were panhandlers asking guest for money as they entered their rooms, walked their dogs, & even right outside the ballroom. The panhandlers were bothering guests throughout the whole weekend.
We asked the hotel staff about stopping the panhandlers, giving them a description & they said "We do not want to approach someone who might be a guest & risk insulting them."
How about all the guests there who are already insulted by being robbed, harassed by panhandlers, etc? And the thefts took place over the whole weekend, it was not just one night. The manager, when he finally did come talk to us (I had to call cooperate for that to happen) Said he would pay the maintenance man to act as security at night. That went well. More thefts on Friday night. He was found sitting behind the front desk by my assistant when she went down for some Tums in the early morning hours. The doors by the ballroom with a sign that states "Access by room key only from 11pm to 7am " were duct taped & zip tied so they would not lock. I took photos of this. Bottom line is, the manager blamed us for the thefts. Said it was our fault. No concern what so ever for his guest or their safety.
Staff service for your room? We got up on Sunday morning to make coffee in our room to find housekeeping had not cleaned the pot from the day before or turned it off. Coffee still in the pot and the light was blinking. They had put new cups in & replenished the coffee packets to make more. That is all. 
I have asked & asked for this hotel to do the right thing & replace my stolen equipment so I can do my job. I have been met with no sympathy or desire to do the right thing. Much less accept accountability. 
Help from cooperate? Zero. They say it is a franchise & they have no control. Again, no accountability for someone who represents their name. Disgraceful!

title: “Comfortable place to stay”
text: I thought this was anice place to stay. Overall it was comfortable, and the front desk staff was the most friendly I've ever met. They continually joked with us and recognized us as we came in the front door each day. The only thing I didn't like about this hotel is the bathroom wasn't very clean. You can tell it had been mopped, but they must not have vacuumed before the mopped, because it smeared hair around on the tile. There was even hair stuck to the back of the door. Gross.

title: “Very Pleasant and Comfortable”
text: I travel for business frequently. The staff at this hotel was by far the most friendly. Check-in was quick. When there were questions on where to eat, they recommend an excellent local restaurant, Pappasito's. Rita was particularly outgoing; calling a driver for the night and ensuring we had what we needed on our stay. Also enjoyed the lounge on the second floor.

title: “Older but nice and good service.”
text: Staff interactions were great. Room is older but nice and clean. Great housekeeping everyday I was there. Wireless was fast and worked well. Breakfast buffet was as expected, not great but good. Bartender was really cool. We joked about a girl asking him if the beer was really what the "handle" said or something different, it was classic. I would recommend for business or pleasure.

title: “Downtown hotel meets but doesn't exceed expectations”
text: Typical big conference hotel. Attentive staff, clean rooms quite simply put a good place to stay while doing business in the downtown Houston area. The hotel is also conviently located near both the Toyota Center and Minute Maid Park Stadium. I really don't have any complaints. Just found the place quite average overall. The location was great because we were in Houston for a trade show at the adjacent George Brown Convention Center. You can walk through a connecting walkway to access the convention center. As expected the food available at the hotel property restaurants is average at best with the exception of the steak house, Spencers for Steak. Which was good.

title: “Weekend Vacation”
text: I had an opportunity to place a slient bid on this weekend vacation close to home. I checked in without any issues. The hotel registration went perfect. The hotel was grand, everything about it. I live in Houston but have never ventured downtown to explore the venues. I was impressed at the room and the view. The extras I requested were waiting for our stay. My wife and I had the breakfast bar in the hotel and that was amazing. There was never a shortage of employees to accomodate anything you desired. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Houston. I will definetly plan another weekend away at the Hilton America.

title: “Very Nice Place”
text: This Hotel is top notch. The room is very nice and the bed is extremely comfortable, the pool is indoors and it’s a little stuffy when you first walk in. They have a nice patio off of the pool area over looking Houston. Minute Maid Park, Toyota stadium and the convention center are within walking distance. This hotel is well worth the money, even the valet parking.

title: “Beautiful and clean”
text:
This hotel was fantastic. It was our first stop on a 3700 mile road trip with the family (which consists of two young children). It really set the stage for a wonderful trip. Once you walk in, the lobby was very pretty, and the staff immediately greeted us and began the check-in process.
The room was large, and very clean. The linens on the sheets were comfortable. It was quiet enough that I was able to get a couple hours of sleep in the middle of the day. 
We really have nothing 'critical' to say about this hotel. A wonderful place, and definitely on our list for our next travel through Houston.

title: “Excellent Christmas Party - The Hotel did a Wonderful Job!”
text:
We held the British School of Houston Christmas Party for parents and staff here. It was a great evening. Everything went smoothly, the food was even better than expected and we had no complaints.
Thanks to the team - you did a great job!

title: “Second time through....Still an A+”
text: We came back to the SC after staying here a year ago. TA will delete my older review so if you look for it it won't be there. Anyway..it's a great deal in Manhattan!! A one-bedroom suite with kitchenette for less than $400!! What a deal!! It's in a great location that's close to great shopping, dining, and the subway. The staff is always helpful and friendly. The rooms are HUGE and most importantly quiet. Sure, there is some siren noise, but not much. The beds are comfortable as well. The breakfast is typical; yogurt, baked goods, toaster items, cereal, etc. This hotel always impresses me as a luxury hotel without the luxury price tag. Expect robes, turn down service, a pants press (??), two flat screen TVs, two closets, etc., etc... We'll be back for third visit for sure.

title: “Excellent!”
text: All the way around, this is a superior hotel. My wife and I spent three nights there over the Columbus Day weekend, with two teenage boys. Everything is superb and we will return if the opportunity arises. Plenty of space in our one-bedroom suite, very clean, thorough room attention each day, perfect bed, more than ample free breakfast food, friendly helpful staff, tasteful wall hangings, better than average fitness room, great location in Manhattan mid-town east right next to 51st and Lexington subway. One final thing -- when we checked out, the man at the front desk did a magic trick for my younger boy. This is a really special place. Kudos to TripAdvisor for bringing it to my attention!

title: “Really liked it”
text: We stayed in an Executive Suite. It had plenty of room for NYC even with 2 young children -- including floor space, a small "kitchen" table, couch, coffee table, kitchenette. The continental breakfast had a good selection and was well supplied. The doorman was friendly and provided us with umbrellas on our way out when it was raining. We were able to borrow a DVD player from the front desk. We all agreed we'd stay here again.

title: “Great Find”
text: Great find, thanks to trip advisor. Great location 2 blocks from Times square. Clean, friendly and have no Issues.. Very quiet to sleep considering the location, i was surprised but a GREAT Surprise. Looking forward to making the Iroquois Hotel my Home when I am in New York City

title: “Fantastic Hotel”
text: Everyone that works there was so friendly and available to assist. The hotel was perfect and we enjoyed our time in the city and having a great hotel experience was part of that. The door was always opened for us and the desk personnel assisted us with everything we needed. The Triomphe restaurant served us wonderful drinks (little pricey) but well worth it as we settled in for the night. The location was excellent (walking distance to Broadway, shopping, Times Square). The beds were awesome and comfortable and the rooms were clean.

title: “Perhaps overrated?”
text: Nothing wrong with this hotel but I don't really know what makes this a 4* hotel with an almost $300 price tag other than its location. I have stayed at much nicer 3* hotels. The service is good and everything is adequate but if this is one of the best rated hotels in New York (currently 24/430 NYC hotels at tripadvisor.com) I'd hate to see what the lower ranked hotels are like. By the way, you get no in/out rights for your car using their valet parking which is $55 per day plus $10 extra for SUVs, something which is common in NYC, but people should know ahead of time, perhaps other hotels offer that???

title: “Great Location - Even Better Staff”
text:
My Sister and I chose the Eventi while staying in NYC for a long weekend to celebrate my 30th birthday. From the moment I arrived I knew we chose the right hotel. 
The location is phenomenal! Situated between all the tourist destination of up-town and mid-town and the hot spots of the village and Soho. We loved it... On Saturday is a was short walk to a great brunch place called The Guilty Goose where we enjoyed bottomless mimosas and tasty brunch fare. 
Aside from the awesome location is the staff of the Eventi. Kimpton is know for their excellent customer service, but nowhere is that more apparent than at the Eventi. Every member we encountered was personable and friendly. Their openness and general friendly demeanor made my sister and I feel at home the whole weekend. I especially want to mention the night staff. The evening and late night concierge were AWESOME and their attention to detail were second to none! 
I am so happy we chose the Eventi to stay at while celebrating my very memorable 30th birthday!

title: “Great stay, would definitely come back”
text: We had a terrific stay at the Eventi hotel last weekend. We were treated very kindly, and when they found out it was our anniversary we were showered with good wishes and some gifts too. There are many things to like about this hotel; we got a free $15 coupon to raid the minibar and free internet for being Kimpton InTouch members; it is centrally located so if you want to go to midtown or downtown you can have the option of walking; the staff was excellent, the rooms were spotless, and the bed was comfortable. Although checkout was noon on Sunday, we were able to leave our bags and our car with the valet for the day while we walked around NYC. They offer a good AAA discount as well. I would definitely stay here again.

title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
text:
I recently stayed two nights here to attending a wedding which was also being held at the hotel.
Staff: The front desk was always helpful and pleasant to deal with. One night the television would turn on but not get a channel and the front desk sent up engineering within 5 minutes. 
Location: Great NYC location. We drove in and parked at a garage very close to the hotel, but Penn Station is also within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance to the Empire State Building and near plenty of other cool bars, restaurants, and shops. We were able to walk everywhere and didn't bother using a car/subway because everything we needed or wanted to do was right around us.
Room: Comfortable, plush, and very clean. The bathroom was very cool and modern too with a spacious shower.
Wedding/Event: The wedding we attended was absolutely beautiful and the food was to die for. The hotel staff certainly put on a great party and made sure all the guests were taken care of. 
Overall I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and would recommend.

title: “1st trip to New York - Chatwal did not disappoint”
text: Service at The Chatwal was extraordinary and extremely friendly. Every employee on staff (doormen, front desk, housekeeping, restaurant personnel) made a point of saying hello or good morning and welcoming us back when we returned from time away. The room was spacious, quiet and very well appointed. We ate breakfast and dinner at the Lamb's club and found both meals to be excellent. We defintely are recommending The Chatwal to our friends.

title: “Review Incomplete”
text:
I have been trying different hotels in NYC trying to find one to stay at consistently for business. This hotel has to be one of best hotels I have stayed at in NYC. The service was impeccable. I was upgraded to a suite upon check in which was also amazing. Check in service was great as they also escorted me to the room and gave me a tour. They pressed my clothing upon arrival. The gym was also spotless and had everything you could need for a road warrior.
The hotel had the feel of the ulitmate business traveler hotel with rooms that were silent as a tomb and limited traffic in the lobby. This is even more impressive considering it is in the heart of times square.
The reason this review is incomplete is as I attempted to sleep in this magnificent room I was repeatedly bit by a bug (I assume a mosquito). This went on all night and prevented me from getting a proper nights sleep. I called the front desk and the man attempted to be helpful and offered to go buy bug repellent for me which I declined as I felt silly. The bug issue created a very uncomfortable night stay.
The fact that the service was so impeccable and the room was pristine makes me want to believe that the bug issue was an anomaly. I plan on giving this hotel another chance.

title: “Style, location & great staff.”
text:
We stayed @ The Waldorf last year but wanted a more central locality this year,happy we did!! Rooms were large,fantastic bathroom & heaps of wardrobe space.
Breakfast was expensive but of high quality.Given the closeness to Times Square, the room ( on the 6th floor ) was surprisingly quiet.
All in all, the staff were what made this place a reccomended experience.

title: “Excellent with room for improvement.”
text:
Stayed Ina studio suite for a long weekend. The rooms are large reasonably priced and very clean. Excellent bedding and wonderful housekeeping who went out of their way to help with clothes pressing needs. An outstanding experience once checked in. 
The checking in process was a disaster with the front desk staff running a credit card three times for different amounts and thereby security locking the card. It took thirty minutes to resolve the issue. 
Room service took a long time and was overpriced as always. 
As long as you do not mind a rather eclectic front desk experience this is a great hotel and we will return.

title: “Birthday stay, perfect”
text: My husband booked the room for a night in the city for my birthday. An assistant called him prior to our arrival and asked if there was anything she could do. He just told her it was my birthday. When we arrived there was a bottle of chilled champagne, a fruit plate, chocolates and rose petals scattered around it. In the bathroom there were more rose petals around the tub with candles. It was really something to see. They went out of their way to make my day special. The room was modern, I loved it. It was really a great stay. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: “Great service”
text: It is difficult to find fault with the Setai: the location is bang in the middle of Manhattan, the decor is sharp and service is great throughout. The quality of food at breakfast and in the Bar on Fifth was excellent. The only downside during our stay was a consistent shortage of staff on the front desk.

title: “Celebrating a first job in style at the Setai NYC”
text:
I am at the Setai with my 16 year old daughter, still here actually, but sadly checking out today. We came to Manhattan for her to visit her uncle who lives here and to celebrate my older daughter's new first post college job in the area. My recent college graduate stayed with us several nights and commuted. It was a cinch for her to catch the subway to her job in Brooklyn in the Dumbo area. And the roomy suite made it easy for her to grab something to eat, have Nespresso coffee, have her shower in the amazing bathroom, read the paper, and get ready to venture out. The walk to the subway was also not bad, just down Fifth Avenue in Herald Square.
Our suite is the perfect choice for this occasion. I booked a deluxe apartment suite, after considering booking a studio suite. I have been thrilled that I decided on the apartment suit due to the setup with a door separating the living room from the bedroom, giving us extra room to spread out and relax without disturbing whoever was resting. It comes with the most comfortable bed and bedding you could ask for. The duvet cover is of the softest, best quality I have seen. It is hard to force myself to get out of bed in the morning. It was also very convenient with the extra half bath for getting dressed and ready to depart.
I was asked if I needed anything when we checked in. Immediately I was offered additional hangers, which came in handy because between us we had a lot of clothes for different things we were doing. There is a typical hotel closet AND an additional deep closet so everything fit perfectly. There are also 4 nice built in drawers and a ledge perfect for setting a suitcase on. There are two drawers in each nighhtstand, along with cordless phones on each side, a nice clock, dimmer switch lights on the lamps, as well as convenient outlets to charge phones on each side. The Samsung TV's in the bedroom and the living room were large and of high quality. Wifi access was free and reliable, which came in handy with all of our multiple devices and very much needed due to all of our separate coming and going.
What was important to me above all was location and view. On both points this suite exceeds any expectation I had. We had meals in all corners of the city, visited museums, shopped, visited my brother's office and apartment, all via short cab ride, with the exception of an amazing ride in the Maserati to the Metropolitan museum that my 16 year old and I will not soon forget! I can't imagine an easier spot to use as a base in Manhattan. If traffic is stopped in one area, there are alternate routes. 
As far as the view, one side of this bedroom has a large double floor to ceiling window towards the Hudson, facing Fifth Avenue, the other has a view of Fifth Avenue for many blocks, along with a perfect view of the Empire State building. Two sets of double windows in the separate living room give us additional views of that building, although wew have to look up to see the top.
So far, when I run out of bottled water, soft drinks, Nespresso pods or cream, all I have to do is call, and it appears, the Nespresso pods are replenished without any request. We have also received daily treats, like cookies and pretzels and the best popcorn I have ever eaten in my life (I think butter is involved!) delivered to the room, several times a day if we are in.
I used the wonderful gym on the third floor this morning. They have a number of good weight machines, 6 or so good quality treadmills with tv's built in, and complimentary earbuds, chilled bottle water and even apples for guests.
I really like the quality of all the furnishings. They are comfortable, understated, and clean. It is nice to have lots of surfaces for our purchases on from our shopping excursions on Fifth Ave. There is room under the table where the bedroom tv sits to slide your suitcases out of the way. I appreciate the floor to ceiling bookcases in both the bedroom and living room and all the art books placed there. The huge marbled bathroom with wonderful deep soaking tub, large glass enclosed separate large marble shower with great shower head and top quality decorative file was wonderful. The marble bathroom floors were cool, which I enjoyed, along with the wonderful floor to ceiling windows and nice blind system. There was even a thermostat driven floor heater to warm the marble floor in the bathroom as well as and a small orchid plant. The same floor to ceiling double windows brought beautiful light with a bonus view towards the Chrysler building into the bathroom, and there was great blinds for privacy. Everything has been thought of in the hotel.
Another plus of the apartment suite is the fridge and freezer. Manuela at the front desk gave us directions the first day to an organic market a few blocks away, and we stocked up with fruit and yogurt and another items. We also had leftovers from our restaurant meals so the fridge was perfect. We loved going during summer Restaurant Week, and really splurged. Again, the central location facilitated our ability to try restaurants in different neighborhoods, expanding convenient dining choices.
I can't say enough about the service we are enjoying here. The doorman, the house car driver, the front desk staff, the housecleaning and supplies stockers were all very professional and very accommodating. Manuela at the front desk from Italy remembered my last name from the time I checked in, as did Ashley and Kimberly. They graciously provided an umbrella when it rained. I spoke to a security person named Rodney after we left to track down an item we could not find when we got home, and he took extra effort to help me, even calling me back promptly after he reserached the small item. I did not use the spa due to traveling with my 16 year old, but I did tour it. It is a very nice set up, very roomy and serene. Nice space, great amenities, you could spend a day here for sure. I hope to return with my husband and try it out. We also did not eat at the hotel restaurant but I did go down and have a drink with my older daughter one night in the bar. It had comfy sitting areas to enjoy the live jazz band which we very much enjoyed.
Be sure and ask for a map at the front desk, it was a good map of Manhattan, with easy to follow info on the subway system and a magnified map on the back of the immediate area.
I can't wait to come back to the Setai. I may not need a suite the next time for my husband and myself but I sure would prefer one!!!!!

title: “Great time in this hotel”
text:
I stayed 4 days in August and I was already there 2 weeks last year in August 2011
- Fantastic Rooms with a great design !!! -
- Service very good - better than last year -
- Breakfast ok ... need to renew the menu
- Good location close from time square, central park etc.

title: “Amazing NYC Hotel!”
text: Our son was away at camp for part of the summer so my wife and I decided to enjoy a NYC getaway. The Andaz staff treated us well from check-in to check-out - always thoughtful and attentive without being intrusive. The property itself is also breezy, full of light, and modern while feeling warm.

title: “Modern, Sleek, Sexy, Hip, Cool”
text:
Lots of Adjectives, I know, but that's exactly how I felt during my weekend stay at the Andaz 5th avenue hotel. I was celebrating my 30th Birthday with a group of girlfriends and it was the most memorable experience ever. In fact, I think I’ve found my soul mate!
Before arriving, I took advantage of their concierge service to surprise the ladies with some in-room amenities. Dana Steer, the concierge that handled my request, executed each and every detail flawlessly, including my desire to have a balcony. If you are planning a long weekend or special get-away definitely take advantage of this service. He was very responsive and professional with the bombardment of emails I sent. 
 As for the room, I reserved the large two bed with two bath suite. The room was awesome! I was greeted with a personalized welcome note on the huge flat screen TV. Why is this important? It’s one of those minor unexpected details that individualizes each guest. Reflecting back on my stay, I think we loved it so much because we felt like we were the only ones in residence. That's how attentive and personable all of our interactions were. 
 The rooms were huge and there was plenty of space for the four of us to sleep and for the other 2 ladies that came over to have cocktails before dinner. I felt like I was entertaining in my apartment. Other reviewers have commented on the bathrooms and I think you should just find out for yourself, you won’t be disappointed. 
I will say I’ve always been a Marriott s guest, but the Andaz/Hilton has won my loyalty! The hospitality and service is unmatched. Every need was anticipated with prompt, courteous and polite regard. 
The staff and management at the Andaz 5th Ave made my 30th birthday sooo fly!

title: “Great Property, Location, Rooms and Staff!”
text: The Andaz 5th Avenue in NYC has become our preferred getaway hotel in NYC. If you have not stayed at an Andaz before, it is a Hyatt "boutique" property. I'd compare it to a "W Hotel", but nicer. For NYC, the rooms are a very nice size. The amenities are fantastic (including the very cool complimentary mini-bar for non-alcholic beverages and snacks). Also, an excellent fitness center and restaurant. We go there for little weekend getaways from the kids, but our kids would love the place too. And the staff is both welcoming and helpful. It is rare that you are asked about a late check-out when checking in, versus trying to get one later in the stay. You'll find that everything is state of the art. You can't stay at a better place. And the location is perfect for Midtown--walking distance to everything without being too crowded.

title: “Unreal!”
text:
This place I would highly recommend to anyone.
It is just a short walk to the subway and one stop on the express train to Times Square and a short walk to Central Park. The location is great as it is quiet in comparison to other parts of the city.
Has lots of small eateries close by and a food store across the street.
We stayed there from the 17th of August for 6 nights, the room was average size (but we had 2 double beds in our room) and everything we needed. The staff were helpful and nice, they accept travelers cheques no problem.
We had no drama with the cleanliness of the room, no cockroaches or bed bugs were seen.

title: “Staying at the Beacon with Kids”
text: We stayed at the Beacon for 11 days in August 2012 as part of a sightseeing trip to New York. I was travelling with my two children (aged 12 and 8) so our needs are a bit different to when we are travelling as a whole family. The Beacon worked well for us - its more than a hotel room with a bit more space and the location is excellent as it just ten minutes away from the action, but not in a touristy area, so you feel like you are actually living in New York as oppose to holidaying. The beds were a bit smaller than I expected - I would say the two beds are more like King singles than doubles so it was a bit of a squash with an adult and a child in one bed and definitely would not work for two adults that need space. However the rooms are well laid out and have everything you need. Housekeeping is good and unlike others we had no problems with bugs or anything of that nature. The sitting room is of a good size and a welcome respite at the end of a busy day to be able to stock the fridge with a few drinks and chill without having to order room service etc. The area has plenty of nice local eateries (so cheap for someone coming from Australia) and the proximity to Central Park is a lovely walking/running start to any day. We did not eat in but there is a tiny kitchen with microwave and small cooker, so if you wanted to it would be practical to have light meals. There is a laundry on the 7th floor which is great especially as I put some laundry with the concierge on the first day and it call came back dry cleaned - even t shirts!! So having access to the laundry is great with kids etc. The rooms are also very reasonably priced for New York and the staff really helpful. Its not the sort of place if you are looking for a couples break with facilities on hand but if you are looking for a family hotel with more space than a hotel room, this is perfect. The staff are also very helpful in securing cabs, posting things, and generally helping. We would use this hotel again.

title: “Spacious accommodation in good location, but......”
text: This is a good value, spacious hotel in a great location, but the residual problems of cockroaches and faulty lifts endure. Looking back at past reviews, there has been a continuing problem with cockroaches, and sadly our stay was blighted by the appearance of a very large roach on the pillow of the sofa-bed our kids were occupying! We only discovered it when pulling out the sofa-bed at the end of a very long day, and our two kids refused to sleep anywhere other than our bed! My husband manned-up and took the sofa-bed, having had the mattress and bedding changed by hotel staff who were unable to provide us with a suitable room until the next day. Give them their due, the hotel offered us another room for the last two nights of our stay, and gave us a free night.
