Only one lift was working for the duration of our stay, causing all sorts of problems, particularly for people on the higher floors. Great location-close to restaurants, supermarkets and subway. Very good self-serve laundry facilities.

title: “One problem after another”
text:
I stayed at the hotel mid-April for a business trip. The first day the tub did not drain properly and by the end of my 10-minute shower the water was up to my ankles. I reported the issue and was told it would be fixed that day. The next day, same thing happened so I called again and was again told it would be fixed. It was the same the following day so I gave up asking. 
The complimentary newspaper was delivered 3 out of the 5 business days and when I called to inquire about the first missing paper they said they would try to find one for me but it never arrived. I didn't bother to ask on day 5.
After a long day I had the Do Not Disturb on my door while I was resting before dinner and the phone rang. It was the bell desk telling me there was a bellman outside my door with a package and they were calling because I had put the DND on the door. WTH? I answered the door but there was no tip for that terrible service. 
Thursday evening the TV did not work so I called down and the repair person was quick to respond but by the time they had it fixed my program was already over.
On Friday as I was getting ready for work the toilet backed up and overflowed. The bathroom was quickly flooded with used toilet water. I called down and housekeeping sent up someone to take a look, he called someone else to clean up the mess and no less than 5 people walked through my room surveying the situation while I stood there in my bathrobe thinking of the meeting I was going to be late for. They took up the water with towels and a mop but did not use any cleaner on the floor and did not address the wet rug in the hallway. I called down to the desk and spoke to the manager, explained the situation - the dirty floor and rug wet with toilet water - and asked for a new room. At first they wanted me to pack up my things and they would move me later while I was at the office but I insisted to be moved right away so they relented and offered smaller room but did not offer a price adjustment. I started to read them the riot act and they offered me a suite so I packed up and moved to the suite. It was right beside the elevator, the noise was a bit of a disruption but at least it was clean.
I've stayed at several 4Seasons hotels and I can't understand how they allow their name to be associated with this hotel. One of the worst hotels I've stayed in, certainly the worst for business in the U.S.

title: “It's a Four Seasons”
text: I stayed last week at the four seasons. What distiguises a four seasons is always top notch service and people and this hotel was no exception. Sleep quality and bedding were to notch as was the home keeping service and the turndown service. Even when things did not go smoothly, the staff was very nice and always tryed it's best. When I arrived at noon my room was not ready - I asked, since I have to wait anyway, for a high floor, which they were able to accommodate. Lamira at the front desk was always nice and a pleasure to talk to. a true 5* exprience in this hotel.

title: “Luxury Standard Downtown!”
text: I just returned home from a business meeting at The Four Seasons. Like most people when you hear the name Four Seasons, I expected to be wowed, and though I expected perhaps more, I was still pleased and certainly recommend this hotel. From my room on the 9th floor, I could see.the Toyota Center. The House of Blues was close. It was very conveniently located. The rooms are very well appointed, think Ritz Carlton, top end Westin's, Hyatt's, and Hilton's. French soaps, marble bathrooms, and nice bed. Though my favorite is the Westin's "Heavenly Bed". I realize I am not picking a bit. I guess the hype had me over expecting. Still a great hotel and terrific place to stay in downtown Houston!

title: “Cool Vintage Hotel in DT Houston”
text:
I had a business meeting and took my friend with to Houston. We decided to check out one of the Marriott's autograph hotels we've been hearing about traveling around. The Icon has plenty of vintage charm.
The lobby is really cool. Right behind the front desk you see the old bank vault and the front desk staff has great stories about the building. 
Our room was decent sized, huge bathroom. The room itself was ok, the floor was a bit uneven here and there and it had a funky smell to it, almost like hay or barn type smell. I travel with air freshener in case of smoke smell and I'm glad I do cause I needed it. The beds were comfy and the sheets were clean. There was storage under the tellie for clothes and a funky ice bucket and mini bar area with real glasses. The bathroom was awesome. Big modern really nice.
We ordered room service a couple of times and it was super good. And we also ate at the restaurant downstairs, also really good. 
Overall it really has some potential.

title: “Hotel with great potential.”
text: Stayed here 4 nights for business. The building that houses the Hotel (an old bank building), is awesome! I love a hotel with character. The room itself was also great... big, newly refurbished, awesome shower, big, fluffy towels, a comfortable bed, and very clean. This itself makes this a very good hotel. There were a number of misses... Not a reason to not select perhaps, but, depending on rate, maybe a reason to go elswhere. Too bad, Hotel Icon could be great. I mentioned the pluses, and there are many, so it has yhe "bones" to be great. But to be better thn the "3 stars" I would give now, here are the misses... Check in was okay. Valet and bellman, but oddly, no one asked to take or assist with luggage although we were the only one's checking in (I arrived with a co-worker, and meeting two others for a total of 4 rooms). Not a huge deal as I have no issue handling my own luggage, just odd of a hotel that can be better. After finding our way to the front desk (no one assisted getting us in) we started the check in process. No issue here really. I did find a couple of things again that were a miss... I asked for a high floor room (there are 10 or 11 floors), I was given a room on floor 4. Odd because this Hotel is a Marriott Autograph Collection Hotel and I am a silver member so I usually get the bascis in my profile. In addition, I was hosting a reception at a moderate cost in the hotel one of the nights. I didn't need an "upgrade", and did not ask for one, just a higher floor. I was told that "this was all they could do", politely, but nonethless this was it. When I got to the room, I truly thought it was great... I already mentioned the many pluses above. However as I opened the curtains to the two windows, I found myself looking at the side of an abondoned building and a parking lot. The view from a lower floor. So I proceeded back to the Front Desk and let the female clerk know I loved the room, but really wanted a higher floor. I made it clear I was willing to wait (we did check in early, around Noon, so I get all rooms are not ready yet). She did at least humor me and spent a minure or two looking for another room, she finally told me that was the best she could do. This ended up even more strange as one of my employees, who checked in later, was given a room on the 7th floor. Now I am not suggesting I should get a room better than someone I work with, but it did prove there were better rooms. And remeber, I am silver with Marriott Rewards, and I was hotting and paying for the reception. Just odd. Later in the day, my co-workers actually, unprompted by me, asked if my room had been upgraded or if I had received some sort of personal welcome (fresh fruit, welcome note, something), and when I said no, they were really surprised. I guess I was too. When I went back to the room that night, I noticed the curtains were closed, but nothing else had been done to the room. Was there turndown service? I woulkd have thought in an Autograph Collection Hotel it would be yes, and someone was there, but the coverlet on the bed was still there, and the dirty towel I used to shower earlier was still there as well, and nothing on the pillow (note, chocolate, etc.). Again, odd. Even stranger, on night two, the curtains were again closed, nothing else in the room serviced, and night 3 and 4 saw no one in the room. Is there turndown or not? There should be at this level of hotel, but I have no idea. Also of strange note, I removed the coverlet myself and placed in a pile on the chair in the room... it was never touched again. Not folded, not placed back on the bed, nothing. On day 2 I finally folded it neatly myself, placed it on one of the nightstands, and that is where it remained. Again, the room was always clean, the bed made, towels refreshed, but then there were these misses. Another miss... I am not a huge consumer of the mini-bar, but I often grab a bottle of water or perhaps a sode. On the very nice wet-bar area counter was a price list. However, when I opened the refrigerator it was empty. It remained empty for my entire stay, but the price list, wine opener, ect. remained. No big deal as I saved my Company some money, but again an odd miss. The Reception was very good that I hosted in a space overlooking the lobby. I received very good comments from my Guests. Mike the Catering Manager was very pleasant to deal with, made great recomendations, and the Servers at the reception were very attentive to my Guests. I have no issues here. In summation I have no reason to not recommend as the location, ambiance, room size / decor were all very good. It is however those details that make a "typical" business hotel such as a Holiday Inn or a Hampton Inn (not picking on either, that make them what they are in their class. This is an Autograph Collection Hotel that to me is not yet at that level. If you can get a great rate, then I would stay here again. I guess I was disappointed that this could be a great hotel and has the potential, but just misses in so many of the needed details.

title: “Modern with Excellent Location”
text: We stayed at the Sorella Hotel with our young son over Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel is smallish in a european style and conveniently located for west Houston/Memorial access. Pros: Shopping and restaurants are within easy walking distance and include a wide variety of favorites. The hotel is very clean and our room on the 8th floor was quiet and comfortable. We appreciated the fresh apples and bottled water in our room on arrival as well as the complimentary cocktails. Didn't try the breakfast offered. Enjoyed the engineered wooden floors in our room. Cons: Small unheated pool was more of a landscape feature than a functional pool...unusable in November and disappointed my son. Bathrooms have great walk in showers but are sparsely furnished with towels and extras. No hotel news stand that I could find and no newspaper delivery to rooms.

title: “wonderful stay, peaceful, romance!”
text: I went online and saw the pics and the place looks just like the pics, BEAUTIFUL! So before going to our room went ate at Yard House which the food was mouth watery good! After a midnight meal and drinks we walk to the hotel room. This place is new and very upscale. My date had the chocolate covered strawberries and champigan. Honestly the chocolate was no govida but it was nice and the champigan was not something i would have picked out but the thought was really good. lol...We stayed in 802 which over looks the court yard great view...I give it 5 stars and i would love to go back

title: “Great night's sleep - once I found it!”
text:
Getting off a plane and picking up a hire car after a day's travelling is never great at the best of times, but when the Sat Nav doesn't recognise the address of the hotel (too new I think), and when you do get to the general area, the hotel doesn't have one of the usual american-style massive billboards on top, it leads to some "interesting" detours!
After a bit of to-ing and fro-ing, I eventually managed to find the hotel car park and check in.
The rooms were very good, and the bed really comfortable. A little 'control panel' in the desk had all the connections needed to charge mobile phones, mp3 players etc. and was a good idea. Alarm clock was an hour out (clocks had just gone back) which was a bit confusing, but I tend to rely on my phone to wake me up in any case.
Communal areas clean and tidy. Bar was dark and trendy. Didn't have much in the way of interaction with staff during my stay, but check in and out were as efficient as you would expect.
Great location - you can actually walk to a number of shops and restaurants, which is unusual for Houston.

title: “Convenient, but loud”
text:
This place is great during the week, but stay away on the weekend.
They book a lot of weddings, and it is extremely loud.
Do not stay on the courtyard side of the hotel on the weekend - unless you are out until after the bands stop playing in the bars - around 3AM.
A very nice hotel - but definitely missing something at this price point. 
FYI - I travel a great deal for business (3 months a year) and would not recommend this hotel if you plan on staying over the weekend.

title: “A Great New Hotel for Houston”
text:
The new Westin at Memorial City is in a great location for West Houston, located on the I10 at Gessner and easy to reach both the Energy Corridor and Downtown locations. There is a direct connection to the excellent Memorial City Mall by a covered walkway(A&F, Hollister, etc and Cinemax complex). Good gym facilities and small pool and jacuzzi on the 18th floor with views over the City - though this area could do with a little tropical greenery.
High energy attentive staff do make a real difference and special mention to all the people at the front desk, bar and shuttle service.
Some suggestions:
Improved signage for walkway to mall / Hertz office
More toiletries / towels in bedrooms
Consider installing free wi-fi in lobby

title: “Beautiful hotel, friendly staff”
text:
Recently in Houston on business and decided to stay at the Westin Memorial which just opened a few weeks ago. I had driven by the Memorial many times in the past and it looked great so I was eager to see how it would turn out. The lobby is big with lots of check in counters, a restaurant, sundry shop and bar. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the amenities are great.
Pros:
- Staff was friendly and helpful
- Rooms were nice with good views overlooking the city
- They have an Executive Lounge for Starwood Gold/Platinum on the 18th floor which provides continental breakfast and happy hour each day.
- The workout facility has everything you need.
- The pool on the 18th floor is great and it also opens up to the outside. It has a beautiful view overlooking the city and is definitely worth a visit. 
Cons:
- Still new, and they are ironing out some of the basic kinks
- You need your key card to be able to use the elevator for any floor. This is a good security feature but quickly becomes cumbersome. Also- on the last day my card stopped working, so I had to wait for someone to help me get downstairs just so I could get a new card to use to get back into my room.
Overall, this is a great new hotel and definitely a step up over the Galleria and Oaks.

title: “Leider keine 5 Sterne”
text:
Es handelt sich um ein neues tolles Haus mit Krankenhauszugang und Zugangsbrücke zur Shopping Mall. Sehr toll gelöst. Die Zimmer sind groß und ansprechend ausgestattet. Die Betten in einem guten Zustand. Weshalb ich keine 5 Sterne geben kann. Das Inernet Geld kostet ist zwar für mich nicht nachvollziehbar, aber 12 Dollar + Tax fürs Parken geht gar nicht.
Das ist unverschämt.
Würde ich wieder hin: Ja, ist ein klasse Hotel. Der Pool hat eine tolle Aussicht auf die Skyline.

title: “Good Hotel, free wi-fi, free popcorn and unlimited soda”
text:
Found this hotel easily using out sat nav system. Check in was smooth, which following a long flight was just what was needed. The receptionist was very friendly and provided us with the relevant information relating to the complimentary breakfast. The latter was sufficient for our needs and filled us up for a day of sightseeing. It included hot and cold options, including a waffle maker. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable, always willing to help. The hotel manager also mingled with the guests during breakfast. This hotel also supplied hot food at tea time which we did not sample but included foods such as hot dogs and other such delights.
As you have guessed, this is a decent hotel but you will need a car to get to places from there, which is the same throughout Houston. It is exactly as described, the rooms were clean and roomy and serviced daily which is just what we needed, plus there was unlimited free wifi access throughout the hotel.

title: “Excellent value and location”
text: A very good Hotel friendly staff. We are from the U.K. My partner had to go away on business for a few days and l felt quite safe on my own. The manager came round every breakfast time and said hello to everybody.Not a lot of choice at breakfast but nice fresh bread and lovely scrambled egg.Free food in the evening, again not a lot of choice but nice baked potatoes and salad..There is a small shopping centre Uptown Park 5minutes walk that has a few shops Starbucks and a great restaurant called Mccormick & Schmick's. The hotel has a small fitness centre and pool but the spa is lovely after a hard days shopping at The Galleria (5min in a taxi)?..From Pat

title: “Free WiFi, and hot food!”
text:
The place was a little hard to find if you never been to Houston before.
My GPS was not able to locate the location, good thing on the Drury web site it also list the long and lat corrdinates that I can enter into the GPS.
Was going to stay in another hotel in south Houston, this location was selected due to one place that I need to go. Due to my surprise, my friend moved just 10 miles west of the hotel. This worked out very nice for me.
Saw the review from globetrotter15_25 about the towels being old and worn.
The towels in the room were nice.
At the time that we stay at the Drury Inn, the next morning notice a lot of people leaving with dogs. I did not know that there were pets allowed. Later on discover that there was a dog show that weekend and there were poeple staying at the hotel with there dogs. During the night did not hear a dogs barking. Then again I may be tired from the long drive.
At 5:30pm they have some thing called "Kickback", basically FREE Hot Food & Cold Beverages (soda). This was a nice surpise, I knew about the free breakfast and the WiFi but not about the "kickback".
Parking is gated.
The room is nice and clean.
The staff is friendly.
There is a Target store very close by which is very nice.

title: “Saw Sade stayed at Drury Inn”
text:
On the 23 Of July 2011 my husband and I attended the Sade Concert in Houston Texas at the Toyota Center.
While we were there, over night, we stayed at the Drury Inn located at 1615 W. Loop South. The associate at the desk during check in was a very friendly young man, with a great sense of humor. 
Our stay at the hotel was A+! 
 This is why we continue to choose this hotel location time after time when visiting the Houston area. The staff is very professional and friendly. The rooms are very clean and neat, the beds are comfortable and everything you need is right there at the hotel. This hotel offers a hot breakfast with waffles, an afternoon snack and cocktails along with popcorn and drinks for the children.
The grounds around the hotel are clean and well maintained. Having had a car stolen while visiting Houston once what impressed my husband most about this hotel location is that there is a gated parking area that allows you to exit the parking lot only with the use of your room key; Is this security or What!

title: “Wonderful Stay”
text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for a long weekend/wedding reception. Overall we had a wonderful experience. The staff is so friendly and more than willing to help. At check-in our first room had a funny smell to it. Crystal was very helpful and more than happy to move us to another room. The room itself was quite nice and spacious. The bathroom was decent, could maybe use a little facelift. The wedding reception was very nice and very good food. On our last day, we asked for a late check out which we received. Henry was very helpful. Thanks to all of the staff for making it a wecoming weekend in Houston.

title: “Overal, A Good Experience”
text: I travel approximately 80 days a year for business (in Europe and US) and found this hotel quite acceptable. I couldn't rate it higher because the hotel management allowed the contracted gardening service to run their leaf-blower early in the morning. That wasn't fun to wake-up to. (I know if I was running a hotel that wouldn't happen until at least late morning/early afternoon. Seems like a no-brainer.) On the up-side, the front desk employee, Henry Strait was very courteous and helpful. It's questionable if I'd stay there again - just because of the noise, but if I do, I'll definitely ask for a room on a higher floor.

title: “Excellence in everyway”
text: First time in Texas and I can officially say I know where I am going to stay when I come down here again. The staff especially at the front desk is a memorable one. Henry Strait and Crystal are probably the friendliest people I have ever met at a hotel before. The rooms as a whole are very nice and comfortable as a. If you forget something don't worry everyone here has your back or will do their best to help accomodate so you feel at home. The hotel is great overall. Great location because right across the street is pretty much anything you could want to eat and shop for! I promise you I will be back here.

title: “Great Meeting Venue”
text: We had a bird show and convention at this property and the staff could not have been more helpful or accomodating. Nice rooms, great rates and not too far from IAH airport. We used super shuttle from airport.

title: “Rita ROCKS!!”
text: I checked into this hotel Wednesday evening to be welcomed by Rita. Rita is the epitome of customer service! As I stepped up to the counter she smiled, looked me in the eyes and greeted me. Her calm “can do” attitude put everyone at the front counter at ease. She received a phone call from a client staying at the hotel. She graciously asked if I would mind if she took the call. Of course, I agreed. This client asked her, “What channel is ESPN on, on in his room television?” She was extremely patient with this client and found the channel from a roster at the front desk. She has patience that is golden. Please let her know that she is doing a fantastic job and her pleasant demeanor does not go unnoticed. Thank you Rita for helping make my stay an enjoyable one.

title: “Best Customer Service anywher”
text: Ms. Rita Washington made my stay a joy. She remembered my name from my previous stays when she also gave great customer service. If she lived in my area, I would try to steal her away as an employee. Hotel is older but nicely remodeled. Will always stay here when I am visiting my corporate office. Thanks Ms. Rita for making me feel like family!

title: “Excellent staff”
text: The hotel is very large in size and clean. Great for business groups and weddings. Mr. Henry and Miss Crystal at the front desk were nice, friendly, and very helpful with my questions. The food at the hotel was excellent. Our room was restocked with supplies and cleaned everyday by the lovely Mrs. Maria. The hotel shuttle service was handy for me. Mr. Leon took me to the small shopping malls across the street, and he told me about the local area. I love the array of restaurants around the hotel and there is a theater too. I can say that I ate delicious food inside and outside the hotel. I was always greeted with smiling face's from the staff. Which means alot when you're away from home.

title: “Need maintenance”
text:
I've been staying here two times. The first time my carpet was wet nearby the windows, so I could not stand there without getting wet on my feet.
The last time I stayed, the room was better.
The breakfast is okay, but sometimes they don't have the brown bread.

title: “My first stay at a Hilton!”
text: I was VERY impressed with the whole expirience we had this weekend. The people who checked us in and out were very nice, and all smiles. Our room was AMAZING, it was a standard double queen (traveling with friends) and the size was impressive, the beds were SUPER comfortable, the pillows were the best pillows I had ever had in a hotel. We did book our room through Priceline, so our rate was fantastic. Not sure how much their standard rate is though, but I am willing to bet it is worth the money! The location was great, we could walk to Jones Hall, and to all of the food places around downtown Houston.

title: “Updated review”
text: My second time staying here now, I didn't have any issues, the rooms are still so so, it's not high end, but not bad either. The rooms have newer flat screen tvs and are spacious with desks and a sitting area. There is wifi throughout the hotel for free. The staff was super friendly, so nothing bad to say about them. The restaurant was so so, and the staff was really slow in there to notice me waiting, and then to get me a drink and the bill, so I can't recommend the restaurant anyway

title: “Mixed feelings”
text:
Overall by experience at this suite was a good one. I'd stay here again, but like any other hotel it does have drawbacks. It is very clean and has good decor and flat screens in every room. The breakfasts and dinners served are very good and it features free soda and popcorn during the afternoon. 
The staff is my only exception. They are helpful but very paranoid about who stays in the hotel and who doesn't. They don't give me a welcome feeling, and it seems like you can't relax or get work done downstairs because they usually ask to see your room key to prove that you're staying there.

title: “if you want to sleep, avoid this hotel”
text: This hotel is right next to an extraordinarily busy and noisy highway. So the noise is relentless.Staff is not responsive to requests for a quieter room saying there aren't any. The rooms facing away from highway are above the bar where, according to the staff, the music goes very late. In today;s world there are noise-blocking window technologies. This hotel needs to invest in them.

title: “Great hotel!”
text: We stayed at Hotel Sorella over the weekend of 10/28-10/30 for our wedding. We also blocked rooms for our guests as well. The hotel was very modern, contemporary and clean. Location is great and there are many bars/restaurant/shops w/i walking distance, which is unheardof for Houston. The rooms are spacious and clean and the staff is very accommodating. I highly recommend Hotel Sorella. It's best to request a room overlooking the courtyard, as the others face the highway/construction.

title: “A great base for our first visit to the US of A”
text: Stayed at this hotel in March for our first visit to New York – our first visit to America, in fact – and we could have hardly chosen a better place. Very conveniently situated, with the shuttle bus from Newark Airport dropping us only a couple of blocks away, and Times Square very close. Warm welcome, and friendly, courteous service all through our stay. We asked for a quiet room towards the rear of the hotel and away from the elevators, and they were more than happy to oblige. Our room was very spacious and comfortable, with two queen-sized beds. Complimentary coffee available in the lobby all morning, replaced by warm honey-flavoured cider in the afternoon and evening – a great boon on cold March days in New York. Free wi-fi in our bedroom, plus two computers and a printer available for guests in the lobby. A great place to stay, and we fully intend to be back.

title: “Great service in a great location for a great price”
text: My trip was a combination of business and pleasure, so I was looking for a hotel that was convenient for both. A friend of a friend recommended it and I'm glad I listened. It started a little rocky because we wanted two beds but only got one, but other than that it was perfect. Great service, clean, comfortable, and convenient to everything (or a train that would take me to everything). I don't get to NYC very often, but this is now my go-to place.

title: “Slightly disappointed”
text: We stayed at the Eventi 2 nights. The room was very nice and clean, especially the bathroom and shower. The staff was helpful and prompt when we requested extra towels. The hotel, however, had a slightly club vibe with leather walls, etc. Also,it is not in the best location. We would not choose to stay again at this hotel.

title: “Love this hotel!”
text: I just returned from a weekend at Eventi, and it could not have been better. We were celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday, and when the staff heard this, they did their best to make it special for her. Everyone in the hotel seemed to know who we were and that my daughter was celebrating her birthday. Even the housekeeping staff left a hand-made card for her. When we arrived at the hotel very late one evening after going to the theater, the entire lobby staff clapped and cheered for her. But even without the special attention, we loved everything about this hotel. The rooms were well-lighted and set up to make the most of the space. The beds and pillows were extraordinarily comfortable. The service was exemplary. Kimpton Hotels have great properties, and this one is no exception.

title: “Fabulous”
text: We just got back from a 4 night stay and were very impressed to say the least. The room decor was great - I loved the technological "gadgets" and particularly the computer phone by the bed from which one can do a zillion things from calling the butler to shutting the drapes. We loved the art deco theme and particularly the 40's background music playing throughout the property. Excellent location also - and despite being about 1 block from Times Square and in the middle of the theater district the rooms are acoustically sound - a very quiet hotel and we were street side on the 3rd floor! We did not eat there but the staff were fabulous and we will definitely stay there next trip. Kudos!

title: “Wonderful experience in every respect”
text: I stayed at the Chatwal for two nights with my parents following my graduation from university and we truly enjoyed our time. Unlike most hotels in New York, Chatwal demonstrated a consistent standard both in terms of service and the condition of the property. The hotel has a sleek modern art deco feel to it, the staff was wonderful in every respect, and we enjoyed our two spacious rooms, one single and one double. The bathrooms were particularly enjoyable with a waterfall shower and an integrated TV-set, which also worked as a mirror. The Chatwal was like an oasis in a part of New York that generally has a pretty touristy feel to it being just a few steps away from the madness of Times Square. Lastly, I wanted to thank the front desk staff for a complimentary late check out and for being so accommodating. We will surely stay at the Chatwal during our future visits to New York City.

title: “very nice hotel”
text: Certainly the level you would expect from the Four Seasons. Stayed over a weekend and the surrounding area is fairly lacking in restaurant choices for breakfast. But this is rather typical of a downtown hotel in a major city's business district. Very comfortable rooms (we had a suite) and always ready to help staff. Would certainly stay again.

title: “Great hotel”
text: Have stayed here a few times, very nice older hotel, rooms are clean and nicely decorated. Service at the bar is great and breakfast in the restaurant was very good. Great value for the money, perfect location downtown.

title: “"Loved it!"”
text:
We stayed here last night, and I couldn't wait to get on here and tell you about it!
We live in the Houston area, and wanted an overnight getaway from the family. I loved this hotel! It used to be a bank building, and you can tell from the old vault at the front desk and the huge open lobby area. This is a very historic area of downtown, and it was fun just to walk around and look at the architecture of the surrounding buildings too.
The lobby was beautiful, and I really liked the music they played in the common areas. Front desk staff weren't overly friendly, but got the job done very quickly, which was nice. Then we moved on to the elevators. They still have the old "dial" style things to show you which floor the elevator is on :-) You have to put your room key in a slot on the elevator before you can select your floor, which I thought was a nice security precaution, given some of the unsavory folks who sometimes live on the downtown streets here.
When we arrived at our room on the third floor, we were blown away! One of the nicest rooms I've had in any hotel, anywhere. Seriously. It was a junior suite corner room, and it was huge. The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom, too. It had an enormous shower, double sinks, and a jacuzzi tub big enough for two people. When night fell, we could see all the lights from the downtown buildings through our windows - what a cool ambience!
The bed and furniture were all quite comfy, and the room temperature was easy to control. Bedding was also top-notch, for an excellent night's sleep.
If the Mezzanine level is open in the lobby, there's a little romantic niche up there if you can find it
We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, and it was very good and plentiful, and priced about like you'd expect in a hotel restaurant.
It was an excellent stay, and I'm already trying to figure out when we can come again!
The only negative: Mandatory valet for the car at $28 per night. I can understand this in a city like San Francisco or New Orleans, where cars must be parked very far from your hotel and valet has to go several blocks to retrieve your car; then it's a wonderful convenience to be able to valet your car instead of having to look for street parking. But this hotel has a parking garage attached to it, so I don't understand why we couldn't just park our own vehicle in it. Oh well.
Additional info: We ate at the Hearsay Gastro Lounge right around the corner, and the food was really good there. You can reserve on OpenTable.

title: “What a steal of a deal!!”
text: We were not expecting much given some of the reviews, but I found a great deal on this property on Priceline. Hotel was amazing. We asked for a room away from the crowds because the other reviews said the walls were paper thin. We had a great night's rest and never heard a peep all night. The bed was so comfortable. Room was very spacious. We loved it! Also convenient to a few places downtown to grab a quick dinner.

title: “Adecuado”
text: Adecuado para viaje de negocios; el desayuno se toma en un restaurante del centro comercial Gallerie, al cual se accede directamente desde el Hotel. Buena atención del personal y aseo. Las habitaciones cómodas y con balcón.

title: “Exceptional service”
text: I travel a lot for business and this hotel had the best service of any hotel. The staff went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied, and I even had a plate of cookies and chocolate covered strawberries waiting in my room after a long day at work. During check in and out, I watched the hotel staff continually demonstrate exceptional service to everyone they met. The room was large and clean. I would definitely stay here again.

title: “Great extended stay”
text: I travel a majority of the year throughout Texas and recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 weeks straight. What made this hotel a unique place is the amazing staff they have. Very warm and welcoming every day. They do the best to accommodate their guests with all needs, shuttle service and actually excellent food. Although this is a little older hotel, the rooms are good size and very well insulated. I don’t think in the room I heard any hall noise. Plenty of places to eat in the area as well. I will be back.

title: “The customer service phenomenal”
text: Everytime I stay at this location the staff always goes beyond expectations. There are two employees in particular that have built a great repor with me. Henry Strait and Aurelia Gaskin always welcome me with smiling faces and do whatever they can to make my stay comfortable. They keep us coming back..!

title: “Great Stay”
text:
The whole crew at Crowne Plaza was very courteous, helpful and professional.
I enjoyed the excellent service I received during my stay.
I want to especially thank Rebecca for using her personal vehicle to make sure I arrived at my class at Omron on time.
I was on my days off during my stay, the great service and good attitude of the hotel employees made it a good experience while away from home.
thanks
Oliver B. Mills
Nabors Alaska Drilling

title: “Special Thank You for Lara”
text: Upon checkout I asked Lara if I could mail a package from the hotel. She replied that it was not a problem. I gave her the box, shipping information, and account number. She arranged to prepare the box for shipping and asked if it was ok to ship by a certain carrier as she passed by it on her way home! Box arrived safe and sound. Thank you Lara. I will be sure to return to the Crowne Plaza Brookhollow my next trip to Houston!

title: “Good with one major deal-breaker”
text: Good location, pleasant staff, excellent breakfast options. The room was clean and fairly comfortable, though a bit crowded with a king bed. Parking was plentiful and close. The one bad point was the poor condition of the towels: old, worn, and often stained, they were very unappealing and quite a contrast from the otherwise good quality furnishings.

title: “No reason to stay anywhere else!”
text: My family and I were all very pleased with the hotel. There were 6 of us and we had adjoining rooms. So many pluses that you don't get at other hotels - FREE breakfast, FREE parking, FREE wifi, indoor/outdoor pool, and the "Kick Back" time was awesome which included lots of snacks, free fountain drinks, and even 3 alchoholic drinks per adult per night. The hotel was very clean and close to everything we wanted to do and the employees were professional and friendly. The price was great too, especially for all the perks you get! We would definitely stay there again!

title: “Great Hotel for Kids”
text: We loved everything about our stay at the Drury Inn Galleria. We were in Houston for a medical appointment, and chose this location for a change, as we usually stay in the Texas Medical Center. First of all, you never have to worry about he kids being hungry, there is always somehing to eat. The kids spent most of the time at the indoor-outdoor pool. We loved taking our free cocktails, popcorn, sodas, and evening food, and kicking back at the pool. The kids also loved the glass elevator, and beautiful lobby. The breakfast was delicious. The staff was incredible too, plenty of people were always around to help. The rooms were very clean. There were also vending machines, and a washer/dryer. We were happy to have a microwave, fridge in the room too. I will stay at this hotel from now on. The Galleria was around the corner.

title: “A Winner!”
text: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. Priced similarly to a Westin or JW but more chic. Outstanding free continental breakfast makes it a great value. Our room was very quiet. Stayed for ten nights and only noise was very muted jazz music by a band in the plaza below from 6 until 9 on the weekend. While here, we learned it was just named to Conde Nast Gold List (#12 in U.S.). Loved having all the great restaurants and shops around us...tons within walking distance. The hub is a plaza next to the hotel with open space, fountains and fire pits, which seems to serve as a neighborhood gathering place for young and old in the evening. Very European. Lots of fun to watch the little rug rats run around the green space, but few families staying at the hotel. Mostly business people. All 5 star amenities except turndown service and slippers, both far outweighed by the beautiful breakfast and 4 star rates. Huge and efficient walk in shower (no tub) and single sink with plenty of counter space. Everything well designed. Deluxe rooms overlook the plaza, standard ones see the freeways. All are large and the entire hotel looks exactly as it does on the web site. Valet parking is available but pricey and not necessary. There is free parking a few steps from the lobby, which is actually located on the second floor. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: “Excellent hotel!”
text:
Was here on business for two weeks, my wife came along for the trip... We both enjoyed our stay here, hotel was great, location was perfect (for shopping, eating & drinking) and room was decent! The only one negative thing I would have is the gym was pretty poor, but I think all guests get free passes to the external gym which is just 100 meters away from the hotel...
I will return to sorella next time I'm in Houston on business and would definatly recommend it to anyone...

title: “Dont Stay Here Unless You Have Noise Cancelling Headphones”
text: We stayed here this past weekend mainly because of positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Its the first time Trip Advisor has done me wrong. We were given a room that backed up to the Sam Houston Tollway. The accomodations were fine, the room and lobby attractive,...blah blah blah. The problem began at 7am when the construction adjacent to the hotel started. We were awoken to the sounds of bulldozers and other large machinery. That was only the beginning....That night music being played below by an out outdoor musician sounded like he was standing and playing in our room. The music went on well past midnight. It was ridiculous. I have never stayed in a hotel where noise was this much of a factor. Oh, and I failed to mention that we could hear anyone out in the hallway as clear as day. The floors that they use in the rooms allow sound to travel unbelievably. Anyway, the buffet was great and the beds comfy but nothing makes me more miserable than being constantly assaulted by sound in the privacy of my room....To make matters worse when I was checking out and the receptionist asked how my stay was she made no comment after I said "Terrible".

title: “Great destination”
text: This hotel was a conference destination, but would be a great get away destination if you are wanting an urban experience. Great shops, restaurants, etc.

title: “Brilliant Hotel, it really made our visit wonderful”
text:
My wife and I recently spent a week in New York for our honeymoon and after much research I chose the Iroquois Hotel. What a wise decision it was! As mentioned in all other reviews the hotel is located 5 minutes from Times Square and Fifth Avenue making it ideal for any tourist.
Upon arriving we were given the keys to our 11th floor room by Vanessa who was very friendly and always eager to help. The room was just brilliant. Whilst not the largest hotel room, it was perfectly sized for our needs and we found the view to be perfect and just what we wanted.
As it was our honeymoon, the Hotel staff had provided chocolate covered strawberries, chocolates, a bottle of wine and a nice congratulations letter. We thought this was a really nice gesture and started our trip off on a very positive note.
 Back to the room, The bed was super comfy and the bathroom was well laid out with a large amount of towels. The room doesn't come with a regular fridge as standard, it has a minibar style cooler which will charge you if you tamper with any of the contents however I believe a regular fridge can be provided if necessary. The rooms AC was a Godsend given how warm NY is this time of year. Walking back into the room after a scorching hot day was always a relief!
Even if we had the do not disturb on the door, we would recieve a complimentary call in the evening asking if we would like our room cleaned later on anyway which is rare nowadays and a welcome choice.
The hotel staff, from front desk to the cleaners were all very polite and always eager to please. I would especially like to thank the three doormen we had most contact with; John, Carlos and Rocky. They opened doors, helped with our luggage and would hail cabs whenever we left on a day trip. 
The only negative I could mention was the hotel only having one elevator. It's a minor complaint but staying on the 11th floor often meant we were waiting a little while on an elevator that wasn't packed full. As I said, a minor fault for a beautiful, comfortable and highly recommended hotel which we will DEFINITELY be staying at next time we travel to the Big Apple! Book with confidence and enjoy your stay!

title: “Iroquois - great location and a good find”
text:
We had been searching for a hotel in New York for a long weekend in March, and one name kept coming up as available - The Iroquois. It seemed to be reasonably priced though well located, so perhaps there was a catch - well, we were pleased to find there wasn't.
Situated just minutes walk from 5th Avenue, Times Square and numerous must-see places, the hotel could be used as a business stopover as well as a tourist base. Service was friendly at all times, and the facilities were clean and well-maintained. The rooms are not the huge size that is associated with many US hotels, but this is due to the nature of the building and its location, and is more than made up for in the character.
The hotel restaurant is quite pricey, but there are so many good eateries within 3 blocks radius that you can always find somewhere to eat from breakfast to dinner.
Highly recommended and will be looking to stay again on our next trip to the Big Apple.

title: “Thank you Rita Washington!!”
text: Thank you Rita Washington for your wonderful customer service! You are definitely a great ambassador for Crowne Plaza! Next time we come to Houston on business we will be staying at the Crowne Plaza!!!!

title: “Nicest People in Houston!!”
text:
I stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights and my first impression was a sarcastic "great, another hotel." Obviously, I travel A LOT. But the employees here really made an impression on me - they remember who you are, remember what you like, aren't pressuring at all...it's SO refreshing. They remember your name when you walk in the lobby in the middle of the day. Who does that?! 
Each morning I saw Richard in the restaurant he had a smile and would greet me by name and ask me about what I "got goin' on today." And then each evening Ali would bring up my room service, ask me how my day was, tell me I was working too much when he saw the desk in my room covered in papers, make me laugh and leave me with a smile - even if my day was stressful, that guy had me smiling by the end of it. The manager even drove the shuttle for us a few times!
People are just SO nice and not in a fake or overbearing "get your stupid smiley face away from me right now" kind of way - just genuinely nice. And I KNOW I can be less than nice when I'm on a business trip - but these people really made a difference in my attitude. Ali and Richard, y'all are rockstars! I'll definitely be back here because of you. 
Thank y'all for listening, being perceptive, and just being flat out nice. High five!

title: “John R”
text: I've been staying at this location nearly every week for almost 3 years. I keep going back because of the excellent service provided by the entire staff. Riz, Aurelia, and Henry always provide a warm welcome and make sure that all my needs are taken care of. I highly recommend staying at the Brookhollow location.

title: “Just ok”
text: Hotel is ok, no thrills. Room was clean with all the basic amenities, clean towels every day. Breakfast was ok nothing special. Gym is a small room with 4 threadmills and a TV. Thin walls could hear the other guests TV's through the wall.

title: “Friendly service, free hot food and free wifi rocks!”
text:
We love this place! We stayed here 4 nights and enjoyed the free sodas and hot drinks available throughout the day. The free hot food served from 5:30-7pm nightly was good enough for dinner with hotdogs, meatballs, chicken tenders, salad, hot potatoes, chips and nachos. Cocktails and beers were also offered. This was ideal for us as we were so jetlagged after travelling halfway round the world. The people at the front desk were helpful offering tips on where to go, and even helped me made arrangements for a tour to NASA space center. Roxanne at the front desk helped me call 3 different operators to find the best deal for us and made arrangements for next day pick-up. How cool is that?
The location is great. We walked to the Galleria for shopping (about 2.5 block away), and took a cab back with all our shopping (about $7). Jack-in-the-box, a 24h food mart and 24h pharmacy are just down the street. 
We were upgraded to an oversized King suite - a living room and a bedroom - so we had 2 plasma TVs and a microwave, empty fridge and a coffee-maker. The room was spacious and clean. My son enjoyed the recliner and even napped on it one day. Check-out time is 11am, but the sign said you could asked for an extension later. As our pickup to the airport was 1pm, I asked for an extension and got it, no questions asked! I am now hooked on Drury's and would opt to stay in their chain for my next stay in the USA!

title: “A Home Away from Home..... with b'fast,dinner & wifi included what more could you ask for!”
text:
Drury Inn at Galleria in Houston was a home away from home. With breakfast, dinner snacks including 3 alcohlic drinks, wifi, free parking and the fastest friendliest checkin staff what more could you ask for.
The hotel is of course not 5 star but honestly why would you want to bother going anywhere else with all the inclusions and wonderful staff we are hooked. 
And of course its at a bargain price too.
The room was great with a huge bathroom and separate vanity. The rooms furnishings were so comfortable and there was even a fridge and microwave for your free popcorn downstairs. 
We had a wonderful nights sleep and felt so relaxed after a long drive the day before. The breakfast was a mini buffet with everything you want and more !
In the future we will be staying at Drury Inn & Suites on our travels throughout America....with all the inclusions and convenience of parking too it will be Drury all the way !

title: “Perfect in every way”
text: My husband and I were celebrating our 24 year anniversary and they made it special by putting us in a king suite on the 5th floor. It was so nice and quiet and very relaxing. The food and drinks served for no additonal cost in the evening was superb and the hot breakfast the next morning was great and filling. The extras are truly free when you stay with them and the hotel was clean and updated in everyway. I will stay at the Drury Inn by the Galleria downtown everytime I am in Houston for business or pleasure from now on.

title: “Very Chic.....”
text: my partner and I were visiting family in Katy, we wanted to say in a new hotel and are glad we decided to stay at Hotel Sorella.. very very nice place, service was excellent, rooms VERY NICE. i will stay here again..

title: “It is very good - restaurant not good”
text:
I stayed there once last October for business and I wasn't really fascinated, but after another experience, I have to say it is good. Unless you can go to an higher level (galeria), then this is your choice.
Rooms and hotel are new, clean, no problems at all. Fancy style hotel. It was built on an area where there was a commercial center. So now everything is new.
Around there are restaurants at a walking distance (unheard for Houston), you better go there as I tried the restaurant of the hotel and it wasn't great.
The view from the hotel is the highway, and you are not downtown. So evaluate what you want from your Houston trip.
It is a bit expensive generally speaking, but I did not find any great deals in Houston for this level of hotels.

title: “modern”
text: Clean sleek and modern. Great for a weekend getaway. Free breakfast with juices, yogurt, danish, cereal, fruit & great coffee! Food and drinks is a bit pricey at hotel. There are other places to eat very close by. On Sat live music on the green that is kid friendly. Sushi place under , hotel that has great prices at happy hour. Room is clean sleek & modern. Flat screen tv, mini bar, cd player, hook up for ipod, ironing board, free breakfast, free wi-fi and nice comfy plush robes.

title: “Hard to beat!”
text: After several stays this place is the tops. The rooms are nice, the staff helpful and the location great. The other plus point is a nice breakfast with plenty of original and healthy options.

author.location: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom

title: “Excellent Hotel & Service”
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel and the service was remarkable. Firstly, they helped me with directions since Google maps places the location of the hotel incorrectly. They then let me check in early and accommodated me well. Room service was great, although they seemed to be very hell bent on cleaning the room by 12 p.m., even though my girlfriend and I weren't ready yet. 
I had a bit of an issue when I returned one night because our restroom's door had mysteriously locked itself. The staff didn't have a key to open the door, but the manager at that moment (I believe it was Iya) helped open it as quickly as possible. She sent someone to open it quickly and even called to make sure everything was resolved.
Lastly, I had forgotten my laptop charger in the room. Elizabeth and Tammy located it and shipped it via UPS free of charge! I've never experienced such friendly service with any business. They truly care about making their customers feel special. Although the location is a bit outside of all the Houston hot spots, I can definitely see myself returning every time I'm in Houston. The rooms were excellent as well. HDTV with over 50 channels and extremely comfortable beds.

title: “Perfect hotel for a business conference or training venue.”
text:
Even before arriving at the hotel I found the sales staff to be very responsive to our requirements for the set up of the conference room for our week long Management training session. On arrival I was surprised to find the hotel foyer welcoming and homely and the rooms were well appointed with extremely comfortable beds. The quality of the TV system in the room was the best I have seen in any hotel!
During our training session the service given by the facilities and catering staff was of a consistently high quality as were the meals and the variation of the food from day to day.
Thanks to all the hotel staff but in particular Brittany for making it all happen.

title: “Huge hotel”
text: You walk in to a very impressive lobby with a great bar to the left that a good place to meet for drinks and bar food, its open and perfect size. The rooms are very nice just like any other Hilton. We were hoping for a brunch on a Sunday but not one. Just the regular menu but the drivers will take you to area restaraunts plus they gave us a free dessert, just for asking. Very nice and restful stay. (If you are on the arena side there is a amphitheater that may have something going on that you may hear in your room)

title: “A Work of Art”
text: My usual hotel in Houston was booked, so I had to give this one a try. Boy, am I glad I did. This hotel is a work of art. The lobby is ultra hip and the rooms had everything that you could imagine. It was a great, comfortable stay in a hotel that exceeded expectations. I was thoroughly impressed with the helpfulness of the front desk team as well.

title: “Enjoyed My Stay Here”
text:
I had to go to a downtown wedding and I thought this hotel would be the perfect place to stay after searching the internet. I found it to be extremely elegant and refined and I loved my room! I had a corner room on the fourth floor and it was very well maintained. 
The only negative aspect of the hotel is that they were doing construction on it at the time, which caused some disruption and I thought the location of the hotel was not in the best area. Next time, I will probably opt to stay in the River Oaks area or something near the Galleria. One other thing that was a little bothersome was that the morning after the wedding (keep in mind I got back into my room very late that night before), I wanted to sleep in, slip into my robe, order room service, and relax before checkout at noon. The room service was spectacular and I thoroughly enjoyed my breakfast, but by 10 a.m. housekeeping was knocking at my door to come and clean. I placed the "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door, but the girl (who did not speak English) came back again repeatedly and said, "I need to clean your room." I felt very rushed and annoyed, and felt like I was being kicked out!
Overall, I had a pleasant experience here and I felt like the hotel lived up to my expectations.

title: “Wedding”
text: We felt as though we were staying with relatives. The staff were so eager to help make us comfortable. Valet was quick, food good and healthy, bed was very comfy and the all around atmosphere was very pleasant. Thank you Four Seasons

title: “Fantastic luxury hotel !”
text: Hotel is beautiful and luxurious. Staff is great. Great personal service.

title: “Lovely location”
text:
Wanted to stay somewhere slighty quieter than last visit and hotel beacon was perfect. Subway less then 5 min walk. Central park 10 min walk. Used the subway alot to get around. Food shops where great as our room had a small kitchen. 
Very residential area and not so many tourists so felt one of the locals.

title: “Worth splashing out for”
text: My two teenagers and I stayed here for four nights in the second half of our trip to NYC. By this time we were grateful for the extra space and privacy a suite gives you. We requested a good view and were knocked out by what we got from the 21st floor. Took loads of photos in different lights. The suite was decorated in a soothing green palate and was completely immaculate, with arty prints far superior to the normal bland wall-fillers. Having the kitchenette meant that we could bring back food from the amazing 'foodie' supermarket across the road. All dirty dishes were discretely replaced while we were out. If only this would happen at home! The location is perfect. The walk to Central Park is long enough to give you a feel for the neighbourhood without tiring you out too much, and 72nd Street subway is just a couple minutes away. The only downside to the hotel is the lack of a restaurant/bar/cafe. It would've been nice to have a place to chat to other guests, though friendly American guests were happy to break the ice in the lifts!

title: “Top marks”
text:
We stayed in the Beacon, New York last week and we have nothing but praise for the hotel, the staff (particularly the staff), and the rooms were really nice and spotlesly clean.
We travelled to a wedding with a largre group of people and having seen their hotels, I know we got the best deal of all. Some had cheaper hotels, none had better.

title: “The best hotel experience we have ever had!”
text: “The shop menu was wonderful, the food preparation terrific and the ambiance delightful….The atmosphere of the Bar was fun, hip, enjoyable and the drinks and food fun are delicious………Our stay was perfect!.........The hotel is truly amazing, whenever we needed something it was there!....I believe our stay was the best of any hotel at which we have ever stayed.”

title: “Sleek, modern and all the trimmings”
text:
This hotel is simply amazing and very stylish. The open style check in area, where the staff seem to just float around with computer tablets, the sleek cafe/bar and the modern rooms.
Andaz is simply a breath of fresh air from the old style boring New York hotels that lack character.
The room itself was lovely. The ceilings were ridiculously high. The bathroom has sleek stone-like floors. The is a rainwater shower, with a separate shower head so you can use both at once. Dual sinks and a foot spa. 
We had a view of the Library which was gorgeous. There are also remote controlled blinds, so you can open up the view without even getting out of bed. The bed itself was super comfortable and the TV was perfectly positioned at the end of the bed.
This hotel gets all the little things right, such as including free WiFi, free mini bar (non alcoholic) and snacks. I would rather have these things built in to the price of the room, than pay ridiculous extra charges that make you feel like you've been ripped off.
The staff were excellent. Our window broke and they moved everything for us when the engineer could not fix it on the spot. We ended up on the 4th floor, and the sound proofing was excellent.
I noticed some people commented on the price of breakfast. Down in the cafe there were a couple of breakfast options for less than $10 and the coffee was excellent (I can't speak for room service).

title: “A Classy Hotel in a Central Location”
text:
I can honestly say I have done my homework with NYC hotels, simply because the choice is endless. We finally chose the Setai for our 3 night, child-free stay in the City because it seemed to exude luxury - something you don't often get when 2 small children are in tow. We weren't disappointed. This is a classy hotel in a central location.
We stayed in a large terrace suite which had a queen bed, a seating area, a dressing area, an enormous bathroom with walk-in shower and the biggest bath you are ever likely to see. While you couldn't really see much from the terrace itself, it was a bonus to be able to lay out in the 'fresh' air and listen to the noise of NYC below. Nice touches generally in the room, include: a television in the bathroom mirror (things you never knew you needed), a free soft drinks mini bar, a nespresso machine and lovely biscuits/popcorn at turn-down. 
As you would expect in a 5* hotel, the staff were all courteous, friendly and helpful, with some great insights for places to eat from the concierge. The spa was fabulous - we really didn't have enough time to do all the different treatment rooms justice but I can thoroughly recommend a massage. The bar was good. 
Perhaps my husband's favourite benefit of the hotel was the Maserati which gave us a ride to our dinner date. You can't book it but if you speak to the doorman on your way out in the evening, he can advise you if you're likely to be able to use the car and the waiting time.
None of the main sights are very far from the hotel; the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, the Chrysler Building, the Rockerfeller Plaza and the 5th avenue shops are all an easy walk. Real finds for us this time were the High Line, Bryant Park and Daniel restaurant.
To summarise, a great hotel if you want class, service and a little bit of luxury. Don't come here if you want trendy, hip interiors with parties going on in to the early hours. Not this time anyway...

title: “A home from home”
text:
I stay here when in NYC for work, I have stayed in other hotels, Marriott Marquis on Time Square and Algonquin an autograph hotel on 44th street, neither even come close to the Setai, the rooms are modern, clean and fresh, with great space in the bathroom for your toiletries, they also replenish their toiletries daily without fail and offer all the extras, like body sponge, comb, cotton buds and pads, you seriously don't need to take anything with you other than your toothbrush and tooth paste. 
Last time I was there I requested a DVD player to do my exercise dvd in the room, although I checked in at 1am, they came up and fitted it for me to have in the morning, and yes the room was big enough for me to do my work out DVD too!
The turn down service with cookies or other treats is a really nice touch and the complimentary drinks are great to grab as heading out the door on your way to work and rushing! 
All in all, I now only stay elsewhere if the Setai is full, otherwise I stay here (even forfeiting collecting Marriott points, because this hotel is honestly worth it!)
Also if you are traveling on your own and a woman I can honestly say I felt very safe at this hotel, the staff make you feel like they know all the guests and this made me feel like they would notice if someone was walking around and not staying at the hotel, plus the lift nly works with a valid room key, looking forward to returning on the 13th August again!

title: “Great Property and Great People”
text: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights, having cashed in a boat load of SPG points that I have been accumulating (and cherishing) for years. I am an SPG Platinum member and have stayed in many great locations. This hotel has rooms that are as good or better than any that I have stayed in, with great decorating and all the technological advancements mentioned in earlier reviews. The location is great, being very central, but is a nice escape from Times Square (which is fun at first but can quickly turn to annoying). What sets this property apart is the staff. In my experience, the service was exceptional and was beyond reproach. They pay attention to every detail and genuinely care about guests' enjoyment. As a relatively small hotel with great staff, it was like coming home to a private residence at the end of the day. We will return without hesitation.

title: “FABULOUS HOTEL”
text:
The hotel is great. The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. The property is lovely. It is stylish and sleek. The room was beautiful and quiet, and filled with the most wonderful and modern ammenities.The mattress was so comfortable and the sheets and bed linens were so soft. The bathroom is out of this world. 
Any one complaining about this hotel just doesn't want to be happy. 
It is a fine hotel with a fine staff.

title: “Great boutique hotel”
text:
My wife and I spent four nights at Eventi Hotel in Manhattan. It was a little bit expensive. We payed 500 americans dolars per night but Manhattan is an expensive destination.The location is the must. We arrived from Washingron DC by train and we walked 3 blocks from Penn Station to the hotel. The lobby is impressive, wonderful , well decorated. The check in was perfect and fast. We stayed in the City View Room and we had the Empire State View. The room is a litle small and dark, but clean, nice decorated, confortable bed,very good bathroom, free wifi, great view window.Everything fine but the room needs a litle bit more light at night.
We had complimentary coffee and tea every morning in the lobby.For the breakfast there are lots of "deli" near the hotel. There´s a good 0.99 store at 32th street when it´s possible buy bread, cheese, orange juice,yougurt etc etc etc and it´s very cheap and good quality.
To go to Newark Airport we booked throught the hotel reception the" supershuttle" and was very good too.They pick us up in the hotel direct to Newark Airport for only 20 american dolars each person.
Well New York is still a very good destination.Wonderful city. I recommend to stay at Eventi Hotel.I enjoyed so much.
It´s our second Kipton Hotel. Very nice hotel brand.

title: “"Blame-the-customer-attitude"”
text:
There are a lot of great things to say about this hotel, but I was still disappointed. One thing was the announced fitness class. For two days in the row, the instructor never showed up - and I did not get one excuse from the hotel. On the contrary, one receptionist more or less blamed me; perhaps I was at the wrong place, perhaps I had showed up too late, etc. 
Having worked with service management in a hotel myself, that kind of "blame-the-customer-attitude" always pisses me off! 
Another day I was out all day and came back at 7 PM, only to find that my room had not been cleaned. When I asked why in the reception, I got their standard answer: it was my fault! I must have pushed the "do not clean button", which I am sure I had not done. (My neighbor in the attaching room had, though, and perhaps they thought it was a suite). 
Now, these things did not ruin my stay and there were a lot of great things as well, such as the fitness centre, which I really liked. I might stay again, but not get up at 6.30 in order to catch the fitness class, which does not always exist.

title: “Big on hospitality”
text:
I stayed at The Iroquois New York over 4 days and must say I went away rather impressed. Although the hotel was a little dated, its charm had really to do with the building's long and illustrious history (I read somewhere even James Dean once stayed here).
The room I stayed in was small but comfortable. What should be emphasized though is the level of service, in particular Bill the bellboy and Vanessa at concierge. Their overarching help and enthusiasm made my stay at The Iroquois a lot more memorable.
The Iroquios Hotel is strategically located within a stone's throw from Times Square and Fifth Avenue - a real gem among the litany of hotels in Midtown - and most definitely warrants a return visit.

title: “Great Gem in Midtown”
text:
Everything about the Iroquois was first-class. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable. As we stayed for a week, we got to know the front desk clerks as well as the doormen and housekeeping staff. The room was on the smallish side, but terrifically well-appointed and well-thought-out. Not sure why you'd need any more room, when you get right down to it. We also tried the Lantern's Keep bar (excellent) and treated one of our Manhattanite friends to dinner at Triomphe, which was exquisite. If you are looking for a stylish, small hotel in a great location -- walking distance to Grand Central, library, Broadway theatres, etc -- look no further. 
As a regular NYC visitor, I've enjoyed staying in many different hotels over the years, but I'm sure that I'll be back at the Iroquois in the future!

title: “Perfect location in Midtown!”
text: We chose the San Carlos Hotel solely because of the TripAdvisor reviews we read about it. We had an interior room which was quiet and cozy. The rooms have a refrigerator, microwave and coffee-maker. Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and also a wonderful business center with several computers with internet access and connected printers. The workout room was perfect as well - TV's, towels, bathroom, and all the necessary exercise equipment. The Hotel Staff was spectacular... helpful, kind, efficient and quick. We arrived early in the morning on a Tuesday (red-eye flight) and were able to get into our room at 10am to nap and shower. The Aveda shampoos, soaps and lotions were wonderful and the bed was the best hotel bed we have ever slept in. The location could not be better... walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and easy Subway access to everywhere else. Next time we travel to NYC, we will be staying at the San Carlos Hotel.

title: “Such a delightful surprise”
text: We found the San Carlos through TripAdvisor and couldn't have been more delighted. It was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in in NYC. The location was supurb, the front desk very welcoming and our rooms immaculately clean, spacious and away from any street noise. We couldn't believe our great good fortune. The continental breakfast was generous with sweet rolls, patisseries, yogurt, orange juice, coffee, tea, fresh fruit, cottage cheese, etc. The 24/7 internet availability was convenient as were the 24/7 gym facilities. The room was tastefully decorated, the bathroom smacking clean and up-scale modernized, the beds amazingly comfortable with lovely linens, and the staff and personnel couldn't have been more accommodating and gracious. All in all, the San Carlos is a hotel that we can recommend without reservation. Hello to Gabriel and to Bobby...two of the staff members who are excellent representatives of the San Carlos's impeccable hospitality.

title: “Fantastic holiday”
text: I have just returned to London today, having spent five nights at the San Carlos, which I picked out from Trip Advisor reviews. Expedia informed them it would be my birthday when I was staying. Upon arrival I found a beautiful room big enough for three, and a fabulous gift box of goodies with a Happy Birthday note. You can't top that! The staff were exceptionally helpful and polite. The hotel is situated in a very nice part of Manhattan and very near the subway - you can get just about anywhere! My room had a fridge with small freezer, microwave, china and coffee maker always supplied with coffee. I cannot fault the San Carlos and need to save up to return as soon as I can!

title: “Real Boutique hotel”
text:
SN is a small jewel.
 It has only 50 rooms and suites. Most or all are individually owned and furnished but run by the hotel. Rooms are recently renovated and are luxurious in traditional way.
It is like having your own opulent apartment at the best location in NY.

title: “Awesome Suites w/ Central Park Views”
text: Absolutely gorgeous, large suite with expansive views on Central Park. It even came complete with binoculars and a bird watching book as well as a telescope - very nice touches! Lovely large master bathroom, huge living room that was really lushly appointed, not so large bedroom ( ! ) , sweet guest bath. Extraordinary views, excellent service, excellent room service, great location. If you don't mind spending - this is a wonderful choice.

title: “My review”
text: This is a very nice place to stay, very clean rooms very comfortable with no bad smells. The only bad thing is the location, which is in a run down area of town that is trying to evolve into a nice area.

title: “Great business hotel in NE Houston.”
text: Excellent and caring front desk staff and management. Very clean and comfortable hotel. The breakfast and coffee are better than a typical "continental" style at many moderately-priced chain hotels. I've stayed before, and will continue to patronize this location.

title: “Great Hotel”
text: This is a very clean Hotel and the service was wonderful! Breakfast was very good. The staff was very nice and helpful. Location very good close to alot of places. I plan to stay here any time I'm in Houston. I won't go any where else but this Hotel.

title: “Great experience”
text: Location was of the most up most importance Central to everything that I wanted to visit. The room was Clean and Large Plenty of room to move around in. One of the staff was sad to see us go (traveled with our dogs) said she enjoyed seeing our pets every morning. Which not many places say and mean.

title: “Singapore Math Training”
text: We had excellent service throughout our stay. Aurelia, Henry, Crystal, Stanley and everyone else that we encountered were pleasant and helpful. I left my Kindle in my room and Crystal was more than helpful in arranaging it to be sent to me. Thanks again for the excellent service

title: “hospitality exellent.”
text: we stayed at this location and it was so pleasant.front desk attention is very good,henry is a very good worker,thanks henry for your attention.we will be back soon. clear lake restoration plus roberto saravia m.

title: “Much Better Hotels Nearby”
text: The hotel itself is an older property. This in and of itself isn't bad but it's breaking down and apparently the staff can't keep up. There are two connected parts to the property on the east side it's a bit more modern, on the west side of the pool just think of it as Motel 6. While the staff does an excellent job on service it can't help but be seen as bailing water on the Titanic. Late night the stream of hookers through the lobby seemed endless. The air conditioner was set around 80 and had the knobs removed. When I asked if they could either bring me a knob to change it or give me another room I was denied on both counts. Overall I was very disappointed and won't stay again.

title: “Extras without any extra payment!! Fantastic”
text: What can I say? After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, I booked this hotel and was not disappointed. Upon arrival, was greeted by cheerful staff who quickly reallocated us to a quieter room as my husband didnt want to be disturbed by passing traffic (its located off the freeway). The room was spacious and very, very clean. Had hair dryer, ironing board and iron, microwave, tea and coffee making facilities plus fridge and TV. Would have been great if it had a safe, but that's just a minor point. There is a small pool, gym and you can buy snack food at their "pantry shop" - though supermarkets are within 5 mins drive. They also have an onsite laundromat so you can wash and dry your clothes for about $1.50 each machine, which we did. Great "kick back" at 5.30pm, we saw many guests eat this as their main dinner instead of pre-evenings snacks. They served hotdogs with buns, baked potatoes, salad, chicken breast bites, crisps and popcorn. Each guest is allowed 3 free alcoholic drinks and soft drinks are limitless during this period of time. Also on site, free wi-fi and access to printer, free printing (if you needed to print your boarding passes) and one hour free international calls each day, and local calls are free. My husband and I enjoyed our stay here, even though it was not a fancy 5 star hotel which we usually stay in, it was a pleasure to stay here and I would not hesitate to book this place again when we next visit Houston. Location was great for shopping at the huge Galleria complex and equally great for dining local fare like Taste of Texas, Goode & Co, Saltgrass and Kata Robata.

title: “Great Location, Outstanding Service, Friendly Staff, Lots of Perks”
text:
First time we ever stayed at a Drury. This one in Houston was wonderful. Staff is very friendly (even left us a birthday card and anniversary note) and extremely helpful. Call directly to get best rate. 
Not a deluxe hotel by any stretch, but well above average quality for the price. Great basic accomodations, but the extras and service set it apart.
We were in town for concert and Astros games. Easy access to highways. Very convienient to downtown area and (if you must!!!) the Galleria. Airport (IAH) an easy 30 minutes ouside of rush hour. 
Room was clean and comfortable albeit a bit small. Pool is small but clean (indoor/outdoor). Free basic hot breakfast in the morning and drinks/appetizers in evening. 
Very impressed. Will stay at this Drury if ever back in Houston, and will stay at other Drurys while travleing based on this experience.

title: “Fantastic Place for a Party!”
text: From the moment I stepped into this hotel when I was looking for a place for my daughter's bat mitzvah party, I knew it was the perfect place to have her event. The staff is friendly, knowledgable, and did everything they could to make the party a special event. They succeeded! The food was excellent, the accomodations for out-of-town guests were comfortable, the service was great, the banquet room was the perfect size. I had a very good experience with the Hilton Garden Inn and will recommend it to family and friends planning a social event.

title: “Great wedding experience”
text:
