We had our wedding reception here. The hall was great and the staff that was on hand was super. We were provided the king suite, it was very nice. THe room is set up kind of awkward and making it into a suite may have been a stretch. The a/c works in mysterious ways as well. 
Sometimes the desk staff is great, sometimes not. We noticed about half the time they seemed to not be to interested in their job, while other times they were right on top of it.
The place has its ups and downs, but what they have going for them is its brand new, with many staff that really want to make sure you have the best experience. The worst thing about it is the road that its on being in between a resturant and a hummer dealer. If you blink you will miss the entrance and be taking the long way around.

title: “Great conference due to professional staff attention”
text:
From the minute I called to set up a last minute startegic planning meeting every request was attended to. As the meeting facilitator I am always a little nervous about trying new hotels - you never know what to expect. We were able to successfully put together a very important planning meeting with Hilton's professional staff. I had a number of last minute needs that the banquet and conference staff were able to accommodate with a smile.
Highly recommend and will plan another meeting here when the opportunity exists

title: “Everything is first class”
text:
I organized fundraising events at the Hilton as part of a conference going on next door at the George R Brown Convention Center. This hotel is visually stunning. Everyone was taken care of -- the valets and bellmen were always smiling, check ins were quick, and the rooms were clean and nice. 
The staff who organized the events were top-notch -- there was not a request too big or a detail too small that they did not take care of. Everything was flawless. I highly recommend this hotel and all of its wonderful staff.

title: “Great Location and Expected Rooms_DvB”
text:
The staff was courteous but aloof. I suppose that is what you expect at a more elegant hotel. Check-in was speedy and the view was ok. They have a viewing deck that offers excellent city views.
I am always baffled when I have some unexpected trip or travel plan change, and I stay at a low price airport hotel or mid-priced chain, the bottled water is complimentary as is the Internet. Then you stay at a central hotel that is billed a bit more exclusively and everything has a fee.
Otherwise, the sleep quality and location are superb. This property is an easy walk to many downtown destinations even in Houston’s heat and humidity. Both weather discomforts are eliminated if you stay here and use the skybridge to the GRB Convention Center.
This is probably not the most family friendly hotel given the ambiance and business traveler traffic that could easily find little Timmy underfoot, but for leisure or business, it is a great location and clean property.

title: “cool downtown hotel option in houston”
text:
If you're in town for business but want something a little different than the standard business hotel, you should try the Hotel Icon. We were only there overnight but it was the perfect location for our meetings, dinner, etc. I hope our next visit will allow a little more time to enjoy the area.
The location is perfect for most of the downtown offices but the hotel also has a complimentary shuttle service if you need it. The hotel is in a converted bank building with a really massive lobby-area that now serves as the front desk and restaurant/bar. The old-style property brings a lot of interesting detail to the renovated hotel so that there is almost always some unique feature to attract your attention. The staff is also very friendly and really helpful when answering questions or providing directions.
There are multiple room offerings available but even the “standard” room was over-sized and really well decorated. My room had everything I needed to get a little work done and included a mini-bar area and a very large bathroom with a large soaking tub and a separate full size shower.
I went for a run at the near-by Buffalo Bayou (a short 3-block walk) in the morning so I didn’t use the gym but when I stopped in for a banana and a bottle of water it looked like they had all the basic equipment necessary for a quick workout while on the road.
If you haven’t been to the Hotel Icon, I hope you get a chance to visit soon.

title: “Not a safe area & no taxi's available”
text: I booked this hotel for my husband based on the recommendations on this site. He said the hotel was ok but the area not so great and would not want to stay there again. There were no taxi's available in front of the hotel and you had to wait while they called one to pick you up. He was told that due to the area they didn't like waiting around.

title: “Very nice place to stay in Houston”
text:
I just returned from a three-night stay at the Hotel Icon and was very impressed overall. My friends and I shared two rooms in this renovated classic building on the northerly end of downtown Houston. We were in town for a ballgame at Minute Maid Park, which was about a ten-minute walk from the hotel. The Icon is also located next to a stop on Houston's new light rail line and is close to downtown freeways. Do note that if you're staying here on the weekend that downtown Houston isn't yet a 24/7 hub of activity despite efforts to develop one. Finding coffee both Saturday and Sunday mornings was a challenge. However, drinking and dining options within a short drive were plentiful, and we found some good pubs and bars south along Main Street that satisfied our needs.
The room I stayed in had two queen beds, and ample seating. The desk doubled as the nightstand between the two beds, which was unique but fine. There was also ample storage in a closet and three-drawer dresser. The bathroom is huge and amply lit, and had a spacious shower/ tub with good water pressure. There was also a spacious marble counter in the bathroom and multiple large mirrors in the room and bath, which would be handy for primping if I did that!
One thing of note: the hotel is going for a retro 1920s-1930s look while positioning itself as a 21st Century hotel with modern amenities. The color schemes and furnishings are different from anything I've ever seen in a modern hotel. However, I think it mostly succeeds in its modern and classic stylings despite a few very minor hiccups (the free in-hotel wi-fi didn't seem to work).
We didn't avail ourselves of many of the hotel's amenities except the valet parking, which was prompt and reliable, if not a touch on the pricey side. The hotel bar in the lobby looked fine with a handful of local beers on tap, and the hotel restaurant looked the part.
All in all, I would definitely stay at the Icon the next time I found myself in Houston and would recommend it to others.

title: “Excellent stay for Mother's Day getaway!”
text: I live in Houston and my husband gave me a night at in hotel in Houston to stay the Saturday before Mother's Day. I had never stayed at the Four Seasons, and they had a great rate on hotels.com. When I got there, I was really close to making my appointment at the spa on time. When I arrived at the front desk, I found out that my reservation I thought I had made on hotels.com had not actually gone through. The nicest guy at the front desk, Robbie, probably saw the fear on my face and assured me not to worry that there was still some availability at the hotel. He so kindly put my luggage away for me and directed me to the spa and told me not to worry about anything and that he would have me taken care of by the time I got back. Evelyn at the spa was wonderful for a massage. When I returned to the front desk, Robbie was not there, but a nice girl named Yvette told me that Robbie had indeed taken care of me. They were all so nice at the desk, offered me a bottle of cold water, and they even walk around the desk to come give you your key. You feel like royalty with the service. We usually stay at Ritz Carltons when we travel, so service is very important to us. When I got up to my room, sweet Robbie called me to check in on me and make sure everything was okay. The room was so clean and nice and very quiet (was on 16th floor overlooking pool), and the beds are very comfortable. There is even a dvd player if you bring your own movies. The bellman, room service attendant, and valet attendant were all so nice and service oriented. Even the concierge was so nice when I called with a question. The room service food was wonderful (I had the margherita pizza), and my family came up the next day to spend lunch at the pool and the food there was wonderful too. The pool area is very lush and relaxing. You are greeted when you walk out to the pool and taken to chairs. You feel so special. Thank you to the Four Seasons Houston for such a memorable Mothers Day and a shout out to Robbie at the front desk for making it extra special - thank you Robbie!!

title: “I was there today.”
text:
I have stayed at the Four Seasons chain for several years now. I usually go to the one in Nayarit, Mexico. It's a resort rather than a hotel and they never cease to amaze me. I had to be in Houston for a few days and I decided to stay at the Four Seasons. As soon as I stepped out of my car and was greeted by the valet I was greeted: "Welcome to the Four Seasons, Sir" and I knew I could expect top-notch service as I would in any 5 star hotel. 
The doors were opened for us everywhere we went. Our bags were taken up and our car was valet. Standard for this hotel. The lobby looked great, but not the common "Grand" entrance in comparison to other Four Seasons hotels I've stayed at. I was processed really quick to get my room key. The lady walked me to the elevator explaining all the hotel's amenities such as the out-door pool (which unfortunately I did not get to try out due to the rainy weather), gym, and the italian restaurant. Very courteous. I went up the elevator and got to my floor, which as many have commented looks rather old. Not in a classy-old, but rather in a way that you can tell they have put off hotel maintenance, restoration, and remodeling. I stayed at a Hilton in post oak blvd in houston with nicer hallways/decor. 
The room was nice, as I would expect. Very neat and great bedding. Including all the ammenities you would expect from a Four Season such as the sandals (his/her), the bathrobes, news paper, shampoo, conditioner, lotions, etc. By now we had our bags delivered by the bag service gentleman. The decor of the room was nice, but like I said, I have stayed at nicer hiltons. The Four Season should be in the same "playing field" as a St. Regis or a Ritz but the rooms are not even close. I don't complaint so much being that I paid about $170 for the night and $30 valet parking per day in comparison to $700 a day in the Four Seasons in Mexico.
The concierge was great they are very helpful in getting anything from reservations to exotic car rentals to pretty much anything you want. The food was great. I highly recommend the lobster pannini they have to share. It was great! Overall, the service was great, food was great, value was great. I would go there again but this hotel shouldn't really be called a "four seasons" until they heavily remodel. End of story. Still, I'd visit again.

title: “Not Four Seasons standards or value for money”
text: If you have previously stayed at Four Seasons properties internationally (especially in Asia) then this is likely to be one of the worst Four Seasons you will encounter. Negatives: Drab, dated decor does not give the feeling of luxury or exclusivity / rooms were often not cleaned until late afternoon (I understand the hotel was very busy but even after I complained, this issue was not rectified for 2 days / bathrooms are quite poor and very dated. Positives: overall friendly service (front desk / bell hop / valet etc) / rooms are large / bed is good.

title: “Best ever”
text:
Our first trip to New York. Thanks to the Beacon not our last. We will certainly come back to NY and book this perfect hotel again. Great location, very good rooms and a perfect staff. Located next to the theatre and the central park. For food just walk across the street to the supermarket Fairway (they have everything) or to the deli Citarella.
We had a suite with two bedrooms, a lounge and a kitchen situated at the corner of the building. Great views from the windows.

title: “Excellent location, pleasant rooms”
text: Stayed here twiice, love the area. Also love the separate bedroom & living area with a small kitchen, very handy considering the great food stores across the street. The rooms are quite spacious, nice furniture & artwork. Clean & well maintained.

title: “Great place to stay”
text: The hotel is in a quiet location in a lovely part of town. We had a suite with a bedroom , separate lounge and kitchen. Was very spacious and tastefully decorated. There is a supermarket and lovely deli across the road ,there is a wine shop very close by which stocks everything you can imagine including lots of Australian produce. The lobby staff were very helpful with everything and nothing was too much trouble. There is the beacon theatre next door which hosts some world class acts. Really enjoyed our stay and would visit again.

title: “very nice place to stay”
text: I stayed here with the recommendations from my travel agent I found it a very nice quiet area to stay in nyc with an awesome market across the road, at a great stop for the subway from time square, the best cafe next door for breakfast absolutely loved it

title: “Great, stylish stay on 5th Avenue”
text:
We spent a long weekend here, having booked last minute, and were very happy with the whole experience. Check in was quick and seamless via iPad, with very welcoming staff who escorted us to our room (despite us arriving around midnight). The room was a good size and very comfortable with a nice bathroom and a stylish desk area. We particularly liked the free nibbles and non-alcoholic drinks in the mini-bar, and the hotel offers free wine in the bar in the early evening. The large tv has a built-in DVD player and the room was very quiet (facing into an internal courtyard). Although we didn`t try the breakfast or restaurant, the communal areas are very stylish and the hotel overall has a modern, sleek atmosphere.
Only (slight) downsides were the fairly long walk from the lobby to our room (which was seemingly in some connected annex) and the fact that our room wasn`t serviced on one of the days (although we did have the do not disturb sign on until mid afternoon, we were then out of the hotel for the rest of the day leaving plenty of time in which the room could have been cleaned).
The hotel is very well-located on 5th Avenue, across the road from the New York Public Library, with easy access to shops and subway stations and was decent value for a very pleasant stay.

title: “Wonderful Experience”
text: The Andaz is a wonderful property. It is located in front of the Public Library. Not only is its location great but the staff is exemplary. Once entering Andaz we met Kelly. She was genuinely friendly, helpful and yet professional. She did everything right. She really made our stay worthwhile. When we told her about our 17th wedding anniversary she was genuinely interested and asked us follow up questions about us. She then noticed we had walked quite a distance and offered us a sparkling water. Her genuine great attitude made us more enthusiastic. While the property is luxurious I really credit the staff with making our stay truly memorable. Kelly truly made it memorable. I wish I could say more great things about her but because of her we will surely be going back to the Andaz.

title: “Modern, very helpful staff”
text:
Stayed in an Andaz Lrg Suite for two nights with my wife and kids. We liked the modern interior, especially the bathroom was large and very nice, everything was new and flawless. Room was quiet although facing towards the street, we all slept very well in the beds.The suite also had a terrace with nice city views, and was very spacious, consisting of several rooms. For USD 595/night I think this is quite a good deal for NYC standards.
Staff was very friendly and helpful, they always knew our name when we came to the lobby to ask for something.
Also nice that drinks and snacks are free in the room, as well as Internet.
Location is great if you want to explore Manhattan. We never had breakfast at the hotel, as there are plenty of great options nearby, including top espresso coffee shops.

title: “Nice experience in a great location”
text:
I am a real fan of the Andaz brand and concept. My favorite is the Andaz on Wall Street, but this hotel is very nice as well, although the rooms are lot smaller than they are in the other Manhattan property.
The bathroom is a real highlight of all of the Andaz hotels. In this property, it might be bigger than the bedroom. The shower in particular is wonderful. 
The check in and out is great. It is probably inspired by the Apple store experience. Very personal and the hotel personnel uses iPads to talk to you rather than use a desk. The process is quick and you are on you way to your room in minutes.
The breakfast was also great although a bit pricey. I had a plan with free breakfast which means a max of $75. I asked for a bowl of berries and I got two pints of great fruity. Very wonderful
So my first choice remains the Andaz on Wal Street, but if you have business in mid-town or want to be a tourist for a day, the location of this property is suberb.

title: “Wonderful Long Weekend”
text:
I took my older children for a long weekend to NYC on July 19th. We stayed at The Setai for four nights, and it could not have been more wonderful. The service was excellent, from the front desk to the housekeeping. The hotel is contemporary, but not cold. It felt quiet and welcoming when we came back from a busy day. We stayed in a double queen suite because there were three of us, and the room was HUGE; we didn't feel like we were on top of each other at all. I've read some reviews that said the rooms were noisy. Ours was on the 10th floor and very quiet.
The location was also perfect for us. It seemed really centrally located to everything that we wanted to do...broadway play, Shopping on 5th Ave, Central Park, SOHO, West Village. Everything was either an easy walk or a quick subway ride away. I couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience. Won't bother staying anywhere else.

title: “Setai Have Broken my Heart, Ididn't Want To Leave........”
text:
Continuing celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary, we booked Suite for 3 nights for the price of 2. 
Pros:
-Very polite, friendly and helpful staff, will go out of their way to ensure your stay is happy.
-Always address by Mrs... or Mr...
-Will accommodate you with the best that's available if capacity too full 
-I like check in and check out any time, but out of consideration for other guests and room service staff, we checked in at 3:00 PM and checked out at 3:00pm again out of consideration for other guests, even though we could have left later and I wanted to. There for since we were busy with other matters, we did everything we planned on our checkout day and were very satisfied to not have missed on anything we planed.
-Non alcoholic drinks in fridge plenty. And what a marvelous idea was to suggest us if we only drink water then they will replenish it only with water, if you need more they will deliver, but we always had enough.
-N espresso is great in the room, I have one home and addicted to it, so if you finish all of the coffee offered, call in the evening and they will deliver you more to have in the morning.
-Quiet rooms so if you meditate, its great/or want to take siesta or fall asleep early, notify front desk not to be disturbed if your sign is on. The only time someone will knock are the fridge/coffee replenish or bring you cookies and will do turn down service if you desire.
-For a suite the accommodation was huge and when the person knocked to deliver ice I was in the bathroom and it was a walk to get to the door, after I opened the door he thought no one was in and was about to leave, I thought that was funny explaining to him that it was a long walk to the door.
-The rooms are well appointed and the decor is pleasant to the eyes. Room and Hotel itself is very clean.
-If you are like me staying in 5 stars hotels the bathroom are pretty much the same in renovated hotels, ours was huge and I loved the window in the bathroom, we've been partying often in there while waiting for my service dog to finish his dinner, he is spoiled and wants us to be around when he its. 
-Two TVs are standard in NYC for suits. And if you never sow TV in the mirror, I somehow felt the screen was bigger than in other hotels.
-Bed is comfortable, so are pillows, I absolutely adored the style of the windows, honestly that was my first choice to stay in Setai, provides with ability to look down without stretching.
your neck. And lower window opens from the top which is less scarier than from the bottom as in Trump Soho.
-If after your room was cleaned and you noticed that something wasn't replenished - a phone call away and a minute of wait.
-If your top cover not on the bed with little neck pillow, it is most likely in the closet.
-Loved the Foyer, Powder room with the door.
-Real walk in room closet.
-Bath tub is for two and the biggest I was in aside from that in Mercer.
-Rain Shower.
-the hotel has Souna and Steam room, Gym, with private room for floor exercise alone or with personal trainer. 
-If you take advantage of their spa, you also receive access to whirl pool, ha-mam, and rain shower from all over top, walls (this kind of shower was my first time experience to see) and plenty of healthy snack and fruits and drinks. The spa person will be more than happy to give you the tour. We did the tour of the hotel while waiting for our room cleaned.
-We didn't use the bar or restaurant, because my husband already planned the places to eat ahead of arrival and it is his department. If you are like us who enjoy rather unquiet ambiance the kind that no one can hear your conversation we liked Dallas and Irish Pub a block away. We drink protein shakes for breakfast and lunch, but the day of our check out we walked over to Barking Dog which is famous for their Pancakes which I like and my husband ordered eggs and mixed breakfast meats.plate. Don't order toast, it comes with the good size bun.
-Places to see Bryant Park, always something going on there, there is a watering whole and instead of benches there are chairs and tables. Which are scattered all over and you can find private spot to enjoy and then move to another spot that is what we were doing. I also think the chairs for the reason that a person don't make a bed out of it. Park is opened until 9PM. Security is present. Oh and they also have ping pong table there to rent.
-Library a must see, I've been there many times when I was studying in University. But being there as a tourist is not the same experience, things I missed. They always have something in the exhibition room that is unique theme. 
-AC is quiet and works perfect with 3 room temperature thermostats.
-Not like I ever seen in other hotels the channels managary is organized in sections, where each section of channels is listed in TV guide with consecutive numbers. I don't recall seeing such in other hotels.
Cons: non I can think of. If you are experienced traveler you know what to do, if you are not, don't upset yourself with something that wasn't done the way you expected, just ask they are there to ensure you leave Setai Happy. 
-Suites are expensive, but once you try one you cannot go below, but in my opinion there is nothing like staying in the suit. But if you are in New York Sight Seeing and believe me you will be disappointing not booking longer stay, but even if it is longer stay you still will not have enough days to see all. We've been coming to NYC on vacation 12 times and still didn't see everything we wanted to see. But since we are local we mostly come to enjoy the room and the view is the top priority for me.
-I wish we could have stayed on the higher floor that would really complete our joy.
From my experience if you come with the right attitude you will do your self and your health a lot of good and will only bring good memories back. This worked in every hotel in NYC we stayed at, except Soho Trump with the staff there Guaranteed to ruin not just your stay but entire vacation, and you will stay 5 categories below of the room you reserved in SohoTrum for the price double of what you pay in Setai.

title: “Would love to go back!”
text: Excellent service, lovely view and I'm going to have great memories as I got engaged at this hotel! From the moment we arrived the service was spot on, although sometimes over eager e.g trying to turn down at 6pm when we were getting ready to go out for dinner! Apart from that I really enjoyed my stay and the service and ambience and the helpfulness of the reception staff.

title: “Great hotel with outstanding service”
text:
I stayed at the Setai with my partner for 4 nights last week and our stay was faultless. The service totally exceeded our expectations - every member of staff we met over the 4 days delivered great service. Whilst, in theory, this should always be the case in 5 star hotels I often find some inconsistency between members of staff (some much better than others) in most hotels, including other 5 star properties. This was not the case at the Setai - clearly they have been trained exceptionally well and enjoy working there. We loved the little treats (cookies etc) in the evening - such a nice touch.
We had dinner in their restaurant Ai Fiori - it was so good i almost wanted to go back again the next night. Thankfully i was convinced that we should have some variety and we went to Buddakan (fabulous!!). Room service was also great (my partner says it was the best swiss bircher museli he has had - and he lives in Switzerland..). 
We both used the spa - it was ok. Treatments were nothing spectacular but again the service was great and the facilities are good too. I also used the gym - really big in comparison with the gyms in other hotels (modern equipment and lots of it).
Location wise it's really good - although I did have to adjust to not being so close to central park which is where we normally stay in NY. If you want to go shopping in NY (5th / Madison etc) my credit card can testify that the Setai is to hard to beat.
Overall an outstanding hotel.

title: “Delightful”
text:
The Chatwal was probably the most luxurious hotel we ever stayed in, not only the accomodation but the placement is nothing short of divine (right in the center of NYC). The hotel employees were always enormously friendly, and were always ready to help if we needed anything. 
If there's anywhere that can make your stay in New York even more memorable, we can only advise you to stay at this litle piece of heaven in the center of the Big Apple.

title: “Gorgeous Art Deco boutique hotel near Times Square”
text: We stayed at the Chatwal over Memorial Day weekend. Great service at every turn from the front door (Ali) to the bar (Jacques). Excellent dinner recommendations from the concierge. The staff was ready with umbrellas and any amenity we needed. The rooms were elegant- suede walls, well-stocked bar, great furnishings, roomy closets and storage, and the bathroom is amazing. The Chatwal is a beautiful retreat at the edge of busy and chaotic Times Square with easy access to multiple transportation stops (42nd Ave, Port Authority and Bryant Park). There are no views from the rooms, but the rooms themselves and public areas are gorgeous. We'll definitely be back.

title: “Wonderful”
text: Thanks to Starwood's overly generous and short-lived Best Rate Guarantee Free Night NYC promo, I stayed here last week in a Junior Suite. It was wonderful. At no point did anyone make me feel badly that this was a free stay. The room was large and well appointed, although very masculine in decor (which is fine but my tastes are more feminine). I enjoyed a drink in the hotel bar and while the drink was delicious, my friend and I were ignored until we flagged down a waiter and then ignored again once we got our drinks until we flagged him down again for the check. I guess we didn't look like the typical patrons. Oh well. Otherwise, the night was great, the bed was comfortable, the rain fall shower was amazing (although the rest of the bathroom was a little too mirrored for my tastes--everything including the vanity and sink was completely covered in reflective metal) and it was well sound proofed.

title: “Overall GREAT stay!”
text: We just returned from a few days at this property and were totally satisfied with our stay. First of all, we LOVED the bed, it was perfectly cozy and comfortable! We ordered breakfast and it was fantastic- the omelette was light and fluffy, the yogurt parfait fresh and delicious, and the steel cut oatmeal with fruit was perfectly cooked. Our corner room was private and exactly what we were looking for as a romantic get away. We cannot wait to return!

title: “Not excellent for the price”
text:
We stayed for 5 nights in a King room. Room size is ok considering its NYC, the bathroom is big, maybe shedding a bit for the room size might be a better design. 
Housekeeping is excellent, turn down service is excellent. Front desk agent was friendly at check out. Each call for extras was completed in a timely and friendly manner.
Only complaints:
-when your neighbor's door shut, it always slams and rock your room. When your neighbor talks outside their door, u can almost hear everything! Window insulation is much better blocking out the street noise, which can be bad because the property is right by the NYPD station.
-we encountered a BIG African American staff checking keys during after hrs entry. While this is much appreciated for our safety, the guy was a bit awkward in his interactions. It did made us uncomfortable on two occasions. The weekend person was much friendlier....
-we encountered a huge problem when we returned to catch our limo for our return flight at JFK. Long story short, we learned afterwards that our limo company had told the front desk or doorman that they had arrived and waiting for us. We were never assisted by any staff (and we were two out of the only 4-5 people in the lobby). After 15 mins waiting in the lobby and nobody assisting us, we got into the wrong limo! Did not find out until almost arriving at JFK. Needless to say, a mess to sort out!
Overall a good property, close walking distance to TS (10-15 mins), but for $509 a night, we could have stayed at the St Regis....

title: “Best Hotel”
text:
Most incredible stay. The staff is pleasant and very helpful. Rooms are extremely clean. Views and the veranda are excellent.
Aston was more then helpful as always. He made us feel very comfortable. This was are second stay in the hotel and are looking forward to going back.

title: “great place to stay in ny”
text:
I always look for a Kimpton hotel. I call them Ritz Light- much of the quality of a Ritz
 (without all of the pomp) but at a fraction of the price.
Eventi was well located for our needs, safe, clean, well appointed, excellent staff, 
(wine cocktail hour for hotel guests (and some might say "big deal" but in a fine restaurant
in NY (and we always stay at the Morrison House - a Kimpton in Alexandria, Va) a glass
of wine costs about $12 - so if my wife and I have two glasses of their good house wine-
we are saving almost $50- so it is no tiny accomodation).
I most highly recommend Kimpton and just hope such exposure by me and others won't
have a hotel fully booked when I try to reserve.

title: “Great location and helpful staff”
text: The Iroquois is very well located and quite charming. The room we stayed in was not large, but it was clean with all needed amenities. The bellman who took us to our room spent time with us giving restaurant recommendations and other tips to make our stay enjoyable.

title: “Thanksgiving stay”
text: We stayed here over Thanksgiving last year. The hotel is very close to Times Square but at the same time it was very quiet. We had absolutely no problem with noise. The hotel itself is very nice and the staff is very friendly. The rooms are on the smaller side, but it's New York, so what do you expect? A nice touch was the hot cider in the lobby every evening. Would definitely stay here again and recommend very highly.

title: “Elegance and Convenience”
text: This lovely boutique hotel has old world charm but contemporary conveniences like free wi-fi. I love the Frette sheets, towels and robe. Everything is spotless and everyone was friendly and pleasant, including the doormen, housekeepers and front desk staff. A special thank you to Vanessa the concierge who helped us get theater tickets and gave us excellent advice each morning. The location is ideal for Times Square, Grand Central and Bryant Park.

title: “A gem in midtown”
text: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and were delighted we did. We were given the high floor room we requested -- it was spotless, extremely comfortable, quiet, and pleasant in every way. There was a fridge and microwave as well as free wifi. The staff were friendly and helpful and the few mistakes they made were quickly and pleasantly corrected. Breakfast was fine, too, and the location was perfect. I've been recommending the San Carlos to everyone.

title: “It was excellent”
text: We visited in the first couple of days in August, the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were spotless, we had a suite so that our teenager could have his own space. It was plenty big and really clean. Situated right in the heart of midtown we couldn't have been in a better position. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

title: “Don't Want TimeSquare Crowds & Cookie-Cutter Hotel - This is THE Place to Stay!”
text: I have stayed at several of the name brand hotels in TimeSquare and in the theater district, but once I found the San Carlos Hotel -- it's hard to imagine staying anywhere else in the city for the same star rating & cost. I've been a guest at the San Carlos 4 times now, and the appeal is the location, the staff and the quality of the rooms. You are conveniently located near many places to see & tour since you are at 50th & Second St. -- you can walk to Radio City, Rockefeller Center and Times Square, plus a subway station is nearby. The choice of restuarants is really great & also in walking distance on 50th & Second & Third & Lexington. Better food and better prices than in Times Square or the theater district. If its your first time in NYC you may be more comfortable in Times Square hotels to easily find your way around, but if you are returning to NYC, you won't be sorry if you try the San Carlos Hotel -- the staff and atmosphere are superb! We got a jr. suite at a special rate on the hotel web-site for a price we had a regular room here and at other places in the past. So check their web site for specials. If you can find a good rate, book with confidence and know you won't be disappointed.

title: “Great hotel, and we're picky!”
text: My wife and two younger children stayed here for three nights. The room was spacious, clean, and the most well-lit I've ever been to. There were power outlets EVERYWHERE! There was a refrigerator as well. The pull-out sleep sofa mattress was comfortable, and the service was outstanding. Free wireless is another plus. When we return to NYC, we will definitely stay here again.

title: “Great Hotel”
text:
Just back from a 2 night stay at San Carlos hotel in one bedroom suite ,great
experience , staff friendly ,offered late check out free of charge,can't understand the
moans about breakfast its included in rate it was a good bonus

title: “O.K.”
text: Very nice hotel, a little overpriced. I do have to agree with a previous write-up, in saying that the front desk help are not very nice. You would think they would be a bit more courteous. Just remember there are plenty to choose from.

title: “Overpriced and overcharged”
text:
Watch yourself with this hotel! They wait until the night before you arrive to send out a confirmation email and they change the prices. 
We booked ourselves into a suite 6 weeks in advance. A day before we arrived they sent a confirmation email with a 15% increase in price and an extra charge added for our intended use of the sleepr sofa for our two children.
The reservation clerk I spoke to giggled on the phone when I called to ask why the price had been raised.
The Netherland has seen better days - recommend avoiding it!

title: “Wonderful stay, great hotel”
text:
I was put up here for the week by a client after the usual hotel I stay at fell through, and it was a pleasure. The room I was in was wonderful, though I didn't get the view of the city or park that other rooms would have. I'd like to complement them on being the first hotel I have stayed in where they actually have HDTV programming for the HDTV's (everyone else just has stretched standard TV signals on their expensive LCD TV's I find). The hotel gym was by far the best I've had in the past year on the road, with plenty of cardio equipment with individual LCD TV's, and a good selection of machine and free weights as well. The shower in my room was the best I've experienced as well, tons of pressure.
The only downsides to the hotel were that the wireless internet access was fairly slow, and would drop sometimes for a few seconds, and it just felt strange to me to have someone run the elevator for me. I didn't like having someone know that I was just stepping out to grab a burger down the street.
It's out of my price range when I come to NYC for fun unfortunately, but I do hope that work can put me up here again the next time I'm in town for business.

title: “Everything you could ask for...and more!”
text: I've stayed at the Sherry several times the past year. They have a BOX of chocolates in your room with a personal note. The rooms and suites are immaculate. They sent a Christmas card. I need not say any more! Oh, yes, the service is top notch...always.

title: “wonder hotel”
text: People if you're in Houston,Texas and need a hotel off the I-10,this is the place to be.I enjoyed my stay the staff was outstanding exceptionally clean rooms.I could go on but, you need to experience it for you self.I'll give it a "20". Good value I didn't want to leave.

title: “BEWARE!”
text: Although the rooms are nice and breakfast is ok....just a warning that this hotel isn't in the best of neighborhoods. Our vehicle was broken into overnight while they had a "security" guard on duty. When reported, the front desk clerk seemed uninterested. We were informed by the responding officer that the neighborhood down the road from the hotel is known as a druggie hangout and the area is not the safest to stay in as it is known for criminal activity . So if you can, stay in the city rather than the outskirts.

title: “Good experience”
text: My stay at this location was good. I have stayed here several different times and have had not problems to speak of. Rooms are plenty big, beds are comfortable, and bathrooms are nice. Associates at the front desk are always more than helpful...very friendly. No complaints from me.

title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
text: This was a very Clean hotel. The bed was the most impressive, as it was a very comfortable mattress. Unlike most other hotels. We stayed in a suite and it was just me and the husband but I could see us bring the kids and staying in this suite. The staff was friendly.

title: “Great Hotel”
text: We flew into Houston for a 100th Birthday celebration, This hotel was closest to my friends home. After reading the reviews posted on this site, I booked a room. I agree with all the other postings ... it was quiet, clean, staff was friendly and the breakfast menu was very good. We would definitely encourage anyone to book a room here and we would stay here again.

title: “The ONE and ONLY hotel choice in Houston Energy Corridor”
text: It's rare that one hotel stands out ... but the Hilton Garden Inn Houston Energy Corridor really does, every time. Hotels are a necessary part of my life, have been for decades. I and my colleagues have now stayed at this hotel a dozen or so times, and the experience just never fades. Imagine phoning the front desk on a weekend, being recognized on the phone, greeted by name, and welcomed with genuine joy ... that was my experience last weekend when booking a last minute stay. Unheard of! All the staff, from Management to Front Desk to Catering to Hospitality ... all incredibly friendly and helpful, doing their level best to make you feel at home. Whether on business or personal time, this hotel offers the very best service levels, and at a very competitive price. Need anything, including local shuttle service and advice? ... just ask, and the staff work hard to satisfy your requests. Beds are the best around! And for conferences, they have the best team we have ever worked with!!! If I have to be away from home, here's my first choice. Go ahead, try them, you'll not be disappointed!

title: “Great hotel, but terrible billing issues”
text:
I stayed here for a conference, in May and I loved the hotel. Good food, nice staff.
But, I was sharing a room, and it took over 6 weeks to get a receipt that I could use to get reimbursed. I had to call multiple times. For being a conference hotel, it was a bit ridiculous that I couldn't get a receipt with my name on it. I made the reservation, but everything was switched to my roomate, then all the documentation had her name, and my address, credit card and details on it.

title: “Great Experience”
text: This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed at. The rooms were very well thought out, the beds were very comfortable and the exercise room was awesome. But the best part of the hotel was the staff. They were friendly, and when I had an issue they went over and beyond to resolve it. I would definitely stay here again.

title: “Excellent Hilton Staff”
text: I was part of a delegation to visit Houston in June 2012. We stayed at the Hilton Americas-Houston. We were treated very well. The food was excellent and the staff was very courteous and friendly. I remember fondly one employee in particular. His name was Joe Guerra. Joe is an Executive Level Concierge and he couldn't have been friendly to me. I will stay at Houston Americas-Houston if I am in the area in the future.

title: “Enjoyed our stay! Beautiful place!”
text: Beautiful boutique hotel with super comfy rooms located steps from the metro rail.  It was such an interesting hotel with beautiful interiors! I spent an hour taking pictures of the hotel.  Enormous bathroom with a fabulous walk in rain shower. The TVs were small & outdated & that is my only complaint.  We stayed in a corner top level standard room with a great view of the city. We did not try the restaurant but it looked fabulous & that's my only regret during our stay. The hotel bar is fabulous & the bartender was excellent...very friendly & outgoing & mixed some fabulous drinks!

title: “Outstanding Experience in All Aspects”
text:
I selected this hotel for a one night stop over for my wife and I. I was shooting for a nice, intimate experience and was well rewarded. The room price was a great deal and we were upgraded at no cost without asking. The fellow that checked us in was extremely personable, reminding us of a certain character from Will and Grace.
The turn of the century decor was very well done. The room was very nice and as others have stated, the bath was spacious well appointed. 
After arrival we hit the bar for cocktails and we have to say, this was the highlight of our trip. Our barman , Houston Farris, is probably the best I've come across. This guy is an expert in classic cocktails, and it was a pleasure just watching him create outstanding drinks, one after another. I am really into classic drinks and the cocktail menu in this bar is real gem. Nothing run of the mill about it. I started with a martini, and it was one of the best I've ever had, with a splash of orange bitters and garnished with a lemon twist. I also sampled the Aviation, and the Manhattan no.5. My wife had a great margarita and was treated to the recipe. 
We ended eating at the bar and tried three appetizers, first was a pork torta,then a seafood cocktail, and finally shrimp and grits. Each was outstanding. We talked for days about how good the food and drinks were that night.
We enjoyed the hotel, the service, the food and drink so much we seriously discussed changing our travel plans to allow another night's stay.

title: “Downtown Decadence!”
text:
Stayed at the Hotel Icon with my Mom celebrating a Mother-Daughter Date Night. The front desk was friendly, the decor is charming (Texas chic meets rustic Old-Fashion flair) and you can't beat the downtown location! 
We enjoyed a nightcap at the Lobby bar where we met the bartender, Mike. He was very welcoming and made terrific drinks. We also ordered Room Service for Breakfast, and it was muy delicioso! 
My only complaint regarding Hotel Icon was the toilet paper. This Boutique Hotel is cozy and kind, but your bum might disagree.

title: “Wonderful stay”
text: As someone that enjoys restoration this hotel was outstanding. Well done, wonderful detail. They even upgrades me to a penthouse ( with a great view and amazing bathroom). I will stay here from now on when I travel to the area

title: “OK but was expecting better”
text:
We stayed in the Four Seasons for a couple of nights at the weekend.
Postives: Good location for main Houston sights + Minute Maid Park.
The candy trolley
Breakfast service
Gym: good facilities
Negatives: Hotel tried to nickel & dime & overcharged us for several items (why do they offer discounted meals, etc & yet still charge full price?)
No upgrade given on check in (although booked via preferred partner - not a big issue but no effort/discussion made at check in)
Laundry service: almost a day late & my wife had to chase them to deliver
Pool area: too crowded & slow poolside service (was ignored by poolside attendants for approx 30 minutes)
Bell service: We had to wait 30 mins for bell service to arrive
Concierge: unhelpful even with some simple questions.
Overall, we were disappointed by the service/experience that we had at this hotel besides a few individual hotel employees (breakfast service).

title: “Great place! Great service!”
text: Was here for 3 nights on business. WOW was I impressed. Front desk was super helpful with directions and cabs. The TempurPedic beds are AWESOME. Room was super clean every day with nice towels. Would stay again if I had the chance.

title: “Exceptional Hotel”
text:
The Four Seasons is one of my favorite places to stay. The staff is friendly and accomodating, and the atmosphere is beautiful, peaceful and relaxing. The location is convenient for me when attending conferences at the George R. Brown convention center because it is within walking distance. Plus, the Shops directly across the street (which can be reached via the skybridge from the hotel), and the Phonecia Foods market a block away provide a nice place to grab last-minute items or treats like Starbucks and a selection of restaurants if you aren't in the mood for a pricey meal or are in a hurry.
The restaurant in the hotel, Quatro, is fantastic and an incredible experience to enjoy if you want to spend a little time and money for an unbelievable meal. The spa is also fantastic, as is the pool area and work-out center. 
We took our infant daughter this time, and there was a crib waiting in our room. The staff was very friendly too her, and we felt extremely welcome. Many other places I've stayed with a baby have seemed to shy away from offering the same level of service when you have your child, but the Four Seasons is a true exception to this rule.
The valet service was excellent, prompt, and friendly too. Overall, we really love staying here every chance we get, and will definitely look for other Four Seasons Properties for future travels.

title: “A+ Luxury, Quality, Service”
text:
Stayed at the Four Seasons Houston for the ABB Automation & Power World conference April 22-27. Stayed in one of the Executive Suites for my stay. This was my first stay at a Four Seasons, and every one of my expectations was met. From the bell staff, check-in, rooms, housekeeping, poolside, gym, restaurant and finally check-out. Four Seasons truly made my stay an enjoyable one. The beds are large, comfy and plush. Flat screens in the rooms, a nice working desk and lounge area. Ample drawer and closet space. They even provided starch for the iron if I wanted crisp shirts.
The bathroom was well-appointed with all the amenities as shown on the website. I even had a bidet in my bathroom which is something I only expect to see in Europe! It was a nice surprise. 
The pool is a great escape after a long day at the conference and the pool staff are attentive, but discrete when it's obvious that you just want to relax, get some sun and read a book.
I wish I had a better schedule so that I could have used the gym more often. The machines are all fairly new with a good variety so that everyone could use what they want. The morning I went to do a workout I didn't have to wait for a single machine. They provide Gatorade by the cup, bottled water, tea and coffee at the break station. Each machine has towels and earphones provided. Good weight and weightlifting machine selection. Lots of bosu balls and a nice stretching section.
I tried the restaurant for a couple breakfasts and had room service a couple of times at night. The food quality was great, as was the prompt service.
I really have nothing bad to say about the Four Seasons, except that they've ruined me for any other (lesser) hotel I'll have to stay at in the future. You have made me a convert and I look forward to returning the next time I'm staying in downtown Houston.

title: “Disappointing”
text: Our family group of 7 checked in and we were allocated rooms ending 01 - as in 1701, 1901 etc. small corner rooms with one queen size bed (two of our party are well over 6' tall so this wasn't ideal. with two suitcases in each room there wasn't room to swing the proverbial cat; I then switched on one of the electric rings to boil a kettle and it set the fire alarm off. By this time I was fed up and asked reception if we could be moved to larger rooms; I was told that nothing was available but two rooms could be moved the following day to a standard King size room. The next day my husband and I moved to this standard room and it was 100% better - king size bed and far more space; although the bathroom was just as small as the one in the original room with miniscule towels. and I had to ask every day for shower gel to be left when the room was attended to. Two more of our party were moved the following day and the family member sleeping on his own didn't bother changing rooms as the room was adequate for single occupancy (which I discovered subsequently) is what they are assigned for - so why three couples were given these rooms I don't know. So beware if allocated a room on any floor ending 01 - tiny, corner room with small bed and far too small for a couple. Diner next door (Viand) was excellent for breakfast - there are no facilities at all at the Beacon. Would not stay there again.

title: “Hotel Beacon a real Gem.”
text:
I have just returned from a 5 night stay at The Hotel Beacon (2 adults + 1 Child). I would not hesitate in recommending or indeed using this hotel again.
Fantastic big suites, clean, great staff and perfectly located in the beautiful Upper West Side. Our suite had 2 Queen beds in one room and a King sized Bed/Settee in the lounge part. The room also has a built in kitchen if you want to cook yourself.
There is a fantastic restaurant/Diner right next door that we used every day for breakfast.A bank 1 block away that's open 6 days a week and an absolutely wonderful Deli directly across the street. There's also an indoor market opposite if you want to buy fresh fruit and veg.
Don't hesitate to stay you'll love it....

title: “Roomy for N.Y.”
text: I stayed here in 2010 with my teenager, 7 and 4 year old sons. Four of us were very comfortable. I slept in a king bed with the younger son, a twin rollaway next to us with my other young son and my teen had the fold out sofa bed in the front room. Nice little kitchen and T.V's in both rooms with great views of the city. We walked into Central Park everyday but getting to spots we really wanted was a haul or we took taxi's as my youngest was afraid of the subway. We met a nice couple in the elevator who lived there and seemed happy to talk to visitors but the residents on either side of us were clearly not happy as we were probably too loud (being 3 brothers wrestling on the bed and being used to a big suburban house). Next time I will wait till they are older for a NYC hotel but this place was clean, comfortable and quiet. I would stay here again. Price was more than fair. Note, a great market directly below. Great bagel place across st. to the right and great childrens museum around corner.

title: “Pretty good for New York”
text:
Room size is good. Clean. New. Quiet. Great location. Free drinks and snacks. In New York? 
I have stayed at a lot of hotels, this is pretty nice all around. I would recommend this to anyone with the budget.

title: “absolutely perfect”
text: I stayed here during a short business trip to New York and was very impressed. Loved the hotel, my room with its high ceiling and rainforest shower, its location and the service I received always went above and beyond. I will definitely be returning to Andaz 5th Avenue and also looking forward to visiting the other Andaz hotels globally!!!

title: “Sofistication in the right location”
text: I was pretty used to Hilton when going to Manhattan but this hotel has really surprised me. Fast check in and out, wonderfully suites and espetacular location. Breakfast $$$ above average but you are plenty of options around the hotel. Will be back for sure.

title: “Best and coolest hotel in NY”
text: I spend again 2 days in NY. Andaz 5th got the nicest and biggest rooms. On the 11th floors the rooms even got a terasse. The stuff makes you feel like home. In the basement there is" THE BAR". Great stuff - great cocktails - just the bar manager is a little bit stiff...The cocktails are wonderfull.

title: “Ultimate luxury only surpassed by great service!”
text: This hotel is nothing short of incredible. Amongst a lot of snobby hotels surrounded by tourist traffic, this hotel is the best location for people who enjoy luxury without the hubbub. An overly friendly staff, and an emphasis on service will make your stay a wonderful experience.

title: “Surprisingly bad service.”
text: We stayed here for the weekend and we were both surprised at how bad the service was. We checked in on Friday and out late Sunday and the housekeeper came once on Saturday night at like 8 pm. It was really odd. We were not in the room that much so there was no reason she should have come so late. We were in a suite that was fairly expensive and it was disappointing at best. The style is modern and the room was attractive but the service was so below what it should have been. Would not go back The plaza is worlds better.

title: “Best Hotel in NYC, hands down”
text:
Well worth the money - by NY standards that is. 
Everything is on par with a 5 star, only some minor glitches (noisy room doors, few stains on carpet, terrace door broken). 
It is so rare to find a really good hotel in NY with huge rooms, that you forget about these, and service is much more efficient, fast and courteous than in other 5 stars of the city. 
Great gym. 
Yes, it does not have the glamour that you would find in Paris or trendiness of London's best hotels... but if you can afford it, it's by far your best choice, especially if you're on business. 
Location is also contrary to some reviews perfectly central. Not the ritziest part of Fifth Avenue, but convenient for everywhere. 
I'd just put some plants on the exceptional terraces (was expecting a tiny balcony, but got a stunning huge patio with a view of Empire State), and more staff at front desk. 
Stayed for a while and it's the first time I thought of any hotel in NYC "if I could afford it, I'd live here".

title: “Would stay there again”
text: Booked the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and was very pleased with our 3 night stay in NYC. Hotel is fairly new and we found it to be very clean. Nice large bathroom and beverages in the frige definately a plus. We told them it was my daughter's birthday and they surprised us with an incredibly tasting chocolate layer cake. Staff was very accomodating and helpful. Location was pretty good, could hardly hear the road noise at night and heard nothing from the hallway. Would definately stay there again.

title: “My New Favorite Hotel!”
text: I was overwhelmingly impressed by my stay this week at The Chatwal. As a frequent business traveler, I've stayed at several different Midtown hotels, but this one was far and away the best. From the moment I walked into the beautiful Art Deco lobby, everything at the Chatwal was perfect. The Front Desk staff and Concierge were both friendly and extremely helpful. The room was incredible - amazing amenities and the best hotel bathroom I've ever seen (think heated toilet seat and TV integrated into the mirror!). The restaurant also had great food and service for breakfast. For such an amazing location so close to Times Square, my room was perfectly quiet. I can't wait to come back and stay again!

title: “Elegance, personal service”
text: The care and attention that the front desk staff, concierge, wait staff, extend to the guests is a joy! We enjoyed a one night stay in this gem of a property.The Art Deco style is a throwback to a long ago era. From the room design, wall sconces, furniture,as well as the bellhop outfits, one feels transported to another time. James at the Front Desk provided an interesting historical perspective about The Chatwal Thank-you, also to Desdemona, at Guest Services. A stay at the Chatwal is an opportunity not to be missed!

title: “High tech with sparkles”
text:
We just returned from staying 3 nights in this wonderful hotel - the nicest one I have stayed in in NY and I have stayed in many both down market and up market. My 2 grandsons were wowed by the bathroom - the cocoa colored tiles have sparkled material in them which makes the entire bathroom glow. The kids thought it was the coolest thing they had ever seen. The technical aspect of the hotel is amazing - curtains and lights are controlled by a console beside your bed and the bathroom has so mahy features you just have to experience. Even a heated toilet seat!!!
The staff is most attentived and efficient. Always a doorman to greet you on arrival and departure. The bar was relaxing and lively but still soothing after leaving the hectic street activity. You would never kinow you were so close to Times Square. We did ot experience the restaurant but it looked very upscale and intimate. Had we not had our two 6 and 7 year olds we definitely would have gone. If you love theater this is the location to be in. I want to stay here for a month.

title: “Eventi shines again”
text: We have made this hotel our home away from home on our frequent travels to NYC. And even though it is a cool landing spot, with clean lines and a techno music vibe, we do feel quite at home each and every time we visit. By now, after perhaps 10 or so visits to this hotel, we have had the opportunity to stay in a variety of rooms - all seem just a bit different, many with stunning views and those without the city views are often suites - a bonus if space is your thing. Without exception, the rooms are quiet and extraordinarily clean. We love that somehow the professionals who man (and woman) the front desk and lobby remember our tiny four legged pooch each time we visit. It is likely because he is a wild little guy, but we like to think the top notch Patrick, who often checks us in and Gabriella, who problem solves just about anything, just have outstanding memories! Do take in their happy hour on the 2nd floor, but be sure to wander up to the 5th floor terrace, even in brisk weather to catch a glimpse of 6th Avenue facing downtown at dusk - just lovely. The hotel is in a section of town that is getting better and coming back. Restaurants and shopping (the famed Macy's is just three blocks north) are often just a few blocks away - and if you're a walker, you are in a perfect location to take in mid-town, Chelsea and even mid-town east shops and dining. We love the location because it is a block from Penn Station and on a straight thoroughfare uptown or downtown. The hotel has kept its standards high since our first stay the week they opened. It sounds like they are working on getting the bar/cocktail lounge up and running - so we'll look forward to that on a future visit. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hip, central, welcoming stay and deals can often be found if you book well-enough in advance. We are certainly looking forward to our next stay in just a few months - can't wait!

title: “Another excellent Kimpton hotel”
text: Eventi is a clean, modern hotel on 30th and 6th Ave within walking distance of NY Penn station and Times Sq. The rooms are small, but clean and quiet. The staff are friendly and helpful. The new restaraunt, Brighton, offers reasonably priced pizza, burgers and fish in separate 'shacks'.

title: “Amazing. Simply AMAZING!”
text:
Simply blown away. From check in to check out, and everything in between. 
A friend and I were in town to celebrate my birthday for the weekend. The Eventi had a bottle of champagne, chilled and waiting in the room upon our arrival to start the celebration. Awesome! Later that night, we went to Club XL, where someone slipped something into my drink (NOT a fun experience!). What Eventi did for me blew me away. The club called the hotel, who sent a Town Car for me, there were several employees waiting outside for my arrival, who helped me to my room, and made sure I had everything they could offer to make me more comfortable. I never saw a bill for the car, and they checked on me in the morning to make sure I was okay. They weren't obligated to do ANY of that for me. 
Not only am I blown away by how far this amazing hotel was willing to go out of their way for me, but I will be forever grateful. If you look on Trip Advisers top 25 list of the best hotels this year, 4 of the properties are Kimpton Hotels. Surprised? Not in the least! I will never, EVER, stay at a property other than Kimpton. Forever loyal. Well done Kimpton, well done :)

title: “Unexpected excellence!”
text:
I just came back from a 1 night stay at the Iroquois, after spending 2 nights at the Intercontinental Barclay a few blocks away. 
What a pleasant surprise! This was the epitome of a 'boutique" hotel. Smaller, with great service, nice attention to the rooms. I had a queen bed in a corner room that was absolutely quiet. Although there was no view, I faced into the back side of the hotels with other rooms and no street traffic. The bed was nice, the room nicely decorated. The bathroom was small, but had nice fixtures, marble floors and a full bathtub with sliding glass doors. I had a fairly decent sized closet that didn't take away from the space in the room. The A/C was working well, and not too loud.
The lobby was always pleasant and the bellboys very attentive. 
The other great point was the location on 44th, right next to the Sofitel. The street does not get a lot of taxis and no buses, but packed with limos and private cars so it's quieter. Also right at 5th Ave and all the tourist attractions. 
I'd definitely stay here again, highly recommend it!

title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
text: Was very pleased with our stay at the Iroquois. Wanted the charm of a small hotel and this was it. Gave it a very good and not excellent because our deluxe room was very small. The staff couldn't have been nicer. It was our anniversary and they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine. Location was excellent too since we were going to see Cirque du Soleil Zarkana at Radio City. All in all a very pleasant experience.

title: “Great location, great service”
text: If you want to be close to to the action but still have a quiet room, this is your hotel. Although the room was small, we did not spend that much time there anyway. Everything was super clean, I loved the robes and the chocolates on my bed. The housekeeping staff was very nice. The front desk staff was super helpful with anything I needed to know, from the train schedule to comedy shows. The porters were also very nice, especially Bill. He made sure we got to airport ok.

title: “So good we stayed 2 extra days”
text: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and couldn't have been happier. We had one bed suite, roomy with kitchenette ideal with 2 children. Staff friendly especially Bobby. We were more than happy with breakfast, and free wifi and cleanliness very good. We stayed longer because of hurricane Irene but were glad to do so.

title: “Clean, spacious and friendly. Great central location.”
text: We stayed at San Carlos Hotel for 4 days. We would definately recommend and return to this hotel.

title: “What a hotel!”
text: We stayed in a suite recently at the Sherry Netherland, it's the best place that I have stayed in NY. The suites are beautiful and huge. The location is great; right on Central Park. Breakfast is inclluded along with sodas and juices. Suites have modern kitchens w/ ice makers, furnishings are top notch and the staff is terrific. A very classy and impressive hotel. A 10.

title: “Great location, fine room, beautifully painted elevators, nice folks”
text:
This is a fantastically located hotel near the Plaza, across from Central Park close by MOMA, Broadway and superb shopping.
The staff is very nice but you can tell this is a residence/hotel.....so not the same type of service that one would expect in the Ritz. The chaps who provide room service and run the elevators are quite nice.
You can't go wrong if you get your room at a decent price.
Enjoy New York!

title: “Perfect Location”
text: Just recently stayed at the Sherry. Located at the entrance of Central Park, the location could not have been better. The service from the staff was excellent. The rooms were beautiful and clean. We got a great rate on their winter special; when we stayed 4-nights we were upgrated to a suite overlooking 59th avenue. The only drawback was that the restaurant is currently under renovation. Would stay there again, without hesitation!

title: “If you can afford it,do it!”
text:
If you want to indulge in one of the best hotels NYC has to offer try this property. It is first class!
Doorman,elevator operator, room service,twice a day maid service,front desk,accomadiations all first class.I'AM a New Yorker and I believe this is one of the best properties in this city.Steps from Central Park,5TH avenue, and Rockfeller Center.The rooms have the best furnishings and detail I have expierienced.
You may want to spend time in your room just to enjoy it but New York is right outside your door.The price tag is high but if you get a good deal,GO for it!
P.S. Lori at the front desk was the best.

title: “Would stay here again!”
text: Very nice, clean hotel! Great place too for people that travel w/ their furry family members! Great spread in the morning, very comfortable rooms w/ micro- fridges, which help save money on meals so you can heat something in your room if you want.

title: “The BEST Affordable Hotel in Houston - Great Extended Stay Hotel!!!”
text: This La Quinta is one of the best I have stayed in anywhere. Very clean, super convenient to downtown attractions (15 minutes to the Astros, Toyota Center, House of Blues, The Bayou Music Center) full breakfast with eggs and meats included (along with the usual waffles, cereal, breads, pastries)! Many places to eat just minutes away and a spotless pool to top it all off. What really sets this La Quinta apart is the staff. They are the most friendly and hardest working I have seen at a hotel in recent memory. Sonya at the front desk is awesome! Super friendly and helpful and always baking cookies! The cleaning staff - especially Betty - are the best. I lived here for 67 days and my room was cleaned daily and nothing was EVER missing. You could leave money and/or things of value out be mistake and they were always there when you returned to the room. All of the staff were very courteous and extremely pleasant. For the money this hotel is one of the best in Houston. They definitely made my relocation to Houston a much easier one - Thanks!

title: “Handicap Accessible”
text: Wonderful stay. Huge rooms/suite. I requested a handicap shower and we were provided with a beautiful suite with plenty of space to move the wheelchair around. Great service. Needed extra pillows and towels for my disabled mother and I was provided them without hassle. I would difinitely stay again if I ever travel to that area. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I paid around $140 + tax for the room/suite and it was well work the money to accomodate our special needs.

title: “Luxurious Hotel-First Class Service”
text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this gorgeous hotel and would certainly return.The hotel is situated right on 5th Ave and is a 10 second walk to the nearest subway-great for tourists!! This hotel offers luxury things that other hotels in NYC just dont have - including the biggest suite I have ever stayed in, high ceilings, massive bed,huge lounge and a huge bathroom that was all beautifully decorated and so clean.The small touches of fresh flowers and luxury chocs were lovely as were the aveda products in the bathroom.The staff were amazing they couldn't do enough for us including ordering us a takeout delivery and chilled wine when we just wanted a night in.Its a small hotel so the service is fantastic-being greeted by name is almost unheard of in most hotels.Its not cheap, but you get what you pay for! I would certainly recommend calling them to find out if they have any deals on, which is what we did. If you would like a intimate hotel with luxurious accomodation that gives fantastic service, is near the 5th Ave shops and a subway than this is the hotel for you.

title: “Very lovely time”
text: My husband and I stayed only one night at the Sherry, for an anniversary celebration. We loved the location, across from Central Park. The doormen were attentive, and went to great lengths to flag down a cab for us in the pouring rain. The room was furnished nicely, very traditional, and came with fresh flowers, chocolates, and a welcome note from the hotel. The refrigerator was well stocked with bottled water, orange juice, and soft drinks, which were complimentary. We did not have a view, as our room faced a courtyard. We were out for the evening, and when we returned, the bed was turned down, and chocolates were left on our pillows. A complimentary breakfast was served in our room, consisting of coffee, juice, fresh fruit salad, and a basket of five assorted muffins, croissants, and other breads. We had a terrific price for the room, and, considering all the extras, it was a great value. We wished we could have stayed longer.

title: “A hidden gem!”
text: Great hotel. We couldn't fault it apart from the breakfasts which were a little basic. Great location, clean and comfortable and the staff were always helpful.We really enjoyed our five night stay!

title: “Great suite hotel for families”
text: Had never heard of this hotel before, but pictures looked great so we went for it - very hard to find reasonably priced suite in NYC, We were not disappointed! The room was huge, especially for NYC. Very well kept, very quiet, the staff was very friendly, especially Mathew the doorman. The free buffet breakfast was very basic (limited pastry selection, toast, yogurt, plus coffee, etc) but good. Highly recommend it for families. We are a family of 5 (2 parents, a 5 yr old, 2 yr old, and 3 mo old) and it was perfect for us.

title: “Great friendly city spot”
text: Rooms are just fine -- not huge, but lots of really nice touches - a mini bar + fridge + microwave + coffeemaker. The top floor suite, if you 'go for broke' is great with rooftop terrace. But even the basic rooms have really nice flat screen TV, great beds and bedding, and very spiffy brand new telephones. Desk service is delightful - personal, charming, welcoming - you feel like an old friend the moment you walk in. Convenient mid-town location, easy walk to the best shopping- uptown to Bloomingdale's, west a few blocks to Fifth Avenue - and a few more blocks to theatre. And parking just $30 a day -- good price for NYC. And free continental breakfast as well, a real added benefit.

title: “very nice hotel”
text: I had my reservations on booking this hotel since I only stay at life style hotels, but I was pleasantly surprise. the staff was very friendly and did everything they could to make my visit a nice one. I will def be back when I need to get away from my day to day routine.

title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in a great location”
text:
We spent 3 nights at the Iroquois New York and we very impressed. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was extremely spacious for a New York hotel room. The decor was very tasteful and befitting of a boutique hotel.
The staff we friendly and helpful, and Vanessa at concierge was amazing, very knowledgable and helped us out a lot when we were trying to find things like the post office and laundromats. The only negative was the shower, it could do with an update and the water pressure needs to be higher.
We thought the pricing was fair, and will absolutely return to the hotel if we can get a similar rate in the future, this was my 3rd trip to New York and I found this hotel to be far better than others that I have stayed at in the past, the location is also very good, a short walk to Times Sqaure if you're that way inclined but far enough away to be away from the madness, very close to the subway. For those coffee lovers who can't bear the thought of drinking Starbucks, Stumptown Coffee is a 20 minute walk away at the base of the Ace Hotel at 18 West 29th St, in my opinion, far and away the best coffee in Manhattan, and for the caffeine addicted, well worth the walk.

title: “Good quality and helpful staff”
text: Stayed in a larger suite room (worth the extra) and found it very comfortable. The Pool was good and the Gym had some great newish equipment. Cooked Breakfasts were not free but good value. No free drinks in the evening but there is a small bar and a happy hour. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location is just behind Texas Land and Cattle on the I10 so useful for the offices in that area and they have a shuttlebus.

title: “My stay was a big series of Wows! Awesome!”
text: This hotel will be my hotel of choice for any trips to Houston in the future! From the friendly "hello" and explanation of the hotel's services and features by Boris at check-in, to the shuttle ride with Elizabeth, to the dinner served by Laura in the hotel's restaurant, my stay can only be described as a series of "wows". The hotel is new and everything is very clean. The fitness equipment is in good repair and safe working order and the hamburgers are to die for. The pool is well maintained and relaxing after a hard day's work. I highly recommend this hotel. You won't be disappointed!

title: “Incredible service”
text:
Yes, we would return, because of how this staff handled many issues, and we've never interacted with so many hotel staff members at any hotel as we did on this visit.
Great staff, all friendly, who immediately took care of the issues in our room. Two staff fixed the commode, which was not flushing properly in the morning, then flushing on its own in the evening.
Monica in Guest Services brought us a router to help us when we couldn't get WIFI on our iphones. Roger, a security supervisor, fixed the safe when it wouldn't open, and another gentleman fixed the door lock, which jammed.
Each time we had an issue the staff member who fixed whatever issue offered us coupons for the coffee bar or a meal in the lobby cafe. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and we've never had things fixed so quickly. Excellent customer service.
The room was spacious and clean, with turndown service and fresh towels each evening. Continental breakfast in the executive lounge included fruit, hot and cold cereals, breakfast breads and pastries, coffee, juice. The fresh fruit was excellent.
The hotel connects by skybridge to the convention center, and also the hotel garage across the street, and it's a convenient place to stay downtown.

title: “Excellent large convention hotel”
text: Very nice room, quite large, good workspace, on the Hilton Honors floor. Very nice & friendly staff. Excellent breakfast buffet.

title: “Nice hotel but poor service”
text:
I stayed there recently for 5 nights. The hotel was clean and on par with other 4 star rated properties. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. However, the service was very poor!
I was disappointed with the service at the front desk, where the staff lacked basic courtesy and professionalism. For instance, when I asked for a upper floor and quiet room at checkin, I was given a sixth floor corner room not far from the highway. When I went back to the front desk after seeing the room, I was told to come back the next morning, and when I went back the next morning, I was told to come back after 3 pm. I told them to call me when a quieter upper room becomes available, and never called the call. The guy who checked me in seemed to be absent minded, for I told him that I only needed one key but got two.
The bell captain was also rude and lacked basic professionalism.

title: “Nice stay downtown, only wish they had a pool”
text: I stayed at Hotel Icon last weekend. It is a nice boutique hotel. Personally, I like the rooms at Alden better. The rooms are styled reminiscent of how rooms would look at an old 1900s manor. The bathroom is nice and spacious. The free shuttle service is outstanding and will take you anywhere within 3 miles of the hotel. Location is excellent. Service is excellent. The only "non-positive" I have is that I forgot my toothpaste and at any other hotel I have been to they will give me a small trial size or 1 use toothpaste, but they said it cost 1.50. The have a 24 hour gym in the basement which was not crowded when I went to work out. Very nice, quiet hotel.

title: “Excellent Hotel in Downtown Houston”
text: The Four Seasons is very nice. The rooms are comfortable and attractive, but not exceptional for the price. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful.

title: “The Chatwal is a lovely oasis in mid town”
text:
Right off Sixth Avenue on 44th St., the Chatwal conveys a sense of luxury and peace as soon as you enter. Between the lobby, the bar and the rooms, it conveys a sense of art deco splendor as if you are traveling in a private rail car or yacht.
