The room furnishings are unusual and successfully camouflage the small size of the room. The bathroom is not large, but big enough and is gorgeous.
The staff was extremely helpful and gracious---a wonderful surprise in every way.

title: “Clean, clean, clean”
text:
Ok, this review is a little late. 
We stayed in March during our trip for the Architectural Digest. I'm an SPG Gold member so I try to stay at SPG hotels as much as possible. I'm also a bit of a germ freak and was thrilled to find out the Chatwal was bed bug free!!! 
The rooms are old world 1920's styled. Yes, they are a tad dark, and yes the room control can be difficult at times. HOWEVER, the bathroom is excellent, the bed is inviting, and the embrace makes you want a dirty martini on the rocks.
The location is great as well. I would recommend this to those looking for excellent service, great location, and attention to detail.

title: “Great New York Hotel”
text: Excellent value for money. This is the best mid range hotel I have stayed in New York. Room was spacious and clean. Staff helpful. Loved watching the US open tennis on the big screen from the outdoor bar. Hotel in good location within walking distance of many of the iconic sites of NYC.

title: “What a joy”
text: to be treated as well as we were on our trip in July, 2012. This hotel has been renovated and is just delightful. You will not be disappointed if you decide to stay at the Iroquois.

title: “Top location”
text:
We went to NY for my wife's 60th birthday and our 40th anniversary.
The Iroquois upgraded us on arrival to a corner room that was away from the street. The refurbished room was fitted out with period fixtures to match the age of this iconic hotel, though it took some figuring out to operate the shower tap. It needed to be pulled out, as well as turned, to get the shower head to work.
The staff were very friendly and helpful for our entire stay. The hotel is close to the theatres, Times Square and MOMA.
If you want a good restaurant, almost next door is DB bistro moderne (see danielnyc.com). Great coffee can be had at Greg's across the road. If you want THE best restaurant, go to Eleven Madison Park. Spectacular!!!

title: “Lovely with HUGE rooms”
text:
I have stayed at the hotel twice. It is excellent, uptown though in a bit of a chi-chi location. 
It is far from the wonderful vibe of downtown, but it has something that downtown doesn't have. SPACE. Each time I have stayed in this wonderful hotel I have enjoyed a large suite with spacious bathroom and kitchenette. Downstairs is Cipriani's for breakfast lunch, dinner if you wish and room service.
I love the fact that I (lots of luggage always) never have to see a bag or anything to betray the horrors of shlepping all that stuff around! There is so much storage space here.
As a Californian (by way of being a Londoner originally) I have come to find serenity in lots of space. NYC can be exhausting when you are there on business. The Sherry Netherland is a tranquil hideout, the prices are great, often somewhat negotiable, and always, always an elegant option.

title: “If you like traditional hotels, then you will love this one!”
text:
We have just returned from our first trip to New York and we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is more expensive than other hotels but it well worth it!
We got a special romantic package deal, which cost $500 per night, which included continental breakfast in the restaurant and a horse & carriage ride in Central Park. We also got expensive chocolates and fresh flowers in our room!
The room was fantastic - loads of space, lovely furniture including a huge comfy bed. The bathroom was also lovely and the toiletries supplied were the best I have ever come across in a hotel! 
The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times - there is always someone close by to help with luggage, doors, directions etc. 
The hotel restuarant was quite expensive, hence expensive room service food. However, the food is fantastic and the service from the staff is excellent. 
I liked the additional items which were available on room service - such as painkillers, antihistamine etc, as well as snacks and other essentials useful if you are caught short.
The location is fantastic - right across the road from Central Park - although we felt that there was not much to do in the evenings in this area of the city.
The only bad points were the view from the room (we were on the 5th floor at the back of the hotel - I think this is the cheap rooms!), and the noisy air conditioning!!

title: “Wish I could say it was worth it”
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Sherry Netherland in Nov 2004. It was a mother/daughter shopping weekend and I wanted to treat her to some place nice. The Sherry Netherland was a big disappointment, especially for the price. The front desk people were not very nice. I do have to say that the elevator operators & bellman were very nice though. But we arrived a little early for our room, and we were told the room wasn't ready and to come back at 3, as that it when check in was. We came back at 3:30, only to hear that our room still was not ready. After waiting another 15 minutes, they told us we could go up, but that they were still cleaning, so we got to watch them vacuum & finish cleaning our room. Not what you would expect for a "luxury" hotel! For the money you spend, I would highly recommend looking into another hotel. There are plenty to choose from.

title: “See yourself at the Sherry-Netherland”
text:
Many years ago, as a student and NYC taxi driver, I got to see every building in the city, again and again. This hotel is the most beautiful in the city architecturally, and I finally got the chance to stay there early this year. Nearly everything is worthy of the legend; the lobby is exclusive and quiet, though welcoming, and is beautifully appointed. 
The elevators have hand-painted details with medieval style art showing animals and flowers among the carved wood and coffered ceilings. The hallways are a bit to Plaza-ish for my taste, a bit too frou-frou but not as garish as the Plaza (as if something could be). Our Park View Suite was on a high floor at the corner; one side had a perfectly-framed view of the Empire State Building, while the majority of the windows looked out onto the park where we could see up to about 96th street on CPW. The bellman said that our room was John Travolta's favorite place to stay in New York (I immediately heard my own lying voice telling fares in the Taxi years ago that Mick Jagger had just got out of the cab, which usually made for a good story and a good tip). 
The room was gigantic by NYC hotel room comparison, and the fantasy-inspiring park view held our attention for quite a while before it slowly sank in that the room must have been decorated by the art director from Saturday Night Fever, and no wonder Travolta likes it. I would be surprised to see calculations showing that less than 35% of the walled surface was covered by mirrors, and the mirrors seemed to live in the bathroom where they covered every single inch of everything except the floor (marble), commode, counter, basin and ceiling. Utter reflectivity, and images of one's self cascading to infinity. Even the back of the bathroom door was completely covered in mirrors, in case you wanted to close it and shoot a sequel to "Enter the Dragon" there. 
Large brown sectional sofa with tan and brown pillows (I remember the '70s term - "earth tones"), sharply contrasting with a clean Biedermeier-style entertainment center and a large round glass dining table far, far too big for that part of the room. That's it for complaints, any my dwelling on them reflects $900 a night in different expectations. When I asked for a different room, something less-reflective, they said all the Park View suites were booked (and explained that each unit is actually a privately- owned condo, decorated by the owners).... But still, each staff person was helpful, friendly and unobtrusive. The nightly Godiva chocolates and daily flowers were cheerful. The room service from Cipriani's should be a model for everyone to follow. The bedroom had a walk-in closet where the kids delighted in hiding. The small kitchenette had a full-size fridge which we stocked with items from Katz's and Zabar's and Balducci's. We had a terrific time- with the views, the service, proximity to the park and Wollman Rink, the immense room space, and the happiness we got just from looking at the structure. It's the architecture and the location that made me want to stay there, and if they write to say they've dropped Steve Rubell from the interior design contract, we'll happily go back anytime.

title: “The Best Time in NYC”
text: I had the most wonderful time at the Sherry- Netherland. The staff was excellent and meets every need I had. They are some of the nicer people I have met in New York. I would definitely recommend the Sherry- Netherland to any one who likes a great view, great food, superior service and a need for elegance in a more old school style. Take my word for it a night at the Sherry is a night you will never forget. The most miraculous thing about the Sherry- Netherland aside form its location is it quite serenity. Not only are they very discreet about all matters they have your best interest at heart and will upgrade you with out giving it a second thought. I loved my time there and I am sure you will to.

title: “This is a Friendly Hotel with Personal Service”
text:
We (Family of 3 including teenage son) have just returned home from a 15 day stay at the San Carlos. We had a one bedroomed suite (2 queens and a sofa bed in lounge).
We found all of the staff to be courteous, friendly and professional. The suite was clean and spacious, and the quality of the towels and linen excellent. My son had use of the free WiFi in our suite with his laptop - though there are adequate PC's available to use .on the second floor. I used the dry-cleaning service and this was really quick.
The self service breakfast was a selection of pastries, cereal, juice, yogurts,l frech coffee etc., which was more than adequate.
The hotel is really handy for the subway, and within walking distance of all the main streets you need to visit.
Though our next trip to New York will be a shorter one - we WILL be staying at the San Carlos!

title: “Overall very nice and good value for NYC”
text: This was my second time staying in this hotel. We were in NYC for 4 nights and this hotel was ideal as a central point for the different activities that we had planned. Rooms are good sized (for NYC) and staff is friendly and helpful. Several times we asked the staff for help on restaurants or directions and their advice was always "spot on". We used the breakfast buffet (adequate continental breakfast) and internet service (good - though not always fast). Lastly....and one of those little things that make service good...on the one very rainy night during our stay they had a large quantity of good portable umbrellas that people could take with them for the evening.

title: “Our new NYC home away from home, but better!”
text:
We loved the San Carlos! From the minute we arrived we were treated like old friends. The front desk (Evelyn & Gabriel) were helpful and tried their best to get an early check in into our suite beacuse we arrived at about 9 a.m., but nothing was availble. While we waited, the front desk staff entertained our kids with magic tricks! When they did get us in (still a few hours earlier than official check in time) they gave us a beautiful suite on the 16th floor (quiet, spacious, good air conditioner-we were there during a heat wave). . The bell staff (Bobby, Johan and Matthew) were friendly and knowledgable, and gave us good suggestions for families since we were tourists traveling with a 10- & 11-year-old. During our stay there were thunderstorms and the hotel had "loaner" umbrellas near the door for our use as we cruised around the city, which was great.
I've read complaints from others about the conteniental breakfast, but we thought it was plenty of food and choices. Since it was included in the room price for the four of us, it was a terrific value (you can't beat free). The breakfast consisted of rolls, assorted pastries, bagels, (the little chocolate croissants were especially yummy), tea, coffee, hot chocolate, milk, orange juice, assorted yogurts, cottage cheese, whole apples, assorted jams, cream cheese, Rice Krispies and Corn Flakes. The nice lady working at the breakfast kept everything well stocked throughout the morning (7-10 a.m.)
Our suite was clean and well appointed and roomy (we couln't believe we had that much space in mid-town Manhattan). The housekeeping staff was wonderful too. They were available the minute we requested anything. Returning from our daily adventures, the place was always spotless and my dirty dishes were the all done. What a luxury! The kitchenette came with a microwave, refridgerator, sink, dishes/service for 4 +. 
The Hotel location is also wonderful. It's walking distance to many attractions and a variety of restaurants (although there is a subway station not too far away). The front door staff is on top of it when you need a cab hailed (although much of the time we just tried to walk off the great Italian food we'd eaten in the neighborhood).
The staff of the hotel went well above our expectations. We will ONLY stay at the San Carlos when we return to NYC. My kids are already saying, "We miss the San Carlos." Me too...

title: “Great hotel and friendly staff”
text: I don't think I have one bad thing to say about the San Carlos.

title: “Spacious with GREAT staff! Loved it!”
text: We flew into Newark and didn't arrive at the hotel until midnight. Bellperson on duty (Matt) was exceptional! Delivered our bags, set our thermostat, gave us a brief rundown of the entire suite. From the staff, we got restaurant recommendations, directions, etc. Always a smile, a joke, a friendly face. The suite itself was like a small apartment! Clean, comfortable beds, with room to move around. Even our 15 year old loved it, and she's the pickiest in our family! Continental breakfast left a bit to be desired, but everything else more than made up for it!!

title: “Decent little hotel, great location”
text: The location - right off Times Square and not far from St. Patrick's, Rockefeller, etc. - is ideal. The staff was really great. The downside was that the room was really tiny. I didn't expect a lot and I can deal with small spaces but I barely had room to move around. The dark colors probably made it feel smaller than it was but I've got nothing against the decor really. The other downside was the bed. It drives me crazy when the mattress sinks in the middle and that's what happened with this bed. I didn't sleep well at all. The gym was good - a few cardio machines and weights which was totally fine. Overall not too bad but I'd probably search out another hotel during my next trip to the city.

title: “A perfect gem of a hotel!”
text: My husband and I spent 5 nights at this charming mid town hotel..loaded with luxury amenities at an affordable price, right in the heart of town. Brass fixtures, minibar, free wi-fi in each room, plush, comfortable bedding, robes, and flat-screen TV are just some of the in-room highlights. Complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning and each afternoon there was a refreshing chiiled urn of cold iced citrus water, and considering the heat wave that was a definite plus! Small reading library in the lobby with computers and printers (so you can print out your own boarding passes, and a great little bar and restaurant..we will definitely stay at Iroquois on all future trips!

title: “Wonderful comfortable hotel near Times square”
text:
Pros: The location is extremely near the times square( 2 streets away ) and the 5th Avenue and Madison Ave. The hotel is infact just next to Sofitel Hotel .Lots of nearby area for food , supermarket and shopping.The room is quiet and the bed is comfortable.Free coffee in the lobby in the morning.Free wifi is a bonus.Staffs are friendly
Cons: NO electric kettle for boiling water.However, you can ask for free hot water supply from room service.The room is not too spacious for double queen sized room.NO specail view in room .Try not to use the hotel to call for taxi with quote charge of $90 to airport and my friend try to call he taxi company himself which is around $55 only.The other thing is that the lift is very slow indeed.
Restaurant : Red flame and many restaurants along the restaurants are good .

title: “Nice hotel but...”
text:
I've stayed at the Hilton, Hyatt, Magnolia and Club Quarters in Houston. I would rank this as #3, with Hyatt being my top choice and Magnolia the 2nd. The hotel overall is good but I think service can be better. Our glasses were quite dirty and when I called the guest services, all I got was a "Oh", did expect an apology. In addition, we paid for our daily wireless and it was terrible. I was not able to get a good signal in my room for my iPAD, but in hallway it was a little better. 
The view was very nice, we stayed facing the Discovery Green.

title: “Grandioses Hotel mit der besten Lage direkt am Central Park”
text:
Eine bessere Lage wird man in New York City für ein Hotel wohl nicht finden. Das Sherry Netherland liegt im Herzen von Manhattan an der 5th Avenue direkt am südlichen Anfang des Central-Parks und neben dem berühmten Glass-Cube Apple-Store. Man kann also problemlos zu Fuß zum Shopping-Marathon aufbrechen oder (am besten am Wochenende) einen Spaziergang im Central-Park unternehmen.
Wir hatten eine sehr geräumige und stilvoll eingerichtete "Courtyard View" Suite im 11. Stock. Obwohl in einem der Zimmer gegenüber zur Zeit unseres Aufenthalts Renovierungsarbeiten liefen, haben wir in unserem Zimmer nie etwas davon gehört. Die Schallisolierung der Zimmer ist also hervorragend. Die Mini-Bar (Wasser und Softdrinks) gehörte zum Zimmer mit dazu und wurde täglich kostenlos aufgefüllt.
Das Personal war einfach großartig, immer freundlich und sehr hilfsbereit. Erst im Nachhinein haben herausgefunden, dass unser persönlicher Liebling Bell Captain Pete Brito (und das sehr zu Recht) zum New Yorker Bellboy des Jahres ausgezeichnet wurde. In Erinnerung blieb auch der Portier, der sich todesmutig in den New Yorker Rush-Hour Verkehr warf, um uns ein Taxi zum Airport zu besorgen. Ohne ihn wären wir wahrscheinlich heute noch dort ;) Ich glaub dass es in New York kaum ein anderes Hotel geben wird, in dem man genauso herzlich und freundlich behandelt wird wie im Sherry.
Die Zimmerpreise sind natürlich relativ hoch, aber die Reise und der Aufenthalt waren es definitiv wert! Wir können das Hotel uneingeschränkt empfehlen!

title: “Top Hotel in Top Lage am Central Park”
text:
Das Sherry Netherland liegt direkt am Central Park und somit in einer einzigartig guten Lage zum Shoppen und Sightseeing! Wir hatten ein sehr geräumiges, sauberes Zimmer direkt zur Strasse, somit einen tollen Blick auf Manhattan und Park, trotzdem war es völlig leise, da sehr guter Schallschutz.
Sehr freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal; Hotel ist uneingeschränkt zu empfehlen.

title: “Ottima posizione centrale”
text:
L'albergo si trova praticamente di fronte al Plaza e al Central Park nella Fifth Avenue; posizione bellissima e molto comoda. Albergo vecchio stile ma molto ben tenuto; camere molto pulite e servizio attento. La Concierge Tammy molto brava, efficiente e collaborativa.
Purtroppo il servizio di Ristorazione è dato in gestione al Ristorante Harry Cipriani e quindi al mattino, la piccola colazione mancava di atmosfera siamo perciò andati o al Plaza Hotel oppure al Hotel Pierre. Una mattina abbiamo utilizzato il servizio in camera per la piccola colazione ed è stata però molto buona Questo è stato l'unico neo e comunque, data la centralità e la pulizia dell' albergo sicuramente ci ritorneremo.

title: “Perfect! Clean and friendly!”
text: Great stay! Super clean, fast elevators, small but nice free breakfast, excellent staff. Will definitely stay here again. Not one complaint!

title: “Clean - large rooms - comfortable beds.”
text: Stayed here with wife and two boys. Rooms huge by new York standards - think of an embassy suites type room with upgraded finishes. Room had kitchenette with mini frig and microwave. Two TVs, two large closets, nice bathroom. View was of building next door. Smallish common areas include a nice computer lodge, nice but smallish lobby, and a breakfast room where the continental breakfast is served. Breakfast has cereals, yogurts, pastries. Great midtown location within short walk of lots of attractions. Subway station one block north. Get the one week metro pass and you can travel all over thes city for the cost of one round trio cab ride. Overall, a great base to explore and a good value compared to other NYC hotels.

title: “Well located for Times Square and city sights.”
text: We stayed here for 4 nights from 28th - 1st July. The hotel is small but friendly, clean and well appointed. The rooms are nice but small., beds very comfortable The bathroom's are tiny, there is very little natural light and the back rooms we were in had no view. Only one small lift working for 12 floors. Having said that, it is ideally situated for all the main sights being on 44th and 6th. So just around the corner from Times Square and 5th Avenue, and a short walk to Grand Central Station and therefore easy to get to all the wonderful sights of NYC. Parking cost $35 a night in a car park opposite. Staff always helpful.

title: “great hotel”
text:
We just stood at the hotel and everything was great.
Thank you Lisa for making such a smooth check in.
The rooms were gorgeous. Up to date with all Hi-tech.
The entire hotel is spotless.
We will be back

title: “Great NYC value and location”
text: We stayed at the Iroquois for a theater weekend in NYC and enjoyed it very much. It is the only hotel I know in NYC where every single member of the staff is very friendly and helpful. It is a small hotel -- and the rooms are small, too. But they are very well appointed, clean, and exceptionally comfortable. We stayed in a room with two queen beds (we were two friends traveling together), so that may have made the room appear smaller. The marble bathrooms are clean, bright and contain everything you need. There is a small reading room off the lobby which was a pleasant spot to read the newspaper and have coffee. The restaurant in the hotel is also quite good, but there are legions of good restaurants in the same area. I'd return to The Iroquois given its service, comfort, location in the theater district, and value.

title: “Good clean hotel”
text: Very clean rooms, pleasant employees, easy access to Interstate 10, nice breakfast offerings, cookies available at the desk, hard beds, dissappointed that animals are allowed in the rooms. Heard barking when a dog was left alone in a room during the day and have allergies to pet hair

title: “Clean, clean, clean!”
text:
This three-year-old LaQuinta is very conveniently located near the highway and exceptionally clean, inside and out. The decor is attractive and fresh. The rooms had the usual amenities, and the king size bed was comfortable.
We ate at a nearby Golden Corral that had the largest international selection of food imaginable. It was very busy, but we did not wait for a table. The food was good.

title: “Fantastic service”
text: We stayed at hotel for state Democratic convention and wanted to see the Houston skyline from the 24th floor open patio. A gracious bartender, Fred Yanas, assisted us in entering the patio area. Upon our return, he pointed out the Houston landmarks on a personal walk around the 24th floor glass enclosed bar.

title: “entire staff friendliest, most helpful, and smiling of any hotel i have used--outstanding from GM thru entire work force”
text: The people who work here are absolutely wonderful--front desk, dining room, housekeeping, maintenance, back office, general manager. Very clean and well appointed common areas, rooms quiet. We stayed 8 weeks in an accessable room that was very comfortable. However, the entire staff made the long stay very nice.

title: “A Welcome Change”
text:
I was impressed with HGI Energy Corridor. The facility was top notch and the staff was excellent. My stay was short, only one night. I arrived at @8:00 p.m. and checked out @ 8:00 a.m. All of the staff was excellent, specifically the night desk attendant (LaLa), the wait staff at breakfast and the morning desk attendants. 
I stay at Hilton properties specifically. I have probably stayed at 200 Hilton properties in the past 4 years. This is the most pleasant experience I've had. The food for breakfast even tasted better. Whenever the occasion presents itself, I will choose Energy Corridor if it is available.

title: “In LOVE With This Hotel!!!”
text: Brilliant!!! This is a VERY nice hotel, Staff is friendly and helpful, you feel welcome the moment you walk in. The hotel is gorgeous and clean, from the lobby area to the restaurant and lounge area (with outside seating) to the rooms! We enjoyed the weekday wine & cheese hour on the closed in Patio... there was a big movie screen TV across from the patio where we were able to watch Monday night football! Perfect! The staff was extremely helpful and kind, all seemed to enjoy their job. Dinner and dessert from Humphrey was delish! I also order room service breakfast (French toast in the morning) which was also good. Everything we requested we received, I asked for a quiet corner room on a high floor and I got just that (room 1817 a city view King) stayed in that room 2 nights then came back for a 3rd night because our flight was cancelled and they gave me an executive suite! (room 1412). Both rooms amazing, spotless, with a great view and that SHOWER... Very Impressive.... They give several extras such as free internet and a $15 coupon to raid the mini bar... I forgot my deodorant, called the front desk and they were knocked on my door within 5 minutes with a new stick of deodorant. It rained while we were there and they had complimentary umbrella's for us to use. I can’t think of anything negative to say! Great place for a business traveler, good location right down the street from Penn Station! No complaints, I will be back! Very pleased!

title: “Great hotel - Wonderful staff”
text: I live in New Jersey and have been to NYC many of times; however, this was my first time every staying over night. It was recommended by my friend and I am so glad that I took his advice. The staff was absolutely great, always smiling and willing to help me in every way even getting me a taxi. The hotel is very clean and the bed was so comfortable. My view was out of this world - 16th floor. I plan on staying there again and would highly recommend Eventi.

title: “Disappointing Room, Restaurant”
text:
At time of check-in, I was told I was upgraded to a junior suite, since I am an SPG Platinum member. When I walked into the room, I thought there must have been a mistake. The room was very small and extremely dark, with no natural light due to a much larger building located very close the room's window. When I called down to the front desk, they rudely told me that there was not another room available. I called SPG to cancel the reservation and to move to a different hotel. The SPG representative called the hotel and spoke with the manager, who said he agreed to cancel the reservation.
Surprisingly, while reviewing my credit card statement, I noticed that I recevied a charge from the Chatwal, even though SPG had canceled the reservation and I did not stay in the room.
In addition, avoid the restaurant, unless you enjoy dining with a swarm of fruit flies.

title: “Great Location”
text:
Stayed at the Chatwal for 4 nights! They treat you like Royalty from the moment you step in the door. Every staff member were extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were nice and cozy - pillows amazing! Bathroom is beautiful. One small issue is that you can hear the people in the room next to yours. Location is fantastic! It is located half a block from Time Square centre.
Would not purchase the continental breakfast at the Lamb's Club (adjacent to the hotel but separate Management) as you only get croissants and raisin buns. My friend is gluten intolerant and we are all healthy eaters. They refused to substitute our breakfast with fresh fruit or yoghurt (which would cost them way less) so we cancelled the breakfast and ate somewhere else.

title: “i loved it”
text: this hotel was nicer than the plaza i loved the view of the empire state building i stayed in the penthouse very excellent

title: “New York Favorite”
text: Beautiful high-ceiling rooms, amazing personal service, great food in their restaurant, cannot say enough for the comfort of the stay. Personal, welcoming staff at all hours of the night and day. Not accustomed to entering a NYC hotel and feeling like you are "coming home" but this is the one. The room was very spacious and the inclusion of some glass walls and shelving reminded us of Barcelona hotels. Windows floor to ceiling encompassing the entire outside wall, with two coverings - one just a semi-sheer curtain and the other a black-out curtain, both easily operated with convenient controls. Very quiet in the hotel. We were both surprised and delighted by this hotel and will make this our new favorite spot to stay in NYC

title: “Boutique Hotel, unconventional, good location, some innovative things...”
text:
At arrival you are greeted in the center of the lobby by the reception, where you stand next to that person, looking at the screen and making sure the reservation is ok. The No-Barrier zone is refreshing actually, I liked it. Quick check-in, and with some innovative approaches: minibar is included for all things except alcohol, nice touch, so you don't feel ripped of when you take that 7,5$ bottle of water in other hotels, also WIFI is free, even on several devices, cool!
Room was very good, We got one on the 9th floor, so we had a spectacular view on the high risers and the NY Public Library. The room was very spacious, especially to NYC standards. Good bed, good linens, good bathroom, but no seperate bath, just a walk-in shower, but with some extra's like a small stool, so you can sit down, a rain head, normal shower head and a lower waterfall head, for your foot bath that is also provided under the stool.
I didn't use the on site restaurant, because I wanted to enjoy the city as much as possible, neither the breakfast, so I can't really comment on that.
Overall it was a very pleasurable experience. I would certainly recommend it.

title: “Very nice stay - Recommended Hotel”
text: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Andaz Hotel 5th Avenue. Very well situated (in front of the New york Library) and even if New York citizens think the best stay is up up up (upper east side). If you love design and modern style, you will be delighted - we stayed in a suite (48sq meters) on the 10th floor (I suggest you ask for an elavated floor) - Gym sport is well equiped, mateless and pillow are really really greet bathroom is huge with a nice rain shower. very good and elaborated breakfast. Staff is available, kind and efficient. Non alcoohol beverages are free (water, apple juice) in the Suite a little Kitchen and well equiped was available.

title: “Perfect place!”
text: Can't fault this hotel. 3 night we spend there was a pleasure. Service is really good, spacious and really comfortable rooms.It has all you need and more. Spotless! Would come back and recommend. The only downside could be that it is about 20 min walk to Time Square, which we did not mind!

title: “NYC Gem”
text: The Hotel Beacon was the perfect place for four women from Minnesota to explore New York City. We were so tired from exploring, seeing the US Open, and sightseeing that most evenings we bought wine at the shop next door and food from the great stores across the street and spent the evening in our living room area. Beautiful view of sunset from our window ... see photo. The desk staff was so helpful and very friendly, and the hotel was immaculate. We'll be back!

title: “Generally Good Experience”
text: My experience at the Four Seasons was generally good but not exceptional. My room was nicely decorated and large, although the bathroom was a bit dated. The bed was comfortable. The hotel has excellent exercise facilities. Breakfast was generally good but a bit on the expensive side. The staff is uniformly excellent.

title: “4 Seasons in Houston--as good as ever”
text: I had not been to Houston in about ten years. I stayed again at the Four Seasons and found it even better than I remembered. I had a nice suite with a very comfortable bed. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is outstanding for business. I give it my highest recommendation.

title: “Packed in like Sardines”
text: The downtown Houston Four Seasons is a hotel for business, not a resort. I attended a conference there 3/12 and although very nice, we were packed in elbow to elbow during the conference and for meals. The design of the hotel is very modern, and seems somewhat cold. The sheets seemed slick, not like a heavy quality cotton, but like a cheap sateen. I found the bed uncomfortable and the glass doors on the tub made me feel a bit claustrophobic. The full sized beds seemed very small in the large room. The common areas are very nice. The green apples available in the lobby are a nice touch. I waited in a long line to check in, when the person working my line left with the customer ahead of me. Very frustrating. The front desk consistently had long lines during my stay.

title: “Handy and dandy”
text:
Spent 4 nights here when in Houston on business. Handy to downtown, handy to restaurants, handy to bars on Main Street, handy to the Sunday morning drunks released from the City Jail looking for bus fare. 
Boutique hotel with a cow theme. Or they could be bulls. Nice spacious rooms, free wifi and sizeable and functioning bathroom. Big TV. Quite limited breakfast menu but soemthing for everyone. 
Found front desk staff very helpful.
Not significantly different to the Lancaster where I stayed last time in Houston.

title: “Not my type of a 5-star hotel, but 5 stars nonetheless”
text: I'm generally not a huge fan of the old-fashioned boutique-style hotel; if I wanted a five-star experience, I'd go with a modern hotel, but that doesn't take away from rating Hotel Icon as five stars. My king room was very large and clean, and the bathroom with both shower and sunken tub was equally large. While I'm normally a stickler for updated decor, all the older decor in the room matched the style of the hotel perfectly. The building itself is gorgeous, and the front desk staff was very helpful (I was staying on a Friends & Family rate, but they treated me as if I was paying a full rate, which would have been $250+ per night). I ate breakfast at the hotel for two mornings, and was pleasantly surprised by the food quality - the pancakes specifically were delicious (and weren't too overpriced given the hotel). It isn't as centrally located downtown as other hotels and there aren't too many restaurants in the immediate couple blocks if that's important to you - but it's still a great hotel in its own right.

title: “Nice, chic and comfortable”
text:
Very good loation and nice area easy to walk in the area for eating or some shopping.
Very clean.
Very comfortable.

title: “Location, Location, Location!”
text:
I traveled to Houston for business and Hotel Sorella was highly recommended by several co-workers. The hotel exceeded my expections and I have high standards.
The hotel is located in City Center with a number of restaurants and shops in the complex. This was a big plus for my colleague and I after a long day at work.
The room was spacious, modern and spotless and the complimentary breakfast was a nice touch. The fitness facility was small but very clean and well maintained.
Overall I found the service to be very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely return to Hotel Sorella for business or pleasure the next time I'm in Houston.

title: “Modern Excellence”
text: This is by far the best hotel I have stayed in. Every part of the hotel is decorated in a unique, chic way. The beds are amazingly soft! Breakfast is open near the main lobby with lounges, couches and huge windows leading out to a patio. I also highly recommend the hotel bar, Mona Lisa.

title: “Great Stay”
text: I was very impressed with this hotel overall. The first and most important thing I noticed immediately was the cleanliness. Also the staff was very very friendly and accomodating. I also liked the fact that it was gated and was in a great location...not too far from everywhere we wanted to go. The breakfast was one of the better free hot breakfasts that I've had at hotels and the evening snacks were great as well. The kids had chili dogs, while I enjoyed a baked potato and salad. They also have complimentary beverages and popcorn. We will definitely be staying here again. It was a great, particular for the price.

title: “Decent, no frills hotel”
text: I was here for a week, on business. The hotel was clean, simple and had all basic amenities. Room was spacious and did have a working a/c (was noisy though), clean bath & toilet and towels. Beakfast was just okay, and the evening free drinks/snacks were okay too.. drinks are served in plastic glasses, dont expect cups or real glasses. Okay for a short stay when you are out working and come back only to eat & sleep.. there was a basic fitness centre too which was good..

title: “Great service, older facilities”
text: Great service, and great food, although, a bit pricey for what you get, but the gym treadmills were breaking down and had broken cup holders and the TV didn't work on one and the incline was broken on another. Ali served my meals to the room thoroughly and timely every day. Laura at the front desk was very helpful in getting me situated when I arrived at 1:30AM.

title: “Great service, but needs updating.”
text:
The good: Service is prompt. I ordered room service every night and the waiter (Ali) was knocking at my door within 20 minutes. Breakfast was quick also. The happy hour every weeknight for priority club members was a nice treat. Good bites, socializing, and free drinks is a great way to cap off the workday. Flat screen tv in rooms and fairly quiet. Wireless Internet for free.
The not so good: hotel feels like a time warp to the 80's. However the bed linens, pillows, sheets are new. It seems to be a fairly busy hotel and i am surprised a hotel of this brand status has not been updated in so many years. Hotel needs a major renovation.

title: “Wonderful Hotel”
text: This hotel is an excellent choice for service, comfort and location. The Iroquois is located within walking distance to all the local attractions. The service was excellent and the rooms were quiet and clean. No problems, no complaints. Loved it!!!

title: “It's terribly Expensive, but not High End”
text:
This is a good, not great hotel. Reminds me of many European hotels. Good Staff, reasonable price, decent sized rooms, close to where you want to me. Not a bad place to stay at all. Just not something unique. 
I will stay here again.

title: “Surprised...in a good way”
text: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a graduation weekend and were surprised at the cleanliness of this hotel. This hotel had upscale lights, very updated and the staff was always very friendly. We stayed in a room with two beds, a microwave & refrigerator. We were very satisfied with our room and restroom. Everything worked, no signs of previous guests as you sometimes get with some hotels. The location is away but close enough to where you need to be with great access to I-10. I felt 100% safe at this location and would recommend to anyone. The price is extremely reasonable for this location.

title: “Best around this area of Houston”
text: I really loved that I was able to stay in the area where my daughter was at. At first I wasn't to sure because I am not familiar with the area on how safe it is, but I stayed around 2 weeks here and everything was nice. You will get the random crazy guest checking in, but everything is handled nicely by the staff. One call to the front desk and they're on it! I didn't see a lot of family staying..mainly business people or workers, i guess because its so close to the main areas where people work like the port and downtown. I had never avoided so much traffic. Coming from this side of town into Houston was ideal. in general everything was good. I do agree with the occasional hard boiled eggs, but then again who wouldn't want their mom cooking at the hotel for us? : ) awesome stay...thank you!

title: “Decent hotel for a short stay in Houston”
text:
The hotel interior is nice and clean. The staff were friendly. The complimentary breakfast was decent with typical waffles, bagels, bread, biscuits and gravy, eggs and bacon/sausages. One of the mornings while we were having breakfast, we saw one of the Spanish speaking staff (in hotel uniforms) brought her two small kids to eat there as well. It is a bit unprofessional for my standpoint. 
The area where the hotel is located is mixed. It is not in a bad area, but not a nice area either. I felt reasonably safe, but I'd advise caution. We stayed here for a two-day college visit, and would consider stay here again in the future. However, this would not be a place I'd choose to stay for vacation though. By the way, the hotel is only about 20-30 minute drive to downtown provided smooth traffic.

title: “Must stay”
text: Stayed on first floor. Service excellent. Nicely decorated for Xmas. Looks brand new everywhere. Room very clean and modern. Excellent value for $55. Fabulous breakfast. Complete with Texas shaped waffles! Kids loved it!

title: “Overwhelmed by the Friendliness of the Staff”
text:
The Last two Hilton Hotels I had stayed were in Kuching, Sarawak overlooking the River and Hilton Salalah right on the beach looking East to India. So I was spoiled by the friendliness of the staff.
My stay here has begun auspiciously and I have yet to spend the night here, even though I am in the Executive Floor and writing this review watching the crimson red sun setting behind the skyscrapers. As I entered the lobby I ran into a fellow Endocrinologist from Australia, Cairns to be precise whom I have not seen in two years! 
Valerie Yang the Front Desk Manager was more than helpful. Pleasant and solving the problem at hand.
Went to the 19th Floor Executive Lounge and the welcome by the Concierge there, Jackie, was more than expansive. That she shares the same name as my sister was a good omen too. 
The room allotted to me is rather large with a huge window and all the amenities that you expect from Hilton.
I am looking forward to my stay until 26th! Once again thank you, Valerie and Jackie

title: “Good conference hotel”
text: Above average hotel for business and conferences, friendly good service. Only down point is being charged $15 a day per device for wifi and Internet.

title: “Huge convention hotel, comfortable”
text: Wear your track shoes to get around this place, especially if you use the self parking. Nice service and rooms. In lobby they had folks offereing glases of lemonade or ice tea which was nice. Not sure if that;s usual or for the state Democratic convention that was starting while we were there. Location ws convenient to Minute Maid Park. We walked the 6 blocks to the Astros game, and caught a pedi cab back. Price would have been too high but we got a deal through a discount site which made it worth it.

title: “Convenient...but...”
text:
This hotel is connected through air conditioned walkways to the George Brown convention center. If you are here for a convention there is not a better option.
If you are just in Houston and not worried about the convention center then you might elect to go elsewhere. Again - this is a convention hotel. So - if you aren't attending a convention - do you really want to stay in a hotel with thousands of people who are??? It's a big property. There are east elevators and west elevators. There are 2 big circular entrances with valet parking. Lots of lounge space etc.
I found the rooms to be nice - and quiet. The elevators were fast. The executive lounge was nice. The food was good.
The internet was pitiful. I was on the 14th floor - a high floor - but not the top floor. There are I think 6 or 7 floors above 14. I couldn't get a wireless signal better than low signal and frequently it just dropped altogether. It amazes me that Hilton charges for the internet - and then on top of that the service is so poor it wouldn't be worth the money if it was free.
The valet parking is the only easy option. There is a self park garage ($15 instead of $30) - good luck. The valet service is not fast. You will not have to worry about whether you forgot to pay for your valet service - because you will not see your car until you have paid. The guys themselves are fine - and very comfortable receiving tips.
The front desk is where I found service most lacking. at check-in it seemed that they hired high school kids who were busy playing around. Not a big deal - but not what I would expect. At check-out it was ridiculous. There were 4 clerks. One was working with a customer using a highlighter on a map (why the concierge or bell desk wasn't doing that is a mystery). One was standing there but "unable to help you." I gave him my room keys - he said he could take them but could not check me out - then stood back. He seemed angry. I'm guessing that he was in trouble for something and was waiting for a manager to let him access his computer again. It was interesting to see a grown man pout. The other two were on the phone making what sounded like personal calls. The thing is they didn't get off the phone. A line of about 6 people formed. This was at 11:45 am - checkout time is noon. How in the world does a hotel not have a manager on the floor to see this fiasco at what should be a very busy time. In the end - I saw the other folks wanting to check out just write their room numbers on a papaer and put them on the clerk's keypad (while she glared at the interrpution to her call). 
It was bizarre. I assume that some confrontation had just occurred - someone fired or dressed down etc - and that the manager had just walked away. It looked like the entire desk staff were engaged in telling their friends and coworkers how terribel life was and what victims they were.
In any case the bottom line doesn't change - if you are going to the convention center stay here - there is no better choice. If you are not going to the convention center then there are lots of better options.

title: “Poor Security - No In-Room Safes..!!!”
text:
Property claims to cater to business travellers but has no in-room safe...???
Staff also seem to be clueless regarding basic aspects of the property and surrounding area.

title: “I really felt like an honored guest”
text:
I have been travelling on business for more than ten years and this has been one of the most memorable experiences I have had. The staff really know how to make you feel like you are a "guest" in their hotel. In particular, Boris and Rita are the consummate professionals. Their people skills and customer service skills exceeded my expectations. I wish I could find a Boris and a Rita at every hotel where I stay.
I also loved the amenities in the room. No cheapie toiletries here.
What would have made my stay even more amazing would be to have a magnifying makeup mirror in the bathroom, disposable cups and glasses (feels more sanitary) and bottled water in the room.
However no gadget or gizmo can replace service excellence and I certainly experienced service excellence at this hotel.

title: “No Doubt - Best Hotel in the Area”
text:
My husband and I stayed at this beautiful property for a week, combining a business trip with leisure. Toward the end of our stay, our adult children joined us, booking a couple rooms for a few nights. When they arrived, they said, "WOW, this is a very pleasant surprise!" That comment fairly well sums up our entire experience. First, I had a specific request for our room, which was not available upon check-in (my fault for failing to communicate it while making the bookings). The third morning as I walked through the lobby, Rita (front desk) greeted me by name, said the room I’d requested was coming available in a few hours and asked if I’d like to move. I happily did and it was perfect. I had the pleasure of meeting and chatting with manager Chris Meador on a few occasions. I remain impressed with the professionalism, pro-activeness, friendliness, and over-all excellence of every employee I came in contact with there. 
The hotel is sparkling clean and quiet. The rooms are well appointed and roomy and the beds exceptionally comfortable. The lobby bar and restaurant feature a good selection of menu and drink items and the food is delicious. The lobby itself is a welcoming place to gather and visit. All of us thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Having traveled extensively over the past few decades and stayed in many categories of hotels, I believe that HGI Energy Corridor compares well to 4-star properties.
Thank you Chris, Rita and the rest of the excellent HGI Energy Corridor staff. We plan to return and have already advised many colleagues heading to the area that your Houston oasis cannot be beat.

title: “Love the Eventi Hotel”
text:
Stayed at the Eventi Hotel for a week while visiting my son. I booked a Premier one bedroom suite for my husband, son, and I with hopes of a relaxing stay (in between helping to move my son to a new apt). We loved the Eventi from the moment we arrived in our 23rd floor suite, where a bottle of chilled wine and cheese & fruit plate were waiting for us (thanks Patrick!).
The suite had an incredible view of the Empire State building & NYC skyline. The bathroom had double sinks, a walk-in shower, spa tub, and separate toilet area. Lots of marble everywhere. I absolutely loved the rain shower --- be sure to use it. The parlor area had a leather chair and a sleeper sofa that was comfortable for my teen. Our room was super quiet---we never heard another guest during the entire stay. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows were supportive, so I slept incredibly well during my stay.
The hotel was centrally located for us. We either walked or took taxis depending on our destination. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. We were assisted with our auto on numerous occasions during our shuffling of goods for my son's move. The staff went above and beyond to help. 
I look forward to spending time at the Eventi Hotel again---I am spoiled now!
p.s. don't forget the wine reception from 5-6 pm

title: “Eventi delivers top notch performance!”
text: Our first time at the Eventi and loved every minute of our stay! The hotel is modern and very clean. Only complaint would be the neighbourhood - but that is overcome by a safe few block walk, subway or cab ride - all within minutes. All of our requests were met and exceeded. The service exceeded expectations and for NYC was pleasantly surprised by how friendly, professional and courteous all at Eventi were - not one negative! Gabriella was top notch and took care of us! My mom having her first NYC experience was wowed by Eventi. Will for sure stay again and am counting the months until my return!

title: “clean and modern”
text: hotel is clean and modern , a bit far from the subway and museums for us but was very nice. free coffee in the morning is always good. help was very helpful. we have no complaints except more light i the bathroom would be good.

title: “My favorite hotel”
text:
I got married last Nov at the Eventi. Planning a wedding can be very stressful but thanks to Lisa and the Eventi team it was a breeze. We spent a great week with my family and had an amazing ceremony at the Verdi Rooms.
But that is not all, when we came back last June for a few days, the staff remembered us and pampered us again like newlyweds.
If you add that sense of home to the amazing location in MidTown, the beautiful decor, and the overall Kimpton experience, I am sure it might become one of your favorite hotels too.

title: “OMG my favorite luxury boutique hotel”
text:
Got a reasonable deal for this relatively new 5-star hotel just next to Times Square (on 44th, same block as the ABC studio). Were upgraded to a junior suite, perhaps because we were celebrating our honeymoon. The service was incredible. Friendly desk attendant, an actual hotel butler, art deco style out the wazoo.
Then the rooms. Wow. Somehow mixing ultra-modern features with luxury art deco style (high tech room controls on the phone), bathroom in sparkly maroon/brown granite and mirrors, TV in the wall, and the toilet from space with a warm seat and water jets (!!!). The upgraded room had a small "walk in" closet with safe and mini bar area, seating area, and desk that opened up to reveal a light and work area.
The location can't be beat for Times Square activity, without being right on the square (just half a block off).
Maybe the only downsides were that the room control touch screen on the phone did not respond well to touch, so it was often hard to change the lighting and drapery settings; also that the desk lamp that lights up when the lid is hinged open basically shined directly at eye level while working, so I had to drape a hand towel to serve as a visor when working on my laptop.
But overall, this was an amazing luxury boutique hotel, at a great location, with incredible service. I will return.

title: “This hotel is the greatest”
text: We stayed here for one week and it could not have been better. The location is perfect for a trip to NYC, half a block from Times Square, the subway, theatre and plenty of great restaurants. Our room was fantastic (we are Platinum Starwood members and were upgraded to a suite) Tasteful furnishings and the bathrooms are not to be believed... every imaginable amenity and convenience including a tv built into the mirror of each bathroom. The front manager Brad, was incredibly helpful and accommodating in all areas. The staff in general made you feel like you were part of the family, and that they really wanted you to have whatever you needed. Had a fantastic facial in the spa and wonderful drinks at the bar. Cannot wait to come back

title: “excellent”
text: Stayed at Chatwal---fabalous hotel--Elizabeth at front desk---the best----Have stayed many five star hotels --this ranks with all-----Richard-S.-----Pa.

title: “Excellent value for money”
text: Our family of three stayed in a premier king room over the past weekend at The Setai. The room is extremely spacious as advertised with twdo walkin closets and a nice vanity desk which my wife fully appreciated. It was 100 degrees outside so the free refreshments in the fridge was a welcomed amenity. I always felt that top hotels are too mean to charge five bucks for an in room soda on top of five hundred dollars for a regular room. Breakfast was included in our room rate and they were very flexible with the billing, netting off what we ordered vs. the billed amount in the package. The food was good and a la cate only, we enjoyed the tranquility of the restaurant which is a far cry from the hustle n bustle of the typical buffet breakfast. The staffs were all very friendly and warm, which I felt was much more welcoming than the rigid politeness of some of the old style hotels on the upper east side. Location is obviously very good, within walking distance of multiple subway stations which I must say (the NYC subway) has been further improved since I was there a few years ago. Bath room fixture is top notch and the warm air coming out from under the sink, warming your feet n the marble floor is particularly thoughtful. I'm sure I will enjoy that even more if it was cold outside. The gym is a bit small but they have a yoga room which was perfect for me practising my taichi but on a week day with more business travellers it may be a problem.

title: “The best!!”
text:
Sorry - but I'm going to rave...
This hotel was AMAZING!! 
My husband and I have done some serious travelling the past 3 years, and we both agree that even though we've stayed in beautiful hotels with great service, this was by far the best!
The location is unbeatable - Fifth Avenue, just 3 blocks from the Empire State Building - surrounded by cafes and shops etc, on route for numerous buses, and a 5 or so minute walk to the subway.
If you don't feel like catching a taxi, bus or subway - the hotel has a complementary car (first in - first served basis) which will take you basically anywhere in Manhattan between 10am - 10pm. Sooo convenient!!
We stayed in an Avenue Apartment Suite for a week, and it was amazing. Beautiful decor and great size. It has a small kitchenette and washer/ dryer which was excellent for a week's stay. 
Another excellent feature was complementary fridge items. I know it sounds pety, but we've been to so many places where you pay heaps of money and they still charge you for water. The Setai was almost like home...
The service was beyond excellent. From the daily room servicing (they would bring you snacks every afternoon) to the incredible reception staff we could not say 1 bad thing about anything.
Their personal assistants (especially Sohee and Kimberley) were amazing, and helped make the say so much better! We live in the UAE which has an impossible postal service, so I had ordered several packages to be delivered to the hotel during our stay. They were more than happy to collect them for us.
They have an excellent restaurant (Ai Fiori) - food is outstanding, and a very nice bar on ground floor as well.
Honestly - wasn't the cheapest stay, but it was well worth the money for a week's amazing comfort in NYC... 
Will definitely go back again!!!

title: “Enjoyable stay”
text: The hotel was in an excellent location....3 minutes walk to the Empire State Building, 10 minutes walk to the Rockefeller Center, 15 minutes walk to August Wilson Theatre to see Jersey Boys, 25 minutes walk to Central Park and 4 minutes walk to get the Hop on Hop off bus which we found to be excellent value (we negotiated 4 days for the price of 3). A previous comment was made about the $94 credit for breakfast (per couple)......you CAN have anything off the menu up to the value of $94 (remember to factor in the 18% service charge and taxes) it's not rocket science........you'd have to go overboard with the amount of food ordered to greatly exceed this credit !! The staff were, without exception, happy, friendly and helpful with one outstanding member of staff being the lovely Manuela. We thoroughly enjoyed the meal we had in the hotel restaurant Ai Fiori for my birthday.......just one little blip when a side dish was forgotten and arrived a little too late to be enjoyed with our main course. The hotel is modern, contemporary and spotless. I would rate it as a very good 4 star but not quite up to the standard of other 5 stars we have stayed in around the world. Couple of negatives which are very minor but hopefully will be addresed by management after reading this review .... the coffee at breakfast was never hot and the nuts occasionally offered in the bar when we had cocktails tasted stale. We didn't have chance to try the spa, unfortunately, but we checked it out and it looked very nice. We caught the NYC Airporter bus from JFK ($28 per person round trip) to Grand Central Station and then got on the complimentary minibus which dropped us outside of the hotel. The hotel complimentary car service took us back to Grand Central to pick up the bus back to the airport which run every 30 minutes. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: “Family Staycation Package a Plus”
text: Booked a Family Staycation for the weekend and the Avenue Apartment we were in was really fantastic. Beautiful view, beautiful decor, great ameneties, and more space than I could have imagined. Perfect for kids - the in unit washer dryer was fantastic, I was able to do all our laundry before we left. Loved being able to use the house car and the complimentary drinks. And not being charged for wireless like you are at so many other luxury hotels is just a very sensible perk. A lot is made by the hotel (on the website) over the Pretasi linens but I didn't find them to be all that special. There was nothing wrong with them, just not great. The giant fluffy towels, however, were very nice. My husband said the mattress hurt his back. I didn't find it that bad, but I've definitely stayed in chain hotels that seem to have the comfy bed thing figured out nicely. Turn down service was great.

title: “Nice rooms and helpful staff”
text:
My husband and I spent 4 days in New York with our 4 month old baby and stayed at this lovely hotel. We had a nice and spacious room with high ceilings. The room was very modern with glass finishes in the bathroom and living space. The complimentary slippers and robes were a treat. The complimentary mini bar came in handy. 
Most importantly for us travelling with a small baby was how helpful the staff was. We had baby hire items (stroller and bath from Baby Chic) delivered to the hotel prior to our arrival and the staff stored them for us. We also needed a microwave to sterilise bottles and they were kind enough to provide a small one in the room. This was really really helpful. 
The hotel is in a really nice spot across from the New York library. Good location off 5th ave.
We would definitely stay there again.

title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location!”
text:
This was my wife's first time to NYC and our experience at Andaz helped her to fall in love with the city. 
Location: A+. Awesome view of the library, Bryant park and peek-a-boo view of the Empire State building. Being across from the library was great because we weren't staring diirectly at another building every time we looked out our window. It really helped us to appreciate the full expanse of the city. 
Staff: A++ There was a plumbing issue in our room when we arrived and the hotel was completely booked...we arrived at just before midnight and the staff did everything they could to make it right. They arranged a room at a nearby hotel and credited our 1st nights stay. The also upgraded our room for the rest of our stay. The staff was always warm and attentive and the hand written note from Jonathan F. was a very nice touch. I've already sent two friends there and they had a great experience. I'm sending my father and mother in the fall and they'll be staying at Andaz as well.

title: “Nice rooms”
text: Rooms are lovely at this hotel and staff is friendly and polite. We were disappointed that they could not deliver on important requests we made months before and during our stay. No adjacent rooms, no roll-aways, no late checkout, etc. We had a group of kids that needed to be together for close supervised -- so separate rooms were not an option. We traveled out of state twice over a two month period to meet with hotel staff to examine rooms and were assured we'd be accommodated. NOTHING was delivered and we were only informed ARRIVAL DAY. We felt very unwelcomed. Too bad, because the hotel rooms and the staff are nice. Our group was split up all over the hotel in an Andaz Suite and two Large Twin Rooms -- all on separate floors. So much for two months advanced planning....

title: “Great hotel @ a reasonable price for NYC”
text: Stayed at the Andaz the first weekend of August. Arrived at noon and they were able to check me in immediately (in a different room type but same square footage) so that I could head out. Staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations. They don't have a traditional reception desk and decor is modern and pretty. Our room was on the 7th floor on the north tower. Very quiet just didn't have a great view. Shower is big and nice. Low comfortable bed and comfy pillows too. Had breakfast downstairs and it was very expensive. Ate breakfast out the rest of the time. Great location on 5th avenue in front of the New York Library. Close to grand central station, Bryant park and shopping. There is a bar down the street O'Caseys with good food and service. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Got a great rate for a very good hotel.

title: “Great Hotel”
text:
Been here a couple of times and always welcomed by a friendly group of people at the front desk. The rooms are modern and comfortable. Andaz 5th Avenue is amongst one of the first hyatt properties with an interactive television system which allows you to surf the net, get movies etc. Its pretty cool. The bed is comfortable with a good firm mattress. The bathrooms are well appointed. The bathrooms only have standing showers with a good rain-shower. 
The restaurant is pretty good for all day dining. Very decent for hotel food. 
Looking forward to my next visit soon !

title: “Great family hotel”
text: My husband and I stayed here with our 6 week old son in a king studio for 2 nights. We come to the city often and have stayed at many different hotels. The Beacon is my favorite so far. The room was plenty big for the 3 of us, and having the kitchen was great for making bottles and such. Location is great, right near the park and all kinds of good restaurants. There is a Starbucks right across the street. Fairway market is also across the street, you can get anything you can think of there. I love getting "real" bagels whenever we are in the city. The Bagel Bakery on Amsterdam and 77th is really good! We will be staying here next time we are in town. It's a great place to relax after a day walking around the city!

title: “Great location & price”
text: My family of 2 adults & 2 children 6 & 9 years old spent 8 nights at the Beacon in March. We were really happy with the location , our 1 bedroom apartment was more than big enough for all of us & having a kitchen was fantastic. Our only issue was with the smoke alarm going off when cooking, but maintenance were very quick to assist & fix the issue. The fairway market across the road is perfect as you can get all you need & you're only a cross of the road away. The Subway at 72nd made getting around with young kids very easy & we found the proximity of Cental Park & other places of interest an easy walk as the weather was wonderful. We would love to come back to New York & would stay at the Beacon again.

title: “Great Location”
text: As hotels go, it's okay. Nice big rooms with a kitchenette. Shame they don't have a restaurant - or even a bar. Have stayed here several times but for me, it's always the location that does it. Right on Broadway with Central Park a couple of blocks behind you. There are lots of fabulous bars and restaurants all around the upper west side so you're spoilt for choice. I have always found the staff to be efficient and courteous but not exactly friendly. However, this doesn't really matter at all because of the nature of the hotel, you only really have to speak to them whilst checking in or out.

title: “Excellent family hotel”
text: We stayed at The Beacon for a week (one couple + 1 18 yr old). The Beacon offers small apartments (suites) with a bedroom (with cable TV), bathroom, kitchenette and living area (with cable TV) with sofabed. This was perfect for us. The Beacon is very well located: close to central park, close to the subway station (73rd Street) and plenty of decent restaurants in the neighborhood. The front desk staff is very helpful as is the doorman. For breakfast you can go to the "Viand" which is in the same building as the hotel or you can go to a few diners within a few blocks.

title: “Oversized rooms with own kitchenette”
text:
Hotel Beacon is part hotel and part apartments (above floor 20 it seems). Rooms are spacey, or 'oversized', in a NYC context. Most rooms are actually two rooms and a small kitchenette featuring oven, fridge, sink and a micro. This is good since the hotel does not serve breakfast. The interior feels a bit outdated and adds to the feeling of having your own NYC apartment :)
Service is spotty. Staff had all sort of problems arranging transport, delivering utensils for the kitchenette and most noticeable, to properly close the door to our room after a parcel delivery. Could have turned nasty but nothing was stolen over the few hours the door was 'ajar'.
Internet is wireless and free and a bit quirky (leases run out way to fast and way to easy). 
The hood is excellent with lots of nice restaurants and famous grocery store Fairway just across Broadway. Walking distance to Central Park (approx Strawberry Fields) and Columbus Circle. Subway lines 1 and 2 just a block up or down.

title: “Its a Four Seasons...”
text:
I stayed at the Four Seasons Houston for business. The hotel is a typical Four Seasons, with a good lobby, great staff and great rooms. The hotel's location was located in the central business district so it was dead on a Sunday. 
The room was great, amazing bed, amazing bathroom just as you would expect from a Four Seasons. 
I ate both room service (which was excellent) and in the restaurant onsite for dinner and breakfast. Dinner was okay, nothing special. Breakfast was delicious even costing $50 for a single person. 
All in all, good hotel, with great rooms in an okay neighborhood.

title: “wonderful service and great rooms”
text: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in March, 2012 as we were both attending the Microsoft Convergence conference in Houston. I was afraid that as two out of several thousand conference attendees, we would be treated like cattle and not as guests. Instead, we were welcomed by name, had a great room, outstanding service from the front desk, valet, concierge, and bar/restaurant. The hotel itself is very nice, the beds are insanely comfortable, and the fitness area was also very nice and not crowded. We did not try any of the spa services, but they looked very inviting. At checkout we were asked about the stay and had nothing but positive things to say. All in all, I highly recommend this property, especially if you're in Houston near the ballpark or convention center.

title: “A nice weekend escape”
text: Had a great time, the room was erfect and car service outstanding.

title: “Comfortable and Accomodating”
text: Our beds were so comfortable! and the staff was warm and accomodating regarding any request we made (extra pillows & towels, coffeepot for the room, oscillating fan for white noise, etc...) The hotel staff were helpful and friendly and always glad to assist us during our stay. I loved being able to pop across the street to The Phonecian for a snack or bottle of wine, shop in the nearby retail stores, and listen to great music at the House of Blues, all without having to walk more than a block. The housekeeping staff were efficient and moved in & out of our rooms like phantoms -- we would leave for a couple of hours & return to a room fully refreshed. The pool, spa, and work-out areas were clean and uncrowded - staff friendly and gracious. Lovely bar with better than average 'bar food' available. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay at the Four Seasons.

title: “Big, nice room with great bathroom”
text: Very nice and well decorated. Clean and nice towels, sheets. The bathroom was great- huge tub and separate shower. The shuttle to local spots was super too. The front desk staff not that helpful but overall would recommend hotel.

title: “handy for city centre”
text: handy for city centre and the tram system stops outside. parking was just next door

title: “great addition to the marriott family”
text: Stayed two nights in early Feb. Great lobby and dinning area. Staff was very attentive from the tme i stepped out of my car. Rooms are well appointed with seperate whirlpool tub and shower. Hotel is a bit isolated, but the have a great shuttle (suburban) that will run you to local dinning and entertainment. Overall a very good stay

title: “Boutique Hotel”
text: I would say this hotel is best for those who like "boutique" hotels with old world decor and ambiance. It's likely not for the business traveler though they do offer a shuttle to downtown business locales. Valet parking only is available on premises and cost about $30/night. My wife and I both arrived in separate cars due to different business obligations so $60/night was quite a penny to pay for parking. Paid lot and and metered parking is available off property but it's not convenient as none allows you to pay for 24-hour increments. If you're not willing to get up at 5 a.m. to pay for the "day parking", you'll get ticketed or booted. I was disappointed that even with utilizing the valet, no one offered to assist with our luggage. Two young strapping guys there just watched as my wife and I struggle to get into the lobby in order to check in.

title: “Birthday bliss”
text: Hotel Sorella for my birthday. I absolutely love this hotel. The decor is hip, the location is great. Shopping and night life is just steps away. The one thing I don't like about this place are the vallet guys. They're quick to try to hustle the guests. Other than that, great place to take a staycation.

title: “Excellent hotel experience”
text: This hotel was fantastic! Modern and very pretty inside. Extremely quick check in and very clean rooms. The pool was small but nice and refreshing. We walked to Eddie V's and Yard House which were both fantastic as well. Great to have so many shopping and dining choices within walking distance.

title: “Lots to do and can walk to many things - shopping, good restaurants all within striking distance. Great rooms”
text: Lots to do and can walk to many things - shopping, good restaurants all within striking distance. Great rooms

title: “Nice getaway spot”
text: We stayed at the Sorella one night for a little b-day getaway on the recommendation of a good friend. I love the interior of the hotel and the decor, very pretty. Check in was fast and the desk attendant was very polite. The room was very roomy with modern decor. We decided to walk around the City Center area for a bit that afternoon...I guess I didn't realize how new the whole area is, but there are still very few retail stores occupying the spaces, however there are several restraunts, and there is still construction going on around the area. We decided to have a cupcake at Sweet and then a drink at Yard House. Later in the evening we walked over to Brio for dinner. The general area around the hotel outside was just swarming with people...and was still equally packed when we came back over 2 hours later after dinner...lots of kids running around too which I thought was strange since it was after 10pm and it doesn't strike me as a kid or family oriented area. After dinner we decided to go up the the hotel bar, the Monnalisa, for drinks and some live music. The music and drinks were great...but unfortunately we didn't stay too long because it was absolutely packed in there and there was no seating available by the time we got there...very little offered to begin with. We would have been ok to stand for a while and enjoy the music, but for some reason there is a large fire pit in the center of the room. While it looks really cool, it's still fire and it really heated the place up! That heat combined with the muggy and hot Houston air flowing in and out as people walked out onto the patio just made it uncomfortable in there. Next time I'll make sure we get there early so we can get a table...far away from the fire! We weren't ready to turn in for the night so decided to go over to the large lounge area near the lobby...there was ample seating there inside as well as outside and only a few people over there. We ended up sitting for a while on the patio (2nd floor) and people watched below. When we returned to our room we found a bottle of champagne waiting for us on ice! Neither one of us ordered it and there wasn't a note (and we weren't charged for it) so I'm assuming it was just a gift from the hotel...Nice :) I do have to say that the walls are paper thin. I was unfortunately kept up several hours throughout the night because of some drunken fools banging and screaming. From what I could hear, I believe they were asked to keep it down several times either by hotel staff or other guests, but that seemed to only fuel their behavior. So, while the bad behavior of others certainly isn't the hotel's fault, the walls provided VERY little noise buffer! I booked the room package that included sunday brunch at the hotel restaurant, Bistro Alex. The food and service here are great. I highly recommend this package for the value. The brunch included in the package is not buffet, but on a normal menu and you can just order to your content as many courses as you like...even dessert! One adult beverage per person is included too. I recommend the steak migas...soooo good! There were also musicians playing jazz music throughout brunch with was great! Also, we did not use the pool, but walked by it several times and were surprised at how super-tiny it is! the lounges by the pool look really nice, but I was just really surprised at how small the area is as well as the pool itself. If you are planning on some pool time during your stay, I'd get down there early to claim a spot! All in all, we had a good expreience, minus the noisy drunk idiots of course, and will definitely consider this hotel again.

title: “I Love the Sorella!”
text: My husband and I stayed at the Sorella for the second time for a weekend getaway, and it was just as amazing the 2nd time around as our 1st stay. The rooms are extremely clean and the staff are very polite and professional!

title: “So Many Freebies!”
text:
We stayed at Drury Inn & Suites on Friday, August 6th. This was our first time staying with this hotel and we were more than impressed. After check-in, we grabbed a complimentary soda and a bag of freshly popped popcorn. It hit the spot after our drive from San Antonio.
We took advantage of the complimentary 5:30 Kickback and enjoyed hot dogs, chili, chips, and our 3 drinks. Considering it was all included in our very low e-saver rate, it was a terrific value.
The included hot breakfast in the a.m. was also great. Scrambled eggs, sausage, french toast, fruit, biscuits and gravy, and so much more. We saved $$ by eating both dinner and breakfast here.
The staff was all very friendly and made sure everyone was happy and taken care of. We also learned this hotel chain is pet friendly (no fees) and will definitely be bringing our dog along for the trip next time.

title: “A really good hotel”
text: I'm member of Hilton and normally I just stayed on Hilton Families Hotel but I stayed here because they gave the state rate that I needed. This Drury's certainly is a gem. The only thing I didn't like from this hotel was the decoration style (all flowery and hard fabrics), everything else was really good. I would recommend this hotel without a doubt

title: “Awesome Experience”
text: I took my family on a trip to Houston to enjoy a family fun weekend . I decided due to my recent stay at a Drury in San Antonio that a Drury Hotel was the way to go. I was not dissappointed. The hotel was located within minutes to so many fun things. We had two rooms beside each other on the fifth floor. My grandkids aged 7 and 5 loved the pool and hot tub.
