It was not a huge Hotel but the staff and cleanliness made it a great stay. The happy hour food was a huge plus too. Who doesnt like hotdogs, nachos, popcorn and drinks ? Especially kids. Breakfast was great too. We made waffles and everyone had a huge variety of many other breakfast foods . The price ?????? It couldnt have been better for our budget..FREE. I would stay here again and again and will always find a Drury whereever we travel.

title: “Business Travelers Friend”
text: Stayed at this hotel while on a business trip. Services include free high speed internet, complimentary breakfast buffet (real breakfast), free cocktails between 5 and 7. Really close to the galleria mall, surprisingly quite being so close to the interstate. Nice sized rooms with adequate workspace. Fitness center with flat screen TV, great pool, can swim from inside to outside, pool closes a tad bit early, but still great.

title: “Excellent customer service and value”
text:
I have stayed here for business travel for several years. The staff always make me feel welcome, and are attentive to my needs. The front desk staff are particularly pleasant and helpful. Henry did a great job and Rita and Rizwan and always ready to make things right if you experience any problems.
The hotel itself is a little old, but the bedding is always very comfortable and a good nights rest is guaranteed. It is a good idea to be on a higher floor during weekend when the conference and ballroom facilities may be in use. They also have a 'quiet' floor where guests are asked to refrain from loud TV etc. The rooms are spacious and clean. I expect to keep coming here often in the future

title: “Service excellence”
text: I just wnated to say what an excellent experience I had at the Crowne Plaza Houston.The customer service was above and beyond on any request I made during my four day visit. Crystal and Rita were the catalyst to make me feel at home with their beautiful smiles and professional attitudes to match. Adam and Henry also did an excellent job to make my visit an enjoyable, memorable visit. Rizwan Marfani added more excellence to the visit by being knowledgeable about various topics concerning Houston and the hotel. I feel this is a true reflection of the hotel leadership and the expectations followed by all who work for them. The overall "down to earth" attitude of all the staff mentioned makes me look forward to coming back again and again. Thanks for a great and fun experience.

title: “Started out nice, went downhill fast.”
text:
This hotel has been here, I think, longer than I've been alive. I remember seeing it when I was a little kid, so I wasn't expecting a 5-Star quality resort. I had middle of the road expectations, and when I got to the property, at first, my expectations were met. 
I was originally placed on the 9th floor (known as the quiet floor... I have no idea what that means).. but priority rewards member.. free upgrade to club level. Aw, the club floor perks dont run on Friday. Oh well. 
Was in room 200. It's a nice, large room. The bed was very firm and comfortable, the linens fresh and clean. 
This particular room had been upgraded to a more modern television, but I soon learned this made no difference because the signal to the television was analog, so it took a 4:3 image and just stretched it to 16:9, all in glorious 480i resolution. There was an HBO guide in my room, but I couldn't find HBO on my TV, and unlike ANY other hotel I've stayed in, there was no TV Channel guide in the room. I was on my own blindly looking for channels. 
The internet is slow as you can see by my screenshot. I'd guess they have just one 1.5mbps T1 based on the bandwidth I was seeing. They really need to upgrade their circuit. 
There were some minor cleanliness issues with the room (see photos). There was black mold growing on the caulking in the tub. That was kinda gross. 
I ordered room service. They forgot the bacon on my hickory burger. I was hungry and just ate it anyway because I didn't want to wait any longer. Sadly, after I ate the burger I learned from click2houston.com that the crown plaza has had an amazing 33 health code violations from the city of houston health department for 2012 so far. Eeek. That's the 5th worst report in the entire city according to their list. Really, you can go there and read all the violations. 
The staff at the hotel, is amazingly friendly and helpful. They really make the property.
You absolutely want to stay in the tower, and not the "courtyard rooms". The courtyard rooms look like it'd be like staying in a motel, with the rooms opening up to the exterior instead of the interior hallways. 
My room had a fairly nice Timex alarm clock with AUX input (for mp3 player) and had built in wave/rain/white noise sounds you could listen to. 
There was a giant spider living above room 218. (See pic). 
But the thing that made my visit the absolute worst visit of any visit to any hotel ever: when I first got to the hotel, it was very quiet. But then suddenly, a ton of people show up for an event in the ballroom, based on what I saw, I assume it was a Quinceañera. And they had a DJ. And the event went on. And on. And on. And you could hear it pretty much all over the hotel. And there were people out in the pool and hottub even after it was supposed to have been closed. And they were making noise. Front desk called security, but he apparently did nothing. They were in the pool for at least an hour after that. At nearly 1:00AM I can STILL hear the music blaring from the event. I go to the front desk, and they offer to move me to room 910. I go up to 910, and there are ants crawling around everywhere. I go back to the front desk, and they offer to move me another, but smaller room on the 9th floor. Whatever... its late, and I'm tired. I go back down to the 2nd floor to get my stuff, and its now 1:45AM. Thankfully, the music has stopped. I tell the front desk I'm just going to stay in 200, put the do not disturb on the door, and finally go to sleep. At 8:30AM-ish, housekeeping knocks on the door and tries to get in, waking me up. 
The bathroom is VERY tiny. 
The air conditioner barely was able to keep the room adequately cool. It was no louder than any other hotel a/c unit I've encountered. 
The faucet sink dripped all night, and I could not get it to shut off. 
Had the event not kept me up all evening, I would have put up with the few dirty things I saw and just dealt with it. I would have felt entirely ripped off if I had paid full price. Thankfully, I got a cheap deal on hotwire.com. 
After last nights experience, I probably would not stay at this property again. I agree, this property needs an upgrade. But again, the hotel staff is very, very nice.

title: “Good stay, clean, but not so good neighborhood”
text:
The La Quinta in Houston, Texas on Normandy, St is a very nice LQ Inns and Suites, however, the neighborhood is not so nice.
Sirens all night, lots of shady/shabby looking houses, building, people in the area. It is on I-10 on the east side of Houston...not the greatest part of town. However, it was very close where I needed to go and had good ratings as a nice, clean property...which it is.
The check in was quick, friendly. The room was clean, smelled good and the beds were warm, soft and I slept ok, considering the sirens and such.
The property does have a security fence around it, however it is not gated. They do employee a security guard and that does help.
The breakfast was ok, typical LQ with mega starch/carbs combo. I was in a hurry, so I did eat there. 
Park your vehicle in front in the lighted area. Don't venture off the property after dark.
All went well during the stay, I would stay again if needed on the east side of Houston.

title: “Nice stay”
text: Was in town to work on a Habitat project nearby. Decided to stay in a hotel rather than having to fight early morning traffic from the west side of Houston. Chose this La Quinta based on reviews and price. Nice, clean hotel, although the hotel had a strange smell in the halls. It may have been new carpet or something. We did have an initial problem with service at the front desk when we arrived and after waiting a while had to actually call the hotel to get a response. The clerk claimed to be having problems of some kind, but once we were checked in our stay was fine. Breakfast was very good and the attendants were pleasant and helpful. This La Quinta is nice and our stay was pleasant. If you need to stay on the east side of Houston near Interstate 10 and want a nice, comfortable room at a good price, then I recommend this hotel.

title: “Very Satisfied and can recommend highly”
text:
I planned a one-night visit to Houston, TX for business. My meeting was located only about a mile from this LaQuinta (there is another LaQuinta located only about a mile to the west), and I saw the great reviews on this site, so I decided to stay here. It was great. 
The rooms were clean, comfortable, and business-friendly. The front-desk staff and other employees were overly friendly. The free breakfast in the morning was very good. An excellent bargain, and I would not hesitate to stay here in the future. 
Final note: The hotel is located about 25 minutes from Hobby Airport and about 35-40 from Bush International.

title: “Best La Quinta in Houston”
text:
Should you ever need to stay on the east side of Houston just off I-10 and 15 minutes from downtown (depending on the time of day), this is currently the best choice. La Quinta Normandy is very new. As a result, so are all the fixtures, carpet, TVs, luxurious King beds, bathrooms and so on. For a budget hotel, this place is positively luxurious.
The pool was clean, the breakfast decent for being included (eggs, bacon or sausage, along with fruit, cereal, bread, bagels etc) and the staff was friendly and helpful. I cannot think of anything that wasn't right with this place, right down to the microwave and bar fridge in every room. A great bargain!

title: “Enjoyable stay in Houston”
text: A very comfortable and elegant hotel. The facilities (at least those I used) were excellent.

title: “Conference”
text:
$30 taxi trip from Hobby. Hotel has a shuttle that'll take you anywhere within 3miles. It's a short (2-3 blocks) walk to shops, food court, House of Blues, Macy's and the tunnels.
Make sure you go to the Flying Saucer. 
Ninfa's on Navigation was excellent. Try a Beerarita.
Food served at the conference was also surprisingly good.

title: “Wished we had stayed elsewhere.”
text:
We spent 4 days at the Hilton of the Americas. Within 30 minutes of our arrival we wished we had stayed elsewhere and it was downhill from there. 
On our arrival we were practically accosted by the valet folks demanding our keys and grabbing our luggage. Valet parking was $30.00 a night. Self parking at the attached garage was $15.00, with in and out privileges. 
The front desk did not have my reservation for an handicapped accessible room. The were able to assign us to and equipped room which looked out over the roof and the next building. I will say the bed was comfortable, but the room needed some repair - the right faucet on the sink was loose and moved around. The concierge person pointed us to only high end Restaurants - 3 blocks away from the hotel. We ate elsewhere as the prices for eating at the hotel were ghastly expensive: 1 pork chop was $61.
The Breakfast Buffet was ok and service was ok we ate there 2 mornings before the convention. 
After the second day, we tried to get a beer at the Café Bar in the Hotel. There was only one server. It took over 45 minutes to get a beer and longer to get food. We were told the kitchen was busy.
After the third day we decided to eat at the Café. Again there was a shortage of servers and a long wait for our food. We were told the kitchen was busy. More than half of the café was closed off. Our food was acceptable; my pasta dish was bland and tepid. The hotel was out of the local Houston beer, having only beer from "ALEC" member brewers. 
We were told we would not get a printed bill, but we did get one before we checked out. In the middle of the bill was a charge for Valet Parking: $30.00. This was corrected by the front desk, at our request.
My husband requested a bell person and a cart and was told, rather arrogantly it would be more than 30 minutes as they were busy. We carried our own luggage. While my husband was making the first trip to the car with our luggage, I got a call saying the porter was on his way up - I said no thanks and the a porter knocked on our door.
Wish we had stayed elsewhere.

title: “My Second Home”
text: I come to this hotel every week, and I always feel welcome. The service is stellar. The rooms are nice. And the breakfast is phenomenal. Also, the cook at night is great. He's very talented and always open to "customizing" something on the menu to fit your tastes. The bartender is friendly and super helpful. The breakfast staff is great. The front desk staff is very welcoming. I can't say enough about this place. Highly recommended.

title: “I'll be staying at this Garden Inn again next week”
text:
I have been staying at this hotel on a weekly basis since shortly after it opened. Had been staying about 1/2 mile down the road at Hampton Inn and watched it being built with great interest. It is a big step up. Great sleep number beds. Woulderful breakfast. The evening food service had a very rocky start (bar is fine), but it is improving.Nice pool, business/computer room and work out room. I could stay most any place I like in this area and I choose this hotel.
Only problem is that is it not right on the frontage road and the sign is a little small so the unfamiliar could easily pass it up. Trun just before the Hummer dealer

title: “great hotel in mid-town manhattan”
text: stayed here for a week with wife & 2 teenagers July 2012. Lots of reviews of manhattan hotels report small rooms - not this place. I travel a reasonable amount with work, mostly around europe, the rooms were no smaller than average in my opinion, and immaculately furnished and clean. staff very friendly. Only used the restaurant once, every morning we left the hotel, turned right and had breakfast in the (24 hour) deli on the corner of the next block - excellent fresh food for approx. a third of the price of the hotel breakfast. also useful for late night cups of tea. great location, leave hotel turn left 3 mins to Macys, 5 mins to times sq. Leave hotel turn right 20 mins to the village etc. Free wifi if you register with Kimpton via their website

title: “Perfect Choice”
text:
I travelled to Manhattan for a week with my boyfriend last september and as a first time visitor to NYC I spent a long time looking for the right hotel for our trip. In the end we had a couple of choices and booked the Eventi based mainly on the great reviews on Trip Advisor....and it lived up to all expectation! On arrival we were greeted by lovely staff who kindly upgraded us to a high floor room - much to our delight. The room was lovely, with amazing view. The huge bed was so comfortable and judging by other NYC hotels we looked at, the rooms were very spacious. It was cleaned every day and when I called reception for extra towels and hair straightners (as mine did not work) they were happy to help and had them at the room in minutes. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and when we asked for advice on transport, tickets for baseball and restaurant recomendations they were albe to give us all the help we needed and all with a smile! 
We ordered room service on one occasion which was a little pricey but you are in NYC and you are paying Hotel prices so that is to be expected....it was delicious! I would definately have ordered more had there not been so many amazing places to eat close by. The hotel also left a bottle of bubby and cupcakes to celebrate my birthday while we were there.... a lovely touch!
The location of the Eventi is fantastic. With it being our first visit we wanted to explore as much of Manhattan as possible and the Eventi was ideal for this. It is central to everything you want to see as a tourist and the local area is great. We caught the train to Penn station from the Airport which cost us $12 instead of paying upwards of $60 for a taxi and when we arrived it took us less than 10 mins to walk from the station to the hotel, even with our suitcases! 
We were so impressed with the Eventi we have actually booked to stay here again when we return this December. Not something we would normally do as we prefer to try new places but we couldnt think of a single reason not to!

title: “Perfect Downtown Location”
text:
Went there for business & weekend in July.
The hotel is perfectly located in Manhattan @ 6th&31st close to Times Square, Madison Square garden, the posh 5th Ave, Gramercy park, Empire State Bldg, Flatiron Bldg & adjacent Park, etc. Not the cleanest area in the city but very close to all major (very touristy indeed) attractions.
Very elegant, chilldown setting & layout (3rd floor lounge, an excellent relaxation spot). The fresh, frutty scented water offered complimentary to guests in the lobby, a nice & classy touch. Free wine & cheese tasting in the afternoons in the lobby is another good idea from the management. As expected, the property was spotless clean (quite contrasting with the neighbourhoods...).
The rooms we stayed in was rather small, yet it featured a relative large & well appointed bathroom, well insulated windows that kept away the noise & bustle of the 6th we were facing (East).
Excellent bed.
Kind of noisy A/C. it would blow soundly a strong flow of air at regulate intervals to maintain the temp we had set that made a strong contrast with the tranquility in the room. This would go on & off every 2-3 min or so which was kind of upsetting, especially at night, so we had to turn it off to sleep well although it was a terribly hot & humid weather.
Breakfast was optional but very, very good. Excellent selection of berries, btw!
The hotel had a couple of restaurants, we tried one of them, very good. we enjoyed particularly the outdoor terraces it featured, another surprising feature of this hotel's layout.
Staff was nice, courteous, smiling happy and above all, efficient. But then again it is the American service stdd I got used every time I travel to the US.
All in all a good experience and would definitely recommend the hotel for business or leisure.

title: “Great location, great service!”
text:
Perfect location for my business needs, super smooth check-in, fantastic room. Become a part of the Kimpton In Touch loyalty program (free) for wifi at no cost, a 'raid the mini bar' coupon and know the secret password (by connecting on facebook or twitter) for an extra special welcome when you get to the hotel. (My extra special welcome was a bottle of wine in the room when I returned for the day!)
Electrical outlets aplenty, great desk, clean, large bathroom. Everything I need to be happy in a hotel (well that and fantastic pillows, a smoke-free room and blackout drapes - they have all of that...)
A great room is always made better by great service and Victoria at the front desk made my arrival super special (and she found a Mac Book charger to loan when I realized I left mine on the train.)
All in all, great price, near everything you want to visit, terrific property and lovely service.

title: “THE BEST NYC Hotel!!”
text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Chatwal over the Easter weekend. I happened upon the Chatwal and am so glad I did. This hotel is nothing short of wonderful...the staff, the ambience, the location......everything perfect! Having stayed in many of Manhattan's finest, from chain hotels to boutiques, I can say with confidence that the Chatwal beats them all, hands down. It is truly lovely. And, when we checked in they gave us an upgrade to a deluxe king room. We will always check the Chatwal's availability first when visiting the city!

title: “New York break”
text:
We were on a round the world trip from Australia and as an SPG member I usually stay at member hotels. The chatwal is a beautiful newly restored art deco hotel just off times square. It's location is fantastic ands is on a quite side street so is perfectly quiet.
The staff were faultless and their customer service spot on. We had a suite and it was lovely. The barthroom was the highlight, beautiful black marble and large rain shower. The bed was fantastically comfortable and we loved the ability to control the lights, temperature and curtains from the touchpad buy the bed. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel to people wanting to have a quiet retreat in the heart of it all.
Dr Helen willcock

title: “First Class Experience”
text:
There is little, if anything, not to like about this hotel. Cordial and hepful staff, outstanding room decor and comfort, quiet location just steps from Times Square. High-tech touches abound in this art deco masterpiece. Lobby bar plus a 2nd Floor lounge that overlooks 44th Street. Bathrooms are to be experienced, not visited. The Lamb's Club restaurant is excellent, and a small, well equipped fitness room, spa, indoor pool and hot tub round out your on-site options. Wi-Fi is on the house as it should be. 
I prefer The Chatwal to the Four Seasons and the New York Palace, both top properties but each lacking the "boutique" charm and warmth that you find here. If you like high-class, high-tech, high-touch without the attitude, The Chatwal is a smart choice.

title: “Better late than never review!”
text:
This is a little late review from my stay way back in Dec 2011. Service was superb! I called engineering to bring a DVD player and it was quickly delivered in the room. Room service was outstanding! I remember having the halibut placed in a small lecreuset like cute little dutch oven, it was very good. I also dined in at Al Fiori and had the sea bass while my friend had the poached lobster. Both were outstanding! 
Maserati service car was able to take me to Chinatown. When I was leaving, the doorman was having difficulty searching a cab, but instead of having me wait, he walked 2 blocks to catch a cab and had it drove up front to the hotel to pick me up. Now that is great service!

title: “Excellent Service”
text: We spend four nights in NYC and picked the Setai for the first time. We liked everything of this hotel. The rooms are well decorated and comfortable, the service is impeccable. I like hotels in which they dont charge you extra for things like internet access and courtesy car service, water at turndown, etc. The gym is very well equipped and has everything you need for a good workout. The lobby bar is fun with nightly jazz live music. And the location is as good as you can get. So we will most likely make this one of our top choices when going back to NYC

title: “Disapointed!!!!”
text: we recently stayed for a week in early june, huge dispointment. first they put as in a tiny room with view to a construccion site. after speaking to the receptionist they moved us to a betterwroom, without view but at least it had a decent size. the breakfast was terrible, we had dinner at their restaurant one night and the food was not good. the location is good and the people who work there is very nice, but i can not see it as a five star hotel. i can not understand all the praises.

title: “WOW!”
text:
What a wonderful hotel. The personal assistants will make certan that all of your requests are taken care of. The beds are not my favorites as they are low to the floor and at times a bit uncomfortable.
t

title: “WOW!!”
text: Amazing! Love this place!! Staff is great the people that stay here are so friendly and all around amazing folks!!! Such class and very fantastic!! Very Modern as well so it is good on the eye! They will assist you with anything you need, I stayed here when i first moved to NYC looking for a place. And it felt like home I wish i coudl have rented a room here monthly! HA

title: “great hotel for business or vacation!”
text: I travel to NY very often and like staying at different hotel every once in a while. I was very pleased at Andaz and will be staying here as long as they have rooms available every time i go to NY. Great central location but you're not in the craziniess of Times Square. Room sizes are large for NY standards. I loved the free mini bar (not including alcoholic beverages though!) Still it's nice to be able to drink a bottled water knowing it won't cost you $10!

title: “Great neighbourhood hotel”
text: We really enjoyed the space in this hotel and the very comfortable beds.The nearest subway stop was within easy walking distance and made it a pleasure to visit any tourisr sites. Would definately return to the Beacon for a further New York visit.

title: “We loved this hotel and WILL be returning”
text: Stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our trip of a lifetime. It was recommended by a close friend. Rooms were a great size for New York. the Subway was a 3 minute walk away as was the Natural history museum. Central park close by. Lots of restaurants and good shopping close by. Hotel staff were great. Even though there was work on our floor, it didn't affect our stay. Really can't say anything bad about this hotel and it was a home away from home.

title: “Upper West Side Gem!”
text: This is my 2nd stay at the Hotel Beacon. I particularly like it because: (1) Great neighborhood (2) rooms are more like apartments (3) great location. The Hotel Beacon is near a number of convenient subway stations which will take you anywhere you want to go. The neighborhood is very nice, quiet and very safe. The room was very good - and included a small kitchenette, a living room, tons of closet space, and a comfortable bedroom. The hotel also has free wifi. Another very very good stay at Hotel Beacon!

title: “AMAZING PLACE TO STAY!!!!”
text: Great hotel, rooms are awesome, the staff are the best, from the courtesy driver to the front desk to, especially, the maids. This hotel brings a whole new level to customer service. Everyone from our company had the same wonderful experience!

title: “Not 5 stars, but nice”
text:
Im not sure how this hotel is rated 5 stars. It seemed like an average 4 star to me. I guess its more of a legacy rating.
This hotel has a beautiful driveway and entrance. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were just average. However, the beds were VERY comfortable.
I have to say, we came in after a late night and ordered room services. Very overpriced and mediocre at best. The tortilla soup was like a tomato soup instead of chicken based and had little flavor. The club sandwich was ok, but had way too much egg on it. Egg seemed to be all I could taste. My gf got a hamburger and she said it was dry.

title: “Our wedding at the Fourseasons”
text: We had our wedding at the fourseasons just couple of weeks ago. It was the best experience ever! We were treated wonderfully. The staff were excellent and accommodating. The food was delicious and everyone had a wonderful time. I would recommend the fourseasons of Houston to anyone.

title: “Not for business traveler - maybe when I'm more relaxed”
text:
I was puzzled by the positive reviews on Trip advisor for this hotel. Then after reading them again after I stayed here for 5 nights it occured to me that most travelers must be in a very relaxed state of mind when they stay here. When I travel on business I put in 10-12 hrs days regularly. As such quality service and efficiency matter to me. When vacationing I typically have a higher tolerance for poor service, less quality food, and the like. So I will not stay again at this hotel. I'll list my likes and dislikes .
Likes: Architecture is historic. Rooms comfortable and quiet, well equiped. The transportation shuttle service. Excellent offering and a life saver given the seedy character and deserted streets in Downtown (at least when it is after 6 pm.) Rooms are large and the bathroom is fabulous and even larger. Love the tub and shower. Quality ammentities. TV is large and has High definition channels. Maintenance was responsive and professional
Dislikes: Food at restaurant : Unhealthy, over priced, Incredible slow service, servers and bar personnel are more interested in talking with each other than servicing the guests Took 25 min for soup and salad at 9:30 pm. Soup was luke warm --I guess the microwave was not working since it would not pass a kitchen inspection if served this temp. Likely kept in the fridge and microwaved to heat up. If on a diet this is not the place to eat...except for salads Ordered a cucumber and tomatoe salad. Not exagerating 20 min to recieve and Approx 1/4 of a tomato, 1/8 of a cucumber, 3 bits of feta cheese , 1 slice of onion, a couple bits of shredded mint and maybe 20 pepitas . and I added 2 shrimp This very very small salad cost 13 $. 1/2 cup of soup was $7. I'm a lite eater and I left very hungry. Front Desk personnel are inconsistent. Ranged from excellent to disinterested.

title: “Service”
text: I was only here for one night and, when I checked out , I forgot an item in my room. The Director of Housekeeping went above and beyond to see that it was mailed to me at my home which is quite far from Houston.

title: “Eclectic and Cozy”
text: I stayed here on business and I was pleasantly surprised with the decor. The lobby has a bank vault behind the front desk which is over 100 years old that was saved from the original structure. The rooms are spacious with comfortable bedding and the bathrooms have a separate shower and tub. I usually stay near the Galleria and I do prefer that location better, but if you have to stay in the downtown area this is the hotel I'd recommend.

title: “Jacuzzi with a (tv) view!”
text:
Chose this hotel because of location, downtown Houston, and because I wanted a nice, cozy, warm hotel as I had to spend a full day basically to watch the NFL playoffs on a Sunday after having gone to the Texans game on saturday.
Being a Marriott Gold member, I was upgraded to a nicer room, which had a fantastic Jacuzzi tub with a window panel that opened on the room and allowed me to watch the game on an HDTV flat 30" screen while enjoying the Jacuzzi!
Rom service was excellent but the filet at the restaurant was amazing!
Staff went out of their way to nake you feel at home.
Overall just a fantastic experience.

title: “Perfect Getaway Spot in Houston”
text: My husband and I like to take mini vacations at high end hotels and resorts in the area-- less cost because of the greatly reduced transportation expense and a chance to be pampered. At a friend's recommendation we booked the Sorella in the City Center area of Houston. It's a sleek hotel, refined lines, excellent beds, nice towels and bathrobes and from some rooms a great view. Nice pool, great deck chairs but a very small area and a tiny pool. Parking is valet or self. We tried the Brennan's cafe in the hotel and had a nice flat bread appetizer and a great martini-- service was friendly but slow. Great restaurants nearby and interesting shops. The room was only $179 per night. We'll go back soon!

title: “4th of July City Centre Fireworks”
text: Got a Deluxe Room facing the "green" to watch the 4th of July Fireworks. Although the fireworks show only last 10 minutes, the hotel room was worth it. Beautifully clean and modern. The kids enjoyed swimming, but I wish the kids were not kicked out of the pool at 9pm. We would have enjoyed watching the fireworks from the pool area.

title: “Excellent 3 Star Hotel”
text:
I stayed at the Drury in St Louis near the arch and was blown away at the value, quality, amenities and service. The Houston Galleria property doesn't quite compare to that, but it is a wonderful place nonetheless. 
As with all Drury Inn's you will be impressed at the complimentary items such as breakfast (it's a full on meal, not just continental); free snacks and drinks in the afternoon; free wi-fi; free cable tv; free parking; and more.
The hotel is located within 1 mile of Galleria Mall on Westheimer Road. In a car, about 5 minutes; about 15 minutes walk.
The rooms are tidy, well appointed and modern.
My only complaint (it's a small one) is the lack of an in-room safe.
Drury Inn is setting the standard for mid-class hotels.

title: “Great location and food”
text:
Kids loved the indoor/outdoor pool. Food was good for breakfast and good for evening meal especially with kids(meatballs, baked potato, salad, chicken fingers).
Room smelled like smoke even though it was a non smoking room. Staff was extremely helpful with suggestions and directions.
Problems with elevators working. Also kids were playing games on the business center computers and shouldn't have been allowed to do that if it is a business center

title: “Druury Inn's are great........just watch out for highway noise!”
text: The Drury Inn's are my favorite hotel chain. I've stayed at probably 6 or more in the last year or two. They are new, clean, staff is always great, evening snack hour could be a meal, breakfast is always fresh and varied. The only complaint is the road noise if your room faces the Interstate. Ask about it first; sometimes all of the king bed rooms face the Interstate. And...............they are all pet friendly!

title: “Great stay at Drury Inn”
text:
Recently my family had a formal event in Houston. We have never stayed in a Drury Inn but decided to give it a try because it was near the site of the formal event. This hotel provided us a wonderful experience. The management was extraordinary. They were there for us and even knew our names before we left after three days. The location was perfect ~ very near the Galleria, near an interstate with easy access and provided easy parking for us. The room was clean and provided a pleasant atmosphere. My only suggestion for the Drury Inns would be an update in bedding.
If you are looking for a reasonably priced, clean, great for the family atmosphere , and great ammenities~ this is the place for you.

title: “Crowne Plaza Brookhollow Excellent Service”
text: Over the last few years I have stayed many times at the Crowne Plaza In Houston just off of highway 290. The service is about the best I have seen for a hotel, comparable to any high quality resort, The people at the desk really try to go above and beyond, Henry always makes sure that I have my prioity club rewards each day and has chased down the shuttle in the evening to run me over to the restaurants accross the street, always trying to make sure I have everything I need, he is a real proffesional. The rooms have always been clean and in good working order and Barbara has set up an excellent corporate rate package deal for our company that cant be beat. The whole staff is very friendly and makes the stay very enjoyable, I highly recommend that you stay at this hotel when you need to visit Houston.

title: “We Loved it!”
text: We just checked out of the hotel. I was a bit worried at first because of some reviews. I called to make some room requests and was very impressed with the service over the phone. When we arrived, I needed to make other changes. Mr. Henry Strait took care of us and was so kind and personable. He handled several requests for us during our stay and went above and beyond. Probably one of my favorite front desk guys EVER! Loved the pool area too. Great place to stay :)

title: “Needs upgrade”
text: I've been staying at this hotel over the last 6 years or so and have always enjoyed it up until recently. Everyone is very friendly but the last room I had wasn't up to scratch even though I am a Priority Club member. The air conditioning unit was very loud, the toilet bowl hadn't been cleaned when I checked into the room, they did come and clean it. The cleaning staff never seem to change the time on the electronic digit alarm clocks. The resturant menu hasn't changed in years and is not open in the evenings. You have to eat in the bar area. There are however, many restuarants close by and the courteousy bus will take you to them and pick you up after. All rooms are large but there is no refrigerator or microwave. There is a coffee maker in each room. Swimming pool is outdoor and a good size. I'll probably continue to stay here as it's close to one of my offices, my company get good rates and I get the reward points, if not for that I would probably change hotel in the future.

title: “Courtesy”
text: I stopped in because I had to get internet access and announceed myself to the front desk, Henry Straub. He was courteous and recognized me as a gold card member, asked if I needed anything and offered me a bottle of water. I appreciated his help and thought it very courteous.

title: “The staff was excellent and professional!”
text: The staff went put of their way to make my stay excellent. The rooms were updated and very clean. The shittle service was good and the drivers excellent.

title: “Just Okay”
text:
I stayed here for work and it was ample, but far from nice. The hotel exterior is especially unsightly for the Galleria area - it looks like the hotel was built in the 1970s. The inside was somewhat nicer, but still nothing exciting. A previous reviewer had commented that there was all new furniture, but if this is true, I couldn't tell. 
I stayed in a room with two double beds and it was incredibly cramped. The room had a huge over-sized recliner that I could have done without, since it left nowhere to store my suitcase. Luckily I was traveling for work and I only needed one bed, so I had my suitcase on the bed I wasn't sleeping in. The rooms do have mini-fridges and microwaves, so that's a plus. 
The bathroom is an okay size, and they have the sink and vanity area separate from the toilet and bathtub, which is nice if you are traveling with multiple people. The complimentary toiletries leave something to be desired - they give you shampoo but no conditioner. 
The free breakfast was adequate, but the breakfast area is fairly small, so it was difficult to maneuver around at the same time as multiple other guests. There are also very few tables in the dining area, and the tables a very close together, so you have to be careful not to bump into them. A larger person would definitely have trouble getting around the tables. 
The free manager's reception in the evening is nice, although you are limited to three drinks, and the snacks consist of goldfish, pretzels, tortilla chips, salsa and processed cheese.
The pool is actually kind of nice - it's not huge, but it is partially indoors and partially outdoors, so you have a choice of swimming with or without sun.
All in all, it is an okay hotel. Nothing really special, but not horrible either.

title: “Nice Getaway”
text: The Hotel was super clean, nice modern-retro design, We stayed in the Jr. Suite. Pretty roomy, and pretty pricey! We called the front desk for a mini fridge and had it delivered to our room in about 10 minutes. The view was great from room 915. The free continental breakfast is fruit, cereal and a few pastries. The location is great, in the middle of city center houston. Check out time is noon. Overall it was a great two night stay.

title: “Our Second Home!”
text: We try to use any excuse to celebrate a weekend at Hotel Sorella. In fact, we only 2 miles from the hotel but lavish in the fact that it feels like it could be "anywhere" when we stay there! My favorite things are the pool, the Mona Lisa Bar that open onto the pool deck with wait service, Bistro Alex (Ask for Stephen), the modern Decor, the nice hotel staff, the pastries for breakfast, CityCenter, the shopping (Anthropologie), the movie theater (Studio Movie Grill) and Lifetime Fitness (w/Spa). My 7 year old also enjoys everything this hotel has to offer!

title: “Second stay at Sorella - better than the first.”
text: The Sorella is a nice, contemporary hotel. Quiet for hotel traveler. The area where it's located is developing nicely, walk to shops and restaurants, convenient for business traveler.

title: “I'm moving in.....”
text:
Love love love this hotel - I want to move in there. Unfortunately we only got to stay for one night but we'll be back! We stopped in Houston to stay over the night before leaving on a cruise the next day from Galveston. Beautiful rooms, incredible baths. The bedding on the beds is very high quality. I loved the weight of the comforter on the bed - really kept us warm - not like the flimsy excuses for comforters at other hotels that leave you freezing all night.
We had drinks and snacks (try the fries with lemon aioli!) in the bar downstairs on arrival and really enjoyed the ambiance of the lobby area. Later that night, we had dinner in the restaurant and the food was awesome. Room service breakfast the next morning was EXTREMELY fast - I ordered, hung up the phone, got in the tub and they were at the door!

title: “Icon, says it all. Thank you!!”
text:
Are stay was split between here and another Houston property during this visit and I have to say that this is a far better level of service. perhaps we expected different things of this beautiful little property but they didn't let us down.
Rooms: Well appointed and clean.
Food: Hot, flavorful and well portioned
Cost: Other than paying for valet (used to it), the value is well worth it.
Service: Leaps and bounds above several other properties.
Comments: There was a lot of buzz recently amongst the staff about the Marriott merger and I have to say they were all very poistive about it. I think it may have added to the positive nature that they extended to the guests.
I could see this being a great place for a romantic get away as well. Boutique style hotel, great management.

title: “Convenient & Totally Acceptable Hotel”
text: I stayed here for an event at the adjoining convention center, so in terms of convenience this place can't be beat. Skyways on the second and third floors connect the hotel to the convention center, meaning you don't even have to go outside into the Houston summer humidity to get around! Overall this hotel provides accommodation that is somewhere in the "averagely nice" range. The beds are comfortable, the TVs are actually HD and get very good picture, the toiletries are fairly high quality, and there are tea/coffee making facilities in the room along with a very large desk. The bar in the lobby is nice, and the food at The Cafe is decent if not overpriced. The major drawbacks to this hotel are 1) there's no free wi-fi in the rooms and 2) the desk staff are not very friendly. I was happy enough with my stay in this hotel, although if I could do it again I probably would have gone with the Embassy Suites across the street which has free wi-fi and continental breakfast.

title: “The walls are too thin”
text: Even though the rooms are very nice, the beds are very comfortable, and the view from the 17th floor where I was was amazing, we could hear what was going on in the next room. The Spa is nice but expensive and the pool is smaller than expected and its indoor only. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They are well trained for sure. Its always a busy hotel and the small shop at the ground floor is very nice as well. Unlike many other hotels in Downtown Houston, you can instantly find a taxi while staying at Hilton. Its connected to the convention center and very convenient if you have any conference or convention at the convention center across the street.

title: “Immer wieder”
text:
Dieses ist immer wieder eines meiner Favouriten in Houston - basierend auf Preis / Leistung.
Das Haus ist sehr sehr sauber, Top Zimmer im gewohnten Hilton Garden Inn Standard. Top Bett, Kaffeemaschine und Külschrank.
WIFI und PArken ist für umme.
Es gibt ein Business Center und ein Fitmess Raum.
Frühstück ist klasse - als HH Diamnond für umme, aber echt gut. Eier nach Bestellung zubereitet und der Rest vom Buffet.
Ein klares GO

title: “Empfehlenswert.”
text: Schöne Zimmer und sind sehr gut eingerichtet. Service was ausgezeichnet und das Hotel bietet viele extras, die ein Hilton halt bietet, gratis Internet, das auch relativ gute Qualität hatte. Das Frühstück für 10 Dollar war auch sehr gut. Es hat ein sehr gut ausgestattetes Fitness Raum, was sehr zu empfehlen ist, aber am besten morgens kommen, denn es füllt sich auch sehr schnell. Wie immer ist das Hilton zu empfehlen.

title: “Super”
text: Das Hotel ist nicht so leicht auf Anhieb zu finden (insbesondere die Einfahrt). Zimmer sind gross, sauber und gut eingerichtet. Der Fernseher ist ein grosser Plasma und Internet ist gratis und schnell. Badezimmer sauber, guter Wasserdruck mit verschiedenen Wasserstrahleinstellungen. Das beste am Hotel fanden wir das Businesscenter mit Fax, Kopiergerät und allen möglichen Utensilien für die tägliche Büroarbeit und das Bett. Das Personal war sehr freundlich und sehr zuvorkommend. Ich würde dieses Hotel sofort weiterempfehlen!

title: “Relaxing stay”
text: Had a comfortable and relaxing stay at the Chatwal. This NYC luxury hotel truly exudes class and sophistication from its interior appointments to the quality of customer service.

title: “Best Hotel in town”
text:
After a Really Bad experience at a another Hotel luxury hotel this Juwel saved our Trip to New York!
The Chatwal New York is definitely the best Hotel in town. Not only the beautiful and very luxurios Rooms and suites fit the highest standards of the Hotel Business but also the perfectly trained staff guarantees a unforgetable stay. From the front desk, the bellboys, the Concierge, the Butler to the Hotel Management, everybody Serves the Guest in a for New York very seldom Perfect manner. We will come back!

title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
text: My husband and I stayed at the Setai in early June. We treated ourselves to a really lovely hotel and we were not disappointed. Everything about this hotel were great - the room was big, the bed comfy, the service was outstanding, the food was good and was in a great location. It was our first time in NYC so we wanted to do all the touristy things and this was a great base. Can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

title: “Great People”
text: Rita was awesome - the whole staff was really great and helpful.

author.location: West Des Moines, Iowa, United States

title: “Are you serious??? This is a Crowne property??”
text: My girlfriend and I booked a room here as participants in a Kizomba weekend workshop. When we first arrived all seemed well, we were told our room would have a "poolside" view. Upon entering the room we noticed it was a bit warm but attributed it to the fact that most hotels turn down the thermostat when unoccupied. I went to turn it to "cooler" but the knob (yeah, I know right...) just spun and spun. I had to pull the knob off, replace it with a knob off of another control, then turn it to "cooler". While I was doing this my girlfriend was in the bathroom hustling to get ready for the workshop, and came out to tell me that their was hair in the tub! That tells me the housekeepers need a refresher course because in addition to hair in the tub, there was crumbs all over the floor. The ceiling in the main living area had black gunk all around the edges, looked like mildew, didn't want to know. The poolside view? Was of decaying palm trees, you couldn't see anything from the patio. The amenities advertised on the web site were non-existent, no microwave or mini-fridge. The tv was a 21" old school tube type that I haven't seen in years ANYWHERE! Being good sports since we already had unpacked and got the room at a great rate and trying to make the best of things, we stuck it out.....until the next day. I finally had to go complain at the front desk about the air conditioner not working, (it ran all day and all night and the room stayed temperate at best). We ended up having to move to the inside of the hotel, the tower, to floor #9. Immeadiately upon entering this room we could see that there is obviously a profiled system of room assignments. The majority of the guests for the Kizomba workshop are/were Latino or Black and were given rooms on the "outside" with the view of the pool probably at a discounted rate. Everyone of them we spoke to had the same complaints about the air conditioner, lack of amenities, type of tv, etc. The new room we were assigned had a 32" Samsung flat screen and the air conditioner was cold. This room was cleaner, had nicer linen and bed coverings, the bathroom was clean, etc. The best thing about this hotel was the pool which is spacious enough, clean, and not to deep. While at the pool I noticed the whirlpool wasn't working....imagine my suprise. I have to commend Crystal, she was working the front desk and handled my complaint with grace, quickness, and genuine concern. She arranged for staff to bring a luggage dolly to our room, pack our things, and deliver them to the new room while we had the complimentary breakfast buffet ($12 value per person x 3). She called later to say that the horrible hot night we spent there would be comped as well. I appreciate her service very much. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy or a homeless person even if it was free. There are other hotels in this area that I would suggest you look into before this place. We first selected it based on the brand (Crowne Plaza) and then convenience (the workshops held there), but were greatly disappointed. You will be too.

title: “CREDIT CARD LOST”
text: I lost my credit card a day before my trip to Houston, Texas. When I discovered that it was lost, I was really upset, but I knew I could immediately cancel it and replace it, so that was not a problem. The problem was, I had already booked a room at the Crowne Plaza Houston - Brookhollow with the card I lost and I would need the same credit card to check into the hotel. I didn't know what to do!!! I called the hotel and told them my dilema. At first I was told that I really needed that card because they needed it to secure it for any incidentals that may occur and without it I couldn't stay. I panicked! Well, Crystal, a hotel Representative, helped me to resolve this dilema in a very courteous, professional, and compassionate manner. Without me going into all the details, all I can say is this young lady went above and beyond to assist me and she should be commended for this. Keep up the good work Crystal!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone because of people like you working here and it's a beautiful and comfortable.

title: “High Quality for a Chain”
text: We'll be trying more Drury Hotels, after positive experiences at the Drury Galleria and at another Drury in San Antonio. My husband and I are recent retirees who love travelling around the US, and -- because we travel with our poodle -- we have become very familiar with the various hotel/motel chains. In this group, the Drurys that we have visited compare very well. The rooms were unusually comfortable and very clean (something that is not, unfortunately, always the case at chains). The staff was friendly and helpful, both when we made the reservation and during our stay. And the prices are highly competitive. We will be seeking out Drury Hotels in the furure.

title: “Decent for an overnight stay”
text: We needed a place to stay overnight in Houston that was pet friendly. Although the hotel wasn't new, it was clean and comfortable. The location was convenient. It works for an overnight stay, but I'm not sure if I'd want to stay there for an extended period of time on a vacation.

title: “Great all the way around”
text:
Went to Houston this past weekend to spend some time with friends. Drury Suites offered great location and price, clean and spacious rooms, and excellent customer service. 
Located conviniently near Galleria Mall. Need a car to get there or a cab will cost you just a few bucks.
The suite was very clean and spacious with 2 TVs, microwave and a mini-fridge. Breakfast buffet is complimentary and offered a very good selection of items.
Staff was very pleasant and always eager to assist. 
Overall, a great experience all the way around.
Will definetly stay again next time in Houston.

title: “Great, as always!”
text: We always stay at this Drury when we go to Houston. It is very clean and in the last several months was extensively updated with new furniture, new beds, etc. The free high speed internet worked great and the complimentary snacks/drinks each evening are a real plus. The breakfast is good and the breakfast staff keeps the area clean. The staff is very helpful, especially Raul. He always has a smile on his face and is happy to help. The GM, Keith, is also a top notch manager. My husband travels to Houston about once per month for business and the family goes with him when possible. We have never had a bad experience with this hotel. I promise you will not be disappointed!

title: “Very nice overall”
text:
Quite a bit from the downtown, but if you you're in the area there's probably no better place to stay. Very good value for money. The breakfasts however are fruits and cereal only, so if you after some eggs and bacon you may be suprised (it's a healthy option though).
Amazing indoor sports/fitness centre just around the corner ($ 15 for an entry).

title: “European-style hotel in Houston”
text: Most hotels in Houston are pretty boring: standard rooms and service, belonging to the big hotel chains and somewhere along a busy road. Not so with Sorella. The hotel has an eye for design and is located in a hot-spot pedestrian area with plenty of restaurants, shops and a movie theater at walking distance. The hotel offers a nice, complimentary breakfast. It has a small swimming pool, but that is more for decoration than for actual use. Fitness room in the hotel is small, but you can get access to a major fitness complex, two minutes away.

title: “Nice!”
text: Loved the hotel, nice room, great food at Bistro Alex, great band at Monnalisa bar, upscale and trendy atmosphere.

title: “MUST STAY”
text: Hotel Sorella is a beautiful modern and elegant hotel. The beds are sooooo comfortable and the rooms are very clean. The continental breakfast was really good. Everything is walking distance if you are looking for a good time. Plenty of pubs, a theatre where you can eat and drink, and great restaurants. Free parking available as well. You Must stay at this hotel whether you are coming to Houston or simply live in Houston and want to get a way because this is where you must go.

title: “One of the best hotels you'll ever stay in”
text:
Seriously, every time we have to travel through Houston we make a point of staying the night just to stay at the Icon. Sad isn't it but I'm a bit addicted to this hotel. From the red and gold valet parking station, the stunning lobby, beautiful bar and colonial style lifts your greeted with an excellently inviting opening design statement. 
We stay in the delux rooms (the are great deals to be had on this hotel on a weekend as its in the business district) which features a huge king sized bed and my favourite feature, the connected bathroom with louvre doors over the tub into the bedroom.
Every single feature has been thought out to perfection and the general style: European boutique meets cowboy burlesque is just the right side of delux and cosy. I've always found the staff to be more than helpful. never used the gym but I'm told it's lovely. Beer prices in the bar are a bit insane.
WARNING/TIP: don't think that because the Icon is smack dab in the middle of Houston's boring business district that thes nothing going on around here. An observant walk round the surrounding streets will reveal a buzzing little scene of cool cafes, cutting edge bars, a fabulous Mexican fast food joint just up the road, galleries, etc etc. If youre really stuck and want a quick bite to eat, there's also the tired looking Italian place on the corner that does a great early bird menu and has friendly staff.

title: “Good crew at this Crowne Plaza”
text: When one visits this Crowne Plaza, the first thing that impresses is the people. Henry, at the front desk, anchors the crew. He greets you with a genuine smile, and takes care of anything that may come up during your stay. The manager, Rizwan Marfani, adds his classy cool to the blend. Always a pleasure to stay here. The "happy hour" and breakfast are added bonuses, for the Priority Club members.

title: “great help from the front desk”
text:
This is my third time to be in Houston. However, when i took the shuttle bus from the airport to the crown plaza hotel in downtown Houston, they just drove my to another one and dropped me there.
I was helpless at the time since it was late in the evening and my host in Houston was not able to drive me back. But with the help from the front desk server, Henry Strait, i was able to get back to my hotel safe and sound and did not waste much time. He helped me out by offering me almost everything i needed and even called the cab for me. It was so nice to meet him when i jumped into trouble. Thanks Henry.

title: “Hotel Stay”
text: I came in to Houston at around 11pm with no place to stay. When I contacted Crowne Plaza Aurellia Gaskin answered the phone. I advised her of the situation I was in and despite the fact the hotel was basically at capacity she not only was able to find me a room but she also accommodated my girlfriend, her son and my dog!! I would recommend Crowne Plaza as the hotel itself is nice, but overall it’s the staff that truly makes the experience enjoyable. Employees such as Aurellia will keep me coming back to Crowne Plaza whenever I am in Houston, but even more so keep me loyal to Crowne plaza in general when I travel!!

title: “The best hotel experience I've ever had!!!”
text:
If there was ever a hotel that embodies hospitality, it would be the Crowne Plaza in Northwest-Brookhollow. 
I am a teacher in the Lubbock area but was going to be taking a special training course that would put me in Houston for 3 weeks. Not having any friends or family in the area to stay with, I used priceline.com to find a hotel that I could stay at for cheap. I was able to stay at the Crowne Plaza for an amazing $40 per night for 18 nights. It was the best home away from home I could have asked for. 
The most impressive feature of this hotel by far was the clientele. I probably spoke with every person who worked behind the front desk and they were all SUPER friendly and helpful. I have to give a shout-out to Henry, who checked me in with a warm welcome and a free membership into the Priority Club, which allowed me free breakfast every morning, and free drinks and finger foods in the evening. 
Speaking of the Priority Club food—it was delightful. Every morning they had pastries, fresh fruit, good coffee, assorted yogurts, cereal, juice, milk, bagels, English muffins, and bread for toast. The finger foods in the evening were surprisingly satisfying—always one hot item like onion rings, spring rolls, chicken wraps, or meatballs, plus really good cheese and crackers, fresh fruit, and fresh vegetables with ranch dressing. And the free drinks included all kinds of beer, wine, and cocktails. (P.S. When I ran out of free drink tickets, I went to the front desk and asked for more and the lady working was happy to oblige. I was afraid I’d be overstepping but she was very kind to give me enough to last until the end of my stay!)
Another favorite feature of mine was the pet-friendly policy. Since I was going to be gone from home for 3 weeks, I needed to be able to bring my cat along, and was able to at the Crowne Plaza for a small one-time fee of $25 (which was a steal considering that wouldn’t buy me 2 nights at a kennel). And since I had my cat in my room during the day while I was at class, they let me leave the do-not-disturb sign on the door during the day until I told them I was back in the evening so that they could send the maid and I could put my cat in his carrier while she made up the room. It was the perfect arrangement and accommodation for my needs. 
A couple other great amenities I enjoyed at this hotel were the business center (where I was able to print things for class for free), the fitness room (which had a cold water dispenser, cups, towels, a big wall of mirrors, 3 treadmills, an elliptical machine, a stationary bike, free weights, and a couple weight machines), a nice outdoor pool and hot tub, and a small convenience item room where I bought some emergency contact solution and candy bars . 
And of course my room was great—I especially loved the floor-to-ceiling wall-to-wall windows, as did my cat . I was on the 7th floor and I never heard any noise from neighbors next to, above, or below me. And the king-size bed was really comfortable. 
The biggest surprise came to me on my last night in the hotel—I would be leaving the next day but the problem was that I had class until 4, and needed to leave my cat somewhere before heading out of town afterward. I asked the front desk for an extended check-out so that I could leave my cat in the room while I was in class and pick him up on my way out around 4:30. Even though their policy says otherwise, the manager gave me a break, and let me take my time and check out as soon as was convenient. This made my last few days in Houston so much easier and stress-free. 
I am truly grateful for the hospitality of the Crowne Plaza in Brookhollow—it is a one-of-a-kind hotel and I hope I have a reason to return to Houston in the future so that I may stay here again!

title: “quiet rooms”
text:
Room was very quiet. We couldn't hear noise from other rooms, hallway, traffic, etc.
The room was clean and furnished nicely, but not at a luxury level. 
The inn advertises one hour of free long distance/night which we did not need to use and was not explained to us by the desk clerk.
Breakfast included a waffle station and other hot foods.

title: “It was very good”
text: We went down for a wedding. The suite was spacious and clean. The hotel staff friendly and the snacks were great if you have kids. The location was easy to find as well. Would stay there again.

title: “Family Loved It”
text:
We were visiting this time for a Praise/Liturgical Dance at the Houston Comets game. The staff was so helpful and very attentive to the needs that we had at that time. The kids loved everything about it and want to go back just to stay there. We all had so much fun and the manager there is sure to go above and beyond to make your stay extra special. On behalf of Women on Fire for God (----), we thank them highly!!!!!!
Minister Kahala Bolton, Director

title: “Very Quiet Stay...What I needed for My trip to Houston”
text: This was a very good stay for me. I was in Houston preparing to speak at a Director's conference for ministry work. The breakfast was hot even at 9 am :) There was plenty to go around for all the hotel guests. Will use this hotel for many times to come.

title: “Attentive and Quiet”
text: We stayed at Drury Inn and Suites for 4 days while my mother had surgery in Houston. Check in was quick and efficient. The rooms were modest in size but clean and well-appointed. They were remarkably quiet even though located next to a busy interstate. There was no road noise nor noise from either the hallways or adjoining rooms. The bed linens were changed daily and the staff quick to bring additional linens if needed. Each morning a hot breakfast was served (complimentary) and was surprisingly good. Coffee, soft drinks and popcorn were available in the lobby throughout the day. The staff was friendly, helpful, and gracious, and seemed to truly understand the concept of taking care of guests. Although advertised as near the Galleria, it actually is too far to walk given the hot sultry conditions of Houston. However there are many restaurants that are within 2 to 3 minutes drive. The hotel is centrally located to many attractions, with rapid access to the inner bypass. If we return to Houston, we would stay at Drury.

title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!”
text: GREAT HOTEL!!! My husband and I went to this hotel for our 8 year anniversary. We had a WONDERFUL time. At check in we were immediately greeted with HAPPY ANNIVERSARY. As we walked in our hotel room we could not get over how big and beautiful the room was. The Champaigne and chocolate covered strawberries were a perfect touch to the beginning of a beautiful night, not to mention the hand written letter and Anniversary card that was so kind for the manager to write for us. I would highly recommend treating yourself to this hotel.

title: “Excellent hotel in a vibrant setting and modern design”
text: Modern hotel with excellent lounge, restaurant and cafe in a hip urban setting surrounded by shopping, dining, and residential living. Very good westside location, but not convenient if you have to travel to either the Reliant Center or Downtown areas.

title: “Hip, trendy, fun, stylish, vibrant & welcoming”
text: Great hotel, fresh, clean, modern, stylish and unique. Be careful on pulling up outside though, vehicle access bit of a mess. Staff professional and welcoming, rooms are comfortable and bright. A hotel with class with great access to various cafes, bars and restaurants, green and music. Bathrooms are fabulous - large open wet rooms ... no where to hang towels though - appearance seems to have superceded practicality in small areas - but not a huge deal.

title: “Classy, elegant and chic!”
text: This is the second hotel in I have stayed in that's a part of Marriott's new Autograph Collection. This one is nice as very nice as well. Beautifully appointed and very nice staff. Downtown location.

title: “Nice decoration but not good customer service”
text: We stayed at the Icon for a weekend. The rooms are very nice especially the bathroom. Ours had a whirlpool. Some elements in the rom are not maintained properly (light fixtures, the sofa). Bed is very comfortable. The gym is nice but there was no staff in the spa area so it seemed dead. The staff at the front desk were not friendly at all. They were not smiling nor very nice to us. I think for such boutique hotel, you expect a more personalized service. Last thing,mthe valet parking is way too expensive!

title: “Quaint & Perfect”
text: Needed a quiet weekend away from my hectic life and Hotel Icon was the perfect choice. Loved the huge bathtub, comfy bed and decore. Very secure, service was exceptional! Great valet too, guys remembered my name

title: “Great Place to Stay.....”
text: We stayed here for a long weekend....great accomidations, wonderful room and very clean and well appointed, excellent bar in the lobby; service was superior and very friendly.....can't tell you if the dining was good, we ate out.......we'll go back for sure.....

title: “Très bon hotel à Houston, mais à 20 mn du centre”
text:
L'hotel est situé à coté d'un grand axe autoroutier, mais pour autant, il est calme et l'on est nullement dérangé par le bruit.
Les chambres sont belles et spacieuses et la salle de bain est elle aussi grande et propre.
La piscine est agréable, même si elle n'est pas très grande.
Sinon, c'est le meilleur petit déjeuner que nous avons eu durant le voyage.
Pour le reste, l'hotel est un peu excentré par rapport à Houston, mais le tarif justifie largement le petit déplacement.
Une bonne adresse pour Houston.

title: “Handled large conference very well”
text:
Located next to the conference centre, this was a very busy place for a recent conference of some 8000 people. With heavy demand on all of its services, the hotel did very well. The rooms and food were par for the course for a Hilton but they certainly handled such a large conference with the utmost professionalism. 
I am sure that even in times with less than 8000 people coming through their doors every day they would do very well.

title: “Great Stay!!”
text: Everything was clean & the staff was very helpfull & friendly. Free breakfast was good and always plenty of food. Would highly recommend staying there.

title: “The stay was pleasant and the staff very helpful”
text: I would like to thank Shana and angela. They where very helpful and friendly. That helps make for a pleasant hotel experience. Thanks

title: “Very nice surprise”
text:
I was in Houston for 3 nights attending a conference. I searched trip advisor thoroughly trying to find a nice hotel where I would feel comfortable, as I am very, very picky about my hotel accommodations. I either try to find a hotel in a city that is new (within 12 months of opening) or is 4-5*. I found this Laquinta which was newly opened and it did not disappoint. The room was very modern and new. The furnishings and interior decorations were beautiful. Usually, if I am unsure of a location I purchase my own set of bedding once I arrive in the city to ensure that I am comfortable. At this location, there was no need to bother. I was quite comfortable with the sheets and comforter that were on the bed - they appeared brand new. 
What was surprising to me was the level of customer service I received from such an establishment. Although the price we paid was not on the level of the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, the level of service we received was comparable to those 5* hotels. Front desk employees always addressed us by name and were just as helpful, if not more, than any other 5* concierge I have dealt with. 
The hotel provided a very adequate continental breakfast each morning and although I did not partake, others in my party were quite satisfied. 
Overall, I would most highly recommend this location. The accommodations are great, the price is very reasonable, and the level of customer service provided is phenomenal. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and believe me that says a lot.

title: “Good quality and great service...”
text:
Visited this hotel in the start of July. I was on a roadtrip from New York to LA with my friends, and we where stopping in all the mayor cities. After a long drive from New Orleans, we spotted this hotel of the I-10. The two nigth-clerks where so nice and even gave us a discount on the room since we arrived so late. 
After staying on a lot of 50-90$ hotels we where astounded by how nice this hotel was. Very good rooms that felt very clean and a good working air condition. 
The pool area was also very nice, and the night clerk even turned on the lights for us at 2 am. 
The breakfast was ok, a make your own waffel station. Bagels, eggs, bacon and sausage. Very good if you count the price of 69.99 for four people in a two double bed room. 
The hotel is nicely located if you have a car. If not its to far away from houston.

title: “Excellent hotel highly recommendable”
text: Quiet hotel, spacious comfortable rooms, superb service. very good restaurant, nice bar. Excellent fitness center with outdoor pool, sauna, steam bath. attention to detail.

title: “Nothing special but OK”
text:
This is one of those typical conference hotels. Everytime you go there seem to be at least three major business conferences going on. 
The hotel is Four Seasons, so pretty good, but I was not at all positive about the area it wass located in. If this is downtown Houston, what did I miss?????? I believe I was the only person in the entire city.. I strolled around along 6 lane streets and finally found some sort of nice area, with a street that had a trolley bus running through it, a Starbucks and a bookstore, but that was it. Was this Houston, I guess it was.

title: “Great deals on a great hotel”
text: This hotel is just lovely -- it's peaceful, designed with low-key elegance (in a city not famous for being low-key anything). The rooms are well-appointed and the staff is flawless. On top of that, the restautrant is actually quite good. All of that, for a price not much higher than the Marriott.I

title: “Almost perfect”
text:
We needed a suite hotel with a full kitchen for our annual Labor Day trip and wanted to stay on the UWS. The 1 bedroom suite is great: full kitchen, 2 full beds, pull-out sofa bed. Location is even better. Across the street from Fairway, easy walk to 72nd street station with express trains to get places fast, pleasant walk to AMNH, Central Park, and the Boat Basin.
One amazing thing about this place is the windows. They open about 4 inches at the top so you can get a breeze and hear the NYC sounds. But when you close them, it's complete silence. I need some of these for my home!
I say almost perfect because we were initially given a room that should be out of circulation: mold dropping from the ceiling in the bedroom, toilet not cleaned for a while (brown rings in it), etc. Once we called down, we were easily moved, but that was not pleasant at 11:00 at night with a child in tow.

title: “Great Family Hotel”
text: Stayed in early July with my two teenage children. We had a suite that comprised of a full bedroom and a pull out bed in the living room and a full kitchen. We were pleasently surprised to find out the kitchen had a full cooker. The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly. There is a great supermarket across the road that sells everthing. The area is very safe a short walk to the nearest subway station. But you can easily walk to the main sites.

title: “Close to Central Park, the river and the subway to downtown”
text: The location was fabulous and felt very safe. Each room has a kitchenette (including a bagel toaster) and there is a supermarket / cafe across the road. We were given a list of restaurants close by and hotel staff were happy to recommend one depending on our mood. There is a coin operated laundry in the hotel. We walked through the Park to the Guggenheim and in the opposite direction to the river where we had great hamburgers at Pier i cafe. The subway is close by and is great value - next time we will buy a weekly ticket. The Peter Woytuk on Broadway sculptures start at the subway station on 72nd and the 'Hens' are in front of the Beacon. We will stay at the Beacon again.

title: “Awesome Location”
text: The location of this hotel is fantastic. The hotel is very unique with a modern decor. The rooms are simple and spacious. We enjoyed the free mini bar (non alcoholic), wifi and the complimentary wine tasting in the evenings. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel.

title: “2nd time was great too!”
text:
My second trip to Andaz was with my sister. Once again, I was very pleased with my stay. We had a great twin room. The rooms are large and modern compared to other NYC hotels. The bed was super comfy with really nice linen and duvet.
Snacks and non-alcoholic drinks in the mini fridge are free and replenished each day. Free internet. We loved the coffee and fruit in the morning. 
The shower isn't very private, but we made it work.
I think the strong point of this hotel is the staff and the atmosphere. Someone looks after you from the time you come in, until the time you leave. 
Special mention to Tessa, Peter, Joe, Amanda, and Adrian, who went out of their way to make our stay great,and our outings easy. They were all pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful when we asked for information. 
I highly recommend this hotel. We'll be returning.

title: “Pleased with my choice!”
text:
Well I wasn't 100% sure about booking the Setai. Our default hotels are usually the Four Seasons and the Mandarin Oriental and despite the high rating on TA I was unsure about an unknown hotel. I shouldn't have worried. 
The hotel is excellent. The guy at check-in was a delight, really charming, personable and efficient, reflective of all the staff we encountered during our 8 night stay. We'd booked a studio suite (which doesn't come with kitchen) and I was prepared to ask to a room with a view over 5th Ave, but as it happens our allocated room came with the view. Our room (1004) was huge, with a large dressing area and a large bathroom. It was all quite high spec, with a large TV, Nespresso machine, ipod dock and a bathroom TV. The bed was large and very comfortable. As many have pointed out, the soft-drink mini bar is free as, is the wi-fi, both count very highly with me! Also some of the best hotel slippers I have encountered. As others have pointed out, the rooms are rather beige - an accent of burgundy, I feel, would not go amiss in any future design updates. But no matter.
The staff I thought was excellent - all very personable without being too in-your-face. The concierge offered good recommendations for eating out and for the cinema. The hotel car was often in use, but we usually preferred to walk so we didn't enqire of its availability very often. We had a couple of massages at the Spa, which were very good and typically priced for New York.
We only have a couple of criticisms. Firstly, our requests made to the personal assistants, whether by phone or in person, were often not responded to. When we told that a blu-ray player or a pillow or housekeeping would be sent to our room, it usually wasn't. Most of our requests required repeat calls before our they were fulfilled - the management needs to address this, because this lack of service is not in keeping with the high standards evident in the rest of the hotel. Secondly, breakfast was a tad pricey for my liking. Our light breakfast (me: bagel, him: eggs benedict, plus coffee and orange juice) came to, I think, $110 all in. While I have money to spend, I don't like to waste it. Thirdly, not enough hangers for two people. Small points, but one likes to give a full picture.
If I were to come back for a long weekend and hadn't been to New York before I would probably stay somewhere closer to Central Park, but otherwise I would come back to the Setai time and again. It seemed excellent value to me, when compared with the Mando and Four Seasons. Overall, I am very impressed and very pleased with my choice.

title: “Amazing Hotel Unique Find in NYC”
text:
Very trendy, luxurious hotel with an amazing staff! Stayed here for business. My room was upgraded to a premium room I believe and it was very large compared to other NYC hotels. They delivered a snack to my room mid-day and evening plus turn down service. My room had an espresso machine, small refrigerator, huge closet, huge bathroom (3 people could fit in the bathtub) and TV in the mirror in the bathroom (see pics). The staff from the front desk to logistics for our meeting were amazing and extremely helpful! The food served during our meeting days was great tasting, beautifully displayed and unique everyday. We had more help with technical and a/v support, the food & drinks, and other special requests during our meeting than we could ask for. Would highly recommend staying here if you are splurging on a hotel or budgeted for the daily room rate.
Location is an easy walk to Time Square.
One note....Avoid getting a room with view of construction on building next door. The construction noise will wake you early if you are trying to sleep in. Plus when you open the curtains, you are looking right at the construction workers and they are looking right at you.

title: “Amazing”
text:
The hotel was out of this world. The people were super helpful, they bent over backwards to help me out with any issue that arose, including trying to find an extra night to stay even though the hotel was booked solid.
The luxury collection really stepped it up with this one. The people made the difference. I can't tell you how great this hotel was. The location is OK. its right next to time square but if you go out the hotel and take a right, you are in another area.
Loved it. Absolutley loved it

title: “The worst service”
text:
My room was small and dark, charmed up no doubt, but a Hampton Inn provides more sizable rooms and comfort.
