Things in my room were broken, and after 3 promises over a 3 day period, I gave up.
At these prices they need to get with it.

title: “Not feeling the love Eventi”
text:
I just returned from a 4 night trip to NYC with my husband. After pouring over online reviews, I chose Eventi for its rooms but mainly for the stellar service. The rooms were wonderful and a good size for NY standards. I loved the spacious marble bathroom with walk in shower and rain shower head. The decor was modern and perfect for our taste. I requested extra towels from housekeeping and the request was met the next day with a nice note to boot. The property itself is great. Even the location, which we were skeptical about, was good. Granted most of the reviewers are accurate in that there's not much in terms of dining options immediately outside the hotel, but you can take the subway or cab nearly anywhere and Penn Station is only a short walk from the hotel. 
Now let's talk about service, and I'm referring specifically to the front desk and concierge. I had read again and again on this site about how the staff went above and beyond for them. Unfortunately, we experienced none of it. Even as Kimpton In Touch members, the most we received was the mini bar credit and free in-room WiFi. Upgrade to rooms upon check-in? Nope. Great view of the Empire State? Not unless you consider walking over to a side window and looking left a "great view". We needed directions to MetLife Stadium for a college football game and wasted a lot of time, behind other frustrated patrons, waiting for the concierge, who was nowhere to be found during our entire stay. The bell captain finally came over and printed something out for us, which was basically straight off of the stadium website (and information we already had). 
When it came time for restaurant reservations, the staff seemed to know of only one place: The Breslin. What's a good breakfast place around here? The Breslin. Where should we go for drinks? The Breslin. Is there a special dessert place we should try? The Breslin. Seriously? With the number of incredible restaurants in the city, that's all you've got for me? We actually tried it the first morning for breakfast but again spent an inordinate amount of time looking for it. We were given the 2 cross streets but no other information. We realized pretty quickly how many storefronts there were on that corner and ultimately discovered that The Breslin is inside the Ace hotel! Needless to say, after a few tries with the staff, we ended up using our online resources to find our way around and to discover where to eat in the city. I did try one more time to secure dinner reservations at Spice Market, which incidentally the concierge at The Hyatt near Grand Central told us about. Front desk called us back to let us know only 11pm was available. I jumped online to the restaurant website and booked a 6:15pm via Open Table. I was even able to push it back to 8pm on the same day based on our own changing schedule. So it seems, the internet was more of value than the hotel staff. 
I was really excited at the thought of being treated like royalty based on the reviews, but sorry to say, we didn't feel the love Eventi!

title: “A Great Stay”
text:
We stayed at The Iroquois this month for 4 nights as a group of three women on a New York adventure. We found the location ideal, just a few blocks from Times Square. The staff including door man Bill were so helpful and friendly giving us great advice including where to shop for groceries and where to find the best New York cheesecake!
The room had 2 comfortable queen beds and had enough room and all the modern conveniences. Although small the bathroom was modern and provided for our needs.
 After long days of sightseeing we took advantage of the free DVD rental on a couple of occasions. Although we didn't eat in at the restaurant there were plenty of affordable meal options nearby to suit every taste and budget.
I would highly recommend this hotel as a comfortable, stylish and affordable stay.

title: “Fabulous”
text: Stayed here for 2 nights & everything was excellent. Staff was friendly. Stayed in a suite That was beautiful. Will never stay anywhere else whenever we are visiting NYC.

title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
text: Stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for the second time in the past 18 months on a pleasure trip to New York. It is just so conveniently located and with , very spacious rooms which are beautifully appointed with modern style furniture and extremely comfortable. The beds are perfect for a good night's sleep. The hotel staff is extremely gracious and kind. Best of all is its central location and its very attractive room rate which is excellent considering you are talking about Manhattan, one of the world's most expensive cities.

title: “Great family stay”
text: We really enjoyed this hotel. It was the perfect location in NYC. Close enough to walk to major attractions, including Central Park, but tucked on a relatively quiet side street. The staff were very pleasant, especially the nice gentleman at reception who did magic tricks for my son. We'll be booking a return stay this fall!

title: “We will be back”
text: Allt i toppskick. Verkligen ett toppenläge. Enkelt att utgå från detta område om man vill vara i New York. Alltid trevlig personal, alltid tillgängliga, vi fick hjälp med att boka musikalbiljetter, tips var vi kunde äta och de gav rekomendationer om vi var ute efter något speciellt. Alla som arbetar här behandlar gäster på ett trevligt och serviceminded sätt alltid. Alltid städat, flera nya handdukar varje dag. Verkligen toppenkänsla att bo här.

title: “Great location - quality hotel”
text:
We were here for a Thanksgiving break and the serving people were pleasant, the location was great and we were very pleased with the attention to our requests.
We asked for a fridge and a DVD player to be in the room. They were there when we checked in.
There's free parking in the lot behind the hotel. You have to walk maybe 250m, but nice grounds and safe. One of the 2 outdoor pools is heated, so we were able to swim laps in the cool mornings.

title: “beautiful property, bad experience”
text:
(If you want to read the summary it is the last paragraph) I have been to this hotel for weddings, high tea, conventions and a weekend get away with my husband. The property is beautiful and located among the trees and a hill on Buffalo Bayou. We booked a Sunday Spa package with a deluxe room, a massage,late 4 pm check out and a credit in their dining room. We arrived on Saturday at noon and the 4th floor room was beautiful, the front desk very friendly and hospitable. The pool wasn't heated, we defaulted to a small indoor jacuzzi that was over run by children who had come to swim. The casual dining room wasn't open and we were directed to to the bar, the bartender said it wasn't 1pm and she couldn't serve us yet. We ended up in the high end restaurant for lunch. Sleeping was impossible, at 10:30pm a woman was scoulding a screaming child in the hall (I guess in an effort to not wake a sibling in the room). At midnight the area outside on the first floor patio had a couple smoking and talking loudly. At 1:30 am a loud drunk crowd bustled down the hall. Falling asleep again, about 3 am another drunk crowd came through and woke us up. We didn't call the front desk because we had no desire to change rooms at 3am. They were supposed to deliver coffee to the room at 8 am and did not. I called room service and they said they would send it, I called back they said the left it outside the room and knocked on the door. They had not. They finally got it to us by 9 am. The spa was beautiful!!! The next afternoon, we had booked a couples massage and it was a transcendental experience. The therapist were first class and gave us relaxing massages, offered us champagne, juice or tea and light snacks. We relaxed in their whirlpool and sauna. Leaving the spa, we were starved and moved to the casual restaurant. It was 2:30 and they told us they were closing. The reluctantly served us and attempted to charge our meal to the room. The waiter came back and told us we had been checked out (all of our belongings were in the room and we were locked out. We had to go to the front desk and inform them that we had a package with 4pm checkout. They gave us new room keys, charged the lunch to our room and told us we could" take as much time as we needed to leave the room." I went to my room and decided to go and get a detailed bill of our charges. I took the stairs which exited outside the hotel. It had rained the concrete outside the door was slippery and I did the splits on the concrete. I filed all of my complaints at the front desk and they issued a $100 credit, which is not enough for all of the disappointment. My husband had called the valet for the car. The car arrived and they had not charged the parking to our room and we had closed out. My husband went inside to pay for the valet. The valets and bell men were all standing around talking while I sloughed my luggage into the trunk. After in the car, we saw the valet had left mud in the carpeting of our freshly cleaned car. I will say we were very disappointed. 
 Summary, *the pool wasn't heated, *the restaurant wasn't open,* bartender was rude and wouldn't serve us food, *doors and windows thin (noise all night),*they didn't deliver the 8 am coffee that was scheduled, *they checked us out before our time ended resulting in extra trips to the front desk,* the concrete slippery,* the valets ignored me as I loaded our luggage, *they forgot to bill the parking (another trip to the front desk) and *they got mud on the carpet of our car. You would think an Omni would have it together and offer the service and luxury expected.

title: “Crowne Plaza Brookhollow-Excellent Hotel”
text: We had a graduation Party at this hotel and the service was great. The staff is very friendly and cooperative. Also the catering manager Piper Heinrich is very cooperative and friendly, she did a great job in guiding us with everything. i would reccomend this hotel to everyne and we have been doing parties in the same hotel for the past years.

title: “Overnight Stay”
text:
My husband and I drove down for a quick family get together that was being held at a local bar, so we decided to stay here. 
As usual - we found an awesome deal on priceline! 
Check-in was a little slow, but they only had one person at the front desk, so I couldn't complain too much about that. 
We only stayed one night, the beds were comfy, the room and towels were clean.
We did end up inviting a few family members over after the shin dig, and got a little too loud with laughs so they sent the bell boy to tell us to shut up - I wasn't offended, I'm glad that they have someone on site to take care of that for the other guests.
Over all and all, we had a nice stay.
Check out was a breeze and we would return.

title: “I love the Crown Plaza”
text: The last few times I stayed here I was disappointed. Check in was sadly disappointing as well this go round. However, when I went down to follow up and report my disappointment, Aurelia Gaskin had already resolved all my issuers. If it weren't for her excellent service, I probably would not have given this location another chance.

title: “Beautiful Hotel”
text: My husband and I live north of Houston and were attending a downtown Houston birthday party and decided to book the Icon. What a treat! This is a beautiful and spotless hotel and the staff is so pleasant. I honestly expected it to be a little "stuffy." Not so, they made us feel right at home. We were even surprised with an upgrade to a Junior Suite!

title: “Best Marriott Property in Downtown Houston”
text:
This is now a Marriott property and beats the Courtyard in downtown in Houston which in my opinion is terrible. In fact it is the best Marriott hotel I have stayed in while in Houston. The hotel does a nice job of mixing an old Bank building with modern style. I stayed in a corner room on the 4th floor which provided plenty of light through windows on both outside walls. The room seemed a little crowded with all the furniture in it, but it did have the comfortable Marriott bed in it. The room was tastefully decorated and included a flat screen TV with plenty of HD channels. The bathroom was very large and had a nice big walk in shower with two shower heads. 
I ate both dinner and breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. The menu leans towards upscale Texas / comfort items. The bartender told me they would soon be remodeling the lobby and bar area. They have numerous upscale cocktails on the bar menu. If you are traveling by yourself you can ask for the full dinner menu up at the bar and not have to settle with just the bar menu.
Service was could be hit or miss. The wait staff at the bar seemed very unorganized at times and the main bartender even confirmed this with me. The overall employee response was ok, but nobody seemed overly polite.
Given the corporate rate we have hear I most likely will stay at Hotel lcon again when in Houston.

title: “AMAZING HOTEL!!! AND AMAZING FOOD!!!”
text:
I stayed here for the international quilt festival. The host hotels were all booked, and I'm so glad because I got to stay here!!! I love the theme of the hotel. You have to love staying at a place with a story. This building used to be a bank a century ago. The vault behind the main desk and the luxurious lobby sets the tone as soon as you arrive. I stayed in a room with a jetted tub that was totally worth the extra money. I was staying by myself, but the niceness of the room makes it totally honeymoon worthy. Giant tub that you can see from the bed (or close the shutters if you want privacy) and giant glass shower...beautiful view of the city.
I had an issue with figuring out how to work the tub the first night because there are two faucets...one that fills the tub quickly and a handheld one to rinse off with. I couldn't figure out how to switch between them, so I called the front desk to see if they knew. They sent someone to my room in literally a couple minutes. They must have a handyman on call because this guy showed up with a whole tool chest ready to go to work, but he showed me how to work the faucets and that tub was FABULOUS!!! I had another issue later in my stay (I was there five days) with the key to my room. It was demagnitized by the convention center (no fault to the hotel). The hotel elevators are secured by your room key...you have to use your room key to move between floors. So it wouldn't let me move the elevator. I was only on the elevator about 30 seconds and was getting ready to go to the front desk to get a new key when a manager stepped on the elevator and asked if I needed assistance. I told him what happened and he escorted me to my room, opened my door, and sent someone up with a key a couple minutes later!!! Needless to say, I was highly impressed with the customer service. 
There are bulls and cows subtly strewn throughout the hotel decor. I loved this feature because my hubby and I have inside jokes about cows. If you don't like it, it is subtle... and it's Texas, so it fits whether you like it or not. 
I also workout regularly so I did use the fitness center a few times. It's actually underneath the hotel so you go through the spa to get there. There are free headphones for you to use, clean rolled towels, and all the essential equipment for your workout....really stylish red equipment and all the walls were brick and there was really nice overhead lighting.
I also used the transportation service regularly to get back and forth from the convention center. You go to the valet area to ask for a ride and they give you a business card to call them to pick you up. They can get busy around the main rush hours, but I never waited longer than 15 minutes which is praiseworthy in my opinion for downtown Houston.
Finally, I used the restaurant for several meals, both breakfast and dinner. I thought the food was FANTASTIC. Very original but not so out there that there's no way I'd touch it. They have a shrimp and crab meat salad there that is amazing, and my very first breakfast was a heaping plate of vanilla french toast topped with toasted nuts and powdered sugar and served with maple syrup on the side and a bowl of bananas...all for about $10...hungry? :) YUM!
So, I know some people on here complain about the wait for the free (I repeat, FREE) transportation (that goes all over downtown Houston if I forgot to mention that), the cow decor, and whatever else...maybe I'm too middle class to understand complaints like that, but my overall assessment--I think this place ROCKS!!!

title: “It has a pool that you really can swim in”
text:
The lap pool is 25 yards with three lanes and lines on the bottom. So, if you enjoy a swim workout instead of the machines, this hotel is great. The fitness room is decent with new machines and nice views. There are small amount of free-weights, too.
The location in downtown Houston is excellent, as I'm sure the other reviewers will tell you. You can walk to the baseball stadium, restaurants, shopping, etc. Also there's an indoor catwalk to the convention center, which is next door.
The eateries in/attached to the hotel are good and not over priced.
The quality of the rooms and service was what you'd expect from a Hilton.
One thing that annoys me to no end is that wifi in the room is $15/device. If the hotel must charge for wifi, why not charge $15 for its use in the room??? A family of four would have to pay $60 to be connected.

title: “USE THE BALCONY”
text:
Wow! Stayed here for a conference recently and was really impressed. Beautiful rooms (and what a view), ridiculously comfy beds, hot shower, helpful staff. It's also connected by two sky bridges (2nd and 3rd floors) to the conference center. You don't even have to step outside into the heat. My favorite part was the balcony on the top floor. Just stroll through the pool area and you can sit out on a balcony that overlooks the entire city. On a warm summer night, with the lights sparkling below and the moon above, who could ask for more? 
One other tip -- just a few blocks away is the Phoenician, a little international deli with great prices. Save on lunch so you can splurge on dinner.

title: “One of the best conference hotels”
text: Stayed here for one week for a conference handling 8500 particpants. The food and beverage staff, along with the rest of the hotel staff were excellent. WIth all of us trying to eat at the same time, the hotel handled all of this with aplomb. Many conference hotels know that you are trapped, and they don't seem to care if you're happy or not; the Hilton Americas is different. Connected to the George R.Brown Convention Center on the 2nd and 3rd floors, this is the most convenient hotel if you're attending a conference there. The housekeeping is the only thing that needed improvement as my bathroom could have been cleaner upon check-in. The rooms are large and very convenient for business travellers. Large desks, internet (for a fee) and a nice eating area for room service. Highly recommended.

title: “Paseo familiar”
text: Todo estuvo raelmente agradable desde el desayuno lo unico es k tuvimos k pedir toiler paper desde k llegamos no habian puesto.de ahi todo estuvo perfecto

title: “Excellent in every way!”
text: My co-worker and I stayed at the Four Season Houston the last week of January 2012. We were in town for a tradeshow and coming "home" to this hotel at the end of a long day was a wonderful treat.The staff was friendly and sincere. The rooms were spacious and sunny. The sushi at the lobby bar was superb. The pool, gym and spa area were perfectly maintained and the outdoor jacuzzi was a great remedy for our tradeshow weary muscles. We started each morning with room service coffee and eggs benedict and it was perfectly prepared and presented. The complementary car service was appreciated and allowed us to branch out to some good restaurants. My co-worker and I travel frequently and internationally and we both agree that this hotel is the best of the best.

title: “All as expected at Four Seasons Houston”
text:
We used WhataHotel to book a one night Girls' Getaway in downtown Houston last weekend. WhataHotel has special arrangements with many upmarket hotel groups. In this case, we were able to book two rooms for $159.00 plus tax each. This included not only the standard ameneties of a Four Seasons Hotel, but also free breakfast and lunch. That is a GREAT deal on a great hotel.
Lucy at Whatahotel handled everything in an friendly and professional manner. All of the staff members at Four Seasons, particularly the drivers of the complimentary car service, were lovely. The car service was very handy for us because we were going to/from the theater district.
We recommend Whatahotel and Four Seasons Houston!

title: “Dear Four Seasons; where have you been all my life?”
text: The best hotel in Houston. Great location if you're looking for a business hotel in the heart of it all. I have stayed in many great hotels but strangely haven't been to a Four Seasons (it's a mystery as to why). This has me now commited to the brand (when possible). The service was first rate, wonderful attention to details, I arrived early with no problems checking in (at 12 noon) and the room was comfortable, spacious, had large windows and the fitness center was perfect. The onsite restaurant was great for a late lunch meeting that I had and the downstairs bar area at 6pm was humming.

title: “Very Nice Hotel”
text:
Some notes on a recent 3 night stay:
Room: A standard room with king sized bed. No complaints.
Staff: Overall the staff was very courteous and professional. A step above the usual. One minor quibble: The room staff kept coming into my room to perform their daily duties: making the room, turning down the bed, folding my dirty clothing, organizing my toiletries on the bathroom counter, etc. I found it odd...especially the folding of my clothing...but I guess I could get used to it.
Restaurants, Bars, Food: The bar/restaurant on the third floor, Quattro, was a little non-descript, but as usual the staff was nice. Prices were unexpectedly high. My colleague and I had lunch there after our arrival. It cost $90 with tip. The lunch was good but not that good.
The 1st floor bar was above average. Every night we were there they featured live music. A jazz trio took requests and were able to play a request of mine. Nice! 
During our meeting, the hotel catered the meals. I was impressed with the breakfast, lunch, snacks, and dinner that were catered by the hotel. Overall the food was above average for selection and execution. I especially liked the poached sea bass that was served for lunch one day. Excellent.
Mazza's (Across the Street): Not affliated with the Four Seasons, but since it's so close I had to comment. We went there after a meeting for a drink. The bartender was surly and clumsy. I wouldn't go back.
Internet: They have two options for internet access: normal and high speed at approx. $7 and $15 per day. I signed up for the $7 option and had no problems. 
Overall: A very nice experience for business.

title: “Value for money”
text:
Stayed at Beacon Hotel on Broadwayrecently for 1 week. Room was on 24th floor with views to Central Park and the city. Rooms were larger than expected and with a fully functional kitchen. There was a fridge, microwave, stove, coffee maker, kettle, crockery etc. Bathroom was a little small but clean.
Location was great as the subway way a 2 minute walk away. It was within walking distance to Central Park and another subway line.
Staff were very helpful

title: “Great location, great rooms!”
text:
We stayed here for a week in mid August and we loved it.
The one bedroom 2xdouble bed suite option was great and had a lot of space for the kids to play.
Hotel staff were always helpful and the wifi was great for us to keep in contact with the family.
Location was amazing with central park nearby, plenty of eateries around but best of all there ia a magnolia bakery and a crumbs bake shop nearby. Great when kids need a treat!.
Only thing to consider is that at about 10 in the morning when everyone is leaving the hotel to start there day can be a bit difficult to get down stairs with a double stroller.

title: “A Boutique Hotel I Could Make Home”
text:
If I ever become a famous artist with exhibitions in New York City I will move into the Hotel Beacon as a permanent space while in The States!
A lovely private, newly renovated boutique hotel, with sophisticated interior deign and colour palette! Great comfortable beds, a small but well equipped kitchenette with plates, knives and forks, coffee and tea making facilities and a double burner stove if you really feel the need to cook.
However, The Beacon is so well situated on Broadway, that you can walk across the street to the best little New York Deli - with a choice of wonderful breads, cold meat, cheese and gourmet salads that you will never feel the urge to cook again. There is also a small supermarket with everything you can ever need!
3 blocks from the nearest subway means you can be anywhere in the city in no time flat, including Times Square - though if you are a walker Times Square is within walking distance - about 30 blocks!
I would love to return!

title: “Why Am I Telling You This?”
text: This hotel has recently been remodeled, and gets better over the years. Your only worry is that is may be sold out way ahead so book early for your trip. So why am I telling you this - you could be thinking to go at the same time as me? One more: the beds are so comfortable that you need a wake-up call. Otherwise, you will surely oversleep.

title: “Great location”
text: The Andaz is a unique hotel in so many ways. The rooms are gorgeous, the service from check in to breakfast excellent and the location is fantastic. The GM is Australian and you can see he has added little touches such as a good cup of tea that can really make a stay. The whole stay was seamless. I loved the free mini bar and wi fi. Nice work. I will definitely stay again.

title: “I love this hotel”
text:
My firm is just down the block and having tried the three nearby hotels (Grand Hyatt and the Library being the other two), this is by far the best and my preferred place to stay. Having just spent two weeks staying here I felt very much at home, the service was terrific, and the little added touches like complimentary WiFi, sodas, iced tea and juice in the mini bar included, and some rooms I've stayed in also have the Nescafe coffee machines - really make a difference between a good hotel and a great one. 
The staff in the restaurant are lovely, there's always someone available at reception to answer a question, when you call the 'host' your call is answered in two rings unlike other establishments I have stayed in where it practically rings out, and room service is very prompt (they often quote 40 minutes but it arrives in 20). The Andaz really is fantastic and by far my pick of the midtown hotels. 
The only thing I don't like is the service from the girls in the bar area in the basement - just surly and sour. But all things said, overall the Andaz is terrific and while the room rate may be higher than other nearby hotels (aside from maybe the Setai) it is well worth it. 
The only note I would make is that if I wasn't staying for work I probably would not choose to stay in midtown because on the weekends it's a little quiet and there's more action elsewhere. There's only so many times you can walk up 5th Ave before realising there is great (if not better) shopping elsewhere, or that the main areas of interest are either downtown/Chelsea/Gramercy/West Village or around Central Park for the most part. That said New York is very walkable, cabs are cheap, and the subway is both inexpensive and reliable, so even if you do choose to stay here the rest of Manhattan isn't that far.

title: “5 stars”
text:
My boss came here last year and had a negative experience but I wasn't going to let that put me off since my wife and I hosted our wedding reception at The Andaz Liverpool street last year and were impressed.
Upon arrival we were shown straight to our room, a suite. The same person who checked us in took us to our room and showed us how to operate the in room lighting and windows. Considering how close to fifth avenue and Madison avenue, I was able to fall asleep with ease and didn't hear any of the hustle and bustle.
The bathroom was as other people have previously described. One 42" Plasma in the bedroom and a 60" in the living room. Big.
The location is exceptional, opposite the New York Library. The staff were very friendly and attentive and definitely made us feel at ease.
Very happy with our choice of hotel.

title: “feel like home”
text:
different concept of hotels, it’s a must that you sit in the reception and have a welcome drink from the fridge inside the lobby! The room and the bathrooms are very good. the fridge inside the room has free milk, chips and chocolate! 
the location is great on the 5th Ave. I would come back agaian

title: “FABULOUS HOTEL!”
text:
Just returned from 4 night stay at The Setai. Upon arrival all the staff including the bell hops, concierge, and reception were so friendly, and accomodating - and all had the best attitude. Every staff person had a huge smile on their face and many would greet us by our names.
We had a beautiful studio suite, which was very spacious with modern decor. The bedding including the sheets and pillows were all the finest. The bathrooms were wonderful with double sinks, lots of counter space and a TV in the mirror. The bathroom towels were very luxurious! The walk in shower was very large and the soaking tub was gigantic! I have never been in a hotel with so much closet and storage space. There were drawers everywhere. The refrigerator was filled with complimentary drinks and at turn down there were treats including cookies and popcorn. There were large picture windows in the living area and also the bathroom. Their were 2 other flat screen televisons - 1 across from the bed, and another one in the sitting area. The lighting in the room was excellent. The housekeeping staff cleaned our rooms 2x a day to perfection!
We were impressed with everything the hotel had to offer. The bar was a great place for a drink and had jazz music nightly.If you are looking for a Fabulous hotel in a great location this is the hotel for you. The managers of the hotel should be proud of all their staff for making our stay so special.

title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
text:
I was nervous about my trip to New York - my first trip to America, and bringing my two teenage children. However, when we arrived at the Setai, any concerns were allayed as we were greeted by the very courteous Brett who whisked our cases in from the taxi almost before they hit the pavement. He gave us a tour, yes literally, of our room - a double Queen bedded suite with a hallway, dressing area and magnificent bathroom. The bedroom was a very comfortably large area with amply stocked minibar ie with complimentary soft drinks which was kept well stocked throughout out our stay. The room was very well serviced twice a day, was always very clean, everything neatly arranged or folded, and cookies left each afternoon etc. Nothing was too much trouble. The room looked over 5th Avenue and we were never bothered by other guest noise at night - evening traffic noise was not intrusive. The beds were very comfortable. The bar provided very good food in the evening. I particularly liked the security - there was always someone greeting you at the entrance. The lifts required a card swipe to take you to your floor which made me feel very safe with my children. 
The location I thought was amazing. Two blocks from the Empire State building and a walk up 5th Avenue offers fabulous shops, the Public Library - do go in it is beautiful, Bryant Park, the Rockefeller Centre, Trump Tower, and after 20 minutes Central Park. Handy also for Central Station which is also lovely. Two minutes South brings you onto 34th Street for more shopping.
We loved our stay at the Setai and were really grateful to the Personal Assistants who were very proactive in offering their help and advice. I would definitely book the Setai again if I visit New York, and I think it made our trip all the more special. A special thank you to Norma, Brian, Kimberley, Brett and Jeff in the bar :). We miss you!

title: “Huge disappointment: go elsewhere”
text:
We've just returned from a few nights stay at the SETAI 5th Avenue. The hotel did not deliver on my expectations of 5*. In my view it is more a 3* star aspiring to a 4*.
We have stayed in 5* hotels all over the world. We expected more for our money from the Setai. I have recently email the Capella Management on some issues...so far they have not responded or addressed any of the complaints we mentioned.
On arrival we were greeted with a gift...breakfast vouchers for $90 dollars per day. Don't be fooled by this...hotel staff will try and get you to spend at least double this so that charges are added to the bill. The breakfast waitress told us...you can have what you want it will not be added...but it was charged as we paid for it!
Took 3 telephone calls before I received extra coat hangers.
Rooms on lower floors look onto dingy dull and depressing alleyway. We asked to be moved and were moved at 10 pm the following evening.
Its in a tacky location, lacks a mature responsible manager on site...go elsewhere in New York.
SETAI - very dissappointing and not worth the extra money we paid.

title: “In time square but not”
text: This hotel is amazing. Well worthy of the newly promoted spg category 7. From the start the entire staff was friendly accommodating and went above and beyond. Upgraded us to room with balcony. Welcome gift for spg gold 2 drinks in lbs bar other option is 250 points no brainier drinks are amazing and the bartender was so nice and has a passion for what he does. These are real drinks mixed with skill and masterfully created. I am from NYC so I know what size room to expect but with that said normal size but immaculate bathrooms are as noted very nice. Rain shower is great dumb design as floor gets wet half glass who cares you don't clean up. Turn down service is wonderfully. Butler did introduce himself was accommodating brought ashtray for a cigar on my upgraded balcony. Toiletries asprey are amazing I actual purchased 5 bottles of lotion from asprey.com. Love the smell. Choice of newspaper. No French press coffee like st Regis gives tv in bathroom in mirror is nice touch car valet was slow. Doesnt feel like time square till you get up the block and are hit with the mix of tourists and shady people but hotel is a respyt. Concierge was great gave after dinner recommendations ate at hakassan walking distance it was excellent little pricy. I highly recommend this hotel worth the experience I am bored of the w the ny st Regis is a little old and stuffy this was a welcome addition to Starwood

title: “5 Star Hotel at a 5 Star Location”
text:
Great 5 star hotel in a great location with close proximity to Time's Square and the Theatre District. Brandon Short provided bulter service second to none. The room was very quiet with all the amenities and then some. All staff were very professional and pleasant. The Lamb's Club restaurant has a great assortment of quality food with service to match. Check out the heated toliet seat and other special functions the toliet can provide.
A true 5 star hotel.

title: “This Hotel is Number 1 in Customer Excellence & Amenities”
text: We ended up at the Chatwal by chance and never have we been so satisfied and well taken care of. From the bell staff ( I wish I could remember the name (we arrived around 3pm Sat) to the desk staff, our experience was magnificent. Christina, at check-in, learned it was my birthday. Upon entering our room a lovely birthday card greeted me. The decor and the room and particularly bath amenities were superb! most beautiful and refreshing shower. Carolina graciously helped with our parking as we need a bit more time to accommodate the play we were seeing. I can't recall the bartender's name, but he was from Martinique. Wonderful drinks. All staff were very friendly. I can't wait to return to The Chatwal. Carolina gave us the history of the hotel and the Chatwal brand. Very interesting. I look forward to checking out some of those hotels too. Thanks all for a lovely stay and a very special birthday celebration for me at the Chatwal.

title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
text: The Chatwal is one of the best hotels that my wife and I have stayed in. The rooms, especially the bathrooms are exceptional. The decor throughout the hotel is very tasteful (art deco). But what really makes this hotel is the staff. Professional service delivered with efficiency and friendliness, absolutely top draw. This hotel is expensive, but worth every penny, cent, euro or currency of your choice!

title: “What a great experience! If you need a place to stay in New York, Eventi is the best place!”
text: The staff is very friendly, they are always available to help you in any kind of need! I went to New York to visit the city and Eventi has the perfect location for that! It's almost side by side to Empire State Building and very near to broadway, times square and 5th avenue. Besides, there are 2 subway stations in front of the hotel so moving around the city and take advantage of the main atractions is very easy. The hotel is very clean and modern. It's brand new! The rooms are very comfortable, spacious and the view from the top floors is breathtaking. I definitely recommend this hotel to all kind of trips. It doesen't matter if you're just passing by New York on a bussiness trip or if you brought your whole family to visist and walk around the city. Eventi, a Kimpton Hotel will suit all your needs and preferences. Enjoy! :)

title: “Cool hotel”
text:
My wife and I stayed here because a good friend works for the chain, and it was a great place to stay. I love the food parc downstairs, essentially a fancy food court with awesome choices. 
The suite we had had a cool layout and an awesome huge bathroom. The hotel was in a prime location, we walked to a broadway show and korea town. 
Would recommend this place.

title: “Excellence in the city”
text: From check-in to checkout, everything was superb. The location is perfect, the hotel is swank, and the staff is very personable. You will be staying in a luxury hotel without the stuffiness. I love Kimptons, but this one was topnotch.

title: “Near all the action”
text:
I booked the Iroquois for 5 nights in April. I chose this hotel for its location and the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. 
When we arrived we were greeted by the concierge who helped with our luggage. He was very polite and told us to find him if we have any questions/queries.
The room was very small but expected in New York - it was nicely decorated and very clean.
This didn't bother us as we would only be using the room to sleep in as we wanted to explore NY as much as possible. It would have been nice to have tea and coffee facilities in the room.
The Iroquois is located right near times square/theatre district. It was great to just be able to walk home most nights. 
The bar and restaurant is expensive but good food if your willing to pay the prices. There are some great Italian restaurants further down the street on the left hand side.
The iroquois is ideal for a short stay and a perfect spot for sightseeing.

title: “Centrally located, very nice staff.”
text: My husband and I stayed at the Iroquios for one night with our two children (ages 11 and 9) in April 2012. The concierge, Sergio, was friendly and patient and helped to direct us in our sightseeing and restaurant searching. The room was nicely decorated and clean. It was small, but fine for a short stay. The bathroom was also clean and updated. The location was great - near Times Square, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, etc. I think the location on 44th St also contributed to a quiet room. The price was affordable for a family visiting NYC. We will return to the Iroquios. We did not have elavator or water problems as some other reviews had reported.

title: “Centrally located”
text: Last time in NY I stayed at Algonquin. I thought it was OK but not more than that. This time I chose this hotel which was better but it is not more than three stars. The service is OK, the door men are very nice, the reception so so. The room is very small and you should not live here if claustrophobic, I practically stared into another wall from my window. The location is very good, close to shopping on Fifth Avenue.

title: “Great hotel & excellent location”
text: Just had 6 great nights at the San Carlos New York from the 15th June. Excellent location. a little noisy across the road is a nightclub, but you are in New York & you have to get used to that. The rooms are large for New York, with Queen Size beds which is highly unusual for America, which were extremely comfortable. Great lounge area, with a small kitchenette, enough for us (microwave, fridge & sink). Staff couldn't do enough for us, everytime we came back from a long hard day pounding the streets we were always greeted and asked how our day was. Breakfast for a self serve is excellent, you really dont need the huge buffet everyday, they had a great choice for a continental breakfast, somedays it does get a little crowded though. Some fantastic local restaurants just two blocks away in a really local area, supermarket, pharmacy etc. Very safe area never felt unsafe. Great stay, thank you San Carlos. Highly recommended..

title: “Believe what you read.”
text:
My family of four stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for 3 nights. First trip to NYC. The room, Executive suite king, was fantastic. Very clean, very roomy for the four of us, 2 adults + 2 teens. Extremely comfortable bed meant a great nights rest. Very quiet hotel aside from NYC constant noise. Short walk to all the great sights. Highly recommend for a wonderful stay. 
Tip for delicious chinese food. Wuliang YE on 48th street around the corner from rockefeller center. Fantastic food.

title: “Nice family hotel”
text:
My first time staying in the city with the family. After reading endless reviews I chose the SC because of the positive reviews, availability, location and because they have 2 beds and not a sofa pullout. 
I could not have picked a better hotel for my family vacation. First of all the staff was excellent, from the bellhop to the maids, they were over-the-top nice. The room was way more than what I expected for a NY hotel. I had the 2 queen suite. The room was big, and more important VERY clean. Small kitchenette was very helpful with the kids. Other pluses include free breakfast, and wifi. Negatives include air condition units that could be less noisy, street noise if your room is on the lower level street side and $30 a day parking. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip in.

title: “Great Hotel, Great staff, great location....... we'll be back !”
text: Firstly the staff here are excellent, friendly, helpful and very efficient. The hotel is ideally located on 50th and 3rd, $7 taxi ride to Times Square or a 15 minute stroll, and a similar distance to Central Park. the room sizes are 'huge' by New York standard and while not cheap it certainly delivers value for money by New York standards. We had 2 rooms, a King and a double double. The beds were as comfortable as I have ever experienced away from home. A definite bonus was the 'continental breakfast' included in the room price., nothing extensive but juice, cereals breads, toast and coffee started us off well each morning. Another added extra was 'Free' wireless internet access.

title: “Great location to explore the city”
text: My family of four stayed at the San Carlos the first week of June in a King Suite. The room included a true king size bed and a pull out sofa for the kids. The room was very clean and large enough too accomadate all of the extra bags of souveniers. Only complaint about the room, the AC was too loud for a light sleeper. The hotel offers a continental breakfast of pastries, juice and coffee, that was average. The location can not be beat, easy walk to Rockefeller Center and the rest of 5th Ave. Central Park is a 20 minute walk. The E and 6 subway lines are very close and can get you to the East, North and South parts of Manhatten within minutes. The proximity of the hotel to 3rd and 2nd Ave give great access to local restaurants (Sofrito, Lasagnas, Morning Star Cafe, etc). I usually get to the city every other year and like to try different hotels, but I would not hesitate to stay at the San Carlos again.

title: “A very nice place to stay”
text: This hotel is very conveniently located in the Galleria area, yet somewhat isolated and out of the hustle and bustle. My wife and I arrived on a Sunday evening for a week-long stay ... business for me and pleasure for her. The bellmen and valets were efficient and courteous. We were greeted in the lobby with a glass of champagne and a quick check-in ... both of which were very much appreciated. Our 3rd floor room was small; but luxurious, clean, and quite comfortable. During the entire week of our stay, we found the staff to be extremely friendly and accommodating ... attentive to all of our needs. Overall, the Omni was a very pleasant lodging experience and we will definitely be back!

title: “Comfortable hotel but beware the hidden costs!”
text:
In some ways, the Omni Hotel is typical of the kind of business hotel I used to stay in 20 or 30 years ago. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, well furnished and suitable for a business person wanting to work quietly in spare moments outside of the office. The hotel has a restaurant, a bar, a well equipped gym and an outdoor pool. The hotel boasts conference facilities and a ballroom for functions. With our visit coinciding with the Christmas holiday season, we saw several parties take place and there was a festive atmosphere to the place. The elevators were very efficient and we never waited more than a few seconds for one to arrive. The breakfast buffet was very good with freshly cooked omelettes to order. Finally, the staff were simply outstanding; friendly, helpful and full of smiles and willing to go the extra mile to provide good service. Full marks all round for that but now on to the minus points…
Although the lobby area is very large and welcoming, other parts of the hotel look a bit tired and show their age. For example, the dominant colour scheme throughout the hotel appears to be brown. This may have been the standard a few years ago and presumably it's supposed to give the hotel a sober, business atmosphere but to me it felt a bit gloomy. Our room, although very comfortable also showed its age, particularly in the bathroom where some of the fittings seem old fashioned. For example the shower head looked as if it had seen better days and had a low water flow. The lever that switched the water between bath and shower was temperamental and it took me some time to get the shower working properly. The shower curtain seemed dull because it was coloured a light brown in line with the overall theme. Compared to modern business (and even budget) hotels in Europe, the décor in the Omni falls way behind the competition.
Hidden costs: Mrs G and I arrived at the Omni after a stressful arrival at the airport, transit through immigration and a car drive into Houston at peak traffic time. We just wanted to get to our room and relax so opted for valet parking on arrival… at 24 dollars per night as we discovered later. Self parking is a bit cheaper costing 17 dollars a night. You could argue that secure parking in other US cities (and most major European cities) comes at a similar price but somehow it just seemed excessive. I didn't realise until reading through some of the hints just now on Tripadvisor that free parking is available somewhere around the back of the hotel. Not sure how safe this option would be, especially at night.
The major rip off however is the charge for wi-fi access to the internet. More and more hotels (both quality and budget) offer cheap rate or even free internet access but the Omni charges 9.95 dollars per day except there is a catch that isn't obvious or made clear. The charge is actually 9.95 dollars per day per DEVICE. So Mrs G and I had connected with two different laptops plus a smartphone. Three devices at 9.95 per connection… kerching! To give the hotel some credit, we were able to negate the charges racked up over one week by signing up to a loyalty scheme (more junk mail on the way presumably) but seriously? 
If my review seems over negative, it's not meant to be. I did enjoy my stay at the Omni and would stay there again, but I'd be interested to see how it compares with other hotels in Houston. Compared to European hotels, the Omni has a lot to learn in terms of general décor and ambience but on the other hand, the Omni could teach European hotels a thing or two about customer service. Overall I enjoyed the stay but those extra charges... ouch!

title: “Quiet in the middle of Houston”
text: If you are looking for a nice hotel a little off the beaten path - the Omni is a good choice. It's in the heart of Houston, but on a big piece of property with plenty of green space (albeit part of a business park). The facilities and rooms are top notch. My only beef is that the service is not quite as crisp as I would expect for a hotel of this caliber.

title: “ALWAYS A PLEASURE”
text:
I fancy myself a hotel connoisseur as I seem to be in them often, and there is nothing like sinking into a nice comfortable bed, in a very cool and clean room at the end of a long enjoying downtown nightlife. This Hilton property offers the most comfortable beds and pillows I have found in any of the other area hotels. The bathrooms are spacious and impeccably clean, and always stocked with great amenities. I have to say, the floor staff is willing to find any thing you need be it extra towels to shampoo, and they are always very sweet about. I never feel as if I have inconvenienced them, when I know they are so busy.
I entertain clients on weekend trips into Houston taking in House of Blues events and miscellaneous activities around Downtown. Our party visits the Hotel about 6 times a year and generally book several rooms at one time. Our stays are consistently perfect. I hadn’t written a review until I happened on trip advisor and read some less than complimentary and inaccurate (imho) reviews. I’ve stayed at many of the Boutique hotels such as the Icon, but continue to come back to the Hilton of the Americas as my first choice. I always seem to be booking multiple rooms, usually a front desk nightmare for most Hotels since arrival times are sometimes different for our party. However, the front desk staff is second to none, very responsive and genuinely friendly. I always feel like both myself and clients are being treated like special guests of the hotel. As soon as you walk, in you are memorized by the stunning, blown-glass sculpture. Nestled through the very large but cozy lobby are sitting areas with free wifi. The bellmen, especially Jerry (hopefully that’s correct), are always incredibly helpful. 
On our most recent visit, we stayed in what is in my opinion the best room in the place. Parlor Suite 1725/1729 has the most fantastic view with large windows, and is a great set of rooms for entertaining. The room is outfitted with a nice a large table and sitting area where we all enjoy much needed and really great room service after a late night out. Occasionally we stay on the executive level and have always enjoyed the evening reception and morning continental breakfast. Most of the rooms we have personally visited offered an amazing view of Discovery Green park and I believe each floor has a sitting area that overlooks a new park.
Just a side note, on one of our wedding anniversaries we stayed with the Hilton and we were severed a beautiful cake on the 26th floor terrace to celebrate. It couldn’t have been more lovely and is a very special memory for us. These guys go out of their way to make special moments in guest lives important so it is a great place for a birthday or anniversary. The hotel is also very family friendly even though most think of it as a buisness type destination. There are lots of weekend family activites in the park and the area is very safe. We walk almost everywhere.
I would like to personally thank Mr. D’Rovencourt and Claudia Robinson for their ever present attention to details and taking such great care in making sure our stays are always perfect. Your influence is illustrated through your wonderful staff.

title: “Great Hotel, Downtown Location”
text: Stayed at the Hilton during a recent conference. The hotel amenities were top shelf. The bed was amazing, bathroom clean and roomy, and the toiletries were quite good. Housekeeping of my room was excellent. Only beef was the wireless internet - kept cutting out every 5 minutes or so. Will return on my next trip to Houston!

title: “Best choice for convention ctr - otherwise try elsewhere”
text: Best for convention center. Walkway from hotel to center. Staff are helpful, restaurant/bar are good. If you do not need to be near the convention center, there are more convenient hotels for a broader range of activities - interests. $15 charge for wifi - may want to consider spending $30 for an upgrade to the club floor. Includes the wifi, continental breakfast and evening snacks. Nice place to bring people back to meet if you are at conference

title: “Unbelievable service and style”
text:
We got engaged here in November and it couldn't have been more special. The following month, I hosted a baby shower high tea for a friend visiting from outside of the country and again, the help and service was amazing. The coordination was top-notch and it could afford to have a wedding at the Four Seasons, I would. My fiance and I look forward to staying at the hotel for years to come to celebrate our engagement. 
-- Genevieve Woodard

title: “Fantastic Stay”
text: Fantastic service and attentive to all details from the time you arrive until departure. Can not say enough about the hotel staff and their attention to detail.

title: “outstanding service”
text: I have stayed at the Four Seasons numerous times and the service is always first rate. From the time you arrive to the time you leave the staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. The room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. The curtains close completely and make the room quite dark so you can really get a good nights sleep. If you are looking for a great place to stay in Houston it's pretty hard to beat this hotel.

title: “Great hotel!”
text: We stayed at the beacon with my husband for our honeymoon.. Perfect location. We had a one bedroom suite which had a kitchenette which was perfect because across the road you have fair way where you can buy some groceries.. The service was great the staff were very good..The subway is about 1 min walk.. Central park is about 3 blocks away which is not far. Also there is a Starbucks right next door which was perfect. Overall great location, the staff were great and great hotel. Will definitely go back

title: “Home away from Home”
text:
Hotel Beacon is a wonderful getaway in the heart of the upper west side of New York City. It truly is spacious and clean, as other reviewers have stated. It is right across the street from the Fairway Market (wonderful!) and a block away from the 72nd street subway station. Lincoln Center is a nice walking distance and Columbia University is a short subway ride (15 minutes tops from hotel room to campus). Central Park is also only a few blocks. Be sure to check out Levain Bakery on 74th Street. Their cookies are magnificent!
The only negative, was the air conditioning. The room was a little warm during the day and lowering the thermostat didn't help.

title: “Recommended to me, recommended to YOU!”
text:
This was our first family trip on holiday to NYC and this hotel did not disappoint at all. Good location for everything we wanted to see and do! Fairways supermarket was across the road with a Starbucks nearby on the corner. Subway not too far away. Central Park fairly nearby (short walk). small kitchenette useful although we didn't use that much. Beds comfy, no bed bugs! Bathroom clean and nice towels.
Maybe a bit expensive when we compared prices with passengers on the flight home who had stayed further out but I guess you pay for convenience!

title: “As good as it gets”
text:
Unconventional check-in that was made super special by the best hotel concierge I have come across - thank you Jo! He made our whole New York trip special from arrival to departure.
We loved the interior design - Tony Chi at his best. The bathrooms especially are wonderful but there is no element of the hotel that we didn't like. It blends the informality of a boutique hotel with the luxury of a top five star. It will be our NY base from now on.

title: “Great hotel, great location”
text: A very enjoyable two night stay. The Andaz is extremely well located in mid-town, as it is on 5th, across the street from the Public Library and Bryant Park, a few blocks from Grand Central and Times Square and only 10 blocks from Rockefeller Center. The hotel is classy but low key with none of the chaos of the large NYC hotels. Our room was terrific - a large one bedroom suite with a private bedroom, an excellent sofabed, and a small kitchenette. Given it's location, it was also very quiet.

title: “Slick - but maybe a bit too cutting edge?”
text: Very comfortable and well-run hotel in a great position. Spacious and comfortable rooms with in my case a nice view over Fifth Avenue, including the wonderful New York Public Library and early 20th century skyscrapers beyond. Well done the hotel for little touches like free wifi and everything in the minibar being complimentary except alcohol. Great breakfast options in the restaurant. Just a few reservations: it's not obvious what the advantage is of having the free-floating reception 'island' instead of a more traditional arrangement - it was sometimes hard to tell who was an employee and who was a guest; also the offer of a glass of wine to guests who arrive at 'reception' late in the evening is probably misjudged - this may sound fusty, but our priority, late at night, was to get to our rooms, not to socialise over wine with the hotel management. The shower seemed unnecessarily complicated - water flow and temperature were somehow controlled by the same handle and took a long time to figure out. And there isn't a business centre as such, just a couple of lap-tops off the main reception area (printing involves emailing one of the staff). It works reasonably well as long as you don't mind the (quite nice) canned music. Although this hotel gives its address as Fifth Avenue, the entrance is in fact on East 41st Street.

title: “Great Place!”
text: I stayed at Andaz on a Friday night two weekends ago. The location in midtown is perfectly close to great shopping, train stations, and restaurants. The room was very impressive.... super modern and very fancy with high ceilings. I loved the shower! It had three shower heads. And the complementary snacks were an extra bonus. I had a hard time figuring out how to turn on the lights, TV, and open the door... I guess I'm not as technologically savvy as I should be. The hotel staff were very accommodating and helpful... quickly bringing me some forgotten toiletry items. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. I got a great night's sleep! There was also a great view of the beautiful public library from my window. Overall this was a comfortable and beautiful room. This is the perfect place for someone looking for a very modern and chic place to stay in a great location.

title: “Anniversary Gone Wrong!”
text:
Upon check-in, I was very impressed. My wife and I were greeted by name and immediately taken care of. Our personal assistant immediately introduced herself and was extremely helpful during my stay with all of my requests. The room was absolutely amazing and I loved the decor! The room was spacious and had a comfortable feel. 
My wife and I went out the following day for a little sight seeing. When we returned at 5pm, our rooms had NOT been cleaned. Not a big deal at this point because we were headed right back out to dinner and to the theater, however I made sure to call the front desk to let them know the room still needed to be cleaned. 
What could have been easily corrected at 5pm turned into a disaster when we arrived back at the hotel at 12:30 am and our room still had not been cleaned! For OVER $1,000 a night, I expect nothing less than my room to be cleaned! I was mortified that my wife and I had to sit in the lobby until almost 2am waiting for our room to be cleaned. This simple oversight ruined my very 1st wedding anniversary!

title: “Fantastic stay at the Setai”
text:
A truly wonderful hotel ... From the bellman offloading my bags to the person at front desk - all were welcoming with a smile.
Location was great - a few blocks from times square and 5th avenue is on your doorstep.
Room was enormous with one of the biggest bathrooms ever ( the bath was more akin to a swimming pool ! ) everything is brand new and looking good.
The little touches really make a BIG difference - free Internet, free sodas in the mini bar and popcorn and choc chip cookies at turn down. And best of all - no set check in and check out times. Now that is forward thinking !
Couldn't have asked for more ...

title: “Definitely not a 5 star hotel or experience”
text:
We stayed at Setai last month and were truly disappointed several times during our stay.
The location is great for walking to times square and shopping districts. The rooms are large for NY standards, but carpets are off white and very dirty with stains, poor choice for colors or needs carpet cleaning services.
Their concierge/personal assistant service is great in concept but not in reality. We had several negative experiences with the concierge. We ordered tickets for empire state building and they charged us twice for the tickets. As well, we order statue of liberty tickets and were charged twice for those as well. The worst situation is when we sent a bag to our room from shopping and the bag mysteriously disappeared! Security did a good job to show us how several parties(about 6 different times) had gone in and out of our room during the day (while we were out). After we complained and asked to speak with hotel manager we were told he would talk tu us After his meeting, and after waiting 2 hours without any contact we had to force the issue at front desk! Finally I had to make a suggestion for the hotel to take the measly $200 of missing or stolen merchandise off our $6000 bill!!!! Very poor customer service that a hotel manager could not have handled this serious situation and made an offer of compensation, which would have made them look better and like they care about their customer and reputation. Made us wait and wait and didn't have the courtesy to see us in person or call our room, very poor and inexperienced management team. Any decent hotel would have credited a night or offered some form of a future credit weekend to encourage more business, unfortunately I am better at customer service then they are, and I have nothing to do with hospitality business. We stayed at a hotel in June that was 3 star (no choice) and they forgot to clean room, so manager took $100 off a $200 room for not cleaning room!!!
As well their maserati car service is never available as its always in the garage, so false advertising for that service. we also arranged a car to Brooklyn and they charged us $350 which is absolutely outrageous and it wasn't anything fancy! All other car services were charging $65 to $85 for the same service, I feel robbed by this ripoff.
Also we had a major miscommunication one night over dinner late at night for our family which we were misdirected to wrong address and type of restaurant which ended up being closed. They need to train their concierge staff to know the city better and call ahead for restaurants.
This was a very negative experience from what we expected from this hotel. I travel the world and stay at 5 star hotels, but this hotel definitely missed their marks.

title: “Quaint and Sophisticated”
text: Everything about Chatwal is magnificent. From the moment you arrive, until it’s time to leave you will not be disappointed. Upon arrival, the doorman opened the door and whisked our bags up to the lobby. The Lobby is small but classic. Elizabeth at the check in desk was very pleasant as she greeted us with a smile at 6am after our red eye flight arrival from Phoenix. She asked our pillow preference (feather or foam) and introduced us to our butler. We were upgraded to a king room 204 with a beautiful terrace where we relaxed on several occasions with a bottle of wine. The room was phenomenal: high tech lighting, very nice closet and storage space, safe, fully stocked bar with full size bottles of Patron tequila, Jack Daniel’s, Grey Goose vodka, etc. The room is equipped with everything you need; except an iron, BUT you don’t need one, because the butler will press your garments. Both the bed and the sitting chair were extremely comfortable. And the bathroom OMG, luxurious is an understatement: fresh cut flowers, rain shower, bathrobes, Asprey products, and a beday, need I say more……. Our rate included free internet and continental breakfast which was tasty and adequate to start the day. Nightly turn down service included bedside slippers and Fuji Water, The hot tub and pool were a welcoming treat after walking to the Empire State building and spending time in Central Park. The hotel is steps from Time Square and the Theatre district. We also enjoyed drinks in the Lambs lounge. Can’t wait to return to Chatwal!

title: “Manhattan luxury”
text:
My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at the Chatwal in New York a short while ago. It was the nicest stay we've had in New York and the location was terrific.
The hospitality was warm and gracious, from the front desk to the bell hop, the restaurant staff and the maintenance worker who came to replace a battery in our safe. The response to our request for service was immediate!
We loved everything about the room, from the decor to the heated toilet seats. The bed was plush and comfortable and the room was extraordinarily quiet.
We were steps away from Times Square and some of the best restaurants in Manhattan.
We will absolutely stay there again.
Many thanks to everyone at the Chatwal who made our stay so pleasant.
Mary-Lu and Chris
Canada

title: “I'm not sure a better hotel experience is possible.”
text:
I travel close to 90% of the year and always stay at Starwood properties unless one isn't available. Having stayed in several Category 5 (and a few 6) I was really curious about what makes a hotel a 7. Additionally, since the Chatwal is in downtown NYC, space is at a premium so I figured it wasn't huge room sizes that make a Category 7 stand out.
I checked in shortly after 4:00 PM. The Valet handled our luggage and the Butler accompanied us to our room. I thought it was overkill but he explained he needed to show us how to 'use everything' in the room. The first thing that stuck out was that you just wave your keycard over the sensor instead of having to insert it. When they opened the door, I was immediately taken back by the room. There was an excellent view, a really long hallway and it was much roomier than I thought it would be. The room was lightly lit and the beautiful 'wallpaper' was actually made of suede.
They walked me over to the bed and showed me the room controller. Everything in the room that was electronic can be controlled by a touchscreen device located on your night stand. Drapes, the shades, lights, temperature were all remotely controlled. You can call room service, have your car brought up automatically, and several other similar things all from the controller. The bed seemed a bid too firm at first and I was a little surprised by it. Yet, after laying in in for just a few minutes I found it quite comfortable and it ended up being the best I've slept in recent memory.
They showed us the closet and storage space next. While this seems pretty self-explanatory, there was a lot you could easily overlook if you weren't shown it. That's b/c utilizing space efficiently is taken to an art form at the Chatwal. They showed us each of the closets, how to get in to everything, and a few other assorted niceties like the fold away feature of the desk. There's butler service, shoe polishing service and closets that are not just roomy, but very well organized. Packing and unpacking was made much simpler by the way they had everything laid out.
He proceeded to explain the wifi access and how to open the stealth desk and cover (which my wife found amazingly useful for getting ready and putting makeup on ).
Last up was the bathroom. There were mirrors everywhere which was very convenient when you're getting ready and trying to make sure you can see things from every angle. If you weren't shown that there was a Television in the mirror, I would never have figured it out. The bathtub was huge and had Jacuzzi jets in addition to a 'rain water' shower. My wife raved about the bathtub which I did not try. That's b/c I was too enamored with the shower itself and the rain water faucet is just one of the things we discovered in the hotel room that we'll be equipping our home with.
The final item on the bathroom tour was the toilet. It was a very low profile no noise model which was nice, but pretty much what you'd expect in a hotel like this. So I was wondering why it needed explained to me. I quickly realized it was the 'Toto' (I heard about it on the Howard Stern). I'll just leave it at this - Google 'Toto Toilet seat' - as eccentric as it sounds, the wife and I both immediately agreed we'll be getting them for our house. If nothing else, the heated aspect is very comfortable and the images on the control box alone are worth the price of admission.
All in all, the service was just amazing. The room was amazing. Everything about the trip was just perfect and i recommend it as highly as I can recommend something. The part I guess that still sort of surprises me is that I am a regular at the W (which is an awesome chain - I mean nothing negative about it at all) and really thought this would just be a slightly more glamorous version with a little more flashy service. I was very wrong and the coolness of the Chatwal can not be overstated.

title: “Surprisingly good service in a hip new hotel”
text: We stayed at The Eventi for a friend's wedding. The city was packed with people attending Fashion Week and The US Open as well as all the usual NY craziness. The staff at The Eventi handled it all with equanimity and grace. They couldn't have been more professional and accomodating. The hotel itself is new, clean and hip. It's in a great location convenient to Madison Square Garden, lots of great restaurants and the fashion district (my wife added that part.) I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

title: “Loved our stay here”
text: We chose the Eventi Hotel because it was right in the middle of Manhattan. We planned to walk everywhere and if that got too tiring there was Penn Station a few blocks away and another subway station just a few blocks east. This hotel, we felt, was the perfect location to explore uptown, downtown and everything in between. The staff were fantastic! Not pretentious at all and there to have a laugh and share their insights. From the minute you walked in the door you were made to feel so welcome. We were really worried about how small the hotel room would be given all of the reviews that we read for multiple hotels. We did not find it an issue at all and were pleasantly surprised with the large bathroom. We opted for a room on one of the upper floors, so noise was not an issue and it was nice to have a window that opened and fresh air coming through. This was our first time at a Kimpton hotel and were very pleased!

title: “Chic, Modern, Clean and Convenient Hotel”
text: We stayed a week at the Eventi last November for travel and my cousin's wedding. Our beautiful corner room could see the Empire State building and was very clean. Bed and bathroom were lovely. Gym was good with water and apples for you to snack on and rehydrate. Staff were really helpful and location was so convenient - couple of blocks away from theatres, literally just next to Little Korea, super close to subway and Macy's! And loved the wine hour~ Definitely one of our best hotel experience, and we're there while it was Halloween - so all staff dressed very funky and cute! We would definitely recommend this for anyone looking for a good hotel in NYC.

title: “Great hotel, great location”
text: Stayed for a week in the Eventi Hotel on a first trip to NYC in a Cityview King on the 22nd floor. Wanted to stay somewhere special and conveniently located, and this hotel did not disappoint. The hotel is near subway stations and about 15 minutes walk to Times Square - close enough to be a convenient walk but without the crazy crowds that would definitely put me off from staying in Times Square itself. Staff at the hotel were awesome - two minor issues with the room on check-in (bathroom and the iPod dock) were fixed speedily and the cleaning staff were great. My only quibble would be the gym facility which was a little on the small side as far as the weights stations go, but I guess this is NYC after all and space is at a premium...

title: “Another great review”
text: I recently stayed at the Iroquois with a friend. It's so difficult to find a hotel which offers 2 beds. The classic room at the Iroquois is ideal for 2 women traveling together. Although the room is small, it's very efficient. My only complaint is the bathroom which has very little room for toiletry storage and there is no fan so a shower will steam up the mirror. This is my fourth stay at this hotel and I think it's close to perfect. Times Square is so chaotic, noisy and crowded. Being close to 5th Ave, it's still an easy walk to theaters and even closer to the best shopping street in NYC. The room was ultra quiet and dark, and the bed was comfortable--all important components of a making me a happy guest. Unfortunately during our stay, one elevator was out of commission. I am sure the new one has been installed by now making the wait time up and down much faster. All in all, I am a loyal customer and high recommend a stay.

title: “A Mixed Experience”
text:
My friend and I had booked deluxe rooms for our weekend stay. We arrived at 12 noon, too early to get into the rooms but the staff were very helpful; took our bags, gave us help with restaurant bookings, etc. We came back at around 5.45pm, were given room keys, and told the luggage would be sent straight up. The luggage took nearly 15 minutes to arrive and in fact I was on my way to get it when it arrived at the 3rd floor. I should have just taken it up myself. I then unpacked the things that I needed for 2 days, got into my bathrobe and went to have a shower - only to discover that there was no water. I phoned down to reception to be told how the shower worked. On trying again I then had to phone once again, as there really was no water. Someone was sent up, maybe 10 minutes later - but not a member of the front desk staff - some poor chap who couldn't fix the water and simply had to report back to reception. I phoned AGAIN as I still hadn't heard anything. The man came back with a new room key, but it was unclear as to whether this was my new room or somewhere to have a shower. He said he would move my stuff - but I was still in my bathrobe, due to go out in half an hour, and needed my stuff! So I ended up piling it all into a heap and moving it right then. On getting downstairs to reception I imparted my feelings and, of course, the staff were very apologetic. But my 'rest' time had been wrecked, and I just felt that the whole point of booking into a hotel like this was to avoid exactly this kind of problem. When I got back to my room there was a letter of apology and wine and chocolates, and an invitation to breakfast, which was a very nice gesture, but I'd have rather not have had the hassle.
Good things - the bar in Triomphe was lovely, and the Lanterns Keep bar is really special. The location is fantastic. The staff are friendly and polite. Not so good - only one lift working, the wi-fi is a bit touch and go, and the rooms were comfortable (especially the bed), but very slightly shabby. The paintwork could do with renewing, and both the rooms I saw were very dark. There was no vanity mirror in the room I was moved to.
I am aware that I sound extremely fussy, but I'm really not. I often stay in travelodges or similar and am very happy with it - but having splashed out to stay somewhere really speacial, I expected more for the money. I've stayed at 2 other hotels in the 'small luxury' range recently and they were both better experiences. I'm sure that the Iroquois experience can be fantastic, but unfortunately it wasn't for me, on this occasion.

title: “Great location, smaller more personal hotel”
text: Stayed two nights here. Excellent location for exploring midtown - Times Sq, Bryant Park, 5th Ave. all close by. Hotel room a good size for a NY hotel, but we had one of the large rooms on the top floor. Very helpful staff at this location - from the bellboys to the concierge who had good restaurant recommendations (try out the db moderne next door for breakfast) and we were able to not only store our bags on check out day, but we used the gym shower facilities before traveling on. would definitely stay here again for a Manhattan visit.

title: “Excellent hotel, location and service.”
text: The location was great close to Grand Central, Bryant Park and Times Square. Friendly service from all the staff and especially from Bill. The room was quite comfortable, very quiet and kept clean. I would recommend a king bed as the queens size appeared to be smaller than usual queens. The toiletries were quality Molten Brown. There is free WiFi and the complimentary coffee in the morning. The complimentary overnight shoe shine was greatly appreciated. We had a perfect stay and would go back in a flash.

title: “Lovely Hotel”
text:
What a little gem! I booked a King Suite and had asked for a high floor and quiet room.. We were allowed to check in when we arrived at 11:30AM- how wonderful is that! The front desk staff was very friendly as was the rest of the staff from bellboy to housekeeping.. The hotel even sent a "birthday basket" to my husband with a card wishing him Happy Birthday. We really felt spoiled by the enitre staff.
The bed was comfortable and the bathroom a little larger than some other NYC hotel bathrooms I've seen. Housekeeping was very friendly and did a great job- asked for feather pillows which were brought to the room. The air conditioner worked well but the one in the living area was a bit noisy. The only street noise we heard was the occ siren. We never heard any of the other guests in the other rooms. The breakfast was okay.
