Had plenty of healthy choices fruit and cereal, as well as pastries. Even tho its included in the room rate, I much preferred the Bagels from ESS A Bagel on 3rd and 51st street. 
The location is great- near GCT and subway. We would walk back from the theater. We really enjoyed our visit and hope to return soon.

title: “Great Hotel”
text: Across the street from some night life and walking distance to other great eateries and businesses, this small hotel meet our expectations. Our only complaint would be the sound of the air conditioner as it turned on but that is nothing in comparison to the quality of the room. Compact in size, yes, but offers everything you need.

title: “Great hotel, good location!”
text:
We booked a double queen room. The room we got was good, fairly big for a new york hotel. The biggest plus is that it comes with a microwave and an empty bar-sized fridge that is for our use! There is a separate drinks fridge that the hotel provides for in-room convenience. But for us with young kids, a microwave in the room is a big plus!
The hotel provides a good continental breakfast spread, including fresh pastries, OJ, coffee/tea and yoghurt and cereal selections. We had our breakfast at the hotel everyday. 
There is a free business center with 6 desktop computers and free internet access. A printer is even provided free to print-out online reservations/tickets and flight check-ins. Wifi is free around the hotel. There is a pool but we did not get to try it.
This hotel is has a good location mid-town. A block away is the Metro station on 51th St/Lexington, which covers both the 6 and M line, so it is fairly convenient. We do need to walk to 52nd street Metro entrance which has an elevator for our stroller. It is also a fairly quick 15-20 mins walk towards Times Square with the kids. 
If supper is needed, there is a number of late night cafes around the hotels. Laundry service is also available down 2 blocks.

title: “Great Girl's Trip”
text: Love the Omni! This hotel has been always been great. The location is fabulous for shopping! No problems with noise, easy check in, and check out. We stayed for a 40th birthday celebration (2 nights) and had fun going to dinner and shopping. Check out the Black Swan, it was an amazing time.

title: “Frequentt flyers hub”
text: Spent almost 2 weeks in the hotel. Staff was so helpful & had a free room upgrade. Everything was well planned and organized, check-in/out didnt take a few minutes. Good variety for breakfast. 30 minutes walking distanve from downtown and good shopping spots like Galleria Houston. Nice forest scenery from the room. Would recommend to any business traveller visiting houston.

title: “Great hotel but room service and maid service needs to be better”
text:
First of all, we did fill out the comment card however we got no reply from management!! So now that we had no reply from them,we decided to write this review on trip advisor!! We decided to wait for their concern but they didn't!! So here it is!!
Overall it was a gorgeous resort! The only thing we have to complain about is room service and maid service!! The first day we got there, we got our sparkling wine with truffles and on time!! However the next 2 days the room wasn't done at a normal time!! We had to call or go to the front desk at least twice to advise them!! And for our alloted time to get our wine and cheese plate for the next 2 days it was suppose to arrive at 4pm and we remember that one day we had to call 3 times to get it delivered but it came at 7 pm!! When we are on vacation we don't believe we have to do their job!! It was extremely irritating!! However overall,front desk,restaurant and the whole staff were very
Warm and friendly!!

title: “Fantastic Hotel in excellent location”
text:
What a great hotel - in a fabulous location. The service was excellent - the continental breakfast a welcome start to the day with a large choice of food - all fresh and lots of variety.
The staff were courteous and polite without being overwhelming - nothing was too much trouble. 
The hotel is ideally located - just a few blocks from 5th Avenue St Patricks Cathedral, the Empire State Building and Central Park - the subway is very convenient also and an excellent way of getting around the city - great value too at just $2.25 for a single ride - whatever the distance.
Highly recommended

title: “They Are Doing Something Right Here”
text: As a previous review says, I'm hesitant to let too many people in on this gem. First of all, it's pretty unusual that the hotel's owner/operator is on site. I checked in with the wonderful Gabriel at the front desk--a most charming and welcoming staff member. I am beyond particular and Gabriel was attentive to the requests that I had made when making the reservation. He actually let me look at a couple of rooms to make sure that my preferences were met. The room that I chose was not yet available (it was very early) so I shopped for a while. When I returned to the hotel, Gabriel said that the owner of the hotel wanted to meet me. I travel at least 80 days a year and have for several years--I've never met the hotel owner. The owner was charming and lovely and was clearly interested in making sure I had a good stay. My room was lovely--a beautiful upgrade. The experience at the San Carlos was very much like staying at a friend's beautiful apartment. Everything was clean and fresh. The bed and linens were a good quality. The location of the San Carlos is excellent with subway and bus lines within steps. I prefer midtown east--so this location is really perfect. Again, I almost don't want to tell too many people about this as I fear it won't be available the next time I go back.

title: “unexpected suprise”
text:
I have alway wanted to visit New York during the festive period and last year me and a friend decided to spoil our seleves and go for it,
We made our booking for our 5 Night stay at the waldorf astoria, upon arrival we were informed that the hotel was faced with a difficult situation and that they had very little rooms to cover the amount of guests checking in, I have to admit i was very concerned an a bit distressed we had saved all year for this one off trip and here we were with no room, Our check in clerk quicky re assured us that he could move us to another hotel to the same standard and area of the city and also get the hotel to re issue a refund for the cost of our stay as way of an apology, The hotel in question was the wonderful san carlos hotel, he showed it to us on the internet an phoned to ask for a suite, we were fairly happy with this outcome to be honest, the check in clerk walked us to our car they supplied for the transfer just around the block, 
The san carlos is not as big and flashy as the waldorf but what it does ooozzzz is sheer class, The check in guy was pleasent and friendly and a good source of information if you required any, our room was just gorgeous, kitchen area was great to keep all our drinks chilled, dining area and a siting area with comfy sofas and a huge 40inch plasma, the seperate bedroom also had another 40inch plasma and a great comfortable bed, plenty of storage space for all our shoping and belongings, 
The hotel also supplies a contiental breakfast included in your stay if you wish but theres a little cafe just acroos the road that does great food there newyork bagels was amazing.
When checking out at 12 the clerk at the reception booked our airport transfer an when he heard we were not due to leave till 4 he gave us our room back till 2.30, the extra time relaxing before our long flight back to ireland was wonderful , which i wasnt looking forward to at all with delta airlines, id recommend aer lingus in future, 
The reason im only writing my review now is my travel agent thomas cook is now only re issuing the refund of the cash the waldorf promised us 5 months later, they just couldnt understand why they would put us up in another hotel plus give us our money back lol.
To sum it up we didnt book this hotel to start with but if i am lucky enough to go back it will be first on my list, 
A beautiful hidden gem in the middle of the city

title: “Very nice.”
text: My wife and I spent a long weekend here, and were very happy with everything. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was excellent. Would not hesitate to come back.

title: “Gorgeous hotel, great location, exceptional staff.”
text: We stayed at the Eventi hotel this past June on our second trip to NYC. I wanted to book a more upscale hotel to celebrate a special milestone in our lives, and after careful research online I chose the Eventi (I booked four nights, and a special couples package that was advertised).We arrived pretty late in the night, after a delayed flight into JFK and were ready to relax. Upon check in, I confirmed my package and was pleasantly surprised to hear we were upgraded to a larger room. The woman who checked us in was very nice, but didn't inform us about the hotel in any way. She just gave us our keys, and directed us towards the elevators. Once in the room I was disappointed to see the champagne (that was included in the package, and to be there upon arrival) was not there. I called down, and they sent up the champagne and a fruit plate. The room was everything as promised; modern, clean, welcoming, spacious, and luxe. The bathroom was fantastic, equipped with a combination whirlpool tub and shower. The next morning we received a call asking if we would like to place our breakfast order (included in the package is breakfast in bed) I asked if we could order in tomorrow instead, and they said no problem. The next morning I called to place our order, and the clerk at the front desk informed me that there was no "note" on my account regarding a breakfast package. She then put me on hold for about five minutes until she could find the information. Breakfast came up rather quickly, and was decent. The very small issues we encountered on our trip are by no means a deal breaker. I just felt like at the pricey rate per night, you should experience a flawless stay. My only suggestion would be to ensure what's booked is correctly provided, and perhaps review that front desk staff informs all guest equally of the hotels amenities and programs upon check in. All in all, this hotel delivers on everything it promises you. We enjoyed our stay very much, and would come back again.

title: “AMAZING Hotel!”
text:
I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Amazing service. The staff is super friendly and work hard to make sure you feel important. The bathroom's are amazing and there are so many great amenities. We loved the wine hour and complimentary bikes. We rode to Central Park and had a blast. This hotel has been, by far, the best hotel experience we have had EVER. Well worth the money. Rooms are beautiful and clean. Plus, if you forgot something, they'll bring it up to your room, no questions asked. My husband and I will definitely be back. 
Thanks Eventi for such a great NYC experience. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great hotel in NYC.

title: “Never staying anywhere else now”
text:
Gorgeous hotel, super chic and cool. The staff are super friendly, courteous.
 The hotel is at a fabulous location with an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Really, it was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. 
I wanted to move in!

title: “Very different”
text:
The Chatwal is a really different experience. It’s a small boutique hotel. The rooms (mine was a Grand Deluxe) are not large, as you might expect given the prices. They are long and narrow but well appointed. The décor is modern with beige suede walls and maroon furniture. So a dark masculine feel to the room. The furniture is non traditional modern, I think. There is a large flat screen across from the bed. Their selling point is the bathroom which is super modern, chic. It’s also done in a maroon stone with silver sparkles to it. The rain bath shower is not so great as water leaks out on to the floor because there is only a half glass door with the rest exposed. I had tons of water on the floor every time I took a shower, so while it looks cool it’s not functional. The toilet has an electric bidet if you like that type of thing. There is a TV in the mirror which I didn’t use but someone might like. The best part of the room in my opinion was the small terrace. It’s got seating and a table which is very unusual for New York and a nice surprise. No view at all but still nice to have fresh air. 
I went to the Lambs Club bar which is very nice. I also ordered room service which was quick and the food was excellent. 
The location is right by Times Square so great if you are seeing a show. 
I would recommend this hotel but be mindful that is not your typical luxury hotel with a large light airy room.

title: “Chic Boutique Hotel”
text:
Spacious rooms are one of the benchmarks of a hotel luxury, however The Chatwal emphasizes a chic style over size. You can expect a comfortable bed and pillows, high-thread count sheets, small bathroom with higher-quality amenities such as a heated toilet seat, bath robes and nice spa soaps. 
The hotel looked as I expected. The staff were very pleasant, helpful, and friendly. I felt safe with a door man and card key elevator access. It was very clean and met my expectations. It is in close proximity to Times Square (approximately 150 paces or less than a 2-minute walk). 
I would recommend the hotel's restaurant, The Lambs Club, for dinner but not for breakfast. Instead, you will find a lovely restaurant across the street with a nice breakfast menu or a couple of Starbucks about a 5-minute walk in either direction on 7th Avenue.

title: “I highly recommend the Setai, but still a few negative moments to mention”
text:
I will start with a statement: this could be far the best hotel in NYC. I can not compare it to many others, I had a chance to stay at Trump Int only, but I was impressed with the extremely warm and efficient attention from the entire team at Setai. 
We had a long trip from Europe with a 5 y.o. kid and although I had to wait in line to do check-in (one person was trying to help some guest while another one was typing something on his computer...not a great welcome sign to your guests) and nobody greeted me on arrival except bellboys (huge credits to everyone!) I can not fault our overall experience.
The suit I booked through LHW was huge (but no kitchen as mentioned in some other reviews...). It overlooked Fifth Ave and was very clean, large and well appointed. This is so different compare to Trump Int.! But I was not very happy with a fact that there was no bedding prepared for our son (it was clearly stated in my reservation that we are 2 adults and 1 kid) so he slept with us in one bed (we were too tied to spend time solving it on arrival). No special attention to LHW members, no upgrade (but I do not complain as we are not fancy about such things).
What I liked the most was the honesty and clearness in what is offered: in-room refreshments and internet are free and it is made clear to you when you make reservation and it makes you feel like a real guest. I appreciate the honesty of including such details in the price of the room instead of charging you extra for water or anything else (so annoying sometimes). There is no alcohol in the minibar though...I guess you need to order it? There were no instructions on it anywhere...
Hotel's location is somewhat in the middle of nowhere, but you can easily walk to all major sights. It could be a problem for those coming from small towns or those being in NYC for the first time, but we did not find it difficult to walk anywhere.
Food: Breakfast was absolutely fantastic. In room dining too. I loved the food. BUT, I would expect a bigger choice for vegetarians and those who prefer organic food. They failed to offer us any of the juices I asked for (even water melon...) and I found it strange for a hotel trying to market itself as a 5 star hotel. Could be because hotel does not have its own restaurant but the one being attached to it is servings hotel guests (that is how I understood the concept...). There seem to be some confusion in orders and we had something missing every time we placed an order for in-room dining (we rarely went down to the restaurant for breakfast, etc.). I think restaurant and housekeeping should have some better system on how to cooperate and communicate properly.
No issues with housekeeping.
Overall, this is a very nice property. Great staff. I highly recommend the Setai.

title: “So Glad I Selected This Hotel”
text:
I just returned from a conference at the Convention Center in Houston. I was initially reluctant to stay at the Hilton Americas because it was so large. I thought it would be very impersonal. What I found was that the staff was extremely customer oriented. The front desk staff did everything possible to ensure that I got the type of room I requested. The rooms were lovely and very quiet. I never heard any noise from inside or outside the hotel.
Another great benefit of the hotel was the convenience to the Convention Center. I was able to go back and forth to my room several times during the day without ever having to go outside and deal with traffic or the muggy Houston weather.
The Hilton Americas turned out to be the perfect choice for me.

title: “Loved the hotel, the location, the staff”
text:
My two young daughters and I accompanied my husband on a business trip to Houston in May and had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton. While our family wasn't the typical clientele, it is mostly business travellers, we found the staff wonderful and very accommodating for our family. James, one of the bellman, was particularily helpful. It was also unique to see the Executive Chef in the lobby of the hotel interacting with the guests.
We found the room to be a good size, beds and pillows delightful, and of particular importance to us, very clean. Our room had a gorgeous view of the park and Minute Maid stadium. 
The location of the hotel allowed my daughters and I to visit many of the local attractions including Discovery Green (which is across the street for splash park/ playground time), the Zoo, the Children's Museum and the Natural Science Museum. The hotel offers a shuttle to the train system that runs to the zoo and museum districts; however, we felt safe enough walking the six blocks to the train station. I don't think I would do the walk in the evening but during the day the downtown felt safe. 
There are a number of good restaurants nearby as well as quick service locations. Don't miss the takeout and snacks from Phoenicia (one block from the hotel), the food is so good and reasonably priced.

title: “Hilton Americas is World Class”
text:
I have had an all around great experience at this hotel. OUTSTANDING manager who helped me personally with several items for which he went far beyond the call of duty. The rooms are spacious and the prices are quite good. Many offer breakfast and/or internet included. Right in the heart of downtown close to Minute Maid Park and the GR Brown Convention Center. Far and away, the nicest hotel staff I have experienced in a long time. 
The only slight problem is that the wireless signal is quite week. If it does not improve, just use the ethernet version and you will be fine.
I will definitely attempt to stay here again as I return to Houston!

title: “Great location!”
text: We had a fab tine! The hotel is in a perfect location. The concierges are awesome and the doorman also. Extremely helpful! The apartment rooms are large and clean. Decoration is a bit boring in main area but bathroom rocks! Love the tv in mirror!

title: “The best NYC has to offer”
text: This is truly a 5 star hotel and the best NYC has to offer. Especially for pet friendly options. We stayed here for an extended period of time and I cried when we had to leave, it felt so much like home. The suite was spacious, clean, and beautiful. Room service and the restaurant were perfection. The bar was great. Entire staff very well trained in customer service relations. Centrally located hotel and the hotel car was a great bonus the times it was available. Concierge was great as well. Just cannot say enough great things about this hotel. I recommend it to everybody going to NYC.

title: “A real gem”
text:
The Chatwal is a small boutique hotel with well designed rooms and public areas in an art deco style.
Service on our three night stay was excellent and attentive from all members of staff. On arrival we were upgrated to a delightful suite. But the real discovery is to find a hotel in a quiet side street in the centre of New York that is just a few paces from the madness of Times Square! We thoroughly enjoyed the style, rooms,can-do staff attitude and location. We'll be back!

title: “Beautiful hotel. Convenient location!”
text: We stayed for 3 nights at the Eventi in August. We had a one-bedroom suite and it was a beautiful suite. It was very clean and no sight of bugs. Bed was comfortable. Love the hardwood flooring. Staff were friendly and courteous. The location is very convenient, for going uptown, downtown and even across the river to Jersey City, NJ via PATH.

title: “Perfectly Situated, Quintessential Manhattan Hotel”
text: We just returned from the Eventi Hotel in New York City, and will definitely return to this hotel. We have come to expect excellence from Kimpton hotels, and the Eventi exceeded our expectations. Our room was beautiful...sleek, modern, immaculate....and had a view overlooking not only the Manhattan skyline, but a huge outdoor tv screen (probably one or two stories tall) that is situated in an outdoor patio area adjoining the hotel. Great for watching the U.S. Open! Our room was also extremely quiet (my husband travels a lot and noted that this was one of the quietest rooms he had ever stayed in...and in NYC no less!), and the beds and linens were superb. The staff was extremely friendly and outgoing, and had great attitudes--they seemed to genuinely enjoy engaging in conversation, and gave helpful tips on where to grab a quick bite to eat upon our arrival (try the burger place right next door). The location on 30th and 6th was also so convenient. It was a block or so from Penn station, and we were able to easily roll our luggage to the hotel, instead of waiting in the long cab line. And 2 blocks away was the subway station...perfect! Oh, and thank you to the staff for providing champagne and chocolates for our wedding anniversary (I alerted them to our anniversary before our trip:)...and also for the awesome wine social hour on the 2nd floor patio dining area....and the list goes on! If you are considering a trip to NYC, do not hesitate to book the Eventi. Cross "hotel" off your to-do list and enjoy planning the rest of your trip. You will not regret it!

title: “Excellent Location”
text: A wonderful vacation. Concierge & Frontdesk staff were cheerful and helpful. Room with two beds typically small for NYC, was clean and tidy. Beddings are Frette's, fresh and neat. This was our second visit after five years. The hotel has been kept extremely well. No complaints at all.

title: “Still ambivalent after all these years”
text:
This is really a 3 and 1/2 star review, but I couldn't bear giving them a 4 star review and telling you all to downgrade it slightly.
Over the last 10 years, I have spent at least 3 nights every quarter in the Galleria area of Houston, and try different hotels on a regular basis to see how they continue to rate. However, my last stay at the Omni was over three years ago because of an absolutely abysmal experience. But my secretary convinced me that because this one of our corporate choices (which I regularly ignore), that I should at least give it a try again. I succumb to my secretary's logic, but only to be reminded that while the Omni appears to try hard, it's all surface fluff, with significant underlying systematic problems.
Simply put, after a horrendous stay three years ago, I was allowed to have "Deja vu all over again", with another mediocre stay.
The Omni started by repeating their error of three years ago. I specifically order a queen or king bed everytime I stay at any hotel. I don't like full size beds, and would rather sleep in a sleeping bag. Three years ago I show up late (because I fly in at the end of the day), with a guaranteed reservation (we'll always charge your credit card .... because we can!) and they claimed they didn't have a king size room (they only have kings and fulls). After telling them point blank that I'd go to another hotel, the "found" one room - a king in a basement like area that was dank and damp. It was a horrible stay.
So when I arrived on the Thursday before thanksgiving, once again they pull the same stunt. Not even bothering to argue, I simply pulled out my trusted iphone, fired up an app, and had a king reservation less than 2 miles away. But I wanted to be sure that I wouldn't be charged on my card for cancelling because they couldn't fulfill my reservation. That would take finding a manager, which since it was after 11PM, I wasn't terribly thrilled about waiting. However, knowing the Omni's mindset that they could do no wrong, I decided to wait.
The manager came and understood why I was cancelling. He was quite nice, and miraculously "found" a king room after all. I was tired. I had to leave in less than 7 hours. I decided to stay. -10 points for the bungled reservation and the diffident underling service, +5 for the manager's kindness and service.
Since I drove, I decided to park in self parking - for which you get the honor to pay a not small sum to enjoy. I forgot that the garage is literally a 1/4 mile away from the elevators and THERE IS NO DIRECT WAY FROM THE PARKING GARAGE TO THE HOTEL THAT DOESN'T REQUIRE YOU TO GO OUTSIDE FOR A VERY LONG PATH. Seriously. Because everyone knows that it never rains in Houston (/sarcasm off), the Omni has there garage without an inside path. But worse, when you're in the garage, you have to either leave from the middle and take this meandering path to the hotel (which requires you to go up and down stairs without any handicapped ramps, great if your dragging a heavy bag), or go back out on the road and either follow the road to the hotel entrance (a good 300 yards), or go by the service entrance and follow a path along the back to come in through the outside restaurant (btw, this is the Omni recommended route - I guess they don't want you to be hit by a car and have the Omni have to fight being responsible). -25 points for the stupidity
This abomination is all the more ridiculous because it would be simple to make an exit to the open air parking garage structure where it nearly abuts the Omni, create a bridge over a small culvert and then put you to the back of the building, where an entrance could be easily made. I asked about this three years ago, and I was told "it's in the plans to be done soon". Guess what? I asked again - same exact answer. - 25 points for the repeated stupidity
Now having had all of this remarkable annoyance, the room was perfectly appointed - simply grandly beautiful with every detail. The bathroom is grand, and probably bigger than my first apartment. Note that there is no in room coffee maker. But, when I awoke at 5AM and went down stairs, there was a free open coffee station with Starbucks coffee - very nice detail. I didn't notice if this was still there after the restaurant opened. +10 for thinking of your customer
My other quality checks were also precisely met. The internet was fast and free - very nice. +10 The showers water temperature and pressure did not vary - another check for quality. +10 There were no unsightly but slight overlooked problems that can easily be found in most hotels (a screw missing from a fixture, a stain on the carpet, etc.) Everything was perfectly in order. I admire this attention to detail and no how hard it is for a hotel to do this. +10.
The breakfast buffet is above average, with the wait staff being very attentive. However, note it's very expensive if not included with your room (~$20)
So, once you survive the fight to get to your room, it's a lovely experience - until you have to fight to get back to your car.
With just a few simple changes (actually have the rooms you reserve, and fix the &%$#%! path to the garage), the Omni would be a 5 star hotel, set in a beautiful high rise business park. Until then, I'll wait another 3 years to give this another review.

title: “some good, some bad”
text:
I've been traveling to Houston for 20+ years and always thought this was a past-its-prime, Uptown/Galleria hotel that catered to oil guys and hooks in the 80s. That said, I had the chance to stay for free after converting some frequent flier miles on a 2nd tier airline into hotel points, and went for it. 
 Hotel is renovated and in great shape, and certainly has above-average fittings, decor, and room size. Very courteous staff and a swanky luxury vibe, BUT ....
 Why am I paying $16 to self-park and $9.99 for wifi? And another $16 for a half-liter of bottled water? 
 Moreover, I know I was a "freebie" guest, or at least low on the revenue spectrum, but they gave me a room that was basically adjacent to a convention meeting room off the 2nd floor lobby, while a conference was going on. Big hint then - don't be shocked when I help myself to the pastries, coffee, and bottled water that are on a serving table 10 feet from my door. 
It's not that I'm a pilferer or cheap - but when I'm woken up by the sound of dozens of people chatting in the hallway, there should be something in it for me. 
 Overall - very good stay, nice hotel, good people, and great location. I'll go back - but only if I get a good deal or if someone else is picking up the tab, as I'm sure there are better deals in that neighborhood.
